title: DCM STFC Sec III
content:
Stakeholders impact: 

Improved access to finance for MSMEs: The MSME sector is extremely critical for the development of the country as it accounts for over 30% of the GDP and provides employment to more than 110 million people. The Covid-19 pandemic had severely impacted the economic environment for the MSME sector. In particular, commercial vehicle (CV) financing was amongst the worst-hit segments in the financial sector given mobility restrictions and low truck utilization rates. This segment is recovering from the pandemic, and demand for CVs, especially used CVs, remains buoyant given the growing economy, and the focus on infrastructure. The proposed investment would support access to CV finance to MSMEs, particularly micro enterprises, focusing on MSMEs in underserved areas like low-income states and rural regions of India. 

Market impact:

Beyond the project level outcomes, IFC anticipates the investment to promote greater inclusiveness of underserved segments like MSMEs in underserved regions like LIS by demonstrating the commercial viability of serving these segments at scale. The project also supports integration of the securitization market in India, by attracting long term capital from investors.

title: Al Douh Cement
content:
The Project will
scale and strengthen local cement production capacity in Iraq, while generating
jobs and strengthening economic linkages to other sectors. The Project is
expected to create 800 jobs during the construction phase and 89 full-time jobs
after commissioning.

title: Fraport TAV Antalya Yatirim,Yapim ve Isletme A.S.
content: IFC expects the Project to generate significant stakeholder impacts in terms of improved access and quality of the airport's landside and airside services, positive government revenue, and economy-wide impacts derived from the airport operations and the activities in the aviation and tourism sectors. The anticipated market creation effect is to preserve T<fc>rkiye's role in the global and regional tourism market.

title: WCS COVID DTB II
content:
Increased access to finance: The Project intends to provide US$100mn of working capital facilities to DTB, which will then on-lend to its clients (including SMEs), over the next two years which will support the Banks' capacity to sustain operations and expedite post-crisis recovery.                                                   

Resilience: By sustaining the Banks' ability to provide loans to SMEs, the Project is intended to promote the resilience of financial service providers, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Kenya.

title: Standard Chartered Bank (Pakistan) Limited
content: The development impact of this Project is expected to be centered around supporting trade volumes and domestic production in Pakistan via an increase in the supply of trade finance. The Project will help close the trade finance gap in Pakistan and provide financial access to SMEs which currently have limited or no access to finance.

title: Mediterrania IV
content: The project-level outcomes are delivered through increasing access to equity and value creation for mid-cap companies in Morocco, Egypt, and Cote d'Ivoire, including supporting investees that are female-owned/led. Mediterrania is an experienced fund manager and will provide strategic and operational expertise to help investees streamline operations and scale up to become market leaders. Market creation is delivered by strengthening the competitiveness of the PE market in Morocco, Egypt and Cote d'Ivoire. The project supports an experienced fund manager to raise a follow-on fund in the mid-cap market segment while attracting institutional investors to the markets. Beyond the project, the success of the Fund will demonstrate the viability of operating in these markets and attract new local fund managers to enter these markets.

title: SeABank Housing
content:
Stakeholder effects: Increased access to housing finance. IFC anticipates that the Project will help address the lack of mortgage finance in Vietnam, particularly for the middle- and lower-income segments. 
Market Creation Competitiveness: IFC anticipates the investment will demonstrate the commercial viability of housing finance, including for the middle- and lower-income earners, and will result in greater market competitiveness through demonstration and replication.

title: KhanBank Loan
content:
Project Outcome
Increased access to finance for MSMEs: IFC's proposed investment in a senior loan will support Khan Bank through its largest branch network in growing its MSME loan portfolio, which represents 39% of the total loan portfolio, and contribute to addressing the financing gap for MSMEs in Mongolia. 

Increased access to green finance: The proceeds from IFC's investment in the green bond to be issued by the Bank will be used for financing eligible green assets. IFC's proposed investment in the green bond will support Khan Bank in growing its green portfolio. 

Market Creation
Sustainability: The green bond to be issued by Khan Bank is expected to contribute to improving sustainability of financial market in Mongolia, as IFC will support a systemically important bank in the country to issue the country's first green bond. The green bond will follow the Green Bond Principles, thus reinforcing harmonized green practices in the market via demonstration and market enabling channels. Moreover, the growth of the Bank's climate portfolio is likely to demonstrate the importance of climate finance as a separate asset class, sending a strong signal to the market and motivating other financial and non-financial institutions to replicate and contribute to the development of the green bond market.

title: Ascott SLB
content: The most significant expected Project-level effect is environmental effect through reduction in GHG emissions and resource efficiency. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater sustainability in the real estate sector in emerging East Asia Pacific (EAP) countries. CLAS's strong commitment to greening its properties will provide a highly visible demonstration case given its prominent position in the marketplace. This could help further the sustainability agenda of the institutional real estate market in emerging EAP.

title: GTFP Providus B.
content:
Project Impact:
Stakeholder Effects: Access to Trade Finance for SMEs in Nigeria  IFC's GTFP will provide trade finance support to Providus Bank and consequently to the Bank's customers thereby promoting trade for both corporates and SMEs in Nigeria. By joining the GTFP, the Bank will have access to a network of 400 confirming banks. This is expected to help boost the profile of the Bank and open doors for more future engagements with the confirming banks beyond trade. This Project will consequently allow the Bank to offer better terms to its clients which includes SMEs.<U+00A0>

Contribution to Market Creation:
Resilience: GTFP builds, protects, and deepens trade finance networks in lower income/IDA and fragile and conflict-affected countries, by continually enabling individual trade transactions to take place, which slowly builds resilience of trade networks, trade, and income to these economies. This support is especially critical in the maintenance of liquidity and essential goods when the market is facing shocks (most recently triggered by COVID-19). GTFP also ensures that the flow of essential goods and finance is maintained, preventing a potential crisis and further building resilience in the market.<U+00A0>

title: Afrigreen Debt Impact Fund
content: The Project is expected to improve the affordability of electricity supply for C&I customers in W&C Africa by supporting the development of ca. 90 megawatts of solar photovoltaic capacity. C&I customers in the target markets face high electricity costs due to high tariffs for grid electricity (e.g., Ghana and Senegal), as well as reliance on diesel generators in Sierra Leone and Nigeria. The Project will also contribute to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution by displacing fossil fuel generation with a green source. At the market level, the Project is expected to enhance financial integration by supporting a debt fund with a standardized, scalable platform approach to help address a funding gap for small and medium C&I solar, thereby demonstrating a financing model that may be replicated by other lenders.

title: IDEI Green PCG
content: IFC expects the project to generate an increase in access to quality housing for middle-income populations and have positive environmental effects through reduction in energy and water consumption. At the market level, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote financial integration of the housing market through demonstration effects, where the Company will diversify its lender base through the issuance of the first Sustainability-Linked Bond (SLB) by a housing developer.

title: Kairouan Solar Plant
content: The Project promises strong development impact in Tunisia as it is expected to (i) expand solar capacity to generate more efficient and environmentally friendly sources of energy to meet the growing local demand; (ii) contribute towards improved affordability of power by lowering the cost of generation, which is currently heavily reliant on imported fuel; (iii) contribute to power market competitiveness by attracting private sector participation; and (iv) enhance the power sector resilience by diversifying the country's power generation mix, which currently has a very low share of green generation infrastructure.

title: InVivo Ukraine
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory to Good. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the impact on farmers' access to markets and quality inputs as well as its contribution to global food security.

title: Vivriti_ABS
content:
1.	Access to finance for MSMEs including women owned MSMEs: As per IFC estimates, the MSME finance gap in India is ? 25.8 trillion (USD348.6 billion), equivalent to 18% of GDP, when aggregating both the formal and informal sector. By supporting financial institutions in offloading existing MSME loans, the project will free up capital for expanding additional financing to MSMEs.
2.	Market integration: The Project will support the development of the securitization market in India both from the buy-side as well as from the sell-side. By introducing a new platform to buy loan portfolios of multiple FIs through a fund structure, the Project will demonstrate the effectiveness and viability of such a vehicle and encourage further such funds/structures. On the buy-side, IFC's participation in this structure in India will encourage other domestic institutional investors as well as foreign investors to participate in the securitization market, which currently is dominated by local banks.

title: Greenlam South Limited
content: The expected project-level outcomes are stakeholder effects, through contribution to employment and value-added to GDP in India. IFC anticipates that the Project will create significant jobs with the new upcoming capacity, including direct and indirect jobs. Contribution to market effects are to improve sector competitiveness through demonstration effects. The Project supports a market leader in laminate manufacturing to enter the particle board market, and expects to contribute to strengthening the competitiveness of the wood panels sector.

title: Home First Debt
content:
Stakeholders impact: 

Improved access to affordable housing finance and green affordable housing finance: IFC anticipates that the investment will increase retail borrowers' access to housing finance and green housing finance, and encourage homeownership for low-income segments. Rapid urbanization in India has led to several challenges including congestion, pressure on basic amenities, and severe housing shortages in cities, especially in the low-cost segment. 
Limited penetration of green housing is another key challenge in the housing market in India. IFC estimates a total green buildings/housing investment opportunity of US$1.4 trillion in India from 2018 to 2030. 

Market impact:

Competitiveness: IFC's support to the Project, along with IFC's other systematic engagements in the affordable housing segment, will promote greater competitiveness in the affordable housing market in India, including supporting the development of green affordable housing. The housing market in India is very active with both banks as well as NBFCs and HFCs providing housing finance. However, a large proportion of the housing finance focuses on higher income groups, and low and middle-income groups remain unserved/underserved. Although IFC has been supporting the development of affordable housing financiers through continued interventions, the shortage of affordable houses and affordable housing finance is substantial and would require continuous ongoing support.  In this context, the Project will demonstrate the viability of providing housing finance to lower-income groups at scale, and will also support the development of green affordable housing.

title: Avenue II
content: The Project is expected to contribute to increase the provision of health services in Kenya through increased capacity.

title: Produbanco SGB
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is improved access to finance for SMEs, women-owned SMEs and climate-smart projects, including those associated with the blue economy. Beyond this Project-level outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will further contribute to market wide sustainability through innovation, demonstration, and capacity building channels, as it will catalyze private FIs and investors to allocate capital to environmental challenges through blue financing.

title: IFRIA TCLP SSA
content: The Project is expected to improve access to high quality 3rd party TCL services in Morocco and Senegal through strategic acquisitions and greenfield investments that will add capacity of nearly 50,000 pallets across five facilities to meet growing demand, primarily in fruits & vegetables and fish supply chains. The investment will support economic growth and job creation in the target markets and will contribute to emissions savings through reduction of food losses and measures to reduce the carbon footprint of the facilities. Further, IFC expects the Project to improve competitiveness by introducing formality, efficient scale, new technologies and higher quality standards into the TCL industries in the target markets. Expansion of TCL services through the platform may also contribute to the integration trade flows across the North and West Africa region, as well as improved access to international markets for customers (by supporting imports), local fishing companies and producers (by supporting exports).

title: DARP NPL Jive II
content:
Stakeholders impact: The Project will support the acquisition and resolution of small and medium enterprises (SME) and corporate distressed assets in Brazil. By creating a more active distressed market, it will help: (a) financial institutions to offload distressed assets, and consequently release capital and decrease their liquidity needs, which will strengthen their capacity to increase their lending activity; and (b) Brazilian companies to normalize their defaulted obligations, regain access to credit and continue their operations. The Project will also support companies by providing immediate liquidity through the acquisition of their existing legal claims and precat<f3>rios.
 Market impact: IFC expects the Project will contribute to further develop the Brazilian distressed assets market by supporting Jive, an integrated asset manager and servicer which services a wide range of distressed assets. These are assets are currently not resolved in the market in an efficient manner.

title: Transform Health Fund
content: The project will promote access to growth capital for Fund investees in a number of Sub-Saharan African countries. By providing investees with needed financing it will support them to respond to the large gap in the availability of appropriate quality health services and products in these countries. Many of the investees would otherwise face challenges accessing finance. By providing financing to these companies the project will thus expand access to healthcare services and products. Providing support to these companies can be expected to have broader impacts on the markets they operate in and so strengthen these markets competitiveness and resilience.

title: Suzano Climate
content: IFC expects the Project to generate economy-wide effects and to have positive environmental effects. At the market level, the Project will help strengthen the competitiveness of Brazil's pulp and paper sector by incentivizing other players to replicate zero fossil fuel technology and other designs that optimize energy and resource efficiency.

title: Syrdarya CCGT
content: The Project will constitute a strategic asset in Uzbekistan's energy mix and is expected to add cost-efficient baseload capacity to NEGU to meet the growing demand for electricity. The Project would also reduce carbon emissions in line with Uzbekistan's Nationally Determined Contributions ('NDC') by displacing existing aging generation units with a more efficient CCGT technology. The Project would contribute to increase the resilience of electricity supply by adding installed capacity to the energy mix, and stabilize baseload supply to provide the necessary system flexibility to scale up renewable energy generation in line with Uzbekistan's carbon neutrality roadmap. The Project could also improve sector competitiveness by reinforcing market structure with increased IPP participation.

title: Sococim Low Carbon Cement
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are economy-wide and environmental effects. Beyond the Project, IFC expects the project will contribute to improve the sustainability of cement production in West Africa through dissemination of production processes compliant with the most demanding sustainability international standards; and increased availability of low carbon fuels.

title: GRPO Green Bond
content: The Project raises financing through a green bond issuance to refinance existing liabilities which were used for redeeming a portion of the US$250 million Eurobond issued in 2020 by GGU. The Project will help GCAP to support GRPO's core business and new renewable energy investments. The debt refinancing supported by the Project unlocks risk capital from the Sponsor to develop renewable energy projects. The main expected project-level outcomes are the positive environmental effects derived from increasing renewable energy capacity in Georgia and facilitate renewable energy supply to meet growing demand in Georgia. At a market level, the investment increases financial integration of Georgia's infrastructure corporates to capital markets and contributes to develop domestic capital market through demonstration effects.

title: Sal de Vida
content: IFC expects the Project to generate significant economy-wide impacts and local community benefits that will improve the fiscal outlook, economic performance, and social welfare (particularly for the bottom of the pyramid population) at national and regional levels. The anticipated market creation effect results from the Project's support for the transition to a low carbon economy by helping Argentina's lithium mining industry to integrate further and contribute to the global market. The Project is expected to increase Argentina's contribution and participation in the global lithium industry and set high sustainability standards for Argentina's lithium mining industry. The Project will further strengthen Argentina's position as a key global supplier of lithium for the decades to come. Sal de Vida is expected to contribute to the economy of Catamarca and its stakeholders via local employment, the development of local supply chains, and community development programs.

title: DCM FHIPO CL
content:
IFC's support will enable FHipo to expand the scale of its investments, by increasing the amount of residential mortgage portfolios acquired by them. This in turn is expected to have the following impacts: i) Residential mortgages originators will be benefited by obtaining access to liquidity and funding diversification to increase their operations, and, consequently, increasing the number of families being able to get mortgage financing; ii) investors will benefit since the project will contribute to a wider availability of impact investment opportunities in the capital markets and iii) enhancing Fintech mortgage market in Mexico through FHipo's partnership with YAVE.

The project will also have stakeholder impact as it will i) increase access to housing finance for formal sector workers that are currently un(der)served by commercial lenders; and (ii) complement the public sector's effort in addressing the severe shortage of affordable housing. Additionally, IFC anticipated that the Project will promote greater market inclusiveness by encouraging other financial institutions to replicate an innovative financing model that targets women-headed households, which have a lower access to finance and to housing loans in Mexico. IFC expects this financing method will help scale the availability of support for women and offering a model for replication by other financial entities.

title: Arcelik LTF
content: The Project's expected development outcome includes (i) economywide effects, through exports and job creation, and (ii) promotion of sector integration in terms of novel productive capabilities and technology transfers in Bangladesh.

title: Banco Internacional Blue Bond
content:
IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to climate finance, in particular blue economy projects aligned to international standards. 

Being part of a programmatic set of interventions from both the IFC and the WB that aim to increase Blue Finance in the country, beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the investment will contribute to greater market sustainability by promoting a new asset class following and disseminating the recently published IFC Blue Finance Guideline Framework in line with ICMA's Green Bond Principles.

title: BI COVID 19 WCS
content:
Expected Development Impact of the Project

The expected project-level outcomes are: Increased access to finance for SMEs (including WMSEs). Beyond the project-level outcomes, IFC expects this Project to contribute to market resilience, by supporting a systemic player to maintain and strengthen the SME lending market.

title: Banistmo Loan
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome are increased access to finance for SMEs including women-owned SMEs (WSMEs) and increased access to housing finance for low- and middle-income households including female-headed households. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that its financing will promote greater market inclusiveness via demonstration and replication and capacity building channels.

title: DCM-CRO-MREL Sustainability Bond-Raiffeisen Croatia
content:
The project is expected to:
i) contribute to increasing access to financing for eligible climate and social projects in Croatia
ii) contribute to greater market resilience by enhancing the capitalization of systemically important banks toward compliance with regulatory requirements under the European Commission's bank recovery and resolution directive 2019/879/EU (BRRD 2) by January 2024.

title: CR-SME FRB
content: EnvSocialRisksImpact Pending

title: GTLP SCB V
content: Increased access to finance: The Project will increase access to finance for Emerging Market importers and exporters. Improved availability of credit is expected to benefit local enterprises (producers and importers, including SMEs) along with value chain and, therefore, support growth, sustain employment and encourage the generation of higher incomes. Demonstration Effect: The Project will show other market participants the strength of an IFC partnership with a major international bank and Program Partners to support trade finance globally. The Project will have a strong demonstration effect by encouraging greater local/regional bank participation in Emerging Markets trade finance, thereby increasing access to such type of financing for local importers and exporters.

title: Altum CKD II
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) an increase in access to finance for SMEs, and (ii) an increase in the availability of climate finance by providing alternative sources of long-term financing to well performing SMEs and NBFIs. The Funds provide direct loans to SMEs and enable NBFIs to on-lend to underserved and constrained SMEs. Beyond the Project-level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the investment will contribute to market creation by improving environmental sustainability by establishing international green lending principles in the climate finance segment. Further, IFC expects this project to demonstrate the commercial viability of climate lending to SMEs and therefore encourage replication through alternative funding channels, such as debt funds.

title: Xcaret Hotels
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are economy-wide effects through increased direct value-addition and job creation, as well as indirect effects through increased economic activity in the supply chain. In addition, the Project will promote environmental effects through increased resource efficiency and carbon emission savings, as the new establishment will be EDGE certified. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote competitiveness by adopting green building practices and the Group's commitment to international Environment, Social and Governance Practices, which is critical for a healthy and sustainable recovery of the sector.

title: Dav Co Inclusion
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is improved access to finance for female-headed social households, WSMEs, LGBTI people and climate-smart projects. Beyond this Project-level outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will further contribute to market creation through capacity building, competitive pressure, and demonstration and replication channels, as it will trigger market-wide impact on financial inclusion of LGBTI people.

title: Gozem Vehicle Financing Platform
content: Development ImpactsThe main project-level impact is on stakeholders by supporting improved access and quality of urban transportation, and from increased formalized employment improving  quality and diversity of jobs. The project may also contribute to lowering the energy intensity of transport infrastructure by utilizing new vehicles with higher fuel efficiency. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to increase market competitiveness through improved innovation and project offering by developing a replicable financial and technical solution for the transport sector aimed at increasing the stock and quality of ride-hailing in francophone markets.

title: DFP Patria Infra
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is the improved quality of finance for infrastructure corporates through the provision of an alternative source of long-term local currency funding for projects aimed at increasing quality of infrastructure in Brazil. Moreover, the Project is expected to include a focus on projects and companies with female participation. Beyond the Project, at the market level, IFC believes that the Project will contribute to deepen integration of infrastructure to capital markets by demonstrating viability of infra debentures to finance greenfield and brownfield infrastructure projects with more flexible terms under a non-recourse basis, as well as the catalytic role of debt funds to mobilize institutional investors and position infrastructure debt as an investible asset class.

title: Eurofarma
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to vaccines and oral solids and antibiotics. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that its financing could support greater market resilience as spillover effects accrue to the healthcare supply chains in these markets.

title: GBRO Green Loan
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is increased access to green housing finance in Romania. Beyond the Project outcomes, IFC anticipates that this investment will promote market sustainability by the diversification of product offering, and the adoption of best practices in green mortgage finance through demonstration and replication channels.

title: Zhonggu GL
content: The project will support Zhonggu in expanding its operations through investment in vessels and containers, which will strengthen its multimodal transportation services and dry bulk containerization. The main project-level outcomes are the positive stakeholder effects of supporting increased volume of domestic cargo transported by expanded shipping capacity, and increased inland connectivity by supporting the Company's strategic expansion of multimodal transportation. Moreover, by shifting transportation from roads to sea and rail, the project is also expected to lead to positive environmental outcomes. At the market level, the investment is expected to contribute to competitiveness by supporting private investments in the domestic shipping sector, and demonstrating the shift towards dry bulk containerization and multimodal transportation.

title: Africa Go Green
content: AGG will fund decarbonization efforts in various sectors including (i) housing, (ii) e-mobility, (iii) manufacturing or industrial facilities, and (iv)  energy efficiency appliances, such as clean cooking solutions. Furthermore, IFC expects the Fund to attract additional investment to these sectors by demonstrating the viability of green investments in Sub-Saharan Africa. With new entrants in the market, IFC expects the Fund to foster a deeper integration of target countries' firms to global financial markets.

title: GPE Debt
content: The Project is expected to result in increased access to quality connectivity for individuals and businesses in Ethiopia, a country with large connectivity gaps. These outcomes will be achieved by rolling out fixed and mobile networks, including using a mix of 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G technology, with the objective to rapidly increase population coverage by 2029. Beyond the Project, this investment has the potential to create a competitive market for telecommunication services in Ethiopia via an enabling legal framework and competition facilitated by the entry of a new private sector-led operator, as part of the liberalization of the telecommunications sector.

title: DCM JKB Green Bond
content: The Project is expected to have the following Development Impact: (a) Stakeholders' effect  Increased Availability of Climate Finance: IFC will provide up to 5 years financing that will be leveraged by the Bank to grow its green portfolio which requires availability of longer-term capital. This will help in improving access to climate finance, contributing to the overall reduction in GHG emissions. IFC estimates that this investment will result in greenhouse gas reduction of approximately 31,376 tCO2e by 2027. As a reporting indicator, IFC will track the green-house gas emission reduction per year; and (b) Contribution to Market Creation - Sustainability: IFC anticipates that the Project will promote sustainability through the issuance of the first green bond in the country that will set standards for further such issuances and increase overall climate/green financing in Jordan. The Project is expected to establish and set the standards for green bonds in the market and hence encourage replication by other issuers. This is expected to mobilize incremental long-term resources for climate finance related projects and raise awareness among private sector companies of the merits of diversifying their financing sources and attracting capital markets financing to support green projects. As the first green bond in Jordan, the Project will set standards for the future issuances and introduce a new asset class to the local capital markets, which is expected to generate strong interest and pave the way for climate capital market transactions for a wide array of investors.

title: Global Partners
content: The Project is expected to result in increased access to quality connectivity for individuals and businesses in Ethiopia, a country with large connectivity gaps. These outcomes will be achieved by rolling out fixed and mobile networks, including using a mix of 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G technology, with the objective to rapidly increase population coverage by 2029. Beyond the Project, this investment has the potential to create a competitive market for telecommunication services in Ethiopia via an enabling legal framework and competition facilitated by the entry of a new private sector-led operator, as part of the liberalization of the telecommunications sector.

title: CCF Pilot
content:
The most significant,
expected Project-level outcomes are increased access to financing for producers
of NBS carbon credits and increased access to carbon credits for purchase by
entities seeking to use the credits, both of which will contribute to the
global transition to net-zero emissions. Beyond the Project-level outcomes, IFC
anticipates that the investment will support the growth of the carbon credit
market.

title: Dembesh Hotel
content:
The most important project level outcomes are:
(i) Economy wide effects: The Project which will support the expansion and modernization of the hotel is expected to have various positive economy-wide effects including: (a) direct job creation/preservation and contribution to GDP during the construction and operation phase of the hotel as well as indirect effects across the supply chains; (b) higher tax revenues for local government; (c) provision of infrastructure supporting the development of the tourism sector; and (d) increase in economic activities through increased international arrivals. These benefits will be important in South Sudan, where unemployment rates, exports are heavily dominated by oil and tourism & travel represent a small share of the GDP; and
(ii) Stakeholder impacts: (a) Employees: The Project will also contribute to local skill development. Dembesh Hotel will provide training to all its employees, addressing the skills gap and (b) benefit local suppliers through increased linkages.

Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will facilitate market creation in terms of:
(i) Competitiveness: The Project is anticipated to be the second internationally branded hotel to enter the market, contributing to the development of the country's business infrastructure; and 
(ii) Integration: The Project has the potential to promote integration of local suppliers within domestic supply chains. As suppliers receive training and contingent to level of training they receive, they can expand their reach beyond the hotel and start working with other local players.

title: Karavasta Solar
content: The Project will increase the electricity supply in Albania at a competitive tariff (for the supported generation). The Project contributes to increased resilience through the diversification of Albania's energy mix, which is currently fully reliant on domestic hydropower plants and imports. The Project contributes to an improvement in competitiveness by demonstrating the viability of developing PV solar projects with a mixed tariff structure and off-take strategy that takes partial market risks.  It is expected that successful financing and implementation of the project will encourage further private investments in the country.

title: Dhiraagu II
content: The main project level outcomes are (i) increased capacity of broadband networks through the construction of the first direct- route submarine cable providing digital connectivity between the archipelago of Maldives and the global Internet, reducing its dependency on other countries, and resulting in quality of broadband connectivity for individuals and businesses, and (ii) increased employment opportunities for women in technical roles. Beyond the project, this investment is expected to result in increased competitiveness of the market for broadband connectivity by inducing a market-wide improvement in affordability via competition channels.

title: Lighthouse IV
content:
Project level outcomes are delivered through increasing access to equity and value creation for mid-market companies in India, including supporting investees that are female-owned/led. Lighthouse is an experienced fund manager and will provide strategic and operational expertise to help investees to expand into new market segments and streamline operations. 

Market creation is delivered by strengthening the competitiveness of the private equity (PE) market in India. The project supports an experienced fund manager to raise a follow-on fund in the mid market segment. Beyond the project, the success of the Fund will encourage other local fund managers to raise new or follow funds in the segment. In turn, this will attract domestic and international institutional investors and is expected to reduce the need for development finance institutions (DFI) presence in the market for future fundraisings

title: KCB Senior Loan
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is improved accessibility of climate finance. Beyond these outcomes, IFC anticipates that its concerted investment and advisory services approach with the leading bank in Kenya will send a positive market signal on the commercial viability of further market expansion of green assets, including green buildings; thus, contributing towards increased sustainability through the demonstration, replication, and capacity building channels.

title: Kamal Steel
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are (i) economy-wide effects through value-addition and job creation in the target countries and (ii) environmental effects based on the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in the Tanzania and South Africa plants, enabled by the adoption of more resource efficient production processes. Beyond these outcomes, IFC expects that the Project will promote competitiveness in the steel industry in Tanzania by supporting the vertical integration of the supply chain with the operationalization the plant in South Africa. The Project will allow the Company to lower costs of production, improve resource efficiency, and expand its production capacity. This will likely generate competitive pressures and provide demonstration effects to other players, who will be incentivized to adopt a similar business model and improve the cost-efficiency of their operations, directly supporting the steel industry's competitiveness.

title: Uniao Quimica
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to vaccines and much-needed medication in Brazil, including additional capacity for COVID-19 treatment medication. There is also expected to be an impact on market resilience through strengthening the supply chain to deliver medication and vaccines.

title: SCV Fund III
content:
Project level outcomes are delivered through increased access to early-stage equity and operational value add for technology companies, primarily in the SEE region (mainly Serbia, Croatia, Slovenia, North Macedonia and other West Balkan countries). The fund will provide access to equity and value-creation for investees by helping them raise follow-on capital, introducing experts into portfolio companies to accelerate growth and leveraging their networks and relationships to enable scale.

Market creation is delivered through increased competitiveness of the venture capital market in SEE and through increased disruption of key markets with the support of market-disrupting digital business models. The  VC funds market in the SEE region, and in particular the Fund's target countries, is notably underdeveloped. SCV remains the only VC fund that has maintained presence and invested consistently in some of these countries over the past 10 years. IFC anticipates the Fund will send a signal to improve market competitiveness by demonstrating the viability of early-stage venture capital in the region. Furthermore, the Fund supports investees that develop tech-led innovative solutions to disrupt various real sector business models. IFC expects this will increase digitization and automation across some real sectors in the region.

title: Holland
content: The Project will contribute to (i) the production of 'green' metals through the acquisition and growth of a PGMs recycling company in an emerging market; (ii) recovering of scarce and valuable materials (PGMs & non-ferrous metals) to transform them into critical industrial and metallurgical commodities, resulting in lower greenhouse gas emissions compared to primary mining; (iii) creation of employment and economic activity in emerging markets; and (iv) demonstrating the application of circular economy concepts and energy-saving technologies and practices in e-waste, used lithium-ion batteries, and spent catalysts management, which can contribute to their increased adoption in the sector.

title: Amunet Wind IPP
content: The main project-level effect is on stakeholders through the increased affordability of renewable energy capacity in Egypt by lowering the average cost of power generation as well as the associated environmental effects through decarbonizing power generation and displacing aging baseload. Beyond the project, the investment is expected to help enhance the power sector resilience through diversifying the energy mix and supporting the cost recovery model & subsidy elimination program that the GoE is implementing with support from the IMF.

title: El Sewedy Loan I
content: The Project is expected to improve efficiency of operations, reduce cost and carbon footprint intensity. The most significant expected project-level outcome is primarily driven by (i) the reduction of Green House Gases (GHG) emissions via the Solar IPP projects in Algeria and Namibia; as well as (ii) economy-wide effects through the increase in value added and formal employment creation in Pakistan and Tanzania.Beyond the Project outcomes, IFC expects the greenfield investments of the Project to promote the competitiveness of high-quality and more complex high-voltage electrical equipment (e.g. cables, wires and transformers) in the electricity transmission and distribution value chains in Tanzania and other countries in Africa.

title: YKL Climate
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is increased access to climate finance, including climate mitigation and adaptation financing in the form of green and blue leasing loans for SMEs. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase the market?s sustainability by catalyzing other market participants to also engage in blue financing via innovation and demonstration channels.

title: Ventius Kosovo
content: Project-level outcome: economy-wide effects. The Project is expected to contribute to employment in a country where unemployment rate is usually high. The proposed investment will support the Company and its customers to sustain their operations and create 1,500 new jobs, as well as additional jobs along the value chain. The Project is also expected to contribute to Kosovo's GDP (by expanding domestic value addition and exports) and foreign exchange generation.

title: Balfin Group
content: Expected Project-level outcomes are increased supply of business enabling infrastructure, and increased access to modern retail for consumers. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote competitiveness in the retail market in Albania.

title: DCM RBRO MREL 2
content:
The project is expected to: 
i) contribute to increasing access to financing for eligible climate and social projects in Romania. 
ii) contribute to greater market resilience by enhancing the capitalization of systemically important banks toward compliance with regulatory requirements under the European Commission's bank recovery and resolution directive 2019/879/EU (BRRD 2) by January 2024.

title: GWFP Nitron 2022
content: Project outcomesContribute to the agriculture sector in LAC and globally by increasing reliable fertilizer supply to farmers. The transaction will help farmers to improve crop yields and increase supply of fertilizers and reinforce food and nutrition security. The larger available trade finance lines will allow Nitron to reach a wider range of customers and suppliers.Stakeholder effects: Increased access to fertilizers for farmers: The main stakeholders are local farmers who import fertilizers to grow their crops of agricultural commodities. In 2021, Nitron sold 6.4 million metric tons of fertilizers to LAC. Currently, fertilizer application rates in many LAC and emerging markets are significantly below international averages, which negatively impacts crop yields and farmers profitability. The greater access to fertilizers is of particular importance given the restricted availability of liquidity and the constraints with respect to country/obligor limits in emerging markets.Market Creation:Integration: IFC expects the Facilities, through the demonstration and replication channel, to contribute to the strengthening of financial integration of the fertilizer value chain in the markets where Nitron operates. In this way, Nitron is expected to attract other private sector banks to finance the growth of its trading activity. This would be due to the market's positive reaction to IFC's continued support of Nitron.Resilience: The supply in trade finance, in LAC and elsewhere, has been negatively affected by the declining trends in cross border banking networks. IFC's continued participation in the facility should maintain/ increase the number of banks interested in working with Nitron. IFC's participation in the financing will help to ensure participation of other cross border banks, supporting a larger amount of much needed fertilizer imports into LAC.

title: Vertex Fund 5
content:
Stakeholders (investee companies): Increased access to early stage equity and operational value add for technology companies in SEA and India. The fund will provide access to equity and value creation for investees by helping raise follow on capital, introducing experts into portfolio companies to accelerate growth and leveraging their networks and relationships to enable scale. The fund has demonstrated success with their previous funds.  Access to venture capital in India is high and in 2021 VC volumes continued to rise over four times compared to the previous year. The majority of VC volumes were driven by late stage VC where funding rounds are significantly higher. While there is access to funding in the country, high quality and institutional domestic fund managers who can provide quality operational advice and mentoring, especially at very early seed stages, remains limited. The SEA region also has good access to venture capital, with regional volumes doubling in 2021 and reaching an annual five year average VC volume of 5,593m. However, the entire regional block still only has half the VC penetration rate of India, demonstrating that relative to the size of its economic activity, there is still potential for more venture capital to meet demand. 

Integration:  Increased disruption of key markets through the support of market disrupting digital business models.  The Fund is supporting investees developing tech led innovative solutions to disrupt various real sector business models IFC expects this will increase competitiveness across markets that are characterized by low productivity, poor efficiency and low competition. The investees' innovative businesses models can strengthen supply chains by reducing the role of brokers and intermediaries, improve price transparency, and have a demonstration effect by catalyzing replication from new entrants In markets where investees grow rapidly and become sizeable market players, innovation at scale can generate large impacts on a market's competitiveness by pushing traditional players to innovate or reducing traditional incumbents' market share.

title: Omni Equity
content:
Through this investment, IFC will support a specialized technology platform in its efforts to leverage digitization trends and regulatory developments to bring quality improved trade finance solutions to suppliers across Latin America.
IFC anticipates that the project will scale a digital supply chain finance platform contributing towards reducing information asymmetries in the market by fostering digitization of transactions, improving access to data & analytics, and bringing best practices from Chile and Colombia to new markets.

title: DCM TTB GreenBlue 2021
content:
Increased Access to Climate Finance: IFC's proposed investment will support TTB to grow the financing of EVs, and, as a financial intermediary, to catalyze the private sector in Thailand to adopt environmental and social sustainable principles, thereby reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emission.

Increased Access to Finance for Blue Projects: IFC's proposed investment will assist TTB to provide more financing to critical areas such as marine plastic recycling, water conservation and wastewater treatment projects.  
 
Market Creation: The first blue bond to be issued by a Thai financial institution would create market for the new instrument, catalyze the role played by financial intermediary in promoting sustainable development of ocean economy, and set standard for other local financial institutions to replicate. Currently there is no established practice for private sector financial institutions to issue blue bonds, which should include a set of common principles on use of proceeds, measurement, and reporting. Over the course of the investment horizon IFC will apply a systematic approach to developing the blue bond market in Thailand and globally, through a combination of investment, upstream and advisory engagements.

title: Yunda Rural Agri Logistics
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcomes include improved logistics and express delivery services to customers in the less developed Central and Western China, reduced food losses and increased access to the e-commerce market for farmers, and creation of high-quality formal jobs in the frontier region with economy-wide effects. At the market level, the Project is expected to improve domestic integration of logistics services to help reduce the discrepancies between higher-income eastern coastal region and lower-income central and western regions and rural areas.

title: BUA Cement P1
content:
Through the proposed investment, IFC will support a leading cement manufacturer in Nigeria improve access to good quality cement at affordable prices in Northern Nigeria and neighboring land locked countries. IFC's
additionality in this Project comes in two forms: (i) Economy wise and employment effects in the form of contributing to GDP by supporting domestic value addition to available natural resources (i.e., limestone and clay) and creating direct and indirect jobs ; and (ii) Improved access and sustainability in the form of eliminating longdistance trips to source cement for customers in Sokoto and other northern regions as well as support cleaner power generation solutions not widely present in the northern parts of Nigeria. The Project will also include provisions of IFC's value-add advisory services as outlined above.

title: Korzinka
content: The Project will have significant development impact. The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes are i) increased access to modern retail for consumers in Uzbekistan and ii) job creation and preservation. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote financial integration through enabling a loan aligned with Islamic Finance Principles.

title: BOP Evocabank
content:
Improved access to finance for SMEs: The Project will increase access to finance for MSMEs to support economic activity. 
Market creation. Resilience: The Project will strengthen IFC's efforts to foster resilience amongst banks and MSME finance providers in Armenia by helping the market deal with the continuing uncertainty and catalyzing investor response.

title: Blueberry III
content: IFC expects the Project to generate economy-wide effects from job creation and economic value-added through expansion. At the market level, the Project will help to strengthen the resilience of South Africa's blueberry sector to frost and abnormal rainfall risk through, planting OZblu<U+00AE> varieties that fruit in alternate windows, R&D and implementation of innovative mitigation measures.

title: Naked Insurance
content: The most significant, expected Project outcome is increased access of non-life insurance for individual customers in South Africa. Furthermore, the Project is expected to contribute to greater competitiveness in the market, by supporting the growth of an innovative insurtech that focuses on driving insurance digitization.

title: BOP CRDB TZ-Senior Loans
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome for the project is access to finance for MSMEs to support economic activity and resilience in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of lending to BOP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

title: AIK Banka SME
content: IFC will support AIK to provide increased access to financing for SMEs, and through climate finance support some of these SMEs in greening their business. At the market level, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater market competitiveness within the climate finance market in Serbia, through demonstration and replication channels.

title: Mavesa Ecuador
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are the effects on consumers where the Company's financing of heavy vehicles will enable microentrepreneurs to develop and run their businesses that would otherwise not be possible. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that its financing will promote competitiveness in the commercial vehicle retail industry in Ecuador.

title: BOP BSS Micro Loan
content:
(i) Stakeholder's Effect: increased access to finance for MSMEs. The Project supports BSS to provide much-needed financing to microentrepreneurs and small businesses and aid them in overcoming liquidity constraints and returning to their previous income generating capacity. 
(ii) Market Creation: resilience. The Project will support resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of lending to BOP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

title: KB Bukopin Debt
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring ("AIMM") rating of Good. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is greater access to finance for MSMEs including women-owned businesses, affordable housing, some sectors of basic infrastructure, and essential services such as education and healthcare. IFC anticipates the investment will contribute to greater market integration by demonstrating the feasibility of issuing thematic instruments that are aligned to international principles and will drive much-needed financing to underserved social sectors, especially in the wake of the COVID-19 crisis.

title: Kitabisa
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is increased access to insurance to underserved segments in Indonesia. Kitabisa will offer accessible coverage through an innovative direct-to-consumer and digitally native approach with on-demand sharia-based insurance products targeted at low to middle income groups that would typically not buy insurance products due to limited availability and/or affordability of suitable products. Through an end-to-end digital business model, development of unique and affordable products and a focus in increasing consumer awareness of insurance, Kitabisa will tackle some of the key barriers to insurance access in Indonesia. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the project will lead to greater competitiveness in the insurance space, by demonstrating the viability of digital-led business model in increasing insurance uptake, including amongst underserved segments.

title: SeABank Convert
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) improved access to finance for local SMEs and (ii) promotion of international standards and best practices in E&S risk management.

title: Telecom Arg 2022
content: The Project is expected to result in improved quality of digital connectivity for individuals and businesses in Argentina, by increasing the capacity of broadband networks through new or upgraded mobile sites, expansion of fiber-optic networks and the use of more efficient energy sources. Beyond the Project, this transaction is expected to sustain the competitiveness of the market for broadband internet in Argentina by contributing to expand high-speed broadband networks beyond the Company via competition channels.

title: Ege Endustri
content:
Economywide effects-Increasing exports through value addition: Automotive (auto parts)  industry is one of the primary drivers of Turkey's exports and economic growth. In 2020, exports of vehicles and vehicle parts amounted to US$22.7 billion, representing 13% of total exports of goods and services. Vehicle parts, in turn, amounted to US$4.6 billion or 3% of total exports. Through the Project, the Company will increase its exports, directly contributing to improving Turkey's current account deficit (CAD)  particularly important amid the volatile macroeconomic context experienced recently by the country. The Project is anticipated to contribute to the Turkish economy by both direct value addition, as well as through indirect effects induced in the value chain. Finally, IFC anticipates that through increased backward linkages, the Project will contribute to indirect employment in Ege Endustri's supply chain.

Integration: The automotive supplier industry is well developed in Turkey. In 2020, overall vehicle parts represented 2.6% of Turkish exports, valued at US$4.6 billion. The most important challenges faced by Turkish automotive suppliers are (i) subdued adoption of new technologies, which may result in lower value-added products and associated decline in margins, given the increase in global demand for technology-based products and (ii) limited strategizing and investment to develop the necessary capabilities and positioning to remain competitive in the future.  It is imperative for the Turkish automotive supplier industry to prepare for the transition from traditional systems to higher-technology adoption, per the market dynamics as global automotive OEMs are ramping up their production of electric vehicles (EVs) and hybrid engine models. 

Ege Endustri has emerged as one of the leading players among Turkish automotive suppliers, through continuous investment in technology, research and development, cost competitiveness and capacity expansion.  IFC's Project will build on Ege Endustri's ongoing strategy for the electrification of its products. The consolidation in a single facility of two existing plants and adoption of robotic equipment for automated manufacturing technology will enable the Company to achieve economies of scale and increased cost-efficiency, expanding the output capacity to produce axles and suspensions for e-trucks. The success of the Project will provide demonstration effects to other automotive suppliers in Turkey to improve their cost-efficiency, enhance operating standards, and expand capacity for local production of higher-technology products, which can potentially strengthen their forward linkages and integration with global OEMs. The Turkish automotive suppliers will be incentivized to follow suit, amid increasing pressures in the global supply chain as automotive industry leaders gradually increase the electrification of their products. Furthermore, in the long-term, Ege Endustri's capacity expansion for e-truck components has the potential to support local OEMs of electrified heavy commercial vehicles in Turkey.

title: BGrimm Bond
content: The investment is expected to support B.Grimm's strategy to decarbonize its portfolio while increasing RE capacity in the region. The Project will support greenfield renewable energy projects and reduce GHG emissions, which will sustainably address growing energy demands in markets dominated by thermal power. IFC' expects the investment to improve financial integration by demonstrating a relatively new financing instrument with potential for uptake in the wider region as companies transition to sustainable solutions and more investors seek companies adopting such strategies.

title: Absa Housing
content:
Stakeholders Effects: Increased access to housing finance. The Project will contribute to increased access to affordable housing finance (mortgages) leveraging Absa's market position and substantial reach. The entirety of the ZAR2 billion loan proceeds will be allocated for affordable mortgage finance, thereby helping narrow South Africa's housing finance gap.

Inclusiveness. This will be the first SLP certified loan by a commercial bank in South Africa thereby introducing a certified social loan in the market to mobilize capital for affordable housing. This demonstrates to other banks and investors the viability and replicability of mortgage lending centered around affordable segments. Other financial institutions may be expected to see the merit and business case of scaling up investments to reach these underserved groups, resulting in a wider adoption of social loan and bond frameworks and standards that will create a more inclusive environment.

title: AGUNSA UCL
content:
Stakeholders - Access and Quality.
The project will allow the continuity to the operation of Valparaiso's Terminal 2 under a short-term concession, thus maintaining access and quality to port users. To maintain the terminal level of service the client has committed to purchase equipment to support vessel and land side operations for both containerized and general cargo.  The project will also allow the company to continue growing its logistics services portfolio (warehousing, labelling, consolidation and deconsolidation of containers, pallets dismantling/assembly, temperature-controlled storage), which was up 8% in YoY basis, and to consider the potential expansion of its geographic footprint outside of Chile.

Market Level - Competitiveness.
The Project will contribute to maintaining market competitiveness by supporting a key player introducing innovative services and practices into Chile's logistics sector. Agunsa is implementing technology solutions like a virtual trucking services exchange portal that contributes to improve asset utilization which results in lower vehicle operating costs per unit of cargo transported and can potentially result in lower costs to customers. In addition, the platform's real time pricing increases price transparency for customers. The platform also increases reliability of trucking services by offering tracking cargo capabilities which adds visibility to the logistics chain.  By demonstrating the business case of this innovative services, the project is expected to promote the development of a more sophisticated sector and effectively contribute to economic distance between Chile and its commercial partners. Logistics competitiveness is an important driver of economic growth in Chile and accounts for 11.5% of its GDP (2020).

Market Level - Financial Integration.
The Project will pioneer the use of a sustainability-linked loan (SLL) in the logistics services sector in Chile, contributing to their increased adoption and helping draw ESG investors to the sector. Agunsa's pioneering SLL will contribute to market development by demonstrating the viability of this instrument for a company of its size and by providing a model for structuring similar loans in the Chilean market. Replicating the SLL would allow mid-size companies to tap into the demand for assets that have a positive environmental impact, in order to diversify sources of financing.

title: ECCBC Green Loan
content:
Project Outcomes: 
IFC expects the Project will:
i)	Create ~26 direct jobs plus about 6,510 indirect and induced jobs throughout the value chain, because of increased production and downstream effects on the retail value chain 
ii)	Increase outreach and improve business of the distributors and retailers especially in the rural areas of West Africa 
iii)	Contribute to a low-carbon pathway by virtue of more efficient compressors and manufacturing processes, especially the replacement of existing refrigerants by ones with zero global warming potential.

Market Creation: 
i)	Increase competitiveness in the beverage sector in North and West Africa through the demonstration of the business case for resource efficient production processes.

title: Horizon Ukr IV
content:
Stakeholders (Fund's portfolio companies): The Fund will provide capital and value creation to mid-cap companies primarily active in Ukraine and Moldova, to address a lack of access to equity capital, particularly given the challenging environment, by making investments of $1030 million in around 10-15 companies. Horizon Capital has demonstrated a strong track record of supporting value creation in its portfolio companies, reflected in both market expansion and job creation. The Fund Manager has delivered solid results by backing competitive platforms generating hard currency revenues globally, which are resilient to domestic macro and currency shocks. The Fund Manager remains fully committed to Ukraine and Moldova, including a dedicated operations advisory team to support portfolio companies in managing the current situation and continuing to pursue their growth objectives. In line with its commitment to promoting gender equality, Horizon Capital has set a target of at least 25% of its portfolio companies being women led/owned companies.
Resilience: Ukraine has a long history of PE investments; however, current circumstances limit commercial interest and investment in this market. As a leading investment firm in Ukraine, Horizon Capital plays an anchoring role within the PE market in Ukraine, demonstrating fundraising strength and delivering results during prior periods of conflict and economic uncertainty. IFC expects Horizon Capital's continued commitment and presence to support preservation of near-term market activity, while backing companies which will support Ukraine's economic revival and future growth. The Fund will be one of the first investments by IFC in Ukraine since the war began in February 2022, and as such, will send a significant signal in demonstrating market resilience and encouraging investors to capitalize on the opportunities that Ukraine and Moldova have to offer.

title: RSE Covid HSA
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is the increased supply of staple goods in a country experiencing internal strife and high levels of food insecurity. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates its investment will improve market resilience by increasing food production, which builds capacity to withstand shocks and stresses related to COVID19. Please see the related public disclose: https://disclosures.ifc.org/project-detail/SII/43466/hsa-foods-yemen

title: South-East Europe Food Retail
content: The Project will enhance access to quality affordable food in the Target Balkan Countries, create jobs, including for vulnerable population and Ukrainian migrants, and contribute to strengthening the food supply chain in all project countries. The Project will also promote market competitiveness in the Target Balkan Countries by increasing penetration of modern retail and by demonstrating higher performance standards for energy efficiency in new stores and warehouses built as part of the Project.

title: LOGOS Green Data Center Venture
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are derived from increased access to data hosting services through construction of DCs in facilities in emerging countries in Asia and Pacific region, which will benefit global digital platforms, including hyperscalers and DC operators that serve businesses seeking to introduce their IT equipment, and therefore, could result in improved business productivity and increased availability of digital services for individuals. The Project seeks to introduce a business model that facilitates access to land and energy, two critical inputs that typically delay market entry for DC operators. Furthermore, the Project will adopt several sustainability standards, including designing DC assets that are more resource efficient compared to traditional DCs, and seeking to power the facilities with renewable energy that have a lower carbon footprint. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that, depending on the target country, a successful introduction of this business model could accelerate entry of new hyperscalers seeking to catch up with the Venture's clients, or the expansion of DC operators taking advantage of greater demand for data hosting services stimulated by the Project.

title: Dialog 2021
content:
i.	Increased uptake of quality broadband connectivity through densification and coverage of high-speed broadband networks in Sri Lanka, in a context of a macroeconomic downturn with high inflation potentially affecting consumers' purchasing power, and against the background of gaps in quality of connectivity compared to other emerging markets. 

ii.	Maintaining the competitiveness of the market for broadband connectivity in Sri Lanka, which remains underdeveloped, by reinforcing competitive pressure on other telecom operators to accelerate their network upgrade.

title: Olam WC Loan
content: The Project will sustain flows of key food commodities of wheat, corn, and soy to over 10 countries in Africa, Asia, and Middle East regions. The most significant, expected project-level outcome is food security for consumers in countries affected by high food inflation. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that its financing will promote greater resilience in the global food supply market.

title: Alcazar Energy Partners II SCSP
content: The main project-level effect is on stakeholders through the increased affordability of renewable energy capacity in the target markets as well as the associated environmental effects through decarbonizing power generation and displacing aging baseload. Beyond the project, the investment is expected to help enhance the power sector resilience through diversifying the energy mix in the target markets.

title: WCS COVID Daycoval II
content:
Through the Project, IFC will support Daycoval to increase access to finance for SMEs and WSMEs in Brazil. It is expected that this in turn will preserve jobs and enterprise growth by supporting working capital needs and trade related financing for Brazilian SMEs with a focus on women owned SMEs. In Brazil, credit penetration has been one of the most important issues in financial sector development given the structural barriers and lack of incentives for banks to service these segments. The COVID crisis has exacerbated the challenge, further tightened credit lines and hindered the growth potential of the SMEs.

Moreover, the Project will also help the financial sector increase its ability to continue to withstand shocks from the continuing devasting effects of the COVID-19 crisis and other macro vulnerabilities. Through this project, IFC is enabling Daycoval to support the working capital needs of SMEs during a time of crisis and contribute to the diversification of available financing in the market to include SMEs.

title: DCM BQD Blue Bond
content:
1)	Increased funding for blue projects: IFC anticipates that this Project will increase access to finance for the blue economy through the targeted use of proceeds and expanding the green finance principles to include a new blue finance taxonomy.
2)	Sustainability: IFC anticipates that the Project will promote sustainability by catalyzing the blue finance in China and more broadly in emerging markets.

title: DCM BCR MREL 2
content: The Project will increase access to housing finance and climate finance (in the form of green housing loans), two of the most underserved segments in the Romanian economy. The project is also expected to promote a more dynamic domestic corporate bond market by increasing the diversity of instruments, tenors and issuers.

title: Isbank DPR
content:
Improved access to housing finance: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to the increase in access to housing finance in Turkey, as 100% of the use of proceeds will be allocated for residential mortgages.
Improved access to green housing finance: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to the increase in access to green housing finance in Turkey, as up to $35 million of the use of proceeds potentially will be allocated specifically for green mortgage loans.

title: MCPP OP Allianz
content: The Fund will invest only in IFC-originated projects in which IFC is already an investor through its A Loans. Therefore the IFC investment in this Fund does not receive an AIMM score. Each IFC-originated project under the fund will receive an individual AIMM rating. As such, the development impact of the proposed first loss investment will mirror the development impact achieved by IFC.

title: Growtheum Capital Partners SEA Fund I LP
content: Expected development impact outcomes include i) providing access to equity capital for mid-cap companies in SE Asia, and ii) value creation for the Fund's portfolio companies through hands-on operational and strategic support.

title: Accra Medical I
content:
IFC expects the Project to increase the delivery of high-quality healthcare services in Ghana. The project will do this by supporting the development of the new facilities. This will directly benefit patients in Accra and Takoradi and the larger community through the provision of enhanced specialist care, and contribute to the market's development.   
The concessional rate for the cost of capital will accord AMC the ability to reduce service charges and/or introduce discount pricing to untapped segments of the market which could result in an expansion of AMC's outreach to a larger populace. 

The funding will result in the provision of the following additional services at AMC Accra: (1) Obstetrics & Gyanaecology Services; (2) Neo-natal Intensive Care Unit ; (3) Intensive Care Unit /High Dependency Unit Services, and  (4) Specialist Surgical Services. Access to critical care and emergency care services to help improve the capacity and quality of critical care services

AMC Takoradi will be an ultra-modern 15 bed Physician Specialist and Medical Diagnostic Centre and expected to serve the Sekondi-Takoradi Community thereby helping to fill the void to accessible, affordable and reliable customer-oriented healthcare services within the Sekondi-Takoradi Metropolis.

title: WCS Fidelity GH
content:
The project is expected to (i) Increase access to finance for MSMEs by supporting Fidelity Bank's capacity to provide working capital and trade related solutions to MSMEs which will help to bridge the MSME finance gap in Ghana.
(ii) Promote competitiveness in SME finance as FBL demonstrates the commercial viability of the segment through increase scale and a boost to its Inclusive Banking Program.

title: GTLP HSBC
content: By sustaining HSBC's ability to provide trade finance services, despite global macroeconomic challenges, the Project is intended to address global trade finance gap and increase and/or maintain access to trade finance for ultimate stakeholders including Emerging Markets Issuing Banks ("EMIBs") and underlying importers and exporters in Emerging Markets. In addition, it is aimed at promoting global financial and economic integration by increasing the delivery of trade finance to EMIBs, resulting in more support of trade activities across markets through a wide geographical coverage and potentially grow the enabling platform of the Correspondent Banking Network.

title: GTFP Global IME
content: The proposed project is expected to have both project level and market level development impact. The expected project-level outcome is improved access to Trade Finance for GIBL and its trade finance customers. The proposed GTFP facility will allow GIBL to connect with more global Confirming Banks (CBs) with better capacity which will help the Bank to process more transaction for its clients. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that GTFP improves overall market integration by (1) maintaining and expanding trade finance, financial linkages and trade across multiple markets through strengthening these bilateral correspondent banking connections; (2) serving as an enabling platform to make new connections between local and international banks and their customers; (3) channeling new sources of capital to support Emerging Markets and Developing Economies (EMDE) trade flow through demonstration and replication of successful correspondent banking connections and the trade finance program itself as a successful investment instrument.

title: WCS CR Banpais
content:
The project is expected to have a development impact in terms of increased access to working capital credit for SMEs and WSMEs in Honduras. The Facility is supporting BanPais' clients' capacity to sustain operations during an acute shock, supporting the private sector economic recovery process and shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. 

More than two years after the first COVID-19 infections, the pandemic continues to affect firms in a variety of ways, hindering a sustained recovery. Moreover, Honduras and the northern part of the country where BanPais operates were severely affected in 2020 not only by the COVID-19 pandemic but by the impact of hurricanes Eta and Iota, exacerbating the country's intrinsic vulnerabilities. A return to pre-COVID-19 economic activity necessitates access to finance for SMEs to sustain and grow operations and economic activity. 

The proposed investment will provide working capital to the Bank focusing the proceeds on the SME segment, facilitating loans to this segment and helping reduce the SME finance gap in the country.

title: BBVA Colombia Green Senior Loan
content: By supporting BBVA Colombia, IFC best positions the private sector to support the growth of green buildings and climate smart assets in Colombia.

title: SLGP Equity BCDC
content:
Assessment of Project Outcomes
