content: The Project is expected to strategically increase access to climate financing specifically by supporting the financing of green consumer loans. Consumer credit solutions can play a key role in supporting the green transition in Romania and with this project, IFC will help consumers to contribute to climate goals through their consumption choices, particularly by helping to fund green asset purchases

title: Demir MSME
content: The most significant expected project-level effect is increased access to SME finance in the Kyrgyz Republic, including for WSMEs. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that through demonstration and replication effects, the Project will contribute towards increased inclusiveness of women owned SMEs finance market in the country.

title: Airtel Africa
content: The Project is expected to increase access to quality mobile connectivity through the expansion of capacity and coverage of high-speed mobile network in target countries with gaps in access to quality mobile connectivity. These outcomes have the potential to result in enhanced GDP growth and employment in the target countries by enabling efficiencies, innovation and inclusion across their economies. The project is also expected to increase overall mobile market competitiveness by funding and thereby enabling further technological innovation or improvement in affordability of high-speed mobile Internet.

title: ISC-AVV
content:
The Project is expected to align with the AIMM Rating for the Startup Catalyst Envelope.

IFC anticipates that the Project would result in increased access to seed stage equity for digital startups in Vietnam, especially for women founders. The Project is also expected to increase the ability for startups to succeed and scale digital businesses, through the Fund's dedicated mentorship programs and window for follow-on funding.

Beyond the Project, this investment has the potential to develop the start-up ecosystem and initial building blocks for venture capital markets in Vietnam, via demonstration and replication, enabling, and capacity building channels. IFC's investment is expected to send a signal on the viability of investing in digital startups established in Vietnam. IFC's support also enables creation of a constant and quality pipeline of investment opportunities that investors at Series A stage and beyond.

title: DCM Haier Leasing Social Bond
content:
1)	Stakeholders Effect - Improve access to finance for social sectors, specifically in rural areas:  IFC anticipates that this project will increase access to finance for the provision of essential services in rural areas in such as education, healthcare, food security as well as sustainable agriculture businesses, and the support of SMEs, in particular women enterprises  in China. IFC expects this project to provide innovative long-term financing for end borrowers and improve Haier Leasing's capacity related to social financing. 
2)	Market Creation - Sustainability: IFC anticipates that the issuance of the ICMA compliant social bond by Haier Leasing will enable other players in the market to follow suit with internationally recognized instruments to raise funds for social projects including SME, healthcare, education, sustainable agriculture in China. The Project is expected to help create a credible and sustainable market for social bonds in China and is expected to encourage other Chinese institutions to replicate the use of internationally recognized social bond principles to raise funding for social projects.

title: FCSRE Vitas Palestine MSME Loan
content: The Project is expected to support Vitas Palestine in achieving the following objectives: (i) increasing access to financing for MSMEs in West Bank and Gaza; and (ii) promoting greater inclusiveness in the MSME finance market through expanding access to finance for women-owned MSMEs.

title: DCM KMRC
content:
(i) Increased access to housing finance: KMRC, through its role as a mortgage liquidity and refinance facility, is expected to expand access to longer-term funding for housing finance, giving commercial mortgage lenders the ability to on-lend for longer tenors at a fixed rate. 
(ii) Increased affordability of housing finance: Longer loan tenors at which Primary Mortgage Lenders can extend to borrowing customers will lower monthly mortgage payments, thus lowering the income required to buy a house.
(iii) Financial integration: The Project is expected to contribute substantially to financially integrating housing finance with Kenya's debt capital markets, allowing more effective intermediation of longer-term capital from savers (local institutional investors) to corporate borrowers in the housing sector.

title: Abydos Solar IPP
content: The Project promises strong development impact in Egypt as it will (i) expand solar capacity to generate more efficient and environmentally friendly sources of energy and displace inefficient power generation sources; (ii) improves affordability of energy, lowering the average cost of electricity generation; and (iii) enhance the power sector resilience by diversifying the country's power generation mix.

title: Zarafshon Wind
content: The Project would: (i) reduce CO2 emissions by displacing carbon intensive generation in the merit order of dispatch; (ii) deliver electricity output at a competitive tariff; (iii) contribute to improve competitiveness of the sector by supporting one of the first wind IPP projects and catalyzing private sector investments; and (iv) increase resilience of electricity supply by diversifying Uzbekistan energy mix.

title: AlleyRoads
content: IFC expects the Project to increase access to good quality affordable housing in a market characterized by a large demand-supply gap. It will also contribute to job creation, training, and development of supply chains in the local community. Finally, demonstration and replication effects are expected by showcasing that green affordable housing projects in the rental space can be profitable and successful.

title: HTB Women
content:
Project outcome: The Project will contribute towards narrowing the WMSME financing gap by providing additional loans to WMSMEs during the tenor of the loan. This is expected to increase economic activity and job creation in Cambodia to expedite post-crisis recovery. 

Market-level outcome: IFC's engagement with the Bank will mobilize private sector investors to support the financial sector in Cambodia and increase access to finance to the underserved WMSMEs.

title: JAT Africa
content:
Project level Impact: 
(i) Economywide effects: The Project will expand the Group's production capacities and allow the Group to source more inputs from local suppliers, which will support domestic value addition and associated job creation. Using IFC's economic impact assessment framework, we estimate that the project will lead to an average increase in annual GDP of US$217 million across the target countries, of which about US$26 direct value added, and US$192 indirect value added, as well as the generation of 1,600 direct jobs and 7,150 new indirect jobs. 
(i) Stakeholders - Increased outreach of distributors and retailers to smallholder farmers:  The Project will improve the Group's outreach to smallholder farmers through an expansion in its distribution networks in Nigeria and beyond. Specifically, scaling up blending and packaging operations will allow the the Group to increase the number of distributors and retailers reached by 7,200, in all turnover categories, from key accounts to medium and large agri-dealers to small-size retailers, not excluding the farmers that may be reached through market days or other training and extension services. The distributors will be strategically located, offering coverage across the individual countries, and increasing proximity to the customers, while also generating market intelligence for the Group. Further, the Group will be investing in ERP and warehouse inventory management systems, in the hope to enhance real time inventory management and, going forward, to experiment with digital and direct delivery models. 

Market level impact: 
(i) Competitiveness - Triggering new product offerings and supporting greater domestic value addition: IFC expects the Project, through the demonstration and replication channel, to contribute to increasing competitiveness of the crop protection sector in sub-Saharan Africa, through a first-mover company that will start local manufacturing of a select range of reliable herbicides in Ghana, Uganda, and Tanzania, and encouraging other companies to follow its lead and bring the production of quality crop protection closer to its final beneficiaries. The proposed investment will showcase the potential of domestic vertical integration in the crop protection industry in sub-Saharan Africa, and in particular spearhead a replicable business model for the crop protection sector in Anglophone West and East Africa. Market effects will play out through the example of a distributor company that evolves into a local manufacturer, thereby increasing its margins  as has been proved to be the case with the Group's Nigerian operation  and steadily broadening up its market share. The Group's strategy aims to shape the market, not only building on a regularly growing manufacturing base, in order to reduce costs and possibly attain economies of scale, but also enhancing its capacity development of retailers, both directly and indirectly through training of trainers and multimedia and digital content platforms.

title: Santa Adelia
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcomes are economy wide impact and environmental effects from increased ethanol production as well as renewable energy sales. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment has the potential to contribute to improving agricultural practices at the sector level and further strengthening its competitiveness through demonstration effect and replication.

title: Averda Corporate Finance
content: The investment is expected to (i) increase environmentally-sound waste treatment capacity in the target countries with focus on plastic recycling and help reduce the amount of waste sent to landfills; ii) increase material recovery and help prevent pollution through production of plastic pellets via mechanical recycling of plastics waste, displacing the production of the virgin materials and reducing GHG emissions; iii) contribute to market competitiveness by supporting private investment in the waste sector and demonstrating the role of plastic recycling plants in Oman, South Africa, and Morocco waste management systems.

title: Hamkorbank Loan
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring rating of Good based on an AIMM score of 48. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 64. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is increased access to financial services for MSMEs in Uzbekistan, including women-owned SMEs. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater market inclusiveness in Uzbekistan via competition and demonstration channels.

title: ISC- Anchorless
content:
The Project follows the AIMM (Development Impact) Rating for the Startup Catalyst Envelope. IFC anticipates that the Project would result in increased access to seed stage equity for digital startups in Bangladesh, an IDA country with a nascent digital entrepreneurship ecosystem. The Project is also expected to increase the ability for startups, of which at least 20 percent are targeted to have women founders, to succeed and scale digital businesses, through the Fund's mentorship and window for follow-on funding.

Beyond the Project, this investment is expected to contribute to creating the start-up ecosystem and venture capital market in Bangladesh by demonstrating the commercial viability of the VC fund model in the country, and more broadly, investing in Bangladeshi startups. IFC's support also enables creation of a constant and quality pipeline of investment opportunities that investors at Series A stage and beyond depend upon.

title: RSE Covid Mauricio Ser 2020
content: The Project helps ensure continued provision of quality education to low income students in frontier regions. By supporting consolidation, the Project contributes to the professionalization and digital transformation of the sector, increasing resilience to future crises. IFC will track students reached and capacity in affected markets.

title: Axian Telecom Bond
content: The use of proceeds for refinancing in Togo seeks to unlock a capital expenditure program. The refinancing operation in Tanzania will also unlock investment that will result in increased access to quality mobile connectivity for individuals and businesses in Tanzania, a country with large connectivity gaps.

title: BOP Esquire
content:
Project outcome: By partnering with an NBFI focused on unsecured business loans to SMEs, the Project will contribute towards narrowing the financing gap in the country by providing additional loans to WSMEs during the tenor of the facility. This is expected to increase economic activity and job creation in the Philippines, thereby expediting post-crisis recovery. 

Market-level outcome: As macroeconomic instability and uncertainty on long-term risks has led to increased difficulties in accessing medium-term funds needed to support the recovery and growth of lending operations, IFC anticipates that project will support resilience amongst microfinance and Base of the Pyramid (BOP) finance providers and catalyze investor response.

title: New CWI Landfill Gas
content: The Project will support the sponsor in expanding its LFGE plants in China, especially in poorer and frontier provinces where the majority of the landfills exist. It supports improvements in the quality waste management services by lowering the risk of landfill fires and explosions as well as significant positive environmental effects of reducing methane emissions.

title: GWFP AgroCompanies
content:
The Project is expected to: (i) increase the supply of wheat to African millers in the destination countries to produce wheat products; (ii) increase the supply of animal feed (soya bean, corn) to destination countries; (iii) increase technical support from the Group to millers to improve food safety and quality; and (iv) increase (in-kind) financing to millers to ensure continuity in commodity trading.
 
To measure progress against this outcome, IFC will track the: (i) volume of products supplied to customers; and (ii) number of customers reached.

The Project is expected to have catalytic effect of stimulating industry-wide best practices in grain trade financing, grain sourcing and processing, and facilitating food quality and safety improvements, moving the sector toward greater competitiveness from domination by large players to more participation by mid-sized players.

To measure progress against this outcome, IFC will track the number of private sector banks providing support to the Company (which should increase or at least remain stable).

title: Respublica
content: The Project is expected to increase acccess to affordable student housing in the underserved South African student housing market and responding to a significant gap in supply. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater competition in the affordable housing market segment via demonstration and replication channels.

title: Capital Bank of Jordan WCS
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good, based on an AIMM score of 53 applicable to each investment under the FIG Envelope as per the IFC Fast Track COVID Facility (IFC/R2020-0052/1). By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations which were disrupted by the acute pandemic shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income earning opportunities.

title: BOP Al Amana Microcredit Morocco
content: The project will provide financing to micro-enterprises located in Morocco, and the most significant expected project-level outcome for the project is: improved access to and quality of finance for microenterprises, including women microentrepreneurs. The income streams of microenterprises have been severely affected by the lockdowns, increased uncertainty, and a slow-down in economic activity in the wake of the pandemic. As the economy begins to recover, microenterprises need access to funding to finance investments in inventory and inputs to resume economic activity. In this context, the project supports Al Amana, one of the largest MFI in the country, to provide much-needed financing to assist microentrepreneurs especially women, who are less than half as likely to get access credit than men, in overcoming liquidity constraints and returning to their previous income generating capacity.

title: GTFP VISTA Bank Burkina Faso
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Bank's customers. On the market side, the project will further connect the Bank's cross-border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels. It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: Genomma Lab II
content:
Project-level: (i) increase access to
     quality and affordable medicines; and (ii) create
     employment opportunities and economic linkages with additional gross value
     added. 
 Market creation: enhance resilience of
     supply chains for over-the-counter medical supplies.

title: Sodigaz Burkina
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are increased access to LPG products, especially for rural households, with improvements in household's indoor air quality contributing to improved health outcomes, especially for women and children.  The Project will also contribute to improvements in the affordability and sustainability of electricity provision. Beyond these outcomes, the Project will promote competitiveness of the LPG market in Burkina Faso through a sizable expansion in capacity, enhanced operational efficiency, and the adoption of improved safety standards. The upgrade in the Company's distribution network is anticipated to lead to three main impacts in rural areas: (i) decreased leading time required for requalifying bottles and loading trucks; (ii) increased the availability of safe LPG cylinders, and (iii) improved distribution and retailing services.

title: Alterra Africa Accelerator Fund
content:
Expected
development impact through:

(i)
job creation, improved job quality and diversity, and economic growth;

(ii)
at investee company level, implementing best practice corporate governance and
social and environmental standards; and

(iii)
supporting regional integration by investing in companies expanding into
neighboring countries.

title: BanBif Green SB
content:
IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to climate finance, including energy efficiency and green building projects that would enable businesses to improve their environmental footprint. The Project is expected to contribute to GHGs reduction and improve air quality by providing financing for green buildings and green projects.

Beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the project will promote competitiveness in the financial and real estate markets. In addition, given the moderately developed state of the climate finance market in Peru, IFC's engagement will build capacity and set standards, using tools to assess eligibility and track environmental impact.

title: CREI Phils
content: The Project is expected to result in (i) increased capacity of mobile networks through the construction of towers, to be shared under an open-access basis  in a country with significant gaps in quality of connectivity; and (ii) improved environmental sustainability by supporting the conversion from diesel power generation to more efficient, greener alternative tower power solutions. Beyond the Project, this investment could contribute to creating a market for tower colocation in the Philippines by supporting the expansion of one of the most competitive tower companies among the first entrants.

title: BPC Ecuador Loan
content:
Project level impact:  IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to finance for SMEs and women-owned SMEs, an underserved segment in Ecuador and contribute to narrowing SME financing gap in the Country. 

Market level impact: IFC anticipates the Project will contribute to increasing the competitiveness of the women-owned SME finance market in Ecuador by further increasing access to finance for these companies, which could help them navigate the economic recovery of the pandemic and meet their long-term capital requirements.

title: Uniminuto II
content: The project will support the provision of high-quality education into lower-income rural areas and the company's digital strategy through D4TEP. The most significant expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to high-quality and affordable tertiary education. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that its financing could support greater market competitiveness and inclusiveness driven by the rise in quality standards in low-cost education models and the introduction of best practices in online programs.

title: Forte Convertible
content: The development impact of the proposed project is the increase in insurance coverage in the non-life segment through both expansion of existing insurance products and introduction of new insurance products in Cambodia and also in other East Asian countries, including Lao PDR. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that via demonstration, replication and innovation channels, the investment will foster increased competitiveness in its operating markets by introducing new insurance products and catering to specific needs in the market.

title: GTFP VistaGui Guinea
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Bank's customers. On the market side, the project will further connect the Bank's cross-border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels. It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: Wave Debt
content: By supporting Wave Mobile Money SA (Senegal) and Wave C<f4>te d'Ivoire SA, IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to a larger financial inclusion in countries which record some of the lowest account penetrations globally, by giving customers access to affordable accounts and payment services and allowing them to transact more often due to a simple fee structure and lower transaction costs. Beyond the Project, IFC expects that the investment will contribute to promoting systemic changes in the mobile money markets in Sub-Saharan Africa by allowing Wave Mobile Money group to continue rapidly scaling up its services, which, in turn, will demonstrate to incumbents the viability of a transparent and cheaper pricing structure, pushing them to lower transaction costs and simplify their fee structure.

title: Lidl Romania RSE
content: In the context of COVID-19 pandemic, IFC, through the crisis response financing, will help Lidl to: (i) increase access to quality products at affordable prices in remote and rural locations of Romania; (ii) grow domestic supplier base to minimize supply chain disruptions; and (iii) elevate food safety standards along the supply chain and safeguard employees in the stores to be built or modernized as part of the Project. By limiting supply disruptions, the Project promotes resilience in the food retail market.

title: GTFP ADIB  EGYPT
content:
The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing
access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased
access to trade finance to the Bank's customers. On the market side, the
project will further connect the Bank's cross-border connections, increasing
the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels. It
will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's
financial markets more deeply.

title: Pier
content: The Project has an AIMM rating of Good. The most significant, expected project-level outcome is improved access (to individuals) to theft insurance for smartphones and cars. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote competitiveness by demonstrating an innovative business model to reach new customers.

title: ISCMicrotraction
content: IFC anticipates that the project would result in increased access to pre-seed stage equity and increased ability for startups to scale operations and receive follow-on funding in Nigeria and other IDA/FCS countries across Sub Saharan Africa. The Project also has potential to increase the competitiveness of the local start-up ecosystem and venture capital by increasing the activity and interest from a variety of stakeholders within the tech and startup ecosystem.

title: Growsari RI
content:
As part of this Project, IFC seeks to support the acceleration of Growsari's growth plans throughout the Philippines and anticipates that the Project Outcomes are Very Strong, derived from increased access to supply chain for informal retailers, with the potential to result in improved efficiency. Most retailers on the platform are expected to be informal and run by women, qualifying the Project as an Inclusive and Gender Business. Beyond the Project, the Contribution to Market Creation is Strong, aiming to substantially strengthen the integration of the retail value chain in the Philippines through digitalization, via demonstration and replication channels. A successful expansion by the Company is expected to demonstrate the viability of this business model, thereby triggering replication by new entrants and traditional players, and therefore promoting faster digitalization of retail supply chains, beyond the Company.
Integration  (i) Increased integration of the retail value chain in the Philippines through digitalization, via demonstration and replication channels. The Philippine retail value chain, which entails a B2B segment from manufacturers, distributors, and wholesalers to retailers; and a B2C segment from retailers to consumers,  remains underdeveloped due to significant frictions in the B2B segment arising from the presence of multiple middlemen and fragmentation.

title: Vayana 2021
content:
IFC anticipates that the Project will promote improved access to affordable working capital finance for suppliers and distributors, including MSMEs, in India. The Project will support the growth of Vayana's specialized technology platform to deliver supply chain financing solutions.
IFC also anticipates that the Project will promote integration in the supply chain financing sector by establishing a key market platform which integrates financing, tax and transaction data solutions for MSMEs in India.

title: DCM-HDBank ConvDebt
content: The project is expected to (i) increase access to finance for individuals and SMEs, including WSMEs through both traditional banking and digital platforms and (ii) contribute to market resilience in the Vietnam banking sector by sending a positive signal and boosting investor confidence thus enabling local banks to attract investment needed to build their capital positions and sustain their growth.

title: EBK Sub Loan II
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is improved accessibility of SME and climate finance. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that - as part of IFC's broader systemic approach to strengthen the capital base of leading and regionally important banks in Kenya - it has the potential to promote greater banking sector resilience that will contribute to regional financial market stability and help the market withstand shocks by boosting capital adequacy.

title: Mammoth Foam
content:
Assessment of Project Outcomes:
- Economy-wide effects: The Project is expected to contribute to economic activity, direct job creation, and preservation of the existing high-quality jobs (1,000 employees) and the broader social fabric that the operations of the Company and the salaries contribute to. The Project also indirectly supports jobs and economic activity for local businesses that engage in the distribution of final products and sourcing of raw materials. 
- Stakeholders: Consumers in Kenya, Uganda and Malawi will benefit from improved affordability and access to a high-quality variety of bedding products. The Project will achieve this through (i) debt refinancing and expansion of raw materials storage capacity which will lower procurement cost of raw materials as a result of better working capital management, translating into improved affordability of final products sold; (ii) increased assistance to SMEs distributors through access to trade credits, which will intensify linkages in the value chain; and (iii) expansion in the number of retail distributors across the target countries as the Company grows its production. 

Assessment of Contribution to Market Creation:
- Competitiveness: IFC anticipates that the investment will promote sector competitiveness in Malawi via the adoption of innovative manufacturing processes. Through the Project, MFA will expand its production capacity in Malawi, adopt novel technology and machinery, increasing its overall efficiency. Market impact in Kenya and Uganda is expected to be limited.

title: Mavin
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good. The Project is assessed as part of the overarching programmatic intervention (ASF Asia Recovery Program) to respond to the impacts of the ASF on the regional pork industry. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome resulting from this expansion is the impact on consumers from the provision of safe pork at the time of severe supply shortage as well as implementation of advanced biosecurity procedures at the new farms. At the market level, the Project, alongside other planned investment, and advisory interventions, is expected to promote market resilience through improvement of biosecurity and disease management, both by supporting industry consolidation and disseminating best practices among smaller players.

title: AwanTunai
content: IFC anticipates that the Project will promote increased access to credit as well as enterprise management solutions amongst MSMEs in Indonesia.  The Project will support AwanTunai to increase the breadth of its business solutions product offerings as well as in increasing its lending operations to both wholesalers and merchants. IFC also anticipates that the Project will promote inclusiveness in the financial sector in Indonesia by demonstrating the viability of AwanTunai's business model to provide access to credit to underserved micro and small enterprises.

title: Genesis II
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is increased access to finance for underserved MSE segments in Guatemala, including WSEs. Beyond the Project and in conjunction with other WBG efforts in the country, the investment will foster greater financial inclusiveness for MSEs and WSEs through the demonstration and replication channel by encouraging other financial institutions to grow their MSE portfolios.

title: IFC BEST Bond Fund
content:
The
main project-level outcome is improved access to private sector capital for
issuers of Sustainable Bonds in EMDEs through mobilization of capital from
institutional investors to specifically invest in Sustainable Bonds issued by
EMDE entities. This is expected to encourage increased issuances of Sustainable
Bonds by EMDE issuers. Beyond this outcome, IFC anticipates the proposed
investment will catalyze change in the market through increased issuance of
Sustainable Bonds in EMDEs and thereby promote greater integration in the
market via innovation, demonstration, and replication channels.

title: CajaArequipa SD1
content: By supporting Caja Arequipa to finance MSMEs, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: Nedbank Green Bond DCM
content: The expected Project-level outcome is increased access to climate finance (specifically, green residential buildings): Through this Project, IFC will build on Nedbank's leading position in green financing to expand its nascent EDGE-certified green housing program, focusing on the supply side, by catalyzing uptake of green housing funding beyond the usual players. Beyond the Project-level outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project, combined with the other initiatives under IFC's programmatic approach to increase climate finance in South Africa, will help scale up climate finance, strengthen green finance standards in the country, and encourage replication by other South African institutions, thus, contributing towards increased environmental sustainability through the demonstration and capacity building channels.

title: ISC Disruptech I
content:
The Project follows the AIMM (Development Impact) Rating for the Startup Catalyst Envelope. 

IFC anticipates that the Project would result in increased access to seed stage equity for digital startups in Egypt. The Project is also expected to increase the ability for startups, especially fintech and fintech-enabled startups, to succeed and scale digital businesses, through the Fund's mentorship and window for follow-on funding. 

Beyond the Project, this investment is expected to support the start-up ecosystem and venture capital market in Egypt by demonstrating the viability of investing in digital startups established in Egypt. IFC's support also enables creation of a constant and quality pipeline of investment opportunities that investors at Series A stage and beyond depend upon.

title: BOP ESKH SL LCF
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to be: (i) at the project outcomes level - stakeholder effect: improved access to local currency financing for MSMEs that would help them to overcome liquidity constraints in post-crisis economic environment and return to their previous income generating capacity; (ii) at the market creation level - resilience: improved resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers by helping the market deal with the growing uncertainty and catalyzing investor response.

title: Zenex Animal Health India Private Limited
content: Project-level impact: The growth of the Company will increase the production of quality pharmaceuticals for livestock and poultry, resulting in better yields and increased income for farmers. Market-level impact: The Project and Company's growth will enable changes to existing markets that deliver sustainable development impact by promoting competitiveness through demonstration, replication, and competition.

title: Project Kio
content:
Stakeholder Impact: The Project is expected to increase access to quality digital connectivity and data center capacity for individuals and businesses.

Competitiveness: The Project will support increased competitiveness for mobile connectivity or data hosting services in the target countries, via competition channels.

title: Fitesa
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is the increased delivery of raw materials for healthcare personal protective equipment ("PPE"). This will strengthen the availability of these materials in the region. IFC expects that its intervention will promote greater stability in healthcare provision by strengthening the supply chains relied upon to fill the growing need for medical supplies, especially PPE.

title: Coffee Revival
content: The Project level outcome is the impact on farmers through: (i) adoption of sustainable coffee production practices and AAA sustainability standards; (ii) yield improvement; and (iii) domestic value addition through investments in processing facilities, leading to increased farm earnings through more reliable access to coffee markets including Nespresso. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will stem from better integrating underserved regions of the project countries into global value chains by setting up coffee buying points, processing facilities (wet/dry mills) close to the producers and demonstrating the business rationale for enhancing this type of physical infrastructure in the target areas to counter existing bottlenecks for revival of specialty coffee and sector development in general. The AS services contribute to demonstration effect largely at the production level through capacity building of farmers, motivating other sector players to establish or expand their engagement with smallholders to improve quality, increase coffee production, and to safeguard, revive and market rare and high quality coffee.

title: PFG
content: Stakeholder effects - Increasing investee growth: The Project is expected to help PFG in its bid to further close the financing gap that exists, especially in mid-sized, early-stage companies in Emerging Markets in a range of sectors that PFG has experience investing in: Technology, Fintech, Life Sciences, Energy/Cleantech, and Consumer/Commerce. The Project is intended to provide growth capital to high growth companies in geographies of interest, thereby increasing their growth (revenue) and filling the shortfall created by risk averse banks or dilutive equity providers.Contribution to Market Creation - Integration: IFC anticipates that the Project will connect early-stage companies in emerging economies with international and domestic finance providers by demonstrating the viability of scaling a venture debt model, that is well-established for this segment in high income countries, in emerging markets.

title: Nazca III
content:
1.	Increased access to early and expansion stage equity for technology companies in Mexico. Access to VC in Mexico remains low compared to the size of its economy. Within this context, Nazca will provide access to capital across an investee's lifecycle through its fund.
2.	Increased competitiveness of Mexico's VC market. Mexico's VC ecosystem remains under-developed and the success of the Fund will prove the viability of this sector and help catalyze new local Fund Managers. 
3.	Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: VC funds such as Nazca invest in companies that often introduce a disruptive digital business model in a market. These innovative businesses can put pressure on incumbents to compete on prices and service quality. They can also strengthen supply chains by reducing the role of brokers and intermediaries, which improves price transparency and efficiency.

title: ABC Climate II
content: IFC expects that this Project will increase access to climate finance in Brazil, particularly in (i) the renewable energy segment by supporting the generation, transmission and distribution associated to sugarcane biomass projects and (ii) climate smart agriculture segment with eligible loans that are accepted if the sugarcane, coffee and orange crops are granted with an eligible certification.

title: DCM Pichincha GB
content: The Project is expected to have a strong stakeholders impact by aiming to increase access to finance for SMEs and, more specifically, WSMEs. The estimated financing gap for SMEs is US$15.7 billion or 16% of the country's GDP, while the financing gap for WSMEs is US$1.2 billion, which represents 8.1% of the SME finance gap. Moreover, Ecuador ranks 86th on the 2019 Gender Inequality Index, implying that there is still much work to be done to level the playing field and increase access to finance to WSMEs.Additionally, the Project is expected to have a strong contribution to market creation through inclusiveness, as the Project is anticipated to be the first gender bond issued by the largest bank in Ecuador with a strong SME and WSME business focus and will promote greater market inclusiveness by encouraging other banks to issue thematic bonds of their own focused on supporting WSMEs. With this proposed investment IFC will introduce a gender-themed bond, which is specifically designed to support women-owned small businesses. IFC expects that increased market-wide awareness of this funding method will help demonstrate the commercial viability of financing WSMEs.

title: Nam Long Bond
content: The most significant expected project-level effect is improved quality of life by giving the low-mid urban income population access to quality and affordable housing, schools, hospitals and commercial areas. The Project will also create jobs and positive environmental impacts. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that success of the proposed investment will encourage other developers to serve the low-mid urban income population in other secondary cities in Vietnam.

title: GWFP Kernel
content: EnvSocialRisksImpact Pending

title: BoP Ipak Yuli
content: The project will provide financing to MSMEs and women-owned SMEs (WSMEs) located in Uzbekistan. The most significant expected project-level outcome for the project is access to finance for MSMEs to support economic activity and resilience in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of lending to BoP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

title: DCM Solis FIDC
content: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to increasing access to finance for MSME buyers engaged in short-term supply chain finance and which are obligors to the Fund. Brazil's low credit penetration is attributable to structural issues in the banking sector; concentration, high degree of state intervention, high interest rates, etc., which all contribute to a lack of innovation and incentives to go down the market to reach MSMEs. The Project is expected to contribute to the improvement of access to finance for MSME retailers, as it supports a financing structure that improves financing terms at which MSME retailers acquire merchandise from large corporates in Brazil. IFC expects that the Project will further contribute to a greater market competitiveness by increasing the offer from alternative lenders in the MSME financing segment, while deepening the local debt markets via the diversification of the FIDC market. The Project will ultimately contribute to an improved availability of financing options for MSMEs.

title: Pharma Indonesia
content:
Project level: The Project is expected to benefit patients in Indonesia through increase in the local production of quality pharmaceutical products. It is expected to make the health system more resilient to supply chain shocks of the kind that affected countries during the pandemic. The Project is also expected to benefit employees through the creation of local jobs along with skill training opportunities.  
Market level: The Project is expected to increase the competitiveness and resilience of the pharmaceutical markets in Indonesia. By supporting the introduction of relatively sophisticated production and the creation of a pool of well-trained workers with hands-on experience, the Project will lay the basis for further development of the pharmaceutical sector in Indonesia.

title: Women-inclusive Enterprises
content: -	Increase in accessibility of finance for gender-inclusive businesses:IFC anticipates that the Project will support TSKB to increase access to finance for women inclusive businesses, with the whole IFC's proceeds earmarked for this purpose. -	Improved outcomes for women employees of borrowing gender-inclusive businesses:IFC anticipates that the Project will support TSKB's women inclusive mid-caps to support women employment and to improve the gender score.-	Inclusiveness: By promoting greater gender equality through wider use of gender certification tools by the Bank's customers, this project will contribute to an increased inclusiveness of the Turkish labor market.

title: FCP 4G Credicorp Capital and Sura Asset Management Fund 2
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory. The most significant, expected project-level outcome comes from the improved access to road infrastructure and it supported by the improved quality of finance for infrastructure projects through the provision of longer-tenor funding. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote competitiveness by fostering the creation of infrastructure debt funds as an investible asset class for institutional investors with a long-term focus and a complementary source of funding for infrastructure projects through demonstration and replication effects.

title: Quona Fund III
content: The Fund will 1) provide access to early-stage capital and operational support, which will lead to increased likelihood for emerging market startups to scale and succeed; 2) expand access to financial services for underserved consumers and MSMEs; and 3) increase competitiveness of the financial services market by demonstrating the viability of innovative fintech business models, which could be replicated across markets.

title: HIKAL III
content: Climate Change and Resource Efficiency: This Project is expected to contribute to climate change mitigation by net reduction of GHG emissions through installations of rooftop solar panels, biomass briquette based boilers, and more efficient production processes that result in reduction of waste and lower consumption of water, electricity, and materials. Competitiveness: This Project is expected to contribute to increased competitiveness in the pharmaceutical and agrochemicals sectors as the Company works on innovation and expanding its product offering in the market.

title: Goertek Vietnam Loan
content: Economy wide effects: The Project is expected to support the development of the electronics value chain and contribute to the local economy through increased exports. Employment: The Project expects to create about 40,000 direct jobs along with skill training opportunities in the local markets, thus establishing a sizeable talent pool for future development of the local industry. Almost all employees of the Project are expected to be hired locally with female employment as a priority. All of them are expected to undergo professional training conducted by senior engineers and technicians of Goertek. Integration: The Project will help a major player in the global electronics value chain to expand into other emerging market, help to formalize the local electronics manufacturing sector up to export standards and enhance the local supply chain linkages. The know-how and expertise will be transferred at a scale needed to jumpstart other competitive manufacturing and supporting industries in the region. Its high E&S standards and production efficiency will also have market-wide demonstration effects and benefit other local players. Competitiveness: The Project will develop two full-fledged production sites in Vietnam for localized manufacturing of complicated smart devices and spur the competitiveness and growing innovation in the local economy. It will also facilitate the development of supporting industries by procuring more inputs from local suppliers in Vietnam and build up their capacity to support manufacturing with higher value-add.

title: Odata MX
content: The Project is expected to result in increased access to data hosting services for businesses by building, over the next two years, a data center in Mexico, with a potential to boost productivity growth for businesses, especially SMEs, and support the growth of technology startups. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that this investment will incrementally improve the competitiveness of the market for data hosting services in Mexico by maintaining competitive pressure other providers, thereby supporting the continued growth of data center capacity and gradually alleviating the supply gap in Mexico.

title: AYALA CORPORATION SOCIAL BOND
content: At the Project level, the Project is expected to: (i) support the development of Environmental and Social ("E&S") initiatives across AC Health Group's investment portfolio in the Philippines; and (ii) create positive stakeholder and environmental effects. At the Market level, the Project will contribute to improved financial market integration by introducing the first social bond issuance in the Philippine real sector. The proposed Social Bond will provide a benchmark for similar issuances, and therefore, promote strengthened standards.

title: Siegfried-Col
content:
This Project is being processed under the Global Health
Platform (GHP). 

Project-level: 

Stakeholder effect: Increased Access to Healthcare Products.
By financing the Project, IFC expects to benefit the middle-to-low income
population in Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, and Central America from lower priced
high-specialty medicines, consistent and high quality, and greater product
variety.

Economy-wide effect: Gross Value-Added  IFC financing will
support a manufacturer located in Colombia. The project will help scale the
production and delivery of healthcare supplies that is likely to result in the
creation of new jobs and/or economic linkages to the rest of the economy.

Market Creation:

Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that its financing could
support greater market resilience as spillover effects accrue to the healthcare
supply chains in these markets.

title: Adenia V
content: Expected development impact through:(i) job creation, improved job quality and diversity, and economic growth;(ii) at investee company level, implementing best practice corporate governance and social andenvironmental standards; and(iii) supporting regional integration by investing in companies expanding into neighboring countries.

title: Lab Stein
content:
Patients: Increased
effectiveness of both the prevention and treatment of diseases. Biopharma drugs
are particularly effective with late-stage, difficult to treat, chronic
diseases such as cancer, diabetes, and hepatitis C, and immunological
disorders. Biologics are better than existing chemical alternatives because
they have higher efficacy outcomes and are more specific in targeting and
hence, have fewer side effects. 

The Project responds to the gap
through investing in a Company with capacity to bring biosimilars to developing
countries where there is a low penetration of biologicals due to the high cost
of innovative products and lack of interest of biosimilars producers to go to
these markets. 

 

Competitiveness: Major
multinational pharma companies, which were once considered traditional pharma
companies, are now shifting into biotech on an unprecedented scale. However,
most low- and middle-income countries lack access to biopharma products, and at
the same time, face increasingly higher drug costs. Introduction of biosimilars
has helped reduce drug costs (ranging from 30% to 75%) and increase access to
treatment in several countries in Europe and EMs. Stein is planning to be one
of the first companies to introduce biosimilars upon patent expiration in a
number of therapeutic areas over the life of project, with a price discount to
the innovator in the range of 50-60%.

title: Crystal Crop
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are: (i) Stakeholder effects: The Project will improve farmers' productivity through better access to customized agrichemicals by enabling the development of formulations that are particularly well-adapted to local crop, soil, and environmental factors and through sale of affordable, generic pesticides. (ii) Economywide effects: The Project will create jobs and add value through backward linkages, where they will produce in-house the active ingredients required to produce their agrichemicals The Project will also create additional direct skilled jobs. The employees will learn new skills and technology to produce these active ingredients(iii) Competitiveness: The Project is expected to demonstrate backward integration, to improve cost control of the value chain, production efficiency as well as the ability innovate and produce high quality the products, and thus improving the sector's competitiveness.

title: ADIB - Egypt Sub. Debt
content: The project shall support ADIBE in growing its operations in Egypt, including increasing access to financing for underserved MSMEs. IFC anticipates that the Project will foster increased inclusiveness in the Egyptian microfinance sector and enhance broader market participation of MSMEs via the competition, demonstration, and replication channels, by demonstrating the viability of Islamic MSME finance and creating competitive pressures on other players to replicate ADIBE's approach.

title: Industrie des Boissons du Senegal
content:
The expected impacts are likely to center around:
Consumers: Consumption of sugar-dense beverages (both CSD and juices) is associated with the
negative nutritional outcomes for the consumers. The impacts could be mitigated by exploring reformulation or shifting production
towards healthier choices.
Direct and indirect employment: The Project is expected to generate 130 direct jobs and expand its local
distribution and storage facilities to support small shops/kiosks (traditional trade). 
Environment: IBS will promote recycling, hence reducing the related carbon footprint and  waste. There may be scope for market
impacts along this dimension in the FMCG market in Senegal.

title: Crescera Fund V
content: (i) The Fund will provide access to long term capital for mid-cap Companies in Brazil.(ii) The Fund will also support private sector development through operational, financial, and environmental, social and governance (ESG) improvements in local businesses.

title: Waycool
content: Expected development impact includes: (i) Improved access to markets, potentially resulting in increased incomes for farmers and enhanced productivity growth for small retailers (ii) Increased integration of the food value chain in India, via competition and innovation channels.

title: ISC-Antler EA Fund I
content: IFC anticipates that the project would result in increased access to pre-seed stage equity and increased ability for startups to scale operations and receive follow-on funding in East Africa. Based on the Fund's track record, it is expected to train and provide networks to East African entrepreneurs, especially encouraging women founders, that will launch startups in the region. Beyond the Project, this investment has the potential to increase the competitiveness of the local start-up ecosystem and venture capital market in East Africa, especially Kenya, through demonstration and capacity building effects.

title: GCB Fund
content: The Project will simultaneously stimulate the "demand" and the "supply" sides of the climate finance challenge in developing countries via fixed income markets solution.  On the demand side, the Project is providing institutional SRIs with potentially higher yields than what is available in developed markets.  Through the Fund, investors would also have access to IFC's unparalleled EM network, with a large global EM client base, accumulated knowledge, and long-term commitment to EM and private sector investments. On the supply side, the Project is providing support to FIs active in EM, who need to raise funding on a large scale to issue green bonds and finance their growing green finance activities.

title: Monashees X
content: 1. Increased access to early stage equity and operational value add for technology companies in Brazil and Latin America. The fund will provide access to equity and value-creation for investees by helping raise follow-on capital, introducing experts into portfolio companies to accelerate growth and leveraging their networks and relationships to enable scale. The fund has demonstrated success with their previous funds. Access to VC in Brazil has increased significantly over the last few years but remains low compared to the size of its economy. The country's penetration rate (VC investment volume relative to the size of the economy) of 0.07 percent is only half that of the total emerging market penetration rate. 2. Increased disruption of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: The Fund is supporting investees developing tech-led innovative solutions to disrupt various real sector business models. IFC expects this will increase competitiveness across markets in Brazil and across Latin America that are characterized by low productivity, poor efficiency and low competition. The investees' innovative businesses models can strengthen supply chains by reducing the role of brokers and intermediaries, improve price transparency, and have a demonstration effect by catalyzing replication from new entrants. In markets where investees grow rapidly and become sizeable market players, innovation at scale can generate large impacts on a market's competitiveness by pushing traditional players to innovate or reducing traditional incumbents' market share.

title: BBVA Peru Green
content: IFC's long-term financing is expected to jump-start an underdeveloped green building finance market by incentivizing supply and demand. Furthermore, the transaction will alleviate the impact of climate change from buildings by strengthening the Banks' ability to structure green building financing following international best practices.Beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the project will promote competitiveness in the financial and real estate markets. In addition, given the relatively underdeveloped state of the climate finance market in Peru, IFC's engagement will build capacity and set standards, using tools to assess eligibility and track environmental impact.

title: CNGR Loan
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is driven primarily by: (i) economy-wide effects, by creating value in the EV battery value chain through the expansion of recycling capacity and employment generation; and (ii) environmental effects from GHG emissions avoided through the recovery, refurbishment, and reuse of lithium-ion EV batteries. IFC expects the investment to increase Integration of EV battery recycling as an essential and inseparable part of East Asia's EV ecosystem by: i) supporting the top ternary precursor materials players in China; ii) developing the EV and components manufacturing ecosystem in East Asia, and; (iii) introducing an integrated EV battery ternary precursor materials producer-recycler model.

title: Ezdehar Mid-Cap Fund II Cooperatief U.A.
content: Expected development impact through:(i)  Providing access to growth equity capital for small to mid-cap companies across Egypt.(ii)  Increased investee growth, through the Fund Manager's financial and operational value add. (iii) Demonstrating the viability of PE investments in the small to mid-cap space to attract new funds into this segment.

title: Algebra II
content: Project Outcomes: Access to early-stage capital and operational support leading to increased ability of startups to scale and succeed. The Fund will provide value creation by providing operational support, access to follow on funding and networks.Contribution to Market Creation:(i) Increased competitiveness of Egypt's VC ecosystem: By continuing to demonstrate the viability of Egypt's VC ecosystem, the Fund will increase competitiveness by bringing more Fund Managers into the ecosystem.(ii) Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: The Fund's innovative investees bring new business models, sometimes into underserved parts of the country, which may bring more competitors into the market, increase efficiency and drive down market wide costs.

title: Di'An Diagnostics
content: Stakeholders: The most significant project outcome is the increased provision of quality and affordable diagnostics services in China. The Project also aims at relieving the overcapacity issue at tertiary hospitals in China while enhancing the testing service offerings at secondary and primary hospitals.Resilience: The Project will help increase overall testing capabilities and hopefully have a spillover effect in terms of building resilience against future pandemics in emerging markets around the world.Market Impact: The key market impact is the facilitation of reduction in prices of critical healthcare diagnoses through centralization and increased throughput and efficiency of lab testing. The project will lead to better quality and more accessible tests to the general public as well as demonstration effect to increase the number of market participants.

title: Santander GHP Br
content: The Project is expected to improve the availability of financing to MSMEs as well as doctors and health professionals to (i) continue to address the immediate COVID crisis by expanding access to relevant MedTech for the diagnosis and treatment of COVID patients and (ii) support the ongoing strengthening of services for this pandemic and future preparedness with response capacity by further equipping the healthcare system and contributing to address supply demand gaps.

title: Valor IV
content: 1. Increased access to early stage equity and operational value add for technology companies in Brazil. The fund will provide access to equity and value-creation for investees by helping raise follow-on capital, introducing experts into portfolio companies to accelerate growth and leveraging their networks and relationships to enable scale. The fund has demonstrated success with their previous funds. Access to VC in Brazil has increased significantly over the last few years but remains low compared to the size of its economy. The country's penetration rate (VC investment volume relative to the size of the economy) of 0.07 percent is only half that of the total emerging market penetration rate. 2. Increased disruption of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: The Fund is supporting investees developing tech-led innovative solutions to disrupt various real sector business models. IFC expects this will increase competitiveness across markets in Brazil that are characterized by low productivity, poor efficiency and low competition. The investees' innovative businesses models can strengthen supply chains by reducing the role of brokers and intermediaries, improve price transparency, and have a demonstration effect by catalyzing replication from new entrants. In markets where investees grow rapidly and become sizeable market players, innovation at scale can generate large impacts on a market's competitiveness by pushing traditional players to innovate or reducing traditional incumbents' market share.

title: Chalet Hotels
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is derived from economy-wide effects by (i) preserving jobs at existing properties, (ii) restarting construction, which would result in the employment of hundreds of daily wage workers, as well as (iii) maintaining timely payments to suppliers including SMEs in the sector that is worst hit by the pandemic. The proposed investment will also (iv) promote greater market resilience in the tourism sector by demonstrating to other players that mixed-use developments create cross-demand and allow for more flexibility as the long-term nature of commercial lease contracts cushion volatility and seasonality of hospitality cash flows, altogether contributing to faster recovery from crises.

title: Atlas Tower KE
content: The Project is expected to increase capacity of mobile networks in Kenya, potentially resulting in improved access to quality mobile connectivity for individuals and businesses in Kenya, by rolling out new telecom towers that will be shared by mobile operators under open access and non-discriminatory basis. The Project is also expected to increase competitiveness of the market for mobile connectivity in Kenya. The Project involves the expansion of a challenger tower company and adds competitive pressure on other tower companies to up their game through business model innovation or price competition, thereby supporting a market-wide expansion of shared mobile infrastructure.

title: RSE COVID Omarsa
content: -	Project impacts: Preserving extensive linkages throughout the value chain; maintaining direct and indirect jobs; increasing availability of high-quality protein.-	Market impacts: Supporting the development of a competitive export-oriented sector; improving market practices regarding energy and resource efficiency.

title: Iraq PayCo
content: The Project aims to improve the payment infrastructure in Iraq and to increase the availability of payment services and accessibility to payment channels across Iraq, therefore the expected development impact includes: (i) Increased access to transaction accounts; (ii) Expanded access to and usage of payment services; (iii) Market-wide integration of the Iraqi economy.

title: DCM-BRAC Bank Affordable Housing Bond
content: The Project is expected to contribute towards (i) increasing access to housing finance for urban households, with a focus on providing more access to housing finance to lower income households; and (ii) increasing the availability of longer-tenor housing finance in the market. At the market level, IFC will contribute via demonstration, replication and competition channels to: (i) integrating the housing finance sector with the local bond market and supporting the overall development of the corporate bond market; and (ii) fostering increased inclusiveness within the housing finance market by demonstrating the business case of moving down the market.

title: WCS COVID GTBK
content: IFC anticipates that the Project will help best position the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earningopportunities. By sustaining the Bank's ability to provide working capital and trade finance, IFC's facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Kenya.

title: Sembcorp Industries Ltd
content: (i)	Stakeholders: The Project will support operations of existing as well as new RE capacity and potentially, other sustainable projects to be developed by the Company (ii)	Financial Integration: The Project demonstrates a relatively new financing instrument with potential for wider regional uptake as companies and investors increase their focus on sustainability.

title: Bac Ninh WTE
content: The main project-level outcomes are the stakeholder impact via the increase in waste treatment capacity that will help reduce health and safety risks in the community, and the environmental impact via the avoidance of greenhouse gas emissions from methane emissions generated by the decomposition of waste in landfills and the generating of renewable power. The expected market-level impact is from improved sustainability by supporting the development of one of the first WTE plants in the country.

title: ISC-Eleven
content: This investment is expected help support the local start-up ecosystems and further develop venture capital markets in the SEE region. Supporting the development of start-up and VC ecosystems also enables creation of a constant and quality pipeline of investment opportunities that investors at Series A stage and beyond depend upon

title: GTLP SMBC Turkey III
content: The proposed project is expected to provide financing to key financial intermediaries in the ECA region, particularly Turkey in the face of economic, trade, and supply chain disruptions caused by COVID-19.  Indirectly, this increased capacity will also improve the availability of credit to local importers and exporters along key value chains and in a wide variety of sectors.

title: OSMANGAZI ELEKTRIK DAGITIM AS
content: The most significant project-level outcome is the improvement in the quality of electricity supply, which will benefit 1.8 million electricity users in five provinces of Turkey with reduced outages. At the market level, the Project will contribute to strengthen resilience of electricity supply by demonstrating replicable smart grid technologies and systems to withstand faults across distribution network.

title: A91 Fund II
content: Project level outcomes are delivered through increasing access to equity and value creation for small to mid-cap companies in India. A91 Fund II is continuing the value creation strategy of Fund I by supporting first generation entrepreneurs, providing both capital and active management support, including mentorship and building systems to institutionalize' company operations.Market creation is delivered through strengthening the integration of the PE market in India. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Fund will continue to support an increase in the share of institutional capital in the investor base of the Indian PE market, particularly through greater involvement of large institutional investors in the small to mid-cap market segment. This signal is important to attract investors that will support the Indian PE market to become more self-sustained.

title: Khaadi Corporation SMC Pvt Ltd
content: Implementation of the Project is expected to generate robust local demand for the labor-intensive textile industry, create ~850 direct and indirect jobs with up to 20% for women and enhance tax collection by encouraging formalization of retail and upstream activities. The Project has the potential to provide more job opportunities for female workers, both for those who work directly with the company and for the female workers in the supply chain such as local artisans, designers, and tailors. IFC anticipates that the Project will promote market integration by: i) improving standards across the value chain; ii) increasing access to market for local suppliers; iii) promoting development of retail infrastructure by creating demand for lease space and; iv) increasing formal retail penetration in Tier II/III cities. The expansion of Khaadi stores into Tier II and III cities of Pakistan will increase access to goods at attractive price-points and quality products otherwise not available outside large cities in the country.

title: FCS RE Kings Beverage
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory. The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes are its contribution to generating domestic value addition and job creation through investments in processing facilities, improving farmer livelihoods through more reliable access to markets, and strengthening the distributor networks. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will stem from (i) first mover operating the largest and first automated plant of its kind in Sierra Leone and using the latest technology and production standards to address local demand; and (ii) expected improvement in quality standards which will encourage competitors to up their game.

title: AP Bank
content: IFC will provide and mobilize additional funding to support Bank's lending to its SME customers, particularly those operating in the agribusiness, and contribute to increasing the availability of financing for SMEs in Ukraine through demonstration, replication and competition channels.

title: Ipoteka Loan
content: The proposed Project is increasing IFC's financing support to a previously approved investment (Ref: IFC/R2019-0209, June 19, 2019) with the purpose of enhancing SME lending. Given this, the development impact assessment of this project is the same as the earlier project, which received an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Excellent, based on an AIMM score of 68. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 112. The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes are increased access to finance for SMEs in Uzbekistan. In addition, the Project will support the growth of Ipoteka's WSME portfolio, as the Bank commits to earmark 25 percent of IFC funding towards WSMEs. Beyond the Project, IFC investments will promote greater market competitiveness through market-enabling, competition and demonstration channels by contributing to the privatization of Uzbekistan's banking system. IFC interventions are key in building a more efficient, inclusive, and transparent banking sector - a critical enabling factor or transitioning to a market-oriented economy.

title: Bank Alliance
content: IFC will provide and mobilize additional funding to support Bank's lending to its SME customers, particularly those operating in the agribusiness, and contribute to increasing the availability of financing for SMEs in Ukraine through demonstration, replication and competition channels.

title: BOP Omni Loan
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome for the project is access to finance for microenterprises including migrants and refugees to support economic activity and resilience in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of lending to BoP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

title: Digital Bridge Emerging Markets
content:
Stakeholder Impact: The Project
is expected to increase access to quality digital connectivity and data center
capacity for individuals and businesses.

Competitiveness: The Project will support increased
competitiveness for mobile connectivity or data hosting services in the target
countries, via competition channels.

title: GyT Sub. Debt
content: The expected project-level outcomes are: Increased access to finance for SMEs and increased access to housing and green finance. Beyond the project-level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the investment will have the potential to promote greater market awareness via innovation and demonstration of new possible products.

title: Toters
content: The development impact of the project will be via: (i)	Project Outcomes (Stakeholders): Improved access to goods for consumers, increased access to markets for merchants, and increased micro-entrepreneurship opportunities for couriers. (ii)	Contribution to Market Creation (Competitiveness): Increased competitiveness of the retail distribution market in Lebanon and Iraq via demonstration and replication channels.

title: CIDT Expansion
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) processing internally what is currently outsourced to 2 other processing ginneries; (ii) generating additional resources and expand farmer support to increase productivity since their interest is aligned with those of the farmers: the higher the volume, the better the margin since price is fixed and therefore not a lever of their profitability; (iii) searching for new sources of procurement, outside the contractual zones, and therefore reaching an additional segment of farmers who will benefit from increased incomes from producing cotton. The stakeholder effects for farmers will be enhanced through the provision of Advisory Services focused on capacity building and improved agricultural practices.Beyond the project level, IFC expects the investment to improve competitiveness in the cotton sector through strong demonstration and replication effects, largely at the processing and primary production levels. Capacity building of farmers will motivate processors in other zones to replicate similar practices with their suppliers.

title: Soufflet Corp
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory to Good. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the impact on farmers' access to markets and quality inputs as well as its contribution to global food security.

title: KICT
content: The main expected project-level outcomes are on stakeholders by helping sustain operations and support equipment purchase and yard expansion at the only container terminal at the Deendayal Port, a major port in India. Project is tagged as climate finance, stemming from the provision of electronically operated rubber tyred gantry cranes (E-RTGCs). Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to contribute to the growth of coastal shipping and associated logistics infrastructure in India as well as promote India's integration with the Middle East and East African countries by facilitating India's exports of rice, tiles and ceramics and other goods.

title: ISC-Ibtikar II
content: Development impact: (i) Address the funding gap for early stage investments in Palestine and the Middle East and North Africa ('MENA'). (ii) Support innovation, technology, and entrepreneurship in the region via investments in internet-enabled companies. (iii) Create high-value employment opportunities.

title: Brimore
content: The development impact of the project will be via:(i) Project Outcomes (Stakeholders): Improved access to goods for consumers, increased access to markets for suppliers, and creation of microentrepreneurship opportunities for agents, who are primarily female.(ii) Contribution to Market Creation (Inclusiveness): Improving the inclusiveness of the Egyptian e-commerce sector by triggering replication of an innovative business model that enable market expansion to the underserved in a cost-effective manner

title: SILK
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) increase in access to non-life insurance, primarily health and engineering, and (ii) promotion of international standards and best practices in corporate governance.

title: BOP Tamweelcom
content: (i) Assessment of project outcome: Stakeholder Effects: Improved access to and quality of finance for MSMEs, many of which are women informal microentrepreneurs and MSMEs have been severely affected by the lockdowns, increased uncertainty, and a slow-down in economic activity in the wake of the pandemic.(ii) Contribution to Market Creation: IFC anticipates that the project will support resilience amongst BOP finance providers by providing local currency financing in the country to support lending to micro and small enterprises, thus helping the sector deal with the growing risk, resulting from the COVID-19 crisis.

title: Project SIMBA Equity - Insurance Sector
