content: The most significant expected project-level effect is increased access to life and non-life insurance in Morocco and selected countries in Sub-Saharan Africa. IFC also anticipates that the Project will contribute towards increased inclusiveness of the insurance market in Morocco through demonstration and replication channels.

title: Keenu Equity
content: IFC anticipates that the Project will promote increased access to digital payments in Pakistan. The Project will support the Company in expanding its payment acceptance network towards the long tail end of MSMEs. IFC also anticipates that the Project will promote integration in financial services, by fostering the widespread acceptance of digital retail payments in Pakistan.

title: Liquid Telecom Equity
content: The Project is expected to increase access to data center capacity for businesses in regional hubs like South Africa, Kenya, Nigeria and Egypt, along with countries with larger gaps such as  the DRC and South Sudan, that are digitally connected to these hubs. This has the potential to enable increased availability of quality digital services for individuals and enhanced productivity growth for businesses, recognizing some potential for increased GHG emissions. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to strengthen integration of the African economy by enabling a faster growth of cloud computing services through expansion of data infrastructure.

title: DCM UBP Social Bond
content: (i) Project Outcome: The Project will contribute to improved access to finance for MSMEs. Under the Bank's Sustainable Financing Framework, the use of proceeds for the issuance will be directed to MSMEs who have been hit by natural disasters, such as the COVID-19 pandemic. (ii) Market creation: IFC's engagement with UnionBank will deepen capital markets for sustainability-linked thematic bonds and increase available funding for MSMEs. The Project is expected to promote a replicable instrument to raise funds for underserved segments such as MSMEs through issuance of a Social Bond in the Philippines, and demonstrate the feasibility of banks to raise funding through issuance of a replicable capital market instrument in a manner that meets international standards.

title: Newko Balkan II
content: The proposed south-south Project is expected to: (i)  create additional jobs and preserve more than 230 direct jobs while increasing purchases from local suppliers; (ii)  contribute to foreign exchange generation through strong export sales; (iii) benefit domestic consumers by ensuring access to lower cost, high quality locally produced conveyor belts; and (iv) promote the resilience of the conveyor belt production activities in Kosovo by supporting the only local conveyor belt producer.

title: GEM Loan
content: Project-level: (i) increase recycling capacities and promote circular economy; and (ii) create employment opportunities and economic linkages. Market creation: enhance integration of battery recycling practices.

title: RATCH Loan
content: The Project is expected to lead to positive stakeholder effects arising from supporting several green and social projects through the Sustainable Loan. As public awareness of climate change and social disparities continue to grow, more infrastructure companies are seeking to shift their businesses towards more sustainable models which support the achievement of NDCs and meet investor demand for investments that are both profitable and contribute positive environmental and social impacts. The Project is expected to demonstrate to other infrastructure companies in Thailand the application of a sustainable finance framework which adopts international principles on project evaluation and selection, management of proceeds, and reporting. This is expected to help the Company effectively utilize relatively new financing instruments such as sustainable loans which would provide flexibility to fund a combination of eligible green and social projects.

title: Global Market Access Holding (DIFC) Ltd
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is improved market infrastructure to support international cross-border capital markets trading activities in emerging markets (EMs). Through its proposed investment, IFC will support the expansion and growth of GTN's low-cost electronic trade execution and market data platform, linking international investors to local exchanges in EMs and fostering trade flow across EMs and between advanced economies and EMs. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that this investment will result in greater capital markets integration, by more broadly contributing to the ongoing digitization of EM capital markets and the removal of barriers to cross-border financial trading for both EM and advanced market brokers and investors.

title: HDFC II
content: The Project is in line with the Government of India's "Housing for All by 2022" initiative. The most significant, expected project-level outcome is increased access to financing for affordable housing for lower and middle-income segments. The Project will also support HDFC in gradually growing its nascent green housing portfolio. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment, together with other IFC's efforts in the segment, will help promote greater competitiveness in affordable housing financing via demonstration and replication channels.

title: Erste_CRO_MREL
content: The Project will increase access to housing loans and climate finance in the form of green mortgages. The project is also expected to promote financial sector resilience and a more dynamic domestic corporate bond market through increasing the diversity of instruments, tenors and issuers.

title: OCB green loan
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) improved access to long-term funding to relevant stakeholders (OCB, and through them, their SME customers) which will support their capacity to expedite post-crisis recover; (ii) improved access to medium and long-term funding for SME climate projects; and (iii) promotion of financing to SMEs in Vietnam.

title: Aspen Pharmacare
content:
The Project will refinance existing loans which funded the
addition of sterile pharmaceutical manufacturing capacity and the acquisition
of related pharmaceutical products which are supplied to emerging markets. This
has allowed for an increase of available supplies of healthcare products to
treat, inter alia, COVID-19 patients, including the supply of COVID-19 vaccines
at a time where demand exceeds supply.

title: Banco BV SEF Credit Line
content: The most significant expected project-level effect is increased access to climate finance in Brazil by growing the climate-smart auto loan portfolio of banco BV. Beyond the project level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute towards sustainability by catalyzing additional banks to provide climate finance for climate smart vehicles through capacity-building, demonstration and replication channels.

title: Infinity Medical
content: Project level impact: Improved access to high quality equipment for patients in Ethiopia. At present, access to foreign currency has limited private hospitals' ability to access high quality medical equipment which needs to be imported. The Project will expand Infinity's capacity to import and distribute medical equipment. The client will also provide training in the use of equipment to the hospitals/ clinics, ensuring patients receive adequate services.Market level impact: The Project will expand access to quality medical equipment for private, in addition to public, health services providers in Ethiopia. The equal footing through access to equipment via finance for both public and private, should help contribute to positioning the emerging private sector, increasing demand for private health services, and contributing to the development of a more competitive health services market.

title: CTP Bond
content:
The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the
Project's effect on customers who will benefit from modern and high-quality
business infrastructure that will help accelerate their business expansion and
growth in Romania and Serbia. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the
Group's expansion in Serbia will promote greater market sustainability as it
will put pressure on local companies to adopt new standards such as green
building.  These practices will not only reduce operating costs and
improve efficiency but also attract international players to enter the market,
bringing with them improved sustainability standards.

title: WCS COVID NMBTZ
content: IFC anticipates that the Project will help best position the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. By sustaining the Bank's ability to provide working capital and trade finance, IFC's facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Tanzania.

title: NSG RSE FACILITY
content: "The proposed loan will finance the completion of the Original Project. This will enable IFC to support Argentina's macro challenges by (i) supporting foreign direct investment (FDI); (ii) substituting imports and generating exports; (iii) adding value to domestic raw materials; and (iv) enhancing value chains."

title: Silver
content: Stakeholders impact: Improved access to finance for MSMEs and climate: The MSME sector is extremely critical for the development of the country by way of production, employment, and exports. However, close to 11 million MSMEs remain either fully or partially excluded from the formal financial system, with an estimated financing gap of ~US$400 billion. The proposed investment will support the Bank in increasing funding to the MSME sector. Further, India requires substantial financing to meet its NDC commitments and grow climate finance. IFC expects that this Project will contribute towards a reduction of the climate financing gap in India by supporting the growth of FBL's climate finance portfolio for renewable energy, climate smart agriculture, green buildings, and waste management projects. The investment will also support FBL in reducing coal exposure.Market impact: Beyond the Project level outcomes, IFC anticipates the investment to promote greater resilience in the market via innovation, demonstration, and replication channels. This approach is expected to demonstrate the viability of MSME lending and inspire other FIs to follow suit.

title: TradeDepot Ser.B
content: IFC anticipates that the Project Outcomes are Very Strong, derived from improved access to supply chain for small retailers in Nigeria, by expanding in Tier 2+ cities, where retailers face frequent inventory shortages due to more challenging access to market than their counterparts in Tier 1 cities, and continuing expansion in Tier 1 cities. These outcomes would be achieved by scaling up an online platform that connects retailers with suppliers and has the potential to result in improved efficiency for retailers as the Company ensures reduced procurement costs and on-time delivery, compared to offline supply chain solutions. In line with IFC's initial investment in TradeDepot, a significant number of new retailers are expected to be women, thereby contributing to alleviate the gender divide in the Nigerian economy. Beyond the Project, the Contribution to Market Creation is Strong, as this investment is expected to increase the inclusiveness of retail supply chains in Nigeria, via demonstration and replication channels. The Company is introducing a business model that involves the use of basic mobile telephony and the provision of embedded finance to reach underserved retailers, especially in Tier 2+ cities. A successful expansion is expected to demonstrate the commercial viability of this business model and trigger replication by competitors, thereby enabling availability of online supply chain solutions in Tier 2+ cities, beyond the Company. Overall, the Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Excellent, based on an AIMM score of 74. On an unadjusted basis (i.e. without likelihood factor), the full AIMM score could reach 88.

title: Axian Togo
content: The project is expected to result in increased access to quality mobile connectivity for individuals and businesses in Togo, a country with large connectivity gaps, by increasing network capacity through the deployment of mobile networks, and by upgrading last-mile fiber broadband network. Furthermore, by supporting a large-scale expansion of high-speed broadband networks in a post-privatization context, this transaction is expected to raise the competitive pressure on alternative operators to improve their offering through a faster roll out of high-speed broadband networks.

title: SLGP SIB SME RSF II
content: - Increased access to finance for SMEs: The project is expected to increase access to longer term financing for SMEs in Cote d'Ivoire.- Inclusiveness: Inclusive growth is expected to be achieved through the successful banking of currently unserved/underserved SMEs (such as women SMEs, agribusiness value chains, smaller size SMEs).

title: BOP Equity BCDC
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome for the project is access to finance for MSMEs in DRC to support economic activity and resilience in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience amongst BOP finance providers, catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of local currency financing to BoP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

title: GTLP CITI V
content: The development impact thesis shared by all projects under the IFC Crisis Response Facility is that by supporting clients' capacity to sustain operations during an acute shock, IFC works to best position the private sector to support the economic recovery process, helping to shorten the time it may take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: BOP LAPO
content: The project will help provide financing to microenterprises in Nigeria. The most significant expected project-level outcome for the project is access to finance for microenterprises to support economic activity and resilience in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of lending to BOP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

title: KIIFB Green Loan
content: The most significant outcome is for stakeholders, through improving access and quality of critical water and healthcare services in a region with inadequate water and sanitation levels as well as high exposure to climate vulnerabilities. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to help enhance financial and climate resilience for subnational entities in India by demonstrating practices to address financial and climate vulnerabilities.

title: Tabreed District Cooling Company
content: Space cooling is increasingly recognized as a development priority especially in emerging economies located in the tropical climate zone. India is experiencing a rapid growth in demand for space cooling, driven by population growth, urbanization, increasing incomes and rising urban heat. According to the India Cooling Action Plan, space cooling demand in India is expected to rise by 11 times from the year 2018 to the year 2038, leading to energy consumption and greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions rising by 4x. The commercial real estate sector is expected to add 100 million RT in capacity during this period. The Company will pioneer the development of DC solutions at scale in India. These projects are expected to improve access to space cooling, reduce lifecycle cooling costs,  decrease energy consumption, reduce peak power and refrigerant demand. The energy efficiency benefits are expected to lead to GHG emissions savings. IFC anticipates that the Company would contribute to faster market adoption of DC technology in the Asian countries by successfully demonstrating the commercial viability of the "cooling as a service" business model.

title: WCS COVID GLR
content: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during the shock resulting from COVID-19, IFC is well positioned to support the private sector in its economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. Specifically, this project intends to provide liquidity to the Company, which will then on lend to SMEs, women customers and women owned SMEs.

title: DARP SPV EOS II
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the offloading of secured retail and SME/corporate NPLs and REOs by financial institutions in the Target Markets, which will support their capital position by freeing up capital and increasing liquidity, and reduce large costs associated with the management of these assets. As a result, this will enhance the lending capacity of these financial institutions. In addition, IFC expects that the Project will help normalize secured retail and SME/corporate obligations, allowing individuals and businesses to resume to sustainable business operations and make them creditworthy again. Beyond the Project-level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the Project has the potential to highlight the importance of regional platforms and contribute towards the much needed increased activity in the distressed assets markets, and demonstrate the effectiveness of the NPL resolution regulatory ecosystem in BiH and Serbia to potential international investors.

title: LPG Mombasa
content: The Project is expected to improve customer access to reliable supply of LPG fuel and improves its affordability (stakeholder effects). Through substitution of solid fuel with environmentally cleaner LPG, the Project is also expected to decrease GHG emissions (environmental effects). Beyond the project outcomes, IFC expects the Project will help demonstrate that the expansion, with improved cost structures achieved through economies of scale and by bringing new technology for transport will further influence other terminal operators  to be more efficient and competitive (competitiveness)

title: DARP SA Cerberus
content: - Stakeholders impact: The Project will support the acquisition and resolution of NPLs by allowing financial institutions to offload distressed assets. In turn, this helps them to release capital, decrease liquidity needs, and reduce their costs associated with the management of these assets. As a result, this will enhance the capacity of these financial institutions to increase lending. It will also help debtors to normalize their defaulted obligations, regain access to credit, and return to actively participate in the financial system. Lastly, the Project will support stress/distress small and medium sized enterprises (SMEs) and corporates by providing credit and the much-needed liquidity to improve their financial health, continue their operations, and ultimately preserve jobs.- Market impact: The Project will contribute to further develop the Latin American distressed asset space especially in Brazil, Colombia, and Mexico. The Project will likely generate a positive demonstration effect by fostering the participation of more players to the region, which is critical to create a vibrant, well-functioning and efficient environment for distressed investing.

title: Robust Nigeria
content: The most significant expected Project outcomes are i) contributing to domestic value addition through investments in processing facilities, ii) improving farmer livelihoods through more reliable access to storage and offtake, and iii) benefitting the environment through reductions in GHG emissions associated with high food losses. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will stem from better integrating an underserved part of the country into global value chains by setting up storage and processing facilities close to the producers and demonstrating the business rationale for enhancing this type of physical infrastructure in the north of Nigeria to counter existing bottlenecks for sector development.

title: ACV Capital III
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes include i) increased access to seed stage and follow-on equity alongside operational value add to enable scale of tech startups in Indonesia.; and ii) increased competitiveness of key sectors in Indonesia, and potentially across other SEA countries, through the support of market-disrupting digital business models.

title: Santander Green
content: Brazil's climate finance market is currently dominated by financial institutions, which provide a general level of climate finance opportunities to their clients. To achieve its ambitious climate finance targets under the Paris Agreement, however, Brazil is relying on the private sector to channel more financial resources towards climate finance activities, including to retail and SME segments. As a systemically-relevant financial institution with country-wide reach and in-depth market presence, Santander is in a strong position to serve as a demonstration example for other funding providers to significantly scale-up climate finance in Brazil through expansion of green lending financial and non-financial products and services, as well as by promoting affordability of green finance in the market. IFC expects that the proposed investment, combined with IFC's capacity building activities, will promote greater environmental sustainability by furthering international green lending principles in the climate finance segment. Further, IFC expects this project to demonstrate the commercial viability of expanding climate lending to retail customers and small and medium-sized enterprises ("SMEs") and therefore encourage replication by other institutions to significantly influence market movement.

title: CIMAF West Africa
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory based on an AIMM score of 40. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 46. The most significant, expected project-level outcomes are economy-wide benefits and employee skills development. Beyond the Project, IFC expects the investment to promote market competitiveness in Senegal via innovation and improved efficiency.

title: Rabo India
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is improved access to climate financing, specifically supporting RE and CSA projects. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment, via demonstration and replication channels, will further contribute towards improved sustainability in the market, by supporting the development of CSA financing and reporting by financial institutions.

title: GTFP STERLING B.
content: Project Impact:Stakeholder Effects  IFC's GTFP will provide trade finance support to Sterling Bank and consequently to the Bank's customers thereby promoting trade for both critical corporates and SMEs in Nigeria. By joining the GTFP, the Bank will have access to a network of 400Correspondent Banks (CBs). This is expected to help boost the profile of the Bank and open doors for more future engagements with the CBs beyond trade. This Project will consequently allow the Bank to offer better terms to its clients which includes SMEs. Contribution to Market Creation:Resilience  GTFP builds, protects, and deepens trade finance networks in lower income/IDA and fragile and conflict-affected countries, by continually enabling individual trade transactions to take place, which slowly builds resilience of trade networks, trade, and income to these economies. This support is especially critical in the maintenance of liquidity and essential goods when the market is facing shocks (most recently triggered by COVID-19). GTFP also ensures that the flow of essential goods and finance is maintained, preventing a potential crisis and further building resilience in the market.

title: GTLP ABSA
content: IFC will play a countercyclical role to help protect cross-border trade finance linkages that support regional and global trade. By sustaining Absa's ability to provide trade finance services, despite COVID-19 impacts, the Projects are intended to promote the resilience of trade finance connections within Africa and between Africa and global markets. In addition, IFC aims to contribute to the maintenance of financial stability by providing comfort to other market participants that, beyond the Projects, are under pressure to reduce exposure in Africa and other markets during this economic crisis.

title: WCS CR Coronation Merchant Bank
content: Resilience: in the context of the shock associated with the COVID pandemic, IFC will, through the proposed investment, support the Bank's capacity to sustain operations and particularly lending to critical sectors of the Nigerian economy.Increase in access to finance: The proposed investment is expected to increase access to finance for players in key sectors of the Nigerian economy by helping the Bank scale up its trade-related financing to enterprises in Nigeria, which in turn is expected to drive economic growth and job creation.

title: BPL SL II
content: The expected Project-level outcome is: increased availability of climate finance (green buildings): The Project will help increase access to climate finance and support Business Partners in its strategy to fund and develop green building projects. Beyond the Project-level outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to increased environmental sustainability in South Africa by demonstrating the viability of green building projects, including to small and medium enterprises. Combined with the other initiatives under IFC's programmatic approach to increase climate finance in South Africa, this is expected to raise the awareness of other financial institutions on the promotion and adoption of green building standards.

title: ETG RSE Medium Term Loan
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is that, at a time of unprecedented crisis as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, the proposed investment will help food flow globally and allow developing markets to maintain jobs and exports. Further, ETG will ensure the availability of liquidity for its distributors and farmers through its procurement activities. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the financing will improve market resilience by maintaining procurement of agricultural commodities across ETG's supply chains and by building the capacity of suppliers and of the Group to withstand shocks and stresses related to COVID-19.

title: BBI WCS
content: Stakeholder effects: Increased access to working capital and trade finance for BBI's customers (FIs and traders) in IDA PSW/FCS countries in Africa. This Project is expected to sustain BBI's ability to maintain liquidity and access to working capital to these customers in IDA/FCS countries. Given the short term nature of the trade transactions financed by BBI, IFC anticipates that BBI will maintain/provide access to finance to customers across IDA PSW countries for a total volume of up to US 300 million over the life of the Project.Market Creation: Integration: By supporting BBI's liquidity needs and its ability to provide trade finance services despite COVID 19 IFC's facility is intended to promote the integration of trade finance markets in the Africa region. This will be achieved by maintaining and expanding trade finance corridors and trade linkages through bolstering correspondent banking network that serves as an enabling platform. This Project will help to protect the essential platform of myriad cross border trade finance linkages, which supports trade in these countries. In addition, it will contribute to the maintenance of financial stability by providing comfort to other market participants, beyond the Project, that are under pressure to retrench from African markets during this economic crisis. To measure the progress against this outcome, IFC will track the number of additional IDA PSW markets where the Bank is currently not actively supporting trade finance.

title: OCP Africa CF
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is driven largely by stakeholder effects, particularly for farmers and distributors, namely: (i) increased agricultural productivity and farmer returns due to customized products and extension/agronomy services (ii) improved logistics for better distribution of agricultural inputs in SSA, particularly West Africa. Beyond the project level, IFC expects the investment to promote mostly small-holding farmers' integration into domestic and regional value chains.

title: Fosun Pharma GHP
content: The most significant expected Project-level effect is the broadened access to COVID-19 vaccine. Beyond the project, it is anticipated that the investment will enhance the resilience of healthcare supply chains in emerging markets.

title: Northwest Hospital Pakistan
content: Project-level impact: (i) expansion of a high-quality provider in an area with few high-quality options for patients, (ii) benefitting the healthcare system by strengthening medical education. Market-level impact: (i) potential for replication of systems by other players in the region leading to higher quality care, and (ii) trained staff going to work in other facilities in the region, thereby strengthening overall quality of care.

title: DCM Banca Comerciala Romania- MREL 2021
content: The Project will increase access to housing finance and climate finance (in the form of green housing loans), two of the most underserved segments in the Romanian economy.  The project is also expected to promote a more dynamic domestic corporate bond market by increasing the diversity of instruments, tenors and issuers.

title: Letshego Namibia Housing
content: Project-level Outcomes: i) Stakeholder effects. IFC anticipates that this Project will increase access to housing finance for formal sector workers in Namibia. Through this Project, IFC aims to support access to mortgage finance for qualifying individuals, complementing public sector subsidies and guarantees available to this segment. Market-level development impact: i) Competitiveness. IFC expects that the Project will demonstrate the attractiveness of the housing finance sector focused on low-middle income individuals. The Project is expected to increase the market's competitiveness as other market participants replicate the Company's success in segments mostly overlooked by commercial banks.

title: Lexo Energy
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are (i) economywide effect, through value addition and job creation; and (ii) stakeholder effects through access to a broader mix of services available at service stations.

title: BOP ABL
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) increased access to finance for SMEs, which will support their capacity to sustain its operations and expedite post-crisis recovery; (ii) further medium and long-term funding from other lenders to support the BOP finance providers and deepen local currency markets as well as access to finance by SMEs.

title: South Asia Growth Fund II, L.P.
content: Project level outcomes are: (i) Access to equity for small to mid-cap companies in India; (ii) Increased environmental and energy efficiency within targeted sectors in India.Market creation outcome is linked to the Fund's portfolio companies' ability to promote and scale resource efficiency and technology solutions.

title: Dolidol
content: Project impactEconomy-wide: The Project's contribution to value addition and both direct and indirect employment will be estimated using IFC's sector multipliers. The Project is expected to create between 200 and 250 jobs. Stakeholders (employee skills): The Project will support the continuous development of technical skills and the development of industry-relevant skills and adoption of superior production techniques, which will lead to an improvement of the human capital in these countries.Environment: The Project includes several climate related components, including installation of solar panels on the Company's facility in Morocco as well as plastic recycling through Dolicen, its new subsidiary. Market impactCompetitiveness: The Project is expected to have meaningful impact in market-level dimension ofcompetitiveness (i.e. through demonstration and replication effects, as other players are considering investing in the automotive sector in Morocco). It will also promote the competitiveness of other related manufacturing sectors (e.g. automotive) which use the Company's output as their intermediary products. The plastic recycling plant (Dolicen) is a commercial approach to manufacturing that can be replicated by other players in Morocco. Installing solar panels may also set a beneficial environmental precedent in the market.

title: SMEV Adiwale I
content: The Project is expected to align with the AIMM Rating for the SMEV Envelope.IFC anticipates that the Project would result in increased access to growth capital and value creation for SMEs in Francophone West Africa, as well as build capacity of a local Fund Manager to professionalize and successfully manage its funds. Based on the Fund's track record and pipeline, it is expected to invest in mid-cap companies in IDA/FCS countries and build the capacity of their internal functions and governance.Beyond the Project, this investment has the potential to develop the nascent private equity market in Francophone West Africa, through demonstration effects. IFC's equity and advisory services demonstrate confidence in this Fund Manager and support of a model that branches out from a traditional focus on Anglophone West Africa, thereby signaling the viability of the PE asset class in frontier markets in Francophone West Africa to other PE investors.

title: SeABank Project
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) improved access to finance for climate businesses and local SMEs, (ii) capacity building through parallel advisory support, (iii) expected reduction in GHG emissions, and (iv) promotion of international standards and best practices in gender and climate financing.

title: I&M Bank Kenya -Tier II Sub-Loan
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is improved accessibility to SME finance in Kenya. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that it has the potential to promote greater banking sector resilience by boosting capital adequacy of I&M Bank Ltd, Kenya. This will help the market withstand shocks, contributing to financial market stability.

title: Camel Ride
content: The proposed Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good, based on an AIMM score of 43. On an unadjusted basis (i.e., without likelihood factor), the full potential AIMM score could reach 64. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the benefit to patients from the provision of high-quality healthcare. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment has the potential to promote greater inclusiveness in Egypt's labor market through demonstration and capacity-building channels.

title: DCM RBRO GREEN MREL BOND
content: The project is expected to:i) Help the country achieve its climate change mitigation targets by supporting the first green bond issuance by a financial institution in the country. The entire proceeds from the bond issuance will be used for financing eligible climate finance projects in Romania.ii) Support the development of capital markets in the country by deepening and diversifying Romania's corporate bond market. Successful issuance of MREL-eligible bonds is expected to encourage other banks, as well as investors, and help develop the market for MREL instruments.iii) Increase the resilience of the Romanian banking sector by supporting a systemic bank and helping it achieve its MREL-targets.

title: Telecom Armenia CJSC
content:
The Project has an
Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory.

 

Project Outcomes: Increased access to quality broadband Internet for
individuals and businesses. Based on the standalone capex plan to upgrade
mobile and fixed network, a preliminary assessment suggests "Strong"
Project Outcomes, with a risk of a Moderate rating if savings
are not reinvested or if there is no addition with respect to the current capex
plan. The gap in access to quality broadband Internet in Armenia is expected to
be Medium as, compared to other emerging markets, penetration and download
speed of fixed or mobile broadband is on par with regional or income-group
averages. Without the refinancing component, the Company may not be able to
expand beyond its historical investment trend. The refinancing is expected to
generate savings that, if reinvested, can support network expansion and upgrade
as well as expand international connectivity. The magnitude of these outcomes
will be explored in appraisal and depends on: the degree of commitment to
reinvest the savings, and how these will be invested; and the incremental
nature of this investment compared to the existing capex plan.

 

Market Creation - Subject to evidence about the expected increase
in high-speed broadband coverage beyond the Company, a preliminary assessment
suggests "Moderate" Contribution to Market Creation. Increased
integration by strengthening international connectivity linkages or enabling
digital platforms may be considered post appraisal. Increased competitiveness
of the market for broadband Internet access by preserving trends in network
upgrade via innovation and competition channels. The market for broadband
Internet access in Armenia is fairly developed with a number of large fixed and
mobile broadband operators providing affordable service within an effective
regulatory framework. However, technological innovation remains limited beyond
the market leader as other operators mainly rely on legacy technologies (3G and
ADSL). By supporting an expansion of 4G and fiber-optic network by the Company,
this investment has the potential to maintain competitive pressure on other
market players to continue upgrading their networks, thereby preserving the
trends in broadband quality improvement in the Armenian broadband sector.

title: CDel SLGP SC Nigeria RSF1
content: Stakeholder Impact: Increased access to finance for SMEs: IFC anticipates that the RSF will allow the Bank to sustainably increase its SME lending profile by providing working capital to support commerce, funded trade finance for the importation of goods/raw materials, and longer-term loans to finance the acquisition of energy efficient equipment and/or business expansion through the risk-sharing arrangement, and hence contribute to increasing access to finance for SMEs. The Bank will also target particularly underserved sub-segments such as WSMEs and climate smart SMEs. The targeted subsegments, and projected quantum of financing to each, will be further defined at appraisal. Contribution to Market Creation: Competitiveness: IFC, by providing longer term financing through an RSF and leveraging the complementary capacity building, will support the Bank in the development and scale-up of SME product offerings and therefore its ability to lend competitively and profitably to SMEs. in Nigeria, an underserved sector perceived by local banks as risky. This would demonstrate the commercial viability of SMEs to the wider sector and help induce greater capital flows towards SMEs.

title: GTFP Unico Mozam
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs. On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels. It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: BOP HTB Senior
content: Project outcome: The Project will contribute towards narrowing the financing gap in the country by providing additional loans to MSMEs including WMSMEs during the tenor of the facility. This is expected to increase economic activity and job creation in Cambodia, expediting post-crisis recovery. Market-level outcome: IFC's engagement with the Bank will mobilize private sector investors in support of Cambodia's financial sector and increased access for underserved MSMEs and WMSMEs.

title: YoKuku Mezz
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is expanding the operations of the leading poultry producer in Uganda with positive economy-wide impacts. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will be through strengthening the competitiveness of the poultry sector in Uganda through adoption of processing efficiencies and quality control measures that will contribute to greater formalization of the sector. The Project will also contribute to marketing efficiency of the corn and soybean markets by reducing transaction costs, imposing standards, and reducing seasonal price variation by adding storage capacity and purchasing grain and oilseeds at harvest time.

title: DARP SPV CDH SOFI
content: Project Outcome: (i) Stakeholder Effects - Capital relief and increasing lending capacity of financial Institutions: The Project is expected to support offloading NPLs from financial institutions with an estimated OPB of US$875 million. This will help financial institutions relieve capital constraints and increase lending capacity. (ii) Stakeholder Effects-Normalization of distressed SME borrowers and distressed property developers. (iii) Environmental effects: Through the Project, IFC will convert the distressed Single Assets into green properties. This will lead to an expected reduction of GHG emission of up to 64,294 t CO2/yr. Market Creation (i) Competitiveness: China's distressed asset market is still dominated by state-owned enterprises, with significant developmental gap between Tier-1 cities/coastal provinces and frontier provinces. IFC aims to promote market competition by strengthening the institutional capacity of capable domestic private sector players and to address the market gap by contributing to the improvement of legal infrastructure in frontier provinces and sharing distressed asset resolution experiences with court systems in those markets. (ii) Sustainability: The Project will be IFC's first green distressed asset investment project. IFC aims to promote greater sustainability through standard setting and market enabling by greening distressed Single Assets and promoting international green building standards to the market.

title: HDBank GreenLoan
content: IFC anticipates supporting HDBank through a financing package of US$70 million to strengthen its climate business, especially around renewable energy. The Bank intends to expand its climate portfolio, through an increase in its financing activities towards solar power plants and solar rooftop projects. IFC also anticipates that the Project will reduce GHG emissions in Vietnam. The expected reduction on sub-borrowers' emissions and technical data on reductions in GHG emissions will be collected and quantified through IFC's Climate Assessment for Financial Institutions (CAFI) tool.Additionally, IFC anticipates that the Project will have sustainability market impact as it supports HDBank's contribution to the country's objective of tackling climate change challenges by adopting environmental sustainability principles and developing a new asset class that promotes greater market sustainability. Through this investment, it would contribute towards capacity building and standard setting in market which is currently in nascent stage in terms of climate finance.

title: GTFP EAB
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs. On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels. It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: Learn Capital Venture Partners - EM, LP
content: - Increased availability of capital for technology-driven start-ups engaged in education and skills development in emerging markets: IFC expects that the EM Fund will increase investment available to education and skills-focused start-up companies across emerging markets, including geographies with limited access to venture capital.- Improved access to efficient training, upskilling and employability-related education services for populations across emerging markets: By investing in companies providing scalable, accessible and low-cost learning solutions, IFC expects to support learners in emerging markets to achieve higher levels of education and develop digital and other employment-related skills so as to participate more effectively in the workforce.- Increased competitiveness of key markets through innovative market-creating solutions: IFC expects the EM Fund will support start-up companies that enhance the efficiency of traditional education models and also companies that leverage new technologies to create innovative services and delivery channels currently unavailable to emerging market populations.

title: WCS CR Banco de la Produccion
content: By supporting clients' capacity to sustain operations during the acute shock resulting from COVID-19, IFC is well positioned to support the private sector in its economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. Specifically, this project intends to provide liquidity to Banpro, which will then on lend to MSMEs. By sustaining banks' ability to provide these services, IFC's facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Nicaragua. Turbulence in global funding markets, among other factors, have made it difficult for the extensive network of client and partner banks to maintain their role as an enabling platform for liquidity to multiple emerging markets, many experiencing their own acute liquidity shocks while the need for liquidity increases.

title: Agrofertil 2021
content: Given the repeat nature of the transaction, the specific contribution from this facility toward market creation may be marginal. Nonetheless, project-level outcome is preserving farmer livelihoods by supporting their access to pre-harvest financing, purchase of inputs, and continued delivery of grain and oilseeds to export markets (global food security).

title: TIDE Africa II
content: IFC expects the project to deliver successful project outcomes, by providing an increase in access to capital for early stage technology companies in capital constrained economies that have the potential to disrupt traditional industries, along with investee growth, which will be supported by TIDE II's value creation strategies. The Project has received an AIMM rating of 76 (Excellent) on account of Very Strong Project Outcomes as a result of the increased access to both equity and operational support for startups mainly in Kenya and Nigeria which serve as critical regional hubs incubating startups than can then scale to serve the broader African markets, especially East and/or West Africa. TIDE II is also expected to result in Very Strong Market Outcomes anchored by enhanced integration driven by increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models. In addition, TIDE II is expected to increase the competitiveness of Sub-Saharan Africa's venture capital market.

title: HTB Sub Debt
content: Project outcome: The Project will contribute towards narrowing the MSME financing gap by providing additional loans to MSMEs including WMSMEs during the tenor of the loan. This is expected to increase economic activity and job creation in Cambodia to expedite post-crisis recovery. Market-level outcome: IFC's engagement with the Bank will mobilize private sector investors to support the financial sector in Cambodia and increase access to finance to the underserved MSMEs and WMSMEs.

title: GTFP MIGA
content: GTFP's guarantees on trade finance transactions provide risk mitigation to their cross-border correspondent banks, protecting the essential networks that enable EMDEs to be integrated with the global trade finance network, as well as to participate in global trade.  GTFP improves overall market integration by (1) maintaining and expanding trade finance, financial linkages and trade across multiple markets through strengthening these bilateral correspondent banking connections; (2) helping to create new connections between local and international banks; (3) channeling new sources of capital to support trade flow through demonstration and replication of trade finance as a viable investment asset class in EMDEs.  GTFP has a particularly strong presence in IDA/FCS markets, where it helps to protect and deepen cross-border trade finance networks, and thus trade corridors.  Such support is especially critical in the maintenance of liquidity and essential goods during this crisis, as well as protecting the architecture that is necessary for crisis resilience and recovery.

title: Vantage Mezzanine Fund IV
content: This Project supports market creation by strengthening the private credit ecosystem and increasing funding market activity in Africa. By supporting Vantage Capital, which has shown itself able to demonstrate the continued viability of the private credit market in a difficult economic environment, IFC anticipates that its financing will continue to strengthen the competitiveness of the private credit market and will signal to other fund managers that it is viable to invest in a region suffering from a lack of investor confidence.

title: FCS Moove
content: The project supports a pioneer company running rental and lease models for ride-hailing car drivers in parts of Sub Saharan Africa where the limited supply of cars has caused severe bottlenecks for the growing ride-hailing business. This will help enhance urban mobility and improve the safety of ride-hailing services, while allowing for improved quality of cars and jobs in the industry. In addition to piloting hybrid vehicles, the project is a strong contributor to the shared economy and it enables the shift from private car use in a congested market, thus classifying the investment as climate finance. This proposed investment also supports the creation of an inclusive business model for ride-hailing in Nigeria by demonstrating a replicable model for the high participation of women in a male-dominated industry.

title: Grit REIG
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are i) environmental effects, through reduction in energy and water uses; and ii) economywide effects through value addition and job creation. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will facilitate the integration of the Kenyan real-estate market into regional and global financial markets through demonstration effects for REIT and REIT-type vehicles.

title: Jungle Fund IV
content: Expected development impact through:(i) Access to early stage capital and operational support leading to increased ability of startups to scale and succeed;(ii) Support and develop innovation, technology and entrepreneurs in Southeast Asia by supporting growing internet companies in the region focused on delivering consumption upgrade and improving efficiency and digitization among businesses, especially among SMEs; and(iii) Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models.

title: LAAD Green
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is increased access to climate finance in targeted countries in Latin-America and the Caribbean. In particular, the Project will target climate-smart agribusinesses that are mostly SMEs and will help LAAD to increase its capacity to monitor green loans. In addition, IFC anticipates that the Project will strengthen green finance standards in the country which will encourage replication by other institutions in the country, thereby contributing towards increased environmental sustainability through the demonstration and capacity building channels.

title: Prime IV
content: Counter-cycling to COVID Market Disruption: The project will help to position the industry to "buildback- better" post COVID-19, and will contribute to restoring the confidence and enthusiasm of theinvestors disrupted by the pandemic.Investment impact: The proposed Project will help in increasing the access to seed to Series A stage equity for startups.

title: Knife Fund III
content:
Project Outcomes:

 

While the country has several accelerators/incubators and
early stage Fund Managers, access to equity at later stages of the life cycle
is scarce. It should also be noted that the Africa region more broadly has some
of the lowest VC penetration rates compared to other emerging markets and South
Africa can serve as a hub to incubate startups and then scale them to serve the
broader African markets. Hence, this Fund will increase access to equity and
operational value add for startups in South Africa that will expand into other
African countries. Further, most of the investees of the previous fund have
successfully expanding into neighboring countries or have a clear business plan
to do so over the next years as well.

 

Contribution to Market Creation:

 

The largest contribution to market creation is expected to
come from the sector specific impacts of digital investees.

Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support
of market-disrupting digital business models: The Fund is expected to invest in
innovative businesses models that strengthen supply chains, improve price
transparency and have a demonstration effect by catalyzing replication from new
entrants. In markets where investees grow rapidly and become sizeable market
players, this innovation at scale can generate large impacts on a market's
competitiveness by pushing traditional players to innovate. 

Increased competitiveness of South Africa's VC market: IFC
anticipates the Fund will demonstrate the viability of Series B venture capital
in South Africa by attracting more investors and incentivizing more
entrepreneurs to start businesses.

title: Daystar Power
content: -	The Project is expected to increase reliability and affordability of electricity for C&I customers facing unstable supply. To meet current demand, Nigerian C&I customers rely on costly self-generation (mainly diesel units and smaller gasoline-powered generators). The Project provides power system management services and alternative energy sources provided cost efficiently to C&I customers in Nigeria. It has a target to install about 30 MWp of generation capacity by 2022. By expanding alternative reliable power solutions provided cost effectively to C&I customers, the project also supports growth and job creation in the Nigerian economy.-	The proposed investment will result in GHG emission savings in electricity generation, from the switch to solar PV from more carbon intensive fuels used in distributed power generation. Emissions savings are estimated at 32,700 tons of CO2 per annum.-	At a market level, the Project contributes to the decarbonization of the power sector in Nigeria by supporting the achievement of scale in deploying solar PV to C&I consumers. The project supports the expansion of a pioneer in the C&I solar distributed generation industry that helps to establish a track record for solar as an alternative to carbon-intensive energy sources. It also provides market signals that help to unlock some bottlenecks faced by solar PV distributed generation, including perceptions on reliability and cost of the solution.

title: Avallon MBO III
content: Project Outcomes:-Increase in access to private equity capital in Poland-Value creation for small-cap companies in PolandContribution to Market Creation:-IFC's investment is anticipated to provide a signal to other potential funds as to the long-term viability of small to mid-cap segment and attract other fund managers to raise new small to mid-cap funds.

title: DARP SA GPC
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is to provide financially stressed but otherwise viable mid-market enterprises with flexible funding solutions to strengthen the capital structure and consequently preserve jobs. IFC also anticipates that the Project has the potential to promote greater market competitiveness via demonstration and replication channels.

title: BOP KMF-FY21
content: Stakeholder Effects: Improved access to and quality of finance for microenterprises and SMEs - The income stream of MSMEs, has been severely affected by the lockdowns, increased uncertainty, and a slow-down in economic activity in the wake of the pandemic. As the economy re-opens, MSMEs need access to capital to finance investments in inventory and inputs to resume economic activity, and to adjust business models to the post-crisis economic environment. The project will further support the implementation of a digital transformation of KMF's products and operations. KMF expects to digitize customer onboarding, therefore enabling a digital and remote loan disbursements and collections for a large share of its MSME customers. The adoption of digital channels and delivery methods have become increasingly important to adapt to customer needs and maintain business operations in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis.Resilience: IFC anticipates that project will support resilience amongst microfinance and base-of-pyramids (BOP) finance providers by helping the market deal with the growing uncertainty and catalyzing investor response. A rise in non-performing loans, and disrupted borrower cash-flows has left banks reluctant to lend directly to BOP segments. Macroeconomic instability and uncertainty on the long-term viability of their operations has led to increased difficulties in accessing the funds needed to support the recovery and growth of their lending operations. By investing in KMF, IFC will demonstrate to other investors the viability of supporting the sustainability and recovery of BOP financial service providers.

title: BajajFin Debt
content: Improved access to finance for MSMEs including women owned MSMEs: The MSME sector is extremely critical for the development of the country as it accounts for over 30% of the GDP and provides employment to more than 110mn people. Further, the MSME segment, which has been facing growth and funding challenges even before COVID-19, has experienced further constraints since the pandemic, owing to significant risk-aversion amongst lenders. The proposed investment would increase availability of financing to this  underserved MSME segments, including women-owned MSMEs which are even more constraint for funding compared to the overall MSME segment.

title: FintechOS
content: FintechOS is a software company that provides the tools to expedite the digital transformation of banks and insurance companies. By supporting the Company's operations, IFC expects to ultimately improve the quality and accessibility of financial services in emerging markets, starting with Eastern Europe.

title: Agila
content: The investment will support a leading low-cost airline in the Philippines address liquidity pressures due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic and help maintain access to essential services for passengers and businesses. It will contribute to mitigating disruption to connectivity and help better position the company ramp up services to match growing travel demand as economic activity starts to recover. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the financing will contribute to market resilience of airline sector in Philippines via market enabling channels.

title: Viveo
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is the improved delivery of medical products and the quality of the supply chain.  This will strengthen service provision by healthcare facilities throughout the country, including in frontier regions. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that its financing could support greater market resilience as service capacity to treat COVID-19 increases.

title: Everstone IV
content: IFC's role and additionality consists of: (i) own account equity and; (ii) non-commercial risk mitigation

title: Alpha JWC Ventures Fund III, L.P
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes include i) providing early stage capital and value creation expertise to tech-entrepreneurs to enable businesses to scale up; and ii) increasing competitiveness of businesses through the support of market-disrupting digital business models.

title: Medgenome
content: Expected development impact includes: (i) Access to genetic diagnostic services and targeted medication (ii) Market creation by significantly deepening the genomic segment via demonstration and replication, and capacity building channels.

title: CORSAN Water
content: The direct anticipated impact of this project is to increase quality of water supply services in Rio Grande do Sul and the environmental benefits of reducing wasted water resources. At the market level, the project will contribute to increase competitiveness of water sector in Brazil by demonstrating a feasible water loss reduction strategy that improves the financial viability of water utilities. The project also contributes to introducing into the market sustainability linked loans as an innovative financial product with potential to enable water infrastructure sector investments.

title: Faering Capital International Growth Fund III
content: Expected development impact through:(i)  Providing access to growth equity capital to companies across India, including underserved regions; (ii)  Increased investee growth, through the Manager's financial and operational value add; (iii) Increased Gender Equality through Manager's policies both at investee and Fund level.

title: IZSU Support
content: The most significant project level outcomes are increased access and quality of water supply and wastewater services in Izmir. Beyond the Project, at the market level, IFC will contribute to improve water resilience by demonstrating low-cost, innovative and scaleable solutions to support conservation in water stressed areas of Turkey.

title: GTLP Bank of America
content: By sustaining BofA's ability to provide trade finance services, despite COVID, the Project is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets in Latin America. This project, through IFC's countercyclical role, will help to protect cross-border trade finance linkages, which supports regional and global trade. In addition, it is aimed at contributing to the maintenance of financial stability by providing comfort to other market participants, beyond the project, that are under pressure to reduce exposure in Latin America and other markets during this economic crisis.

title: EGP India - Thar
content: The main project-level outcomes are the environmental impact by displacing GHG emissions and the stakeholder impact by helping meet India's increasing electricity demand. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will improve market integration by enabling the generation and transmission of power from renewable rich states to renewable deficient states through the national grid. The Project will also increase market competitiveness by demonstrating scaling up of a new and efficient module technology to meet ambitious national targets.

title: Asia Impact Investment Fund II
content: Expected development impact outcomes include i) providing access to patient equity capital for companies in Southeast Asia, particularly those serving the needs of the BoP, and ii) deepening the impact investment landscape in the region.

title: Onomo Hotels
content: IFC expects the Project to increase employment, as well as demand for goods and services from the relevant Project companies' suppliers. It is also expected that the Project will promote the resilience of the tourism sector by preserving availability and quality of services provided by a pan-African player and improve the local offering of quality hotels for regional business travelers.

title: Hero Fincorp TW
content: Increased access to finance - The Project anticipates providing two-wheeler asset financing for self-employed individuals or micro and small enterprises in in low income states of India. Contribution to Market Creation: Inclusiveness: HFCL will primarily cater to the needs of additional first-time borrowers who are entering the market and will demonstrate the financial viability of serving the unserved segment, especially small entrepreneurs in low income states.

title: GTFP BRIDGE CI
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs. On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels. It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: RSE COVID - Facey Group III
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is direct employment in the Facey Group/PBS' markets, achieved by maintaining the provision of critical IT equipment and services to businesses as they increase digitalization of their operations in response to the pandemic. Beyond the project outcomes, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote greater market resilience by strengthening connectivity by supporting a higher penetration of networking and cloud computing technology in its markets and increasing the ability of companies in the service sector, especially in Guatemala, to maintain operations during the crisis, via market enabling channels. The Company's clients are mainly from the government and banking and financial services subsectors, and their ability to maintain operations during the crisis using appropriate IT equipment and services would contribute to enable their suppliers and customers, typically from the service sector in Guatemala, to continue operating and delivering essential services to the public.

title: Liquid Telecom South Africa Term Loan
content: The Project is expected to increase the capacity of broadband networks across several countries in Africa, potentially resulting in increased access to quality broadband internet for individuals and businesses. Beyond the Project, this investment will contribute to maintaining the competitiveness of the markets for broadband internet across Africa by providing access to shared broadband infrastructure to all retail operators under open access and a nondiscriminatory basis.

title: Profi Romania Grocery
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Satisfactory. The most significant expected Project-level outcome is derived from stakeholder effects through improved access to high quality food products by customers, especially in the rural areas of Romania. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote greater market competition in secondary cities and rural areas through demonstration and replication channel.

title: GWFP Mercon 2021
content: Access to finance and markets: The project will continue to have significant positive impacts on the main stakeholder groups, and especially on coffee farmers and surrounding communities. The farmers should continue to benefit from reliable access to markets and in select cases access to finance and training provided by the group, particularly in regions where financing has become challenging. The Company's activity is benefiting the producers directly as it purchases their products and provides them with financing, certification, logistics, and forward price fixing. Inclusive: With more than 20% of Mercon's global supply from farms of less than 5 hectares, the investment is classified as inclusive in terms of reach to smallholder farmers.IFC expects the project, through the complimentary IFC Advisory Services project (#604064), to help farmers in Nicaragua improve their Robusta coffee production, with better quality and higher yields. This is also expected to introduce practices to strengthen the sustainability of coffee production.Integration: IFC expects the facility, through the demonstration and replication channel, to contribute to the strengthening of financial integration of the coffee value chain, in the markets where Mercon operates. This is essentially achieved through maintaining connections between several private sector financial institutions and coffee farmers, cooperatives, suppliers and aggregators.

title: Wavemaker 4
content: Project Outcomes:Gap: The VC funding gap is assessed as small relative to other emerging markets. However, it is noted that the Fund is in the very early VC stage (Seed/ Series A) which is a riskier segment and lacks sophisticated institutional funds. This stage of the Fund is also critical to develop a quality late stage pipeline of startups. During diligence, the amount of capital invested into investees operating in the more underpenetrated parts of the SE Asia region will also be considered.Outcomes: Access to early stage capital and operational support leading to increased ability of startups to scale and succeed. During diligence, information on investee performance, follow-on funding and value creation strategies used by the Fund Manager will be assessed to set targets and assess the intensity of the project.Contribution to Market Creation:The largest contribution to market creation is expected to come from the sector specific impacts of digital investees.Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: By investing in technology-enabled solutions across a variety of B2B, enterprise and deep-tech sectors, the Fund will assist in the development of the region's digital economy. The Fund's innovative investees bring new business models,  ometimes into underserved parts of the region, demonstrating the viability of early-stage VC investments in a region where VC funding is still in its infancy; thereby bringing more competitors into the market, increasing efficiency and driving down market-wide costs. It will be expected that at least two of the Fund's investees will change market  structure.

title: China Cube Water Loan
content: Assessment of Project Outcomes:IFC anticipates that the project will have positive stakeholder and environment effects through increased access to WWT. The project's focus on frontier regions will increase access in areas where treatment rates are lower than in China's large urban areas. Moreover, water pollution control remains a pressing issue in China where WWT plays a pivotal role by reducing the release of pollutants and the contamination of local water sources caused by the discharge of untreated water. The project will support expansion of WWT capacity to satisfy the growing demand of quality water and WWT service. This is expected to have strong positive impact in a province such as Shaanxi that suffers from extreme water stress levels.Assessment of Contribution to Market Creation:    The project is expected to contribute to competitiveness in the WWT sector by supporting the expansion of an experienced actor operating in the frontier provinces. The sector remains dominated by SOEs and local SOEs centered on the larger cities, and the project's focus on frontier regions, high operational standards, and subsector initiatives is likely to have a positive demonstration effects for other players to replicate.

title: Amaggi Sustainable Cotton
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is expanding production of sustainable cotton to meet growing consumer demand, while reducing the environmental footprint through precision agriculture methods.

title: Gaja 2020
content: Project-level outcomes are: (i) increased access to private equity capital; (ii) value creation for small to mid-cap companies in India, and; (iii) improved access to digital services for individuals and enhanced productivity growth and cost savings for businesses through digital solutions.The main market-creation outcomes are: (i) strengthening of the competitiveness of the PE market in India by supporting a local fund manager scale up and demonstrate sustained track record; (ii) signaling the viability of the small to mid-cap control segment, and countering the wary perceptions in this space.

title: Liquid Telecom Bond
content: The Project is expected to increase the capacity of broadband networks across several countries in Africa, potentially resulting in increased access to quality broadband internet for individuals and businesses. Beyond the Project, this investment will contribute to maintaining the competitiveness of the markets for broadband internet across Africa by providing access to shared broadband infrastructure to all retail operators under open access and a nondiscriminatory basis.

title: Indorama Eleme Petrochemicals Limited- Efficiency project
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) the economywide effects via value addition; ii) the environmental effects from savings in the consumption of fossil fuels and GHG emissions reduction. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates the potential to promote market sustainability through a demonstration effect.

title: Pronaca Covid
content: Economy-wide Impact: The planned expansion will have a positive impact through value addition.Market Impact: The Project is expected to contribute to broader sector competitiveness by supporting a leading player.

title: Hamza Textiles
content: Economy-wide effects: The Project will support the Group to increase process and product complexity, and strengthen its vertical integration, by modernizing the fabric production facilities which in turn will improve profitability and quality of products. In addition, the Project will enable the Company to reduce its lead time to end apparel retailers. Employment Growth: The Project has a strong employment effects and will create 930 additional direct jobs and hundreds of jobs in the value chain. Beyond the large numbers of jobs created, there will also be significant upskilling and training of workers. Competitiveness: This Project, and IFC's sectoral focus in the RMG sector in Bangladesh is expected to contribute to preserving Bangladesh's competitiveness as a global player in the textile and apparel market. Resilience: IFC expects the Project will demonstrate to the other players the necessary investments required to be agile and resilient considering possible future shocks in the market. The Company plans to use the financing to implement agile manufacturing through process modernization and better technology

title: REE Wind Power 2
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good. The main expected project-level outcomes are the environmental impact by displacing  GHG emissions each year and the stakeholder impact by helping address growing demand and expected electricity shortages in Vietnam. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to increase market competitiveness by supporting much-needed private investment in the energy sector which has been dominated by state owned enterprises and demonstrating the role of wind power in the Vietnam's electricity generation mix.

title: ACLEDA sr 2020
content: The Project's development impact is anchored on increased access to finance for underserved SME segments, including women-owned SMEs. Beyond the Project, and along with other World Bank Group efforts in the SME segment, the investment will foster greater inclusiveness of the SME financing market via innovation and competition.

title: Amethis MENA Fund II S.C.A. SICAV-RAIF
content: Project Outcomes: The main project-level outcome is an increase in access to private equity capital and value creation for SMEs in the MENA region.Market Creation: The main contribution to market creation is expected to come from increasing the competitiveness of the PE market in MENA.  The success of this Fund Manager can demonstrate the viability of PE in the region.

title: GreenFeed ASF
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good. The Project is assessed as part of the overarching programmatic intervention ("ASF Recovery Asia") to respond to the impacts of the African Swine Fever (ASF) on the regional pork industry. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome resulting from this expansion is the impact on consumers from the provision of safe pork at the time of severe supply shortage as well as implementation of advanced biosecurity procedures at the new farms. At the market level, the Project, alongside other planned investment and advisory interventions, is expected to promote market resilience through improvement of biosecurity and disease management, both by supporting industry consolidation and disseminating best practices among smaller players.

title: Convergence II
content: The Project is expected to result in increased capacity of digital infrastructure, with a potential to improve quality of digital connectivity and services for individuals and businesses. These outcomes would be achieved by supporting the sharing of broadband and data infrastructure and adding new international connectivity and data center capacity across a number of countries, including some with substantial gaps in digital connectivity. Beyond the Project, this investment has the potential to result in increased competitiveness of the market for digital connectivity and data across the target countries, by creating competitive markets via demonstration and replication channels.

title: BlackPeak Southeast Europe Growth Equity Fund SCSp
