content: Project Outcomes:- Access to private capital: increase in access to private equity capital for small/mid-market companies in SEE.- Investee growth: Increased investee growth through the Fund Manager's value creation strategies.Contribution to Market Creation:- Competitiveness: The project is expected to support a local manager in raising its first regional fund and progressively attracting capital from private institutional investors. The success of the manager could demonstrate the viability of PE growth equity and complement the PE ecosystem in the region.

title: Bolt Technology
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are derived from a digital platform that provides micro-entrepreneurship opportunities to individuals seeking to earn a supplementary income by moving people and goods. The Project is also expected to increase access to affordable urban mobility services for riders, with greater price transparency and improved convenience and safety.The main sources of expected Market Creation outcomes are derived from the potential to maintain the competitiveness of the emerging ride hailing sector across the target markets, by enabling increased access to and usage of online ride hailing services beyond the Company via competition channels.

title: ProducePay-Equit
content: 1) Increased Access to Financing for Farmers:IFC expects that the Project will increase access to non-collateralized financing for produce farmers, primarily from Mexico but also from other LAC countries for export to North America.2) Contribution to Market Creation - Integration:IFC expects that the Project will contribute to an increased integration of LAC agribusinesses to the U.S. market, as it contributes to the growth of an innovative business model fostering flexible working capital solutions for produce farmers to finance pre-harvest investments - not only in Mexico, Peru, Chile, but also in more underserved countries in Central America (e.g. Guatemala, Costa Rica).

title: VA Tech - HAM Projects
content: (i) The Project will provide wastewater treatment capacity in the context of growing pollution of rivers due to lack of treatment capacity in the country. (ii) The Project could help promote market competitiveness by supporting an innovative HAM structure in the wastewater sector in India as the Government attempts to create bankable structures to encourage private sector participation.

title: Sagicor WCS
content: The project is expected to have development impact in terms of: i) Increased access to working capital credit for SMEs sector in Jamaica. The Facility is supporting the bank's clients' capacity to sustain operations during an acute shock and ensure economic activities continue. Jamaica's SME sector are heavily impacted and in urgent need of working capital solutions that would help them sustain through the crisis. Specifically, this project intends to provide up to US$40 million of at least one year working capital to SME customers in any given year. (ii) Strengthening the Jamaican financial sector's competitiveness and inclusiveness, by providing a demonstration effect for other financial institutions, setting a precedent to extend their services to these segments, making the financial sector more inclusive. IFC's intervention will help address the sharp disruptions resulting from the COVID19 health pandemic by providing a liquidity buffer for the bank. This will ensure that the bank is in a better position to contribute to a faster recovery of the economy.

title: Kasada Hospitality Fund LP
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is to provide hotels in distress due to impact of the COV-19 pandemic, and acquired in the previaling environment from a liquidity-constrained non-strategic investor, with additional liquidity and operational support to facilitate necessary restructuring and recapitalization leading to successful turnarounds, and consequently job preservation in the hospitality sector and its supply chain. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater sector integration by making financing more accessible to hotels in Sub-Saharan Africa, including those in distressed situations, via support for the first large-scale, professionally managed equity fund focused on hospitality, which plans to build a significant portfolio of hotels in SSA.

title: DCM SRT CACIB III
content: Stakeholders impact: IFC anticipates that the project will enable CACIB to originate significantly more new trade finance assets over project life across a wide range of EM countries than what would have been the case without the project, using released regulatory capital that CACIB otherwise would have been required to hold against assets in the reference portfolio. The new trade finance business facilitated by the project is expected to help promote the resumption of critical EM trade finance flows in the COVID-19 crisis context. Resilience: IFC anticipates that the project will contribute to market resilience in EMs by strengthening financial connectivity between CACIB and banking sectors in target EMs. IFC would leverage CACIB's vast network of correspondent banks in EMs markets to bolster trade finance flows to EMs. In this respect, primary benefit of the project to EMs is provision of trade finance liquidity at the time of acute need.

title: BBI IDA RSF
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impact: (i)	Increase in trade finance for EMIBs and underlying importers and exporters in Africa. Through the Project, BBI will increase its trade finance in those riskier markets and support the capacity of EMIBs to finance trade flows. (ii)	Market resilience. By sustaining BBI's ability to provide trade finance services, despite COVID, IFC's facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets. In addition, it will contribute to the maintenance of financial stability by providing comfort to other market participants, beyond the project, that are under pressure to retreat from African markets during this economic crisis. In doing so, this project will help to protect the essential platform of myriad cross-border trade finance linkages.

title: Daycoval A/B SME
content: IFC will support Daycoval to increase access to finance for SMEs including underserved segments such as Women Owned SMEs and Underserved Region SMEs. In Brazil, credit penetration has been one of the most important issues in financial sector development given the structural barriers and lack of incentives for banks to go down the market. There is a SME finance gap is estimated at $437 billion in Brazil (24.7% of GDP), 3x of the current stock of SME loans outstanding. The economic crisis of the last few years has further accentuated the already considerable finance gap as the MSME portfolio of the Brazilian banking sector has declined from $210 billion as of December 2015 to $124 billion as of September 2020, representing a 16% reduction in local currency. The Project will support Daycoval to continue addressing the financing gaps faced by SMEs in the country, through its targeted focus on underserved segments.IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to an increased inclusiveness of the SME financing market in Brazil. Historically, the SME financing market has been considered inefficient, due to a number of issues such as lack of financial infrastructure elevating the cost of lending, and the large presence of SOEs limiting competition. The Project ultimately intends to contribute to attenuating the potential flight to quality, or a retrenchment of banks from the SME financing markets, given the higher risk profile of the segment. Daycoval actively participates in the government programs to serve SMEs, while it especially tries to reach beyond general SMEs expanding into underserved segments. In particular, the Project aims to expand into the underserved regions, where the credit penetration was already lower than the national average in the pre-crisis period. The Project will encourage the other banks to go down the market to increase their exposure to SMEs from the underserved regions.

title: Bansicredi CL Gr
content: Project Outcome:Stakeholders effect - Increased access to climate finance: IFC expects that this Project will increase access to finance for climate finance in Brazil specifically through the engagement with the agriculture and energy sectors. Brazil is ranked as the 13th largest emitter in 2018  with 457MtCO2 per year and the agriculture and energy sectors are together responsible for over 60 percent of the GHG emission in Brazil. The Country is projected to continue to increase its emission stemming from the rapidly increasing agriculture production. Through the Project with IFC, Bansicredi will strengthen the operational capacity to better identify opportunities to expand its climate asset portfolio, promoting more sustainable agricultural practices. Bansicredi has an extensive reach in the rural areas and agribusinesses in Brazil, through which the Project will promote the sustainable practices in the agriculture production and the energy use. To measure the progress against this outcome, IFC will track the number and volume of outstanding climate-smart loans.Market Creation:Sustainability: IFC expects that the Project will contribute to an increased sustainability of the Brazilian financial sector by introducing a green funding instrument to finance green assets. An increased sustainability will be fostered via demonstration and replication, and innovation. IFC aims at achieving this via its partnership with Bansicredi, who will introduce a GLP certified funding, a first time use in the Brazilian financial sector. GLP compliant loans give transparency and comfort to the investors, as the principles provide clarification and guidance on use of proceeds permitted, process for evaluation and selection of assets, management of projects, and reporting. This way, the GLP effectively helps investors avoid opportunities that are "green washed". At the same time, GLP compliant loans may be more economically attractive for smaller institutions, for whom bond issuances are not a viable option.

title: AltumCP II
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) an increase in access to finance for MSMEs, and (ii) an increase in the availability of climate finance by providing alternative sources of long-term financing to well performing SMEs and NBFIs. AltumCP provides direct loans to SMEs and enables NBFIs to on-lend to underserved and constrained MSMEs. Beyond the Project-level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the investment will contribute to market creation by improving environmental sustainability by establishing international green lending principles in the climate finance segment. Further, IFC expects this project to demonstrate the commercial viability of climate lending to SMEs and therefore encourage replication through alternative funding channels, such as debt funds.

title: Brandix Apparel Limited
content: At the project level, it is expected to support the Group sustain its operations to counter the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic whilst preserving jobs in Sri Lanka. The Project will also ensure continued production of high value added items and foreign exchange earnings to support the Sri Lankan economy. At the market level, the Project will help to protect exports growth and promote resilience whilst limiting disruptions along the domestic and global supply chain.

title: GHP RSE Nobel
content: Access to Pharmaceuticals: IFC will support Nobel to continue supplying high quality medication to around 50 countries. Nobel's sales are largely in Europe and Central Asia with a focus on countries such as Turkey, Bulgaria, Ukraine, Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, and Kosovo. Job Preservation: IFC will support job preservation during this unprecedent time at Nobel, which has more than 1,500 employees in Turkey.Resilience: IFC will promote resilience of the Turkish pharmaceuticals market through supporting a leading local drug maker during a pandemic. With Covid-19, the market is under significant strain as service providers face depleted supplies. IFC's support to Nobel will contribute towards strengthening the local supply chain.

title: Continuum Green
content: The project will contribute towards long term sustainability of the power sector with wider stakeholder effects and demonstrated competitiveness of C&I segment.

title: GTFP United Ethi
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs. On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels.  It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: GTFP Dashen Ethi
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs. On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels.  It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: RSE Bel Ga MM
content: By sustaining the Company's operations, the project helps to accelerate the 4-party business model that will insulate farmers from short-term price fluctuations during uncertain times. At the market level, the project helps to create a stable market by providing commercial farmers with the necessary fixed inputs, technical support and a fixed offtake at the end of the production cycle.

title: Farpoint Indo
content: IFC's financing will increase the supply of quality affordable housing in Indonesia, especially in the Greater Jakarta and Java area, and mainly for the growing population of young families and millennials aspiring to acquire their first assets.  IFC anticipates that the Project will enhance physical connectivity of the project sites to the nearby big city such as Jakarta city center, attracting residential population that will generate critical mass to help transform the areas.  Furthermore, the Project is expected to have a demonstration effect on the sustainable green building aspect for affordable housing projects.

title: Salt Equity I
content: The main project-level outcomes are: (i) increased access to growth capital for underserved SMEs in Southern Africa (ii) investee growth, which will be supported by the Fund Manager's value creation strategies; and (iii) contribution to market creation by supporting the Fund Manager to catalyze investors for the domestic private equity industry.

title: Truck Lagbe
content: Expected development impact includes:(i) Improved access to affordable quality logistics services for shippers(ii) Increased competitiveness of the logistics services sector in Bangladesh(iii) Increased formal business opportunities for truck drivers, potentially resulting in increased incomes

title: Blue Sail
content: Project-level: (i) increase access to quality and affordable medical consumerables; and (ii) create employment opportunities and economic linkages with additional gross value added. Market creation: enhance resilience of healthcare supply chains in emerging markets.

title: Evoca WCS Loan
content: The Project is expected to provide and sustain access to finance for MSMEs affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in Armenia, as well as promote greater MSME market resilience by sustaining access to working capital for MSMEs during and post-pandemic time.

title: GTST AESA WAF20
content: The Project is expected to have a strong development impact on supporting and ensuring the supply of energy products for IDA countries in West Africa, primarily in Benin, Cote d'Ivoire, Senegal and Sierra Leone. Disruptions in the supply of energy products would acutely affect the functioning of key industries and more generally the macroeconomic stability and GDP growth of the IDA countries benefiting from this Project. The Project also supports regional integration by keeping trade routes and channels open in West Africa stretching into Central Africa, especially to those landlocked.

title: EthioChicken ETB
content: Project level impact: (i) Benefits for rural consumers through better access to affordable poultry products in a market where access to protein and micronutrients is limited; (ii) Expansion in income opportunities for the poultry agents; and (iii) Improvement in skills and capacity building for female farmers to improve their sales and profitability (with the support of IFC's advisory work). Market level impact: Promotion of the inclusiveness of the formal poultry market by expanding the use of the appropriate breed and business model that is tailored to the needs of the Base of the Pyramid (BOP) farmers and consumers throughout Sub-Saharan Africa through demonstration and replication, potentially laying the foundation for the adoption of contract farming/outgrower models in the longer term.

title: upGrad 2021
content: IFC anticipates that the Project would result in increased access to upskilling services, potentially resulting in higher employability and income for the learners and improved productivity for businesses. Furthermore, the Project has the potential to maintain the competitiveness of the higher education sector in India by inducing other online education platforms and institutions to up their game through innovation, thereby maintaining the growth of the online education segment, beyond the Company.

title: Agrocorp Oway
content: At the Project level, the Project is expected to enable indirect job creation for ride-hailing company drivers through the provision of three-wheelers. These jobs will be open to a wider group of potential employees than traditional ride-hailing business models, due to the flexible way of accessing vehicles through a 3-year leasing arrangement. The drivers will also benefit from higher wages than similar jobs within the same sector. At the Market level, the Project is expected, through demonstration effects, to promote adoption of business practices that expand or improve reach to the underserved in Myanmar. Under Oway's model, the financial cost associated with being a driver is no longer a hurdle to access the employment opportunity.

title: Bergman Ross I
content: Stakeholders: The Project will address domestic shortage of diagnostic medical imaging facilities in Ghana. These facilities play a key role in the provision of health care and allow for the effective treatment of cancer and respiratory illnesses, for example. The quality of imaging will be ensured because BRI, a leading South African Diagnostic Medical Imaging Services Company, will train staff in Ghana in operating and managing complex medical imaging machinery based on global best practices.Competitiveness: The Project will introduce and strengthen access to world-class medical diagnostic imaging facilities in Accra, thereby, improving the quality of locally available diagnostic facilities by facilitating the entry of a higher quality provider.

title: Dolma II
Kampong Solar
content: The main expected project-level outcomes are the environmental impact by reduction of CO2 emissions during generation and the stakeholder impact by helping address growing energy demand in Cambodia. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected increase market resilience and competitiveness by supporting one of the country's first solar auctions and demonstrating the role of utility-scale solar projects in the country's electricity generation mix.

title: WCS Crisis Response BRAC Bank
content: This proposed Project is estimated to provide ~US$100 million of liquidity in aggregate over the maximum life of the Project (up to 2 years) to BRAC Bank, which will then on lend to up to 60 or more export-import based corporate and SME customers and support critical sectors like RMG/textile, Power, Pharma, Chemical, Edible Oil etc. By sustaining the Banks' ability to provide these services, IFC's proposed facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Bangladesh. Turbulence in global funding markets, among other factors, has made it difficult for the extensive network of clients and partner banks to maintain their role as an enabling platform for liquidity to multiple emerging markets, many experiencing their own acute liquidity shocks while the need for liquidity increases. IFC expects the facility to attract additional private sector investors and partners to support emerging market liquidity, strengthening the market's ability to absorb shocks imposed by the current crisis.

title: Vatia S.A. ESP
content:
Project-level Outcomes- The Project  is expected to improve energy affordability to end-users as large utility companies tend to charge undifferentiated rates or capacity charges to their clients. On the other hand, retailers tend to provide customized offers, which can initiate a change in consumption patterns such as higher off-peak consumption. Off-peak consumption reduces the need for total peak capacity in the country, eventually decreases the need for standby thermal plants, and thereby reduces the associated charges included in end-user tariffs. IFC  also expects the Project to support the country's climate mitigation agenda by improving access to cleaner energy more competitively and efficiently, thereby displacing high polluting, inefficient, and more expensive thermal generation and hence reduce associated carbon emissions.

Contribution to Market Creation- IFC's support to Vatia is expected to demonstrate energy retail companies like Vatia (beyond the incumbent large utility companies) can act as off-takers to renewable energy projects outside of the auction schemes, providing competition on price and service quality on the customer side, while reconciling the long-term certainty needs of renewable energy developers with the short-term certainty needs of end-customers. This is expected to promote renewable energy penetration and hence contributing towards the  country's energy supply diversification.

title: Coopbank Tier II
content: Project Outcomes:i) Stakeholder effects - Increase in accessibility of finance for MSMEsContribution to Market Creation:i) Resilience: The project is part of a broader IFC FIG's initiative to strengthen the capital base of leading and regionally important banks in Kenya, which is expected to result in systemic improvements in institutions that will contribute to financial market stability and help the market withstand shocks by boosting capital adequacy.ii) Integration: The Project is expected to contribute to an increase in financial integration in the SME finance market through the promotion of replicable instruments such as Basel II Tier II capital to raise funds for SME banking.

title: OCL Malawi
content: The Project is expected to increase access to digital connectivity for end-users in Malawi by deploying fiber for increased access and improved service quality and indirectly by increasing the capacity of the broadband network. This will be further enhanced by the construction of the first Tier III data center in Malawi, which will result in increased availability of data storage capacity in the country, with the potential to enhance productivity growth for businesses and increase access to digital services for individuals. Beyond the Project, the investment will contribute to creating a competitive market for digital connectivity in the country and create a market for cloud computing.

title: UzPSB Debt
content: -	Stakeholder Effect - Increased Access to Finance to SMEs and Climate Finance: As part of the privatization, UzPSB will significantly scale up its business with privately-owned enterprises, including financing of SMEs and climate finance project. The advisory support provided to the Bank will help create strategy, product offering, operational and risk frameworks for these segments, and dedicated funding will further support refinement of these business lines.-	Market Creation Effect - Competitiveness: Through the broad IFC engagement, UzPSB is expected to position itself as an exemplary and leading universal bank in the country. Its impending privatization will pave the way for other local banks which are expected to adopt some of the best practices promoted by UzPSB. This will ultimately lead to the increase of the private sector share in the Uzbekistan financial services market.

title: Provident Housing
content:
1)  The Project will increase supply of high-quality housing units at reasonable prices and contribute towards bridging the housing gap in India. Majority of the housing projects being developed as part of the Project are expected to be Affordable Housing (as defined in the Harmonized Master List of Infrastructure sub-sectors issued by India's Ministry of Finance).
2) Growing economic activity and creating jobs is essential, especially to minimize the economic consequences of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Project will create direct and indirect jobs resulting from the construction of housing units.
3) Incremental demonstration effect by strengthening operations of a successful market player in a fragmented, inefficient market.

title: SP River CleanUp
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are the stakeholder impact from increasing access to sewage network and wastewater treatment by tackling the financial constraints of WESCOs, as well as the ensuing environmental impact by reducing the amount of untreated wastewater and associated pollutants discharged into the Pinheiros river basin. Beyond the proposed investment, IFC anticipates that this investment will promote market competitiveness with strong demonstration effects of supporting the implementation of PBCs to leverage the expertise of the private sector in the wastewater sector. Successful implementation of the proposed investment is expected to attract private sector developers in the wastewater sector in Brazil by demonstrating the feasibility and bankability of similar projects.

title: FHIPO Loan II
content: IFC's support will enable FHipo to expand the scale of its investments, by increasing the amount of residential mortgage portfolios acquired by them. This in turn is expected to have the following impacts: i) Residential mortgages originators will be benefited by obtaining access to liquidity and funding diversification to increase their operations, and, consequently, increasing the number of families being able to get mortgage financing; ii) investors will benefit since the project will contribute to a wider availability of impact investment opportunities in the capital markets and iii) enhancing Fintech mortgage market in Mexico through FHipo's partnership with Smart Lending. The project will also have stakeholder impact as it will i) increase access to housing finance for formal sector workers that are currently un(der)served by commercial lenders; and (ii) complement the public sector's effort in addressing the severe shortage of affordable housing. Additionally, environmental impact is also expected, as the Project will contribute to reducing 1,300 tons of CO2 emissions per year by funding mortgages with energy savings potential.

title: Stellaris Venture Partners India Trust II
content: The Fund is focused on non-manufacturing early stage technology startups in India. Activities to be supported by this investment are expected to have minimal or no adverse environmental or social impacts. Hence, the project is categorized as Category FI-3 in accordance with IFC's Environmental and Social Sustainability Policy. The project will not support coal related or higher risk activities. This is an existing client with an existing E&S risk management system (ESMS) and E&S officer responsible for implementation. The current ESMS will be required to be applied for this project as well. Applicable requirements will include IFC Exclusion List and relevant national E&S laws and regulations if they exist and are applicable.

title: Nyva Expansion
content: Construction of new farms will improve consumer access to quality pork at the time when the industry is facing serious biosecurity risks.

title: Umm Qasr
content: The Project will increase the port's container handling capacity facilitating Iraq's trade growth with the Middle east region as well as the further afield countries. The additional capacity and equipment will introduce operational efficiencies leading to a faster ship turnaround. The Project will also improve the port infrastructure in Iraq facilitating international integration and trade. This is particularly important given the expected increase in imports amid the reconstruction of Iraq after years of armed conflict.

title: CHO Tunisia II
content:
CHO's overall goals through this Project are its contribution to preserving linkages with farmers, maintaining jobs, and domestic value addition. 
The Project's contribution to market resilience will be through building capacity along the supply chain, demonstrating improved business practices to other sector players, and enabling positive spillovers across the sector by maintaining operations during a tumultuous economic period.

title: Actera III add
content: Project Outcomes- Stakeholder: Access to growth capital for Fund investees: The Fund, while maintaining a generalist strategy, will provide access to much needed long-term equity capital for mid-market companies in Turkey.- Stakeholder: Increased Investee Growth: IFC expects the Fund to help in knowledge transfer and bring operational value-add to its investees.Contribution to Market Creation- Competitiveness: The project is expected to increase PE market activity in Turkey by demonstrating the viability of PE investments given the challenging fundraising environment.

title: GWFP Sofitex2020
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is continued access to markets and finance for over 32,889 farmers and increases in productivity for 1,557 farmers. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates the investment will increase integration and resilience in the cotton sector in Burkina Faso, a low income/IDA country, through capacity building and demonstration and replication effects.

title: DenizBank A.S.
content:
1) Increased access to MSME finance for agribusiness MSMEs in rural areas. IFC's financing through DenizBank will provide much needed financing to local MSMEs that are engaged in agriculture, part of which would be in rural areas. The project will also provide and sustain access to finance to MSMEs affected by the COVID-19 pandemic in Turkey. 
2) Enhance competitiveness and integration. The financing will be provided through structural finance that would provide demonstration effect for raising capital at scale from multiple investors through innovative instruments such as DPRs. Landmark transaction with scalable IFI contribution and in parallel other investors contribution affirms a positive market sentiment.

title: WCS COVID BNB
content: Under the Project IFC will provide and mobilize additional funding to support BNB-Bank's lending to its SME customers. This will help SMEs to sustain operations and to expedite their post-crisis recovery.

title: RSE COVID LAAD
content: By sustaining LAAD's operations, the project supports agribusiness companies in the face of increased financing needs and operational disruptions. By limiting supply disruptions, the project promotes resilience in the export-oriented agribusiness sector more broadly

title: Kioo Limited
content:
By supporting Kioo to sustain operations, IFC positions the private sector in Tanzania to contribute to economic recovery and improved market resilience in the regional beverages supply chain in which Kioo participates.

Development outcome indicators to be tracked for the duration of the IFC investment: employment (number of direct jobs); production volume; purchases from domestic suppliers; number of countries supplied.

title: Robi Axiata IV
content: The substantial project-level outcome is increased access to quality mobile connectivity. This investment will support market resilience by maintaining access to and quality of mobile connectivity during and after COVID-19

title: Launchub 2
content:
Project Outcomes: 
-	Stakeholders: Improved access to early stage capital and increased ability for startups to scale. 

Contribution to Market Creation 
-	Competitiveness: The project is expected to increase competitive pressures within the region's VC market by demonstrating the viability of VC investments.

title: Abacus II
content: The Project is expected to benefit patients from the increased availability of critical and safe medical products. The Project also has the potential to promote greater competitiveness in the market to supply medical products in Eastern Africa. IFC anticipates that the project will enable systemic changes to existing markets that deliver sustainable development impact by increasing competitiveness. The Project will contribute to the development of overall market by the virtue of Company's expansion and anticipated resultant pressure on low quality producers to improve quality.

title: MAS Capital II
content:
At the project level it is expected to support MCAP sustain its operations to counter the impact of the COVID19
pandemic whilst preserving jobs in Sri Lanka. The Project will also ensure continued production of high value added items and foreign exchange earnings to support the Sri Lankan economy.
At the market level, the Project will help to protect exports growth and promote resilience whilst limiting
disruptions along the domestic and global supply chain.

title: Zaporizhzhia Smart City
content: The project supports an investment program aimed at modernizing and improving efficiency of urban infrastructure in the city of Zaporizhzhia in Ukraine, with implications on access, quality and safety of service. The Project will modernize and improve public transport operations, as well as overhaul a street. This will improve the quality and safety of public transport. IFC expects the investment program to also contribute to lowering emissions, from introduction of new trolleybuses with autonomous running systems, updating rolling stock to more ecological standards, and providing stable energy supply to charging stations for e-buses and electric transport. Through IFC's advisory services, this engagement improves access to finance, by helping the City to establish a credit rating. At a market level, the Project pilots an IFC "Smart City" approach that improves competitiveness of the city, and could evolve into a scalable product and solution, with potential demonstration effects in Ukraine and other countries in the region. The Project also contributes to improve mobility and connectivity of the city's transportation network.

title: Guodong Tower
content:
1. Stakeholder impact: The Project helps increase the capacity of mobile networks by rolling out over 9,000 mobile towers shared by several operators to deploy 4G and 5G, resulting in improved quality of mobile internet access for individuals and businesses across nine of China's lowest income provinces. Further, against the background of poor representation of women in senior management positions in China, the Project is expected to increase the share of senior female managers employed by the Company by developing awareness of business case for women in leadership, as well as policies and practices aimed at increasing recruitment and retention of women across all levels of the organization.
2. Inclusiveness: The Project contributes to improve the inclusiveness of the Chinese digital economy by inducing expansion of 5G networks in the least connected provinces via demonstration and replication channels.
3. Resilience: The Chinese telecom tower market is dominated by a SOE and has limited diversity of supply for mobile network operators. The Project has the potential to incrementally strengthen the resilience of the market for mobile connectivity via competitive channels.

title: ABSA SL
content: The most significant, expected project-level effect is increased access to climate finance in South Africa. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that, through demonstration and capacity building, Absa's planned development of a climate risk assessment framework and disclosure initiatives will contribute towards the increased resilience of the South African banking sector to climate-related risks.

title: Monashees Exp
content: 1. Increased access to expansion stage equity and operational value add for technology companies in Latin America (mainly focused in Brazil). The Manager's strong reputation in Brazil means its companies have gone on to receive a large portion of all venture capital (VC) allocated to the region. For example, 33 percent in 2018 and 50 percent in 2019 of all VC dollars in Brazil went to its portfolio companies.  2. Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market disrupting digital business models: The Fund is supporting investees developing tech-led innovative solutions to disrupt various real sector business models. IFC expects this will increase competitiveness across markets in Brazil that are characterized by low productivity, poor efficiency and low competition. Through provision of expansion stage capital in a difficult fundraising environment, the Fund will significantly strengthen the ability of investee companies to reach sufficient scale and catalyze markets to respond to these competitive pressures. The Manager has demonstrated market creation through innovation and demonstration.  3. Increased competitiveness of Brazil's VC market, by catalyzing further the later stage venture segment through increased VC backed M&A and exits: IFC expects that by supporting this Fund, with its strong reputation in the market, its success will help increase the competitiveness of the later stage VC ecosystem in Latin America.

title: LH LAC III
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is increased access to mortgage including for low- to middle-income individuals in Panama, and increased access to mortgage in El Salvador. Fifty percent of IFC's use of proceeds will be earmarked to support women-headed households. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater gender inclusion in these markets through competitive pressure and the demonstration and replication channels.

title: NTL LCY Loan
content:
Project-Level Outcome: Stakeholder effects - increased access to finance for micro and small enterprises.
The project is expected to contribute towards addressing the financing gap on micro and small enterprises in the country, particularly in the less developed areas of Thailand where NTL has strong presence. The Project is expected to support NTL to grow its financial services to un(der)served micro and small enterprises and support their businesses. 

Market-Level Outcome: Inclusiveness 
The project is expected to contribute towards increasing access to quality financial services for the underserved segment in the country, have demonstration effect for efficient services with the use of technology and promote responsible finance practices among the NBFIs in Thailand.

title: Alfa Loan
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to finance for climate smart auto, as well as reduction in GHG emissions by increasing funding to acquire electric and flex-fuel cars. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will further contribute to market creation through improved sustainability by promoting green financing standards as well as capacity building based of IFC's support to monitor green loans and report GHG emission reductions.

title: Grupo Xcaret
content: Grupo Xcaret has been a prominent tourism operator in Cancun/Riviera Maya. IFC's financing will provide the needed additional liquidity to ensure that Xcaret can sustain the ongoing situation, support the reopening of parks and complete the construction of Hotel Xcaret Arte. IFC's financing will help to (i) preserve thousands of jobs and support future recruitment; (ii) finance the additional expenses needed for reopening; and (iii) maintain Xcaret's significant local value-chain.

title: City: Rupshi
content:
Food Security: The Project will contribute to improving Bangladesh's food security by supporting improved food safety standards and provide an alternative to the major staple, at competitive prices. The Project will support an increased production of flour that will meet growing domestic demand and partially replace informal mills with hygienic flour of superior quality.


    Employment and broader value creation: Through this investment, the Group will be able to expand its flour milling operations, and will create an estimated 250 direct jobs at Rupshi's facilities, accompanied by further indirect and induced jobs throughout the value chain. 


    Market creation: The Project will aid the formalization of the milling sector by increasing the size of the formal market and the expected partial displacement of the informal mills will promote better quality standards in the industry.

title: Sao Martinho Cogen
content: The project contributes to climate change mitigation by promoting the increase of renewable energy sales and supporting the production of biofuels. In addition, by supporting the ongoing capital requirements to maintain and replant sugarcane, the project contributes to keep the overall health of the industry.

title: DCM Kandeo COF
content: The Fund is expected to contribute to improved quality of finance for MMEs in Mexico, Colombia and Peru. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that the project will result in an increase in market competitiveness, given that it will contribute to the growth of the alternative debt funds market in Latin America.

title: Adumo
content:
Improved access and quality of payment services: The project will support the expansion of a comprehensive set of services targeted at South Africa's MSMEs to foster acceptance of offline and online payments, and to grow adoption of digital payments and services among customers and entrepreneurs.

Improved access to financial services and business management tools for merchants: The project will support the company build on its merchant acceptance platform and its data, to provide MSME merchants with access to financial and non-financial services to manage and grow their business. 

Inclusiveness: IFC anticipates that the project will promote inclusiveness in the payment services market in South Africa by demonstrating the viability of a business model providing access to electronic payments for underserved micro and small retailers.

title: Intelvision
content: The Project is expected to increase access to affordable quality digital connectivity for individuals and businesses in Seychelles by expanding the capacity of broadband networks through the deployment of a new submarine cable that will connect the country to the Eastern coast of Africa. The Project is also expected to increase competitiveness of the market for digital connectivity by leveling the playing field between the market players and potentially result in increased affordability of connectivity at the market level.

title: Monte Rosa Nicaragua
content: The Project will play an important role in supporting the Company's operations in an uncertain macroeconomic environment. The investment is safeguarding production as well as further improving operational practices. At the market level, IFC will support a sugar producer and exporter that will help strengthen the country's standing in the global market through the continuing adoption of IFC's Performance Standards and contribute to setting world class standards across the industry in Nicaragua.

title: Sofia Airport Cn
content: The main project level impact is expected to include the improved access and quality of civil aviation services in Bulgaria. The Project contributes to the expansion of Sofia Airport's passenger and cargo handling capacity as well as ground service offerings which is expected to improve operational efficiency and the quality of services. Additionally, the Project is expected to increase the GDP, employment and government revenues through its economic linkages with the production and service sectors, and the payment of concession fees and taxes. IFC is supporting the first competitively tendered large-scale PPP project following the adoption of Bulgaria's Law on Concessions in 2018, which demonstration effects for potential additional public private partnership projects within Bulgaria and the region. The Project is also expected to help to improve the financial resilience of a strategic asset in the aviation sector in Bulgaria, in the context of an unprecedented shock caused by the COVID crisis.

title: Indonesia Express Logistics
content: Through its investment in ASSA, IFC will support the growth of a technology-driven, e-commerce logistics provider in Indonesia, enabling the new venture to provide higher quality and more cost-efficient logistic solutions, and contribute to improved access and quality of service for a range of customers including e-commerce businesses as well as consumers.

title: HTA Debt
content: The project is expected to increase access to quality mobile connectivity for individuals and businesses in Senegal, and potentially across a number of other countries in Sub-Saharan Africa, by promoting shared digital infrastructure through the acquisition and roll out of new towers that will be shared by mobile operators under open access and non-discriminatory basis. The project is also expected to increase competitiveness of the market for mobile connectivity by enabling technological innovation through a faster roll out of high-speed mobile internet by all operators.

title: COVID CD Finance Loan
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is an increased access to finance for underserved MSEs in the rural areas of China, whose cashflow are severely impacted due to the COVID pandemic. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote Inclusiveness/Resilience via market-wide adoption of CD Finance's rural MSE lending model and encouraging more market participants to focus on the lending to unbanked and underbanked rural MSEs, as it will continue to support the Company to expand its reach, now by attracting additional private sector investors and partners to support these segments

title: Yuwell
content:
Project-level: (i) increase access to quality and affordable medical equipment; and (ii) create employment opportunities and economic linkages with additional gross value added.
Market creation: enhance resilience of healthcare supply chains in emerging markets.

title: WCS Crisis Response Union Bank Nigeria Plc
content: All projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis that, by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: WCS COVID NTB
content: By supporting the clients' capacity to sustain operations during an acute shock, IFC positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. The impact also comes from IFC's ability to respond promptly and sustained availability of output in times of crisis.

title: WCS COVID CARD
content:
By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. 

Project Outcome: By providing access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (emerging market financial institutions, and through them, their customers), the Project will support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery. The Project intends to provide up to PHP 500 million of liquidity to CARD Bank, which will then be on-lent to approximately 43,500 MSME clients.

Market Creation: By sustaining the ability to provide these services, IFC's facility is intended to promote jobs as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Philippines.

title: WCS COVID CSME
content: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. Project Outcome: By providing access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (emerging market financial institutions, and through them, their customers), the Project will support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery. The Project intends to provide up to PHP 250 million of liquidity to CARD SME, which will then be on-lent to approximately 17,750 MSME clients. Market Creation: By sustaining the ability to provide these services, IFC's facility is intended to promote jobs as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Philippines.

title: MUFG ECA GTLP
content: In the COVID-19 environment, this Project positions the private sector as key to support the economic recovery process during this acute shock, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. The Project Outcome will be realized by providing access to finance/liquidity to the ultimate beneficiaries, the Turkish exporters/importers to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery.

title: TBC Uzbekistan Equity
content: The most significant Project-level outcome is increased access to finance for underserved segments in the economy, namely mortgage borrowers, MSMEs, and other retail borrowers, which will comprise the entire loan book the TBC UZ.The project is expected to contribute to increased competitiveness of the banking sector through innovation, competition, and demonstration channels. Should TBC UZ prove successful, this will invite other private investors into the Uzbek banking sector. In addition, strong operational performance focused on modern branches and digital channels is expected to push traditional banks towards innovation and increased efficiency.

title: Lombard Asia V
content: Expected development impacts include:i) Access to growth capital for investee companiesii) Increased investee growth iii) Deepening private equity markets in Thailand and the Mekong region

title: Airport Almaty
content: IFC expects the Project to increase capacity at Kazakhstan's main international airport to accommodate the anticipated growth in passenger and cargo taffic, and indirect impact on growth and job creation through economic linkages. Project is also expected to improve quality of services through facilities upgrades, automation, passenger ancillary services and commercial offerings. At a market level, the Project contributes to improved competitiveness of the airports sector, from the introduction of an experienced private operator and envisaged improvements in operational performance standards. IFC expects the Project to also enhance integration, by supporting traffic growth at Kazakhstan's largest international airport and regional hub.

title: Central Termica de Temane
content: The Project is expected to increase the supply of low-cost electricity in Mozambique which helps to meet the growing domestic demand and supports implementation of the country's ambitious electrification program, with important economy wide effects. This investment is expected to support electricity access growth, with a focus on low-income households. The Project also contributes to optimizing system power generation costs in Mozambique. At the market level, IFC's proposed investment will deepen integration of the Southern African power market by increasing supply of affordable and reliable base-load energy that will improve liquidity on the regional competitive market.

title: Netafim India
content: The expected Project-level outcome is its contribution to generating better yields for the local farmers and strengthening their resilience to climate stocks. The Project in India may have larger benefit given the potential for creating impact at scale using the community irrigation model. The Project will also contribute to sustainability by promoting water used efficiency in agriculture in several water stressed regions.

title: NAVIS CLMV Co-Investment Fund, L.P.
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcomes include: (i) providing access to 6 to 8 mid-cap companies, including on the larger end of the mid cap segment, focused on businesses in CLMV countries, especially in the IDA countries (CLM), where access to private equity or traditional sources of capital is extremely limited; and (ii) increased investee growth, through the Fund manager's focus on improving operational efficiency and corporate best practices.

title: Bank Asia WCS CR
content: This proposed Project is estimated to provide ~US$110 million of liquidity in aggregate over the maximum life of the Project (up to 2 years) to Bank Asia, which will then on lend to up to 70 or more export-import based corporate and SME customers and support critical sectors like RMG/textile, Power, Pharma, Chemical, Edible Oil etc. By sustaining the Banks' ability to provide these services, IFC's proposed facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Bangladesh. Turbulence in global funding markets, among other factors, has made it difficult for the extensive network of clients and partner banks to maintain their role as an enabling platform for liquidity to multiple emerging markets, many experiencing their own acute liquidity shocks while the need for liquidity increases. IFC expects the facility to attract additional private sector investors and partners to support emerging market liquidity, strengthening the market's ability to absorb shocks imposed by the current crisis.

title: RSE COVID Jalles
content: By sustaining the Company's operations, the project helps consumers have continued access to hand sanitizer and ensures continuity of employment opportunities in a frontier region. By limiting supply disruptions, the project promotes resilience in the sugar and ethanol sector.

title: Sunshine
content:
At the Project-level, it is expected to: (i) displace tons of CO2 annually; (ii) help meet Sri Lanka's growing
electricity demand through a cost-competitive energy solution. At the Market-level, it is expected to (iii)
increase competitiveness in the FMCG sector by promoting diversification, and (iv) demonstrate a scheme
to scale-up rooftop solar capacity in the renewable energy sector.

title: ENDA SL IV
content: Project Outcomes Stakeholders effects: Increased access to climate finance for MSMEs under (i) climate smart agriculture (CSA), (ii) waste recycling, and (iii) solar PV. Furthermore, the project is expected to offer support in the development of sustainable practices by ENDA's clients within the MSME segment, which is traditionally underserved, especially with respect to climate financing. The Project is expected to contribute to GHG emissions reduction in Tunisia.Contribution to Market Creation Sustainability:  IFC anticipates that this investment will promote greater sustainability in the market by demonstrating to other lenders the viability of Climate Finance in Tunisia for solar PV, waste recycling, climate-smart agriculture products as well as EE projects.

title: Iulius Iasi
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is derived from stakeholder effects through improved access to high quality Grade A office buildings. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote greater market integration through the development of a new business center, which will provide more economic opportunities to the local population.

title: Indospace COVID-19 Debt
content:
(i) Economy-wide effects: By accelerating construction and development of parks as the Indian economy emerges from the COVID-19 crisis, the financing will enable preservation of thousands of jobs in construction of properties and ancillary / indirect jobs which would otherwise be lost. 

(ii) Contribution to Market Creation:
a.	Competitiveness: IFC anticipates that the Project will provide a significant positive step forward to the Indian warehousing and industrial property market, which is in its evolutionary phase and now going through a severe slowdown due to Covid-19. If the Fund is successful in developing and offering its properties in time for companies to set up operations, it will help demonstrate a path of recovery for the sector, relying on private investment and demonstrate to other players to replicate the Company's modern, efficient, and lower cost characteristics.
b.	Resilience: The Project will contribute to the resilience of real sector markets, through enabling business infrastructure that will ensure continued supply of goods and services at affordable prices and limiting disruptions along supply chains thereby mitigating the effects of the economic downturn.

title: Africinvest Fund IV LLC
content: Project Outcomes:- Stakeholder: Access to growth capital for Fund investees: The Fund, while maintaining a generalist strategy, will provide access to much needed long-term equity capital for mid-market companies in Africa.- Stakeholder: Increased Investee Growth: IFC expects the Fund to help in knowledge transfer and bring operational value-add to its investees.Contribution to Market Creation- Competitiveness: The project is expected to send a positive signal and demonstrate the sustainability of PE markets in the region

title: Eris Student Accomdation Newco
content: The most significant expected project-level impact is increased access to high quality student accommodation in the underserved South African student housing market. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote sector competitiveness by encouraging private expansion into the student accommodation market via demonstration effects.

title: FMF-KBC Senior Loan
content:
Project Outcomes: Stakeholder effects-increased access to finance for MSMEs.       
Market Creation:
1)	Inclusiveness: bridge the financing gap for the bottom-of-pyramid entrepreneurs who raised working capital by collateralizing their vehicles. 
2)	Resilience: facilitate FIs provide funding support their customers' operating cash flow to promote jobs as well as broader stability during Covid-19.

title: Kryvyi Rih Trams
content: Stakeholder - Customers: The Project will modernize obsolete tram network infrastructure to improve quality of service and urban mobility. The tram fleet renewal will introduce units that are compliant with best safety and accessibility standards and improve reliability of service that will benefit existing tram users. Environmental Effects: The Project will reduce the carbon footprint of the transport sector in Kryvyi Rih due to savings in energy consumption of the new tram fleet. Resilience: The project will increase urban transport resilience by tackling weaknesses that affect transport systems across Ukrainian cities and demonstrating ways of improving financial sustainability of municipal transport companies.

title: HSA Foods Yemen
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is the increased supply of staple goods in a country experiencing internal strife and high levels of food insecurity. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates its investment will improve market resilience by increasing food production, which builds capacity to withstand shocks and stresses related to COVID-19.

title: SANFER Col
content:
Potential rating: Satisfactory

Stakeholders- customers: IFC will promote access to affordable and quality pharmaceutical products by financing the construction of a new and larger manufacturing facility in Colombia. 

Economy wide effects: Through the construction of a new manufacturing facility in Colombia, the Project will have positive effects in terms of direct and indirect job creation as well as value addition.

Market effects: Competitiveness- The Project is expected to moderately improve market competitiveness in Colombia through improved scale and efficiency. Sanfer Colombia will also introduce cleaner production and improved quality standards relative to what is currently available.

title: WCS COVID I&M Rwanda
content: All projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis that, by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: GXYX ASF
content: The Project is assessed as part of IFC's overarching programmatic intervention (ASF Asia Recovery Program) to respond to the impacts of the ASF on the regional pork industry. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome resulting from this expansion is the impact on consumers from the provision of safe pork at the time of severe supply shortage as well as implementation of advanced biosecurity procedures at the new farms. The Project will also strengthen the operations of smaller farmers by disseminating best industry practices through the Company's out-grower scheme. At the market level, the Project, alongside other planned investment and advisory interventions, is expected to promote market resilience through improvement of biosecurity and disease management, both by supporting industry consolidation and disseminating best practices among smaller players.

title: RFF ACEP Burkina SL
content:
-	Project Outcomes 
Stakeholders effects: improved access to finance for MSMEs, rural/agri MSMEs - in the context of bridging finance gap for MSMEs (incl. WMSMEs and agri-MSMEs located in rural areas) by deploying (i) its products and services and (ii) access to scarce medium- to long-term finance.
-	Contribution to Market Creation 
Inclusiveness: by demonstrating to other FIs the viability of product offerings and digital channels that meet the funding needs of rural and agri MSMEs in remote locations.

title: IVL Thailand
content:
Economywide effects: The Project will restore the lost economic value of valuable PET resources through a circular economy of PET waste and create employment. 

Stakeholder effects: The Project will increase PET recycling capacity in targeted emerging markets to meet the growing demand for recycling PET in food and beverage applications.

Environmental effects: The Project is expected to divert PET waste from land and marine environment through recycling. The Project is also expected to reduce Greenhouse Gas (GHG) intensity through replacing virgin PET with recycled PET, and implementation of other sustainability projects such resource efficiency and renewable energy.

Sustainability: The Project will  promote a circular economy for PET bottles and catalyze the changes in the market by demonstrating innovative business models and best practices, and through capacity building.

title: RKF COVID Response
content:
Stakeholder effects: IFC's financing will sustain the Company's ability to maintain operations and be in a better position to deliver goods and services to the commercial vehicles and railways segments during the recovery period as the crisis abates. IFC's financing will also help to preserve more than 1,700 direct jobs as well as indirect jobs across the supply chain during crisis.
Resilience: The proposed investment promotes the resilience of the Company through supporting the sustainability of domestic manufacturing of forging components at competitive prices, supplying the essential products to the economy-critical industries such as commercial vehicles and railways.

title: WCS COVID Santander Brasil
content: All IFC projects under IFC's COVID-19 WCS Crisis Response Facility share the same development thesis: by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: ETG Term Facility
content: IFC expects the Project will help strengthen financial and value-chain integration, provide working capital financing for smallholder farmers as a result of ETG's procurement activities; and bring about price discovery in the market place.

title: Logos Indo 2020
content: The most significant Project-level outcome is its effect on customers who will benefit from modern and high-quality warehouses that will help support their business expansion and growth in Indonesia. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater competitiveness in Indonesia's warehousing sector by introducing new concept of modern warehouses catalyzing other developers to raise their standards and improving efficiency.

title: WCS COVID Crisis Response BCP Bolivia
content: By supporting BCPB's capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: WCS COVID Ineco
content: IFC will support  its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC will provide access to finance Inecobank's MSME clients to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning activity.

title: RFF ACEP Senegal SL II
content:
-	Project Outcomes 
Stakeholders effects: improved access to finance for MSMEs, rural/agri MSMEs - in the context of bridging finance gap for MSMEs (incl. WMSMEs and agri-MSMEs located in rural areas) by deploying (i) its products and services and (ii) access to scarce medium- to long-term finance.
-	Contribution to Market Creation 
Inclusiveness: by demonstrating to other FIs the viability of product offerings and digital channels that meet the funding needs of rural and agri MSMEs in remote locations.

title: RSE COVID DCM
content:
(i)Employment: IFC's financing will also help to add  approx. 100 permanent skilled jobs and 250 temporary jobs and preserve 800 temporary jobs during construction, as a result of the expansion. 
(ii) Supply chain: The expansion will ensure the availability of caustic soda at competitive prices, and key raw materials to downstream industries such as aluminum, paper, detergents, agro-chemicals, and pharmaceuticals. 
(iii) Resilience: IFCs investment is intended to promote the resilience of real sector markets, by ensuring continued supply of goods and services in sectors affected by reduced demand, price reductions and exchange rate volatility thereby mitigating the effects of the economic downturn. The chemicals sector, an important sector in India is already exposed to the effects of severe supply chain disruptions and slowing economic growth

title: DCM FDC Gender
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is increased access to finance for MSMEs as well as increased access to finance for WOEs. Beyond the project level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the investment would promote greater inclusiveness via demonstration and replication channels to increase access to finance to women and rural areas of El Salvador. Through this Project, FDC hopes to further standardize its operations across the  country, expand its footprint into underserved segments (rural, women), and establish the viability of lending to these segments with customized products and enhanced interoperability, which could spur the pace of financial inclusion in El Salvador for the rural poor and women enterprises, which currently face disproportionately more constraints.

title: ENA 2020
content: The most significant project level outcomes are the improved quality of electricity supply and reduced grid emissions, through the modernization of key distribution assets and equipment. At the market level, IFC anticipates the Project will improve resilience of electricity supply by reducing distribution losses and introducing ICT solutions that enable ENA to improve their monitoring of the network.

title: AWC Green Loan
content:
1) Job Creation: In terms of local employment, IFC expects the Project to create several direct jobs for the two new hotels such as receptionists, cleaners, security, restaurant workers as well as the indirect jobs in the hotel's supply chain and related linkages such as taxi companies and tour guides. It is expected that [XX%] will be female employment.
2) Domestic suppliers: The Project will also include refurbishments of old hotels, improving the quality of buildings and service offerings, which is in line with the Thai Ministry of Sports and Tourism and the Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT)'s objective of shifting Thailand's offering from "mass-market, quantity" to "high-value, quality".  Local suppliers of goods and services will benefit from greater demand for higher volume and from demand for better quality products and services that allow for greater value added. Close to 100% of AWC suppliers are domestic.  
3) Effect on employees: On average, 60 hours of training will be provided to a hotel employee. The training is given all staff, even hourly employees, and includes essential skill and knowledge areas such as culinary, rooms operation and purchasing, as well as other discipline-specific skills in finance, HR, IT, loss prevention, marketing and sales.  In addition, most of the international hotel brands which AWC use are committed to developing people.  Managerial staff participate in management training programs. . By upskilling its employees, AWC will contribute to the mobility of these employees who can progress to higher level jobs in the same company or move to other companies in the services sector. 
4) Effect on sourcing: Thailand's hotel supply chain is made up of many small and medium size enterprises (SMEs) including small manufacturing companies and smallholder farmers linked to the hotel food and beverage and procurement value chain. AWC estimates that it procures around 30% from local SMEs including give examples. AWC has worked with local suppliers to improve the quality to meet the standards of the renown global hotel operators such as Marriott, Le Meridien, Hilton and Sheraton.

title: RSE COVID WIOCC
content: The Project is expected to increase the capacity of broadband networks by upgrading its submarine and terrestrial cables in response to COVID-19. IFC expects the Project to help promote greater market resilience by enabling retail network operators maintain access to and quality of digital connectivity during the crisis. IFC is providing access to new long-term financing that is not readily available in today's market as a result of COVID. The pandemic induced large outflows of capital from emerging markets, including several African countries served by the Company, with delayed access to finance, particularly for the Company.

title: WCS COVID Abank
content: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC supports the private sector in the economic recovery process, shortening the time for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: ISC-Carao
content: (i) Increased access to early stage equity and increased ability for startups to scale operations and receive follow on funding. Central America has a very large gap in access to venture capital. (ii) The Fund is expected to increase market competitiveness by developing the local start-up ecosystems and initial building blocks for venture capital markets in the region.

title: RSE COVID CIEL HEALTHCARE LIMITED
content:
The Project will provide a signaling effect to the market to encourage investment and potential partnerships with global healthcare companies to support businesses struggling due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The Project will help the Company in maintaining acceptable level of operations so as to satisfy demand for healthcare services in Uganda and will also allow its non-profitable programs to continue without any interruptions. 

By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: COCAL_Bio
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcomes are its positive environmental effects from increased ethanol and biogas production as well as renewable energy sales. The positive effects of the project on local economy and the environment are somewhat dampened by the effective subsidy on ethanol as compared to gasoline that implies an economic loss to consumers. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that the investment has the potential to improve the agricultural practices at the sector level and contribute to further strengthening its competitiveness.

title: KINGUELE AVAL HYDRO
Nedbank Green Loan
content: The most significant, expected project-level effect is increased access to climate finance in South Africa. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that through demonstration and capacity building, Nedbank's planned development of a climate risk assessment framework and disclosure initiatives, will contribute towards the increased resilience of the South African banking sector to climate-related risks.

title: UZ Scaling Solar
content: The most significant project level outcome is a reduction in carbon emissions of Uzbekistan.  The solar PV plant is expected to displace aging and energy intensive thermal power generation in the merit order of dispatch and increase electricity supply from a renewable source at a competitive tariff. By supporting the development of the first utility scale solar PV IPP procured under the Scaling Solar framework, the Project demonstrates a competitive replicable model to scale solar PV in Uzbekistan that will catalyze private sector in a market with limited IPP track record, reinforce a new market structure with increased IPP participation, and improve resilience through the diversification of Uzbekistan's electricity generation mix with low-cost renewable energy generation.

title: LBX Loan
content: The most significant expected Project-level effect is improved access to affordable, quality pharmaceutical products, job creation in frontier region and equal career opportunities to females. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater market competitiveness via competition channels.

title: WCS COVID DTBKE
content: By supporting its client's capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. Investments will quickly provide financial institutions' clients with lines for trade finance, working capital, and risk mitigation solutions to help maintain trade flows, continue lending, support employment and help mitigate the expected global economic slowdown as a result of COVID-19.

title: Evolving Eur I
content: Expected development impact through:(i) providing access to private equity capital to SME and mid-cap companies in SEE, ex-Yugoslavia and CEE regions; and(ii) increased investee growth, through the Manager's control-oriented strategy focused on improving operational efficiency and corporate governance.

title: Blue Nile
content:
The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) employee skills and know-how development from the introduction of the first galvanized wire plant in Kenya, (ii) customer benefits via improved quality galvanized wire available at quicker supplier terms, and, (iii) economy-wide and employment effects with import substitution of imported galvanized wire, creation of 53 new direct jobs for the Project, and estimated creation of 310 indirect and induced jobs in the Company's value chain.

Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will have a strong effect on sector competitiveness and on the integration of the manufacturing sector in Kenya through the building of manufacturing capabilities and enhancing economic complexity.

title: ElCat
content:
Project Outcomes: The Project Outcomes rating is Very Strong with Medium Likelihood of achievement.  The most significant expected Project-level Outcomes are derived from increased access to high-speed broadband networks by enabling the connection of a significant number of mobile broadband users to antennas with fiber optic transmission lines, and directly connecting additional households to fiber broadband internet at home, including subscribers in underserved areas with no access to fixed broadband, thereby enabling digital inclusion and improving the quality of internet access for individuals. This network expansion has the potential to drive higher usage of digital connectivity and services by individuals, businesses and government as data-intensive contents like video streaming, conferencing and calls are becoming increasingly central to online interactions.

Market Creation: The Contribution to Market Creation rating is Moderate with Medium Likelihood of achievement. The Contribution to Market Creation is derived from increased competitiveness of the broadband sector, as the investment will support a company in a market with a limited number of large private sector providers and significantly deepen the high-speed internet access segment via competition channels.

The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good.

title: RSE COVID Agrofertil Ext
