content: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: Biological E II
content:
1. People reached: The Project will increase the availability of affordable vaccines which can prevent potentially fatal diseases and contribute towards reduction in mortality levels.

2. Building domestic manufacturing capacity: By growing within India, BioE will contribute to promoting the development of the country's private sector and overall economic growth through its manufacturing facilities. The expansion of the domestic manufacturing capacity of the Company fits with the "Make in India" initiative launched by the government to make India a destination for production of goods and to boost the national economy.

3. Direct and indirect employment creation: Through this investment, the Company will be able to expand its operations and create additional high-quality jobs in India. 

4. Research and Development: The Company invests significantly in Research and Development which is key to building a pipeline of products for under-met medical needs. The Company plans to launch several new products in India and other developing countries over the next five years.

title: Apeel Science
content: IFC anticipates that the Project would result in increased exports of fruits and vegetables and GHG emission avoidance, achieved by deploying at scale an edible plant-derived coating that extends the shelf-life of fruits and vegetables, thereby reducing food losses. Furthermore, the Project has the potential to strengthen the integration of local suppliers, especially from Mexico, into the international, and potentially local, fruits and vegetables value chains.

title: Otosan
content: The Project's expected development includes: (i) economywide and employment effects; (ii) skills/know-how development via increased technical jobs and skills development, and (iii) promotion of sector integration via product and process innovation and increasing manufacturing complexity.

title: GTFP AL KURAIMI
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets. The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs. On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels. It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: Vinte 2020
content: IFC will position Vinte to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.Project level impact:- Stakeholder effects: By providing a $20m A loan IFC will alleviate Vinte's cash needs for the next 18 months should the COVID-19 crisis extend beyond 2020 while allowing the company to maintain its existing credit standing and keep its workforce as well as ready to continue with the construction once the stay-at-home order is lifted. The project outcome will be realized through the effects on employees of Vinte who will stay on the Company's payroll, the effects on suppliers through continued demand once construction can resume, and the effects on customers as more housing supplies a high-quality developer like Vinte will be available, narrowing the supply-demand gap and generating equity value to homeowners.- Economy-wide effects: This Project will create over 1,400 direct jobs both during construction and operation of the housing communities. The Project will increase demand for construction and building materials in Mexico. Once construction is completed, housing units will stimulate the use of local supplies of goods and services, supporting maintenance, retailing and wholesaling operations.Contribution to Market Creation: - Resilience: The Project will contribute to the resilience by limiting disruptions along supply chains and ensuring continued supply of goods and services in the sectors affected by reduced demand, price reductions and FX volatility thereby mitigating the effects of the economic downturn.- Competitiveness: The first implementation of ASHA and READ tools will contribute to more socially sustainable housing projects in Mexico and LAC through demonstration and replication, as well as contribute to more competitive market by reducing the information asymmetry between home developers and banks on the sustainability and value of homes.

title: WCS COVID ProCredit Holding
content: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this shock, IFC supports the private sector in the economic recovery process, shortening the time for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: Linyang Grid-Parity Solar
content:
(i) Environmental effects: reduce the GHG footprint of the electricity sector 
(ii) Stakeholder effects: meet increasing electricity demand at a competitive tariff in targeted provinces
(iii) Competitiveness: support the country's transition from the subsidized FiT regime to grid-parity projects and demonstrate the role of private sector investment in the state dominated generation space

title: RSE COVID Jointown
content:
Project Outcome
Employees - Most of Jointown's warehouses and distribution centers are mainly located in frontier regions. While layoffs are being anticipated in a number of sectors in China in view of the worsening global economic conditions, Jointown will continue to hire more staff given the growing demand for health-related services, along with the coming on stream of its various new or upgraded facilities.

Contribution to Market Creation
Resilience - Health sector, specifically pharmaceutical distribution sub-sector, is the most needed sector during the COVID-19 pandemic. Jointown and peer companies play an important role in ensuring reliable and timely delivery services of essential supplies to hospitals and clinics, thereby supporting the healthcare system to be able to continue its operations.

title: JKH Services
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the economy-wide effects from direct and indirect job creation as well as skill development training programs the Company provides to its employees, farmers and other suppliers. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater competitiveness by expanding modern retail in Sri Lanka especially in secondary provinces, which will stimulate increased competition, improved labor force, and better industry practices.

title: RSE Nyva CL
content:
The Project has an
AIMM rating of Good, based on an AIMM score of 53.
Project Outcomes: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is
contribution to the domestic food security and better consumer outcomes by
increasing production of safely produced meat. Contribution to Market Creation:
The Project will promote sector resilience by limiting disruptions along the
pork supply chain.

title: CBC Equity & Gender DPR
content: Stakeholder Effects: The project is expected to contribute positively to job creation by improving access to finance for SMEs, particularly in semi-urban areas, which will be accompanied by an advisory services program.

title: RSE Crisis Response Reve
content: IFC's Real Sector COVID-19 Facility is intended to promote the resilience of real sector markets, by ensuring continued supply of goods and services at affordable prices and limiting disruptions along supply chains thereby mitigating the effects of the economic downturn. All IFC projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. The Project will strengthen the Reve Group ability to meet surging demand of low-priced essential goods, to ensure continued access to supply, and to resume expansion when the situation improves.

title: MCS Covid
content:
The Covid-19 pandemic and the various quarantine restrictions imposed by the government (including restricting border access, limiting mineral exports which are key to Mongolia's export earnings) has negatively impacted several of MCS' business lines. These include (i) a drop in patient volumes at Intermed Hospital (ii) reduction in consumer spending impacting the FMCG divisions (iii) rental payment deferral requests from tenants at the group's commercial and residential properties; and (iv) suspension or postponement of some construction projects due to curfews, travel/border restrictions.
The proposed loan will support MCS's capacity to sustain operations and employment during the downturn and expedite post-crisis recovery. In addition, the loan will have a positive effect on (i) employees of the highly affected businesses; and (ii) customers (tenants) through deferring payments, rent relief, and improving working capital terms. 
All IFC projects that are designed to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic share the same development thesis: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: Unimetco
content:
1-	Employment Creation: The Project is estimated to create 120 direct jobs Emerging Markets.  Furthermore, over 4,000 indirect and induced jobs along the value chain are expected to be created.   
2-	Value Chain Creation: Unimetco intends to source its raw materials locally / regionally based on availability. Increasing import substitution is expected to boost local production in appliances, adhesives and footwear sectors.
3-	SME Creation: The expansion plan is expected to contribute to SMEs' growth under transportation, logistics and other services.
4-	Climate Change Impact: The Project will mitigate climate impact through (i) use of PET scrap in its production, and (ii) production of insulation products promoting overall energy efficiency.
5-	Fiscal Benefits: The Project will lead to positive fiscal impacts on host countries through taxes paid and support in foreign trade balance from decreased imports and increased exports.

title: BML Loan I
content: Stakeholders impact: The Project will provide the financing required to support the tourism-related businesses, including those SMEs in the tourism value chain, with their working capital requirements, and to expedite their post crisis recovery. The Bank has designed a working capital financing program to support the sector in the wake of the COVID-19 crisis, and the Project will extend the Banks's effort to this critical sector, which would, in turn, have a positive cascade to related value chains.Market Impact: BML is the largest bank in Maldives and has significant presence across the economy, reaching the majority of private sector in the critical tourism sector. By supporting the largest financial institution for the private sector, the Project is supporting market resilience during the COVID-19 pandemic. The Project will help preserve the financial sector's ability to support the economic recovery effort as conditions normalize.

title: GTFP Union PLC
content: 1.	Rebuilding Confidence in the Market  Due to the current economic crisis as a result of Covid-19, and the drop in crude oil price, most correspondent banks are freezing their existing lines and/or reducing their exposure to Nigerian banks. The engagement with Union Bank will send a positive signal in general, to investors and other international financiers.2.	Increasing Trade in an IDA Country - Increasing supply of capital and consumer goods in an IDA country, leading to jobs, food security and wealth creation.3.	Access to Trade - Increasing access to trade finance solutions by corporate and SME clients that the Bank serves. The line will support trade activities that promote critical sectors such as Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FCMG), Manufacturing, Agriculture, Services, Oil & Gas, Telecommunication and Construction.

title: WCS Crisis Response OCB
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) improved access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (OCB, and through them, their customers) which will support their capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recover; and (ii) promotion of the resilience of trade finance markets and broader stability in Vietnam.

title: SL Hotels Asia
content:
At the Project level, the Project is expected to: (i) sustain the relevant project companies' ability to maintain employment of staff; and (ii) sustain demand for goods and services from the relevant project companies' suppliers so that the project companies and their suppliers could maintain their operations in the current situation.
At the Market level, the Project is expected to: (i) promote the resilience of tourism sector by preserving the availability and quality of goods and services provided by a large regional player; and (ii) preserve the sector's ability to support the economic recovery effort as conditions normalize.

title: R. Fes Meknes
content: 1.improved access to quality transport infrastructure and services: IFC expects the rehabilitation of the rural roads in the Region will expand the road network and improve accessibility to the rural communities. This is expected to benefit about 150,000 people living in rural areas from improved access to public transport and other public services, lower vehicle operations costs and timing saving. 2. Improved access to health -related products: the Project will provide funding to meet capital expenditures related to the health impact of COVID-19. This will have a direct impact on its inhabitants' health and contribute to flatten contagion of the virus. 3. Integration through mobilization of private sector financing: IFC expects that the Project will contribute towards further opening up of Morocco's subnational infrastructure financing to private investors by providing a continued strong commitment and signal for potential participants. 4. Integration through improved connectivity and mobility: IFC anticipates that the rehabilitation of the road will enhance physical connectivity and economic integration of Region to the rest of the country.

title: WCS Crisis Response Prime Bank
content: This proposed Project is estimated to provide ~US$133 million of liquidity in aggregate over the maximum life of the Project (up to 2 years) to Prime Bank, which will then on lend to up to 110 export-import based corporate and SME customers and support critical sectors like RMG/textile, Power, Pharma, Chemical, etc. By sustaining the Banks' ability to provide these services, IFC's proposed facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Bangladesh. Turbulence in global funding markets, among other factors, has made it difficult for the extensive network of clients and partner banks to maintain their role as an enabling platform for liquidity to multiple emerging markets, many experiencing their own acute liquidity shocks while the need for liquidity increases. IFC expects the facility to attract additional private sector investors and partners to support emerging market liquidity, strengthening the market's ability to absorb shocks imposed by the current crisis.

title: WCS Crisis Response City Bank
content: This proposed Project is estimated to provide ~US$110 million of liquidity in aggregate over the maximum life of the Project (up to 2 years) to City Bank, which will then on lend to up to 70 or more export-import based corporate and SME customers and support critical sectors like RMG/textile, Power, Pharma, Chemical, Edible Oil etc. By sustaining the Banks' ability to provide these services, IFC's proposed facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Bangladesh. Turbulence in global funding markets, among other factors, has made it difficult for the extensive network of clients and partner banks to maintain their role as an enabling platform for liquidity to multiple emerging markets, many experiencing their own acute liquidity shocks while the need for liquidity increases. IFC expects the facility to attract additional private sector investors and partners to support emerging market liquidity, strengthening the market's ability to absorb shocks imposed by the current crisis.

title: Banco BHDL WCS
content: Under the COVID-19 Facility, the project's development thesis is: by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. The expected project-level outcome is providing access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (emerging markets "EM" and financial institutions "FI", and through them, their customers). This will support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery. Specifically, this project intends to provide increased access to working capital finance primarily for SMEs.Beyond the project-level outcomes, EM banks provide working capital and trade finance to support their customers' operating cash flows. By sustaining the Bank's ability to provide these services, the project intends to promote the resilience of trade finance markets as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in the Dominican Republic.

title: Ekurhuleni Muni2
content: The proposed investment supports the implementation of municipal infrastructure projects in CoE and is expected to have positive effects on access to quality of urban infrastructure services such as water, electricity, sanitation, and roads for households and private productive enterprises. It is also expected to promote inclusive development by enabling the CoE to expand access to essential infrastructure to households in townships and informal settlements. At the market level, the Project is expected to help i) improve the City's financial resilience by reducing non-technical losses in the water and electricity distribution systems, with potential for market-wide effects; and, ii) increase the financial integration of municipalities with capital markets to support infrastructure projects, particularly in a time of declining market conditions.

title: Puratos Loan
content: The project impacts will be centered on smallholder farmers supplying Puratos (Belcolade) under its sustainable cocoa sourcing program Cacao-Trace. Cocoa farmers will benefit from a reliable access to the market and increased income (including quality premiums and bonuses), through the implementation of a more sustainable and environmentally beneficial harvesting model leading to improved yields and the production of premium quality cocoa. The project is expected to generate more extensive market impacts by influencing the way similar companies addresses cocoa sustainability issues.

title: WCS COVID Daycoval
content: All IFC projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis: by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: WCS COVID OBS
content: All projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis that, by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: WCS Crisis Response Access Bank PLC
content: All projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis that, by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during these unexpected and uncertain times , IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: WCS COVID Crisis Response BAM
content: By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: SeeTree
content:
The most significant expected Project-level Outcomes are derived from improved productivity of permanent crops in SeeTree's markets of operations such as Brazil, USA, Argentina, Indonesia etc achieved by deploying at scale AI technologies that measure the health of individual trees, thereby significantly increasing the percentage of healthy trees. Maintaining healthy trees is critical for productivity growth in the permanent crop sector. New technologies like AI can help improve productivity through automated analysis of large-scale permanent crop farms to measure the health of each tree individually, allow growers to understand the productivity of their trees and other parameters like expected fruit size and correlated these factors to farming practice. Potential productivity improvement can result in higher income as the outcomes of the data analytics allows growers to prepare the right marketing strategy based on size and volume of products.

From this investment, the main sources of expected Market Creation outcomes are derived from the potential to maintain the competitiveness of the permanent crop sector, which is generally developed, by stimulating further adoption of precision agriculture technologies via demonstration and replication channels.

The Company's technology also has the potential to trigger market changes such as the development of the spoke-and-hub farming model if implemented in lower-middle or low-income countries. It may also increase the traceability of fruits, particularly to deal with issues of rejections when crossing borders.

title: TCX II
content:
Project impact:
The most significant expected Project-level outcome is the increased availability of currency risk management instruments that will facilitate increased local currency capital flows into IDA PSW countries.  

Market creation:
The project will contribute to stronger integration and the deepening of financial markets of IDA PSW countries primarily by creating relevant pricing benchmarks that are critical building blocks for the efficient allocation of financial resources. TCX will also help provide capacity building for stakeholders in IDA countries. IFC expects that increased scope for longer-term local currency financing will boost competitiveness in markets benefiting from expanded TCX hedging, encouraging other investors to replicate TCX's hedging activities by demonstrating their effectiveness and commercial potential.

title: WCS COVID DAVCR
content: All IFC projects under the COVID 19 Facility share the same development thesis: by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income earning opportunities. The Project Outcome rating is Strong with High likelihood of achievement, which will be realized by providing access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (EM FIs, and through them, their customers). This will support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post crisis recovery.The Market Creation rating is Strong with Medium likelihood of achievement. Emerging Markets, banks provide working capital and trade finance to support their customers' operating cash flow. By sustaining banks' ability to provide these services, IFC's facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that co mes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Costa Rica. Turbulence in global funding markets, among other factors, have made it difficult for the extensive network of client and partner banks to maintain their role as an enabling platform for liquidity to multiple emerging markets, many experiencing their own acute liquidity shocks while the need for liquidity increases. IFC expects the Facility to attract additional private sector investors and partners to supportemerging market liquidity, strengthening the market's ability to absorb shocks imposed by the current crisis.

title: WCS COVID NSIA
content: Resilience: in the context of the acute shock associated with the COVID pandemic, IFC will, through this facility, support NBCI' capacity to sustain operations and particularly lending to a critical sector of the Ivorian economy.Increase access to finance: The Project is also expected to increase access to finance for SMEs as it will help NBCI scale up its lending towards SMEs, which in turn is expected to drive economic growth and job creation.

title: GTFP NSIA CIV
content:
The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets.  The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs.
On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels.
It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: WCS COVID HKL
content:
By supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. Project Outcome: By providing access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (EM FIs, and through them, their customers) to support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery. The project intends to provide up to US$25 million of liquidity to HKL, which will then be on lend to approximately 3,000 MSME clients. Market Creation: By sustaining the ability to provide these services, IFC's facility is intended to promote jobs as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Cambodia.

Project Outcome: By providing access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (EM FIs, and through them, their customers) to support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery. The project intends to provide up to US$25 million of liquidity to HKL, which will then on lend to approximately 3,000 MSME clients. 

Market Creation: By sustaining the ability to provide these services, IFC's facility is intended to promote jobs as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Cambodia.

title: WCS COVID AMRET
content:
(i)	Project Outcome: The project provides access to finance and liquidity to relevant stakeholders (Amret, and through them, their customers). This will support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery
(ii)	Market Creation: Microfinance institutions (MFIs) provide working capital to support their customers' operating cash flow.  By sustaining MFIs' ability to provide these services, IFC's facility is intended to promote the resilience of financial markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Cambodia.  IFC expects the Facility to attract additional private sector investors and partners to support emerging market liquidity, strengthening the market's ability to absorb shocks imposed by the current crisis.

title: WCS Crisis Response Equity Bank Kenya
content: By sustaining the Bank's ability to provide working capital and trade finance, IFC's facility is intended to promote the resilience of trade finance markets, as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Kenya.  IFC anticipates that the Project will help best position the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: WCS Crisis Response First City Monument Bank
content: All projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis that, by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: WCS COVID VPB
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) improved access to finance/liquidity to relevant stakeholders (VP Bank, and through them, their customers) which will support their capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recover; and (ii) promotion of the resilience of trade finance markets and broader stability in Vietnam.

title: WCS COVID CIB
content: Projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the development thesis that, by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: DCM CIB Green Bond
content: The Project is expected to be the first senior green bond issuance in Egypt. In the absence of green bond history in the Egyptian market, the Project represents a first step towards establishing CIB as a regular issuer through setting the green bond framework and program. IFC investment will testify its commitment to the local capital market and encourage other financial institutions to participate in future bond issuances. IFC is bringing its best practice expertise in structuring and issuing green bonds globally and regionally.

title: Global Bank Loan
content: The most significant expected project-level effect is increased access to housing finance for low-income and middle-income female households in Panama, and increased access to women entrepreneurs. Beyond the project-level effect, the proposed project will both promote inclusive homeownership for women and financing of SMEs owned or led by women.

title: Yoma Micro Power
content: The Project will allow commercialization of a unique business model of the Client by supporting the construction and operation of solar hybrid systems to off-grid telecom towers and co-located villages for delivery of energy services to rural communities. The Project will also support the Client's expansion into C&I segment. The main project outcome is increased access to electricity for communities in rural and conflict affected areas as well improvement in quality and affordability of electricity for tower operators and C&I customers. The Project is expected to have positive environmental impact by displacing CO2 emissions. Beyond the Project, the investment contributes to market inclusiveness and competitiveness by demonstrating a viable business model for distributed renewable energy solutions that other investors can replicate within the region. The investment is Gender Flagged investment and as such, the company, with assistance from IFC's Gender Business, is committed to employ more women in non-traditional jobs in the company, such as engineering, procurement and other careers promoting women in professional roles.  Gender sensitive recruitment processes will be developed and monitored by for progress to increase the female ratio of employees within the company.

title: One Tech 2
content:
Employment creation: OTH will be protecting over 4,500 its existing jobs and will increase permanent employment within its expansion plans by 2022. Moreover, OTH has a formal training center for its employees. As OTH is enhancing technological content of its products, it will engage more university graduates, which is in line with the WBG strategy for Tunisia. In some functions, women represent a significant majority of employees, and created impact on women's employment and training is in line with the WB gender strategy.   
Enhancing competitiveness of a key export player: the Project will support a medium size company set up a platform to undertake future expansion, thereby improving its competitiveness. The Project will help OTH integrate upstream, which will boost its exports with downstream impact on the value chain.
Technology Transfer: the acquisition will allow transfer of know-how and skills and benefit operations by integrating new processes.
Contribution to economic growth: export forex earning will help to boost manufacturing sector development in the Maghreb region.

title: RSE COVID JK Paper
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good based on an AIMM score of 53. The most significant, expected project level outcome is stakeholder effects (employees and customers) Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that its financing will promote greater market resilience via market enabling channels.

title: WCS COVID Prior
content: The expected development impact derives from increased access to finance for SMEs in Belarus which have been negatively affected by the COVID 19 global pandemic and ensuing economic slowdown. IFC's funds will be used to provide working capital lines to eligible SMEs in the country, helping these companies to sustain their operations during the economic slowdown. In addition, by sustaining banks' ability to provide funding to SMEs, the project intends to promote the resilience of trade finance markets as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Belarus.

title: ALBA Asia
content: The Project supports the development of hazardous waste treatment and bio waste management facilities in China, mostly in frontier regions, to help address inadequate waste management services. The main project level effect is on stakeholders through the increase in scientific treatment capacity for hazardous waste and bio waste. The Project will benefit local populations and industries by introducing advanced waste treatment and management methods that are expected to reduce safety and health risks, improve environmental conditions, and contribute to the avoidance of GHG emissions. Beyond the Project, the investment contributes to market sustainability by demonstrating the adoption and implementation of recent regulations for the treatment of hazardous waste aligned to international standards.

title: BoA Kenya RSF
content: Accessibility of finance for SMEs in Kenya: IFC anticipates that by providing BOA Kenya with a tool to mitigate the higher risk of lending to the Very Small Enterprises (VSE) and SME segment, the Project will help increase access to finance for currently underserved SMEs in the country. Market impact: IFC anticipates that the project has the potential to promote greater market competitiveness by demonstrating the commercial viability of lending to underserved VSE/SME segments.

title: FBN Nigeria WCS
content: By supporting trade finance in partnership with one of the largest Nigerian banks, the project will have a demonstration impact, promote competition, and encourage other lenders to participate in funding trade finance in Nigeria:1. Change in accessibility of trade finance for SMEs: The project is expected to improve access to stable USD liquidity for SMEs to support the importation of raw materials and critical commodities. With the funding from this investment, FBN will be able to reach a wider group of SMEs such as those involved in climate smart agriculture supply chains (irrigation equipment, high quality and climate resilient seeds, and alternative fertilizers, etc.), solar companies and solar supply chains, as well as the import-export and distribution of energy efficient and renewable energy equipment.Name% Shareholding1Eastspring Investments Singapore1.92%2Ayoola Oba Otudeko1.50%3Oyekanmi Hassan-Odulake0.86%4T. Rowe Price Associates0.77%5Norges Bank0.58%6BlackRock Fund Advisors0.35%7Global X Management Co. LLC0.29%8Eaton Vance Management0.23%9Legal & General Group Plc0.15%10Eke Urum Kalu0.06%Total for top 10 largest shareholders6.70%Others 93.30%Total 100.00%2. Change in accessibility of climate finance: IFC anticipates that the project will increase financial access for climate smart investments by providing financing to FBN for targeted on-lending to climate smart projects by SMEs and corporates, as this is in scarce supply in Nigeria.3. Competitiveness: The project will help jumpstart the process of raising climate finance and establish a new asset class for the Bank. Through demonstration and replication, IFC expects other banks to adopt a similar systematic approach to establishing their green lending portfolio.4. Sustainability: IFC's engagement with FBN will help build capacity in the Nigerian banking system to scale up green financing with the introduction of tools to identify, appraise and report on green assets, as well as green certification standards.

title: Fullerton Loan
content: Stakeholder Effects: The project is expected to contribute positively to job creation by improving access to finance for MSMEs in the low-income states of India. Further, IFC anticipates the project to support FICCL in increasing its lending to women owned MSMEs. Market Impact: The implementation of the proposed project will support the continued flow of credit to the MSME sector. The financing provided to FICCL and similar MSME focused NBFCs is critical for the livelihood of the customers found in the MSME segment. FICCL will be primarily catering to the need of the additional first-time borrowers who entered the market and will be demonstrating the financial viability of serving the unserved segment, especially the entrepreneurs, including women, in the low-income states.

title: SBSA COVID
content: Increased availability of finance for sectors affected by the CoVid-19 crisis, including healthcare and medical sectors: the proposed Project will support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations amid a challenging environment and contribute to a much-needed increase of long-term investments in the affected industries. Resilience: The Project will contribute to sustaining the resilience of the many corporates and SMEs, which could come under strain under the ongoing crisis. By supporting clients' capacity to sustain operations during the acute shock, IFC is assisting the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable entities to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: FirstRand SL IV
content: The expected project-level outcomes are: Increased availability of Climate finance: The Project will help increase access to climate finance and support FirstRand Bank in its strategy to fund renewable energy and energy efficiency projects in corporates and smaller businesses. Beyond the project-level outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will have the potential to catalyze the sustainable development of South Africa's climate finance market through demonstrating the viability of capital allocation to climate projects, which in turn will raise awareness in the broader financial institutions sector. This should result in reforms and capacity building for a more sustainable banking sector.

title: WCS COVID CBC
content: By supporting clients' capacity to sustain operations during an acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. The impact also comes from IFC's ability to respond promptly and sustained availability of output in time of crisis.

title: WCS IDA PSW
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is significant support for access to finance and liquidity for EM banks, traders, MSMEs, and other real sector borrowers. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the WCS loans will support resilience during an acute crisis, also supporting an expeditious recovery once exogenous shocks have stabilized. The potential impact of the WCS loans is in no small part due to IFC's 15-year history in trade and short-term finance, including effective responses under WCS and other trade products in past crises.

title: Priorbank & Raiffesen Leasing Belarus Green Housing
content:
The most significant expected development impact resulting from the project involves:

i)	Increased access to housing finance in Belarus. Availability and affordability of mortgage funding in the country is very limited, largely hindered by lack of long-term local currency funding. 

ii)	Increased access to climate finance in the country through green mortgages and energy efficiency home renovation loans. At least 50% of the loan proceeds will be channeled towards climate finance, helping the country achieve its green house gas reduction targets in line with National Sustainable Development Strategy.

iii)	Increased competitiveness in the green housing finance in the country: Successful introduction of the green mortgage and energy efficiency home renovation products and growth of these portfolios might resonate through the market and inspire other financial institutions in the country to follow suit and introduce retail climate finance products.

title: MAL - PRAN
content: By supporting MAL's capacity to sustain operations during this COVID pandemic, IFC helps position the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is helping the Company maintain its operations thus preserving employment levels and economic activity throughout the value chain, especially through sourcing relationships with local farmers. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will be through enhancing the sector's resilience to withstand the impacts of the crisis.

title: ISC-Savannah Fun
content:
-	Increase the Pool of Capital Available for Early Stage Startups in SSA: IFC expects the Project to deliver successful project outcomes, by providing an increase in access to capital for early stage technology companies in capital constrained economies that have the potential to disrupt traditional industries, along with investee growth, which will be supported by Savannah's hands-on approach to portfolio management. 
-	Job Creation and Economic Growth: Savannah Fund plans on deploying capital into disruptive and innovative businesses that are streamlining mainstream sectors and creating efficiencies and productivity gains in the sectors in which they operate (logistics, healthcare, financial services, education, commerce, etc.) thus creating value for all stakeholders in the value chain and boosting economic growth. In addition, the Fund intends to invest in companies across Eastern, Southern and Western Africa, thus generating additional employment opportunities and hence attempting to address Africa's growing unemployment problem.

title: YKL SME COVID
content: The potential development impact of the project is composed of the following: i) increased access to finance for SMEs negatively affected by the Covid-19 economic downturn; ii) provide financing support to SMEs operating in key sectors during the Covid-19 outbreak, including healthcare, production of medical equipment, food production, packaging, e-commerce, and logistics; and,  iii) increased access to climate finance for affected SMEs.

title: Endiya II
content: 1. VC investment volumes in India are markedly lower than VC volumes in advanced economies and approximately 1/8th of China. The project will increase access to early-stage venture capital for Indian startups, founded by first-generation entrepreneurs. 2. The Fund is expected to focus on investing in unique intellectual property-led startups and scaling these startups. The Fund Managers' value creation strategies will help scale innovative digital startups and bring more businesses and consumers online, thereby expanding the digital economy.3. The Fund will invest in companies with disruptive business models that bring innovative solutions to market, and drive economic growth while also expanding services to underserved segments of the population. These companies increase competitiveness in sectors that are characterized by low productivity, poor efficiency, low competition and weak supply chains.

title: OnSiteGo
content: The most significant expected Project outcome is improved access to and improved quality of protection services for ACEs in India. ACE penetration rate is still relatively low in India but will steadily increase as household income continues to grow. As ACE ownership increases, the cost of maintenance and repairs and the risk of losing these assets can have a significant impact on households' daily activities and financial well-being. By leveraging a combination of digital and offline models with a customer-oriented approach, Onsitego aims to address the growing needs for ACE protection in India. IFC's investment will support Onsitego to 1) expand its product distribution and service delivery channels, so as to reach, educate and provide ACE protection for a broader consumer base in India; 2) develop and scale its preventative maintenance services, so as to extend its protection coverage beyond newly-bought ACEs; and 3) further improve its technology and service infrastructure, so as to offer even better customer experience. In addition to the above, IFC also anticipates the Project to effectively contribute to the development of the nascent ACE protection market in India.

title: Cerba Africa
content:
The most significant Project-level outcomes is patient impact: access to good quality diagnostic services is fundamental in providing improved access and coordination of care. Currently there are many shortcomings across Africa in terms of diagnostic services. There are too few laboratories and those that exist often have poor quality control, with a limited variety of tests. The Project will fill these gaps by (1) increasing the number of patients & collection points. The project plans to expand its lab network to new countries, including IDA-PSW-eligible countries. The project will also increase the number of collection points to the periphery of major cities, resulting in an estimated 0.5 million additional patients and 2.3 million additional tests; (2) introducing more accurate & faster tests: Cerba will aim to expand and strengthen CLA's systems, and introduce new technology, that will lead to additional and quicker accurate testing by CLA's pathology labs, reducing costs and the need for multiple tests, and (3) introducing a greater depth of clinical tests into the markets it enters. This will allow for diagnostics of a greater range of diseases, and these diagnostics will support a greater range of treatments. 

Market Impact Assessment - the Project will enable systemic changes by increasing the competitiveness of the diagnostics market in Africa. It will do this by supporting the entry and expansion of CLA into a number of under-developed markets. These markets are characterized by relatively small providers that are under-capitalized and without the systems to ensure consistently accurate tests, as well as by the absence of regulation. CLA's expansion will place pressure on other laboratories to "up their game" and will demonstrate the value of its business model and so could lead to replication by other companies.

COVID-19 - African countries have fragile health systems & to fight the pandemic, public authorities will need to engage the private sector. CLA is the largest pan-African lab in terms countries covered and is uniquely placed to join national COVID-19 response plans. Its labs will be amongst the few labs able to conduct COVID-19 testing.

title: WCS COVID Garant
content: By supporting Garanti BBVA's capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities. The project has an AIMM rating of Good based on a score of 53. The Project Outcome rating is Strong with High likelihood of achievement, which will be realized by providing access to finance/liquidity to Garanti BBVA and, through it, its customers). This will support stakeholders' capacity to sustain operations and to expedite post-crisis recovery.  Specifically, this project intends to provide approximately US$150,000,000 of working capital and trade-related lending to 7,500 MSME clients.The Market Creation rating is Strong with Medium likelihood of achievement. Emerging Market banks provide working capital and trade finance to support their customers' operating cash flows.  By sustaining banks' ability to provide these services, the project intends to promote the resilience of trade finance markets as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Turkey.

title: ISC-Flat6 Amman
content: (i) Address funding gap for seed stage investments: Flat6Labs Amman will support approximately 90+ early stage companies, helping to fill the void of early stage capital. More broadly, IFC would like to help build and support local, sustainable ecosystems for entrepreneurship and venture capital. (ii) Catalyze and support local entrepreneurship: Through its bootcamp, acceleration cycles, and various internal and external events, Flat6Labs Amman will provide the capital and know-how to support entrepreneurship. (iii) Job Creation: Since its inception, the Flat6Labs platform has generated more than 3,000 jobs across the MENA region. Similarly, F6LA's graduated companies are expected to create high skilled jobs to match the highly educated workforce in Jordan and spur economic growth.

title: WCS Crisis Response Zenith Bank
content: All projects under the COVID-19 Facility share the same development thesis that, by supporting its clients' capacity to sustain operations during this acute shock, IFC best positions the private sector to support the economic recovery process, shortening the time it will take for the most vulnerable to return to their traditional income-earning opportunities.

title: Engee PET Manufacturing Limited
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) economywide effects via local production and the development of the recycled plastics supply chain in Nigeria, and (ii) environmental effects through introducing recycled plastics into its business model. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that its engagement with the Company will significantly deepen the recycled PET business in Nigeria, thereby increasing product and process complexity in the manufacturing sector in Nigeria with opportunities to further integrate into other value chains.

title: Africa Medical Equipment Facility
content: Stakeholders impact - Change in Healthcare SMEs' access to finance and benefits for patients: IFC anticipates that the Program will enable PFIs to sustainably increase their healthcare SME loan portfolio and risk profile and hence, contribute to increasing access to longer-term finance (up to 7-years tenor), which are financially underserved in these markets. The financing will be used to acquire medical equipment which is expected to improve the effectiveness of the healthcare provided and so contribute to a strengthening of human capital. The development impact is expected to be further strengthened with the IFC Advisory Services provided to selected HSMEs and PFIs and the inclusion of maintenance and servicing of medical equipment by the OEMs. Contribution to Market Creation - Competitiveness: The Program will encourage competition among OEMs which could result in equipment prices falling for the benefit of the HSMEs. Through a demonstration channel, PFIs' expansion of their healthcare SME loan portfolios will demonstrate to the wider market in the Program's Countries that HSMEs form an attractive market segment. The Program is expected to increase the market's competitiveness as other FIs in the Countries increase their lending to this market segment. There is also potential for the Program to lead to more loans and leasing by OEMs and equipment distributors. The Program is also expected to support the promulgation of technologies in healthcare in Africa.

title: Pasarpolis
content: The most significant expected Project outcomes are: (1) Improved access to insurance for digital economy participants - E-commerce is expanding rapidly in Indonesia. As firms, increasingly MSMEs, onboard onto e-commerce platforms, they not only gain access to a much larger market but are also able to access a broad range of services linked to marketing, logistics, payment services and financing. Access to e-commerce and its ancillary services can help MSMEs boost productivity and grow, while expanding access to goods and services for consumers. This investment will help Pasarpolis to expand its coverage of risks related to e-commerce, covering risks that are essential for the development of Indonesia's digital economy and helping businesses and consumers safely and confidently transact online. (2) Access to more affordable and higher quality motor insurance - Indonesia does not have mandatory third-party motor insurance and is one of the world's least penetrated markets for motor insurance. As ride-hailing services grow rapidly in Indonesia, Pasarpolis has partnered with GoJek to embed basic third-party liability protection and coverage for drivers and passengers, and also offers additional policies for more extensive protection for drivers and their vehicles. This investment will help Pasarpolis to continue to grow its capacity to provide coverage for ride-hailing drivers and passengers, and also develop other kinds of insurance for owners and users of vehicles beyond the ride-hailing sector.

title: ODATA SP01/2/3
content: The Project is expected to increase access to data hosting services for businesses in Brazil by supporting the expansion of independent carrier-neutral data center capacity, potentially resulting in increased productivity and usage of digital services. Beyond the Project, this investment is expected to contribute to increasing competitiveness of the Brazilian market for data hosting services by inducing alternative data centers providers to expand, thereby supporting the entry of wholesale data center users and enabling productivity and usage of digital services across the wider economy.

title: BA Loan
content: The expected project-level outcomes are: Increased access to finance for SMEs (including WMSEs), increased access to housing and green finance. Beyond the project-level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the investment will have the potential to promote greater market awareness and competitiveness via innovation and demonstration of new possible products.

title: VACPA
content: The project has an AIMM rating of Good. The most significant, expected project-level outcome is reduction in the volume of water used to irrigate a hectare of date palms and an increase in the number of smallholder farmers that receive offtake contracts, pre-harvest financing, and training. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates its investment will increase integration in the date-based supply chain in the Middle East and North Africa, via demonstration and replication effects.

title: TGF IV
content: Project Outcomes- Stakeholder: Increase access to growth capital for Fund investees: The Fund, while maintaining a generalist strategy, will provide access to long-term equity capital for mid-market companies in Turkey.- Stakeholder: Increased Investee Growth: IFC expects the Fund to bring operational value-add to its investee companies and help them scale.Contribution to Market Creation- Competitiveness: The project is expected to increase PE market activity in Turkey by demonstrating the viability and sustainability of PE investments.

title: NMB Nepal SME
content:
Stakeholder Effects: IFC anticipates the project will provide up to US$25 million in long-term financing for SME. Expected impact includes increase in accessibility of financing for NMB's SME clients, which will ultimately facilitate job creation and income generation in Nepal. 
Market Impact: Increase competitiveness of SME financing: The high-risk structure for SME lending, absence of appropriate credit methodologies, and lack of product differentiation restricts expansion and innovation in SME financing. IFC's focused lending towards SMEs will demonstrate sustainability of lending to this segment and support increase in overall banking credit to the SME sector.

title: Luminus II
content:
Demonstration of a successful private sector technical vocational education and training model that contributes to improved employability of its students. Expansion of vocational education that is focused on manual skills into fragile and conflict affected states (FCS) where these skills are in shortage via South-South investments by the Group. Women' employment: expansion of vocational education is expected to help addressing women's unemployment issue, as women' participation in labor market in Jordan is one of the lowest in the world. Evidence suggests that women at the higher end of educational spectrum and with employable skills may have better probability of being employed. Job creation: The growth in offerings Luminus is looking to embark on can only be achieved by hiring the right personnel in terms of caliber, qualifications, and numbers. The number of those employed by the Company is projected to double in 5 years, reaching around 1200 employees in 2024 as compared to
compared to a total of 506 employees in 2019, 34% out of which are expected to be women, employed at wage rates higher than market average to ensure attracting the level of competence required.

title: GNG Fuels and Fertilizers
content: The Project-level impact of the new investment is expected to have economy-wide effects by generating jobs and economic linkages to other sectors. In addition, it will also have stakeholder effects by providing better access to finance for end customers (farmers). At the market level, the project has the potential to promote competitiveness as the Company can have a strong demonstration effect in the market for other competitors to replicate its high efficiency operations.

title: Indorama Cotton
content: The Project is expected to have a positive development impact, contributing to market creation and generating economy-wide and employment effects. The Project will ensure transitioning to mechanized harvesting that would both increase efficiencies and eliminate the risk of forced labor. The Project will also source cotton from local contract-farmers, helping them integrate into a modernized value chain on commercial terms and reduce off-take uncertainties on both sides. The Project's ginning and warehousing operations will contribute to reducing post-harvest losses and facilitating domestic value addition in the context of broader sector reform and create estimated 700 non-farm new jobs. In addition, the Project will create 1,000 farm jobs.

title: ARCHIPELAGO II
content: Expected development impact includes: (i) providing access to private equity to mid-cap companies in Southeast Asia (SEA), focused on businesses in Indonesia and the Philippines, and (ii) increased investee growth, through the Manager's control strategy focus on improving operational efficiency and management practices.

title: Revo Capital Fund II B.V.
content:
Project outcomes: 
- Stakeholder: The Fund will provide access to early-to late-stage capital for tech entrepreneurs and bring value-add to portfolio companies while helping them scale.  

Contribution to Market Creation: 
- Competitiveness: The project is expected to increase competitiveness of the venture capital market within Turkey.

title: SP Ventures II
content: The main project-level outcomes are (i) increased access to early stage equity for agtech entrepreneurs in LAC, including in under-penetrated parts of the region and to female founders; (ii) increased investee growth through the Fund Manager's value creation; and (ii) increased productivity for farmers/producers (who are customers of the investee companies). In terms of market creation, it is expected that the Fund will increase competitiveness by expanding the agtech ecosystem across LAC.

title: CCM
content: Consumers of agricultural lime, employee skills development and economy-wide benefits are the most significant expected project-level outcomes. In addition, the investment could promote market competitiveness in  both the agricultural and mining industry in Mali which depends heavily on imported lime products.

title: India Alt II
content: Project-level outcomes are: (i) Increased access to private equity capital to SMEs; (ii) Increased investee growth through fund manager's value creation strategies. The main market-creation outcomes are: increased inclusiveness, through the support of a domestic country-focused Fund manager with local operations and staff, develop inclusive business models and practices.

title: Transcapital
content: The expected development impact from this proposed project is to increase access to finance for underserved segments in Mongolia, namely micro-enterprises/individuals, especially towards women and in the rural and semi-urban areas in the country. Through the project, IFC will also be providing much needed mid-term local currency linked financing to Transcapital, through IFC's own account and also via the mobilization of international lenders, which will also help to diversify the Company's funding sources and support its envisioned growth.

title: GTFP- IDA PSW
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets.  The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs. On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels.  It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: Project Swahili
content: The Project is expected to generate direct and indirect job creation and an increase in purchases from domestic suppliers as a result of the store expansion.

title: Simple Credit Loan
content:
Project Outcomes: Improve access to finance for MSMEs along the agriculture supply chain. The proceed of the financing will increase access to finance for the unbanked and underbanked MSMEs along the agriculture supply chain with innovative digital solution by increasing the number of Simple Credit's micro digital agri-loan from 590 by the end of 2019 to 6,094 by the end of 2023,  and volume of outstanding loan portfolio from US$4.8 million by the end of 2019 to US$132 million by the end of 2023.
Contribution to Market Creation: Inclusiveness: The Project will represent IFC's systematic efforts of using digital solution to promote financial inclusion in China and IFC's continued efforts to develop the agriculture and rural areas in China.

title: Growthpoint Properties Limited
content: The expected project-level outcome is increased availability of high-quality healthcare services through increased access to finance for hospital providers in South Africa. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will increase competitiveness of the private healthcare sector by removing barriers to entry for new operators via the introduction of new asset class.

title: DARP SPV Jive
content:
-	Stakeholders impact: The project will support the acquisition and resolution of Target Assets in Brazil, by allowing financial institutions to offload distressed assets. This will allow them to release capital, decrease their liquidity needs, which will strengthen the capacity of these financial institutions to increase lending. It will also help Brazilian borrowers normalized their defaulted obligations, regain access to credit, and return to active participation in the financial system. The Project will also support SMEs, many times in financial distress, by acquiring their existing legal claims and precatrios. By acquiring these assets directly from SMEs, the Project will provide immediate liquidity to them.
-	Market impact: IFC expects the Project will contribute to the further development of the Brazilian distressed assets market by supporting Jive, which serves the Target Assets that are not currently actively resolved in the market in an efficient manner.

title: ECRED expansion
content:
- Employees - A significant number of direct and indirect jobs will be created once all shopping malls of ECRED are completed. 
- Customers: company supports the growth of local retail brands that has a positive impact on the economy
- Women Employment: modern malls provide opportunities for women to enter the workforce by providing a safe and structured environment. 
- Integration: Malls in secondary cities and new areas will provide more economic opportunities to the local population.

title: Rider Iron & Steel Ghana Limited
content:
The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are: (i) Economy wide effects, and in particular, related to the formal income generating opportunities that the Project will create for individuals and micro enterprises engaged in scrap collection activities in RSK's supply chain; (ii) Environmental effects: It will contribute to the abatement of pollution and emission of greenhouse gases, due to greater use of steel scrap in the production process as opposed to primary steel production from iron ore. The local steel production supported by the Project will lead to the elimination of up to 240,000 tons of steel imports, resulting in an annual emissions reduction of 331,900 tons of CO2e.
The market impact includes: (iii) Market Integration- Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will have a moderate effect on the integration of manufacturing sector in Ghana via the building of economic complexity. As the first steel manufacturing plant in Kumasi, RSK is expected to stimulate competition and pave the way for improving the efficiency and increasing the productivity of the steel sub sector in Ghana.

title: Mtn Nazca II
content: 1.	Increased access to early and expansion stage equity for technology companies in Mexico. Access to VC in Mexico remains low compared to the size of its economy. Within this context, Mountain Nazca will provide access to capital across an investee's lifecycle through its fund.2.	Increased competitiveness of Mexico's VC market. Mexico's VC ecosystem remains under-developed and the success of the Fund will prove the viability of this sector and help catalyze new local FMs.3.	Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: VC funds such as Mountain Nazca invest in companies that often introduce a disruptive digital business model in a market. These innovative businesses can put pressure on incumbents to compete on prices and service quality. They can also strengthen supply chains by reducing the role of brokers and intermediaries, which improves price transparency and efficiency.

title: Adecoagro Dairy
content:
The Project will help preserve and improve rural livelihoods. The investment will restore reliable off-take to the dairy farmers who were previously supplying the Chivilcoy and Morteros processing plants and grow its farmer reach further. 

The Project is estimated to create 250 direct jobs and approximately 3,500 indirect jobs through value chain linkages. 

The Project will also have positive environmental impacts through intensification of dairy production and climate smart elements of the investment program. 

The Project is expected to contribute to strengthening the competitiveness of Argentina's dairy sector by helping to shift the sector toward a more intensive and more sustainable production model.

title: Absa Trade Finance
content:
The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are the stakeholder effects - increased access to
financing for suppliers engaged in the Company's supply chain. IFC also anticipates that the Project will have
a strong effect on the integration of the manufacturing sector in South Africa via enhancing connectivity of
suppliers into the domestic value chain.

title: DCM OCBC NISP  2
content: Project Outcomes (i) Improve access to finance for WSME: The proceeds from gender tranche will be channeled towards WSME which will help to reduce finance gap in the WSME; (ii) Expand access to finance for climate-smart projects and environment impact: The proceed from green tranche will increase the availability of financing for climate smart projects in the country. Thus, the Project will help in the creation and development of country's sustainable / climate finance market and contribute to the overall reduction in the GHG emission; Contribution to Market Creation (i) Inclusiveness: The Project would support improvement of access to finance for underserved WSMEs and expected to demonstrate to other market participants the viability of differentiated financial products for WSME (ii) Sustainability: The Program would support the development of a green finance market in Indonesia. Building on IFC's successful effort on investing in Indonesia's first non-sovereign green bond, the Project is expected to further deepen the climate finance market and encourage other financial institutions to replicate the issuance of green financing instruments. Further, the Program is expected to reinforce market standards in line with international green lending principles.

title: DARP SPV CCM
content: The expected project-level outcomes are the offloading of NPLs by banks and normalization of the financial position of defaulted debtors who are currently unable to access formal credit. The sale of NPL portfolios will help banks meet their NPL reduction targets and reduce associated funding and administrative costs, and thereby improving their profitability and capital position over time, which in turn may strengthen their capacity to lend. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment, via demonstration and replication channels, will increase market competitiveness and integration and likely to have a catalytic effect in the unsecured retail NPL space in the region's distressed asset market. In terms of competitiveness, the Project is expected to contribute toward the entry of new servicers specialized in unsecured retail NPLs into Southeast Asia and the market-wide adoption of best practices by servicers active in resolving unsecured retail NPLs. The Project will contribute toward market integration by triggering the mobilization of foreign capital into Southeast Asian NPL markets as the platform will serve as a model for other investors to replicate as they consider investing in the region.

title: SBSA Green Bond
content: Increased availability of climate finance: IFC's investment will help increase access to climate finance and support the development of a platform to promote renewable energy and energy efficiency projects in corporates and smaller businesses. Sustainability: IFC's investment will promote greater sustainability by catalyzing development of South Africa's climate finance market through demonstration of the first offshore green bond issuance that follows international Green Bond Principles coupled with support for awareness raising among financial institutions and continued support for reforms and capacity building in sustainable banking.

title: Suguna III
content:
1. Greater farmer incomes: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the impact on the incomes of poultry farmers who participate in Suguna's outgrower (contract farming) model or use the Group's inputs for independent poultry production. 
2. Increased consumer access to affordable and high quality food products: Depending on how the final product composition evolves as a result of the Project to what is currently available in the market, consumers may benefit from increased access to high-quality, affordable poultry products. 
3. Market creation: At the market level, the Project is expected to contribute to integrating farmers into the poultry value chain by transferring its experience and business model to Bangladesh and advancing the sophistication of contract farming in this underdeveloped market through demonstration and replication.

title: AxeTrading
content: The Project is expected to provide improved pricing transparency for traded debt securities, in countries developing their bond markets and fulfill requirements under new regulations, particularly countries in Africa, ASEAN and Latin America. The investment will also help establish better market infrastructure needed for more dynamic domestic private debt securities markets that are better able to meet the needs of issuers and investors.

title: KICB Micro
SLGP RSF Yoma Bank
content:
Project level impact: 
Increased Access for SMEs/VSEs including women owned/operated SMEs/VSEs: IFC anticipates that this project will provide the Bank with an efficient risk mitigation tool that will support it to sustainably increase financing to SMEs and very small enterprises (VSEs) including women owned SMEs and VSEs. These enterprises represent over 90 percent of the total officially registered enterprises in the country and contribute about 80 percent to employment thus presenting a strategic importance for job creation and the country's economic growth but face constrained access to credit with the financing gap estimated at 21.3 percent of GDP.

Market level impact: 
Competitiveness: IFC expects that this project can demonstrate bankability of SMEs and VSEs on a cashflow lending basis thereby motivate other financial institutions to introduce customized products for underserved segments and come up with alternative credit scoring models. This competitive push would help scale the availability of finance for this market segment and promote financial inclusion in Myanmar where credit to the private sector, which is estimated at 25 percent of GDP, remains relatively low.

title: Amadeus JV
content:
(i) Economy-wide impact: The Project is expected to make a substantial contribution to employment generation in the frontier state of Minas Gerais and to value addition through the multiplier effects. The Project is estimated to generate a total of nearly 7,000 jobs (including direct, indirect, and induced jobs).The Project's overall value addition is estimated at US$512 million, including direct, indirect, and induced effects along the Project's supply chain as a result of the joint venture. 

(ii) Environmental and social impact: The proposed Project will achieve its objectives in environmentally and socially mindful manner by planting on degraded lands, adopting Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) standards in managing its plantations, and utilizing biomass for its energy needs. The Project consists of a set of activities that are expected to produce pulp with the lowest CO2 emissions. An increase in natural wood-based pulp production has also broader environmental benefits since the impacts of wood-based textile fibers on the environment are more limited than that of oil-based fibers. Unlike synthetic fibers, wood-based fibers do not shed microplastics into the water when washed and lend themselves more easily to recycling.

(iii) Contribution to market creation: The establishment of DWP production in Brazil through the joint venture between Lenzing and Duratex could result in increasing the complexity of Brazil's manufacturing base by facilitating the development of higher value added segments of the textile industry.

title: Africinvest Fund IV LLC
content:
Project Outcomes:
- Stakeholder: Access to growth capital for Fund investees: The Fund, while maintaining a generalist strategy,
will provide access to much needed long-term equity capital for mid-market companies in Africa.
- Stakeholder: Increased Investee Growth: IFC expects the Fund to help in knowledge transfer and bring
operational value-add to its investees.
Contribution to Market Creation
- Competitiveness: The project is expected to increase PE market activity in Africa by demonstrating the viability of PE investments given the challenging fundraising environment.

title: NBI SME Loan
content:
Project outcome: The Project will increase access to finance to SMEs, help improve the quality of financial services and products provided to SMEs and contribute to job creation.

Market impact: The Project will contribute to increased competitiveness in the Iraqi banking sector, by demonstrating the commercial viability of lending to SMEs

title: SPE AIF I, LP
content: Project-level outcomes are: (i) improved access to capital, for mid-cap companies in North Africa (primarily Morocco, Tunisia, and Egypt); (ii) increased investee growth through the Fund's value creation strategies. The main market-creation outcomes are: increased competitiveness and integration in the North Africa private equity market.

title: WDP Romania
content: The proposed investment is expected to have limited environmental and social impacts which will be sitespecific with none anticipated to be significant. Further, the impacts can be avoided or mitigated by adhering to recognized performance standards, procedures, guidelines and design criteria as described in the followingsections.
