Thus, this is a Category B project in accordance with IFC's Policy on Environmental and Social Sustainability.Key environmental and social issues applicable for this investment are: design and construction of buildings in accordance with national construction codes and standards, particularly related to seismic resistance and life and fire safety; effective implementation of the environmental, occupational health and safety management plans during construction; energy efficiency and other resources consumption during buildings operation.

title: Lviv E-Buses
content: The main project outcome is improved user access and quality of Lviv's public transport system. The project will also address barriers to improve access of women to a safe public transport. The new efficient trolleybuses fleet, combined with renovations on catenary lines and route optimization, will contribute reduce CO2 emissions of Lviv's urban transport. At the market level, the project will open access of municipal infrastructure to local currency debt capital markets and enhance transport system wide resilience.

title: EFSE MSME
content:
Stakeholders' effect (Access to MSME finance): The most significant, expected Stakeholders' effect is increased access to MSME finance through long-term lending to banks and microfinance institutions. Since inception, the Fund has generated, via on lending by the financial intermediaries funded, more than 1 million sub-loans totaling EUR7.6 billion. This has directly contributed to the lessening of the MSME finance gap in the region, which remains underserved by local banks or any other alternative sources of capital. 

Market creation (Integration): IFC anticipates that the Project will enhance connectivity and integration among public and private investors by demonstrating to the wider investor community that the MSME segment poses bankable investment opportunities representing an attractive risk-reward profile.

Market creation (Inclusiveness): IFC anticipates that the Project can foster greater inclusiveness in the market through expanding microfinance and banking services, through efficient underwriting, use of fintech, responsible finance practices, and innovation to reach underserved segments.

title: SLGP RSF TEB - Kosovo
content:
The project is expected to have a strong development impact as follows:

(i) Scaling up small loan financing to SMEs, including underserved segments such as women entrepreneurs and farmers in Kosovo, which in turn supports job creation; 

(ii) With the risk sharing facility, encouraging alternative financing structures and promote cash flow-based lending in a market dominated by collateral-based lending; and

(iii) Promoting growth in agribusiness, a key economic sector: Approximately 60% of the country's poor live in rural areas and depend on the agricultural sector for their livelihoods. In this context, the project will reach the base of the pyramid by directly supporting the most vulnerable segments of the population.

title: ORIENTAL INFRATRUST
content:
1.	Market Creation & Demonstration Impact: Successful financing of the Project would demonstrate the feasibility and sustainability of large scale de-risked infrastructure assets in the country. The InvIT structure has a potential to be replicated in various other sectors in India and could help in attracting investments from large pension funds and insurance companies.

2.	Benefits to the local economy: India due to its size and diversification has the potential to become a regional logistics and distribution hub. The road sector is a critical component of economic growth and inclusion in India. Indian roads are severely constrained in transport capacity with wide regional imbalances. New investments in transport infrastructure would heighten efficiency, productivity, quality and access and can have spillover effects on priority sectors in India, such as agriculture, manufacturing and tourism.

title: DCM NSIA ABS
content:
Project Outcome: Increased Access to Finance for SMEs. The Project is expected to increase access to finance for SME as it will help NBCI scale up its lending towards SMEs, which in turn is expected to drive economic growth and job creation.
Market Creation: IFC's role as an anchor investor is expected to provide comfort to investors, mostly regional institutional investors, on the new asset class being introduced, not only for the successful completion of the transaction but also for future investment in similar ABS issues. In addition, the successful completion of the ABS issue anchored by IFC is expected to demonstrate that capital markets can be leveraged by commercial banks to raise much needed long-term funding for SME lending.

title: Minsheng Edu 2
content: At the project stakeholder level, IFC anticipates that the Project will expand access to improved quality, affordable tertiary education particularly focusing on the frontier provinces of Jiangxi and Anhui; as well as other frontier regions in China. The Project is also expected to have positive inclusion effects to attract more students from ethnic minorities. At the market level, IFC anticipates that the Project will help drive further consolidation in a fragmented market and raise standards for Minsheng's competitors, particularly in the area of graduate employability where Minsheng has historically achieved graduate employment rates of above 90%.

title: Nyaho
content: IFC expects the Project to increase the provision of high-quality healthcare in Ghana. IFC also expects the Project to place competitive pressure on other healthcare providers to improve their quality of service.

title: SETRAG II
content:
(i) Stakeholder impact: increase capacity, quality and safety of rail services, through improvements to the country's sole rail network. These improvements will support strong projected growth in mining and general freight demand. The Program is expected to add up to 12 million tons per year of long-haul capacity, as well as improve wagon turnaround times by up to 30%. 
(ii) Economy-wide impact: The Project is expected to generate domestic value added and employment effects; 
(iii) Impact on suppliers: The Project is expected to increase local procurement of goods and services. These potential outcomes will be quantified during the appraisal.

Contribution to market creation: 
(i) Integration: The Project improves enabling infrastructure that
contributes to deepening connectivity between Gabon's mining sector and global commodity markets. It also ensures continued access for multiple users, including general freight and passenger traffic, on a non-discriminatory basis. 
(ii) Resilience: The Project supports growth in mining and general freight segments, contributing to diversifying the country's revenue sources.

title: EP Systems
content: The growth of an agent network infrastructure is expected to lead to improved access to transaction accounts and payment services for consumers, and improved working capital and income opportunities among merchants providing agent services.

title: EPCL Expansion
content: Implementation of the Project is expected to increase local availability of Hydrogen Peroxide (H202) in the Country. Customers will benefit from shorter delivery time and lower inventory costs. The Project is also expected to maintain the Company's competitiveness through value addition. The proposed investment qualifies as a climate change mitigation project and is expected to achieve some reductions in annual GHG emissions. In addition, the Project will create jobs and enable transfer of technical and managerial know-how. IFC anticipates that the Project will lead to increased competitiveness of the PVC and base chemicals sector, which will support the growth of the main users of these products such as the textile, building and construction sector.

title: Muni San Jose
content:
The overall expected development impact of this engagement is the following:
Project Level Outcomes 
i) Improve quality and access to urban infrastructure services. These investments are part of the MSJ's revitalization master plan which is oriented to stop urban sprawl in its downtown area, increase the city center density, and improve the overall city's resilience to shocks derived from economic downturn and climate change. The plan delivers impact to the 340 thousand inhabitants of MSJ's metropolitan area and the approximately 2 million people living in the city's periphery. 
The project will enable better delivery of public services (public transportation and mobility alternatives, connectivity and sewerage). The project will contribute to access to new jobs, business and urban services as the rehabilitation of urban corridors is intended to act as a cluster of economic development. The current inhabitants of the project's catchment area are the main beneficiaries of the improved quality of the services. 
ii) Increase municipal government tax revenue base and collection levels. The project is expected to improve the municipality fiscal sustainability  by attracting new permanent inhabitants (increasing tax base) and increasing tax revenue collections from (i) property value around the revitalized corridors; and (ii) licenses and fees related to real-estate commercial and housing development.
Market Creation Outcomes 
i) Increased access to capital markets. The project is the first financing transaction outside the local market and will contribute to demonstrate the viability of municipal infrastructure financing to international investors allowing the municipality to tap into new sources and more flexible instruments. MSJ can be an example of how middle and small size cities can improve financial resilience diversifying funding sources and reduce reliance on inadequate local financing, international bond markets and central government transfers.

title: Abdali CMC
content:
Project-level Impact: Stakeholders 

The project-level impact will come through delivering high-quality care to patients. There is a rising need for healthcare provision in Jordan and neighboring countries. The burden of disease from non-communicable diseases has grown by 50 percent in Jordan over the last ten years. In addition, this project will serve a number of conflict affected countries through medical tourism. The provision of care will be differentiated from hospitals in the area in that it will deliver a model of care based on centers-of-excellence around key services; increasing the depth and quality of local medical professionals through improved training and working conditions, co-ordination of care through a team based approach model. AMC is one of two providers to use the team based approach to care in Jordan. The project will provide health care that is either higher quality, or more affordable than what medical tourists could access in other countries in the region. The current health expenditure per capita in 2019 in Jordan is US$ 495 per annum compared to an average of US$ 1,288 in the MENA region. Out of pocket health expenditure per capital in Jordan is also a fraction of the MENA average, standing at US$ 138 per annum versus the US$ 397 regional average. The Project will provide healthcare
to a high concentration of direct and indirect insurance patients (>80% of patient volumes).

Human Resources for Health: The Project provide the local administrative and medical staff of AMC with world class training in particular specialties It is expected that training, and on the job experience, in this approach will make health workers adept in providing team based care, an approach that is largely new to Jordan. This is in addition to establishing a training model in collaboration with nursing colleges that will be open to nurses from all Jordanian hospitals, thereby improving the quality of nursing in the country.

Market Creation: Competitiveness

AMC's contribution to market creation will largely be centered around increasing competitiveness through being a center of excellence in the region and having a staffing model that increases market efficiency and improves the quality of care.

title: ND Refineries Ltd
content: The Project's expected development impact includes (i) reduction of Nigeria's current account deficit by reducing import of petroleum products (ii) creating direct and indirect jobs in Rivers State Nigeria (iii) improving competitiveness and quality standards in Nigerian refining sector by supporting the expansion of a private player (iv) creating a demonstration impact by showing the viability of modular refineries in countries where there are significant crude-oil reserves such as Nigeria.

title: GWFP Sofitex2019
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is continued access to markets and finance for over 32,889 farmers and increases in productivity for 1,557 farmers. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates the investment will increase integration and resilience in the cotton sector in Burkina Faso, a low income/IDA country, through capacity building and demonstration and replication effects.

title: ITL
content: The Project will support the transition of a domestic logistic player in Vietnam (via investment and acquisition) into an integrated service provider capable of delivering higher quality and efficient solutions to meet Vietnam's growing demand for logistics services. The main project-level effect is on stakeholders through improved access and quality of service for customers. Beyond the Project, the main source of expected market impact is contribution to market competitiveness via demonstration effects by supporting the development of a holistic logistics platform providing high-value-added services.

title: Global Climate Partnership Fund
content: This project is expected to contribute to sustained and increased access to climate change mitigation finance across emerging markets. In addition, the Project will enable further reduction of GHG emissions, bolster renewable energy conversion, and mobilize additional financing for climate change related projects. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to help promote sustainability by demonstrating to the market the benefits of extending climate financing across emerging markets It will also promote competitiveness through capacity building, and demonstration effects.

title: ETC India 2
content:
1.	Impact on Consumers: The Project will contribute to addressing India's challenges with both food security and safety as well as diet diversity. The Project contributes to increased production of calorie rich, nutritious, and safe pulses at affordable price. Further, the Project would also have a meaningful impact on low income consumers since several of the states where ETC is planning its expansion are Low Income States (LIS), namely Assam, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Chhattisgarh. 

2.	Impact on Farmers: The Project will result in increased purchases of pulses from a significant number of farmers. ETC India combines global sourcing with various domestic channels (including traders, local mandis, and government tenders with NAFED) to procure the necessary raw materials. The use of inland third party processors (including in Rajasthan, UP, and MP) is expected to facilitate local sourcing from surrounding producer states. 


3.	Market creation: At the market level, the Project is expected to contribute to improving the competitiveness of third party processors by raising their processing efficiencies and E&S practices and building their overall capacity to serve broader processing needs in the market.

title: Apollo
content:
1.	Improved access to finance for MSMEs and individuals: NAVI Bank will seek to leverage technology platform and data analytics to simplify loan application processes and tailor loan terms to individual and MSME.
2.	Improved access of deposit and quality of deposit accounts: NAVI Bank aims to rapidly scale and achieve higher usage and deposit rates by delivering better terms, convenient and tailored product offerings to individual customers and MSMEs compared to incumbent financial institutions by leveraging digital channels and a more efficient business model.
3.	Market Competitiveness: NAVI Bank will contribute to fostering competitiveness in the market by demonstrating the viability of product and service innovations delivered through a technology-based business model. IFC expects that New Bank's success will contribute to increasing competitiveness in the retail and MSME banking segments in India, by leading incumbents to invest in technology-driven products for customer engagement and financial service provision, as well as by serving as a catalyst for the entry and growth of new digital banking models in the country.

title: Garanti Impact Region
content:
1. Increased access to finance for small enterprises: The proposed investment will increase access to finance to small enterprises with a special focus on regions that are the most affected by the SuTP influx. 
2. Inclusiveness: IFC anticipates that the investment will foster financial inclusiveness by demonstrating to other industry players the need and commercial viability of expanding credit in less developed regions

title: Primary Group
content:
The project is expected to increase:
1)	Accessibility and quality of insurance, namely personal lines (primary auto and home) and international private medical insurance, in growth markets. 
2)	Competitiveness, as  Primary Digital is bringing innovation to product development and distribution that other players in the market are expected to replicate due to competitive pressures. In addition, Primary Health is serving a "niche" segment of the market place that is underserved by national health systems and traditional private insurance.   
3)	Support to SMEs, as Primary Health's direct distribution as well as new products are expected to provide coverage to SMEs, supporting in their effort to attract and retain talent.
4)	Transparency and quality of service by helping end users compare rates and terms across difference insurance providers instantly and seamlessly and therefore make more informed purchase decisions.

title: Amboro
content: IFC anticipates that the project, supported by IFC's advisory services engagement with Davivienda, will improve access to finance for: (i) social low income households that are beneficiaries of the government's social housing program; (ii) WSMEs, where the financing gap in Colombia is significant; and (iii) green assets, primarily green buildings.Beyond the Project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote inclusiveness as it will trigger market-wide impact on financial inclusion of women. Additionally, the Project will promote an increase in climate financing available in the Colombian financial sector, which in turn will contribute to improved environmental sustainability (e.g., water savings, energy savings, and GHG emission reduction).

title: Santander CH RSF
content: The most significant, expected Project-level effect is increased access to climate finance and SMEs. Beyond the Project-level impacts, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote competitiveness of climate financing market by enabling Santander, a large private sector bank, to grow its business in this space, which demonstrates to the market a replicable solution and encourages private sector FIs to invest in climate-related business and to expand lending to SMEs.

title: BT Leasing Bond
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to be: at the project outcome level:  i) increased access to climate finance, including energy efficiency and resource efficiency projects for SMEs; ii) increased access to finance for SMEs. At the market creation level: i) increased competition in the climate business space through demonstration channel; iv) better financial integration of locally-owned non-banking financial institutions (NBFIs) into capital markets and development of corporate bond market in Romania.

title: RBRO B3T2 bond and senior loan
Ceramic Tile AF
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcomes are economy-wide and employment effects, and skills development.  Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will have a strong effect in integration via increasing manufacturing complexity; and of integration in the regional manufacturing sector by linking various production hubs across the sub-Saharan Africa region to Sunda's extensive distribution and dealership network in the region.

title: Weigao GreenBond
content:
At the Project-level, the Project is expected to: (i) reduce Weigao's climate footprint; (ii) increase access, especially in frontier regions in China, to affordable and quality medical devices; (iii) create employment opportunities and support the development of local small and medium sized enterprises through local sourcing.

At the Market-level, the Project is expected to help: (i) integrate other climate conscious healthcare companies into the green capital markets; and (ii) improve competitiveness by prompting competitors to not only raise their quality standards but also maintain affordable prices.

title: SG Ghana SME SL
content: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is an increase in the availability of longer-term financing to underserved SMEs. IFC also anticipates that the Project has the potential to promote greater market competitiveness through demonstration of the commercial viability of lending to SMEs.

title: Geru-Equity
content:
Stakeholder Effects: Improved quality and affordability of personal loans.  
Brazil has one of the the highest credit card penetration rates in emerging markets, with 26 percent of adults having taken a loan from a financial institution or used a credit card according to the latest Global Findex survey.  Average rates for credit cards (300 percent p.a.) and personal loans (110 percent p.a.) are amongst the highest in the world due to limits in credit data infrastructure and competition.  Through advanced analytics enabling increasingly accurate risk-based pricing, and a lean business model, Geru is able to compete with rates offered by the more competitive banks to their own account holders, offering interest rates on personal unsecured loans lower than the market average by an estimated 16-28%, without requiring any collateral deposits.  With this investment, Geru will seek to grow its customer base by leveraging technology and alternative data to further improve their credit risk underwriting, tailoring terms and expanding product offerings to consumers.  Geru loans are not earmarked for a specific use or investment, approximately 50 percent of Geru borrowers to date, states taking a loan for refinancing purposes by lowering the rates or improving product terms. Of these, a significant share are refinancing credit card debt, one of the most expensive and widespread sources of debt in the market.  2.5	Through a carefully-designed, user friendly online platform, Geru allows consumers to verify eligibility and simulate loan terms tailored to their profile with transparent disclosures. This allows platform users to compare terms with those offered by their bank, and apply for a loan in less than ten minutes. While approval is less likely for applicants flagged in the credit bureau that are typically rejected by main financial institutions, through this project Geru will invest in further developing its algorythms to better discern a customer's previous default history, as well to take advantage of the new data opportunities provided by the emergence of a positive registry and open banking regulation.  

Competitiveness
The Project will support one of the two fintech firms approved to become SCDs in Brazil, which has a business model that enables granular price differenciation for its borrowers leading to reduced costs. With the pricing being its competitive edge, Geru provides quotes of interest rates through its on-line platform, which will add a competitive pressure to other lenders, creating downward pressure on costs in the overall sector. As a leading Fintech innovator in personal finance, this way, Geru will foster competitiveness in the market by contributing to a market structure change, as it operates in a much more conducive environment. If successful, the new SCDs will grow and generate competitive pressure to the overall sector, resulting in an increased competitiveness and consequently lower borrowing costs across the market.

title: African Rivers Fund III
BTPN SMEGreen I
content: The expected development impacts of the Project are as follows: (1) Introduction of new financial products and demonstration effect: The proceeds from the facility will be used by BTPN to grow its SCF and green financing business, two products that are at a very nascent stage in Indonesia despite the growing need and large gap. Based on BTPN's reputation and track record as a leading innovator in the industry supported by a strong and committed Sponsor (SMBC), the Project is expected to have a demonstration effect and encourage the replication of green financing and SCF products by other banks; (2) Increased access to finance for MSMEs: The Project is expected to address the significant financing gap faced by MSMEs through SCF program, which has been identified to be able to effectively tackle information asymmetry and lack of collateral, which typically hinder FIs from expanding reach to the segment; (3) Improve financial access for women-owned SMEs: A portion of the proceeds will be earmarked  to finance Women-SMEs, which are still largely underserved by the Financial Institutions in Indonesia; (4) Promote sustainable economic growth: IFC anticipates the Project will contribute to the Indonesia's cumulative GHG reduction targets and towards achieving Indonesia's target to control environmental degradation.

title: GTFP Corona. MB
content: The project builds on GTFP's global platform, increasing access to trade finance to emerging markets.  The Project will provide increased access to trade finance to the Issuing Bank's customers, including both corporates and SMEs.  On the market side, the project will further connect the Issuing Bank's cross border connections, increasing the country's integration through both financial and real sector channels.  It will help to link more traders to other countries and connect the country's financial markets more deeply.

title: Incomlend
content: The most significant expected Project outcome is improved access to trade finance for importers and exporters in the Emerging Markets (EMs). The global trade finance gap in EMs remains large, and increasingly smaller firms from EMs participate in trade transactions as a result of integration in global value chains, leaps in connectivity and digital services. The Project will contribute to enhance access to finance for exporting corporates and SMEs engaged in open account transactions and underserved by traditional trade finance providers. Incomlend has set up a platform enabling these exporters to finance their invoices digitally through a specialized, export-focused service managing due diligence, payment flows and collections, functions typically managed by trade finance banks. Digital onboarding of suppliers and buyers in the platform introduces significant efficiencies compared to traditional funders. Through this project Incomlend will invest in technology to further introduce automation and efficiencies in document verification and processing, further reducing key barriers to profitability that typically limit access to trade finance for smaller exporters.

title: DCM Fondo Esperanza Social Bond
content: The most significant expected project outcome is increased access to finance for microentrepreneurs from underserved segments in Chile. In addition, IFC anticipates that the Project has the potential to promote greater inclusiveness via demonstration and replication channels.

title: Xiang Nian II
content:
Project-level development impact:
(i) create more job opportunity;
(ii) reach more farmers for supply of wheat; and
(iii) provide high quality food for consumers.

Market-level
(i) promote inclusive development in frontier regions of China; and
(ii) promote integration of supply chain.

title: PRINC Health
content:
Economy-wide effects:
Extend access to quality healthcare in underserved regions:  The Project responds to a gap in the provision of healthcare services in Northeast, North, and Southern regions of the country which continue to lag behind the rest of the country. The availability of hospital beds is currently at an average of less than 1.9 per 1,000 population in the Northeastern and Southern regions. This bed ratio is far lower than the 4.33 in Bangkok and is below the median for most developing countries.  The Project aims to fill the gaps in the healthcare system by supporting the creation of a high-quality tertiary and secondary care hospital network targeted at middle and lower-middle income patients in the targeted regions

Stakeholder effects:
Job creation, training and development: The Project is expected to add around 2,000 full-time medical professionals to an existing staff count of 2,000. PRINC plans to make significant investments in training and development of manpower particularly for the nursing staff. The Company is collaborating with various academic and professional institutions to develop customised training programmes and setting up of dedicated training centres for medical professionals. These measures will increase supply of qualified and trained healthcare professionals in the regions outside Bangkok and contribute towards strengthening the overall healthcare infrastructure of the country.

title: DAVR Bank Loan
content:
Stakeholder Effects - Access to Finance for Microenterprise: IFC will support the Bank to increase the number and volume of microloans 
Stakeholder Effects - Access to Finance for SMEs, including Women-Owned Enterprises: IFC anticipates supporting the Bank to provide additional SME loans by increasing the number (volume) of outstanding SME and WSME loans.

title: GWFP Nitron 2019
content: The facility is expected to continue having the following development impacts: (i) development of the agriculture sector in Latin America and Africa by increasing reliable fertilizer supply to farmers; (ii) improvement of crop yields in emerging markets; strengthening of financial integration of the fertilizer value chain in the markets where Nitron operates.

title: Mekong Enterprise Fund IV, L.P.
Valor VOF I
content:
1.	Increased access to early and expansion stage equity for technology companies in Brazil. Access to VC in Brazil has increased significantly over the last few years but remains low compared to the size of its economy. The seed and series A segment (which Valor Fund III operates in) represents 20 percent of volumes and the series B and C stage segment (which the Opportunity Fund will operate in) represents 35 percent of VC volumes. Within this context, Valor will provide access to capital across an investee's lifecycle through its Valor Fund III and Opportunity Fund.

2.	Increased investee growth. Valor Fund III and the Opportunity Fund will leverage their US networks and entrepreneurial background to provide value-creation for investees throughout their lifecycle. 

3.	Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: VC funds such as Valor invest in companies that often introduce a disruptive digital business model in a market. These innovative businesses can put pressure on incumbents to compete on prices and service quality. They can also strengthen supply chains by reducing the role of brokers and intermediaries, which improves price transparency and efficiency.

title: Valor III
content: 1.	Increased access to early and expansion stage equity for technology companies in Brazil. Access to VC in Brazil has increased significantly over the last few years but remains low compared to the size of its economy. The seed and series A segment (which Valor Fund III operates in) represents 20 percent of volumes and the series B and C stage segment (which the Opportunity Fund will operate in) represents 35 percent of VC volumes. Within this context, Valor will provide access to capital across an investee's lifecycle through its Valor Fund III and Opportunity Fund.2.	Increased investee growth. Valor Fund III and the Opportunity Fund will leverage their US networks and entrepreneurial background to provide value-creation for investees throughout their lifecycle. 3.	Increased competitiveness of key markets through the support of market-disrupting digital business models: VC funds such as Valor invest in companies that often introduce a disruptive digital business model in a market. These innovative businesses can put pressure on incumbents to compete on prices and service quality. They can also strengthen supply chains by reducing the role of brokers and intermediaries, which improves price transparency and efficiency.

title: Maple
content: The main project-level outcomes are sustained access and quality of port services in Turkey, through an investment that enables the country's largest container port operator to stabilize its credit rating and undertake capex investments in the near term. At the market level, this investment contributes to sustaining access to global capital markets with potential positive signaling effects.

title: FCS Viva Fresh Kosovo
content: The Project is expected to have a positive development impact, the most significant expected Project-level impact is derived from: (i) economy-wide, employment and supply chain development effects through the expansion of the Company retail network and; (ii) stakeholder effects through improve access of local lower and middle-income consumers to a more affordable and diverse selection of high-quality food products. Beyond the Project, IFC investment will help companies along the supply chain in the Republic of Kosovo to integrate into domestic supply chain.

title: L Catterton Latin America III, L.P.
content: Project-level outcomes are: (i) increased access to equity for consumer companies in Latin America; and (ii) increased investee growth through the Fund's value creation strategies. The main market-creation outcomes are: increased competitiveness in LAC PE market.

title: Al-Jebrini
content: The Project expected project-level outcome is an increase in the access and quality of hummus, salads and perishable, dairy-based, staple food products in Gaza. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates its investment will increase competitiveness in the processed foods sector of West Bank & Gaza, through demonstration and replication effects.

title: Globaltronics
content:
The Project is expected to have (a) economy-wide effects through (i) increased production of digital electricity meters and linkages to domestically available inputs, and (ii) increased direct, indirect and induced jobs; and (b) stakeholder impacts through improved electricity distribution networks, more efficient energy demand management, and decrease of network losses.

Beyond the Project, IFC also anticipates that as one of the largest and most sophisticated digital meter manufacturing plants in the country, the Project will have a strong effect on the integration of the manufacturing sector in Egypt via the building of economic complexity.

title: Luna Export Slaughterhouse PLC
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to export markets for 5,000 smallholder farmers in northern Ethiopia. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates the investment will increase integration in the supply chain, through demonstration and replication effects.

title: Lakeshore II
content:
Expected development impacts include:
i) Access to growth capital for SMEs
ii) Increased investee growth as a result of operational improvements and strategic guidance 
iii) Increased PE market activity, increasing the competitiveness of Thailand's PE market, and potentially catalyzing new local fund managers.

title: GGF 2
content:
i)	Project outcome: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is increased access to climate mitigation finance, such as renewable energy, energy efficiency, and other green financing in the Fund's operational regions of ECA and MENA. The Project will also result in reducing carbon emissions and energy savings in energy intensive and highly polluted regions. 

ii)	Market creation: IFC anticipates that the Project will enhance integration among public and private investors in the green financing segment by demonstrating to the wider investor community that climate mitigation investments represent an attractive risk-reward profile for all parties.  IFC also anticipates that the investment will promote greater market sustainability through climate finance capacity building in ECA and MENA.

title: Zalar Agri
content:
Project outcomes: The Company will increase direct and seasonal workers by 400 mostly in rural regions of Morocco. Today, 40% of Zalar Agri's workers are women. Moreover, at the holding level, 35% of the Company's top management is composed of women. In addition, Zalar Agri expects up to 1,600 indirect jobs would be created among sub-contractors and suppliers. 

Contribution to Market Creation: Through the Project, IFC expects the Moroccan date sector to be better integrated into global value chains, through demonstration and replication effects, as Zalar Agri extends the product range by relaunching the production of premium variety dates (Medjoul).

title: Lorax II
content:
Project Outcomes:
- Stakeholders - Access to growth capital for Fund investees: The Fund will provide access to growth capital by investing between US$15-50 million in 8-10 companies in Egypt. 
- Stakeholders - Increased investee growth: The Fund is expected to add value to its investee companies through a focus on operational value-add and improvement in governance and reporting.

Contribution to Market Creation
- Competitiveness: The Project is expected to increase private equity activity in Egypt.

title: GTLP SCB IV
content:
Increased access to finance: The Project will increase access to finance for Emerging Market importers and exporters. Improved availability of credit is expected to benefit local enterprises (producers and importers, including SMEs) along with value chain and, therefore, support growth, sustain employment and encourage the generation of higher incomes.

Demonstration Effect: The Project will show other market participants the strength of an IFC partnership with a major international bank and Program Partners to support trade finance globally. The Project will have a strong demonstration effect by encouraging greater local/regional bank participation in Emerging Markets trade finance, thereby increasing access to such type of financing for local importers and exporters.

title: VPBank Green Loan
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) improved access to finance for climate businesses and local SMEs, (ii) capacity building through parallel advisory support, (iii) expected reduction in GHG emissions, and (iv) promotion of climate financing standards and best practices.

title: DCM HMC PDF
content: The most significant, expected Project-level effects are increased access to long term finance to MMEs in Chile, Colombia and Peru. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that the investment will result in an increase in market integration, as it helps a further development of the alternative debt funds market in Latin America, which is a key component of a well-functioning capital market, via the innovation and competition, market enabling and demonstration and replication channels.

title: JSC Indorama Kokand Fertilizers and Chemicals
content: The Project is expected to have a positive development impact, contributing to market creation and generating economy-wide and employment effects.  As the first majority privately-owned phosphorus fertilizer plant in the country, IKF is expected to stimulate competition and pave the way for further privatizations of state-owned chemical companies. The Project will also contribute to improving the efficiency and increasing the productivity of the manufacturing sector in Uzbekistan.

title: BBVA Leasing Mexico S.A
content: IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to finance for SMEs in Mexico by helping BBVA Leasing grow its outstanding lease portfolio as well as its outstanding portfolio of green leases. Beyond the Project level outcomes, IFC anticipates that the investment has the potential to promote greater market competitiveness and sustainability through the demonstration and replication channels. IFC expects that the launch of leasing products for SMEs by a credible brand such as BBVA Leasing will have strong demonstration effects that will encourage other players to develop similar products as well as promote the first widely publicized climate-smart leasing products in Mexico, helping to foster market transparency through the adoption of a reporting tool for climate-smart leasing.

title: Asyaport Extension
content: The Project enhances access and quality of port services in Turkey and other countries in the Black Sea region, by increasing Asyaport's capacity and operational efficiency, alleviating imminent capacity bottlenecks and supporting growth in container cargo volumes. These improvements benefit the port's customers including transshipment traffic in the Black Sea region and domestic container traffic from industrial zones located in the Tekirdag region in Turkey. IFC expects the Terminal's expanded operations to also have economy-wide effects (indirect and induced growth and employment) in beneficiary markets. At a regional market level, this investment contributes to deepening connectivity of the Black Sea region to world markets, by strengthening transshipment capabilities on a major international trading route.

title: ABL Trust Mexico
content: By taking advantage of economies of scale and leveraging on the asset quality/base of the leasing companies, the Project's expected project level outcomes are a higher SME reach when compared to projects done on an individual basis and granted under traditional lending schemes. Preliminary numbers show that the Project could help each of the medium-sized companies to increase its profitability, hence the capital generation ratio, within the life of the structure.

title: WIOCC III
content: The Project is expected to result in increased access to quality broadband Internet for individuals and businesses across the target countries by increasing network capacity through the landing of two new submarine cables, the upgrade of existing submarine cables, and the purchase of additional terrestrial network capacity; and increased access to data hosting services for businesses in target countries by building new data center facilities including (edge data centers') potentially resulting in higher usage of digital services by businesses and individuals. Beyond the Project, this investment is expected to increased competitiveness of the digital infrastructure sector in the target countries, with some potential to create competitive markets in the DRC and Somalia, via demonstration and replication as well as competition channels, through technological innovation and affordability.

title: Senegal Societe de Transformation des Legumes
content:
Stakeholders - suppliers (commercial farmers & smallholder farmers). IFC expects the Project will increase market access for onion farmers and help raise their productivity.

Economy-wide impacts - IFC expects the project will create 70 permanent and 20 temporary jobs at the factory and 50 direct and 200 seasonal jobs at the nucleus farm. In addition, the Project will build specialized skills regarding quality, food safety and maintenance in large, commercial and professionally-run, food processing operations, and raise standards by formalizing and structuring the onion supply chain with offtake contracts, price guarantees, and quality requirements.

title: Compass - Fondo de Inversion Adelanto de Efectivo
content:
IFC anticipates that the project will increase access to finance for local SMEs, helping to narrow the existing financing gap in Peru and other countries in Latin America. The project will have an indirect impact on job growth, as it allows SMEs to enhance their working capital to keep growing. The project will increase the capillarity and alternatives of provision of funds to SMEs in a diversity of sectors in the economy. The discount of the receivables represents a cash advance to SMEs, who benefit from higher liquidity that ultimately results in an improved cash management and better allocation of resources.

Beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the project will increase the competitiveness of the Peruvian financial markets through: i) the promotion of the factoring market by addressing the issues of funding availability, and ii) the development of the asset manager industry by supporting a factoring fund as a new asset class for the institutional investors.

title: Provident Growth
content: (i) Increased access to equity for technology companies that have established themselves and require growth stage capital across South East Asia; and (ii) increased investee growth by rapidly scaling businesses to become large digital platforms, by implementing digital strategies for growth and expanding investees' businesses regionally. IFC expects that the digital businesses supported by the fund will rapidly scale and contribute to transform and advance markets beyond the project and their own business, accelerating digitization of key sectors (such as transport, travel, e-commerce, education, logistics, payments, etc.), supporting an expansion of the digital economy in the region, through competitiveness and demonstration channels.

title: Anima Northeast
content: The Project is expected to have a positive development impact by (i) increasing access to high quality affordable tertiary education in a frontier region in Brazil, (ii) contributing to address the shortage of physicians and nurses in the Northeastern region of Brazil given AGES' focus on health disciplines, and (iii) contributing to market competitiveness through demonstration of an effective business model that enables smaller tertiary education providers to formalize their operations, scale up, reach efficient costs and expand their services in underserved areas.

title: Basrah Gas Co
content: The project is expected to significantly reduce gas flaring and increase domestic gas production in Iraq, with the potential to deliver significant environmental, economy-wide and stakeholder effects. This includes a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions, positive impacts on Iraq's balance of payments and fiscal revenues, and an improvement in energy access and affordability. The project is expected to improve the resilience of Iraq's energy sector by reducing reliance on more polluting energy sources such as high-sulfur fuel oil or crude oil for power generation, and will also reduce the need to import gas. The project also has significant sustainability effects from supporting the country's transition to a lower carbon path.

title: Mahyco
content:
1. Farmer Incomes: The Project is expected to improve farmer incomes in SSA through job creation for seedproducing contract farmers, most of whom are smallholders. Farmers in SSA will also benefit from betterquality planting material, which has the potential to significantly increase cotton yields in small holder farmsand reduce losses due to pest attacks, thus increasing farmer income. The Project is also expected to limithealth risks for cotton farmers as the use of insect tolerant seeds reduces the need for pesticides.
2. Food Security: The Company's high quality rice seeds are expected to result in 30-50% yield improvementsfor rice, a critical component of South-East Asian diets thus improving food security and benefiting end consumers.

title: A&C Corner Investments  Limited
content: The Project is expected to provide modern retail space that will be built around the concept of home improvement that currently does not exist in Ghana as well as to reduce the prices of and to provide more options for building materials and home improvement supplies. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater competitiveness by exhibiting the demand for this new type of retail store to other international retailers to expand into Ghana or into other African countries where there is currently no or limited supply of home improvement goods.

title: CFBond
content:
The most significant, expected project-level impacts are derived from (i) increased access to finance to underserved and vulnerable segments of the population in Colombia comprising pensioners and microentrepreneurs; and (ii) providing access to the domestic bond markets to Credifinanciera, changing significantly its ability to obtain long term financing. 
Beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the project will promote the development of an alternative bond market in Colombia allowing medium sized companies to have access to bonds and consequently deepening the capital markets locally. Additionally, the project will promote the market adoption of a business model that effectively provides access to finance to the elderly, an underserved and fragile group countrywide.

title: The Currency Cloud Limited
content: The most significant, expected Project outcome is an improvement in the quality of cross-border payments (transparency, cost, channels). Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote competitiveness in the global cross-border payments market through a demonstration and replication channel.

title: BT Mic Loan I
content:
I.	The most significant project-level outcome would be achieved through increased access to microfinance for underserved groups of the population, particularly women borrowers.

II.	IFC investment will result in significant changes in microfinance segment through innovation, demonstration effects, and capacity building.

III.	Supporting longer term lending to MSEs - by far the largest group in the private sector - will also positively contribute to strengthening entrepreneurship and employment growth in Romania, particularly in rural areas and among women.

title: Tricom Wind Power Pvt Limited
content: IFC's participation in this Project supports the development of a cost-competitive renewable energy project to help Pakistan meet its energy needs. The main project level outcomes are the stakeholder impact by helping meet Pakistan's increasing electricity demand and environmental impact by displacing tons of CO2 per year. At the market-level, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase market competitiveness with demonstration effects by supporting the establishment of a competitive tariff benchmark for future wind projects in Pakistan. In addition, the Project will contribute to sector resilience by supporting the use of indigenous resources to diversify the generation mix and reduce dependence on expensive energy imports.

title: Metro Wind Power Limited
content: IFC's participation in this Project supports the development of a cost-competitive renewable energy project to help Pakistan meet its energy needs. The main project level outcomes are the stakeholder impact by helping meet Pakistan's increasing electricity demand and environmental impact by displacing tons of CO2 per year. At the market-level, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase market competitiveness with demonstration effects by supporting the establishment of a competitive tariff benchmark for future wind projects in Pakistan. In addition, the Project will contribute to sector resilience by supporting the use of indigenous resources to diversify the generation mix and reduce dependence on expensive energy imports.

title: Din Energy Limited
content: IFC's participation in this Project supports the development of a cost-competitive renewable energy project to help Pakistan meet its energy needs. The main project level outcomes are the stakeholder impact by helping meet Pakistan's increasing electricity demand and environmental impact by displacing tons of CO2 per year. At the market-level, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase market competitiveness with demonstration effects by supporting the establishment of a competitive tariff benchmark for future wind projects in Pakistan. In addition, the Project will contribute to sector resilience by supporting the use of indigenous resources to diversify the generation mix and reduce dependence on expensive energy imports.

content: IFC's participation in this Project supports the development of a cost-competitive renewable energy project to help Pakistan meet its energy needs. The main project level outcomes are the stakeholder impact by helping meet Pakistan's increasing electricity demand and environmental impact by displacing tons of CO2 per year. At the market-level, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase market competitiveness with demonstration effects by supporting the establishment of a competitive tariff benchmark for future wind projects in Pakistan. In addition, the Project will contribute to sector resilience by supporting the use of indigenous resources to diversify the generation mix and reduce dependence on expensive energy imports.

content: IFC's participation in this Project supports the development of a cost-competitive renewable energy project to help Pakistan meet its energy needs. The main project level outcomes are the stakeholder impact by helping meet Pakistan's increasing electricity demand and environmental impact by displacing tons of CO2 per year. At the market-level, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase market competitiveness with demonstration effects by supporting the establishment of a competitive tariff benchmark for future wind projects in Pakistan. In addition, the Project will contribute to sector resilience by supporting the use of indigenous resources to diversify the generation mix and reduce dependence on expensive energy imports.

title: ACT II Wind
content: IFC's participation in this Project supports the development of a cost-competitive renewable energy project to help Pakistan meet its energy needs. The main project level outcomes are the stakeholder impact by helping meet Pakistan's increasing electricity demand and environmental impact by displacing tons of CO2 per year. At the market level, IFC anticipates that the Project will increase market competitiveness with demonstration effects by supporting the establishment of a competitive tariff benchmark for future wind projects in Pakistan. In addition, the Project will contribute to sector resilience by supporting the use of indigenous resources to diversify the generation mix and reduce dependence on expensive energy imports.

title: UCLC SEF
content:
Expected developmental impact will be derived from: 
i) Access to finance for SMEs, which remains a major obstacle, especially in the most vulnerable regions of the Country. Although Romanian banks remain the main source of financing, in recent years companies have increasingly resorted to other financing sources such as leasing and other NBFIs. 
ii) Access to climate finance, as IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to energy efficiency and renewable energy projects. This will enable businesses to improve their environmental impact by implementing climate-smart practices such as purchasing through leasing energy-efficient vehicles and equipment; and 
iii) IFC anticipates that the Project would result in increased competitive pressures in the SEF space and would have market impact through the competition and demonstration channels. The Project is expected to enhance the visibility and marketability of the SEF products offered in Romania and foster competition in this market. Supporting UCLC would result in expanding the financing potential for projects compliant with international energy saving criteria and would positively contribute to tackling climate challenges.

title: Water.org Global Credit Enhancement Facility
content:
Project Outcome: Stakeholder Effect: The project will facilitate access to small loans for safe water and sanitation to low income population in EM. IFC expects this investment to unlock up to US$1bn in over 2.7m loans by banks over the life of the Facility, improving access for over 13m individual and household stakeholders.
Market Impact: Inclusiveness: The investment would benefit BoP individuals and households, and women specifically who do not have access to safe water and sanitation. The investment will improve inclusiveness by crowding in private sector banks to provide loans to these population tailored to address these issues through innovation, demonstration effect, replication, and competition channels. Integration: the investment will promote integration of private banks to address safe water and sanitation challenges for low income population through innovation, demonstration and replication channel.

title: Indorama Eleme Fertilizer and Chemicals Limited
content: The Project will promote (i) Economic diversification in Nigeria by increasing supply of raw materials converted to higher value products; (ii) Direct and indirect employment; (iii) Environmental impact through savings in feed usage and the reduction in CO2/GHG emissions; (iv) Integration of smaller downstream companies in the value chain, and possible development of additional plastic processors in Nigeria with the increase in polymer product availability.

title: BGE Green Bond
content:
1. Stakeholder Effect: IFC funding will be used to support construction of the first WtE project in Puyang city of Henan province, a low tiered city in China with GDP per capita below national and provincial levels. 
2. Environmental and social (E&S) effects: The Project has E&S benefits deriving from more sustainable waste management and increased renewable energy capacity. 
3. Competitiveness: IFC expects the Project to contribute to improving private sector participation in the sector through supporting the expansion of a recent entrant to the market and to demonstrate to other private players the opportunities and feasibility of operating in the WtE market in lower-tier cities in China. 
4. Integration: The Project is expected to support financial integration for the sector through demonstration channels for other WtE projects to utilize green bonds especially those that are I-GBP compliant with higher standards than local green bond standards in China.

title: Casa Tramway
content:
1.	improved access and quality of transport services:  the Project will increase access to public transport infrastructure for both urban and rural populations. The Project will also help reducing travel time for passengers by  an estimated average of  about 40 percent compared walking, taxis, and private vehicles during working hours. In addition, it will offer improved traveling conditions specifically for passengers with impaired mobility through the construction of stations with high accessibility standards, additional space for pedestrians (average of 15 percent on sidewalks and 25 percent on squares) and 4,650 new trees.

2.	Rural roads: IFC expects the rehabilitation of the rural roads in the Region will  expand the road network and improve accessibility to the rural communities. IFC expects the paving of the rural roads will benefit about  400,000 people living in rural areas from improved access to public transport and other public services, lower vehicle operations costs and timing saving, estimated at US$5.9 million per year. 
3.	job creation: The Project is expected to create job opportunities for the local workforce including construction jobs and formal operations and maintenance jobs. 
4.	Environmental effects: The transport sector is a significant contributor to both pollution and emissions, contributing about 30 percent of the country's total emission. The development of the T3 and T4 lines will add more efficient and environmentally friendly transportation to the Casablanca urban area and help alleviate some of the traffic congestion in a particularly densely-populated part of the city.

title: KEP Agri 1
content:
Significant expected developmental impact will be derived from increased access to finance to microenterprises, with a focus on agri-businesses and thereby will improve funding opportunities for small farmers.  Despite its contribution to the country's GDP (10.5 percent of GDP as of 2016 and 12.9 percent in 2017) and employment (29.8 percent), Kosovo's agricultural sector remains underserved by banks, due to an unfavorable production structure and high costs of assessing multiple small farmers. As a result, Agrifinancing is becoming the main domain of the MFls with at least 25 percent of loans from MFIs going to agriculture over the past 6 years. IFC's support on this project will help the MFIs to further strengthen their impact in this sector. The expected impact of the co-investment with GAFSP is also critical as it will help to properly price the project, making funding affordable, and consequently, on-lending to microentrepreneurs and end-users in Kosovo. 

Furthermore, it is anticipated that from this project there will be increased inclusiveness in the micro finance market via demonstration and replication channels.

title: KRK agri
content: Significant expected developmental impact will be derived from increased access to finance to microenterprises, with a focus on agri-businesses and small farmers. Despite its contribution to the country's GDP (10.5 percent of GDP as of 2016 and 12.9 percent in 2017) and employment (29.8 percent), Kosovo's agricultural sector remains underserved by banks, due to an unfavorable production structure and high costs of assessing multiple small farmers. As a result, Agrifinancing is becoming the main domain of the MFls with at least 25 percent of loans from MFIs going to agriculture over the past 6 years. IFC's support on this project will help KRK to further strengthen its impact in this sector. The expected impact of the co-investment with GAFSP is also critical as it will help to properly price the project, making funding affordable, and consequently, on-lending to microentrepreneurs and end-users in Kosovo. Furthermore, it is anticipated that from this project there will be increased inclusiveness in the micro finance market via demonstration and replication channels

title: Afk Agri
content: Significant expected developmental impact will be derived from increased access to finance to microenterprises, with a focus on agri-businesses and small farmers. Despite its contribution to the country's GDP (10.5 percent of GDP as of 2016 and 12.9 percent in 2017) and employment (29.8 percent), Kosovo's agricultural sector remains underserved by banks, due to an unfavorable production structure and high costs of assessing multiple small farmers. As a result, Agrifinancing is becoming the main domain of the MFls with at least 25 percent of loans from MFIs going to agriculture over the past 6 years. IFC's support on this project will help AFK to further strengthen its impact in this sector. The expected impact of the co-investment with GAFSP is also critical as it will help to properly price the project, making funding affordable, and consequently, on-lending to microentrepreneurs and end-users in Kosovo. Furthermore, it is anticipated that from this project there will be increased inclusiveness in the micro finance market via demonstration and replication channels.

title: Neolpharma
content:
Increased access to high-quality and low-cost generics: The Project has the potential to increase competitiveness in the pharmaceutical market through the entry and expansion of a generic pharmaceutical manufacturer that will introduce a greater variety of medicine and sell medicine at relatively lower prices than the originator brands. The entry of additional generics companies into markets leads to further price reductions as competitive pressures intensify.

- South-South knowledge transfer: As Neolpharma expands its regional footprint, it will bring new products, more stringent operational and quality practices, as well as knowledge and technology transfer to other countries.

- Employment generation and development of SMEs: with the new injectables plant, Neolpharma expects to generate 500 direct new jobs in Mexico during and after construction phase. The Project will also bring 2,000 indirect employment through the Company's purchases of goods and services. In addition, the new plant in Toluca will generate 250 direct new jobs.

- Increased exports: the Pharmaceutical sector was officially declared as a strategic export sector for the Government of Mexico ("GoM"). Neolpharma's growth strategy to expand outside of Mexico is in line with the GoM priorities as it aims at increasing exports and strengthening Mexico's regional competitiveness.

- High demonstration effect on the importance, technical feasibility and financial sustainability of the API industry: One of Neolpharma's strategic projects is increasing its API plant's capacity, which will create a positive demonstration effect on the feasibility and financial sustainability of an API plant.

title: Arnur Credit II
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is derived from increased access to microfinance and small businesses, specifically for un(der)served population in rural areas of Kazakhstan, which are mostly engaged in agriculture and women borrowers. Beyond the Project, the investment has the potential to promote inclusiveness in the microfinance market, via demonstration and replication channels, by showing to other microfinance market participants the efficient underwriting processes resulting in increased access to finance for micro and small entrepreneurs in rural areas of Kazakhstan.

title: 2C2P
content:
(i)	Improved access and quality of payment services: The expected Project outcome is the growth of  payment acceptance services to merchants in Thailand and the region. While Thailand has achieved high rates of financial access, adoption of digital payments lags behind. The limited penetration and the high fragmentation of payment services in Southeast Asia represent a barrier for both consumers and merchants. As an acquirer and payment processor, 2C2P enables its merchants to receive payments from a broad range of issuers and through a network cash-acceptance points across South East Asia. 
(ii)	Integration: The investment will promote the integration of merchants and consumers in the domestic and regional digital economy. By removing a key friction to development of the digital economy, 2C2P will contribute to growth of digital businesses and value chains across the region.

title: Chiratae Venture
content:
Project outcomes are rated as Strong and consist of: (i) increased access to equity for innovative early stage technology companies; (ii) increased investee growth, which will be supported by the Fund's value creation strategies; and (iii) increased access to digitized products/services for investees' customers, particularly in non-tier 1 cities. 
In the context of a relative active VC fund market in India, the project's contribution to Market Creation is assessed as Moderate and includes: (i) increased integration of the Indian VC market by bringing in more domestic and international LPs.

title: NSG Argentina
content: The Project is expected to have a positive development impact by (i) increasing access to high quality, affordable float glass for SMEs operating in the construction sector in Argentina and neighboring countries, which is likely to result in improved competitiveness and growth of local SMEs; (ii) contributing directly to Argentina's balance of trade by replacing imports with local competitive production by a leading local company; (iii) creating a large number of direct and indirect new jobs; and (iv) training and developing the skills of the newly recruited staff.

title: Alta Semper Ilera Fund I Limited
content:
Project Outcomes
- Stakeholders: Access to growth capital for fund investees. The Fund will provide access to growth capital companies in Africa. The Fund will mobilize additional capital through co-investments.
- Stakeholders: Increased Investee Growth. The Manager is expected to add value to companies through various strategies such as institutionalization of family businesses, restructuring, operational improvements, governance and financial engineering, to generate economies of scale.
- Stakeholders: Access to higher quality health services for customers/patients. Africa has large unmet demand for quality healthcare, which the Fund aims to address.

Contribution to Market Creation:
- Competitiveness: Increased PE Market Activity. IFC anticipates the Fund, through an increase in PE investment levels, will improve competitiveness by demonstrating the viability and growth potential of
companies targeting the rising middle class in Africa and sectors benefitting from its growth.

title: Klabin Growth
content:
Economy-wide impact: The investment will support the increase in competitiveness of an integrated player in pulp and paper in Brazil, a sector that is a significant driver of economic growth in the country. The investment will promote the growth of economic activity and domestic value addition. It will create significant direct employment in the region, which will be complemented by positive indirect effect along the value chain. 

Environmental impacts: IFC's investment in Klabin will contribute to climate change mitigation as part of the financing will be allocated for co-generation, installation of a gasification plant, and wastewater treatment facilities.

Market sustainability: The investment will facilitate broader sustainability improvements in the pulp and paper sector by demonstrating innovative practices, promoting the use of best available technology with respect to pollution controls, maintaining and expanding the use of key certifications.

title: MEG
content: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are: (i) economic diversification and economy-wide effects, (ii) resource efficiency via more efficient production processes, and (iii) regional customers benefits through improved access to more affordable, good quality glass bottle products and suppliers through capacity building. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will have a strong effect in the competitiveness of the regional glass market mainly across North and East Africa, which is facing competition from global players, by improving efficiency and quality standards, and introducing product diversity.

title: Quadria Fund II
content:
1.	Stakeholders (Fund's portfolio companies) - Increased access to equity for mid-market healthcare focused companies across South and South East Asia
IFC expects the Fund to plug in the gap in funding for mid-cap companies, while PE market activity within South and South East Asia remains concentrated in the small-cap and large cap segments.

2.	Stakeholder (Fund's portfolio companies) - Increased Investee Growth
IFC expects Quadria to add value by implementing a value creation methodology focused on improving revenue growth, operating margins, building scale and through strategic initiatives. A key source of value-add for the Fund is its sector focus which is particularly important in the context of healthcare investing, as successful investments often require a deep understanding of the impact of sector dynamics on the relevant business models.

3.	Stakeholder (portfolio company's customers) - Increased access to affordable medication, diagnostic equipment, and quality healthcare for investees' customers, a significant share of which are from underserved groups

4. Stakeholder (portfolio company's customers) - Asia has unmet demand for quality healthcare. Fund II plans to invest in quality, scalable businesses that address healthcare gaps at an affordable price on a financially sustainable basis, thereby improving access to quality, affordable healthcare across Asia.

title: GWFP ETG ING II
content: The renewed facility is expected to continue having the following development impacts: (i) support of commodity trade finance for importers/exporters in emerging markets; (ii) increased access to trade finance for critical commodities, especially in the agro-commodity sector in emerging market; and (ii) improved market integration by facilitating intra-regional and south-south trade for commodities and enhancing connectivity of real sector firms into value chains.

title: DCM BAY Women Entrepreneur Bond
content:
Project-level Outcomes
Stakeholder effects - increased access to finance for WSMEs: The proposed project will use 100% of the bond proceeds to ramp-up the financing of new and existing WSME customers. Through this project, IFC anticipates the Bank's WSME loan portfolio to grow by 59 percent to US$4.2 billion (from a baseline of US$2.6 billion in 2018), serving 32,170 WSMEs (94 percent increase from a baseline of 16,568 in 2018), thus increasing the share of WSME borrowers as a percentage of total SME borrowers from 37.6 percent to 51.1 percent and growing WSME lending volume as a percentage of total outstanding portfolio from currently 33.7 percent to 37.5 percent in 2026.
Stakeholder effects - improved quality of financial and non-financial products and services for WSMEs: Through this project, IFC will support Krungsri to develop a WSME-centric customer value proposition, which will strengthen the Bank's existing SME business and help expand the Bank's WSME loan portfolio. The project is further expected to benefit WSMEs through additional non-financial services tailored towards WSMEs. 
Economy-wide effects - job creation: If the Bank grows its WSME portfolio as expected, IFC estimates the project will create between 45,000 and 83,000 jobs over the next five years.

Market Creation
Integration: Thai capital markets are considered somewhat developed relative to other emerging economies. The themed-bond market in Thailand is gaining momentum. Krungsri's Women Entrepreneurs Bonds will be the first social bond in the market and the first issuance 100-percent dedicated to WSMEs. IFC therefore anticipates that this new capital market instrument, endorsed and issued by a systemic commercial bank, will demonstrate to other market participants the opportunity of mobilizing funding from private sector investors, and thus enhancing financial market integration. As the first Women Entrepreneurs Bonds in Thailand issued under SBPs and ASBS by a commercial bank, the Project will further contribute to market integration via standard setting channels.
Inclusiveness: IFC anticipates the Project will significantly improve market inclusiveness for WSMEs by supporting a systemically important, publicly listed financial institution with a strong SME business to demonstrate to other market participants a successful pilot case for raising funds to establish an innovative women-centric lending program that will both improve access to finance for WSMEs and demonstrate the financial viability of investing in women entrepreneurs. Successful implementation is expected to trigger replication by other market participants, thus encouraging further issuances of themed (women-)bonds to mobilize private sector funding and to enhance WSME-focused financial and non-financial products and services for a more inclusive and competitive market environment.

title: Ukrgasbank Support
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is increased access to climate mitigation finance in Ukraine. Beyond the project-level outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will promote greater market competitiveness through anticipated privatization and promotion of the climate finance products via capacity building, demonstration, and market enabling channels. Also, the investment will promote the sustainability through sustainable lending products that meet green lending standards establishing and promoting these standards in the banking industry through capacity building and demonstration channels.

title: DCM Red Asset FIDC
content:
The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is the increased capital market funding for the underserved SME segment through the growth of a FIDC instrument that finances SMEs, as follows:

Stakeholders - Increased capital market funding opportunities for SMEs as Originators: IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to finance for Brazilian SMEs, helping to address the SME finance gap through a capital markets solution. 
 
Stakeholders - Increased access to finance for MSMEs as Obligors: By acquiring receivables from the originators, the Fund contributes to the financial health of the supply-chain. With more funding available, originators are better positioned to sustain its growth and the growth of its clients, the obligors.

Market Creation - Competitiveness: Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that this investment has the potential to promote greater market competitiveness through the following aspects: (i) the structural change through the increase in alternative financing opportunities for MSMEs, and (ii) the diversification of investment opportunities in the capital markets in Brazil.

title: Sogebank SME Loan
content: The project is expected to have strong development impact in terms of: (1) supporting the growth of the productive sectors of the Haitian economy by expanding and increasing access to finance to small enterprises. The SME finance forum estimated that the total credit gap in Haiti amounts to almost US$2.5 billion, with 49% of MSMEs reporting that they are either under or unserved by financial institutions. (2) promoting growth in agribusiness, a key economic sector representing 22% of GDP. It is estimated that only 28% of farmers have bank accounts and 19% received a credit for agricultural purposes. (3) strengthening the Haitian financial sector's competitiveness through capacity building, demonstration and replication channels.

title: Tasiast Mauritania
content:
The Project increases production capacity of a strategic gold mine in Mauritania, with the potential to deliver significant economy-wide effects including fiscal revenues, foreign exchange earnings, employment and GDP growth, as well as positive community development effects. 
Market creation impacts will derive from improved integration, supported by an IFC AS program to deepen domestic supply chains.  
In addition, an ongoing World Bank project is expected to improve administration of mining taxation, including implementation of tax audits for mining companies, and transparency in public resource management, which would improve broader development effects expected from the Project.

title: OTP Leasing II
