businesses, by growing local companies into national/regional providers and competitors, by encouraging regulatory alignment of the PE ecosystem.
Domestic and international business expansion and supply-chains will foster greater integration in the market. Through capacity-building activities, the project will help investee companies expand domestically, promote domestic
market integration and stronger supply-chains beyond the direct project outcomes. prior experience with investees The Fund Manager has demonstrated this successfully in.

title: 1mg
content: The expected development impact of the project includes i) increased access to affordable and safe medicines, ii) integrated approach to chronic diseases, online consultations and diagnostic services, iii) increased efficiency and productivity for hospitals and retail pharmacies, and iv) improving nationwide connectivity between patients and suppliers of medicines

title: Dodla
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: a) Farmers: The Project is expected to improve access to a reliable off-take market for a significant number of smallholder farmers while increasing their productivity and supporting their shift toward greater commercialization. b) Employees: The Company's expansion is expected to create over 2,500 jobs directly and potentially twice as many jobs would be created along with the value chain, contributing to skill building and non-farm employment. A high share of employment created in the dairy sector tends to be at the bottom of pyramid (BOP).c) Consumers: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute both to improving the food safety and food security through expanding access to quality affordable dairy products.

title: Navegar Fund II, L.P.
content: The expected development impact of the Fund includes (i) improved access to long-term, patient, risk capital for fund investees which should lead to (ii) accelerated investee growth delivered via a deliberated approach from the General Partner through collaborating with management teams and providing hands-on financial, operations, strategic and governance guidance; (iii) increased PE investment levels are expected to improve market competitiveness by small and mid-cap companies supported by good PE investors and (iv) expanded access to institutional capital in the Philippines anticipated from new institutional and private investors.

title: SHTF Sec.
content:
Shareholders impact: The project is expected to improve access to finance for the MSME sector in LIS, by earmarking the proceeds towards these enterprises. It would also support formal job creation by contributing to improvement in economic activity.

Market Impact: The funding to LIS will enable greater financial inclusion in these states which are the poorest states in the country with significantly low penetration of financial services. In addition, by investing through a relatively nascent market segment of securitization of Non-PSL portfolio where there is low participation of institutional investors, IFC will continue to support market creation for viable market-based funding tools in India.

title: GTLP SMBC II
content:
The most significant, expected project-level effect is increased trade finance for importers and exporters - as many as 1800 companies will be directly supported across 24 EMs, as well as sustained support of as many as 65 emerging market issuing banks EMIBs' capacity to provide trade finance. In terms of market creation, the enhanced capital structure of the transaction allows IFC to mobilize capital at scale via an enabling platform channel and promote integration of new investors into the trade finance asset class via the demonstration and replication channel. Specifically, the project is expected to have the following development impacts: 

- Increase access to trade finance for importers and exporters in EMs 
-	Sustain the capacity for EMIBs to provide trade finance 
-	Economy-wide effects: GDP growth and job creation

title: Lionbridge Green
content:
Access to financial services by micro entrepreneurs and SMEs at a time when mainstream commercial lending is being curtailed to this segment in China: With the proposed financing, Lionbridge would be able to expand leasing finance services for electric vehicles to truck drivers, thus rapidly building its electric truck leasing portfolio while increasing the share of climate-smart finance in the overall portfolio. A side benefit is to build truck drivers' capacity and knowledge about the advantages of EV's, thus contributing to accelerated adoption of EVs in the market.

Environmental and Social: IFC anticipates the Project will result in a reduction of GHG emissions through the promotion of leasing finance for environmentally-friendly electric trucks. The actual GHG impact numbers will be determined further during appraisal/pre-IRM

Market Creation
Sustainability: climate change is a significant issue for China. The Chinese government has a strong commitment to reduce current GHG emission reduction levels. Along with the substantial effort to transform the supply-side, Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy upgrades, transportation has become a critical component to achieve the climate goals and EV promotion stands out as the most immediate and effective path. As part of the climate finance strategy in China, the proposed project complements IFC's experience with the CHUEE program. The demonstration of commercial viability will catalyze the replication across other financial leasing peers, thereby contributing to the overall sustainable targets of the Chinese economy.

Competitiveness: the financial leasing product for electric trucks provides an alternative option and thus exerts competitive pressure for truck lending. The proposed project is expected to demonstrate the viability of such products and encourage replication, which will enhance the competitiveness of the truck/ truck lending sector.

title: Kinyinya
content: The expected Project-level outcome is the provision of much needed affordable housing and associated infrastructure in an IDA country where previous efforts have systemically failed. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater market competitiveness via demonstration and replication channel and will integrate a newly developed area as Kigali's residential district by providing enabling infrastructure for the local population.

title: EBK Green
content:
1) Project Impact Assessment:
i)	Stakeholder effect - Change in accessibility of finance for SMEs. The proposed project is expected to increase access to finance for SMEs in Kenya through both IFC's investment and advisory services to the Bank on SME lending.
ii)	Stakeholder effect - Change in accessibility, affordability and quality of climate finance. Part of IFC's investment will be deployed to support EBK's growing sustainable energy finance operations in Kenya. IFC's advisory services providing targeted support to EBK on green finance will help the Bank build a strong green business strategy and develop capacity to offer green financing solutions targeting the Bank's core clients in Kenya.


2) Market Impact Assessment:
i)	Sustainability - The proposed project is expected to promote greater sustainability by demonstrating the commercial viability of sustainable energy finance in Kenya. Capacity building through IFC advisory will bring international expertise to the market and help identify climate-smart investment opportunities and quantify the GHG avoidance.
ii)	Competitiveness - The project is expected to have a catalytic effect on SME finance and sustainable energy finance in Kenya and attract more banks into these segments.

title: Sierra Rutile 2
content: The project is expected to generate positive balance of payments and fiscal effects by increasing Sierra Leone's foreign exchange earnings and generating significant revenue streams to the Government through royalties and corporate taxes over the life of mine. The project will also support indirect and induced jobs in the economy, while sustaining employment of ~2,700 people, 98% of whom are Sierra Leonean. The project also has positive impact on the local community, deriving from SRL's contribution to an Agriculture Development Fund that supports agricultural development in its catchment areas, and community development projects in infrastructure, education, health and agriculture supported under a Community Development Agreement. In addition, IFC will provide advisory services to assist the company in enhancing its community level impacts, through joint development of economic development programs and deepening supply chain linkages. Through IFC's E&S and advisory services, and Iluka's strong ESG practices, the project will also support international best practice in environmental and social impact management, and in community engagement.

title: Netafim Global 2
content: The expected Project-level outcome is its contribution to generating better yields for the local farmers and strengthening their resilience to climate shocks. The Project will also contribute to sustainability by promoting water used efficiency in agriculture in several water stressed regions.

title: SS Senegal
content:
1) Stakeholder effects: The project is expected to improve reliability of supply and reducing the average cost of generation. The investment adds 79 MWp of power generation capacity to the electricity grid, sourced at competitive tariffs. The additional capacity substitutes costly thermal capacity based on imported fuels and emergency plants.
2) Environmental and social effects: Displacement of current and future thermal power generation by solar would result in reduced carbon emissions and pollution and contribute to climate change mitigation. 
3) Market creation: By supporting the first IPPs procured under the Scaling Solar framework, the Project demonstrates a competitive replicable model to scale solar PV in Senegal, that also contributes to establishing a low tariff benchmarks.

title: Actera III
content:
Project Outcomes: 
- Stakeholder: Access to growth capital for Fund investees: The Fund, while maintaining a generalist strategy, will provide access to much needed long-term equity capital for mid-market companies in Turkey. 
- Stakeholder: Increased Investee Growth: IFC expects the Fund to help in knowledge transfer and bring operational value-add to its investees.

Contribution to Market Creation
- Competitiveness: The project is expected to increase PE market activity in Turkey by demonstrating the viability of PE investments given the challenging fundraising environment.
- Integration: (i) Through the capacity building activities of the Fund, the project will help investee companies expand their businesses abroad, promoting greater market integration. (ii) Actera III will expand access to private capital through introducing new institutional investors to Turkey.

title: TIDE Africa Fund
content: IFC expects the project to deliver successful project outcomes, by providing an increase in access to capital for early stage technology companies in capital-constrained economies that have the potential to disrupt traditional industries, along with investee growth, which will be supported by TIDE's value creation strategies. In terms of market creation, the project has been assessed as Strong. IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to integration, by promoting the digital economy and investing in companies that will expand regionally. Competitiveness of the venture capital market will be increased through demonstrating the viability of investments in the region, potentially increasing venture capital market activity and strengthening the domestic venture capital ecosystem.

title: DCM Manappuram
content:
(i)	Rehabilitation for Kerala Flood victims & Financial Inclusion in LIS: The recent Kerala floods affected small farmers and micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) the most since their housing and livelihoods got impacted significantly. The Project will provide finance to these low-income borrowers in Kerala with critical funds needed for them to rebuild their lives and their livelihoods. 

The funding to LIS will enable greater financial inclusion in these states which are the poorest states in the country with significantly low penetration of financial services, especially in the gold loan segments.  

(ii)	Integration: The firms offering gold loans, including MFL, are now expanding into northern territories where gold loan is not traditionally as common as the southern regions of India.

title: BIM Land
content:
1. Tourism development: By developing critical tourism infrastructures, the Project will (i) enable tourists extend their stay in Ha Long; (ii) stimulate the development of a new international tourism destination in Phu Quoc island; and (iii) upgrade the supply of international standard accommodation in Vientiane.

2. Job creation and local linkages: The Project is expected to create a number of skilled job opportunities, including a significant proportion of female jobs, and stimulate demand for locally-sourced materials, services and labor which are mostly provided by local small and medium enterprises. 

3. Environmental and Social (E&S) standard setting: The Project is expected to exhibit high level of E&S compliance in areas such as waste treatment and land acquisition, which is expected to have a strong demonstration effect to other property developments in the same area.

title: AC Energy Green Bond
content: The main project-level outcome is contributing to the stakeholder impacts by addressing the growing electricity demand supply gap in Vietnam as well as the environmental impact of displacing 351,195 tons of CO2 emissions each year. Beyond the Project, the expected market-level impact is through improving market competitiveness through supporting private sector investment in Vietnam's energy sector. In addition, the Project is expected to contribute to market sustainability with strong demonstration effects of supporting the RE generation in the very nascent market in Vietnam.

title: FCS RE Azito 4
content: The Project is expected to: (i) provide competitive, reliable and clean base load power to help meet growing domestic demand while supporting the Country's position as a regional exporter; (ii) displace more expensive and polluting plants (old units and/or plants running on oil); (iii) contribute to lowering the average cost of generation and subsequently sector finances; and (iv) limit incremental emissions thanks to a state-of-the-art modern design.

title: Mintifi
content: The project would help provide uncollateralized small-sized working capital credit MSMEs to effectively reach underserved segments. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote systemic changes in the market by demonstrating the validity of a specialized, technology- and anchor-driven business model as a way to reach large segments of excluded MSMEs, and enable financial service providers to effectively on-lend to these segment through its platform.

title: Epyllion Knit
content:
Stakeholder's impacts:

i. Employment Growth: The Project will create 5,900 additional jobs, mostly for women. 

ii. Employee skills/know-how: The Project is going to attract skilled recruits and further develop their skill sets through various training program required by the new technologies and product range, and thus adding to the skilled workers base in Bangladesh.

iii. Effect on emissions and waste generation: EKWL's new factory will be a LEED certified green factory. 

Market impact:

i. Contribution to Market Creation: The project, along with IFC's advisory services engagements in Bangladesh, has the potential to promote greater market sustainability and intergration in the RMG sector in Bangladesh. 

ii. Impact on market emissions and waste generation: The project, along with IFC's advisory services engagements in Bangladesh, will help foster adoptioin of environmental and social sustainability principles by firms and consumers across the sector through direct capacity building channels and demonstration effects as a result of EKWL's success. 

iii. Increasing manufacturing complexity: The Project is expected to upgrade the company to a more value adding level, involving advanced products, innovative product development, automated production technology and up-grading of professional skills of the personnel. It could potentially be the model that other factories will follow as Bangladesh is climbing up to higher value garment products.

title: Mazar IPP Afghan
content: The most significant expected project-level impact stems from increased access to electricity resulting from the addition of 58.56MW of generation capacity in a country with significant power shortage. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project has potential to promote greater market competitiveness by supporting the country's first IPP and improve resilience through the use of indigenous resources to supply electricity. The key impacts of the Project are summarized below. Project-level outcomes Stakeholder effects - The Project is expected to add about 58.56MW of generation capacity and help address the country's energy demand. Currently, almost two-thirds of the population does not have access to grid connected electricity. The country has one of the lowest per capita electricity consumptions in the world with most firms identifying the lack of electricity as a critical constraint to business development. IFC anticipates that the Project will boost domestic power supply by 30 percent and supply electricity to about 1 million people. Contribution to market creation IFC's investment and advisory interventions, as well as the IDA guarantee and advisory support to GoIRA will help create a new market for private participation and PPPs infrastructure in Afghanistan, not just for IPPs. This could in the first instance be extended beyond thermal IPPs to renewables projects, particularly in solar and wind, for which Afghanistan has potential. IFC's involvement in structuring of this transaction should help make this Project bankable and balanced, and also create a template for future similar IPPs in the country. The Project is also helping create a commercial market for sale and purchase of indigenous natural gas in Afghanistan, which has been non-existent to date, and can contribute to addressing the nation's fiscal and external imbalances. The Project aims to pay a reasonable commercial price for natural gas, providing MoMP with the funds to reinvest in upstream and midstream gas supply projects in the future. Competitiveness - IFC anticipates that the Project could lead to a significant increase in market competitiveness by introducing a pioneering market enabling framework and a bankable contractual structure for private sector participation in the infrastructure space. Currently there are no private sector players in the power sector. The Project, if successful, will demonstrate the viability of private sector participation in the infrastructure sector, which is expected to encourage other potential investors to enter this untapped market that has significant growth potential. Resilience - The Project is expected to contribute to the GoIRA's energy objective of diversifying the country's energy supply, particularly by harnessing indigenous resources to supply electricity. Currently, about 80 percent of power supply is imported through short-term import contracts from Central Asian neighbors. IFC anticipates that the Project will lower the country's energy import bill and reduce reliance on imports, thereby enhancing the country's energy security.

title: Republic Bank TT
content:
Project Outcomes
(i) Stakeholder Effects: (a) Increased access to residential housing finance: Due to the continued growth in housing demand, most recent estimates indicate a shortage of more than 100,000 units, which is significant for a country with a population of less than 1.4 million;  and (b) Increased affordability in housing finance: In T&T wages have not been able to keep pace with the sharp increases in housing prices; thus, households' purchasing power has significantly eroded. For the last two decades the housing affordability ratio in T&T has been at 10:1 vs. international rates of median housing, where a ratio above 4:1 indicates a serious lack of affordability. In this context, RBL is expanding its focus on catering to the middle-income segments where affordability has historically been a major barrier to home ownership.
(ii) Economy Wide Effects: Many of the mortgages supported by the Project are expected to finance new homes; hence, the impact on jobs could be significant. The IFC model estimates the creation of approximately 2.7 jobs per newly built housing unit financed and the value-added impact per housing unit financed to be approximately US$165,000.

Contribution to Market Creation
(i) Competitiveness: Given that RBL is the largest player in the banking sector, the Project will support the Bank as they continue their expansion strategy into the middle-income residential mortgage market, which is expected to contribute to changing the banking sector's risk perception of the segment. Over time other financial institutions will replicate RBL's approach and cater to the growing housing finance demand from middle-income borrowers.

title: Camel Group
content:
Environment: The Project will increase the volume of recycled lead and neutralization for discharge in an environmentally safe way i.e. reduce soil and water contamination. This Project will make sure additional lead are processed and neutralized before discharge to the environment.

Economy-wide effects: The Project will help to create circular economy by establishing the recycling and reusing waste in the value chain since scrap plastic and secondary lead alloys can be used for new battery production and other lead products. The circular, more integrated design of lead acid battery manufacturing and recycling offers a more cost-effective way to produce batteries and create and help to formalize employment in the recycling value chain.

Employees: The upgrading of the two existing facilities will make sure the employees therein benefit from more modern, safer equipment, and strengthened workplace control against excessive lead/acid exposure therefore reduce the occupational safety/health risks. 

Sustainability: The Project is expected to foster adoption of higher E&S standards driven by better technology and processes across the different players in the value chain in China and thus promote Sustainability principles in the market through its demonstration effects. 

Integration: The project will demonstrate that it is a natural fit for battery manufacturers like Camel which requires large quantity of lead and has easy access to used batteries to integrate recycling business into their value chain. The project will also contribute to expand China's economic complexity through increased process and supply chain complexities.

title: Perote II
content:
1. Increasing clean energy production. The Project will contribute an additional 100MWac toward Mexico's stated target of 35% clean energy generation by 2024.

2. Diversifying the energy matrix. The Project will help Mexico unlock its resource rich solar power generation potential, which was less than 1% of the energy mix in the country (2017 statistics) and increase its resilience to shocks by diversifying generation sources.

3. Reduction of Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions. The project will allow for a reduction of approximately 126,926 tons.

4. Demonstration Effect. By serving as a benchmark for the financing of hybrid structures with significant exposure to both Qualified Suppliers (those that provide energy and ancillary services to users whose consumption surpasses 1 MW) and to the wholesale market, the proposed investment is opening the way for the creation of a new market that was enabled by the recent energy sector reforms.

5. Job creation and income enhancement in the local community: members of the community reported that the income derived from leasing the lands to the Project will be significantly higher than what could be obtained from agricultural production and that it will help them raise their living standards. In addition, the project is expected to generate over 600 jobs during the construction stage at the site.

title: Nafoods Group
content:
Farmer reach: The Project is expected to increase the number of farmers who supply raw materials or are employed at the Company's own land by about 11,500. Much of the Company's operations are located in economically depressed or unproductive areas. Because Nafoods is planning to provide its suppliers with high quality seedlings from own nurseries and guidance on the planting density in exchange for off-take of the crop, the yields can improve from Vietnam average of 15-30MT/ ha to 45-50 MT/ ha. 

Jobs creation and linkages: The Project is expected to create 150 full time equivalent new jobs which represents an above average impact compared to other agribusiness investments of similar size.

Market creation: By supporting Nafoods, IFC is helping to strengthen the image of Vietnam as a reliable global supplier of passion fruit concentrate. In particular, the work planned by the Project to help rationalize the supply chain will also be beneficial to the broader sector. The resulting efficiencies are expected to both facilitate competition and put a pressure on less efficient smaller players (encouraging consolidation) and promote better practices throughout the value chain. Specifically, other passion fruit producers are expected to improve their traceability and food safety practices to match the efforts being undertaken by Nafoods.

title: Elecnorte Guajira Transmission Lines
content:
Project level-outcomes: Stakeholders impact on customers/users and community

-Impact on reliability: The project will help reduce the power outages for the region, reducing the length of the power outages and reducing the average transmission and distribution loses. On 2016, power outages reached in total 96 hours in the Caribbean Coast, one of the highest in the Country and well above the 36 hours in average of the country. This Project will help to stabilize and improve the system quality and reliability in La Guajira which is the second poorest region in the country with high income inequality. The project is expected to benefit more than 155,000 costumers (approx. 1 million inhabitants in La Guajira). 

-The Impact on Community: The project will create job opportunities to the local community mainly during construction phase. creating employment on the region.

Market creation 

-Inclusiveness: Accessibility to a reliable power system for BoP customers in La Guajira, one of the regions with the highest income disparity and lowest access to electricity services in the country.

title: BMA SL
content:
Project-level development impacts:
i) Stakeholder effects: IFC anticipates that the project will increase access to finance to underserved SMEs. In addition to improving access to finance, IFC anticipates that the project will enhance the quality of products and services offered to SMEs.
ii) Economy-wide effects: By supporting ATL's SME clients in their expansion, the project is expected to help contribute to job creation and economic growth.

Market-level development impact:
i) Competitiveness: IFC expects that the successful demonstration, by an Angolan Tier 1 bank, of the commercial viability of scaling up SME lending and introduction of new product offerings and SME-focused processes will incentivize other financial institutions to follow suit.

title: Wavemaker Pacific 3 LP
content:
i.	The Fund will provide access to early stage capital for tech-entrepreneurs. Additionally, the Fund is expected to provide strategic and operational value added to its portfolio companies, and support in scaling up and expanding regionally resulting in increased investee growth.
ii.	The Fund will improve competitiveness by demonstrating the viability and growth potential of early stage B2B and deep-tech companies, increasing VC market activity within SEA especially in the relatively underserved markets of Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam.

title: Aqua Expeditions
content:
Skilled employment: The Company offers extensive training to its employees to deliver a customized local experience. High-quality training facilitates knowledge transfer and improves career prospects.

Local linkages: The Aqua Expedition boat will be based full time in Indonesia. The project will have strong linkages with local SMEs in remote locations.

Market creation: The Company will introduce a new product to a market which currently does not have offerings of that quality. The marketing linkages with international broadcaster and magazines will put this new emerging destination on the map, and contribute to the development of the destination in a sustainable way.

title: DCM XP Investimentos II
content:
Widening access to financial inclusion: The Project will be supporting the development and consolidation of a wide platform of distribution of assets, through which XP was able to connect investors looking for alternative ways of investing, and companies and small and medium size banks looking for diversified funding sources.

Greater competitiveness: The Project has the potential to promote greater competitiveness in the credit market for small and medium-sized companies, stimulating innovation and competition.

Market integration: The Project will contribute to greater deepening of financial markets by further increasing access to products and services for retail investors.

title: UPM Maroc
content:
The project-level expected outcome is an increase in the number of health professionals in Morocco and Senegal. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that this investment will strengthen the education sector's competitiveness, through demonstration and replication. 
The project outcomes are esxpected to be strong based on the sponsor's experience and track record. 
The contribution to market creation is expected to be is Strong based on the fact that UPM is a leading player in the Moroccan tertiary education market.
IFC anticipates the project will encourage systemic changes to existing markets by increasing competitiveness, through demonstration and replication of a scalable cost effective model for education provision.

title: GWFP SOFITEX 5
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is continued access to markets and finance for over 273,000 farmers and increases in productivity for 1,000 farmers. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates the investment will increase integration and resilience in the cotton sector in Burkina Faso, a low-income/IDA country, through capacity building and demonstration and replication effects.

title: JFLC Green Financing Package
Vinci Capital Partners III, LLC
content: The main project outcomes are: (i) an increase in access to capital for growing companies, including in the frontier regions of Brazil where businesses have lower access to capital; and (ii) investee growth, which will be supported by Vinci's value creation strategies. The main market creation outcomes are an increase in the competitiveness of the Brazilian PE market, due to Vinci's demonstration of the longer-term viability of investments in the region.

title: Telecom Argentina II
content:
Project Outcomes - Availability: This Project will increase the availability of 4G services across Argentina. The increase on the sponsor's 4G Coverage by 28.5% by 2020 suggests a Strong impact if small cities are targeted. Uptake: The Project has the potential to increase the mobile broadband penetration especially in remote/rural areas. More analysis will be conducted to measure the extent of the potential 4G uptake associated with this project. Quality, robustness and capacity: The Project expects to install roughly 4,000 sites providing 4G connectivity across the country by 2022, which represents an increase of 25% (More analysis on the location of these towers will be required). 

Contribution to Market Creation: Competitiveness - The project can have an impact on competitiveness by introducing the latest technology (4G services) in areas previously unserved/underserved, which others will have to match to remain competitive. Integration - This Project has the potential to increase the online interactions between people, businesses, governments, machines, and processes - More analysis will be required to understand to what extent the size of the digital economy in Argentina will increase as a result of this project.

title: Belgrade WtE
content:
(1) Stakeholder effects: The project is expected to improve the quality of waste management services provided to residential and commercial users in Belgrade. The proposed infrastructure which includes a WtE facility and a new landfill that meets EU standards, contributes to relieving pressure on existing waste management infrastructure in Belgrade, adds renewable to the grid, and provides heat to the local district heating company.

(2) Environmental and social effects: The project will also result in significant environmental benefits resulting from the remediation of the existing landfill and diversion of improperly disposed waste to a new regulated landfill. It also results in significant CO2 emissions savings (about 373,700 tons p.a.) from the use of municipal solid waste as feedstock in electricity and heat generation, as well as displacement of more carbon intensive fuels in electricity and heat production. This project also contributes to meeting the country's sector goals, to modernize waste management (reducing overreliance on landfills, eliminating illegal dumpsites, closing facilities that do not meet EU standards), maximizing waste recovery, and improve environmental sustainability, among others.

(3) Competitiveness: As the first long-term PPP investment of significant size in solid waste management in the Balkans, the project demonstrates a market-based solution for solid waste management in the region. The project benefits from upstream WBG engagement in the power and solid waste sectors in Serbia, that contributed to creating an enabling environment for private sector participation.

title: Zhangmen Education
content:
a.	For students to access good quality and more affordable private tutoring services, particularly in under-served regions of the country
b.	For teachers to access job opportunities and build skills 
c.	For the private tutoring market to increase efficiency through digital solutions and to improve quality standard and innovations

title: RA Energy II
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is increased access to energy by un(der)served households and SMEs with unreliable access to affordable energy, and increased access to financing for manufacturers and distributors of DG. The Project is expected to target predominantly lower income segments and will contribute to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project will enhance financial integration and inclusiveness through the demonstration and market enabling channels.

title: La Genoveva
content: At a project-level, the most significant impact will be an increase in Argentina's renewable energy capacity and the displacement of approximately 168,500 metric tons of CO2 equivalent a year. The project will also contribute to employment and knowledge-transfer opportunities in local populations. At a market-level, the main impact derives from an enhancement of the competitiveness in the country's energy market through the increase of private sector participation in the RenovAr program which is expected to attract more than US$6 billion into a new renewable energy market. It will also contribute to the market's resiliency as the RenovAr Program is expected to diversify the energy matrix away from thermal fuel sources and large-scale hydro while also contributing to the exploitation of Argentina's abundant wind resources.

title: Davivienda CR GB
content: The  most significant, expected project-level impact is increased access to climate finance in Costa Rica. Beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater environmental sustainability by developing the Country's nascent climate-finance market as well as promote application of green standards for financing among banks.

title: ISC-Flat6Labs Tunis
content: (i)   Address Funding Gap: Flat6Labs Tunis will support approximately 90 early stage companies, helping to fill the void of early stage capital. More broadly, by investing in incubators/accelerators and early stage funds via the IFC Startup Catalyst program, IFC aims to help build and support local, sustainable ecosystems for entrepreneurship and venture capital.(ii)   Catalyze and Support the VC Ecosystem: Through its bootcamp, acceleration cycles, early stage investments, and various outreach events, Flat6Labs Tunis will help to accelerate the development of the nascent VC ecosystem in Tunisia.(iii)   Increased Inclusion of Women: IFC's investment will include funding from the Women Entrepreneurs Finance Initiative ('We-Fi') aimed at expanding the inclusion of women entrepreneurs into the VC ecosystem through two distinct channels: capacity building and demonstration effect.(iv)    Job Creation and Economic Growth: Since its inception, the Flat6Labs platform has generated more than 1,000 jobs across the MENA region. Similarly, the Fund's graduates are expected to create high-skilled jobs to match the highly educated workforce in Tunisia and spur economic growth.

title: Sumscope
content: The project will assist in improving secondary market liquidity in the bond and broader fixed income market and thereby provide financial institutions with greater access to the markets. It will also provide value to the development of the interest rate and foreign exchange derivatives market, which will result in reducing volatility. A more developed fixed income market can activate savings, enhance competition with bank-based and other types of finance for non-financial corporates, and provide long-term financing.

title: Siegfried
content:
- Increased exports:  the Pharmaceutical sector was officially declared as a strategic export sector for the Government of Mexico ("GoM").  Siegfried's growth strategy to expand outside of Mexico is in line with the GoM priorities as it aims at increasing exports and strengthening Mexico's regional competitiveness.

- South-South knowledge transfer:  As Siegfried expands its regional footprint, it will bring new products, more stringent operational and quality practices, as well as knowledge and technology transfer to other countries.

- Increased supply of generics: The Project has the potential to increase competitiveness in the pharmaceutical market through the entry and expansion of a generic pharmaceutical manufacturer that will introduce a greater variety of medicine and sell medicine at relatively lower prices than the originator brands.  The entry of additional generics companies into markets leads to further price reductions as competitive pressures intensify.

title: Sinu
content:
Environmental and/or Social (E&S): IFC anticipates the Project will generate several important positive impacts on the environment. 
- GHG emissions: This sustainable forest management Project will implement carbon sequestration activities that result in significant GHG emission reductions at an average of 155,000 tons CO2eq per year (negative net emissions) and zero gross GHG emissions.
- Climate Resilience: As part of its operations and with IFC's support, the Project will contribute toward strengthening climate resilience in the area. This entails employing techniques such as the use of meteorological information, identification of drought and wind-resistant planting material, silviculture to improve moisture retention, and further enhancing Sinu's fire management practices. 
- Sustainable Land Management: The Project will make a contribution toward sustainable land management in an area characterized by extensive agriculture, land degradation from cattle ranching. 

Stakeholder impact: IFC anticipates that the Project will strongly contribute to the development of employment and economic activity in the area, improving resilience and stability in a post-conflict region which can be considered a frontier. Formal employment opportunities are scarce and large companies are absent in the area, apart from Sinu which represents the only formal employment option outside subsistence agriculture. The development of competitive agriculture and agribusiness sector is central to Colombia's overall efforts to diversify its economy.

title: Internac Loan II
content:
The development impact of the project is expected to be high. The most significant, expected project-level impacts are derived from: (i) increase access to finance to SMEs in Ecuador, which will in turn stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction; and (ii) improve access to finance for women owned SMEs, underserved and vulnerable segment in Ecuador. The Bank is expected to leverage on IFC's experience and track record in the SME and women owned segments. 

Beyond the project-level impact, IFC anticipates that the project will create a demonstration effect for other financial institutions in Ecuador in terms of supporting women business.

title: Xac Subdebt
content:
i) Project Outcomes: to strengthen capital position of a systemic bank in Mongolia, enabling it to provide 3,600 to 8,000 additional loans to Mongolian MSMEs and to improve access to finance. IFC expects the Bank's MSME loans to increase from the current 30% of its total loan portfolio to 40% by the end of the project period. 

ii) Economy-wide Effects: to deliver economy-wide effect through providing additional financing to MSMEs that will increase economic activity and job creation. 

iii) Contribution to Market Creation: to improve market competitiveness by motivating other players to increase lending to MSMEs.

title: GWFP Phoenix/BNP
content: The most significant expected development impacts include: (i) increased access for Phoenix to trade finance to support the growth of sourcing, trading and distribution of rice, pulses, grains and sugar into Asia & Sub-Saharan Africa, hence promoting food security in several IDA countries; (ii) increased farmers reach by providing a sizable and stable source of financing for Phoenix's purchase of agri commodities mainly from small and medium-sized farmers, and (iii) indirect support to the business of companies involved in import/export, transportation, storage, distribution of agri commodities, which is expected to sustain employment along the value chain.

title: Ara Tiendas I
content:
1) Job creation: The Project will create job opportunities, including in frontier regions, for local communities and women. 

2) Development of frontier regions: The Project will finance the expansion of proximity discount stores in the local neighborhoods across the country, including frontier regions. 

3) Boost formality and tax generation: The shops will contribute to boost formality and tax generation. 

4) Impact on customers: The Project will provide quality products at very competitive price, thus helping in improving the living standards for the local population. The Project targets to reach the vast majority of the national population and will focus primarily on low- and middle-income groups. 

5) Support of SMEs: The Project will strengthen the SME suppliers and the local supply chain, a vast majority of the products sold in the shops being sourced and produced locally.

title: Isbank GEO SME
content: (i) increasing access to finance for SMEs; (ii) fostering competition in Georgian financial sector by introducing a new strong player and indirectly (iii) job creation.

title: PichinchaGBandSD
content:
The Project is expected to have a significant Stakeholders impact by aiming to increase access to finance to SMEs in Ecuador, as almost 31% of SMEs are fully or partially credit constrained. The Country's SME finance gap is estimated at US$15.6 billion, which is 16% of GDP. The Project also aims to increase and foster the development of climate smart projects. Ecuador ranks 7th in CO2 emissions in LAC and has committed through the Intended Nationally Determined Contributions to reduce GHG emissions by 25%.

Additionally, the Project is expected to have a significant contribution to market creation through Integration, as the Project is anticipated to be the first green bond to be issued by a bank in Ecuador and will therefore have a demonstration effect for climate smart and sustainability-focused projects through banking institutions, further contributing to greater deepening of financial and capital markets in Ecuador.

title: Agricover SME
content:
1.	IFC anticipates that the proposed will (i) increase access to finance for agribusinesses (farmers-owned SMEs); and (ii) avail longer tenor investment loans for climate-smart equipment upgrades to increase energy and water efficiency targeting farming. The Project is a good opportunity to support organizing farming activity in Romania with renewed focus on improved standards and productivity. 

2.	IFC anticipates that the Project will promote adoption of a business model that allows reaching undeserved rural farmers and farmers-owned SMEs, including going down the market and serving smaller farmers through demonstration effect channel.

3.	IFC anticipates that the Project will promote greater environmental sustainability through (i) development of the nascent climate smart agriculture finance market in Romania, (ii) promotion of the climate adaptation standards and increased resilience to face climate change, which will be brought about through demonstration effect and capacity building channels.

title: DCM CRT Santander
content: The project will enable Santander Mexico to increase the amount of its SME and mid-market lending. The project will also contribute to creating a market for SRTs in Latin America by promoting integration of the region into the global SRT market through eventual replication of this transaction by others.

title: FRV Potrero Solar, S. de R.L. de C.V.
content:
1.	Increasing clean energy production. The Project will contribute an additional 270MWac toward Mexico's stated target of 35% clean energy generation by 2024. 
2.	Diversifying the energy matrix. The Project will help Mexico unlock its resource rich solar power generation potential, which was less than 1% of the energy mix in the country (2017 statistics). 
3.	Demonstration Effect. As one of the first large fully merchant solar PV projects to be constructed in the Occidental region, the Project has the potential to serve as a benchmark for future solar PV developments and successful interface with the Wholesale Electricity Market.

title: Africa Dvpt III
content: The Fund will achieve development impact by: (i) investing in high-growth companies, which is expected to lead to above-average rates of job creation; (ii) supporting regional integration by expanding investee companies into neighboring countries; (iii) providing much needed growth and expansion capital and value enhancing advice to companies located throughout Africa (mainly IDA countries); and, (iv) improving companies' sustainable development by helping to implement best practice corporate governance and environmental and social standards.

title: Bank of Georgia SME Loan
content: The Project would support one of the leading private banks having a good geographical coverage in SME segment. The proceeds will be used for financing SMEs and women-owned SMEs, supporting their access to long term local currency funding. IFC's funding would help Bank of Georgia in responding to its clients' long-term funding needs while matching maturities more effectively. The Project would strengthen IFC's role of increasing access to finance for women by partnering with a financially sustainable bank by supporting it in areas of strategic interest such as banking on women.

title: Frida
content:
(i) Project Impact - Stakeholders: IFC anticipates that the Project will contribute to close the significant financing gap for WSMEs in Brazil, where 30% of WMSMEs find themselves to be financially constrained. The Project will leverage on Santander's position and distribution network to expand access to finance for WSMEs. 

(ii) Market Impact - Competitiveness: The Project should demonstrate to other lenders the business opportunity presented by under-served WSMEs, leading to replication that will improve competitiveness through an increased offering of financial services and products for WSMEs.

title: Garanti RO SEF
content: Expected high development impact will be derived from climate mitigation effect, since supporting expansion in the sustainable energy finance area will lead into a decrease in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions. Additionally, the project is expected to lead into improved competitiveness in this segment, as IFC will be supporting the Bank to promote climate-smart products for the first time. Further impact is related to increasing access to finance for SMEs, an underserved segment of the market.

title: Loan CS MEXCO II
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to financial services for underserved mid-cap companies in Mexico. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater market integration via demonstration and replication channels.

title: Lekela EG Wind 1
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact as it will (i) further enhance Egypt's power system reliability by adding ca. 1120 GWh of generation capacity per annum; (ii) diversify the country's fuel mix and generate renewable energy capacity; and (iii) reduce Green House Gas ("GHG") emissions and displace ca. 1.2 million tons of carbon dioxide per annum, a key contributor to Egypt's Paris Agreement commitments.

title: Golden Grass
content:
Project Impact - Stakeholders: The Project aims to close the country's wide SME finance gap by enabling Bradesco to offer financing options to small and medium size enterprises ("SMEs") organized under the APL (Arranjos Produtivos Locais). Bradesco has a strong track record of serving clients across the country, including regions such as the North and Northeast of Brazil. 

Market Impact - Integration: The Project will enhance financial connectivity within the SME financing market and thus strengthen the SME value chain by demonstrating to other lenders operational efficiency gained through the partnership with APLs.

title: SaMi 2018
content: The most significant, expected Project-level outcomes vary by country: in Argentina, these represent employment preservation in a frontier region and generation of foreign revenues during a macroeconomic crisis; in Uruguay, they relate to expansion of high-value agriculture accompanied by job creation and export growth; in Peru, they focus on significant yield improvements that enhance sector competitiveness and reduce environmental impacts of production. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote greater global market integration for Uruguay's citrus sector.

title: KEB Hana Indonesia Rights Issue IV
content:
Project level impact: 

-	Stakeholders- Improved access to finance for SME clients: The SME sector is underbanked and characterized by a relatively low level of debt. SMEs refrain from bank borrowing due to the high collateral requirements, complex procedures, stringent operational and reporting requirements and high interest rates. KHI plans to address this gap by prudently increasing provision of finance to un/underbanked SMEs in Indonesia in a structured, innovative, efficient and sustainable manner. This increase in SME lending is likely to contribute to economic growth, job creation, and poverty reduction.

-	Stakeholders - Improved quality of financial services through digital financial services: The proposed project is expected to benefit end beneficiaries by expanding digital financial services ("DFS") and by incorporating data analytics in underwriting, resulting in better client-oriented product development and cost-efficient distribution of higher quality services. The project will strengthen last mile delivery and servicing of SME clients in an efficient, cost-effective, and sustainable manner.

Market level impact:

-	Competitiveness: KHI is a midsize bank in Indonesia. The digital trend is unstoppable. Technology is disrupting Indonesian banks. Compared to traditional banks, financial technology companies are faster in deploying new technology and providing better customer experience. Customers are evolving, and banks must adapt to stay relevant. The project is expected to result in improved digital financial services and innovative product development for SME finance. It is anticipated, this would promote competition in the market and incentivize other banks to introduce customer focused products and efficient delivery mechanisms.

title: Ferrum I
content: The most significant expected Project-level impact is derived from: (i) economy-wide effects through expansion of local manufacturing capacity and improved productivity; (ii) environmental and resource efficiency via more efficient production processes.

title: Verod III
content:
IFC would (i) play a key catalytic role, especially at the First Close (ii) The Fund will benefit from implementation of the Social and Environmental Management System and promoting the adoption
of IFC's E&S standards across the investee companies especially in the FCS countries like Gambia, Sierra Leone and Liberia which lack fund managers to drive ESG improvements; (iii) IFC will provide additional financing to investee companies through debt/equity co-investments; (iv) improved governance through IFC's continued active intervention on the Advisory Committee.

title: Ayiti Leasing
content:
1.	Institutional capacity building and strengthening of the financial system in Haiti, an FCS country, by supporting the first leasing company in the country through an investment and advisory program focusing on technical expertise, improving corporate governance, and catalyzing the creation of a leasing market in Haiti.

2.	Support the growth of the productive sectors of the Haitian economy by expanding and increasing access to finance to served and underserved segments, focusing on SMEs. The SME Finance forum estimates that the total credit gap in Haiti amounts to almost US$2.5 billion, with 49% of MSMEs reporting that they are either under or unserved by financial institutions and 35% of MSMEs reported lack of access to finance as major barrier to growth.

title: Voyager
content:
i.	Access to and Usage of Transaction Accounts: The project will support the roll-out of a mobile wallet that allows users to carry out financial transactions, including domestic remittances, bill payment, airtime load, etc., on their phones in a cost efficient and convenient manner, thereby deepening financial access for the population 
ii.	Integration - IFC anticipates that the project will result in significant market integration by linking mobile wallet users to a growing array of digital financial and non-financial services, including e-commerce. Voyager's open-loop approach allows for interoperability of transactions and provides access to both traditional and digital accounts, integrating its users into the digital economy. 
iii.	Competitiveness - As a leading innovator in the market, Voyager will foster competitiveness in the financial sector by triggering changes in the market through the use of its low-cost, open-loop payment platform, which will push its competitors to innovate and offer new products and services at lower costs.

title: Belgrade Airport
Xiaomi MCC Loan
Yellow Door
content:
- Stakeholders impacts - The project will enhance affordability and serve towards ensuring cost efficiency for off-takers by introducing distributed generation systems. 
- Environmental impact - The project will contribute to reduction of GHG emissions
- Enhancing Resilience - The project will contribute to increased resilience in the power market, especially in Jordan and growth market areas, where power generation is heavily dependent on fossil fuel. 
- Enhancing competitiveness: The Project will help demonstrate the viability of distributed renewable energy generation as a disruptive technology in growth markets

title: Shadowfax
content:
1. Employment: SF currently has an extensive network of 30,000+ delivery partners on its platform and plans to increase this to more than 1 Mn over the next 5 years. 
1.1. SF is playing a key role in creating entry level jobs for people coming into the delivery sector. Drivers are trained by SF and have an opportunity to learn how to work with customers across different categories. There is high driver turnover in this sector, with drivers moving across platforms. Drivers, with skill sets developed through SF have the opportunity of being hired by large employers such as Amazon, Flipkart that offer a career path (at fulfilment centers, etc.) in addition to the upward mobility SF offers its drivers.
1.2. Driver payouts on SF are about 40% higher than their most recent jobs and comparable options in delivery logistics since they have increased access to delivery opportunities and improved capacity utilization (current estimate of idle load rides in last mile logistics is 60%).
1.3. Drivers can also opt to work part time by choosing to deliver orders during certain time slots. This provides them flexibility and   helps in supplementing their regular income. SF also offers drivers an option of collecting payouts on a weekly/ biweekly basis, which is not common in the unorganized last mile delivery market, and digital payments to drivers further decreases informality

2. Market Impact: SF contributes to market creation by (i) tech-enabling the sector and developing innovations in key aspects of logistics (example reverse logistics) and by (ii) systematically training delivery staff. IFC believes that SF is best placed to improve this market compared to incumbents and competing platforms due to its superior technological integration and optimization capabilities. As the Company scales and aggregates more drivers and customers onto its platform, it is expected that its digital platform will increase price transparency and efficiency in the broader sector. Other competitors and aggregators will be forced to compete on pricing and improve their game with regards to their technological capabilities and product offering or risk losing market share. Additionally, it is expected that the role of brokers and intermediaries in the sector will diminish, which will improve overall price transparency and efficiency. While the sector has already undergone some consolidation, IFC anticipates that this will continue as SF emerges as the dominant platform in the sector. Through a demonstration effect, new platforms that have the same level of technological sophistication as SF could emerge, which will foster more competition as the platforms compete to take market share by constantly improving service standards and driving down market wide logistics costs. Furthermore, SF will help grow the relatively nascent ecommerce last mile logistics sector. While the demand for last mile delivery has grown tremendously over the past years (driven by the rise in ecommerce), the market is still in the process of being created.

3. Helping SMEs:   SF currently serves enterprise clients and independent SMEs including small retail stores, small local restaurants and franchisee outlets of restaurant chains. It provides an efficient and distributed hyperlocal logistics platform to SMEs for serving evolving customer needs of faster and cheaper product delivery through an online to offline channel (O2O model). SF offers prices that are 30%-40% cheaper and aims to increase their access to markets in Tier II, III and IV cities by giving them the option to deliver next day to customer.  By helping SMEs with an online presence provide the same level of service as large retailers, SF can help make these SMEs more competitive. SF is currently in 80+ cities in India and is rapidly and actively increasing its geographic coverage - as of FY17, they were in 20+ cities. SF has served ~7,000 SMEs since inception and is targeting to reach to 100,000 SMEs by 2022.

title: Kobo360
content:
This Project will result in positive outcomes for the relevant parties in the logistics sector in Nigeria (cargo owners and truck owners/drivers) and the market at large. 

For cargo owners, Kobo's platform offers greater access to logistics services through an aggregated platform thereby addressing capacity challenges in fulfilling market demand. By leveraging technology and eliminating middle-men/brokers, Kobo is able to offer lower prices to cargo owners in a market where logistics costs are 1.4-2.8x higher than in the US. In addition, Kobo offers reliability of delivery to cargo owners through real-time tracking of trucks and goods in transit insurance hence ensuring full traceability of goods. 

For truck owners and drivers, Kobo offers increased capacity utilization through route optimization and return logistics hence higher incomes for drivers as well as faster payment cycles.

As the company scales and aggregates more drivers and cargo owners onto the platform, Kobo will bring more price transparency and efficiency to the broader sector.

title: OCB Woman Loan
content: The development impact of the proposed project is delivered through (i) the increase of access to finance for local SMEs, including women-owned SMEs, (ii) promote competitiveness through market-wide adoption of client-centric business model based on sound risk management, including commitment to international standards in risk management and compliance to Basel 2 principles.

title: Metro Myanmar
content:
Stakeholder impact:The Company will source around 50% of its products locally, largely from SMEs. thereby creating a large and reliable source of demand for those suppliers, broadening their market, and give other smaller suppliers a chance to develop and become competitive. These suppliers will also work with small and marginal farmers across the country to help promote modern practices like contract farming, smart input use and post-harvest management thereby increasing their productivity and enabling them to sell their produce at remunerative prices.The Company will improve the local distribution and logistics infrastructure; and introduce higher standards and efficient delivery practices for its clients. This is expected to result in lower prices of quality products for end consumers.The Project is expected to create more than 200 jobs during operations as well as many indirect jobs in the services sector. MWML will contribute to sector formalization and increased tax revenues for the government through transparent tax collection practices. 

Market impact: 

By investing in training, and implementation of international standards for local suppliers and service providers, the Company will contribute to better integrating them in domestic and possibly regional markets. This can help positively impact the local agriculture sector.

title: DCM TMRC Investment
content:
Job creation: through the proposed Project, IFC will promote creation of indirect and induced jobs through construction of residential houses in Tanzania. 
Accessibility and affordability of housing finance: the proposed Project will allow TMRC to offer longer tenor funding to PMLs in Tanzania which in turn will enable PMLs to offer longer-term mortgage loans to borrowers, ultimately increasing access and affordability of mortgages.
Market integration: the proposed Project is expected to contribute to a greater deepening of the capital markets in Tanzania through attracting more liquidity, diversifying market participants, and lengthening the corporate bond yield curve.

title: CLN S-Africa II
content: The most significant project-level outcome is (i) increased value addition resulting from greater localization, which will improve customer access to a more reliable supply of good quality automotive components and parts built to the highest standards, (ii) a continuing focus on proactive career development opportunities that provide increased participation of women in more technical roles. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will promote sector integration via value addition in the local economy, introduction of new processes products, and skills upgrading which will contribute to increasing value chain integration.

title: Progresemos V
content: The most significant expected project-level outcome is an increase in access to finance for micro and SE clients in 1,592 municipalities in 32 Mexican states with 92% of its clients in rural areas by 2020. IFC expects the Project to help Progresemos expand its unique co-financing model and reach an increased number of currently underfunded, Micro and SEs including women entrepreneurs; it expects to reach 450,000 microenterprises, and 1,500 small enterprises while the tripling the outstanding loan portfolio from USD80 million in 2017 to USD245 million in 2022 for micro enterprises and from USD 13.3 million in 2017 to USD 95 million in 2022 for small enterprises. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the Project investment will have the potential to promote greater market inclusiveness via innovation, capacity building, and demonstration and replication channels.

title: Ipak Yuli WCS
content:
1.	IFC anticipates the Project will contribute to improved access to working capital for MSMEs, a sector which is the key driver of economic development and job opportunities in the country. MSMEs play an important role in generating job opportunities in Uzbekistan as they provided about 80 percent of the total employment as of YE2017. IYB is one of the leading banks for MSMEs in Uzbekistan. These clients account for approximately 76 percent of IYB's loan portfolio. The IFC's WCS facility complemented by the GTFP line is expected to enable access to working capital to more than 9,000 MSMEs.
2.	The Project will have the following market impact: i) Competitiveness: IFC anticipates that the Project will result in an increase in competitiveness in the banking sector of Uzbekistan through the strengthening of a private bank in an environment dominated by state owned banks, ii) Integration: IFC anticipates that the Project will enhance integration of the Uzbekistan's banking system into the global financial system, that is currently one of the government's main objectives. The Project will also foster the improvement of environmental and social sustainability principles adopted by the Bank.

title: Hospital Aleman
content:
Project-level Impact: Improve access to quality care through an increase in Hospital Aleman's capacity (+104 beds). This will improve treatment coverage in Oncology, Cardiology, Intensive Care and Surgery throughout Argentina, as patients typically travel to Buenos Aires for treatment.

Market Impact: Increased resilience of the Argentinian Healthcare system.

title: SGBL SSL MCPP
content:
The potential development impact of the Project is composed of the following:

The Project will help contribute towards increasing access to finance to SMEs, which represent the backbone of Lebanon's economy by contributingabout 40% of GDP, but remain underfunded.

title: Trans Corpora
content: By expanding access to modern retail, tourism and leisure infrastructure in the country's less developed regions, the Project will (i) promote food affordability and safety, (ii) support SMEs along the retail value chain, (iii) improve job quality, increase wages and other associated benefits as well as female participation in the workforce, (iv) improve energy efficiency, especially in new buildings, through green building certification; (v) increase tax revenues for the government and (vi) enhance social and economic benefits from the development of integrated sustainable communities in under-served regions.

title: Acajutla LNG
content: The Project is expected to: (i) lower El Salvador's dependency on imported oil; (ii) complement the introduction of renewable power into the system, (iii) provide energy security to foster long-term sustainable economic growth in the country; (iv) reduce greenhouse gas emissions; (v) reduce electricity prices which will increase competitiveness of the country's various industries including manufacturing and services; (vi) contribute to the El Salvador's economy through tax contributions and job creation; and (vii) create a regional gas hub to potentially enable the introduction of natural gas for industrial and transport clients, while also diversifying away from other more carbon intensive fuel sources.

title: Upper Trishuli-1
content:
The Project is expected to have positive impacts at both a sector and project level:

(i) Demonstration effect: First, UT1's PDA and PPA are expected to become model project documents for FDI in Nepal's hydropower sector. Second, efforts on managing cumulative impacts, impact on aquatic habitat and benefit sharing through local share ownership are expected to set a sustainable benchmark for future hydropower development.

(ii) Increased electricity generation: The Project is expected to supply baseload power for domestic consumption of 1,446 GWh per year to reach about 9 million people and reduce dependence on power imports. A large share (nearly 40%) of UT1's output is expected to be in the dry season, which includes the peak winter demand months. 

(iii) Climate change mitigation and adaptation: The Project includes substantial capital expenditures for design elements that improve the Project's resilience to potential climate change impacts. 

(iv) Benefits to local economy and livelihood: The Project's benefits include construction-phase employment of 1,100 workers, a local skills training program, 0.5% of Project costs for community development, up to 10% of Company shares offered to Project Affected People, and 20 kWh of monthly free rural power given to nearby/eligible households.

title: Sabadell Mex
content:
(i) Competitiveness: In the highly concentrated banking system in Mexico, the entrance of Sabadell Spain is expected to help foster higher competition in the corporate banking and project finance space, particularly in tourism (hotels) and green investments.
(ii) Sustainability: The project will contribute on the development of sustainable finance in Mexico, with a special focus on tourism (hotels) and green buildings.

title: Srinivasa Farms
content:
The project is expected to have the following development impacts: 
a) Farmers: A greater number of contract farmers engaged in broiler production will benefit from stable access to key inputs and expertise as well as reliable off-take, which help improve and stabilize their incomes. The layer farmers will benefit from access to quality inputs (DOCs and feed) which should have a positive impact on profitability of their operations. Smallholder producers of maize and soybeans will gain improved access to market as the company increases its feed production.
b) Employees: The Company's expansion will create over 5,000 jobs directly and ensure working conditions that are in line with IFC Performance Standards, which will constitute an improvement over prevalent industry practices. Potentially twice as many jobs would be created along with the value chain, contributing to skill building and non-farm employment. A high share of employment created in the poultry sector tends to be at the bottom of pyramid (BOP).
c) Consumers: The consumers will benefit from increased access to quality processed poultry products that meet food safety standards in a market that is largely dominated by open air sales.

title: Mariupol Buses
content: Users access and service reliability: Renewal and significant increase of the City's municipal bus fleet with modern, efficient, safe and environmentally friendly large capacity units. The Project will increase ridership capacity, which will help MTTU serve growing demand for public transport (including pensioners and veterans),  and ensure reliability of bus services. 2. Bus service quality: Service standards will be improved in 62% of MTTU expanded fleet which will enable the provision of comfortable, efficient, and safe bus services. 3. Environment: Environmental benefits will include a reduction in CO2 emissions due to the replacement of outdated fleet and improved fleet utilization. 4. Resilience: The Project, along with advisory services, will promote systemic modification to pricing of bus transport service enabling cost recovery and promoting financial viability of public service. The Project is going to set incentives to improve the declining quality of private bus operators service. 5. Sustainability: The Project will enable systemic changes in 35% of Mariupol's municipal transport service by fostering the adoption of European environmental standards, such as fleet compliance with Euro 5 diesel, and with potential for replication to private service operators.

title: Riau IPP
content:
Project-level outcomes 
Stakeholder effects - IFC anticipates that the Project will help address some of the supply shortage in the country, especially in Sumatra. The Project is among the first batch of gas-fired IPPs being tendered by PLN under the "35GW Program", a national policy priority to scale up generation capacity. The supply of power in Indonesia has not been able to keep pace with rapid electricity demand, and the project will help address some of the supply shortage in the country by adding 275MW of generation capacity.
 Environmental effect: The Project will add to the thermal generation capacity in Indonesia. There could be a potential net a reduction in the CO2 intensity in the island if the plant displaces more polluting sources of generation but needs to be substantiated. 

Contribution to market creation 
Competitiveness - The Project could contribute to market competitiveness by supporting a local private player expand their market share. The Project also represents the first entry into the Indonesia power generation space by the Thai JV partner - a leading IPP in Thailand. The total installed power generation capacity in Indonesia at the end of 2015 was 55.5GW, of which 38.9GW (70 percent) is state-owned. The Project has the potential to lead to positive demonstration effects for other IPPs and private investors to enter the Indonesian energy market.

title: Abank SME
content:
The key development impact of the proposed project is increased access to
finance for SMEs in the Republic of Turkey, as well as to the women owned SMEs, thus contributing to economic growth, market resilience, and job creation in the country.

title: Cruzeiro Growth
content:
Project Level: The Project will mostly benefit students as the main stakeholders of educational institutions. By financing Cruzeiro's expansion, the University can increase the supply of quality education programs for those acquired institutions. Though Cruzeiro always maintains the name and characteristics of the regional university, Cruzeiro can add product diversity, bringing their high scored quality programs to the acquired institutions (subject to regulatory review). This has been done previously by Cruzeiro, increasing enrollment. Cruzeiro has committed to raising the standards of the acquired universities, requesting accreditation if the university lacks it, so the acquired university will be homologous to existing Cruzeiro accredited entities. Cruzeiro can provide virtual education undergraduate degrees, if not offered by the acquired institutions. They have a competitive advantage in virtual education, being the third largest provider of virtual education in the country, with some programs ranked at the top level, like human resources management or public policy. The students in these regions will benefit from the much lower tuition rates of distance learning, at 67% lower cost than tuition in presence studies, with the recognition of the Cruzeiro brand and quality. These students, mostly working adults, will now be able to attend tertiary studies, for they can adapt to the flexible hours that distance learning allows, and can afford tuition out-of-pocket, without the need of financial aid or government loans. The acquired universities will also improve their operational and administrative standards, by accessing the platform of shared services that connects all Cruzeiro institutions (e.g. virtual library with +300,000 titles and electronic documents, employability tools to aid in the mandatory internship search (estgio), academic content online for a myriad of courses).

Market Creation: This Project will create competitive pressure in quality tertiary education, in the geographical regions where Cruzeiro currently operates and in the newer geographies where it is expanding, either by acquisitions or by setting up virtual education centers (polos). In the economic slowdown affecting Brazil, many youths in the 18-34-year age bracket are working rather than studying. Cruzeiro is expanding the market by providing the option of tertiary education to a population that was discouraged to enroll, due to the higher costs and demanding hours. Between the Northeast and South areas, there are 8.6m potential students in this age bracket, with no higher education degree. Cruzeiro has regulatory approval to open 750   distance centers nationwide (in addition to the existing 505 that they currently operate), that could cater to this population, and double enrollment. Cruzeiro began its distance offering recently, in 2015, and has rapidly reached 111,800 students, becoming the third largest player, with an estimated 8% share of this student enrollment. It can demonstrate the path for other universities to follow for high standards in distance learning and provide a quality service to students. These high standards are exemplified with Cruzeiro's use of innovative learning methods, used to build capacity in all its programs. Cruzeiro uses advanced technology tools like Blackboard, chatBots, machine learning and predictive analytics to upload/download content, control attendance and testing, reduce drop-out rates, improve tutoring sessions. Cruzeiro raises the quality levels of distance learning; it has 11% of its distance courses certified with the highest course score grade of 5 and 73% certified with a grade of 4. Cruzeiro enhances the campus experience in virtual education, providing use of its infrastructure to students enrolled in virtual education (libraries, IT centers, community space, 70 physical tutors on sites, all testing on site).

title: Jungle Fund III
content:
