i) Addressing the gap in Series A+ funding in SEA by providing investee companies with access to scarce financing, allowing job creation, knowledge transfer and growth amongst SMEs.
ii)Support and develop innovation, technology and entrepreneurs in SEA by supporting growing internet companies in the region focused on delivering consumption upgrade and improving efficiency and digitization among businesses, especially among SMEs.

title: ESIP Liftit 2018
content:
-	Support the Growth of SMEs: Liftit's services supports the development of SMEs by reducing their freight costs. As the Company grows, it expects to positively impact hundreds of more SMEs across Latin America.  
-	Improving Livelihoods of Drivers: Lifit currently has almost 3,000 drivers on their platform, of which a majority use the Company as their sole tech-enabled delivery platform, making it their main source of income. Liftit improves the average driver's income by 57%, and provides other benefits including access to digital banking products, cash advances for gasoline purchases and discounts for truck parts.
-	Reduced GHG Emissions: Through route optimization and eventually consolidation of loads, the Company reduces the amount of trucks needed, leading to reduced GHG emissions and delivery-induced congestion.

title: DARP SPV Altus Regional Facility
content:
Project-level Impact: 
1) Stakeholder effect for local companies in distress:  provide financing to stressed but viable companies, often highly leveraged with deteriorating earnings and limited access to bank financing, across target markets and in diversified sectors.

2) Stakeholder effect for financial institutions: enable banks and other financial institutions to reduce their exposure to distressed assets on their balance sheets and recycle capital towards new lending.  

Market-level Impact and Market Creation:
1) Integration: establishment of a regional cross-border platform which will increase efficiency, scale, and knowledge transfer, as compared to local DA platforms. Currently, in the largely fragmented DA market, there are only a handful of experienced DA investors at a regional level.

2) Resilience: increase access to long-term equity-type funding, support of the formalization of the DA market in the region, and attract other investors to the DA market. Through AltusRF, IFC will finance these entities to help meet their financial obligations, achieve sustainable growth and contribute to job creation and economic stability.

title: BT B3T2 Bond
Contabilizei
content: The project directly benefits SMEs in Brazil, which is one of the ten most complex countries in the world with respect to tax compliance for business, according to the World Bank's <e2>??Doing Business Index'. By using technology, Contabilizei significantly reduces average monthly accounting cost fees, relieving capital for other more productive uses for SMEs.

title: Camlin
content:
a)	Improved Access: The Project will ensure availability of diphenols and produce a range of their derivatives, such as antioxidants, performance chemicals and aroma chemicals which are used in food products, supplements, animal feed, pharmaceuticals and agrochemicals. The demand for anti-oxidants is growing due to the centralized mass production of food and feed, ageing population, change in lifestyles, and increasing consciousness of health among the end consumers. The Project will help address the shortage of diphenols which hinders the growth of the sectors that heavily rely on the derivatives. 

b)	Lower Prices: The cost of production of diphenols at the Dahej facility is expected to be lower than the cost at existing diphenols plant in Italy. IFC expects some of the cost savings to translate into lower price for the customers. 

c)	Employment: The Project will create high skilled jobs and allow for skills upgrading of the local employees through training and technology transfer from the facility in Italy to the Dahej plant.  

d)	Environmental Effects: The new plant in Dahej will have higher efficiency in terms of waste management, greenhouse gas emissions, energy consumption and other operational efficiencies as compared to Camlin's existing plant in Italy. 

e)	Competitiveness: The Project will help Camlin innovate new product formulations that improve the quality of specialty chemicals and make the manufacturing process more cost effective, more customized to meet local needs, and environmentally friendly.

title: Riverwood III
content: The main project outcome is expected to be an increase in growth capital for investee companies, which, supported by Riverwood, are expected to achieve strong growth. The main contribution to market creation is an increased digital economy integration in LAC through the support of technology and tech-enabled companies.

title: Stanbic Bank Zambia SL
content:
Increased access to finance: IFC's investment will provide much-needed funding to the agribusiness sector, SMEs and WSMEs in the country through a first-rate bank. It will help SMEs and WSMEs grow and stabilize their businesses, create more jobs and contribute more effectively to boosting productive economic activity.

Promotion of best market practices: IFC's investment will support the sustainable growth of the Bank in Zambia, ensuring that it continues to adopt and promote best practices in the Zambian banking sector, especially given its affiliation to a top emerging market banking group.

title: Roojai
content:
1.	Improved accessibility and affordability of insurance through collection of additional risk factors, user friendly online platforms and the introduction of installment payment plans. Technology and processes further reduce pain points associated with insurance usage.

2.	Improved market competitiveness through sophisticated underwriting models and policy design that incentivizes users to engage in behavior that is associated with lower claims. This is expected to introduce more competitive pressures in the market and prompt traditional insurers to experiment with lower cost distribution models and ways to decrease loss ratios.

title: Chenguang Bio
content:
Development Impact:
- To consumers, the Project is expected to deliver high quality natural ingredients at a larger scale, which will in turn be used in various consumer goods, such as healthcare products, processed foods, cosmetics etc. 

- To employees, the Project can create new knowledge of production technologies and train staff to fill gaps in the current job market that is facing a shortage of highly skilled talents in food manufacturing and safety monitoring.

- To suppliers and distributors, the Project will engage various actors, domestic and global, in the value chain for products and services. It will also help improve the quality standards of food exporters in China.

Market Impact:

By supporting a global provider of natural pigments and extracts that generates 30+% of revenue through exports, IFC hopes to raise the quality and competitiveness of natural ingredients that are used broadly in industrial value chains, to increase visibility of Chinese companies with sophisticated technologies, to promote South-South investment between China and India.

title: Twiga Foods
content:
This Project will result in positive outcomes for key stakeholders in the agricultural supply chain (farmers and vendors) and the environment at large. 
 - Smallholder farmers: The Project will (i) increase access to markets through guaranteed off-take (ii) increase prices (iii) increase efficiency through transparent pricing, swift digital payments and technical assistance, which will result in increased productivity
 - Small Scale Vendors: The Project will (i) increase access to supply (ii) improve quality of produce (iii) improve productivity, which will result in increased vendor incomes
 - Reduce Post-Harvest Food Loss: The Project's post-harvest food loss rate is expected to be 5%, significantly lower than the 30% in the traditional market.

The Project will also result in improved market outcomes by increasing competition in the sector through innovative channels which compel industry players to improve on quality and pricing of produce in order to compete. The Project will enhance integration of different stakeholders in the agricultural value chain working towards increasing farmer productivity. In addition, the Project could increase access to new services (e.g. credit) by reducing informality and demonstrating that farmers can be reached in a commercially sustainable way through technology

title: Garanti Bank DCM Gender Bond
content: The Project will support one of the leading private banks having a good geographical coverage and product coverage in micro and SME segment. The proceeds will be used for financing small business owned by women, supporting their access to long term funding. Garanti has the strongest banking on women program in Turkey and this transaction will further contribute to its track record of serving women customers and business owners. Furthermore, around 46 percent of the banking sector's foreign exchange funding matures in less than a year. IFC's funding would help Garanti in responding to its clients' long term funding needs while matching maturities more effectively. The Project would strengthen IFC's role of increasing access to finance for women by partnering with a financially sustainable bank (2nd largest Turkish private bank by assets) by supporting it in areas of strategic interest such as banking on women. IFC will continue to help developing Turkey's capital markets through the issuance of a new instrument- the country's first gender bond issuance in local currency.

title: WCS2 GIME Bank
content: The Project is expected to increase access to financing for tourism, agriculture, micro finance and small & cottage industry sectors in Nepal, a sector which is financially deprived due to the low supply of credit. Financing is necessary to finance their daily business operations, source supplies, pay employees and support capital expenditure. Further, this growth will ultimately facilitate job creation and income generation for the Nepalese economy.

title: China YuHua Education Corporation Limited
content:
1. Increase access to quality tertiary education: The Project will increase access to quality private undergraduate and vocational education in frontier regions of China.
2. Improve students' employability and competitiveness: Through its focus on applied curriculum, YuHua strives to achieve a high level of employment and competitiveness for its university students, equipping them with practical knowledge and experience.
3. Demonstration effect: Through the Project, YuHua is raising the bar for quality tertiary education in China, demonstrating that employment-linked tertiary education model can be financially sustainable.

title: Mbiza Blueberries
content:
At the project level, the IFC investment will create new jobs, train potential future employees and out growers, and ensure land is managed sustainability as blueberry production expands. IFC expects the proposed transaction will create more than 200 new permanent jobs and 2,000 new seasonal jobs in South Africa. The farmland expansion will include drip-irrigation to ensure water efficiency, fertigation, soil analysis and variable speed pumps to ensure efficiency of energy demand. The Government will benefit from this project through an increase in taxes, foreign exchange revenues and job creation. 
On a more broader market level, Mbiza's successful penetration in the global blueberry market will showcase South Africa's emergence as a new production center of blueberries in the Southern Hemisphere and create a new export industry for the country. The development of this new industry will not only create large-scale employment in the rural areas of South Africa but also contribute to the diversification of exportable fruit agri-production sites in the country (away from the Cape area where agriculture production sites are concentrated).

title: DCM TMB SMEGreen
ESIP Vezeeta
content:
-	Improved access to quality care by lowering the transaction costs of finding relevant doctors and specialists. Through Vezeeta, patients are able to search for doctors based specialty, location, gender, etc. This is particularly relevant for patients who would otherwise struggle to find doctors to meet their needs, such as female patients who prefer female doctors (+20% of the doctors on the Vezeeta are female) and rural patients seeking medical care (represent 19% of the bookings). 
-	Increased transparency and accountability through doctor details and rating system, which in turn improves health outcomes and patient welfare.
-	Enhanced connectivity within the broader healthcare system through roll-out of new and future products including pharma detailing, doctor-to-doctor referrals, lab integration, etc.

title: Apis Growth Fund II
content: (i) The growth of the Fund's investee companies is expected to result in job creation and economic growth; (ii) private sector development and market creation through the Fund's investment into financial services and financial infrastructure investees that will have a measure of financial inclusion in target geographies across Africa and Asia; and (iii) the implementation of best-practice corporate governance, and social and environmental standards at the investee company level.

title: Azure RG
content:
1. Increasing clean energy production: The Project will contribute to meeting the country's energy demand by using an environmentally friendly source of energy.  
2. Climate change mitigation: IFC's investment will support clean energy production with associated avoidance of GHG emissions.

title: Canvest Corporate Loan
content:
1) Address waste disposal issues and associated negative environmental externalities while increasing the use of renewable energy.
2) Support private player in the waste-to-energy sector and help promote competition in a market that remains dominated by state-owned enterprises. 
3) Support frontier region development, including Guangxi, Jiangxi, and Sichuan Provinces.

title: Genesis Fund II
content:
a.	Through its investments, the Fund will help support the transition of the Chinese economy from a manufacturing to an increasingly innovation and technology driven one. The Fund will support the use of advanced information technology to improve efficiencies of the traditional industries such as retail, enterprise services, logistics/transportation, healthcare, and education.
b.	Knowledge transfer and sharing of best practices: The Fund is expected to provide strong and comprehensive support through its board positions on portfolio companies to develop and improve their environmental and social practices and level of corporate governance.

title: Twin Palms Mall
content: The Projects will contribute to economic growth and urban development through:(i) Jobs: direct and indirect employment opportunities for local communities during the construction and operations including jobs created or maintained throughout the supply chain (SMEs). Construction workers learn advanced construction methods and safety standards from a high-quality South African developer.(ii) Consumers: access to higher quality goods for the low-to-middle income and base of pyramid population in an underserved area (i.e. through supermarket anchors with higher food quality/safety standards that are currently unavailable in the immediate area).(iii) Green building: Novare has indicated a willingness to adopt EDGE where possible within its development pipeline.

title: Time Technoplast
content:
The expected development impact for the project is the following: 
(i) Improved customer access to more packaging and other value-added products: 
(ii) Positive environmental effects due to recycling of polymer; and
(iii) Positive economywide effects due to creation of additional direct and indirect jobs.

title: Engro Polymer Phase 3
content: Implementation of the Project is expected to improve availability and affordability of high quality PVC resin and caustic flakes, strengthen competitiveness of local industries that consume these products, such as construction, housing, agriculture, and others, create jobs and enable transfer of technical and managerial know-how.

title: BUH Haiti
content:
1. Institutional capacity building and strengthening of the financial system in Haiti, an FCS country, by supporting a promising financial intermediary through an investment and advisory program focusing on improving risk management, corporate governance, and SMEs lending practices.

2. Support the growth of the productive sectors of the Haitian economy by expanding and increasing access to finance to served and underserved segments, focusing on SMEs. The SME Finance forum estimates that the total credit gap in Haiti amounts to almost US$2.5 billion, with 49% of MSMEs reporting that they are either under or unserved by financial institutions and 35% of MSMEs reported lack of access to finance as major barrier to growth.

title: Fairway WtE
content:
Sri Lanka as one of the countries disproportionately affected by climate change has signed a declaration in 2016 UNFCCC Conference of Parties to achieve 100% of electricity generation through renewable energy sources by 2050 at the latest. This is an ambitious target as the country currently has 52% of electricity generated through fossil fuels (mainly imported). Municipal solid waste is regarded a renewable energy source that can be converted to electricity generation through waste-to-energy incineration plants. Sri Lanka, is currently facing a severe municipal waste management issue with the prevalence of open dumpling which is hazardous and causes significant negative externalities to society and the economy. 
Within this context, the proposed project's market level development impact is likely to arise from improved sustainability by supporting the development of the first sizable WTE plant in the country. The successful implementation of the Project is expected to have demonstration effects on waste-to-energy as a solution for scalable waste treatment while also contributing to the country's renewable energy generation capacity that can be replicated by other developers. The project-level impact is likely to arise from stakeholder impacts by reducing public health risks created by open dumping and environmental effects realized through avoiding waste and associated methane from the reduction in waste from the sourced dumpsite.

title: Ananta Mixed Use
content:
-	Employment creation and knowledge transfer: The Project will create approximately 450 permanent jobs (including ~20% female jobs), as well as approximately 1000 temporary jobs during construction. It will also promote knowledge transfer to local staff through training in all areas of hotel operations, management of the residential tower, and operations of the commercial building. 
-	Indirect job creation and local supply chain linkages: The Project will generate incremental business and indirect jobs for domestic Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) in the value chain, construction material supply and services during implementation and  transportation, F&B suppliers and other service providers during operation. 
-	Increase in domestic revenues and foreign exchange: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange earnings from overseas travelers.
-	Competitiveness: The Project will increase the supply of business infrastructure, and given the high existing demand for it and lack of adequate similar property developments, has the potential to have demonstration effects in the sector and contribute to driving growth in the export sector and other economic activities in Bangladesh.

title: NDB Agri Loan
content:
1. Through the proposed project, NDB expects to provide access to finance to agriculture related MSMEs in Sri Lanka over the next 5 years.

2. The Project will also contribute towards climate resilience via climate smart agriculture.

3. Sustainable agri-finance will help address food security, job creation, and overall economic growth.

title: Produbanco Loan
content:
-	Project level impact: 
o	IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to finance for SMEs, an underserved segment in Ecuador and contribute to narrowing SME financing gap in the Country. With SMEs being the main source of employment in the country, the Project will also support the creation and/or sustainability of a significant amount of jobs in Ecuador.
o	The Project is expected to improve climate sustainability in Ecuador through reductions in GHG emissions, contributing to the country's objective of addressing the green financing gap.
-	Market level impact: 
o	The Project, along with the capacity building provided by IFC's Advisory Services will contribute to increase competition in the climate-finance market, enabling businesses to improve their efficiency and environmental impact through the implementation of climate smart practices/equipment, promoting greater market sustainability.

title: ABI SME RSF
content: The project aims to increase access to finance for SMEs. It seeks to foster banking sector inclusiveness across the countries where ABI is present by supporting the Group in its ambition to grow the amount of credit and types of banking products extended to SMEs. Increased access to finance is expected to help generate private sector growth by creating and/or maintaining employment opportunities. Further, ABI Group's alignment with IFC's environmental and social standards is expected to ultimately benefit the borrowing SMEs and the communities they operate in.

title: ABI AGRI RSF
content: The project aims to increase access to finance for Agricultural SMEs. It seeks to foster banking sector inclusiveness across the countries where ABI is present by supporting the Group in its ambition to grow the amount of credit and types of banking products extended to Agricultural SMEs. Increased access to finance is expected to help generate private sector growth by creating and/or maintaining employment opportunities. Further, ABI Group's alignment with IFC's environmental and social standards is expected to ultimately benefit the borrowing Agricultural SMEs and the communities they operate in.

title: HDB Financial Services
content:
Access to Microfinance & MSMEs: This Project will help in expanding the outreach of access to microfinance to lower end of MSMEs who have little or no access to formal sources of financing. HDB intends to grow its portfolio at an average CAGR of 30-35% over the next five years as well as grow its current customer base at a similar growth rate. 

2. Geographically balanced growth of microfinance: This Project will promote a more geographically balanced growth of microfinance in India by supporting an individual lending model for financing micro / small enterprises as well as small businesses.

title: Global Tea
content:
(i) Contribution to the development of Kenyan and Malawi agri-business industry by supporting a leading agribusiness player that conducts processing and value addition in local Kenya and Malawi markets for export to international markets, 
(ii) Employment generation and smallholder development in Kenya/Malawi.  In addition, the sourcing arrangements with smallholder farmers are likely to improve access to inputs, training and markets for these producers, including through potential support from IFC advisory; 
(iii) Export earnings for Malawi and Kenya (tea, coffee and macadamia) will provide value sources of foreign exchange for both countries, 
(iv) Support climate smart agricultural practices -  the project will assist the company to switch to renewable power for its Ngapani plantation in Malawi that is expected to reduce costs and carbon footprint.

title: China EDU Group
content:
1. Increase competitiveness and quality in private higher education and vocational training: The Project will contribute to the consolidation trend of the fragmented private higher education and vocational training in China, around the platforms with the highest-quality educational services. This consolidation is expected to catalyze a rise in standards across the sector.

2. Increase access to quality private higher education and vocational training and increase supply of work-ready graduates: The Project will increase access to affordable quality private higher education in China, increasing the supply of work-ready graduates to industries with shortages of qualified entry level staff. 

3. Improve instruction standard through enhanced professional development. The Project will establish a professional development center to deliver training and certification to teachers through professional development activities, including training sessions, webinars, workshops, and events, to help the teachers stay abreast of the changes in student demands, new teaching theories and methodologies and other trends.

4. Employment creation and enhanced local linkages: The Company is expected to directly employ a certain number of additional education professionals after the Project is completed including teachers and administrative staff, as necessary to operate schools. In addition, the Project will create numerous indirect employment opportunities for local communities, and will create demand for locally sourced inputs such as construction materials, and services such as transportation. A large proportion of those materials will be supplied by local MSMEs.

title: Central Fin Agri
content:
1. The project will provide funding to c. 10,000 MSMEs in the agricultural value chain in Sri Lanka over the next 5 years. 
2. This will contribute towards climate resilience via climate smart agriculture. 
3. Sustainable agri-finance will help address food security, job creation, and overall economic growth.

title: Magma Square
content: The proposed IFC investment in Magma Square is expected to result in the following benefits: (i) improvements in the urban infrastructure surrounding the commercial center; (ii) better consumer choices in view that the clustering of competitors facilitates price/offer comparisons and improves consumers' knowledge, resulting in higher quality goods available at lower prices for the customer; (iii) improvements in the quality of goods sold, especially food and fresh produce; (iv) increase in standards for hygiene and safety in product handling and storage;  (v) increase in business for and improvements in practices and standards of local product suppliers, especially food and fresh products that filter through to other retail formats; and (vi) creation of more than 1,000 direct and indirect jobs during the construction and operational stage.  In addition, as in many other malls, the proposed Project is expected to attract other developments to the area, creating a demonstration effect and contributing to the overall community development.

title: BPL Sr Loan
content:
Project-level development impacts: 

1)	Stakeholder impact: IFC anticipates that the project will increase access to finance for underserved SMEs, particularly those operating in the agricultural value chain, manufacturing, retail, and trade sectors. 
2)	Economy-wide effects: By supporting BPL's SME clients in their expansion, the project is expected to help contribute to job creation and economic growth.

Market-level development impact: 

1)	Competitiveness: BPL's unique product offering enables it to serve a segment of SMEs that cannot normally be reached by commercial banks. This project will enable BPL's specific product offering to become more widely available in the market, while also increasing the overall efficiency of serving this segment. 
2)	Inclusiveness: IFC anticipates that the Project will enable BPL to sustainably expand its financial services to under-served women-owned SMEs, thereby demonstrating their bankability and encouraging other financial institutions to also expand their services to this segment.

title: KHMF Equity&Loan
content:
1) Market Impact:
(a) Inclusiveness: The project will help to bridge the gap in finance to MSME finance gap in Myanmar, which in turn promote financial inclusion and deepening of the financial market through supporting KHMF's operational expansion in underserved segments. 
(b) Integration: The project will support KHMF to grow its operations in Myanmar through using mobile and hand-held devices to serve its target clients, thereby geographically integrating the market, including rural Myanmar. By establishing the viability of its new business model, KHMF could influence other players to emulate.
2) Stakeholders impact: The project supports KHMF that seeks financial leverage, infrastructure expansion and digitalization to increase the size of its lending operation and to achieve a sustainable scale to serve the underserved micro and VSE segments cost-effectively and sustainably by incorporating data analytics in its underwriting, new product development and rolling-out digital distribution channels.

title: Arohan Fin
content:
Access to Microfinance:
     This project will support the Company in expanding the outreach of access
     to microfinance to borrowers, especially low-income households, who have
     little or no access to formal sources of financing.
 Balanced growth of Microfinance: This investment will promote a more balanced growth of microfinance
     in India.

title: Alliance Loan
content:
1. Through the proposed project, Alliance expects to provide funding to an estimated 7,000 agriculture related MSMEs in Sri Lanka over the next 5 years.

2. This will contribute towards climate resilience via climate smart agriculture.

3. Sustainable agri-finance will help address food security, job creation, and overall economic growth.

title: Olam Smallholder Crop Financing
content: The key project impacts will be centered around the nearly 40,000 smallholder farmers supplying Olam who will benefit from reliable access to market, as well as finance and extension services, with positive implications on yield enhancement, optimal inputs usage and increased income. The farmers may also participate in the Olam Livelihood Charter, the relevant certifications, and Olam's digital farmer platform, to obtain better prices for products meeting certification requirements and also to ensure the sustainability of the supply chains. Olam's work with farmers also has the potential to generate more extensive market impacts by influencing the way other traders and integrators manage similar issues of competitiveness and sustainability.

title: DCM HKL LCY Bond
content:
Stakeholder Impact: 
-	The Project shall support HKL's financial capacity to increase local currency ("LCY") financing therefore leading to improved quality of finance better suited to the needs of MSMEs particularly women, farmers and borrowers in rural areas leading to increased economic activity. Hence it will likely help create indirect employment and jobs and contribute towards the World Bank Group's goal of reaching Universal Financial Access by 2020. 

Market Impact Assessment:
-	Integration: The Project will help develop a corporate bond market in Cambodia through market enabling channel, which will help mobilize domestic savings in LCY, and promoting local currency usage. 
-	IFC's investment in the first LCY bond issued by a MDI would support the creation of the domestic corporate bond market through demonstration of a new viable source of medium to long term LCY debt instrument. The local currency bond issuance would create a bond pricing benchmark in KHR. Additionally, an IFC offshore KHR issuance would also help to catalyze capital market development.
-	Increased usage of LCY financing would help lead to gradual de-dollarization. A high level of dollarization (i) increases the vulnerability of banks with respect to liquidity risk and (ii) limits the scope of the country's exchange rate and monetary policies. Promoting the use of LCY indirectly helps contribute towards a higher degree of exchange rate flexibility in the medium term, which would help the economy regain competitiveness in the context of US Dollar appreciation under dollarization.

title: HFCII_Aptus
content:
(i)	Providing housing to the economically weaker segments: Aptus is focused on providing access to housing finance to low income borrowers, specifically those employed in the informal sector such as self-employed entrepreneurs and un-organized sector salaried workers. This segment is largely ignored by the large HFCs and Banks owing to perceived higher risk profile of such borrowers and difficulty in credit assessment. IFC's investment will directly expand the availability of housing finance to the low income and relatively excluded customer segments.

(ii)	Increase competitiveness of smaller HFCs: The market is highly concentrated with top 5 HFCs having more than 70% market share.  By supporting a smaller HFC targeting affordable housing, IFC will increase their competitiveness, market share and promote growth of the segment.

title: DCM SCB CVA
content: The transaction would support Standard Chartered Bank's management of its derivatives-related Emerging Markets credit exposures.  These exposures often cannot be hedged using risk management products currently available in the international capital markets.  As a result, the amount of market risk management products that Standard Chartered Bank itself can offer its Emerging Markets clients is limited - given the increasing amounts of capital that needs to be allocated by banks to exposures arising from the provision of such products.  By enabling Standard Chartered Bank to hedge a portion of these credit exposures, IFC will free up capacity at the bank for it to provide more risk management solutions to its Emerging Markets clients - something that IFC would not be able to do on its own.  The portfolio - rather than name-by-name - hedging approach being used in this project should also prove relevant to other large banks who face constraints on the amount of credit exposure they can assume in the context of providing their emerging markets clients with market risk management solutions.

title: Agrofusion CL
content: The Company is an important provider of jobs in the rural area of Mykolayiv, where it has also supported a broader hub of economic activity. The project-level impact of the new investment is fairly modest as it focuses on incremental value addition rather than production base expansion. At the market level, the project has the potential to promote market competitiveness and integration. The innovative investment may attract replication from other market players, improving sector competitiveness as it diversifies its product offering and focuses on value addition.

title: Lithium
content:
Environmental Impact: IFC expects the Project to help in the avoidance of GHG emissions by introducing more EVs in urban transport and displacing fuel-based vehicles which are a significant source of India's GHG emissions. 

Stakeholder impact: IFC anticipates that the Project will help create jobs for about 8,000-10,000 drivers over the next five years. The Project will provide organized employment for drivers helping them with social mobility as the company provides its drivers opportunity and training to take on supervisor and trainer roles.  

Market Impact Assessment: i) Beyond the Project, the expansion of Lithium will promote sustainability in urban transport by demonstrating the viability and feasibility of EVs in the market; ii) the Project has the potential to facilitate the adoption of EVs and contribute to national carbon emission targets with potential demonstration effects for other players to follow with similar projects; and iii) the Project also supports the expansion of India's organized CET sector, which is fairly fragmented and unorganized.

title: Attijari Tunisie
content:
Expected Development Impact Outcome of the Project include:
(i) Increase access to finance: IFC's investment is expected to be leveraged by the Bank, and will provide long term financing to develop the Bank's SME financing and green lending business.
(ii) The green market is largely in the early stage in Tunisia, and Attijari Tunisia can become a leading bank in this area. The Bank has already started building a pipeline for green projects, and the IFC financing will help the Bank develop its green portfolio.

title: Amret Senior 18
content:
(i) Stakeholder impact -- Increasing financial access: The Project supports increasing financial access for MSMEs in Cambodia, in addition to maintaining and sustainably expanding financial access to micro borrowers, especially farmers and women borrowers. This contributes materially towards the WBG's goal of reaching Universal Financial Access by 2020.
(ii) Market-level impact -- Contributing to market resilience: Amret is the second largest MFI in Cambodia with strong presence in rural areas, who adopts industry-leading corporate governance and risk management platform, and is committed to responsible finance. The Project demonstrates IFC's support to Amret and the responsible lending practice in the microfinance sector in Cambodia, which is essential towards strengthening the sector's resilience.

title: SSIA Ind Est
content:
1. Business efficiencies and linkages: The modern, high-quality infrastructure that SSIA will develop will result in improved efficiencies and reduced operational costs for occupants and their supply chain partners.

2. Elevating standards: SSIA will demonstrate that industrial estates can be developed on both a sustainable and commercially viable basis. The Project is expected to servce as a catalyst for other firms to make improvements in areas such as labor conditions, safety, efficient use of resources and environmental sustainability.

3. Job creation: The Project will create direct and indicrect jobs and the development of new factories and facilities of associated occupants.

title: Clinicas del Azucar Expansion 2017
content:
The project outcomes are composed of:

(i)	Access to quality and affordable healthcare:  On average, each clinic treats hundreds of low and middle-income patients each month, improving their access to specialty care and decreasing chances of developing complications from diabetes and hypertension. More than 10,000 patients have been treated to date. This also reduces the burden of caring for complex cases on the public health providers. 

(ii) Specialized Healthcare Training:  Mexico has a shortage of doctors or nurses specialized in diabetes care; the Company provides best-in-class training to its doctors, nurses and other health professionals to ensure continued, high-quality service and improved patient outcomes.

The project's contribution to market creation arises from an increase in competitiveness. The project is pioneering a low cost business model that extends access to lower income consumers.

title: Agrotec III
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is improved access to key inputs for farmers leading to better yields and incomes. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that the project has the potential to promote greater market competitiveness and sustainability via demonstration and replication channels

title: Bauducco Growth
content: The Project is expected to have a positive development impact by i) supporting a competitive player in the baked products industry and ii) creating new jobs, with a significant portion of these for women. In terms of market impact, Bauducco is expected to increase competitiveness and inclusiveness.

title: GTLP Citi IV
content:
Direct and Indirect Support of Trade. The Project will help enable Citi to deliver trade finance to emerging market issuing banks. This is expected to in turn increase access to finance for emerging market importers and exporters along the value chain, thus  supporting growth, employment, and  the generation of income.

Cross-border Finance Links Support. IFC is partnering with a bank that has a long track record of developing financial infrastructure, processes, networks and trade finance channels, and the experience to engage in the trade finance space successfully. By continuing to support the cross-border finance links that are essential to emerging market financial systems, the Project will help to increase  trade finance through established channels that have been developed  over time.

title: PT Bajradaya Sentranusa
content:
The financing will have positive effect on the average cost of generation in North Sumatera. Asahan 1 is currently one of the lowest cost producers in the region. The financing will allow the sponsor to invest in greenfield hydropower plants in the pipeline, thus contributing to increased share of renewables and associated reduction in CO2 emission in Indonesia. 

This project intends to enhance financial connectivity by demonstrating the role of institutional investors as an alternative source of financing for infrastructure projects that is at a nascent stage of development in Indonesia. This can have a demonstration effect for successful diversification of financing for infrastructure projects.

title: TPB Senior Loan
content:
(i) Increase access to finance: for underserved segments through market-wide adoption of digital banking solutions that enhance market participation by promoting technology innovation that motivates other banks to improve existing digital offerings. 
(ii) Enhance connectivity by greater deepening of financial markets: by building market capacity that opens new market opportunities for digital banking products and services to help improve the Vietnamese banking sector's competitiveness and promote a cashless economy.

title: LLP Colombia
content:
Project-level Impacts
(i) Increased Availability of logistics infrastructure and reduced supply chain costs for businesses - The Project will add ~160,000 sqms of Class A+ storage and distribution capacity (252,000 if total park is considered) to support the efficient development of the supply chains of manufacturers, retailers/e-tailers and associated third-party logistics providers. Class A+ warehousing parks involve large, modern, flexible and well-located buildings and service infrastructure, conceived to optimize distribution configurations and facilitate scale, throughput and consolidation of inventories and transportation. They offer increased availability of docking ports with levelers for all types of trucks, matched with ample maneuvering yards for large vehicles; the buildings have 12 meters of higher ceilings, increased floor load capacity, long and column free span areas, which together significantly increase the number of pallet positions per unit of GLA when compared to existing Class A, B and C. Common services such as security, maintenance, shared cafeterias and training centers, result in further benefits for tenants. Such advantages of Class A+ structures provide tangible benefits to the typical LLP tenants, retailers/e-tailers, manufacturers and 3PLs. Some examples are:- Scalable Class A+ warehouses allow retailers to consolidate all stocks (which typically have been in multiple sites) into a single larger and more efficient warehouse, reducing total warehousing stocks.- Similarly, the retailers' suppliers (generally manufacturers) can simplify their distributions into larger and more frequent deliveries to one central location, instead of small and numerous deliveries to multiple locations (stores and multiple distribution centers), reducing their stocks and better optimizing manufacturing set-ups.- Such broad retail-manufacturing supply-chain reconfigurations, are estimated to result in material savings equivalent to up to 1.0-2.0% of retailers' revenues.  
(ii) Economy-wide effects - The Project will foster the creation of direct jobs during both the construction and operation of properties.  During construction, the Project will support approximately 600 direct jobs. Further, approximately 1,200 direct and indirect jobs will be created during the operational phase. The Project will support a significant number of indirect jobs through the supply chains, including the sourcing construction inputs and related services during the development phase and the sourcing of products and services to be sold within completed properties.
(iii) Positive Environmental Impact: LLP has committed to achieve EDGE certification, which results in at least 20% savings in energy, water and in materials consumption compared with benchmarks for equivalent buildings. 

Market-level Impacts
(i) Competitiveness: The Project will provide a positive impact in the local warehousing and industrial property market.  As of today, Class A warehousing parks in Colombia stand at 450,000 sqm -or 4% of total existing supply. In addition, the Project will be the first of Class A+ quality. Given its modern, efficient, and lower cost characteristics, it is expected that LLP will set high industry standards and demonstrate the economic viability of a further refined business model.
(ii) Sustainability:  Currently, the penetration of modern and energy-efficient industrial warehouses in Colombia is negligible. The buildings built under the Project will achieve global best practice in energy efficiency standards and, will be the first Green Building certified warehousing properties in the country.

title: PickMe
content:
1.	Impact on the Sri Lankan Venture Capital ecosystem: The Sri Lankan start-up ecosystem is nascent and, while seed funding is generally available, there is a lack of institutional funding for Series A onwards. Outside of the software sector, connections and exposure to other more developed ecosystems (e.g. Silicon Valley, India, Singapore) is limited. The government is making efforts to promote entrepreneurship through promotion of networking events, incubators etc. by bodies such as Startup Sri Lanka and SLASSCOM. Due to the small scale of the ecosystem, there is a lack of mentors/advisors to assist young entrepreneurs in starting and growing their businesses. The success of PickMe would have a strong demonstration effect which is expected to foster entrepreneurship and attract both entrepreneurs and institutional investors to Sri Lanka. 

2.	Impact on drivers as SMEs: PickMe has a positive impact on its drivers, through increased earnings, financial inclusion and training. As outlined above, the Company provides drivers with an opportunity to double their earnings by reducing idle time spent waiting for customers. PickMe contributes to financial inclusion and literacy as it requires its drivers to open bank accounts, through which they can receive real time payment transfers, which enables them to begin building a credit history. PickMe also provides training to its drivers on customer service which enhances their self-esteem and status in society as they can interact in a more professional manner with customers. 

3.	Convenient, reliable, and affordable transportation: As there are limited attractive transportation options for Sri Lankan consumers, especially women who do not own their own vehicles. PickMe enables consumers to move around cities in a safe, convenient, reliable and affordable manner. Consumers using a vehicle hailed through PickMe are safer than consumers using vehicles hailed informally as (i) PickMe checks that vehicles are adequately insured to carry passengers and (ii) the PickMe app includes a SOS button that gives the rider an option of alerting the police in case of an emergency. A 2015 survey commissioned by the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) revealed that 90 per cent of women in Sri Lanka have experienced sexual harassment on public transport, while only 4 per cent sought help from the Police. These barriers pose a threat to gender parity, the physical and mental wellbeing of women, as well as female labor force participation, which is currently at only 35 per cent, significantly lower than some other countries in the region.

title: Omera LPG
content:
1.	Stakeholders Effects: 
a)	Customers effects: Currently, about 90% of natural gas in Bangladesh is used to generate electricity, with demand from both domestic household and industrial segments expected to grow substantially. However, there is a daily shortage of natural gas of approximately 1,000 million cubic feet (mmcft/day) which might cause major disruptions to the economic activities if remain unaddressed. Due to the shortage of natural gas, LPG is even more needed now especially by the domestic households as natural gas is increasingly diverted for industrial and power sector use. The Project will help minimize the shortage gap and address the lack of storage facilities that have become the bottleneck in the distribution chain by increasing the storage capacity at various stages in the value chain. The other bottleneck is in the downstream logistic services, where certain locations are hard to reach or that the transport lead time is long, both due to the constraints in the transportation infrastructure. The Project will help smoothen the distribution of LPG to the end users by constructing capacity barges, cylinder carrying barges, and upgrading the LPG road tankers fleet. This will direct and indirectly increase the reliability of supply by shortening the delivery time and lowering the transportation costs, and to ensure end customers will have access to LPG when they need them. 

b)	Distributors effects: OPL has established a strong distribution channel with more than 200 distributors across the country. OPL is now present in more than 22,000 retail points in the country, and has presence in all the administrative sub-districts of Bangladesh. The project will increase economic activity of these distributors and retailers, most of them MSMEs, due to the higher volume of LPGs and number of cylinders being distributed to the end users. By 2020, additional 2.1 million cylinders will have been distributed to the market and by 2018, additional 3,000 retailers will have been added to the distribution network. 
 
2.	Contribution to Market Creation: 
a)	Resilience: The project will help create a more resilient energy system through promotion of supply diversification, by helping a private sector player such as OPL deliver LPG to the market. The Project also supports the Government of Bangladesh's policy to dedicate the natural gas production to power generation and industrial consumption, which are currently facing erratic and short supplies. Allocating more natural gas to power generation and fulfil the demand of the household segment with LPG will not only create a more resilient energy system but also lead to better manufacturing productivity and thus generate greater economic value from scarce natural gas resources.

b)	Sustainability:  This project will support the promotion of LPG which has low greenhouse gas emission characteristics when compared to for example, conventional cooking fuels such as firewood, kerosene and charcoal.  Usage of these conventional cooking fuels have reduced drastically in rural Bangladesh, but represent still around 75% of the consumption of cooking fuels, so there is a big potential for LPG to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Inefficient cooking emits greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide and methane, and aerosols such as black carbon. Better access to LPG in rural areas of Bangladesh through new distribution networks will provide a cleaner and efficient fuel than biomass, reducing overall emissions and thereby improving overall health of the local population. Unlike firewood and charcoal, LPG is easy and instantaneous to light, easy to control so that the required rate of heating can be obtained. LPG does not produce any smoke or soot therefore in overall is more environmentally friendly and sustainable compared to conventional cooking fuels.

title: Sosagrin-IBS
content:
The project impacts are centered around:
- Sustainability, especially through Sosagrin's envisioned glass recycling program.
- Employment, whereby the Project is expected to create 100-200 new direct jobs.
- The Companies stakeholders, namely their (i) distributors/buyers through increased sales volumes, and (ii) local suppliers through increased purchases.

Moreover, the proposed investment has the potential to generate market impacts by encouraging systemic changes to existing markets that deliver development impact by increasing sustainability in Senegal, through demonstration and replication channels.

title: Fullerton Health
content:
Broader Access to Quality Health Care: The Project will support the expansion of one of the Philippines' leading HMO, increasing the number of lives reached.

Skill Development of Medical Professionals: Intellicare provides training for health care professionals. By expanding its network, Intellicare will increase training opportunities for health professionals in Philippines, improving the level of skills in the sector.

Job Creation: Intellicare's expansion will create new jobs, largely skilled middle income jobs in a broad range of areas. These jobs are well sought after within the healthcare sector in the Philippines.

title: CL SSL MCPP
content: The project is expected to have significant development impact on stakeholders as it will contribute to increased access to finance to a larger number of SMEs in Lebanon, which will help cover the financing needs of the Bank's SME clients during the tough economic times. The long-term tenor provided by IFC, being longer than those available from the market, will allow the Bank to provide much needed long-term financing to its clients that will in turn enable them to implement investment projects and create new jobs.

title: Pakistan MRCL
content: The expected development impacts from the Project are to address key market inefficiencies and promote access to housing finance in Pakistan, by supporting PMRCL in refinancing housing portfolios of primary mortgage lenders (PMLs) at fixed rates and with longer maturities. This in turn is expected to promote private sector participation and competition in the housing finance market in Pakistan. PMRCL is also expected to regularly issue bonds to finance its operations which will help deepen capital markets in Pakistan.

title: Craftsman III
content:
(i)	Employment creation and knowledge transfer: The Project will create additional high skill jobs as it expands its operations. The Project will also create additional employment along the supply chain as it increases purchases and variety of its raw materials. 
(ii)	Impact on customers: Customers will benefit from the increase in capacity which will provide a consistent and reliable supply of quality auto component parts, meet the increasing requirements of components as they expand their volumes.
(iii)	Impact on suppliers: Craftsman will impact the suppliers through the increase in its business with the existing local suppliers through additional purchases and a broader range of purchases of components.
(iv)	Increase in taxes: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues

title: Gaselia Group
content: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is the downstream linkages with base of the pyramid retailers, the employment created, and the environmental impact in Mali and Cote d'Ivoire. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that this investment has the potential to promote greater sustainability and inclusiveness via demonstration and replication channels.

title: PRAN Agro Business Ltd
content:
(1) Greater farmer reach: The project is expected to help PRAN increase its farmer network by procuring raw materials from an incremental 10,000 farmers, thus contributing to market creation for these farmers.

(2) Increased job creation and MSME improvement: The project is expected to create approximately 650 incremental direct jobs and 4,000 indirect jobs, including sizeable female employment (around 60% of PRAN's workforce is female). In addition, the project is expected to create additional indirect employment in micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) along the value chain. 

(3) Setting food safety standards and local demonstration effect: By increasing the availability of hygienically-packaged food, the project would help to set higher standards on food safety in the country for other players, including a large base of farmers. 

(4) Extension services: The project is expected to support climate smart agriculture through implementation of good agricultural practices (GAP) for incremental farmers in its supply chain for key crops such as mango, tomatoes, turmeric and cassava.

title: FCS Sanctum
content:
i.	Job creation: The Project is creating over 130 direct jobs at the Project, majority of which are for the local community.
ii.	Capacity Building: The Project is being operated at high international standards (currently ranked number 1 on TripAdvisor among hotels in the area) and through training of employees, it is facilitating knowledge transfer and improving services standards.
iii.	Benefits to the local economy and supply linkages: The Project will help create demand for locally-sourced materials, services, and labor. The Project is expected to support SMEs, including a wide range of goods and service providers, such as produce farmers, food processors, transportation companies, restaurateurs, and arts and crafts manufacturers.
iv.	Increase in domestic revenues and foreign exchange: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and in particular, foreign exchange inflow as a large majority of the Project's revenues is expected to be in foreign currency.

title: Sao Manoel
content:
- Stakeholders: The investment will contribute to creating skilled jobs and increasing female employment.
- Private Sector Development: The investment will support the continued expansion of a competitive domestic
player in the sugar and ethanol industry, one of the most important sectors in the Brazilian economy.
- Payments to Government: The Brazilian agribusiness sector is highly competitive globally and is key to the
economy in terms of its capacity to raise Government revenues. This investment will allow the Company to
expand its operations and will contribute to the growth of the Brazilian economy.
- Climate Change: IFC's investment in Sao Manoel will contribute to climate change mitigation by promoting
the use of renewable fuel in a country with expanding demand.
- Sustainability: The investment will contribute to disseminating the adoption of solid agricultural practices, as
by promoting the use of innovative technologies S<e3>o Manoel reports high productivity levels compared to the
industry average.

title: GTST Mauritania 2018
content:
- The Project is expected to have a strong contribution to the economy's resilience as it will ensure the supply of energy products for the next two years. Disruptions in supply of oil would acutely affect the functioning of key industries (mining and fishing- among the top GDP contributors) and more generally the macroeconomic stability and GDP growth of this IDA country.
 
- The Project also supports regional integration by keeping trade routes and channels open, especially to Mali and other landlocked countries in the region. While the overall Correspondent Banking appetite of international banks towards emerging
market has drastically decreased, particularly in Africa, this project would contribute to keep critical correspondent banking links active with local financial institutions.

title: Hilton Talatona
content: Employment Impact: during its construction, the Project will provide an average of 350 direct jobs, and during its operations, the Project will create and sustain 123 full time direct jobs, of which 30% will be for women. Through demonstration effects and by catalyzing further developments in the area, the Project is expected to promote the development of business infrastructure in Angola. IFC anticipates that the Project will result in a significant increase in competition that will benefit the Angolan market by expanding hotel accommodation product offerings to include high quality mid-scale business hotels.

title: Esquire Knit Composite Limited
content:
Stakeholder's impacts:
i.	Employment growth: The Project will create 5,500 additional jobs, mostly for women. Additionally, the number of temporary workers required for the construction at its peak is 300.
ii.	Employee skills/know-how: The Project is going to attract skilled recruits and further develop their skill sets through various training program required by the new technologies and product range, and thus adding to the skilled workers base in Bangladesh. 
iii.	Effect on emissions and waste generation: EKCL's new factory will be a LEED certified green factory. Supported by IFC's Advisory Program Partnership for Cleaner Textile (PaCT), the factory will focus on water, wastewater, and chemicals conservation and energy efficiency. 
Market impact: 
i.	Contribution to Market Creation: The Project, along with IFC's advisory services engagements in Bangladesh, has the potential to promote greater market sustainability and integration in the RMG sector in Bangladesh. 
ii.	Impact on market emissions and waste generation: The project, along with IFC's advisory services engagements in Bangladesh, will help foster adoption of environmental and social sustainability principles by firms and consumers across the sector through direct capacity building channels and demonstration effects as a result of EKCL's success. 
iii.	Increasing manufacturing complexity: The Project is expected to upgrade the company to a more value adding level, involving advanced products, innovative product development, automated production technology and up-grading of professional skills of the personnel. It could potentially be the model that other factories will follow as Bangladesh is climbing up to higher value garment products.

title: Lagos City Infra
content: A.	Project-Level Outcomes: The expected project-level impacts include the following:i) Provision of reliable transportation: The Project will support the rehabilitation of 2 Quality Bus Corridors ("QBC") located in the low-income areas of Lagos where the BRT and LRT will not reach.  IFC expects that the project will provide passengers with more reliable and   efficient public transportation, thereby reducing commute times and accidents along the corridors. The number of passengers benefiting from the project per day is expected to be circa 157,000. Based on IFC's Industry Specialist projection, the project is expected to generate an estimated annual timing savings of about 282, 800 hours per year and this in turn translates to an estimated economic value of time savings of $175, 000 a year.ii) Environmental and social impacts: The Project will introduce more efficient and environmentally friendly transportation into the Lagos metropolis and help alleviate traffic congestion in a particularly densely-populated part of Lagos. This is expected to result in a reduction of greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions and environmental pollution. As per IFC's Industry Specialist estimates, about 5,300 tons of CO2 emission avoided per annum.iii) Job creation: The Project is expected to create job opportunities for the local workforce during construction and provide training for long-term operations phase positions. iv) Support social inclusion: Given that the project is located in low-income areas of Lagos, the improved connectivity is expected to benefit the local community and support social inclusion by facilitating access to job opportunities and key social and business services.B.	Contribution to Market Creation: The Project will complement World Bank support for the Lagos Strategic Transport Master Plan Project, which was developed with technical and financial assistance from the World Bank. Past transport projects financed by the World Bank include: i) the Lagos Urban Transport Plan Project Phase 1 (LUTP I; #P074963) - which financed the initial creation and capacity building at the Lagos Metropolitan Area Transport Authority (LAMATA) (LAMATA is the Lagos State's agency in charge of strategic planning, development and regulation (including granting concessions) of the public transport network)), traffic management and road maintenance in Lagos State, and, ii) the LUTP II (#P112956)), which focused on Bus Rapid Transit and feeder roads construction. The Project's contributions to market creation are as follows: i) Improving physical and economic integration: IFC anticipates that the Project will enhance physical connectivity in the Abule Egba- Command and Ile Ile-Ile Epo areas of Lagos, enhancing economic activity and integration of labor seekers and employers. By improving the transport system capacity and urban connectivity, the Project has the potential to promote further mobility to other parts of Lagos, where more businesses and social services are located. The increased business activity will support productive employment for residents who get on the road daily in search of these income generation opportunities.ii) Social and environmental sustainability: The Project is expected to set a benchmark for future similar projects in the city of Lagos through adoption of improved operational and safety standards on the two QBCs including improvement of the pavement, drainage system, sidewalks and lightning as well as improved drivers' skills and introduction of efficient and less pollutant buses in the transport system.

title: DARP APS 2
content: Stakeholder Impact: IFC anticipates that the project will support banks in IFC countries of operation in ECA to rehabilitate their balance sheets, reduce their NPL ratios and cure the high volumes of distressed assets built up in the aftermath of the financial crisis. In addition, the project will provide extra liquidity to vendor banks which can be used for new lending into the economy. Moreover, the project is expected to assist over-indebted small and medium sized enterprises ("SMEs") and consumers to become free of debt and to regain access to the formal economy. Market Competitiveness: The project will be an important catalyst in developing capacity and best practice for distressed asset resolution across the ECA region. Resilience: IFC expects the project to result in lasting systemic improvements to the distressed asset market in ECA. The project will have a demonstration effect for the market for portfolio sales. A strong secondary market serves as a stabilizing factor in financial systems, giving banks a way to re-allocate capital towards more productive assets.

title: WCS NMB Nepal
content: The Project is expected to increase access to working capital financing for SMEs in Nepal, which suffer from a significant gap between the current supply of finance and their demand for credit. Working capital is necessary for SMEs to finance their daily business operations, source supplies and pay employees. SME growth ultimately facilitates business growth, job creation and income generation, especially in key productive sectors of the Nepalese economy. The financing will also support key industries, as the ultimate recipients of funds would include buyers of raw materials, processors and manufacturers that support growth.

title: GREI Bond
content: The Second Project will maintain access to high-quality commercial property in Romania, support the construction of projects under development, and contribute to future expansion as the sector recovers. Additionally, the Second Project helps the sector withstand shocks by supporting a systemically important player sustain its operations and continue with its expansion plan.

title: National Cement Company
content: The Project (i) reduces cement prices to end-customers; (ii) promotes market competitiveness via the introduction of efficient processes; (iii) benefit those small and medium enterprises engaged in transporting the company's raw materials and products in their own trucks and providing maintenance and general services to the company; (iv) significantly increases the domestic business with local suppliers in both countries; (v) supports the domestic value addition to abundantly available natural resources (i.e. pozzolana, limestone and gypsum) in Kenya and Uganda; (vi) creates 496 new direct jobs (323 in Kenya and 173 Uganda), and support an additional 39,000 indirect and induced jobs in Kenya and 29,700 in Uganda through forward linkages; (vii) generates a positive and strong Life-of-Project Economic Return on Invested Capital; and (viii) achieves a positive environmental effect with CO2 emissions per ton of cement produced expected to be 10% lower thanks to the use of more efficient technology.

title: UCL Pharma
Kerry Myanmar
content:
Development Impact:
The Project's development impact is expected to be realized through the below channels. 
Project-level Impact: 
Stakeholder Impact: The Project supports private sector participation in the underdeveloped transport and logistics sector, which has high potential for future growth. The dry ports will facilitate trade flows and improve connectivity between the two main economic growth centers of Yangon and Mandalay to increase access to goods and services in the country.
Economy-wide effects: The Project would support the GoM by generating concession fee payments and tax revenues to the public sector. It is also expected to create around 100 jobs.
Market-level impact: 
Integration: The Project will support Myanmar in its efforts to improve domestic connectivity and increase opportunities for international trade. Development of Myanmar dry ports is expected to have a positive impact on regional integration. The installation of dry ports can contribute to a logistics upgrading of Myanmar as it facilitates multi-modal transport solutions. The locations of both ports are strategically selected to be in close proximity to other transport links and once connected, are expected to play a critical role in meeting the growing container traffic that is transported within the country and across its borders. The Project's successful implementation could also have positive demonstration effects for introducing modern logistics practices that can be replicated by other transport and logistics infrastructure developers in the country.

title: DARP SPV IndiaRF
content:
- Shareholders impact: The project is expected to revitalize a number of distressed companies, and provide capital relief to banks, helping resolve NPLs in India. IndiaRF's ability to turn around these situations will help preserve jobs.
- Market Impact: The project will support the implementation of the new regulatory framework and contribute to a more robust DA market, allowing banks to increase lending.

title: Itau Arg CL
content:
Project Impact Assessment:
- Stakeholders Effects: in Argentina, only 3% of micro, small and medium enterprises have adequate access to financial products, with almost 50% being either unserved or underserved. The Project will increase access to finance for SMEs.
- Environmental Effects: the Project will promote long-term lending to energy efficient projects and renewable energy sources that have lower environmental impact and GHG emissions.

Market Impact Assessment:
- Sustainability: financing for additional energy sources will help mitigate energy shortage and improve energy self-sufficiency in Argentina.

title: DCM Gaucho GB
content: Project Impact Assessment:Stakeholders Effects: The Project will increase access to SEF, including for renewable energy ("RE"), energy efficiency ("EE"), water efficiency ("WE"), and green buildings ("GB") projects.Environmental Effects: IFC estimates that growth in the Bank's climate-finance portfolio will result in a reduction of CO2 emissions.Market Impact Assessment:Sustainability: IFC expects that its investment will introduce and help demonstrate the viability of a new asset class that promotes sustainability (i.e. green bonds). The Project with Galicia, a systemic Argentine bank, shall provide visibility, raise awareness, and generate a demonstration effect of these instruments to other market players.

title: Eleme Fertilizer II
content: The Project will promote (i)economic diversification in Nigeria; (ii)direct and indirect employment; (iii)strong environmental sustainability by redirecting polluting wasted flared gas to productive use and introduce best in class energy and resource efficient technology; (iv)improvement in accessibility and supply of quality fertilizer to farmers; and (v)building of value chain linkages by supporting the local government to integrate smaller local NPK manufacturers into the domestic value chain.

title: BOVIMA
content: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement and Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Excellent. The most significant, expected project-level outcome is improved access to market for herders and smallholder farmers, increased employment, and more economic activity in one of the poorest regions of Madagascar. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that this investment has the potential to promote greater integration and market competitiveness via the creation of a new market for meat exports and animal feed, linked to global value chains.

title: EFC Egypt II
content:
IFC's investment will help to:
(i) support growth in the agriculture sector through granular urea production;
(ii) sustain employment and economic returns, EFC provides significant employment in the area; and 
(iii) support foreign currency generation through exports.

title: Alta Growth Capital, Mexico Fund III, L.P.
content: The expected development impact is that Alta will drive growth, expansion and operational efficiencies at investee level because Alta takes significant minority or control stakes in its portfolio companies, and then uses the 5-7 year holding period to add value through: (i) Building strong partnerships with investees through alignment of interest and common values; (ii) Implementing effective management teams and proper incentives; (iii) Driving growth plans by having at least two partners work on each company and implementing initiatives such as the 100 day plan; (iv) Closely monitoring investee performance; (v) Partnering with IFC to institutionalize and bolster (a) international ESG standards; (b) prudent valuation methodologies; and (c) transparent and consistent reporting standards; (vi) Being active at board and committee level; and (vii) Having an active independent advisory board that provides a network of executives for investees, among others.The expected market impact is on competitiveness of the Mexican PE Market Structure and Activity because of IFC's clear role in bolstering competition in Mexico due to the demonstration effect investing in a highcaliber GP like Alta has on PE CKD's and institutional investors.

title: Altum Capital
BHDL III
content: IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to finance for small and medium enterprises. IFC expects the Project to benefit SMEs that face substantial financing gaps of an estimated US$12.9 billion in the Dominican Republic as identified in the SME Finance Gap Report, with only 21 percent of SMEs having access to formal financing.

title: CAL Bank II
content:
Stakeholders' Impact:



Provision of long term funding to borrowers, which is scarce in Ghana. It is estimated that 77% of SMEs in Ghana currently do not have access to finance and private credit as a proportion of national GDP in Ghana is relatively low as compared to other large developing economies. With 25% of the senior loan targeted at climate smart businesses and 25% at women owned enterprises, these stakeholders will benefit from access to longer tenured facilities. 




Environmental and Social Impact - Climate targets will not only create awareness and provide finance to an overlooked sector in the country, but it will assist in reducing greenhouse gas emissions.



Market Impact Assessment

Inclusiveness: A women in banking focus is generally not prevalent in the Ghanaian banking sector and targeting a portion of the senior loan to women will incentivize the bank in reaching an underserved group. The project is also expected to have demonstration effects in the banking sector, whereby other market players consider introducing products geared to women owned enterprises.

title: Gas Natural Acu
content: (i) Development of the LNG-to-Power Industry, promoting long-term energy diversification and providing energy security. Brazil's power generation is in excess of 70% comprised of renewable sources and the Project will (a) complement the variability in renewable power generation towards providing higher reliability of supply, and (b) provide a basis to promote incremental supply of renewable energy within the Brazilian power sector; (ii) provide dispatchable thermal generation capacity, improving sustainable natural resource management and climate resilience; (iii)  along with CELSE LNG-to-Power project and AES Colon in Panama, demonstration effect by successfully financing the first three large-scale LNG-to-Power projects in Emerging Markets; (iv) establish privately run regional natural gas hubs which will enable increased industrial usage of natural gas and promote switching from more carbon intensive fuel usage; and (v) in the longer term, create the likelihood for better utilization of associated gas produced from the deep offshore Campos Basin fields.

title: BIND CL
content: The Project will support increased banking penetration and access to financial services for SMEs in Argentina, where the credit to gross domestic product ("GDP") ratio is below the regional average for Latin America and its peers. Increased access to finance for SMEs will lead to increased job creation in the country. SMEs in Argentina still lack adequate access to financing and the Project is expected to address this financing gap.

title: DBL Syndication
content:
i. Improved Access to Finance: The Project will increase access to finance for credit-constrained, export-oriented companies and SMEs to meet working capital requirements. It will also expand financial intermediation.
ii. Job Creation: IFC's investment will further support business growth and spur job creation in the SME and export-oriented segments.
iii. Boost Export Competitiveness: The project will help economic growth in Bangladesh by providing exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements and assist in payments for imports utilized. This, in turn, improves their working capital cycle, thereby providing a boost in exports.

title: ONE Bank Debt
content:
i. Inclusiveness: The proposed WCS will mostly support access to finance for credit-constrained, export-oriented companies and SMEs to meet working capital requirements. It will also expand financial intermediation.

ii. Sustainability: Through the green loan component of the project, IFC will contribute to the green and sustainable growth of the economy.

iii.
