Boost Export Competitiveness: The project will help economic growth in Bangladesh by providing exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements and assist in payments for imports utilized. This, in turn, improves their working capital cycle, thereby providing a boost in exports.

title: Bank Asia-Green
content: Environmental Impact: This project expects to allow Bank Asia to improve lending facilities for climate finance and develop their green portfolio. An initial assessment of the use of the proceeds of this investment projects a reduction of GHG emissions by 98,943 tCO2/year.

title: WCSS Pubali Bank
content:
(i) Stakeholders: Pubali Bank's growth strategy compliments IFC's Bangladesh country strategy of creating access to finance for SMEs. The Bank's outreach provides access to the underserved SME sector and enables the Bank to upscale appropriate microenterprises to small enterprises and link them to related businesses through their network. IFC anticipates that this will promote social and business integration. 

(ii) Sustainability: IFC partnership will assist the Bank to upgrade E&S Management System, ensure screening of trade transactions against IFC Exclusion List, additional eligibility criteria, and Host Country Regulations.

(iii) Inclusiveness: As per the MSME Finance Gap report prepared jointly by the SME Finance Forum and IFC, the financing gap for MSMEs in 2017 is USD 38.9 Bn. IFC expects the partnership with the Bank to highlight the viability of extending banking services to MSMEs through demonstration and replication to other Tier II/III banks.

title: RSF HSBC BD
content:
1.	Increased access to finance- The project will increase access to finance for agribusiness, energy, manufacturing, Readymade Garments and Pharmaceuticals sectors in Bangladesh. Improved availability of credit to these sectors is expected to benefit consumers, producers and buyers along the value chain and therefore support economic growth, increase employment and encourage the generation of higher income in these sectors.
2.	Support Key local industries as ultimate recipients of funds under this project would be buyers of raw materials, processors and manufacturers in order to support their future growth.

title: Zorlu Disco
content: The Project will support the Company to undertake much-needed major rehabilitation and modernization of the distribution network in the OEDAS Region, helping to improve power supply quality and reliability, reduce technical and commercial losses, and expand network access to new customers. By strengthening the network and investing in new technology, the Project will also support further integration of renewable energy and help leverage information technology to improve the Company's operational efficiency and customer service capabilities.

title: IDLC Finance
content:
1.	Creating a new asset class and improving access to finance: A commercially viable affordable housing finance product can open up a new frontier segment for financial institutions contributing to the financial sector development and improving access to finance especially in the lower income segments. 

2.	Job creation: Real Estate & housing industry is one of the largest job creators in Bangladesh. By supporting the expansion of housing finance this project will also contribute to job creation in Bangladesh.

title: Co-op Bank III
content:
1)	Project Impact Assessment:

i)	Stakeholder impact - IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to finance for underserved MSMEs in Kenya, particularly those operating in the agricultural value chain, manufacturing and trade sectors.

ii)	Economy-wide effects - By supporting the growth of MSMEs, the Project is expected to help drive economic growth and job creation in the country.

2)	Market Impact Assessment:

i)	Inclusiveness - IFC anticipates that the Project will increase access to financial services for underserved groups, particularly bottom of the pyramid borrowers and microenterprises, through its demonstration and market awareness effect which enhances its potential for replication by the rest of the banking sector.

title: Anthem Asia Myanmar SME Venture Fund, L.P.
content: Expected development impact includes (i) national and regional expansion of local businesses, job creation and economic growth through providing SMEs access to risk capital, (ii) operational, financial, environment and social improvement of local businesses through knowledge transfer by the Fund and (iii) private sector development through acceleration of growth of various target investment sectors.

title: Project Hippo
content:
- Access to quality healthcare: The Project is expected to increase access to affordable, quality healthcare and specialist services in East and Southern Africa, where there is an undersupply and increasing demand across all income groups.
- Build critical healthcare infrastructure: Through the construction and set up of new clinics and hospitals, this Project will go a long way in increasing and improving the much-needed healthcare infrastructure in East and Southern Africa. The Company is expected to create an additional 300 to 400 new beds.
- Employment: The Project is expected to create direct and indirect skilled employment at each of the businesses.

title: BOA RSF
content: The most significant expected project-level impact is derived from the expansion of access to finance for SMEs, including women owned SMEs and SMEs making climate related investments in 10 IDA and/or FCS countries. Increased access to finance for these underserved segments is expected to have positive economic and job creation impacts. Beyond the project, the main source of expected market impact is derived from the promotion of inclusiveness via the demonstration and capacity building channels.

title: Jain IV
content:
1) Raising farmer incomes: the adoption of MIS and better farming techniques is expected to reduce risk from weather, lower cost of farm inputs such as fertilizers and energy, and also increase yields. This will improve farmer income and have a direct impact on poverty reduction for those at the bottom of the pyramid. The Company also contracts with farmers to buy output for its food processing business.
2) Improved water management: India has 18% of the world's population and only 4% of the fresh water resources, and per capita availability is projected to keep declining. MIS improves water efficiency from the average 30-40% in India to 80-85%. This will lead to improved water management and a smaller environmental footprint caused by agricultural growth.
3) Improved infrastructure: The Company manufactures pipes used for water supply, sewage, waste management supporting the GoI's "Swachh Bharat" (Clean India) Mission. They will also be integral in the creation of Smart Cities.

title: Nyva CL
content: The proposed investment is expected to benefit consumers, employees, and local community.  The retailers, and ultimately the end consumers, will benefit from increased volumes of pork, produced in line with best international practices with regard to quality and food safety standards. In addition, IFC anticipates that the project will contribute to job creation in rural areas where employment opportunities are scarce, and will support the local community.

title: SM2PCL
content:
1) Reduce power deficit: The Project will be one of the largest IPPs to be commissioned in Bangladesh, which continues to have a severe power deficit. It is expected to contribute to improve the resilience of the electricity sector by helping reduce the acute supply shortage with a high-efficiency dual fuel plant. 
2) Reduce overall power generation cost: The Project has a competitive tariff compared to other gas fired plants in the country, and much lower than oil based rental power plants; which offers a strategic solution to Bangladesh's long-term power needs and helps the country to lower its power generation cost.   
3) Greater access to energy: Power produced from the Project is expected to reach about 6.87 million consumers in Bangladesh.
4) Employment generation: The Project is likely to create jobs for locals (both direct and indirect) during construction (800-1000) and operation phases (80).

title: DCM L&THF NCD
content:
1.	Support to the affordable housing market: The project will increase access to affordable housing by supporting the financing of developers engaged in the affordable housing segment. 

2.	Job creation: Construction industry is one of the largest job creators in India. By supporting the expansion of housing finance this project will also contribute to job creation in India.

title: Demica
content:
(i) Demica will enhance access to finance for SME suppliers and distributors, by expanding the reach of its innovative and scalable trade and supply chain finance products in emerging markets.
(ii) Demica will offer improved quality and terms of financing for SMEs compared to other forms of finance available. For example, through Demica's supply chain finance platform, SME suppliers can receive financing at terms based on the higher credit ratings of their large corporate buyers, obtaining lower rates than those offered by commercial banks to SMEs based on their own credit profiles.

title: IndoSpace Fund III
content:
Supply of high quality industrial and warehousing property assets in India's core industrial areas is very limited with demand far exceeding supply and resulting in lost opportunities for industrial growth and job creation. The Project will bring in a significant new supply of industrial and warehousing infrastructure for rent in locations across the country, including low income states in India. The modern high quality industrial and warehousing parks developed by the Project will reduce operating costs and improve efficiency in the entire supply chains of manufacturing companies and logistics operators, which will trickle down to lower cost of goods and services. It will also enhance ease of doing business in India, thereby attracting valuable foreign investment and anchoring manufacturing growth. 

The Project will foster the creation of direct jobs during both the construction and operation of properties. The project will also support a significant number of indirect jobs through the supply chain.

The Project assets, once developed, will constitute an attractive pool of matured, institutional-quality property assets that are expected to be aggregated into a portfolio. This portfolio of matured assets as it evolved will become a significant private or public REIT-platform, thus contributing to debottlenecking the evolution of this still embryonic property-based financial market in India.

Lastly, the warehouses under the Project are expected to be certified IFC EDGE compliant with potentially at least 20 percent savings in energy, water and materials consumption compared with benchmarks for equivalent buildings.

title: DCM PNB HFL Bond
content:
Support to the affordable housing market: India does not yet have a vibrant affordable housing market. While the demand is huge, availability of financing and supply of stock is relatively very low. The problem could severely hamper the realization of the GOI's goal of "Housing for All" by 2022. In this respect, this initiative is part of IFC's holistic approach to support both buyers of affordable housing as well as developers of such housing units as defined under the PMAY scheme. 
Reducing carbon emissions: The proposed investment is expected to generate environmental and economic benefits through the development of energy efficient housing construction projects and would help establish a market and an ecosystem for green housing construction in India.

title: BBVA Col SMEs
content:
(i) The project is expected to increase the access to financial services for SMEs, and to increase the access to affordable housing for middle-income households.
(ii) IFC will introduce best standards on environmental and social ("E&S") policies and procedures, strengthening BBVA Colombia's E&S management systems.

title: SDB Senior Loan
content:
Expanding access to finance: Through this project, IFC will provide funding to approximately 5,000 SMEs over the next 5 years. 

Job creation: Based on IFC Jobs Study, Sri Lanka (2012), an estimated 1,500-4,650 new direct jobs will be created by this project. In addition, there will be indirect job creation.

Reducing the gender gap: In Sri Lanka, most women-owned enterprises are in the micro space, with women-owned SMEs representing only 24% of all SMEs. SDB as a bank which originated in the micro space and now looking to upscale into the SME space, is better suited to aid in their growth. Accordingly, the Project is expected to fund approximately 1,300 women-owned SMEs.

title: Faering II
content:
(i) Private Sector Development: Access to long-term equity capital is difficult for unlisted companies. The Fund would provide scarce and patient capital as well as expertise and guidance to support value creation. Faering's value-add to investees, through Fund I and Fund II, is visible through the robust growth in financial metrics, high job creation, and strengthening of the underlying business models.
(ii) Financial inclusion and sustainability: Access to employment opportunities for individuals, access to markets for small businesses, and operational, financial and E&S improvements in local businesses. 
(iii) Market development: Support to the Indian PE industry at a time when broader investor participation has waned, through support of a local PE firm with long-term potential, operating in a segment of the market that has few growth capital managers.

title: Astarta IV
content:
The most significant, expected project-level outcomes are the benefits to farmers and the positive environmental effects of the planned Best Available Techniques (BAT) investments. Beyond the project, IFC anticipates that the investment has the potential to promote market integration through improved competition and market enabling investments.

The project will have the following impact:

(i) Environmental and/or social benefits - IFC anticipates that, alongside improved operational efficiencies and lower costs of production, the project will have a significant positive effect on the environment. The BAT investment program financed by the project entails reductions in both water and energy use at Astarta's sugar plants. The project will also finance more modern and efficient machinery and equipment for the agriculture operations, enabling the Company to cultivate the land in a more sustainable manner. 

(ii) Benefits for the Consumers - IFC anticipates that, given the Company's focus on staple crops and its export orientation, the project will have a strong contribution on food security. IFC expects the increase in production of grains and oilseeds to translate into food availability for about 500,000 additional people. 

(iii) Benefits for the Farmers - IFC anticipates that the project will reach additional farmers through purchases of larger volumes of grains and oilseeds from third parties, investments in new storage capacities for third-party use, and new employment in agricultural operations at Astarta's own farms. IFC expects the construction of new storage facilities to address a significant infrastructure bottleneck for Ukraine's primary producers, enabling sales at more opportune times, expanding choices of who to sell to, and reducing port-harvest losses by up to 3,500 MT per year. IFC expects that these in turn will generate better incomes and more streamlined trading relationships.

title: Sinovation IV
content: a.	The Fund will help support the transition of the Chinese economy from a manufacturing to an increasingly innovation and technology driven one by supporting innovation at early stage. The Fund will support the convergence of internet and artificial intelligence with traditional industries such as retail, fintech, logistics/transportation, healthcare, and education.b.	The Fund is the first in China to create an ecosystem of professional services, co-working space, and mentorship for entrepreneurs; its success and impact have been validated by the number of early stage investments that have raised further funding, with some valued at over US$1 billion today. c.	Financial Success: Evidenced by the Manager's past track record and ability to raise successor fund.

title: Genomma Lab
content:
- Increased access to quality and affordable of pharmaceuticals and personal care products in the LAC region: The Company's existing distribution network enables Genomma to deliver quality and affordable over-the-counter (OTC) medicines and personal care products to thousands of stores, including mom & pops stores, increasing the availability of medicines to often lower income populations who frequent these stores. With the new manufacturing plant, Genomma will be able increase better control quality and manage its production levels, while lowering its production costs, and thus able to offer more affordable personal care and OTC pharmaceuticals.

- Employment generation and development of SMEs: With the new plant and distribution center Genomma expects to generate over 300 direct new jobs in small communities of the state of Mexico during and after construction phase, including female employment. The Project will also bring indirect employment through the Company's purchases of goods and services. Genomma works with c. 80 direct suppliers and c. 240 indirect SMEs/suppliers

- Free up public health system's resources: OTC medicines are an important cost saving tool for government health spending by reducing the number of visits to a doctor for a prescription and reducing prescription drugs costs. OTC medicines provide consumers safe and effective treatments for commonly occurring conditions, saving the patient time and leaving doctor consultation slots open to those for need these

title: Standard Chartered Bank Trade Finance Risk Sharing Facility
content: The project will finance approximately $4.0bn of EM trade finance p.a. and expand trade finance credit to more than 500 companies across countries, over 50% in IDA. By promoting trade facilitation, the project will help to close the trade finance gap at a time when banks are exiting from the trade space and will help to sustains trade flows of critical goods in key sectors of EM economies. Market contribution arises from end-beneficiaries integration into global value chains. Productive networks created by the project between local firms and countries trading goods cross border will send an important market signal of supporting EM/IDA (>50%) trade networks, to achieve the competitive growth of local firms and economies. Furthermore, by integrating new investors into EM-focused trade finance, the project will help channel new sources of capital to support EM trade flows, allowing these co-investors to replicate similar investments in the future.

title: Barak Trade Finance Facility
content: The Project is expected to have high development impact in the following areas: (i) Supporting SMEs and agricultural development:  Many African economies are highly reliant on the sale to and purchase from international markets for many strategic crops, foodstuffs and commodities to support their economic growth. By financing these suppliers and buyers, Barak provides critical liquidity to allow SMEs in agricultural and other value chains to support growth, increase employment and reduce poverty; (ii) Increasing access to finance for low-income and fragile/conflict-affected markets: Barak's on-the-ground presence in Sub-saharan African countries and extensive experience in structured trade products, the fund is able to offer specialized financial products to clients and markets that are underserved by traditional bank credit. The Project will enable Barak to extend additional financing in these hard-to-reach segments and markets.

title: Bizongo
content:
A. Project Impact
A.1. Stakeholder Impact
A.1.1. Increase in number of SME suppliers reached: Bizongo has more than 2500 registered SMEs, allowing smaller offline players to integrate better into the market.
A.1.2. Increased capacity utilization of SME suppliers by providing access to larger customers: Many SMEs in this sector lack professional expertise to market and distribute products, leading to low (less than 50%) capacity utilization. Bizongo is able to provide incremental demand and process knowhow which has led some suppliers to increase capacity utilization, significantly improving efficiency.
A.1.3. Improved financial sustainability of the SME suppliers through shorter working capital cycles: Suppliers are better able to manage their business financially due to shorter working capital cycles - since they no longer need to approach buyers individually - which leads to lower working capital needs and better inventory and time management. Customer acquisition costs are also decreased.
A.2. Economic Impact
A.2.1. Improved Employment: Bizongo currently gives jobs to ~110 employees directly (of which women are ~30%). Increased order volumes for suppliers could also lead to more employment within the SME packaging sector.
B. Market Impact
B.1. Improve efficiency and innovation by aggregating a highly fragmented industry: Bizongo contributes to market creation by consolidating and tech-enabling the packaging sector, which is currently fragmented and largely unorganized, with more than 30k registered packaging companies, out of which 85% are MSMEs. The platform supports innovation and efficiency by improving quality, developing new designs, standardizing existing designs and improving the efficiency of suppliers to make them more competitive.
B.2. Promoting the digital economy by increasing SME integration into ecommerce: SME B2B ecommerce in India is still underdeveloped. Bringing SMEs into the digital economy improves market linkages, strengthens the value chain and promotes financial inclusion (as digital invoices can prove credit worthiness to banks). This project also signals IFC's confidence in the financial viability of the broader B2B eCommerce space.

title: Highland PE Mezz
I&M Rwanda
content:
1) Project-level development impacts: 
i) Stakeholders impact: IFC anticipates that the Project will improve access to finance for SMEs and the agri-business sector, both priority areas for spurring economic growth and job creation in Rwanda; and
ii) Environmental and Social impact: IFC anticipates that the Project will generate environmental and social (E&S) benefits as IFC will work with the Bank to strengthen its E&S risk management standards in line with IFC's E&S Performance Standards.

2) Market-level development impact: 
i) Inclusiveness: IFC anticipates that the Project will enable the Bank to sustainably expand its reach to under-penetrated segments (e.g., SMEs and agri-business sector) thereby demonstrating the attractiveness of these under-served segments, which in turn should give comfort to other banks to extend their services to these segments.

title: SFCL WMSME
content:
DEVELOPMENT IMPACT - PROJECT OUTCOMES:

Stakeholders: The project will create better access to finance for around 20,000 women MSME customers at an affordable rate. This Project is expected to directly fund c. 2,500 WMSMEs. Over the next 5 years, SFCL is projected to provide in total 20,000 facilities to WOEs totaling c. USD 160 million (LKR 25 billion). The project will also support SFCL to increase its branch network over the next 5 years. The new branches will be established mainly in rural regions, where access to finance for MSME's are a challenge.
Economy-wide effects: The combined economic activity would result in an increase in tax revenue to the state at a time where the fiscal position is under stress due to high debt servicing cost. Further SenFin's branch expansion would create around 250 new financial sector jobs in rural regions. In addition, based on IFC Jobs Study, Sri Lanka (2012), an est.1,500-4,650 new direct jobs will be created by this project at the WMSME level. In addition, there will be indirect job creation, which cannot be quantified.

DEVELOPMENT IMPACT - CONTRIBUTION TO MARKET CREATION:

Competitiveness: The credit gap for women entrepreneurs in Sri Lanka is estimated at USD 350 million. This project is likely to incentivise Banks and other NBFI's to launch funding programs targeted at women. The availability of credit, would enable  WMSME's to compete and be a part of local/global value chains and grow their businesses by accessing domestic and foreign markets, which are not currently accessible.

title: Tamweelcom 3
content: The Project is expected to have positive impact on its stakeholders, namely individual entrepreneurs, micro and VSEs, including women entrepreneurs, that do not have access to banking services, but are crucial enablers for inclusive growth and poverty alleviation in the country, a key strategic priority for IFC.  By increasing access to finance to the underserved economic groups the project will contribute to the improvement of living standards and creation of new job opportunities in the country. Tamweelcom has a long and positive experience of working with micro and women clients and under this Project the company will continue expanding its on-lending program thus increasing accessibility of financial services to this group of clients.

title: Zain Iraq II
content:
(a) Project Impact Assessment- (i) increase availability and coverage of the 3G network in Iraq, thus increasing consumers' potential access to mobile broadband; (ii) improve the capacity and quality of the 3G mobile network, allowing consumers to use more data and data applications; (iii) contribute to Iraq's economic growth due to spillover effects across many sectors as a result of increase in mobile broadband penetration.

(b) Market Impact Assessment- (i) Resilience - IFC anticipates the project will result in lasting systemic improvements in reconnecting the recently liberated areas with Baghdad, in the absence of landlines, and supporting crisis response and digital identity to displaced and refugee populations, (ii) Competitiveness - IFC anticipates that the project, by improving the capacity of data connectivity in the country, will help improve competitiveness of businesses in Iraq and stimulate innovation and entrepreneurship in the country as broadband will provide the businesses access to knowledge and information, banking and payment platforms and boost their productivity.

title: BCN SME
content:
i.	Through the project, the Bank is expected to increase access to financial services for underserved SMEs, including women-owned SMEs, a strategic priority for IFC in Africa.

ii.	By expanding access to funding sources for BCN's clients, the project will facilitate employment opportunities and poverty alleviation. Long Term funding will help BCN manage balance sheet risk and broaden the mix of loan products available to its clients.

iii.	The project will also assist in deepening the provision of financial services in Cape Verde, by supporting a bank that provides innovative banking services to unbanked or underserved segments.

title: DCM CRT CACIB II
content: The proposed project will further support the supply of trade finance in EM countries by IFC sharing credit risk on trade finance activities with CACIB. Additionally, CACIB will commit to redeploy some of the capital released from the transaction to finance projects in EMs, which have an interesting social benefit. Thus CACIB and IFC aim at bringing more value to the Project, IFC incentivizing the Bank to support financing activities in EM which have an interesting social impact. Subject to the further development and standardization of Social Bond markets, this may pave the way to then refinancing those assets under potential Social Bonds issuance in the perspective of mutual collaboration between both institutions which have been coordinating together the Social Bond Working Group, under the remit of the Green Bond Principles, during the last 2 years.

title: Telco SA
content:
Assessment of Project Outcomes:
Stakeholders: IFC anticipates that the project will increase availability of mobile broadband by creating the first 4G network in Comoros. More specifically this project is expected to provide full 4G coverage to all of Comoros. As a result, the project will improve the capacity and quality of the mobile network through the construction of 4G-enabled towers. Finally, the project is expected to enhance the uptake of mobile broadband. Penetration of mobile broadband in Comoros is amongst the lowest in the East African region.  
Economy-wide effects: IFC anticipates that this project has the potential to significantly contribute to Comoros' economic growth due to the envisaged increase in mobile broadband penetration. Robust mobile and broadband connectivity enables economic and social transformation as it delivers multiple benefits ("digital dividends") to virtually all economic sectors, by allowing access to knowledge and information, boosting productivity of a variety of businesses, promoting technological improvements and entrepreneurship, enabling greater financial inclusion through mobile banking and generating employment and education opportunities.
Assessment of Contribution to Market Creation:
Competitiveness: IFC anticipates that by introducing 4G mobile services, the project will help improve competition in the MNO market in Comoros, currently dominated by the incumbent, and stimulate innovation. This is expected to result in better quality and service availability for consumers. 
Integration: The project has the potential to enhance Comoros' economic integration in the global markets. Access to quality broadband services has the potential to enhance the digitalization of Comoros's businesses, for example tourism and agriculture, to improve the islands' international competitiveness, and to promote its exports.

title: GTST Sahara
content:
The project would have significant development impact enabling one of the few African private oil trading companies having a regional footprint to: 
(i)	facilitate imports of strategic energy products in IDA countries, which are vital for the economies of the concerned IDA countries. 
(ii)	facilitate exports of critical commodities that are essential to some emerging market economies, and generate FX revenues for those countries.
The project would also indirectly back the business activity of companies involved in import/export, refining, transportation, distribution and retailing of crude oil and oil products, which is expected to enhance and sustain the employment generation capacity of these enterprises in the value chain.

title: DARP SPV CW2
content: Through the SPV, IFC will be channeling financing to local companies in distress, supporting them to meet their financial obligations, achieve sustainable growth and contribute to job creation and local economic stability.

title: DCM ABFL Green Bond
content:
GHG Savings: The proposed investment will result in savings in GHG emissions of up to 120,104 tCO2 p.a. as it will finance power generation through renewable and climate friendly sources. This is critical in the view of the GOI's overall intentions to reduce carbon intensity of the economy.

Integration: IFC's engagement with ABFL will support the latter's commitment to the renewable energy sector sending a positive signal to the market, and is likely to attract other local and international financial institutions to increase their investment in this sector. Additionally, IFC's continued investment in Green Finance will help to popularize this relatively new asset class, and attract niche investors.

title: KS MFI Loan AFK
content: The project is expected to have strong development impact as it will lead to: (i) increased access to finance for individuals and micro entrepreneurs operating in agrisector in an IDA and FCS country which will lead to farm productivity enhancements, better livelihoods and food security; (ii) higher competitiveness in the sector that will directly increase the range of products and services, with special focus on agriculture; and, (iii) creation of new jobs for individuals and micro entrepreneurs, including women, in rural areas. Beyond economic considerations, Kosovo's reliance on agriculture also has a crucial social dimension. Approximately 60% of the country's poor live in rural areas and depend on the agricultural sector for living. In this context, the project will reach the base of the pyramid by directly supporting the most vulnerable segments of the population.

title: Nabati Indonesia
content:
- The development impact of the proposed project will be assessed using the AIMM framework. Project-level impacts are expected through employment creation both during the construction and operation phases as well as through economic activities along the value chain, especially at the downstream end with Nabati's extensive sales force and distributors.
- The Project will also increase tax revenues in Majalengka, a frontier region in Indonesia where the minimum salary is US$150 per month vs. US$ 200 in the closest largest city (Bandung) or US$ 250 in Jakarta. The Project will also improve incomes of the SMEs which supply materials to Nabati.
- The Project is also expected to contribute to food security for bottom of the pyramid consumers. The new facilities to be funded by IFC will produce low market pricing products which are fortified with vitamins A, B1, B2, B6 and B12 (currently ~80% of Nabati's products are fortified).

title: KS MFI Loan KEP
content: The project is expected to have strong development impact as it will lead to: (i) increased access to finance for individuals and micro entrepreneurs operating in agrisector in an IDA and FCS country which will lead to farm productivity enhancements, better livelihoods and food security; (ii) higher competitiveness in the sector that will directly increase the range of products and services, with special focus on agriculture; and, (iii) creation of new jobs for individuals and micro entrepreneurs, including women, in rural areas. Beyond economic considerations, Kosovo's reliance on agriculture also has a crucial social dimension. Approximately 60% of the country's poor live in rural areas and depend on the agricultural sector for living. In this context, the project will reach the base of the pyramid by directly supporting the most vulnerable segments of the population.

title: Rewa Mahindra
content:
1. Increasing clean energy production: The project will help in achieving Government of India's Intended Nationally Determined Contribution of reducing the emissions intensity of its GDP by 33 to 35 percent by 2030 from 2005 levels, and reaching about 40 percent cumulative electric power installed capacity from non-fossil fuel based energy resources by 2030. 

2. Climate Change Mitigation: IFC's investment will enable clean energy production that will help avoid GHG emissions. As the project progresses based on actual power generation figures, company will estimate the GHG emissions reduction and report to IFC as part of its annual E&S performance monitoring report. 

3. Employment generation: The project will create employment opportunities - estimated at 500-550 workers during peak construction phase and around 65 full time skilled employees and around 100 part time unskilled employees during the operation phase.

title: Los Heroes CL
content:
Summary: The most significant, expected project-level impact is derived from the increase in access to finance to low income population. Beyond the project, the main source of expected market impact is derived from market enabling foreign investors funding Cajas' business  and replication effect, which in this case, promote inclusiveness and market resilience.

Project Impact Assessment: The project-level impacts  are composed of the following:Generate a demonstration effect for both the Company to improve its risk profile and for the Chilean Cajas sector as a whole, enhancing investors' confidence in the Cajas sector.Enhance access to finance for low-income individuals in Chile, currently underserved by the country's traditional financial system. Caja Los Heroes has nearly 1 million affiliates, and 77% of the Company's loans are granted to debtors with monthly income under US$613.

Market Impact Assessment: IFC anticipates that the project will enable the development of systemic changes to existing market that will deliver sustainable development impact by allowing foreign investors capital to fund Caja's social business. In particular:
Inclusiveness - Through a replication effect, IFC anticipates that the project will result in increased access to products and services for underserved groups through the support of Cajas' social credit and benefits program.
Market Resilience - Through the market enabling effect of - by the first time - obtaining local regulator permission for a foreign investor to invest and fund Cajas' social credit portfolios, IFC anticipates the project will result in lasting systemic improvements that will help the Cajas market withstand shocks by diversifying sources of funding and lowering the risk profile of the Cajas' sector.

title: Morris Hong Kong
content:
South-South Investment and Higher Operational Efficiencies: 
- Cambodia: The Project entails the transfer of knowledge and technical expertise as well as foreign direct investment from China to Cambodia, developing a stronger South-South value chain in the forestry and wood products sector. As a supplier to demanding U.S. and Canadian markets with stringent industry standards, Morris is well-placed to disseminate these practices to less developed countries. The adoption of best industry practices is expected to strengthen technological capacity and bring process improvements to the furniture industry in Cambodia, improving competitiveness at a larger scale than what is currently prevalent in the country. 

- China: In addition, the China component of the Project will help the Company achieve even greater economies of scale in China, leading to more competitive products for domestic consumption as well as export markets. The planned expansion in China is expected to increase the Company's production by 30%.  

Employment Generation and Standards Setting: 
- Cambodia: The transfer of export-quality furniture manufacturing knowledge and technology from China to Cambodia will go hand in hand with creating jobs in Cambodia and improving the skill base of the local labor force, thus raising overall productivity in the sector. The Project is expected to help create viable long term skilled and semi-skilled direct labor opportunities for approximately 800 people at the Cambodian operating facility as well as additional employment along the supply chain. The Project is also expected to help the Company pursue an ethical work program and contribute to improved labor conditions in Cambodia though the application of IFC's Performance Standards. 

- China: A sizeable number of direct jobs will also be created in China as a result of the Project. The Company's operations are fairly labor-intensive and the new facilities will require about 2,200 new employees. Over the longer term, the number of jobs and their skills level may evolve if the Company undertakes the recommended automatization which would improve resource use efficiencies.  

The Project has the potential to generate market level impacts by supporting the development of the nascent furniture industry in Cambodia and helping to integrate the country into more diversified global value chains. In particular:

- Cambodian industrial production is characterized by a narrow base, low level of technological sophistication, low value addition, and high concentration in only a few sectors (notably textiles and footwear, which represent approximately 80% of merchandise exports). Against this backdrop, a Chinese company diversifying its manufacturing base to Cambodia would help a country which is eager to both move up the manufacturing value chain as well as diversify over-reliance on textiles and garments. To help the country's manufacturing sector, Cambodian authorities have established the new Industrial Development Policy (IDP) 2015-2015, which provides a roadmap to boost investment and broaden the manufacturing base. 

- The proposed Project would build a new production facility in Sihanoukville Special Economic Zone (SSEZ) in line with IDP's vision. By undertaking a phased approach that starts with textile-based production (sofa covers) the Company is utilizing Cambodia's existing comparative advantages but is planning to invest in training and skill-building necessary to transition to furniture manufacturing and assembly. A successful outcome of the project is expected to demonstrate to international investors that Cambodia is a viable place of origin for high quality furniture and potentially attract new players. Furthermore, the Project is expected to have a positive impact on the local economy by upgrading the domestic manufacturing industry, diversifying exports, and integrating the country into new global value chains, thus strengthening its resilience to economic shocks.

title: DCM EPSA Green Bonds
content:
Access to reliable energy: The Project will increase access to renewable energy sources, limiting the Country's reliance on hydropower generation, currently accounting for approximately 70% of its generation capacity. 

Demonstration effects: The Project is expected to have a demonstration effect in LAC, and especially in Colombia, helping to smooth the path to the development of a regional and local green bond market as a way to finance climate-related projects. The Company is expected to be among the first green bond issuers in Colombia.

title: Energy Dev III
content: The project will: i) help address the climate change impacts in the Philippines by providing base load renewable energy power; ii) help maintain the avoidance of GHG emissions equivalent to about 5,047,997 tons of CO2 per year; iii) contribute to diversification of Philippine electricity generation mix in the Philippines which is currently skewed towards coal based generation; iv) provide uninterrupted, reliable electricity supply to people of Philippines.

title: Concord NE
content: The project will increase China's installed wind capacity by 200MW and will displace GHG emission equivalent to 390,000 metric tons of CO2 each year, supporting the country's plans to significantly increase the contribution of renewable energy to its energy mix in line with its Intendeda Nationally Determined Contributions (INDC) commitment. China's INDC outlines a vision of reduction of 60-65% in emission intensity of China's GDP by 2030 from 2005 levels and achieving 20% of generation based on non-fossil fuels versus 12% in 2016. The majority of installed generation capacity in China is in traditional coal-fired plants and using cleaner generation will help alleviate the severe air pollution problem in China.

title: Yerevan CCGT
content: The Project's positive development impact includes: (i) replacement of a highly-inefficient and depreciated power generation asset with a high-efficiency CCGT; (ii) helping the Armenian power sector reduce natural gas cost and ensuring reliable power supply in Armenia; and (iii) further strengthening the Armenian power sector by diversifying the investor base and increasing private sector participation.

title: Tajero WrCap
content:
The Project will have strong development impact
through:  i) improvement of consumer access and value through better
access to a more diverse selection, quality, affordability of food products,
and better consumer prices due to economies of scale;  ii) development of food distribution sector  as the
expansion will help increase the number of suppliers, build additional sales
channels, and contribute to improvement in efficiency and operating standards
throughout the supply chain;  





iii) import substitution: through improving and increasing
its distribution capability, the Group will have an increased ability to
distribute its rapidly developing dairy production capacity for the local
market.  This would decrease sales of imported, hard currency denominated
goods providing a less costly, locally produced alternatives in a country which
depends for 80% on imported food items.

title: Hikma expansion
content:
- Demonstration Effect: Hikma will bring in high quality manufacturing in emerging markets.
- High quality and affordable pharmaceutical products in MENA and other emerging markets.
- The investment will generate direct employment for skilled labor in addition to potential for indirect employment

title: Mandae 2017
content:
-	Support the Growth of SMEs: Mandae's services supports the development of SMEs by reducing their freight costs. As the Company grows, it expects to positively impact hundreds of more SMEs across brazil. 
-	Employment Generation: The Company currently employs 74 people in its direct operations. It intends to keep growing its business and is expected to further increase its workforce over time.

title: Coverfox
content:
1. Improved accessibility of insurance to uninsured. This will improve market efficiency and increase the options available to individuals. 
2. Improved transparency and quality as Coverfox allows for immediate comparability. It greatly reduces the time and effort of shopping for the best insurance product for consumers, leading to more informed decisions. 
3. Improved efficiency for insurance agents who are mostly sole proprietorship or microenterprises, by providing access to wider choice of insurers, cross-selling opportunities and better CRM tool as well as customer support.

title: Branch
content:
(i) IFC's proposed investment in Branch aims to enhance financial access by developing and deploying innovative, scalable, and sustainable lending solutions that reach underserved customers in developing countries. Stringent eligibility requirements, hidden fees and complex products/ procedures have kept many consumers from seeking or qualifying for bank financing. Branch promotes lower cost financial services and innovative delivery channels. 

(ii) Branch's growth will contribute to the competitiveness of the lending market in its countries of operation, by providing a further push towards the delivery of low-cost, easy-to-access, and increasingly longer-term loans for consumers and entrepreneurs.

title: KMF-HALP
XP Investimentos
content:
Consolidating the market: With the Project, IFC will be supporting the consolidation of a sector that changed the culture of investments and has strengthened capital markets in Brazil. 

Widening access to financial inclusion: The Project will be supporting the development and consolidation of a wide platform of distribution of assets, through which XP was able to connect investors looking for alternative ways of investing and companies and mid-sized banks looking for diversified funding sources.

title: DCM BDO Green
content: Project impact: Stakeholders impact - IFC anticipates the Project will increase the Bank's ability to finance climate smart and environmental friendly projects. IFC's successful track record in the green bond market both as an issuer and investor would help BDO build up standards of the green bond for its future issuances and capability to market this product with other investors and issuers in the market. Market impact: Competitiveness: IFC anticipates that the Project will introduce a new capital markets product in the Philippines since it is the first green bond issued in the market. The Project might demonstrate viability of the green bond product, thus opening a way for other similar green bond issuances by other local financial institutions and corporates in the Philippines. Through this investment, IFC will also help build up standards of the green bonds in the market. Sustainability: IFC anticipates that the Project will promote financing climate smart and environmentally sustainable projects including renewable energy generation projects, green buildings and energy efficiency projects.

title: Africa Renewable Energy Fund, L.P.
content:
The AREF transaction is anticipated to have project-level impacts in the form of (i) improved services offerered to customers (i.e. increased access to energy); and (ii) environmental impacts that make a contribution to green industries (i.e. investments in clean energy with associated GHG emissions reductions).  

It will also have market-level impacts, (i) in sustainability, through an impact on building green industries; and (ii) on competitiveness, through diversification of the private equity product offerings in the market.

title: Baidu MCC Gender
LIGHTHOUSE INDIA FUND III, LIMITED
content:
(i)	Private Sector Development: Access to long-term equity capital is difficult for unlisted companies. The Fund would provide scarce and patient capital as well as expertise and guidance to support value creation. Lighthouse's value-add to investees, through Fund I and Fund II, is visible through the robust growth in financial metrics, high job creation, and strengthening of the underlying business models.

(ii)	Financial inclusion and sustainability: Access to employment opportunities for individuals, access to markets for small businesses, and operational, financial and E&S improvement of local businesses. 

(iii)	Market development: Support of the India PE industry at a time when investor support has waned, through support of a local PE firm with long-term potential, operating in a segment of the market that has very few providers of growth capital.

title: Pyramid Pacific
content:
-	Access to quality healthcare: As Pyramid expands, it will help more healthcare providers in accessing quality equipment and enable them to deliver higher quality diagnostics and procedures benefiting from Pyramid's local presence as it provides trainings for equipment use and onsite maintenance.

-	Access to quality pharmaceuticals and medical consumables: The investment will support the availability of quality pharmaceuticals and medical consumables in the region and prevent counterfeit and fake drugs from entering the supply chain through consolidation of the market.

-	Creation of skilled employment opportunities: As Pyramid grows its activities across Sub-Saharan Africa, it will generate employment in countries of operation.

title: Itau-CBC Subdebt
content:
The development impact of the project is expected to be high as IFC's investment will enable greater cross-border financial integration in LAC, as it will continue to support Itau-CBC to consolidate in the Colombian market by supporting its SMEs and climate-smart loan portfolio growth. Furthermore, the proposed transaction will support the creation of a financial services platform with deep roots in Latin America. This is expected to diminish the volatility derived from large international investors entering and exiting developing markets. 

Supporting the Itau Group in a highly-concentrated market as the Colombian banking sector is key to secure competition amongst banks, which in turn can translate into more affordable terms for the public, specially SMEs and climate-smart projects. One of Itau-CBC's strategic objectives is to continue focusing on the SMEs business, as more than 62% of SMEs in the country report lack of available financing as a material constraint for growth.

title: Innova VI
content:
(i)	Job creation: The Fund will focus on mid-cap companies with growth capital needs, which tend to have the largest impact on job creation and the most potential for IFC to develop direct relationships through potential co-investment opportunities. 
(ii)	Access to finance: Long-term equity and risk-oriented capital is limited in Poland; mid-cap companies usually access bank loans in the absence of equity investors. IFC's investment will support Polish companies by providing additional equity in this segment.
(iii)	Private sector development: The Fund will play an active role in strengthening governance and transparency of the investee companies through its hands-on involvement. Operational efficiencies of the portfolio companies will improve, thus promoting growth and sustainability.

title: Universidad Santo Tomas
content:
-	Promote inclusion by increasing access to quality education for lower-middle income students. 
-	Post-conflict impact. The University has a strong social mission statement and is already working in the regions with post-conflict communities. The University, as derived from the Santo Tomas de Aquino religious ethos, promotes the integral formation of the individual, with a strong academic base, complemented with compulsory social impact community work and research programs for all students, building on strong ethics. 
-	Improve quality tertiary education in Colombia. Santo Tomas, as one of the leading universities in the country, and as the first one with multi-campus accreditation, is increasing the standards of academic offering. With this Project, the university will improve infrastructure standards in the regions, it will recognize faculty qualifications (masters and doctoral degrees), and will standardize its processes in all its campus (including open and distance learning education). 
-	Regional productivity improvement: Santo Tomas is providing quality tertiary education in mid-sized cities like Bucaramanga, Tunja and Villavicencio with specific academic programs tailored for the regional needs. As over 50% of the universities are based in Bogota, this high-quality regional presence is critical for students to stay close to their cities of origin and reduce drop-out effects associated with moving to other cities for their studies.

title: EIP Levant Fund SICAV
DCM Chola Masala
content: Additional Reach: The Company is expected to increase its customer base by 500,000 customers over the next 5 years; as a result, it is estimated that 1 million jobs would be created in this period.Capital Market Development: IFC's support would enable CIFCL to launch its first off-shore local currency bond to international investors and open the platform for further such solid, highly reputable but below international investment grade issuers to access the market. Growth in low income states (LIS): Currently, Chola has ~ 50% of its pan-India footprint in low income states. It is expected that more than 60% of CIFCL's portfolio will be in low income states going forward.

title: CIB Subdebt
content:
1.Provide CIB with long-term FCY funding to support its clients' long-term projects.
2.Improve client access to long-term FCY finance, which will in turn ensure both job preservation and creation within the local market.

title: DARP - OB
content:
IFC expects to have the following project and market level impacts from this Project.

-	Positive impact on financial institutions: Through this project, IFC anticipates to support the development of NPL or distressed assets market across the EMENA region with the aim to allow NPL sellers to dispose of their NPL portfolio, improve their liquidity and allow them to originate new loans. 
-	Enhance access to finance: The project will improve the financial standing of the ultimate borrowers, specifically SMEs to <e2>??normalize' their obligations with their lenders i.e. NPL sellers (financial institutions and/banks) and allow them to re-enter the financial system. 
-	Promote best practice distressed asset resolution: The Project aims to encourage adoption of international insolvency standards, with the support of the OB Group in conjunction with their use of legal, ethical and consensual recovery techniques. 
- Boost market competitiveness: Implementation of this Project is expected to develop the EMENA NPL / distressed asset resolution market by encouraging more NPL sellers, buyers and servicers to enter this space; which in turn will promote the overall competitiveness of this asset class across the region. Furthermore, it will help stimulate market wide adoption of specialized processes and best practice by servicers for distressed asset resolution in the regional.

title: Genesis I
content:
The Project will increase access to finance to the underserved population in Guatemala, at least 70 percent of whom would be women.This project intends to
contribute to the goal of Universal financial access 2020 ("UFA") of
the World Bank Group with operations extended by G<e9>nesis Empresarial Foundation
to increase its outreach to underserved and vulnerable.The project prioritize access to
financing for women, indigenous and rural populations in Guatemala, through
market-wide adoption of impact business models, capacity building and enhanced
market participation, promoting economic and social sustainable development.

title: LAFISE SA
content:
IFC's support will enable Lafise to expand the scale of its lending, by increasing the amount of SME and housing loans granted by them. This in turn is expected to have a threefold impact: 

1. The project will increase access to more affordable housing loans and will help to reduce the housing deficit in Nicaragua, which the government estimates at 957,000 units. 

2. SMEs will also benefit from the proposed Project, since it will contribute to reduce the substantial credit gap of US$16.2 billion in Central America, according to the SME Finance Forum. With IFC's support, Lafise will address this gap and will promote more private sector participation. 

3. Nicaraguan environment will be benefited through the financing of Climate Smart projects that are environmentally friendly. In addition, the Bank will need to comply with IFC's performance standards.

title: WCS BRAC III
content:
1.	Improved Access to Credit: The Project will increase access to finance for credit-constrained, export-oriented companies and SMEs to meet working capital requirements. It will also expand financial intermediation. IFC's investment will further support business growth and spur job creation in the SME and export-oriented segments.

2.	Boost Export Competitiveness: IFC's investment will help to accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements, and help them pay for imports needed in the value chain.

title: Firstrand SL
content: Project-level development impacts: i) Access to finance: The proposed project will increase access to finance for SMEs and WOE in particular; ii) Job creation: The proposed project is expected to catalyze employment in previously disadvantaged communities.Market-level impacts and market creation i) Continued support: IFC's investment will send a strong signal of ongoing support and trust in the South African financial market to international investors; ii) Demonstration Effect: The project will have a strong signaling effect and catalyze interest from other South African banks in the IFC SME Push Program and in Banking on Women.

title: Garanti Facility
content: The main objectives of the project are to: (i) respond to the critical term funding gap for SMEs; (ii) generate employment through resultant growth of SMEs and investment in productive assets; and, (iii) increase financial inclusion in Romania: improved access to credit and increasing the economic power of women would translate into improved livelihoods for a wide cross-section of society.

title: Vinavil Egypt
content:
Development impact TBD with IFC's AIMM framework.
Project Level
-	Stakeholders: local builders increased access to quality adhesives, sealants and concrete additives for efficient/lasting construction. 
-	Value addition/employment/economic returns TBD with newly-developed sector multipliers.
-	Environmental impacts/climate change mitigation: 70% of R&D is for eco-sustainable products with 5-10% in CO2 emissions/energy savings.

Market Level demonstration impact TBD for resilience/sustainability of specialty materials.

title: Rikweda
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impact: (i) providing farmers with sustainable access to markets; (ii) expected employment creation of 60 direct jobs and a number of indirect jobs across the value chain; (iii) building farmers' capacity through advisory services to support extension services and improve farming practices; (iv) promoting women's role through support to female producers; (v) promoting food safety through IFC's technical assistance services; and (vi) support climate smart agriculture through the construction of a modern processing plant designed to reduce heat waste and increase water efficiency savings.

title: MBK Loan 2017
content:
Project level impact: 
-	Supporting gender finance: MBK currently has 1 million women borrowers. Through this project IFC anticipates that MBK would reach additional low-income women borrowers particularly in rural areas through the provision of working capital financing.
-	Job creation particularly for women: MBK employs over 4,000 people of which 99 percent are women. The project is expected to create 3,000 further job opportunities for women as the proposed funding will facilitate outreach expansion through deployment of additional human resources.  Furthermore, there may be additional job effects at the women owned microenterprise level.

Market level impact: 
-	Inclusiveness: MBK is a leading MFI in Indonesia with predominantly women clients. IFC anticipates that the project will increase access to products and services for under-served low-income women borrowers particularly in rural areas of Indonesia. It has been in operations since 2003 and its successful track record can positively contribute to the adoption of impact business models through replication.

title: China Warehouses
content:
Expected development impact includes:
(i)	Linkages: Modern, high-quality warehouses support improved efficiencies and reduced operational costs for local businesses and supply chains. 
(ii)	Standards: Other industry players will be encouraged to raise standards by increased competition. The Project is expected to serve as a catalyst for other firms to make improvements in areas such as labor conditions, safety, efficient use of resources and environmental sustainability.

title: CIE Auto Mexico
content:
- Supply Chain: Strengthening the competitiveness of one of a leading automotive parts and components producers and its supply chain in the Mexico, will result in corresponding impacts on technical upgrading of its local supply chain, production volumes and economy-wide linkages. 
- Sustainable employment: The Project will generate 899 skilled direct jobs across the CIE's 9 manufacturing plants in the country in addition to several indirect jobs in the Group's suppliers who will also be increasing capacity and upgrading skills to meet the higher volume requirements. 
- Customers: End consumers, predominantly OEMs and Tier 1 companies operating in Mexico, will benefit from better access to a reliable source of good quality locally produced components and parts for their operations, which ultimately helps with sustaining the competitiveness of the automotive cluster in the country which will depend less on imported parts. 
- Market: Stronger integration of local suppliers into the domestic and global value chains through the improvement of standards and capacity.

title: Mercantile Bank Limited
content:
Increased access to finance: IFC's investment will provide much-needed funding to the SME sector, particularly WOEs and BEEOEs, through a bank which is completely focused on this segment. It will help SMEs grow and stabilize their businesses, create more jobs and contribute more effectively to boosting productive economic activity.

Competitiveness: IFC's investment will support the sustainable growth of the Bank, ensuring that it continues to promote SME lending in the South African banking sector. In particular, this will be the first bank in South Africa specifically allocating a portion of the funding to WOEs and BEEOEs.

title: Westfalia Intl.
content: IFC anticipates the project will affect a significant number of avocado farmers in Colombia, Chile, Peru, and Mexico, who will benefit from better access to inputs such as avocado cultivars from newly-established or expanded nurseries. The project will also create ~730 new direct jobs in Colombia (nursery and orchards), Chile (nursery and logistics), and Peru (orchards) . In addition, the project is expected to have meaningful impact across a range of market-level dimension, including competitiveness, inclusiveness, and sustainability. The proposed investment will make the South African avocado industry more globally competitive  and enhance the country reputation's as a hub for sector expertise and on avocados.

title: Valor Venture Fund II, LP
content: Supporting innovation, creating markets and providing access to capital: Startups in emerging markets currently lack access to patient equity capital, global know-how and operational support that professional fund managers offer. Early stage companies need cash infusions in relatively quick successions as they achieve scale. Without adequate funding, they would not be able to sustain operations and be forced to abandon their pursuit of developing disruptive businesses. Thus, there is a significant role for governments and developmental finance institutions to play in helping to support and sustain entrepreneurship and innovation in underserved markets. Access to equity is difficult for asset light businesses such as technology firms. IFC's commitment would provide the necessary patient capital to support and grow such innovative businesses. Global expansion of local businesses: The Fund will support an innovation ecosystem around its investees to maximize success potential and foster skills development and international best practice. The project is expected to reach 25 early stage companies and improve operations with proper guidance. Governance, and operational improvements: IFC will offer guidance and ensure that local businesses implement best practices in various fields.

title: Phoenix Tower B3
content: Foster competition: Competition among the independent tower operators will allow smaller wireless operators to benefit from reduced barriers to entry as they will have access to leased tower infrastructure for more competitive prices, rather than incurring large Capex for this purpose. Increased wireless penetration: The construction of additional telecommunication towers will allow mobile operators to expand their services both in terms of capacity and geographic coverage, especially in rural or underserved areas. In addition, tower sharing will drive down the incremental cost of expanding coverage for all carriers thereby reducing the cost of mobile service for end users. Access to ICT technologies: PTB tower network will support mobile cellular networks but also wireless broadband and backhaul networks, hence improving the penetration of ICT technologies.

title: Farmoquimica
content:
- Expand access to high quality and affordable pharmaceutical products. The project will help the expansion of a company that is one of the largest supplier of medicines for endemic diseases in Brazil (FQM #1 product is Annita, market leader for the treatment of parasitosis, endemic particularly in North and Northeast Brazil and other regions where access to clean drinkable water is not universal); 
- Support investments in frontier regions in Brazil, which suffer from restricted access to quality drugs at affordable rates. Divcom is entirely based in the Northeast region having the distribution center in Paraiba and manufacturing plant in Pernambuco. Already today, the North and Northeast of Brazil are #1 regions of operations of both FQM and Divcom.
- Support companies manufacturing their products in deprived areas (FQM plant is in Jacar (RJ), and Vidfarma plant is located in the countryside of Pernambuco state), with a positive impact on employment of the local community. 
- Job creation for women. The company expects to expand its salesforces, a large part of which consists of women. 
- Support an attractive South-South investment from the controlling shareholder, Laboratrios Roemmers.

title: Garanti Leasing Romania Facility 3
content: The main objectives of the project are to (i) help respond to the critical term funding gap for SMEs as Garanti Leasing's customer base is predominantly SME's; (ii) alleviate the difficulty of SMEs in accessing bank financing by using asset-secured lease finance; and, (iii) generate employment through resultant growth of SMEs and investment in productive assets, with a focus on women owned SMEs.

title: Amethis II
content: (i) The growth of the Fund's portfolio companies is expected to result in strong job creation; (ii) the Fund will invest in companies that focus on the lower-income emerging consumer; and (iii) private sector development by enhancing regional integration via supporting companies to expand across borders.

title: DCM Patria COF
content:
Increase Access to Long Term Finance: The Project will offer alternative sources of financing especially to mid-size companies, which are not be able to get access to adequate funding from local financial institutions. The project is expected to complement IFC current efforts with financial institutions ("FIs") in this market segment.
Development of new asset class: The Project will help deepen and strengthen local Brazilian capital markets to the benefit of local mid-size firms. The Fund Manager is committed to raising the profile of COFs in Brazil as a nascent investible asset class for institutional investors, capable of providing portfolio diversification benefits and risk/return enhancement. 
Job preservation and creation: The Project is expected to support job preservation and creation by supporting the access to adequate long-term funding to mid-size companies, key segment of source of growth and employment in the Brazilian economy.

title: DCM Dunas FIDC
content:
Increase Access to Finance for SMEs and Women-owned SMEs: The Project will offer alternative sources of financing to SMEs, especially small companies, which are not be able to get access to adequate funding from local financial institutions. The Brazilian SMEs represent a very broad market segment consisting of millions of companies that have limited access to conventional credit facilities through the Brazilian financial system. This is the case, particularly, in markets outside Brazil's main cities, which are underserved by financial institutions. Given the recent recession and still uncertain economic scenario, SMEs are facing a particular difficult moment to access credit in Brazil. Additionally, by offering an alternative source of financing to SMEs, the Project will also reach an underserved segment, which is Women-owned SMEs.
Financing for on-lending through digital channel: The Project will support an innovative way of offering financing to SMEs, by using technology. The use of a digital platform enables faster and more efficient processes, which goes in the opposite direction of traditional lending, creating competitiveness in the market. Furthermore, by supporting on-lending through a digital platform, the Project will enhance financial connectivity and inclusion. In a large country like Brazil, offering a product, which is accessible in any geographic location will scale financing to SMEs and lead to market integration.

title: Ashiana
Zorlu Solar I
content: The Project will: (i) help add new generation capacity and reduce the significant power supply deficit in Pakistan; (ii) diversify the energy mix in Pakistan and help harness indigenous solar resource; (iii) help reduce sector generation costs and enhance affordability, (iv) deliver climate change benefits by avoidance of greenhouse gas emissions, and (v) promote increased private sector participation in Pakistan's renewable power sector.

title: Synergy II
content: (i) The growth of the Fund's portfolio companies is expected to result in strong job creation; (ii) the Fund will invest in companies that focus on the lower-income emerging consumer; and (iii) private sector development by enhancing regional integration via supporting companies to expand across borders.

title: TSKB Sustainable Climate
content: The project is expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of the clean energy, energy and resource efficiency project investments. Specifically, IFC's investment would: (i) improve the competitiveness of the Turkish economy by increasing the utilization of the energy, water and raw materials more efficiently; (ii) develop energy and resource efficiency and related externality investment projects, R&D investments across all sectors; and (iii) improve the local as well as the global environment through reduced emissions of conventional pollutants and GHGs.

title: CHG Syndication
content: 1) Expanding Access to Finance for Private Sector Led Affordable Housing Projects: The Project will provide liquidity to build private sector led affordable housing projects to enable migrant workers, and lower income urban households in China to afford higher quality housing. The Project is expected to finance an additional 6,000 affordable housing units per year and benefit about 30,000 families; 2) Promoting Greater Market Competitiveness: The Project has the potential to promote greater market competitiveness by facilitating private sector participation in the supply side of the affordable housing market; 3) Promoting Greater Market Sustainability: With IFC's help, CHG has implemented its own E&S Risk Management System to effectively assess and monitor the E&S risks of its projects and kept improving the system. The adoption of high E&S standards can help promote greater market sustainability.

title: Polykrome SA
content:
The project impacts are centered around:
-	Improving the company's operational practices and production efficiencies.
-	Building up the domestic manufacturing sector in Senegal.

In addition, the proposed investment has the potential to generate market impacts by stimulating competitiveness of the domestic manufacturing industry and promoting sustainability by obtaining the first Green Building Certification with IFC's support.

title: Vicentin LTD
Haid Intl
content:
(i) Spur Regional Economic Growth through a South-South Investment: Haid's cross-border investments in Vietnam, India and potentially other emerging markets will help to stimulate regional integration, job creation, and economic development through upstream and downstream linkages.

(ii) Improve Farmer Incomes: Aqua feed and fingerlings supplied by Haid to independent shrimp and fish farmers have been shown to generate better feed conversion ratios than those from other suppliers. The use of these inputs and the accompanying technical services from Haid will enhance the supply chain efficiencies and lower inputs costs for farmers, thus contributing to improved farmer incomes.  

(iii) Support Climate Change Agenda: The Project will also contribute to the development of Climate Smart Agriculture and climate change adaptation through better efficiencies, reduced waste, and lower fish and shrimp mortality. These all jointly result in a smaller environmental footprint of aquaculture and higher water quality in the ponds, which is especially relevant in markets experiencing a strain on the environment.

(iv) Food Safety: Haid will adopt best food safety practices in the new markets, in line with its current operations that are subject to several Quality Assurance systems (such as ISO22000, BAP, Global GAP and HACCP). These certifications not only mitigate risks but give the Company a competitive advantage.

title: Alqueria II
content:
Farmer reach & Rural Development: By investing in Alqueria IFC will be supporting 13,000 farmers, most of them in rural areas where poverty levels are higher than in urban areas. Supporting rural development through income generating opportunities is key for the GoC post-conflict agenda. In addition, as a consequence of the project the Company will increase its sourcing of fresh milk benefitting thousand of small farmers in frontier regions of Colombia such as the Orinoquia and costal regions.

Forward linkages development: Alqueria distributes its products through a vast network of distributors, including 160,000 mom & pop shops across the Colombian geography. These shops will benefit by an increased products offer such as fruit juices, yogurt, almond beverages, whey and eventually cheese.

Food security: Alqueria is the third largest dairy producer in Colombia. The Company processes up to1.2 million Liters of fresh milk per day and produces up to 32 MT of several different products ranging from whole milk to dairy value-added products such as yogurt, flavored milk, whey-based products, in addition the Company produces other drinks such as orange juice and almond based beverages. Alqueria's products reach a great percentage of the Colombian population daily, including infants, children, adults and the elderly. 

Food safety: Alqueria produces with the highest standards of quality. All of its products comply with public and private food safety standards. Alqueria's most important dairy plants have been awarded with the Chicago based certification of Quality Check'd. The latter is awarded only to those dairy companies that produce with the highest environmental, social and food safety practices.

title: DCM - PROGRAM FOR COVERED BONDS OF GREEK BANKS
content: The most significant, expected project level impact is derived from improved liquidity and balance sheet stabilization which would benefit the customers of the banks who are severely affected by the banking crisis. In addition, IFC's funding will be used for onlending to mortgage borrowers, who have been facing a liquidity squeeze, as cash starved banks deleverage their portfolios. Beyond the project, the main source of expected market impact is derived from supporting recovery from the crisis and building resilience through re-establishment of sustainable sources of funding on the market from international capital markets, and promoting greater integration of capital markets, both brought about by market enabling and demonstration effect.

title: GFO Loan II
content: Through this project, IFC will support an innovative Colombian non-banking factoring company to increase its reach by becoming an alternative funding source to more SMEs while broadening the implementation of its proprietary e-factoring invoicing platform for the sector at large.The proposed financing could help make financing available for the discount of over 160,000 SMEs' invoices each year. Additionally, by increasing the size of GFO's operations, the Project will support employment generation within the Company. The Project will also contribute to the development and competitiveness improvement of the factoring industry in Colombia, by helping to promote the development of innovative funding products for SMEs and boosting the growth of a non-banking market leader.

title: CRRH-UEMOA Bond
