content: The most significant expected project-level impact is derived from the expansion of the mortgage finance market in the entire WAEMU region. Beyond the project, the main sources of expected market impact are derived from the promotion of market competitiveness and resilience via the market enabling channel.

title: DNP Water
content:
i.	Improve water quality and water access for rural areas: Relative to other countries in the region, Vietnam has significantly low levels of piped water access. IFC investment to support DNP Water's rapid growth plans as a result of its investment would help expand water access and quality. 

ii.	Address impact of climate change: Vietnam is struggling with significant water salinity and unsustainable ground water utilization. As a result, expansion of efficient surface water treatment facilities has become increasingly important. IFC investment to support DNP Water's planned expansion of existing and acquired water treatment operations, as well as DNP Water's planned development of new water treatment projects, will support the mitigation of these impacts from climate change.

iii.	Demonstration Effect: IFC investment will have demonstration effect and will help to promote and facilitate more private sector investment and more foreign investment in the Vietnam water sector.

title: Guinea Alumina Corporation
content:
Macro-economic impacts: The Project is expected to make a significant contribution to Guinea's economic growth through increased production and export of Bauxite and associated job creation and economic activity from the local supply chain. The Project will further strengthen Guinea's position as a key global supplier of bauxite for decades to come.

Fiscal impact: The Project is expected to generate significant revenue streams to the Government of Guinea (GoG). Direct contributions to the GoG will consist of royalties, local development and corporate taxes over the life of the mine.

Employment: At peak of the construction phase, the Project will employ approximately 3,500 people. During operations, GAC is expected to have 650 direct employees, of whom 520 will be local. The Project is also expected to generate significant indirect employment estimated at 9,800 jobs in the supply chain including service companies, construction, transport and maintenance operations. GAC is also establishing a skills development program for local employees which includes operational and safety training as well as leadership and language skills.

Community development and linkages program: GAC is implementing a range of social and economic development and linkages programs to stimulate economic development in the Boke region, ranging from local training and skills development, local content development, health and safety initiatives, and local infrastructure development, among others. IFC will provide ongoing advice to further enhance the impact on local community and supplier development.

title: Almarai
content: The main development impacts of the Project in Egypt include: (i) creating direct and indirect employment; (ii) supporting a large number of small and medium enterprises along the primary supply chain; and (iii) enhancing food safety given Almarai's focus on product quality.

title: CELSE
content: (i) Development of the LNG-to-power industry, supporting energy diversification and security; (ii) Provide needed base load capacity, improving sustainable natural resource management and climate resilience; (iii) Demonstration effect by financing the first private LNG-to-power project in Brazil and encouraging increased foreign direct investments; and (iv) Generation of employment opportunities.

title: WCS Santander Brasil
content:
Support SMEs: The project's main objective is to support SMEs that foster local economies. SME finance is a key priority for IFC as one clearly identified constraint to prosperity and poverty reduction observed in many EMs relates to a shortage of lending to SMEs. This project contributes to reducing the gap because it provides support for SME lending through a financial intermediary that has a broad reach in Brazil. This project is particularly relevant in the current economic recession.

Countercyclical role: a clear objective of the project is to support confidence in the Brazilian banking sector by providing a large financing package, including direct exposure to a systemic bank and to an economic sub-sector when the need is greatest. IFC's countercyclical role through its stamp of approval as a respected investor in the marketplace will help address a possible confidence crisis, and the project will further help anchoring expectations about the strength of Santander and of the banking sector in Brazil.

title: DCM Is Green Mortgage DPR
content:
1)	Access to Housing Finance: IFC's funding will help improve access to housing finance to the fast growing and young population of Turkey.
 
2)	Development of the Green Mortgage Sector: IFC's investment will support increasing an awareness about green mortgages and thereby supporting further development of the sector.

3)	Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions: High potential to decrease greenhouse gas emissions by supporting energy efficiency in the building sector in Turkey. The project is expected to reduce total GHG emissions by about 10,000 tCO2e per year.

title: VPC Debt Facilit
content:
Transparency, Competition and Lower Interest Rates: Supporting non-bank lenders and enabling them to scale will drive competition in consumer and SME lending in emerging markets. This will increase transparency and help drive down interest rates.  
Financial Inclusion: The technology used by Non-bank Lenders for loan scoring consumers and businesses allows them to establish alternative credit scores for borrowers in seconds and thereby provide loans to large numbers of unscored people/businesses. This provides greater access to finance to small business and consumers.

title: Subati
content:
Project Impacts

- Stakeholder Impact: In order to support the employees and their communities, which predominantly rely on subsistence agriculture, Subati provides housing and access roads to link its workers to the farms and cold storage facilities.

- Direct employment: Greenhouse production and subsequent preparation of flowers for export are very labor intensive operations, requiring 2,000 employees currently and increasing by about 700 as a result of the project.

- Value added, and return to the economy: Better operational efficiencies, climate smart solutions and expansion of both rose and herb farms will help the company to diversify into different crops and enhance the company's competitiveness. The expansion of sustainable flower production and the development of the new export-oriented herb sector will contribute to broader private sector competitiveness in Kenya, help to diversify the economy, and generate valuable foreign currency revenues. 

- Environmental & social impact: Given the environmental and social sensitivities related to flower production in Kenya, especially in the area of Lake Naivasha, the bar for the sustainability of any new investments is very high. IFC anticipates the project will be developed in line with best international practices, especially with regard to water management to maximize resource use efficiency. A new water treatment plant will be financed by the project at the herb farm. The project will contribute to the climate change agenda by financing solar panels and a cold storage facility for herbs, reducing GHG emissions and crop losses.

Market Impact
- The project has the potential to enable the development of herb markets in Kenya by further confirming the country's competitiveness in this space and the natural complementarities with the flower production.

title: Jiahe
content:
1. Access to quality food ingredient: By supporting a quality-focused NDC producer, IFC will help Jiahe to set an example for the rest of the sector, and raise the country's overall food safety standards; consumers will benefit from having access to safe and affordable alternative to milk in processed food and beverages.
2. Direct Job creation: The Project is expected to create about 250 direct jobs. The use of quality ingredients by hundreds of SMEs (bakeries and other food companies) will help strengthen their operations and market position.

title: Mahindra Life
content:
The proposed project is expected to generate strong development impact along several channels. Part of the area to be developed is located in the low income state of Rajasthan, impacting the development of a region in need. In the other two states, the project is located in areas that have potential for greater large-scale industrial infrastructure creation. 
a) Development of quality industrial infrastructure: 
(i) For small and medium businesses:
The project is expected to increase availability of critical industrial infrastructure, directly benefitting small and mid-sized businesses that do not have the resources to set it up themselves. 

(ii) For large businesses:
By providing a plug-and-play ecosystem, the Project is expected to reduce the time for companies to go-to-market and enable them to instead focus on core business operations. 

b) Demonstration effect:  Private industrial parks are a relatively new asset class in India, and the project is expected to generate a positive demonstration effect and promote the development of such spaces in the country. 

c) Exporting capacity: The Project is expected to expand India's exporting capacity through the development of a Special Economic Zone (SEZ) in Rajasthan;
 
d) Employment: The Project is expected to contribute significantly to job creation. During the construction phase, the Project is expected to generate temporary jobs in the construction sector, and a significant number of indirect jobs in suppliers' industries for construction materials. The project is expected to also create permanent jobs in the form of outsourced labor for services such as housekeeping, security, landscaping, maintenance, etc. during the ICs operations, as well as jobs through the businesses using the space developed in the IC. 

e) Community development: The Project is also expected to positively impact local communities and seek to promote inclusive development through various activities such as vocational skill training, self-help groups for women etc.

title: Bujagali 2 (Refi)
content: In recent years, the Government of Uganda ("GOU") has shown a strong focus on the country's rapid industrialization by catalyzing growth in the manufacturing sector. The spillover effects of a country's strong manufacturing sector cannot be overstated: they include growth in productivity, the potential for diversification into a variety of economic activities, increased value addition vis-<c3> -vis other primary sectors and creation of new employment opportunities. In support of this objective, the GOU is implementing a three-pronged approach for the electricity sector of (i) lowering electricity tariffs, (ii) increasing generation; and (iii) increasing electricity access. These are critical steps in increasing the competitiveness of the electricity sector, and by extension the manufacturing sector, compared to other countries in the East Africa region.In this context, the proposed transaction is key in making electricity generation more affordable, given that the Project contributed c.44% of the country's energy generation and c.65% of its 2016 generation costs, as disclosed by the Electricity Regulatory Agency (ERA). Reducing the cost of generation is the first step towards reducing tariffs for end users and catalyzing economic growth. Furthermore, the resulting tariff reduction is expected to improve the power sector sustainability and is in line with the GOU's increasing electricity access agenda. To this end, the GOU is also considering several incentive programs to increase demand for electricity and generally boost economic activity in the country.

title: Fenglin III
content:
(1) Private sector development: Continued investments from IFC in successful and scalable companies like Fenglin contribute to the development and consolidation of fragmented forestry and wood panel industries in China, particularly in Guangxi Province, a frontier region where the local economy depends heavily on the industry. Fenglin would continue adopting good practices and high standards for its business practices, such as implementing a laser measuring system for scrap woods delivered to its gate, which allows a more objective and prompt way to compensate its suppliers; introducing higher value-added and innovative products to the market using its in-house R&D work; and adopting international standards and systems in its operations, thereby setting a demonstration effect for the industry as a whole.

(2) Farmers' reach and local economy: The Project would procure at least around 363,000 tons of scrap wood per year directly and indirectly from local forestry farmers in Guangxi Province. This helps to stimulate economic activity among local forestry households, create additional income for them and directly improve their livelihoods. In addition, the Project will procure about 90% more chemicals, such as formaldehyde and urea from local SME suppliers, providing them with more business opportunities.

(3) Environmental impact: The Project would help to raise the industry environmental standards in China through the use of advanced technologies for particle board production including a new air emission system. The new plant would have capability to produce boards with formaldehyde free adhesive on a large scale and continuous basis when the market demands such products, which is currently rare in the industry in China. The Project would also help productively utilize scrap wood that would otherwise be burnt for cooking, thus reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The Project is a sustainable solution to resolving the issues of diminishing wood supply and scrap wood waste, and creates a positive impact on the local forestry industry. The Company's commitment to the highest national and international environmental standards sets an example for the industry.

title: Partech Africa
content: i.	Access to capital: Access to equity is difficult for asset light businesses such as technology firms. The Fund will help support the innovation, technology, and entrepreneurs in SSA. The IFC commitment will help improve access to the much needed long-term equity capital for emerging early-stage companies in SSA, where the startup funding space is still quite nascent compared with other emerging markets.ii.	Job creation and economic growth: Based on IFC's experience, venture capital funds contribute meaningfully to job creation and economic growth.iii.	Governance, operational and E&S improvements: IFC will guide and ensure that local businesses implement best practices in various fields

title: VIB Senior Loan
content:
Project Impact: Stakeholders - The proposed investment will provide needed long-term fuding to VIB, thus help increase VIB's ability to provide diversified financial products and services to SMEs and grow its affordable housing portfolio.
Market Impact: Inclusiveness - The Project will help to bridge the gap in finance to SME and affordable housing segments, which in turn promote financial inclusion and deepening of the financial market through supporting VIB, an IFC's existing client in Vietnam.
Competitiveness - The successful implementation of the Project will promote lending in the economy and underpin the overall growth in the economy, as higher loan volumes will benefit customers, suppliers and new entrants.

title: Carnelian
content: The Project's expected development impacts include: (i) increasing access to affordable quality medicines, (ii) enabling a regional consolidator to increase access to medicines through efficient distribution and increased quality standards, (iii) increasing global competitiveness of a local manufacturer, (iv) contributing toward gender employment, and (v) reducing counterfeiting of medicines through the development of innovative advance delivery technologies.

title: GenBridge I
content: Expected development impact includes (i) national and regional expansion of local businesses, job creation and economic growth, (ii) operational, financial, environment and social improvement of local businesses through knowledge transfer by the Fund and (iii) private sector development through acceleration of growth of consumer sub-sectors.

title: Africa's Talking Ltd
content:
- AT's platform and business model lower access and cost barriers for technology entrepreneurs in Africa:  AT's scalable cloud offering is able to profitably serve both the "one-man" shop and larger customers simultaneously.   
- Enhanced Digitization: AT's Africa expansion offers an opportunity for startups in Africa to target new markets and offer digital solutions which accelerate the realization of the Sustainable Development Goals (by 2030) (e.g. digital payments for pay-as-you-go solar, fintech, and technology-enabled farming, which enhances food security.)

title: Hystead Limited
content:
-	Improved overall standards and setting standards: The Project is also contributing to the overall improvement of quality standards in Serbia, Montenegro and Macedonia, through meeting IFC's E&S standards, including an international life and fire safety (LFS) standard and is expected to demonstrate and transfer knowledge on best practices to other operators in each market.

-	Green building certification: The malls will adopt international green building standards, which is expected to contribute to improvements in water and energy efficiency for the facilities in Serbia, Montenegro and Macedonia.

-	Skills Transfer: The Company will implement a training program through its management team, building on its existing operations and training program in South Africa, and by setting up cooperation with local educational institutions to support their newly developing CEE operations.

title: Goodlife II
content: The investment in Goodlife will provide access to quality pharmaceutical products for millions of emerging consumers in the East African region. It will further help to reduce and eventually eliminate the dominance of counterfeit and fake medicine in the market, which today dominates the regional industry. In addition, the investment in Goodlife will help to support the creation of local jobs, both in the construction and development of new stores, and through the training of skilled in-store professionals who will staff the new Goodlife outlets.

title: ESIP Chaldal
content:
The expected development impact of the project includes: 
i) demonstrating the viability of venture investing in Bangladesh, which is expected to have a catalytic effect on the broader venture ecosystem in Bangladesh 
ii) contributing to the company's financial sustainability and growth
iii) job creation in warehousing and logistics.

title: Rewa Actis
content:
1. Increasing clean energy production: The Project will help in achieving Government of India's Intended Nationally Determined Contribution of reducing the emissions intensity of its GDP by 33 to 35 percent by 2030 from 2005 levels, and reaching about 40 percent cumulative electric power installed capacity from non-fossil fuel based energy resources by 2030. 

2. Climate Change Mitigation: IFC's investment will enable clean energy production that will help avoid GHG emissions. As the Project progresses based on actual power generation figures, company will estimate the GHG emissions reduction and report to IFC as part of its annual E&S performance monitoring report.

3. Employment generation: The Project will create employment opportunities - estimated 400 during construction and 60 in operation phase.

title: Camesa Revolver
content: The proposed project will help increase reach to underserved MEs in Mexico and promote competition in a highly concentrated market

title: Wadi IV
content:
IFC's investment is expected to:
- Support a local producer to expand its exports which will contribute positively to generation of foreign currency in Egypt. Wadi currently exports fruits, vegetables, packaged foods and cell pads (industrial cooling solutions), and has recently starting exporting large animal feed, mainly to Jordan and GCC countries. Furthermore, Wadi produces soy bean meal and mono-calcium phosphate (MCP) locally, which would otherwise need to be imported (Wadi is the only producer of MCP in Egypt).  
- Increase farmer and SME reach. The Company purchases olives, vegetables, and other agricultural products from more than 70 local farms. Wadi also currently reaches more than 1,500 small farmers through sales of its day-old chicks and poultry feed. As it enters new product markets, Wadi will grow its reach to additional farmers and value chains, increasing its economic reach through distributors and suppliers.
- Create direct and indirect jobs, by making the Company's funding sources more sustainable. Wadi currently has more than 3,000 employees.

title: Alcazar Solar 3
content:
- Contribute to addressing power shortage: The Project is expected to support the construction of around 50 MW of solar projects.
- Development of the Egyptian Renewable Energy Sector: The Project is expected to help play a catalytic role in starting solar power development in the country.
- Employment: The Project will help generate direct and indirect employment opportunities during construction and operation.
- Climate Change: The Project will help avoid GHG emissions and thus contribute to addressing global climate change concerns.

title: Alcazar Solar 4
content:
- Contribute to addressing power shortage: The Project is expected to support the construction of around 50 MW of solar projects.
- Development of the Egyptian Renewable Energy Sector: The Project is expected to help play a catalytic role in starting solar power development in the country.
- Employment: The Project will help generate direct and indirect employment opportunities during construction and operation.
- Climate Change: The Project will help avoid GHG emissions and thus contribute to addressing global climate change concerns.

title: ABBank Sr Loan
content:
Project Impact:
Stakeholders - Through this investment, IFC anticipates the project will increase ABBank's ability to provide access to financial products and services to MSMEs and SMEs including women-owned SMEs. The project may also support improvements in affordability of loans in Vietnam. Potential advisory component may improve skills related to SME banking and banking on women.
 
Market Impact:
Inclusiveness - The current MSMSE Finance Gap in Vietnam is 11 percent of GDP. IFC anticipates that the project will increase access to financial products and services for under-served groups including women entrepreneurs, which in turn is expected to improve financial inclusion, employment and reduce poverty in Vietnam. 
Competitiveness - Driven by demonstration effect, as this would be the second banking-on-women project in the country, it could bring other banks to this space and improve the product offering for women SMEs and SMEs in general; thus, closing the financing gap.

title: Tupras
content: The expected development impact of the Project includes (i) supporting energy security of the country, (ii) improving the Company's resource efficiency, (iii) supporting the Company's R&D activities and, (iv) contributing to the enhancement of the Company's financial performance and sustainability

title: Wavemaker Pacific 1 Pte. Ltd.
content:
i.	Investment in sectors, business models and companies that support and nurture entrepreneurship, innovation, transparency, and access across the SEA region.
ii.	Provide access to capital to help grow nascent industry verticals of B2B and deep technology (AI, machine learning, 3D printing, virtual reality, etc.) in the SEA region.
iii.	Encourage operational, financial and E&S improvements of local businesses.
iv.	Foster job creation and economic growth.

title: BECO Holdings Ltd.
content: i.	Support for SMEs: BECO Holdings has supported, mentored, and grown 12 companies so far. Additional funding will help these companies continue to foster job creation and grow into regional and global brands. ii.	Access to long term early stage venture capital is limited in MENA. The gap is currently filled with a fragmented network of angel investors (mostly friends and family) who have limited capacity for follow on investments, limited management skills and a smaller network with which to support the investee companies' growth. These investors also have a shorter term investment horizon and IFC would create tremendous impact in the tech ecosystem through its longer term patient investment horizon.iii.	Support of local entrepreneurship / innovation in high growth technology sectors.

title: JD Finance Loan
Mediterrania III
Maghreb Private Equity Fund IV LLC
content:
(i)	Access to finance: Improving access to much needed long-term equity capital for SME and mid-market companies in North Africa.
(ii)	Financial inclusion and sustainability: The Fund will provide access to employment opportunities for individuals and access to cross-border markets for enterprises. The Fund will play an active role in strengthening governance and transparency of the investee companies. Through its hands-on involvement, operating efficiencies of the portfolio companies will be improved, thus promoting growth, sustainability and regional integration.

title: MCPP AXA
content:
1. Given that the vehicle will co - invest with IFC (on the same terms and conditions) the proposed investment will support private sector development by increasing access to long term debt capital for infrastructure projects across emerging markets from an asset pool (i.e. institutional investors located in OECD countries) that has yet to venture in significant scale into infrastructure investments in emerging markets. 
2. Under MCPP investors approve funding in projects much earlier than traditional co-lenders, providing IFC's clients with greater certainty of finance and reducing their transaction costs during the project development phase, allowing for a faster process to financial close. 
3. The vehicle is directly leveraging IFC's own economic capital allowing IFC to participate in larger transactions.

title: Antalya Muni Tramway
content: By connecting the underprivileged neighborhoods in the north to the city center in the south, the tramway will provide a safe, efficient and environmentally-friendly alternative to road-based transit. The Tramway will be fully electrified, mostly on dedicated lanes running alongside existing roads, thus minimizing environmental impact as well as the need for expropriations. By switching people from cars and buses to the tramway, it will help reduce CO2 emissions along the project corridor. Improved mass transit will offer improved access to employment, education and other opportunities to all residents of the communities served.

title: Ekurhuleni Muni
content:
i)	Contribution to improved connectivity and productivity: The investments in road and transport infrastructure, is expected to reduce commuting time and traffic congestion, which will contribute to improved efficiency and productivity.

ii)	Improved access to infrastructure services: The investment in electrical, waste management and water and sanitation infrastructure, is expected to improve the quality, reliability, and efficiency of key basic infrastructure services provided by the Municipality. It will also result in the expansion of services to new customers and informal townships reaching the low income segment of the population.

iii)	Contribution to social inclusion: Urban poor and other vulnerable groups tend to live in the townships and informal settlements. Enhanced connectivity with the city centers provide these groups with better access to jobs and may allow the areas where they live to be better incorporated in the municipal's economic activities. It will also benefit this segment of the population through improved access to basic infrastructure services.

iv)	Environmental and social benefits: The Project will result in environmental and social benefits due to reduced air pollution and traffic congestion in the metropolis, by encouraging motorists to use the public transit infrastructure that is being put into place. In addition, the investment in the upgrade of water pipes and electrical infrastructure will result in lower technical losses from the provision of services.

v)	Demonstration effect: IFC's involvement in the Project is expected to encourage a wider spectrum of investors, particularly from the international markets, to provide long term financing to municipalities in South Africa.

title: BECO Booster Fund II, L.P.
content:
i.	 Support for SMEs: IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. IFC would support job creation in the MENA region as the Fund's strategy, of investing in early stage companies with the potential to become high growth and high impact companies, is in line with IFC's development impact strategy.
ii.	Access to long term early stage venture capital is limited in MENA. The gap is currently filled with a fragmented network of angel investors (mostly friends and family) who have limited capacity for follow on investments, limited management skills and a smaller network with which to support the investee companies' growth. These investors also have a shorter term investment horizon and IFC would create tremendous impact in the tech ecosystem through its longer term patient investment horizon.
iii.	Support of local entrepreneurship / innovation in high growth technology sectors.
iv.	Private sector development: The ability of the Fund to identify best practices and superior management skills in its invested companies and subsequently disseminate them across the portfolio through an institutionalized, scalable manner, may lead to increased competitiveness and sustainability.
v.	Foster job creation and economic growth, specifically:
-	contribution to GDP growth;
-	contribution to job growth in both blue and white collar sectors, including creation of female jobs and workplace optionality; and
-	providing consumers access to products and services in a far more efficient manner, saving both time and money.

title: Daehan Wind Power Company
content:
The Project will: 
(i) add new generation capacity in Jordan and generate over 153 GWh, meeting growing demand for energy and serving ~27,000 customers annually;
(ii) diversify Jordan's fuel mix and provide for energy security by generating electricity from a domestic, indigenous resource which is currently not being used; and
(iii) avoid greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) of approximately 112,000 tons of CO2 per annum that would have otherwise been generated from fossil fuel usage.

title: Fideicomiso Irrevocable F2061 FHipo
content:
IFC's support will enable FHipo to expand the scale of its investments, by increasing the amount of residential mortgage portfolios acquired by them. This in turn is expected to have a twofold impact:
i) Residential mortgages originators will be benefited by obtaining access to liquidity and funding diversification to increase their operations, and, consequently, increasing the number of families being able to get mortgage financing; and 
ii) Institutional investors will also benefit from the proposed Project, since it will contribute to a wider availability of impact investment opportunities in form of RMBS in the capital markets.

title: Koin
content:
I. Facilitation of electronic payments: The investment in Koin will promote the development of a low cost and pervasive payment infrastructure in Brazil. Making payments electronically rather than in cash has been shown to generate efficiency and promote economic development

II. Wider Availability of Goods and Lower Prices: The ability to receive the good upfront and pay later is an enabler for the e-commerce sector. Therefore, Koin, as an innovative payment solution, will result in better availability and distribution of goods and services. In addition, Koin allows customer without a credit card to participate in ecommerce and benefit from the wider availability of goods and lower prices

title: YMI WC
content: The expected development impact of the Project includes (i) help improve infrastructure, especially those of the rail-based transport networks in Middle East, Sub-Saharan Africa and North Africa and Turkey, (ii) create substantial employment opportunities since construction sector is one of the largest employment generators through contractors and sub-contractors, (iii) stimulate industries in the supply chain including building materials and logistics.

title: KFP
content:
- Economic diversification: The Project will contribute to the country's strategic objective of economic diversification, through development of agribusiness sector, where Kazakhstan has significant potential.
- Employment creation: The Project will contribute to job creation, including in frontier regions of Kazakhstan, where there are higher poverty rates and limited employment opportunities.
- Food security via continuing exports of flour to grain deficit countries of Central Asia (including Tajikistan and Afghanistan). 
- Domestic value addition: By supporting domestic processing of agricultural commodities into gluten, starch, fructose and packaged food products, the project promotes local value addition, stronger downstream linkages with SMEs, and acquisition of new skills by the local labor force.

title: Omarsa II
content: Export-oriented sector development. The Project will contribute to the development of a competitive export oriented sector with extensive linkages throughout the value chain that is key for Ecuador's economy.Private sector development. IFC's funding will support further professionalization of a family-owned business as it grows into one of the sector's regional leaders.Job creation. Omarsa currently employs about 2,950 people. The expansion will create significant direct and indirect employment opportunities.Access to health. As a result of the Project, more families will have access to health support provided by the Company.Tax generation. The Project will increase tax generation for the government.

title: CEDIAM
content: The project will (i) increase income of farmers involved in mango production by linking them to market and improving support services, (ii) help the creation of additional employment, (iii) contribute to the industrialization of Mali, which has one of the lowest industrialization rate in the Africa sub-region.

title: Aanandi: Riverview
content:
(i) Increased quality housing supply to accommodate the business community: this will also counter the impact of rapid urbanization. The project will directly address the need for residential and business infrastructure given the increasing urbanization in the Vientiane area.

(ii) Promotion of gender equality: Through the support of a female, ethnic-Lao, lead sponsor returning to her country of birth.

(iii) Job creation and upskilling: The project is expected to create jobs both during the construction of the development sites and also post-completion, for the operation of rental management and building maintenance.  With a nascent construction development skill set among local developers, this project has capacity to impart significant international standard construction expertise to local construction contractors.

(iv) Local linkages: During construction, the project will increase demand for locally sourced labor and building materials in the country and promote inclusive growth through increased SME linkages.

(v) Community development: The apartment block built by the project will contribute to urban infrastructure development and surrounding community development.

(vi) Demonstration effect: signaling to foreign investors IFC's conviction for investment prospects in Laos, facilitating business accommodation, and encouraging participation in similar projects by local entrepreneurs.

(vii) Knowledge transfer: upskilling the local construction workforce through knowledge transfer from an internationally experienced construction and development team.

title: Abraaj Global Credit Fund LP
content:
(i)Access to finance: AGCF will support access to finance to high-growth mid-market companies that have traditionally suffered from limited long-term debt capital, necessary to sustain their growth. The Fund will provide capital solutions via growth credit and mezzanine debt financing, as an attractive and viable alternative to equity.
(ii) Private sector development: Abraaj's active engagement in portfolio companies will help investees improve operational efficiency and achieve growth when they lack access to finance.
(iii) Job creation and economic growth: The proposed investment will contribute to the World Bank Group's goals of poverty alleviation by promoting job creation. The Fund will provide an important source of financing for high-growth mid-cap companies that are expected to create new employment opportunities and historically have the largest impact on job creation.

title: DCM Akbank CBond
content:
i) The Project would support further growth in the mortgage sector: IFC long term funding would enhance access to housing finance in Turkey, which has an attractive demographic profile and is underpenetrated. 
ii) Mitigate climate change by financing energy efficient green residential buildings.
iii) Supporting a covered bond program in Turkey that meets international standards.

title: IIF USD Loan
content:
The development impact of IFC's investment in the Project is expected to be high. 
The Project is expected to help address the infrastructure development bottleneck which continues to hamper the country's economic growth. This situation has led to a significant increase in the cost of logistics and blocked development of the national and provincial economy.
The Project is expected to create development impact by i) increasing the number of infrastructure projects achieving financial close; ii) increasing funding available for infrastructure projects and iii) increasing support to private and public companies through advisory services from IIF. The proposed Project would help: (i) reduce the infrastructure gap with long-term funding that is consistent with the underlying cash flow profile of the projects (ii) alleviate the constraints that infrastructure bottlenecks impose to competitiveness, growth and creation of jobs; (iii) support the delivery of services including water, sanitation, and electricity; (iv) provide inclusion and connectivity; and (iv) provide broader economic benefits generated through taxes levied on project companies and indirect impacts through higher company growth and more efficient operations. The project will allocate a portion of the proceeds to renewable energy and other green infrastructure projects, thereby boosting sustainable development in Indonesia.

title: BasisBank I
content: The Project is expected to provide increased access to financing for SMEs. On the macro level this will help sustain both import flows of basic goods required by Georgia and critical inputs for the export sector and on the micro level, provide assistance to SMEs to better manage cash flows and assist them to grow competitively in regional and global markets, supporting domestic job creation and diversifying the country's economic base. By providing support to a smaller sized bank the Project is expected to assist in diversifying the banking sector in Georgia.

title: Jalles Machado
content:
(i) Support the expansion of a globally competitive sector: The investment will support the development of Brazil's sugar and ethanol industry, one of the most important sectors in the Brazilian economy, by helping one of the leading companies to improve efficiencies and upgrade its operations.
(ii) Promote climate change mitigation: The project will support climate change mitigation by increasing efficient production of biofuels. Hydrous ethanol made from sugarcane is the most competitive CO2 alternative to gasoline and one of the "greenest" fuels.
(iii) Strengthen a frontier region: The Company's operations are located in Goianesia, part of the Cerrado region, where the project will be undertaken. By expanding the company's activities, the project will create about a 100 new jobs and contribute to government revenues in a region that is highly dependent on the agricultural sector for income generation but has lagged behind national averages in terms of development indicators. 
(iv) Contribute to government revenues: The Brazilian agribusiness sector is highly competitive globally and is key to the economy in terms of its capacity to raise government revenues. This investment will allow the Company to expand its operations and will contribute to the growth of the Brazilian economy.

title: Oxford Street No.1 Aparthotel
content:
Job Creation: The Project will create approximately 50 direct jobs. More jobs will be created by businesses that will rent space in the Project Aparthotel, including the restaurant and the spa. In addition to the direct jobs created through the hotel's operations, the Project creates approximately 120 temporary jobs during its construction period, and a supports a number of indirect jobs through its supply chain. Direct employees will benefit from training, contributing to the upskilling of the country's workforce.

Supply Chain Development: The project will promote local economic growth through its development of the supply chain; the company is expected to source most of its goods and services locally, contributing to helping local suppliers, mostly SMEs, grow and professionalize.

Development of Business Infrastructure: The Project will provide an attractive, cost-effective accommodation option for long-stay business travelers and, as such, will promote business travel and general business activity in Accra. Through demonstration effects, and by catalyzing further developments in the area, this is expected to help promote the development of business infrastructure in Ghana.

title: North Haven Thai Private Equity Fund L.P.
content: Expected development impact includes (i) implementation of an Environment and Social Management System ("ESMS") by the Manager and subsequent implementation of Environmental, Social and Governance ("ESG") best practices at portfolio company level, (ii) economic growth, job creation and expansion of local businesses that is expected to come through the business growth of the portfolio companies and (iii) private sector development as the Fund will be actively involved in the business strategy and operations of the portfolio companies.

title: Nachtigal
content: The project is expected to have the following development impact: (i) Demonstration effect: support a pioneering IPP under the umbrella of ongoing sector reforms in Cameroon. This is expected to set a precedent for future IPPs to be developed on the Sanaga river downstream of the Lom Pangar regulating dam; (ii) Increase access to energy by providing clean, reliable, low-cost base load energy and help meet the fast-growing demand; (iii) Improve the country's power sector financial sustainability by displacing more expensive thermal power generation in the dispatch merit order; and (iv) Promote renewable energy and carbon emissions reductions.

title: Penyao
content:
1) Environmental benefit: By reducing the volume of untreated wastewater discharged, the Project is expected to reduce environmental pollution of local water courses and reduce health risks to the local population.
2) Increase access to reliable services and better treatment quality: By helping Penyao EP pursue new projects, the access to reliable and clean water at affordable cost in the frontier regions is expected to increase.
3) Sustainable economic development and job creation in frontier regions: Some of the projects are located in frontier regions in China.  Construction jobs will be required as new capacity is built and brought into operation and existing facilities are upgraded.

title: Acciona Benban 2
content:
- Contribute to ensuring energy security in Egypt: The Project is expected to support the construction of around 50MW of solar
projects.
- Development of the Egyptian Renewable Energy Sector: The Project is expected to help play a catalytic role in starting solar
power development in the country.
- Employment: The Project will have a positive impact on economic development due to increased power generation in Egypt,
and will support direct and indirect jobs creation during the construction and operations.
- Climate Change: The Project will support climate related mitigation impact by providing clean, zero emissions electricity and
avoid greenhouse gas emissions of approximately 60,750 tons of CO2 per annum and thus contribute to addressing global
climate change concerns.

title: Acciona Benban 3
content:
- Contribute to ensuring energy security in Egypt: The Project is expected to support the construction of around 50MW of solar
projects.
- Development of the Egyptian Renewable Energy Sector: The Project is expected to help play a catalytic role in starting solar
power development in the country.
- Employment: The Project will have a positive impact on economic development due to increased power generation in Egypt,
and will support direct and indirect jobs creation during the construction and operations.
- Climate Change: The Project will support climate related mitigation impact by providing clean, zero emissions electricity and
avoid greenhouse gas emissions of approximately 60,750 tons of CO2 per annum and thus contribute to addressing global
climate change concerns.

title: SECI Benban 2 Arinna
content:
- Contribute to ensuring energy security in Egypt: The Project is expected to support the construction of around 50MW of solar projects.
- Development of the Egyptian Renewable Energy Sector: The Project is expected to help play a catalytic role in starting solar power development in the country.
- Employment: The Project will have a positive impact on economic development due to increased power generation in Egypt, and will support direct and indirect jobs creation during the construction and operations.
- Climate Change: The Project will support climate related mitigation impact by providing clean electricity and help avoid greenhouse gas emissions and thus contribute to addressing global climate change concerns.

title: OBS MFI
content:
1. Secure access to finance to underserved segments in the Serbian economy.
2. Develop a positive economic impact by propping up economic growth, improving access to finance in economically and geographically excluded regions, generating new jobs and improving quality of life. 
3. Help the Bank reduce its foreign currency exposure, better manage assets and liabilities and improve its risk profile.

title: Al Subh Solar Power
content:
- Contribute to ensuring energy security in Egypt: The Project is expected to support the construction of around 50MW of solar
projects.
- Development of the Egyptian Renewable Energy Sector: The Project is expected to help play a catalytic role in starting solar
power development in the country.
- Employment: The Project will have a positive impact on economic development due to increased power generation in Egypt,
and will support direct and indirect jobs creation during the construction and operations.
- Climate Change: The Project will support climate related mitigation impact by providing clean, zero emissions electricity and
avoid greenhouse gas emissions of approximately 60,750 tons of CO2 per annum and thus contribute to addressing global
climate change concerns.

title: Konfio B
content: Access to finance for MSMEs in Mexico: Konfio contributes to financial inclusion and economic development in Mexico by empowering MSMEs with better access to working capital. Konfio's target clients seek credit online because they cannot afford to take time off from their business to go to the bank for a loan. With its proprietary credit assessment methodology, Konfio can make financing faster, more affordable and convenient for MSMEs who remain vastly underserved by the formal bank credit market which has very restrictive lending policies for this sector.

title: Link Africa
content:
(i) Access to Broadband: The Project addresses the growing demand for fiber networks critically needed to support the expansion of broadband services.
(ii) Shared infrastructure: As telecom operators are under pressure to expand their networks and improve their level/quality of service, a company like CSquared will be well positioned to provide high quality infrastructure services more efficiently. 
(iii) Promote economic growth: Improved broadband connectivity directly and indirectly benefits virtually every sector of the economy, creates jobs, fosters innovation and entrepreneurship, promotes social and financial inclusion and improves transparency and efficiency. Broadband access is also expected to help small and medium enterprises to better market their good and services, both locally and internationally.

title: DCM Green MCB
SP Energy Egypt S.A.E
content:
- Contribute to ensuring energy security in Egypt: The Project is expected to support the construction of around 50MW of solar projects.
- Development of the Egyptian Renewable Energy Sector: The Project is expected to help play a catalytic role in starting solar power development in the country.
- Employment: The Project will have a positive impact on economic development due to increased power generation in Egypt, and will support direct and indirect jobs creation during the construction and operations.
- Climate Change: The Project will support climate related mitigation impact by providing clean, zero emissions electricity and avoid greenhouse gas emissions and thus contribute to addressing global climate change concerns

title: PRICO Solar Gaza
content:
(i)	 Provide a domestic source of power helping the development of the industrial zone, addressing substantial demand-supply gap for electricity.
(ii)	Enhance capacity building of local institutions to lay the foundation for private sector participation and long-term growth.
(iii)	Improve energy security via domestic generation of power to support economic growth and job creation.
(iv) Provide clean and cost competitive electricity and reduce diesel consumption by the factories in the GIE and GHG emissions in the process.

title: BOG LC Bond DCM
content: (i) Demonstrate the ability of a Georgian entity to attract long-term funding in local currency from international investors through a market transaction during volatile economic times;(ii) Increase financial inclusion in Georgia. By providing long-term financing to BoG IFC supported a systemically important lender in Georgia, heightening BoG's role in diversifying the country's economic base, creating jobs, and fostering sustained economic growth. Banking sector penetration in Georgia remains low. In order to enlarge financial intermediation, it is essential to increase the flow of credit to individuals and MSMEs and the economy in general; and(ii) Help increase the Bank's capacity to expand lending in local currency, helping borrowers avoid risks related to borrowing in foreign currency

title: Biological E
content:
i.	Children and patients reached: The Project will increase the availability of affordable vaccines which can prevent potentially-fatal childhood diseases. By supplying vaccines to the Government of India, the Company will support India's UIP and contribute to reduction in infant and child mortality levels in the country.  
ii.	Direct and indirect employment creation:  Through this investment, will be able to expand its operations and create around additional high-quality jobs in India by 2022. The Project is also expected to create indirect employment relating to construction, manufacturing and distribution activities of the company. 
iii.	Research and Development: The Company invests significantly in Research and Development which is key to building a pipeline of products for under-met medical needs. The Company plans to launch several new products in India and other developing countries over the next five years.
iv.	Building domestic manufacturing capacity: By growing within India, BioE will contribute to promoting the development of the country's private sector and overall economic growth through its manufacturing facilities. The expansion of the domestic manufacturing capacity of the Company fits with the "Make in India" initiative launched by the government to make India a destination for production of goods and to boost the national economy.

title: Schwarz EE V
content:
- Affordable goods: Modern retail distribution introduces efficiencies which enables low pricing at high quality standards. The share of modern retail in food in Romania and Bulgaria is about half that of developed countries and even lower in Moldova. Expansion of organized retail in the Target Countries will promote access to affordable and high quality food products for low to middle income households. 

- Food safety: Modern retail formats contribute to food safety by improving supply chain efficiencies and reducing food wastage. Local procurements will encourage local producers to apply best practices in their production and operations, thus ensuring quality and safety. 

- Employment generation: The Project is expected to generate significant direct employment in the new stores, indirect employment in the supply chain as well as temporary employment during construction. Typically, women constitute more than 50% of the direct employment in retail stores. 

- Green buildings: New stores expansion through the Project is expected to have energy efficiency features and showcase green building best practices, which will potentially have a demonstrational effect on local building standards.

title: Acceso Credito I
content: The project will support to improve access to finance for MSME's in Peru, particularly those in the transport sector, therefore supporting MSMEs and employment generation and so helping address the inequality that exists within the different segments of society. Furthermore, the project will support the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by supporting the financing of natural gas vehicles.

title: AMERRA III
content:
i) Contribution to food security: The Project will provides liquidity to the food supply chain, ensuring agribusiness companies (and the farmers linked to them) have the funding need to produce efficiently, contributing to food security. Many AMERRA clients are low cost producers of exported food commodities, contributing to making staple foods as inexpensive as possible.
 
ii) Despite their contribution to food supply and rural livelihood, smaller and medium-sized agribusiness companies (and the farmers that supply them) have historically had insufficient access to finance from private sector sources, in particular finance that extends for more than one crop season. The unfavorable supply-to-demand dynamics for financing to this segment continues to deteriorate as commercial banks who had been operating in some parts of the supply chain continue to retreat from it to meet capital requirements. The Project supports the launch of the next generation of closed-end funds from a firm whose business model has successfully intermediated capital from institutional investors in North America that have not historically not invested significantly in these agribusiness segments in the emerging markets.

title: DCM CBC DPR Green
content:
1) Promoting Sustainability and GHG Reduction: The facility will allow CBC to provide funding at competitive rates for Green projects. This will help improve environmental as well as financial sustainability of CBC's clients, especially given the GHG emissions and high energy costs in Sri Lanka.
2) Expanding access to finance for energy efficiency: Through this project, IFC will provide funding to invest in energy efficiency projects to c. 5,000 SMEs. This will also be a demonstration effect in the SME energy efficiency finance space. This will also contribute towards GHG reduction via energy efficiency projects and use of cleaner energy sources.  Where required, this will be supported with advisory.
3) Job creation and poverty reduction: Based on the IFC Jobs study, Sri Lanka (2012), every $100,000 of lending is estimated to have created 10-31 new jobs. Accordingly, c. 7,500-23,250 new direct jobs will be created by this investment. In addition, there will be indirect job creation, which cannot be directly quantified.

title: JK Paper III
content:
1. Strengthening Domestic Capacity:  IFC's investment will help to consolidate and strengthen India's domestic capacity in the sector and enhance manufacturing capabilities, thus improving its competitiveness against imports. 

2. Climate Change Mitigation:  The Project will support the Company's efforts to make its plants more energy efficient by reducing the usage of water and coal. In addition, the Project supports a company that now plants more trees than it consumes, consequently helping to mitigate climate change and making JK Paper a net green company. The Project will thus help set the benchmarks in a sector where environmental footprint is a major issue.

3. Supporting Rural Incomes:  The Company's strong farm forestry program that was bolstered by IFC's previous Advisory initiative completed in 2014 continues to enhance productivity, provide regular offtake, and hence improve the income stream of local farmers. The Company currently works directly with more than 20,000 farmers. IFC will explore possible re-engagement on the Advisory Services front in order to widen and further add to the impact already achieved through the earlier advisory project.

title: CP Achiras S.A.
content: The IFC investment in these projects will: (i) Increase private participation in Argentina's energy sector, by being one of the first projects under the Renovar program; (ii) Support the development of the renewable energy sector, the Project will contribute towards a much-needed increase in domestic renewable electricity generation in order to improve competitiveness of the country, while diversifying the energy matrix from high reliance on thermal fuel sources and large-scale hydro. It will also enable the implementation of large-scale zero-emission renewable generation sources such as wind energy, exploiting the abundant natural resources of Argentina, while decreasing its reliance on imported energy and simultaneously reducing CO2 and GHG emissions; (iii) Benefits to the local economy, the Project is expected to generate employment opportunities during construction phase (both direct and indirect labor) and during operations; and (iv) Demonstration effect: upon successful implementation, the Project will send a positive signal of the feasibility and bankability of renewable energy projects in the country, acting as precedent for further private sector capital participation.

title: NMB Tanzania
content:
The Project is expected to have a high development impact in the following areas: 
1.	Supporting MSME Sector Development: The Project will help the Bank extend its MSMEs reach, an under-served segment in Tanzania. 
2.	Enhancing Access to Finance for Farmers: The Project, by helping the Bank grow its agri lending portfolio through the use of warehouse receipts (WHR) as collateral, will improve availability of credit for farmers, promote employment and support growth.

title: Accion Nigeria Loan 2
content:
i.	Job creation: By expanding access to funding sources to Accion's clients, the project will facilitate employment opportunities and poverty alleviation; and
ii.	Institutional development: IFC's long term funding will support the continued institutional development of the Bank, help manage balance sheet risk and broaden the mix of loan products available to its clients.

title: Arbor Fund II
content: The project is expected to deliver development impact in two areas: (i) increasing access to and improving the efficiency of financial services globally, with a specific focus on Asia, and (ii) developing the private sector in Asia through increased employment, support of high-potential SMEs, direct / mobilized long-term funding, and transfer of international best practices.

title: FCS RE Hansae Haiti
content:
- Job creation and employee skills development.  The Project will create up to 2,600 new jobs, most of which will be for women, the majority of whom are uneducated and have limited earning opportunities.
- Contribution to economic growth.  The textile and apparel sector is one of the sectors where Haiti currently has a strong competitive advantage.   The Project will thus contribute to economic growth in Haiti. It will generate significant foreign currency cash flows given its export focus, helping Haiti reduce its  trade deficit.  
- Demonstration effect.  The project will demonstrate to other foreign investors that despite various challenges, Haiti remains an attractive investment location for textile and apparel operations.

title: BRAC Women Banking
content:
-	Access to Finance for Women-owned SMEs: The Project is expected to have a considerable impact by increasing access to financial inclusion for women-owned SMEs in Bangladesh, thereby increasing opportunities for women entrepreneurs and improve livelihoods for a wide cross-section of society.
- Job preservation and creation of new jobs: The MSME segment plays a key role in Bangladesh's economy contributing to economic growth and employment. Particularly women entrepreneurs face constraints in accessing credit, inhibiting employment generating growth. Through removing these financial barriers, inclusive growth can be extended within typical women dominated segments, creating more female employment. In addition, women employment is more likely to generate positive externalities as they are more inclined to invest profits in the health and education of their families.
- Demonstration effect: Women-owned businesses are less likely to be banked because they tend to be smaller and less formal. The socio-cultural environment where men are still regarded as the heads of the household owning land and property of the family makes it difficult for women to present assets as collateral to access finance. While banks perceive women-owned businesses to be higher risk, they often do not recognize the economic and social benefit of banking women-owned businesses, who tend to be more loyal customers, less price sensitive and more risk averse. Through IFC's gender specific investment, which will be the first one of its kind in Bangladesh, BRAC Bank and IFC can create a positive demonstration effect, encouraging other Financial Institutions to follow.

title: NXTP Opportunity
content: (i) Address funding gap for early stage investments: NXTP 2 will support promising early stage companies (30-40) that otherwise may have trouble raising follow-on funding. (ii) Job creation: NXTP expects companies it invests in via NXTP 2 to create a significant number of high quality new jobs directly. (iii) Support local entrepreneurship: NXTP 2 will help support entrepreneurs directly and the innovation ecosystem across Latin America.

title: GBfoods Africa
DCM MMFSL NCD
content: Access to finance: The project will increase access to finance for the underserved farmers and Agro related SMEs in rural and semi- urban areas and contribute to the economic empowerment of households. Job creation: Providing asset finance to Agro related small & micro business will enable them expand their operations and create more employment opportunities. Support Agricultural mechanization: Availability of tractors and other farm equipment will support agricultural mechanization and improved farm productivity and efficiency and boost production.

title: DCM MRHFL NCD
content:
Increased housing finance access to low income segment: The IFC investment will provide a reasonable amount of incremental funding to enable the Company to provide additional housing finance loans to low income households. Low income households are underserved by the larger financial institutions and IFC's investment will directly expand the availability of housing finance to this relatively excluded segment.

Job creation: The project will create demand for housing and thereby support the construction sector which is one of the largest employers in communities making the rural urban transition.

title: SMBC ECA RSF
content: The proposed project is expected to provide financing to key financial intermediaries in the ECA region. Indirectly, this increased capacity will also improve the availability of credit to local producers and importers along the value chain and in a wide variety of sectors. IFC's support is much needed in the region to help financial intermediaries build capacity for their funding needs.

title: Ananta II
content:
-	Enable backward integration and allow efficiency gains: The Project will allow backward linkage support to AAL, helping to increase efficiency through cost and time savings, and helping to access orders with higher value addition. 
-	Addressing climate change: The Project will include use of efficient water consumption, heat absorption and other techniques to improve energy and resource usage efficiency, which will have a demonstration effect on addressing climate change issues in the RMG industry of Bangladesh.
-	Employment creation: The Project will help create 1,369 direct jobs upon being commissioned.

title: WCS Prime II
content: i.\tImproved Access to Credit: The Project will increase access to finance for credit-constrained, export-oriented companies and SMEs to meet working capital requirements. It will also expand financial intermediation. IFC's investment will further support business growth and spur job creation in the SME and export-oriented segments.\r\rii.\tBoost Export Competitiveness: IFC's investment will help to accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements, and help them pay for imports needed in the value chain.

title: BCR Leasing
content:
The main objectives of the project are to (i) help utilize a proven financial product that would respond to the critical term funding gap for SMEs in Romania; (ii) alleviate the difficulty of SMEs in accessing bank financing by using asset-secured lease finance; and, (iii) introduce competition in the financial sector and promote growth and generate employment.
Specifically, the facility is aimed to (i) Address the critical shortage of term funding for SMEs in Romania; (ii) Help deepen financial markets, boosting RON-denominated leasing and mitigating foreign exchange risks; and, (iii) Generate employment through resultant growth of SMEs and investment in productive assets.

title: DCM HDFC Bond
content:
Increase supply of affordable housing: India does not yet have a vibrant affordable housing market. While the shortage is huge (estimated at about 19 million units in urban areas), the supply of stock is still low. In this respect, the proposed project will create a large dedicated pool of funding that would help jumpstart the market with a big impact. 

Demonstration Effect: Partnering through the proposed project, IFC and HDFC expect that this demonstration would encourage other like-minded HFCs, FIs, banks and investment funds to follow suit and produce impact, much bigger than the direct funding of the proposed project. 

Job Creation: Real Estate and construction is one of the largest job creators in India. India is estimated to need around 76.5 million workers in the building, construction and real estate sector by 2022, with demand for affordable housing is more likely to increase from current level of 29 million households to more than 38 million households by 2030. In addition, there are at least 250 ancillary industries that shall further expand job creation. This initiative, by providing direct stimulus to affordable housing construction, will generate very positive impacts on employment and growth.

title: NTB Senior Loan
content:
(i) Access to finance: An estimated 56,000 MSMEs lack access to adequate finance in Sri Lanka and through this project IFC will indirectly fund around 7,000 SMEs. 
(ii) Job creation: According to IFC Jobs Study, Sri Lanka (2012), an estimated 10-31 new jobs were created for every $100,000 of lending. Based on this, 5,000-15,500 new direct jobs will be created by this project.

title: Stellaris Venture Partners India I
content:
3.	DEVELOPMENTAL IMPACT:

(i)	Global expansion of local businesses: In the current fund, IFC will be supporting 18-20 innovative Indian companies to grow and gain access to international capital markets.
(ii)	Supporting innovation and technology: Stellaris invests in early and growth stage technology firms, supporting and empowering entrepreneurs and innovation.
(iii)	Job creation and economic growth: According to IFC's experience, venture capital funds such as Stellaris contribute meaningfully to job creation and economic growth.
(iv)	Financial inclusion and access to capital: Access to long term equity capital is difficult for asset light businesses such as technology firms, and IFC commitment would provide necessary risk capital for such businesses.
(v)	Governance, operational and E&S improvements: IFC will guide the fund manager and ensure that local businesses implement best practices in various fields.

title: Bozano Growth
content:
(i)  Support job creation: The Fund will focus on mid-cap companies with growth capital needs, which tend to have the largest impact on job creation and the most potential for IFC to develop direct relationships through potential co-investment opportunities.
(ii)  Access to finance: Fund will provide long term risk capital, which is very difficult for the local mid cap companies to obtain in the current environment.
(iii)  Private sector development: Operational, financial, and ESG improvement of local businesses.

title: DCM Bajaj Finance
content: The proposed investment would increase availability of financing to the MSME segment which lacks adequate access to finance despite being a key driver of the Indian economy. Within the SME space the transaction also intends to reach low income states and women-owned SMEs. SMEs in low income states have historically been under financed despite the region having a significant percentage of SMEs, support in this area will aid their inclusion into the formal financial system. Finally, since SMEs in India employ close to 40% of the workforce, access to credit for these entities will help them achieve scale while enhancing sector competitiveness and job creation.

title: AuHFL NCD
content:
-	Increased housing finance access in Low Income States: AFL is focused on providing access to housing finance to low-mid income borrowers in tier II /tier III/tier IV and peripheries of tier I cities, with 57% of its outstanding book in the low income states of Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh. The company provides housing loan in the <e2>??affordable' category, with an average ticket size of around 0.85 mn. The Company has also created a separate vertical for government led affordable projects (PPP model or direct) for EWS and/or LIG segments where cost of units is around INR 0.5-1 mn per unit. Under this program, the Company has tie-ups with various government development agencies to drive uptake. 
-	Increased housing finance access to self-employed and low income segment: AFL is focused on providing access to housing finance to low income borrowers, specifically those employed in the informal sector such as self-employed micro-entrepreneurs and un-organized sector salaried workers. Most of the requirement in housing finance is from the affordable segment in urban areas (~70%) and tier II/III cities. The Company focuses towards loan to SENP (self-employed non-professionals), amounting to around 65% of its portfolio. This segment traditionally does not have easy access to finance owing to perceived higher risk of such borrowers and difficulty in risk assessment. IFC's investment will directly expand the availability of housing finance to the low income and relatively excluded customer segments.
-	Job Creation: There is high demand for affordable housing, particularly in rural and semi-urban areas. The expansion of housing finance has a trickledown effect on job creation through the growth of the multiple industries

title: FirstRand SL
content:
i) Access to Finance for SMEs: Access to finance for SMEs in the RSA remains low. The proposed financing will further accelerate the Bank's outreach to SMEs.  

ii) Financial Inclusion: RSA has a sizable number of SME which are either owned or operated by women. FirstRand has been specifically focusing on women-owned SMEs and therefore, the proposed investment is expected to increase flow of investment to women-owned SMEs.

iii) Job Creation: Through this engagement, IFC expects to help boost job creation throughout the country.

title: Masdar Jordan
Hellas Direct
content:
-	Access to a financial service: Hellas Direct offers low cost insurance in an efficient manner, thereby enabling greater access to a pertinent service through its direct model.     
-	Access to electronic payments: The Company is promoting usage of digital payments by providing avenues of cashless transactions for making payments. Greece is primarily a cash society, and HD is one of the pioneer insurers to promote digital payments.
-	Fostering new technology: Hellas Direct is spearheading latest technology practices, such as online quotes, digital payments, regular electronic communication techniques, digital advertising, algorithms based pricing, digital claims management, etc., thereby benefiting its customers, and the industry at large
-	Safer driving: Usage of applications such as Telematics will incentivize safe driving practices, thereby enhancing overall road-safety

title: WCS Bank Asia II
content: i.	Improved Access to Credit: The Project will increase access to finance for credit-constrained, export-oriented companies and SMEs to meet working capital requirements. It will also expand financial intermediation. IFC's investment will further support business growth and spur job creation in the SME and export-oriented segments. ii.	Boost Export Competitiveness: IFC's investment will help to accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements, and help them pay for imports needed in the value chain.

title: ESIP Power2SME
content:
1. Enabling SMEs to gain pricing advantages: Poor infrastructure and inadequate market linkages are among the key factors that have constrained the growth of the SME sector in India. The Company's key offering enables SMEs in the manufacturing sector to procure raw materials / inputs in a transparent manner while benefiting from better pricing of such items due to demand aggregation.
2. Enabling SMEs gain access to affordable financing: Lack of adequate and timely access to finance by SMEs is another key challenge to an SME's growth. Financial institutions too have limited on ground presence / access to data needed to profile credit servicing capabilities of SMEs. The Company's online demand aggregation platform enables it to capture unique data points on SME customers which allow superior credit profiling that an external lender can comfortably rely on and provide attractive financing terms.
3. Increase in SMEs reached: The Company has more than 50,000+ registered SMEs on its platform. 2000+ SMEs have transacted on the platform so far. Post launch of GST in India, the Company will be able to operate pan India. As a result, the number of transacting SMEs is expected to grow more than 10x by CY21. 
4. Increase in employment by enabling SMEs to grow: According to 2015 estimates of the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises ("MSME"), Govt. of India, the MSME sector generates around 100 million jobs through over 46 million MSMEs across the country each year. The Company's mission is aligned towards improving the financial health of MSMEs which will in turn result in additional job creation.

title: LLP Peru
BMW South Africa
Cibrafertil
content:
1.	Strengthening food security: improved availability and cost of high quality fertilizers will help local farmers in Brazil to boost productivity and increase agricultural production. 
2.	Frontier Regions: Supporting a second tier market leader with operations in frontier regions of Brazil: Cibrafertil is headquartered and has 5 out of 8 plants in Brazil's much needed frontier regions of Brazil (state of Bahia, Goias and Mato Grosso).
3.	Job creation: Cibrafertil currently employs around 450 people in Brazil. Implementation of the Project will help Cibrafertil to generate additional 150 jobs. 
4.	Transfer of technology and know-how: the Project will enable transfer of technical and managerial know-how in the fertilizer manufacturing and distribution sectors, strengthening competitiveness of local famers and contributing to sector growth.

title: Nibulon CL
content:
The Project is expected to: 
Enhance food security: IFC's investment will contribute to strengthening food security by expanding the Company's grain traded volumes from 4.5 in 2016 to 7.0 million tons by 2021 and increasing food availability by 40%.
Strengthen Ukraine's infrastructure: Nibulon will continue supporting the development of Ukraine's grain and oilseeds sector by creating access to storage and reducing crop losses. The Company's ongoing investment in Ukraine's river transport helps to revitalize the country's commercial navigation and provides cost efficient and more environmentally friendly alternatives to rail and truck transport.
Facilitate the access to market: Through its wide origination network, Nibulon annually procures grains from up to 4,700 farmers. As a result, these farmers benefit from a reliable marketing channel and from access to Nibulon's storage, conditioning and transportation infrastructure.

title: ACEP Senegal SL
content: - Access to finance: The Project will enhance access to financial services to micro and small enterprises as well as the agriculture sector, which is expected to lead to job creation, income generation and inclusive growth in Senegal; - Demonstration Effect: This is IFC's first engagement with a financial cooperative in West Africa, and the project is expected to have a positive impact on the perception of the commercial viability of microfinance cooperatives in general and UM-ACEP in particular, and send a strong signal on IFC's capacity to support leading players as they promote financial inclusion.  - E&S: the Project is expected to help UM-ACEP implement an E&S management system and strengthen its capacity to assess E&S-related risks, particularly in the agricultural sector.

title: Banco Davivienda S.A.
