content: - Increase financing to SMEs which is expected to have a significant impact in terms of job creation and economic growth.- Increase financial inclusion for women entrepreneurs in Costa Rica leading to a sustained and more equitable growth as women entrepreneurs create jobs that are more likely to employ other women. - Women are more likely than men to contribute additional income to household poverty reduction and improved nutrition and schooling for their children. Access to credit and increasing economic power for women will translate into improved likelihoods for a wide cross-section of society.

title: Asia Heart
content: 1. Support of private healthcare provider in frontier region: The Project will channel the much-needed private sector capital to finance a new hospital in the frontier region where patients may have better access to quality healthcare services. 2. Sharing of best practices: Best management and clinical practices will be transferred from Asia Heart''s operations to the newly acquired hospitals and the greenfield hospital, hence raising the quality of healthcare services in the country. 3. Employment generation: The expansionary aspects of this project will provide employment opportunities to healthcare workers in China.4. Promoting healthcare reform: Despite the recent lift on restrictions over private investment in healthcare sector, the Chinese health authorities are still cautious due to negative publicity about private hospitals and the lack of successful examples. The ongoing success of Asia Heart may improve health authorities'' confidence in private healthcare providers and may further promote private players to enter the sector.

title: Green Infra Wind
content: Access to energy: Project will help in meeting India''s growing electricity demand by deploying a power generation project that will add 182.4MW of generation capacity by FY2015Climate Change Mitigation: IFC''s investment will enable clean energy production that will help avoid GHG emissions, of approximately 287,703 tons of CO2 equivalent emissions per year beginning in 2015.Employment generation:  The Project will create employment opportunities during construction as well as operation.E&S, Social, Health and Safety Standards: The Project will strengthen the assessment and management of Social and Environmental risks and impacts through structured ESIA, development and implementation of ESMS, upgraded Contractor Management Systems and, structured Stakeholder/Community engagement and Grievance Redressal Process.

title: Ekonomi SME Loan
content: 1. Job creation: To eventually create more local employment opportunities by increasing access to finance for SMEs.2. To support economic growth in frontier regions: While big cities in Indonesia especially Jakarta are growing rapidly with increased banking penetration, frontier regions are left behind in terms of access to finance for SMEs, which hinders the economic growth in these regions. Having established its strong network in the frontier regions with plans to expand into other frontier regions to provide access to finance for SMEs, Bank Ekonomi will support the continued growth of the local economy.

title: Everstone III
content: Private sector development: Providing scarce equity capital to unlisted companies, as well as creating value in investees through capacity building, improving corporate governance and transparency, providing operational and financial expertise, supporting evaluation of new business opportunities and building strategic business partnerships. Job creation: Fund will invest in mid-market companies and scale them into national and regional leaders, leading to job creation at a rate greater than the national average. Environmental, Social and Governance ("ESG")  Standards: The Fund will adopt and transmit IFC's ESG  standards across investees, thereby contributing to sustainable economic development.

title: Seven Energy Bond
content: Greater availability of gas is one of the key ingredients for increasing power generation in Nigeria, a country that suffers significantly from lack of electricity and where only about 50% of the population has access to electricity from the grid. The quality of service is generally poor and lack of electricity has put a constraint on the country''s economic growth. There is about 6 GW of existing capacity in Nigeria, of which only about 4.5 GW is operating. It is estimated that generation capacity will increase to 15 GW in 2020 most of which from thermal generation. Gas production and transportation are critical to the energy mix, and Nigeria harbors significant gas reserves.In addition to supplying gas to the Ibom Power Plant, the Company will directly supply the Calabar National Integrated Power Project, a plant with a capacity of about 560 MW. Moreover, IFC funding is proposed to contribute to a potential 2014 project between Seven Energy and an IOC to eliminate approximately 23mmcfd of IOC flared gas, diverting gas to Seven Energy''s Uquo gas facility where it will be stripped of liquids and the residual gas blended with Seven Energy gas. Finally, the project will generate direct jobs and indirect jobs (through power provided to the grid and to industries including a fertilizer plant in the Akwa Ibom state), as well as government revenues.

title: Portucel Moz
content: Portucel''s investment in the under-developed rural regions of Mozambique lays the foundation for a far greater and expansive development of the regions and of industry over the next 12 years.  While mega-projects in the mining and energy production sectors in Mozambique may be limited in their ability to impact employment creation and productivity spillovers, the Project will create rural jobs and have a significant multiplier effect, thus broadening the economic base of the country. -	Employment: generating at least 2,000 direct and indirect rural jobs during the first phase and up to 6,500 additional jobs once the second phase has been fully implemented;-	Smallholder Farmers'' Benefits: reaching over 150,000 rural poor, and with complementary public investment by IFC and the World Bank in agriculture and agribusiness development, improving livelihoods for 23,000 farmer households;  -	MSME Development Catalyst: promoting development of an estimated 100 MSMEs as suppliers of goods and services to the company, including through training and outgrower component imbedded in the Company''s business model; -	Infrastructure Development: developing several types of infrastructure, including secondary and forest roads, and - during the second phase - a port, that will encourage economic integration; -	Training and Demonstration: encouraging knowledge transfer by providing trainings to local employees, supporting forestry programs in Universities and integrating agriculture extension services to local farmers in the Company''s business model;-	Increasing Country''s Competitiveness through Economic Diversification: Despite the Government''s targets, Mozambique''s forest products sector potential remains unrealized. Successful implementation will encourage additional investment and stimulate forest products sector development, and provide the much-needed diversification to the local economy and additional source of forex earnings to the budget.

title: Clearwater India Limited
content: 1.	Enable stressed Indian companies to (re)finance their existing debt with terms that allow them to recover/rehabilitate and grow. Currently, local bank financing is limited to this type of debtor. The inability to access (re)financing capital could drive these stressed companies, mostly SMEs, to become NPAs or go into liquidation.2.	Lay foundation for the development of effective stressed/distressed asset investment and credit solution culture which, in turn, contributes to the stabilization of the Indian financial system. 3.	Contribute to the recovery of SMEs (CIL target clients) that have been unable to honor their debts due to financial difficulties. The specialized credit solutions of stressed asset investors, like CIL, significantly increase the likelihood that these borrowers can reach restructured loan agreements to avoid losing their assets and, ultimately, re-enter the formal banking system.

title: MyUniverseAB Grp
content: 1.	Driving financial inclusion by increasing accessibility, financial literacy and lowering distribution costs: MyUniverse is providing online personal financial management services to individuals who do not have access to these services. MyUniverse''s initiatives in the area will help improve awareness about personal financial management and help ensure that consumers are able to access the most appropriate financial products for their needs in a cost effective manner. This has the potential to positively impact over 10 million users over the next five years.2.	Improved transparency in the financial investment: MyUniverse is expected to have a significant impact on first time salaried professionals, especially in lower income brackets, who do not have access to sophisticated financial advisers. By providing transparent, rule based, system driven recommendations, MyUniverse allows individuals to choose products that are most appropriate for their financial profiles and not based on commissions that agents receive for selling these products. This is expected to improve the rate and quality of savings, investment activity and overall wealth creation for this under served segment of the population.3.	Demonstration Effect: While online personal financial management  has evolved in developed markets, this concept is new to India. IFC''s investment will help in the viability and scaling up of this business and lead to other companies targeting this sector, resulting in further adoption of financial services management in the market.

title: Gulpur Hydro
content: i) Increase Pakistan''s power generation capacity and contribute to reducing the country''s power shortage situation;ii) Utilize a cost-competitive, indigenous, renewable resource to help mitigate Pakistan''s significant reliance on high-cost and imported thermal alternatives;iii) Deliver climate change benefits; andiv) Promote increased private sector participation in the Pakistan hydropower sector.

title: Valle Solar PV
content: The Project is expected to: (i) provide critical demonstration effect of financial feasibility of one of the first large scale grid-connected solar PV projects in Honduras; (ii) support the diversification of Hondura''s energy matrix moving away from a fossil fuel based energy generation model; (iii) contribute to the reduction of expensive imports of diesel and bunker, which consequently could help strengthening public finances; (iv)	promote climate change agenda, as the project is expected to displace thermal power generation hence reducing carbon emissions.

title: Acme Solar NSM
content: 1. Directly increase power generation to bridge India''s power supply-demand gap 2. Promote climate change mitigation by supporting renewable energy and reducing GHG emissions 3. Generate employment during project implementation and operation

title: BAFL Equity
content: The project is expected to have strong developmental impact by: 1) enhancing access to finance for SMEs which will in turn increase job creation and private sector development overall as SMEs are a main contributor to job creation and private sector development in Pakistan. 2) Developing Islamic banking through supporting BAFL''s growth in Islamic banking, which will help develop this relatively new and important market segment in Pakistan which has strong market potential. 3) IFC''s equity will provide the required support to BAFL thereby improving the Bank''s competitiveness and in turn competition within the banking sector at large. 4) Sending a positive signal to the market through IFC''s engagement with BAFL at a time when MENA and Pakistan are faced with economic and political challenges.

title: New Hope SEA
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to include (i) improved food security through increased efficiency in the supply chain, (ii) increased reach to farmers, mainly small independent players, in regions where the economy relies heavily on agriculture, (iii) support of competitive economic activity in IDA countries, (iv) South-South known-how transfer in animal protein, (v) direct and indirect job creation, and (vi) increased tax revenues.

title: Gama Enerji
content: The expected Development Impact of the Project includes:i) Equity contribution: Securing sufficient equity is a critical issue for Turkish sponsors in becoming owners/operators of infrastructure assets. IFC''s involvement in the Project would help achieve this not only directly but also facilitate a potential future equity raising by Gama Enerji / an IPO.ii) Demonstration effect: IFC will be supporting the Government of Turkey''s (GoT) comprehensive strategy aimed at insuring the power sector''s financial viability through increased private sector investment in the sector. Through privatizations and creating a liberal market environment, the GoT is aiming to attract more private investments to the power sector.iii) Economic impact: Given the strong link between growth and the consequent increase of power demand, Gama Enerji''s investments will contribute to the country''s infrastructure, and help meet the requirements of a growing economy as well as ensuring affordable electricity prices. iv) Supporting the water sector in Turkey and in the near region: Only a portion of the population in the region is currently connected to adequate wastewater treatment facilities, and while a larger portion is served by public drinking networks there are still a number of people who are under-served.  At the same time, much of the existing water infrastructure requires rehabilitation and new water facilities are needed to keep up with urbanization, population growth and industrial water demands. While still at early stages of private participation, Gama Enerji is well placed to engage in water sector projects in Turkey and the region. v) Promoting south-to-south investments: Based in Turkey, Gama Enerji envisages investments not only in Turkey but also in the near region. In this regard, the Company is expected to become an investment platform through which IFC will be supporting south-south investments.  vi) Lower carbon emissions: Gama Enerji envisages continuing to invest heavily in renewable energy projects which will help reducing GHG emissions. Additionally, compared to other energy sources such as coal and lignite, natural gas power generation presents a better alternative in terms of carbon emissions.

title: Condor Gold Plc
content: IFC''s investment will be used to fund the completion on feasibility studies.  Generally, projects at pre-development stage have limited development impact.  Yet even at such stage, Condor Gold has brought tangible benefits for the surrounding communities by providing some direct employment for the local population, as well as investing in social development programs in favor of the neighboring communities living in a very poor rural area in Central Nicaragua.  Out of a total of around 85 people currently working for Condor, more than 95% are Nicaraguan nationals and more than 90% live in nearby communities.  Should exploration lead to mine development and production, the developmental impacts will be notable.  Key expected benefits during mine construction and operation will include revenues to the national government through royalties and taxes, foreign currency from export revenues, significant direct and indirect employment, and enhanced social development programs.

title: Idea Cell Ltd.
content: (i) Increased access to affordable and quality telecommunication services, especially in rural areas: The proposed IFC investment will enable the Company to offer improved access to good quality voice and data/internet services to its rural subscribers, which form about 55% of its subscriber base. The Company''s strong rural focus and management capability will enable better access to quality and affordable telecom services in these underserved markets of India. IFC''s investment in Idea will support the Company''s expansion in rural areas. (ii) Raising additional revenue for the GOI and fostering macro-economic development: Continued investment in this sector is expected to have a broad based positive impact on the economy. Idea is expected to make significant direct contributions to the GOI through spectrum payments and taxes. Importantly in a country like India, the telecom sector is known to have a significant multiplier effect on the rest of the economy. The WBG estimates that for every 10% rise in broadband penetration, approximately 1-2% is added to a nation''s GDP.

title: Davivienda Costa Rica
content: (i) Increase banking penetration and access to credit to underserved SMEs and individuals;(ii) Increase employment generation since SMEs are the main drivers of employment;(iii) The Bank''s climate smart activities will have a direct impact in lowering greenhouse emissions and encouraging efficent management and re-use of scarce resources; and(iv) Demonstration effect with other banks replicating this type of funding.

title: Rede Dor ll
content: i.	Expand access to high quality medical care, given growing demand in Brazil and limited institutions throughout the country with international standards of care;ii.	Aid in the professionalization of private healthcare in Brazil through Rede Dor''s enhanced corporate governance standards and strong management team;iii.	Employ local professionals (medical and non-medical staff);iv.	Enhance cost competitiveness by supporting a scalable business model in a very fragmented sector.

title: RG Brands
content: The Project will have following development impact:(i) Creating and preserving direct and indirect jobs;(ii) Supporting food security and availability;(iii) Strengthening linkages with dairy farmers;(iv) Increasing tax payments for the Government.

title: Bank Audi Equity
content: The expected development impact includes (i) increased South-South investment and regional integration; (ii) greater access to SME finance; (iii) private sector development and sharing of banking sector best practices in host countries/emerging markets; and (iv) promotion of environmental and social management systems

title: BICEC  Agri RSF
content: The Project will:(i)	improve the livelihoods of indirect and direct beneficiaries including smallholder producers involved in the cassava, maize, sorghum and rice value chains;(ii) create further employment at both producer organization and agro-industry levels thereby supporting one of the largest and poorest employment brackets in the country;(iii) addresses issues of food security through the substitution of imports by locally-produced raw materials.(iv) create jobs for women: The project is likely to reach at least 25% women given that for some of the value chains such as cassava and even maize, women are the majority of farmers. Increasing their economic power improves many livelihoods. They are more likely than men to contribute income to (1) poverty reduction; (2) improved nutrition; (3) school tuition

title: A 100
content: - Improving business infrastructure- the stock of quality commercial real-estate in Belarus remains limited and the project will reduce the existing demand-supply gap.- Demonstration effect: by supporting a local private provider IFC will contribute to the development of real estate sector and raise its attractiveness to private investors;- Employment Generation: The Project will create significant number of new direct positions. Temporary employment will also be provided to local labor during the design and construction phase. Commercial real estate projects will also support indirect employment with a multiplier effect along the supply chain.- Increased tax revenues- the Project will lead to increased tax revenues to local and federal authorities.  - IS-AS cooperation- the Client is interested to work with IFC''s Green Building Specialist to explore opportunities for energy efficiency. In parallel A-100 is considering engaging IFC''s Corporate Governance team as it recognizes the need to strengthen CG as it evolves from a closely held family business into a holding.

title: Affero Lab
content: (i) Bridge the gap between employers' needs and employees' skills: one of employers' biggest criticisms is the gap between the formal education system and what the real needs are in the work place. Corporate training is a way to bridge the gap between the two, also allowing employees a better and faster integration within their companies.(ii) Foster companies' competitiveness and promoting higher standards: Corporate training is already a very common practice in developed countries and is viewed as an enhancement of employees' skills, allowing for more productivity.(iii) Improvement of employees' qualifications, chances to progress or finding new opportunities: corporate training improves skills that are invaluable on the job, allowing employees to progress further internally but that can also be marketable, improving their desirability in case they need to look for new job opportunities.(iv) Rationalize the market: Affero Lab's expansion through selective acquisitions and growing market share may help to consolidate the very fragmented market of corporate training, potentially leading to rationalization and quality improvement in the industry. (v) Potential South-South investment: Affero Lab's expansion may include potential investments in Latin America and Africa.

title: FINCA Armenia 2
content: IFC''s long-term financing is expected to bring high development impact by enhancing Finca Armenia''s capacity to support productive micro enterprises, resulting in higher growth, employment generation and poverty reduction.

title: Chase Bank BoW
content: 1) Financial Inclusion: The proposed project will increase access to finance to underserved segments by on-lending to SMEs, women-owned businesses and Islamic population in Kenya.2) Job Creation: Create more jobs and reduce poverty by providing financing to Kenyan SMEs and women businesses that are key drivers to private sector development. 3) Competition: Foster competitive environment in the Kenyan banking sector by supporting an indigenous Tier II SME bank.

title: Americas Energy Fund II Clean Energy, L.P.
content: (i) Reduction of CO2 and other greenhouse gases: the Fund will invest in clean energy and energy efficiency projects, thereby reducing carbon emissions; (ii) Economic development and job creation: the Fund will provide equity capital to help develop and grow projects in the region, which will help promote economic growth and create jobs in local economies; (iii) Private sector demonstration: the Fund will strengthen investees from a financial, operational, management, and ESG perspective, thereby 1) helping to make local entities attractive to investors/acquirors, and 2) demonstrating the business case for clean energy projects and encouraging further private investment into the sector.

title: DTBK Tier II Inc
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact in the following measurable areas:1-Increasing credit availability to the SMEs and Very Small Enterprises (VSEs); 2- Supporting job creation by financing the SME and VSEs. The VSEs are a high impact sector, which has low access to finance. Financing this sub-segment helps create opportunities to achieving more balanced growth;3. Capacity building to help the bank to service VSEs on a sustainable basis; and  4. Demonstration effect/market transformation through DTBK''s continued lending to the target segment beyond the life of the Project.

title: ESIP Kaymu
content: The Project''s expected development impacts include: (i) job creation in the areas of marketing and IT services and indirectly through supply chains, logistics, and other supporting services; (ii) transfer of technology by replicating proven internet business concepts in emerging markets with the goal of turning its ventures into local/regional market leading companies in the online retail space; and (iii) benefit to consumers in frontier regions and secondary cities through more choices, lower prices and convenient service with home delivery.

title: Azure Clean
content: Increasing clean energy production: The project will directly contribute to increase the country's generation from renewable energy sources. The project is expected to generate up to 70GWh from 2015. Climate Change Mitigation: IFC's investment will enable clean energy production that will help avoid GHG emissions, of approximately 53,054 tons of CO2 equivalent emissions per year beginning in 2015.Employment generation:  The Project will create employment opportunities during construction as well as operation.

title: Cargills Foods Company (Private) Limited
content: -	Maintain and create jobs in the growing retail sector: The Group''s retail business currently employs 5,300 employees and the Project is expected to create significant jobs as the Company increases capacity. Majority of the workforce is expected to be employed from the local communities thereby contributing to community development. -	Improvement in the quality of life and fostering inclusive growth: The Project will contribute towards bringing better quality food products at low prices to post conflict areas in Sri Lanka thereby fostering better life quality and inclusive growth across socio-economic strata. -	Development of local supply chains: The Project would increase the number of and volumes from local suppliers, provide additional sales channels for local producers and importers and effectively contribute towards strengthening the retail eco-system relating to efficiencies and operating standards.   -	Increase in farmer reach: The Company procures fresh produce from 8,000 farmers across the country on a daily basis at a fixed price leading to predictable demand and pricing for farmers. The Project is expected to increase its reach to farmers through increased demand for end products.

title: Eaton Uganda II
content: (i) Expanded and Improved Mobile Telecommunication Access: Service quality and network coverage are currently critical issues for all mobile operators in Uganda.  As their networks improve, operators will be able to offer better services as well as expand the reach of those services both in terms of geographic coverage and network traffic capacity.  Further, infrastructure sharing reduces the incremental cost of service expansion for all carriers thereby making it more feasible to service remote and economically disadvantaged areas. (ii) Increased Competition: The Company''s further expansion will allow smaller and newer mobile operators to benefit from reduced barriers to entry as they will lease infrastructure instead of building it.  (iii) Expanded Access to Other ICT Technologies: The Company''s tower network is capable of not only supporting mobile but also wireless broadband, backhaul and broadcast networks, which will result in increased penetration of these technologies.

title: IHS Nigeria 2
content: (i) Expand Mobile Telecommunications Access as collocation reduces the  incremental cost of expanding service for all carriers thereby allowing them to serve remote and economically less developed areas. (ii) Increased Competition as enabling collocation on tower sites previously owned by MNOs will lower barriers to entry for smaller and newer mobile phone and wireless operators through access to leased tower facilities compared to building their own. (iii) Contribute to Mitigating Environmental Impact and Climate Change as the Company will provide a cost effective opportunity for operators to lower their carbon emission as well as physical footprint by sharing infrastructure.

title: NIC Bank Limited
content: i. Improve access to finance for SMEs: The Project will allow NIC to grow its SME portfolio and provide this crucial segment of the economy with access to longer term funding, thereby enabling SME''s to undertake investment projects with more appropriate financing structures.ii.	IFC''s subordinated loan will strengthen the capital base of the Bank. This will ensure that NIC complies with new regulatory capital requirements that are aimed at improving the overall risk profile of the banking sectoriii.	Enhancing regional competition and service.  The project will contribute to the success of the East African economic community by supporting a strong local bank with a growing regional footprint.

title: Usina Delta S.A.
content: The most relevant development impacts are expected to be on climate change mitigation and on assisting communities in frontier regions.The effect on climate change mitigation will come from the co-generation investment, which will be enough to power a city with 180,000 people, thereby  promoting the use of renewable energy in a country with expanding demand. The frontier region supported by the investment is Cerrado region. The Project will foster economic development in the Cerrado by increasing agricultural production and creating jobs in areas which are highly dependent on the agricultural sector for income generation.

title: Pacifico Solar
content: Climate Change Mitigation: The Project will promote a positive climate change agenda by displacing thermal power generation and reducing associated carbon emissions.Promoting private investment into the private sector: By providing a critical demonstration effect of financial feasibility of the first large scale grid-connected solar PV projects in Honduras, the Project will support GoH''s ongoing efforts to increase private participation in the energy sector, as evidenced in the ongoing unbundling and privatization activities.

title: KMF
content: -	Improve access to finance for underserved segments of the society in remote areas of Kazakhstan through supporting lending activities of KMF; -	Contribute to employment creation and improvement of life at the base of the pyramid through the strengthening of the microfinance sector in the frontiers regions of Kazakhstan;-	Create demonstration effect for the Kazakh underdeveloped microfinance industry by helping KMF to upgrade their risk management practices and prepare them for transformation into a bank or financial institution with a number of banking services if and when the opportunity arises in the future.

title: Nyva
content: The proposed investment will support a leading pork producer with significant linkages to the economy of rural areas. Its expansion will help to create business opportunities for local MSMEs, as well as generate employment in processing facilities and in the controlled retail network, with a significant portion of positions likely to be held by women. Debt refinancing will help the Company strengthen its balance sheet in the expectation of possible economic shocks.

title: Ethiop Coffee II
content: The Project is expected to continue to have the following development impact:(i) Strengthen the competitiveness of the Ethiopian coffee sector;(ii) Support economic livelihoods in the Ethiopian coffee supply chains, particularly small farmers and household labor;(iii) Develop a commercially sustainable model of long-term and short-term financing for the Ethiopian coffee supply chain, with potential for expansion to other countries/sectors dominated by small scale suppliers;(iv) Establish the credit worthiness of selected cooperatives;Indicators to be tracked include: Farmers Reached, MSMEs Reached, Employment and Female Employment, Number of wet mills financed, and Volume of coffee processed annually by financed cooperatives.

title: MSC Shipmanagement Limited
content: The Project will support IFC''s goal of promoting environmentally friendly transportation solutions by optimizing vessel efficiency and reducing fuel consumption. It is a novel, energy efficient project that will significantly reduce emissions such as carbon dioxide within the transportation sector, positively impacting climate change. Additionally, the Project will decrease transportation costs, demonstrating the viability of a transport project that is simultaneously focused on environmentally friendly solutions.

title: DARP New Credit II
content: - Allow banks in Colombia and Peru to offload their NPLs, and therefore improve their liquidity and capacity to originate new loans.- Through the appropriate resolution of NPLs, the project would allow a large number of individuals to be able to avoid losing their assets (their homes in most cases) and ultimately to re-enter the banking system.- The proposed investment would contribute to the further development of the distressed assets market in Emerging Markets, resulting in an increase of both the number of NPL transactions and the players in this market.

title: Jordan Solar One
content: The Project will: (i) generate over 47 GWh (at P50), meeting the growing demand for electricity in Jordan, serving approximately 9,000 customers annually based on a per capita consumption of 2,289 kWh; (ii) diversify the fuel mix for Jordan and provide for energy security by generating electricity from a domestic resource; (iii) displace thermal power that has a marginal cost of approximately 30% above the tariff helping to alleviate the losses borne by NEPCO; and (iv) avoid greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) of approximately 30,720 tons of CO2 per annum.

title: Nidera-COFCO
content: - The new global agri trading platform will improve efficiencies of global food supply chains with expected synergies and economies of scales and scopes, and increase competition and efficiency of the global agri trading landscape dominated by large global agri traders.- Contribute to food security:  Part of the investment will be fresh capital to support agri logistics and infrastructure projects in Brazil, Eastern Europe and US, providing farmers better access to market and farm inputs (seeds), and leading to more supply of agri commodities.-Employment generation in multiple developing countries under the Project.

title: Noble-COFCO
content: - The new global agri trading platform will improve efficiencies of global food supply chains with expected synergies and economies of scales and scopes, and increase competition and efficiency of the global agri trading landscape dominated by large global agri traders.- Contribute to food security - The COFCO acquisition will enable Noble Agri to access capital support for its investment program on agri logistics and infrastructure, providing farmers better access to market and farm inputs and leading to more supply of agri commodities.- Turnaround of under utilized assets of Noble Agri.- Employment generation in multiple developing countries under Noble Agri''s investment program supported by COFCO partnership.

title: Smithfield Roman
content: The proposed investment is expected to have the following developmental impacts: (1) Demonstration effect: IFC will support an efficient producer with solid track record to expand high international standards of livestock production and animal welfare practices to other pork producers; (2) Increased reach to farmers through the Company''s planned addition of contracted farms, critical in a country where the economy relies on agriculture; (3) Improved food safety through implementation of highest food safety and E&S standards; and (4) Job creation and increased tax income for the government as a result of growth of operations and enhanced profitability.

title: TMB RSF
content: - Support to the SME sector: Increasing access to finance for SMEs an underserved segment in Thailand.- Generate a demonstration effect: The Project is expected to create a demonstration effect for other banks to serve the SME segment more actively, further enhancing IFC''s developmental impact in Thailand.

title: Abraaj Africa Fund III
content: Abraaj Africa Fund III is expected to deliver strong development impact in the following areas: (i) Job Creation: The growth of the Fund's portfolio companies is expected to result in strong job creation. Mid-cap growth equity investments, which the Fund is focusing on, have significant reach to SMEs, the largest development impact on job creation, and the potential for IFC to develop direct relationships with the underlying companies. IFC's portfolio experience has been that non-SME's in the growth equity space create more jobs than SMEs at a lower capital commitment per job created. (ii) IDA countries:  The Fund will predominantly cover companies located in IDA/frontier countries. Most of the investee companies in the Aureos family of funds were in IDA countries. (iii) Private sector development: The Fund will employ hands-on management in its portfolio companies. The Fund Mananger's structuring know-how, and the wider Abraaj network, will be leveraged on, and value-add and growth strategies incorporated by investee companies, leading to improved competitiveness and sustainability.

title: Grupo ASSA II
content: The Project is expected to generate the following development impact:- Increase economic efficiencies: Help companies across diverse verticals achieve greater efficiencies through broader adoption of technology to help it manage its value chain (eg enterprise resource planning software).- Support the expansion of the IT outsourcing sector in Latin America:  The region has an opportunity to replicate the successful experience of India, where the  sector represents over 5% of GDP and where it is a major source of value added exports.  US and European are increasingly eyeing LAC to achieve efficiency gains from proximity, same time zone advantages, and a well-educated labor force.- High Quality Job creation: Companies like Grupo ASSA benefit local IT professionals by creating high quality job opportunities and developing skills in the value-added IT services sector.- South-South investments:  Besides expanding its operations in Brazil and Mexico, Grupo ASSA plans to continue expanding its operations in other countries in Latin America, such as Colombia, Chile and Uruguay.  Entering these markets enables transfer of technology, improving business practices, foster competition and promote further investment in the Region.

title: Central Termica de Ressano Garcia
content: i)	The Project will contribute to increased diversity in the hydro-power dominated electricity sector (>90pc of installed capacity). Adding thermal power will improve energy security, particularly during the dry season and in years of low rainfalls. Further, the Project will reduce dependency from power imports;ii)	The Project will provide an opportunity to monetize the country''s own gas resources;iii)	The Project will help EDM to balance short to medium term supply/demand gaps and support improvements of the country''s comparably low electrification rate;iv)	The Project will translate into more fiscal revenue for GOM directly through additional tax revenues and indirectly through increased economic activity. GoM will also benefit from the Project Company''s dividend payments to EDM. Given that its mostly financed by the private sector, the Project will not put strain on the public finances;v)	As the country''s first IPP with a long term PPA, the Project will have an important demonstration effect. It will help establish a model for future IPPs and more PPPs in other infrastructure sectors.

title: GarantiLeasingRO
content: Contribute to economic growth through improved access to finance for SMEs. The level of financial intermediation in Romania is yet to recover from the impact of the crisis. Expanded financial intermediation is needed to support the flow of credit to small businesses and individuals which make up the most important part of Romania''s economy;Improve the local as well as the global environment through reduced emissions of greenhouse gases and other conventional pollutants and reduce the country''s dependence on imports of fossil fuels and natural gas. Upon full utilization of the line, up to 82,000 tons CO2eqv of GHG emissions are estimated to be reduced per year.

title: Kayseri Health
content: - Improved hospital infrastructure, efficiency and quality of public healthcare services in Kayseri, a 2nd tier city underserved by both public and private health service providers- Successful implementation and financing of the project will lead the way for other projects in the heatlh PPP program, also located in Turkish second tier cities- Demonstration effect in the region, where private-public partnerships in healthcare and other social services are just starting to emerge- Better health outcomes through use of modern clinical and diagnostic services, reduced waiting times for patients

title: IFC Global Emerging Markets Fund of Funds
content: The proposed Fund is expected to have significant developmental impact by supporting a minimum of 20-25 private equity and venture capital funds which will:(i) Support private sector development: investee funds will help to improve local companies'' competitiveness by providing equity capital and management advice; (ii) Stimulate economic growth and job creation: investee funds will invest in high-growth companies that will create new employment opportunities and contribute to economic development and employment; (iii) Promote international best governance practices: investee funds will be required to adhere to IFC''s ESG requirements and implement these at their investee companies.By mobilizing third-party institutional capital, the Fund will allow IFC to leverage its existing resources and thus expand its developmental impact. In addition, the Fund will help to deepen private equity markets by being able to provide liquidity to investors via secondary purchases, which will improve the attractiveness of the asset class as it provides for an alternative exit mechanism.

title: Centro Hospitalario Serena del Mar (CHSDM)
content: 1) High quality health coverage in an underserved region2) Medical best practices redeployment. The Project will apply to JCI accreditation.3) Job creation for medical staff (nurses, doctors and technicians)4) Education linkage: The Project will engage with Fundacion Santa Fe''s medical faculty to train and retain medical staff in the region.5) Taxes: The Hospital is a for profit legal entity, that will contribute with corporate and local taxes, despite it being a Free Trade Zone.6) Innovation: The Hospital will redeploy innovation medical techniques in the region that are now used by Fundacion Santa Fe in Bogota (robotics, telemedicine).

title: ACWA Kirikkale
content: Turkey Country Partnership Strategy FY2012-2015 outlines strategic objectives for fast, sustainable, equitable and inclusivegrowth that respects the environment. In line with this strategy, the World Bank Group aims to contribute to improved supply ofreliable and efficient energy, increased use of renewable energy and climate actions under implementation.The Project will have a significant development impact as it will: (i) increase Turkey''s electricity output and help meet thecountry''s growing energy demand and provide power supply security; (ii) in doing so, reduce Turkey''s reliance on coal andlignite, thereby reduce carbon emissions in electricity generation; (iii) support power sector reform by increasing the share ofprivate generation in Turkey''s overall electricity generation in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation ofa regional energy market; and (vi) by size and nature of the transaction, influence Turkey''s ability to continue to attract foreigninvestment in the energy sector. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability ofTurkey.

title: Arabia One Solar
content: The Projects will:(i)	generate over 22 GWh (at P50), meeting the growing demand for electricity in Jordan, serving approximately 10,000 customers annually based on a per capita consumption of 2,100 kWh; (ii)	diversify the fuel mix for Jordan and provide for energy security by generating electricity from a domestic resource; (iii)displace thermal power that has a marginal cost of approximately 30% above the tariff helping to alleviate the losses borne by NEPCO; (iv)avoid greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) of approximately 13,000 tons of CO2 per annum.

title: Shamsuna PV
content: The Project will:(i)	 generate over 19 GWh per annum (at P50), meeting the growing demand for electricity in Jordan, serving approximately 9,000 customers annually based on a per capita consumption of 2,100 kWh; (ii)	 diversify the fuel mix for Jordan and provide for energy security by generating electricity from a domestic resource; (iii) displace thermal power that has a marginal cost of approximately 30% above the tariff helping to alleviate the losses borne by NEPCO; (iv) avoid greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) of approximately 11,500 tons of CO2 per annum.

title: Adenium Jordan-1
content: The combined projects will:(i)	generate over 78 GWh (at P50), meeting the growing demand for electricity in Jordan, serving approximately 37,000 customers annually based on a per capita consumption of 2,100 kWh; (ii)	diversify the fuel mix for Jordan and provide for energy security by generating electricity from a domestic resource; (iii)displace thermal power that has a marginal cost of approximately 30% above the tariff helping to alleviate the losses borne by NEPCO; (iv)avoid greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) of approximately 47,000 tons of CO2 per annum

title: Falcon PV
content: The Project will:(i)	generate over 43 GWh (at P50), meeting the growing demand for electricity in Jordan, serving approximately 20,000 customers annually based on a per capita consumption of 2,100 kWh; (ii)	diversify the fuel mix for Jordan and provide for energy security by generating electricity from a domestic resource; (iii)displace thermal power that has a marginal cost of approximately 30% above the tariff helping to alleviate the losses borne by NEPCO; (iv)avoid greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) of approximately 26,000 tons of CO2 per annum.

title: YKL Sustainable
content: The Project''s development impact is expected to be high, as it generates a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of sustainable energy finance and related investments. Specifically, the Project would: (i)	develop sustainable energy investments across all industry sectors; (ii)	improve the competitiveness of the Turkish economy by increasing the number of sustainable energy end-users and lenders; (iii)	improve the local as well as the global environment through reduced emissions of greenhouse gases and other conventional pollutants and reduce the country''s dependence on imports of fossil fuels and natural gas; and(iv)	improve quality of life through reduced pollution and healthier living conditions.

title: MM Ethiopia Soap
content: 1. Add value to the Ethiopia economy by moving from import model to local soap production operation which provides direct and indirect employment to the local community and contributes to the government revenue2. Bring FDI into Ethiopia, thereby encouraging other foreign investments to the country 3. Transfer of knowledge and know-how on soap-making4. Introduction of international standards in corporate governance including financial management5. Foster increased competition and quality in the Ethiopian soap industry through the addition of high-quality soap production facilities in Ethiopia

title: Elengy Terminal
content: 1. Support development of critical energy infrastructure needed to address the Pakistan''s growing gas supply deficit, helping reduce its reliance on future imports of oil and thereby helping relieve an ongoing constraint in the country''s balance of payments;2. Support economic growth by enabling the import of natural gas as a feedstock for industrial and use and electric power generation, in a context of diminishing indigenous gas resources and the power sector''s reliance on expensive imported fuel oil for generation;3. Enable increased use of a less carbon-intensive fossil fuel than imported heavy fuel oil and coal;4. Increase revenues for Government of Pakistan through taxes and increased income for Port Qasim Authority (a government authority) through royalty and lease payments;

title: HDB
content: The Project is expected to have high development impact by helping unlock waterway transport in Brazil to open trade for inland areas, increase grain handling capacity and relieve logistics bottlenecks for exports. It will also strengthen regional linkages (mainly, the Southern Cone) and in principle mitigate GHG emissions by replacing rail/road transport and road damage, congestion and risk of truck accidents. It will create jobs in construction and operation of new infrastructure, and will support public revenues through tax payments.

title: BMR Wind
content: The Project will contribute to the diversification of the Jamaican electricity generation sector away from fuel oils and support climate change investments. It is expected to contribute efficient and cost effective new generation to the sector while reducing both the country''s fuel oil import bill and the sector''s environmental footprint.As one of the first wind farms developed on a project finance basis in the emerging Caribbean markets, the Project will finally have an important demonstration impact. Its successful development would be expected to open the door to future projects to be developed in the region on a similar basis.

title: Penonome Wind
content: - Supporting the Government of Panama''s efforts to promote development of renewable energy projects and displace expensive oil based generation, helping reduce energy prices and contribute to reduction in carbon emissions.- Supporting an investment by an IFC investee company in a new market.- Cocle is one of the least developed provinces in Panama.  The Project is expected to bring employment (during construction) and help to create economic development.

title: Ballarpur International Graphic Paper Holdings B.V.
content: 1. The Company will support rural households by sourcing wood from several thousand farmers, including marginal ones. In its existing locations, the Company helps farmers use more modern farming techniques to improve yield and provides an incentive to farms to meet quality standards.2. IFC has shared with the Company some of the best available technology and practices to increase the efficiency of the forestry operations. Throughout the investment, IFC will support the Company''s efforts to implement the changes and improve its operations.3. The Project will implement and obtain FSC or a similar certification of sustainable forest and land management that conserves biodiversity, soil and water resources and safeguards the health and ecological functions of ecosystems, and lead to a strong demonstration effect. 4. The pulp & paper industry in India remains fragmented. BILT is one of two high grade product (coated paper) producers in the country, and much of the demand is imported. Supporting the Company through restructuring will thus contribute to the overall modernization of the industry.

title: Commercial Intelligence
content: The expected developmental impact from this project are high. Specifically, the project is expected to encourage:1.	NPL sellers, buyers, and servicers to enter the MENA market, thereby helping develop the market.2.	The adoption of insolvency standards, creditors'' rights and collection practices for the efficient resolution of NPLs.3.	the development of a new mechanism to execute NPL transactions at their market value, thereby encouraging other market participants to replicate the Project.

title: Adana Health
content: - The proposed financing will improve infrastructure for public health services in Adana, a second tier city in Turkey, and adress the need for improved bed capacity and to develop underserved specialized areas.- Successful financing and implementation of this flagship project under the program is expected to lead the way for the rest of the projects in the program, most of which focused on second tier cities.- The project is also expected to provide better health outcomes through implementation of modern clinical and diagnostic services, better patient flow (with services consolidated in one campus) and reduced waiting lines.- Additionally, the proposed project will have a demonstation effect in the region and for other sectors (i.e. education), where PPP models are being investigated as an alternative to improve social infrastructure, and are expected to follow the example of the Turkish healthcare PPP Program.

title: Hollysys
content: 1) Industry upgrade for better productivity and quality: The successful implementation of the Project will help China to upgrade its industry for better quality products with increased productivity by adopting more automation systems in the production process., helping address increasing wage costs. 2) Access to better infrastructure: The Project will increase assess to better infrastructure, namely high speed rail (HSR), at lower cost for the mass population. 3) Employment generation: The Project is expected to create employment opportunities both direct and indirect employment along the value chain. 4) Energy saving and environment protection: The project will also promote energy saving and environment protection in China as automation systems will help to increase energy utilization and reduce emissions.

title: Divitia FIM Cr<e9>dito Privado
content: The proposed Project is expected to have the following development impacts:- Increase the Access to finance: The project will increase the access to finance to the underserved mid-size corporate sector in Brazil. The project is also expected to expand IFC current efforts in this market segment by making medium term funding available to mid-size corporates.- Job creation: The fund will provide loans to the mid-size corporate sector, key employer in the Brazilian economy. Thus, supporting the fund in turn supports the primary drivers of job creation and growth in Brazil- Local Capital Markets Development: The project will help deepen and strengthen local Brazilian capital markets to the benefit of local mid-size firms. The Fund Manager aims to foster industry development, improve best practices, and overall raise the profile of this investment technique in Brazil.

title: Fenglin II
content: 1. Sustainable natural resources management:As Fenglin invested in upstream forestry operations, it is committed to adopting best practices and standards in forestry operations. Part of its plantations were already FSC-certified, and it is committing to adopt Controlled Wood Certification for the rest of its plantation. This will be a significant development impact in Fenglin''s wood supply chain. Fenglin is also producing some of its panels at the FSC-certified standard, which is expected to have an important demonstration effect in the wood product sector in China.  2. Job creation in frontier regionIt is expected that Fenglin will create more than 200 direct jobs (based on the projected ramp up size of the plant) and additional indirect jobs in MSMEs through the support services to its plants. These jobs will benefit local livelihoods in a poor area of an interior province.  3. Local wood sourcingFenglin had a total production capacity of 500,000m3 in 2012. In 2013, it has established Mingyang Plant (200,000m3) and has acquired Huizhou plant (200,000m3), and has arrived with a total production capacity of 850,000m3. It is expected that Fenglin will double its local wood sourcing to about 1.28 million tons from the farmers when the two new plants ramp up.4. Sustainable productsFenglin''s products have received CARB certification (California Air Resources Board) and have reached China''s national standard of E0/E1, both are the highest standards for toxic control from formaldehyde. It is expected that the Project will help Fenglin promote the sustainable, lower emission panel products to the market.

title: Al Safi Danone Iraq LLC
content: (i) Import Substitution of basic food & beverage sector products in Iraq will contribute towards the growth of the non-oil sectors in the country, and reduce the reliance on imported dairy products. (ii) Creation of direct and indirect jobs: the biggest impact would be at the distributor level where Al Yasra currently employs 380 workers dedicated to distribution of Al Safi Danone products in Iraq. This number is expected to grow by an additional 450 distribution staff within 5 years. In addition, the ASDI operation will employ 71 FTEs (39 of which are local) at inception, with 15 more positions to be filled by FYE''2015.(iii) Technology and Knowhow Transfer: The Company is importing the latest dairy processing and packaging equipment, while training Iraqi nationals on the job to international standards.(iv) Food Safety: The Project will increase the abundance of high quality dairy products, which are packaged according to international industry practices, at affordable prices. This should benefit end-customers, as well as setting the bar for other producers to emulate such quality standards.

title: Abraaj North Africa Fund II
content: (i) Job creation: The Fund's mid cap growth strategy is in full alignment with IFC's development impact goals.(ii)	Access to finance: IFC's investment will support companies in North Africa by providing additional equity to the midcap market in a context of limited long term equity/risk capital.(iii) Private sector development: The Fund will employ hands-on management in portfolio companies, which will lead to improved competitiveness and sustainability thanks to the Fund's structuring and management know-how.

title: MTI Environment
content: -	MTI will provide sludge treatment and odor control technology to wastewater treatment plants in China which currently are struggling to deal with their own waste products and the environmental problems they create. -	MTI will transfer technology into China and adapt it for local conditions so it address local problems at a reasonable market price. The technology uses waste as a resource consistent with Chinese government guidance.-	MTI will continue to provide EPC services for the growing wastewater treatment market in China.-	MTI will recycle sludge into construction fill allowing for reduced use of soil

title: Africa Improved Foods Limited
content: 1)More than 700,000 children will get access to fortified blended food annually, supporting the prevention and treatment of malnutrition among vulnerable populations.2)Additional income opportunities for farmers that supply raw material to the plants (12,000 farmers in Rwanda).3)Increased access to high-quality nutritional products among African urban and rural populations.4)Support to agri-manufacturing and related value chains in Africa.5)Introduction of higher food safety standards in Rwanda for complimentary foods industry for older infants and young children (above 6 months).6)Large-scale employment (more than 200 full-time employees).

title: Powergrid Equity
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impact:A. Support the critical transmission infrastructure of the country which is essential to improve access to electricity and promote inclusive growth.	 B.  Facilitate an increase in the private sector investment in power generation including renewables.C. Promote Climate Change Mitigation by reducing electricity transmission losses thereby eliminating GHG emissions from avoided generation.

title: Davivienda TII
content: - The Project would support a systemic bank in Colombia and Central America in order to meet the growing financial needs of the local economies. Supporting a bank with regional operations such as Davivienda is especially important as it is expected to diminish the volatility present in developing financial markets, creating therefore a positive demonstration effect. - The Project would enhance Davivienda''s ability to support small and medium enterprises in Colombia, which will in turn stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction in the country.- Creating a demonstration effect for other financial institutions in Colombia by bringing best practices in environmental and social management systems

title: Itau Clim. Smart
content: By working with a Bank with significant regional reach, the Project is expected to have a high development impact, including:i. Positive climate change mitigation: Through funding to the growing climate smart market, Itau will have a direct impact in lowering GHG emissions;ii. Replicability by the market: Itau, a leading financial institution, will have a strong demonstration effect, and its approach will be replicated by other financial institutions throughout Brazil.

title: MC Mali
content: i)	Access to finance for micro-enterprises: The proposed project will enhance access to financial services for micro and small enterprises, which is expected to lead to job creation, income generation and inclusive growth in Mali. ii)	Mali post conflict situation: In the challenging context of the Malian political and economic post-crisis, MicroCred contribute to create opportunities for micro-enterprises in the country, and in particular in Bamako. iii)	Transformational impact: In Mali, where the microfinance sector suffers from a severe crisis, MicroCred Mali offers an alternative business model to traditional MFIs, laying the foundation to restore microfinance clients'' confidence in the sector.

title: Jubilant Pharma
content: 1) Creation of better quality jobs: JLS employs 6,277 people globally, including 1,018 dedicated to R&D and in its pharmaceutical business; JPL employs more than 3,000 people, of which 50 percent are in India. The proposed investment will help maintain these jobs and create new ones, as JPL is able to launch new products, thanks to a stronger balance sheet. 2) Increased access to affordable quality healthcare: The Company''s strong product pipeline and R&D capability will enable better access to quality and affordable healthcare in the underserved markets, including India. 3) Demonstration effect: Through its financing, IFC will help a mid-sized company that has a solid business profile to strengthen its financial structure by lengthening the average maturity of its debt and minimizing its exposure to foreign exchange fluctuations. The proposed IFC financing will facilitate the corporate reorganization thereby enabling JPL to achieve sustainable growth.4) Linkages:  The Company has a number of local linkages both in its pharmaceuticals and LSI business segments.  For example, on the LSI side, JLS has long-term contracts with local ethanol producers as well as purchases molasses from a number of sugar mills for its own distilleries. It also produces some ingredients that are used as agrochemicals with broad applications in agriculture.

title: Soufflet 2
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to include: (i) Small-holders reach as the IFC financing will be channeled by Soufflet throughout the agricultural supply chain; (ii) Improved food security through increased productivity; (iii) Private sector development in challenging business environments.

title: Kvarlis Baga
content: The proposed Project has significant development impact including the following:- direct and indirect job creation and preservation in regions where job opportunities are scarce;- supporting food security in an IDA country;- increased tax payments (generating additional amount of taxes to be paid to the State).

title: Tbilvino II
content: The Company significantly exceeded Development Impact Indicators set for the IFC''s firts loan in 2011. The proposed new project will have significant development impact, including following:  -Promotion of the formal private sector abiding by rules and regulations;-Direct and indirect employment creation in rural areas of Georgia, where the job opportunities are scarce;-Generation of additional amounts of taxes paid; -Linkage to the farmers: in 2010, the Company had 300 Georgian farmers suppliers, however, today it procures grapes from more than 1,000 farmers, which is expected to grow even further even after development of own vineyards as the Company grows fast.

title: PNB HFL
content: 1) Increased access to finance access for Low and Middle Income Segments: These segments are characterized by low ticket sizes and not an area of focus for majority of banks and housing finance companies. PNB HFL is one of the few large HFCs which provides housing finance to the self employed and women clients. The Company is also committed to further expand its business in the low income states of India.2)  Job Creation: Building affordable homes will increase construction activity which has positive linkage impacts on employment and growth.3)  Green Mortgages: The company also proposes to develop, in consultation with IFC, suitably designed mortgage products which could finance "green" residential buildings.

title: SAMHI
content: 1) Job creation: On successful completion the Project is estimated to create direct jobs of more than 2000, with female job creation of more than 400 across the planned properties in India. Additionally, the Project will create indirect jobs, both during construction and operations, including construction activities, facilities management and maintenance, security, transport, logistics, food and beverage supply, etc.2) Affordable hotels: SAMHI group would be amongst the few internationally branded and professionally managed hotel companies in India focusing on budget travelers.  This is likely to make domestic business travel more affordable by increasing supply of competitive hotels in budget segment. 3) Boost investment in Low Income States (LIS):  SAMHI has a pan-India footprint with strong pipeline spread across LIS. The Group has already made investments in LIS of Uttar Pradesh (Greater Noida) and West Bengal (Kolkata) and plans to invest more in these regions.4)	Local supply chain linkages: The Project will create business opportunities along the value chain, both during construction and operations, for small and medium enterprises engaged in transportation, distribution, maintenance and general services to the hotel.

title: Pichincha Senior
content: The development impact of IFC''s investment in this Project is expected to be high given that:- IFC will enhance the Bank and the Group''s ability to support productive micro, small and medium enterprises which will in turn stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction. Pichincha will be able to increase its outreach and sustainability incorporating thousands of new entrepreneurs to the formal financial sector and will strengthen its support to women-owned companies.- IFC will introduce international best practices in environmental policies, strengthening the Banks'' environmental management system.

title: Codevi II
content: The project will have a strong development impact. At full development, over a two year implementation period, the expansion project would generate 4,000 additional skilled jobs. CODEVI''s payroll, higher than the minimum wage, is the only source of stable livelihood for the 7,000 workers and their dependents, whose number is now estimated at approximately 60,000 in the town of Ouanaminthe and its surroundings.  It is estimated that another 30,000 people live in Ouanaminthe, deriving their livelihood from indirect jobs associated with CODEVI''s operations.  Furthermore, CODEVI''s payroll is made up of approximately 50% women who are amongst the most vulnerable segments of Haitian society. The project will therefore provide a social safety net to the current workers and their dependents. This investment is also expected to send a positive signal on the creditworthiness of private sector investment in Haiti and on the potential of the textile sector in the country. This project will contribute to the creation of new growth pole built entirely on the private sector initiative.The IFC approach in this investment is also driven by a focus on delivering impact on the ground to the community that has agglomerated around the jobs generated by CODEVI. To ensure delivery, IFC has also systematically identified upfront partners (with and through Ashoka and other NGOs) to identify and respond to community needs with technologies and businesses to deliver BOP goods and services. A pilot project managed by Ashoka with CODEVI''s support has already reduced the cost of basic goods and services to the workers and families, thus boosting disposable income and tangibly reducing poverty levels.

title: Helios Investors III, L.P.
content: The Fund is expected to have significant development impact on its investees by:- providing them with risk capital and strategic advice in their growth and expansion plans;- implementing best practice Environmental, Social and Governance standards at both the Fund and investee company level.

title: The Ksani II
content: IFC''s investment in Georgia continues to be a large employer and a successful example of privatization and foreign direct investment in Georgia

title: Aihuishou
content: - Challenges: Climate Smart investments are a strategic priority and IFC Management has committed that such investments will reach 20% of long-term investments by FY15. To reach this target, IFC is encouraging innovative approaches with a focus on sectors and markets with the potential to deliver significant climate mitigation impact and scale.  E-Waste is the fastest growing waste stream in the world and currently accounts for 2-5% of total solid waste; however, it accounts for 70% of toxic waste.  An estimated 40 million tons of e-waste is produced every year, growing at the rate of 40% every year. A United Nations report projects that by 2020, e-waste from computers would dramatically increase by 400% from 2007 levels in China and by 500% in India. - Opportunities: The estimated market value of E-Waste management was $11.8 billion last year and is expected to grow to $44.3 billion by 2020.  In addition to the positive environmental impact in proper E-Waste management, proper collection and recycling of e-waste to extract metals makes economic sense as natural resources are scarce, finite, and costly to extract. AHS provides a transparent and trusted platform to collect and distribute the e-waste and this platform is expected to help double the rate of e-waste recycling in 2-3 years.

title: Tiviski S.A.R.L
content: The Project will showcase: (i)	Support to over 2,000 livestock herders.    (ii)	Providing fresh protein. (iii)	Employment creation.  (iv)	Gender promotion (v)	Pastoralism (vi)	Food safety

title: New Liberty Gold Project
content: The expected development impacts during the production phase would include:(i)   Fiscal receipts to the government in the form of taxes, royalties and foreign exchange contribution to the domestic economy. (ii)  Local economic development within an IDA country through the generation of much needed direct and indirect employment opportunities in the Project area.(iii) This will be the country''s first commercial gold project.  IFC will work with Aureus to implement the Project in accordance with IFC''s performance standards and thereby have a demonstration effect on the gold sector.

title: FMBT loan 2
content: (i) Expanding access to finance for MSMEs, particularly small entrepreneurs and individuals in impoverished and rural areas, thus increasing banking penetration and financial inclusion (specifically amongst women entrepreneurs) in remote areas; and(ii) Job creation, poverty reduction and economic diversification through private sector-led growth in an anchor sector.

title: AMERRA Latin America Finance LLP
content: The Project will support liquidity in the food supply chain and help ensure agribusiness companies (and the farmers linked to them) can continue to maximize production in scenarios of high commodity prices, which would make a contribution to food security. Many AMERRA clients are low cost producers of food staples. Despite their contribution to food supply and rural livelihoods, smaller and medium-sized agribusiness companies (and the farmers that supply them) have historically had insufficient access to finance from private sector sources, in particular finance that extends for more than one crop season. The supply-to-demand dynamics for financing of the agricultural sector continue to show insufficient supply from the established financial sector and commercial banks that had been financing some parts of the supply chain but continue to be under pressure to strengthen their capital ratios, which limits their activity in the sector. The IFC Project supports the expansion of an innovative firm whose business model includes providing financing into this segment by intermediating capital from an institutional investor segment in developed countries that has not historically invested significantly in these agribusiness segments from the emerging markets.

title: Raiffeisen Bank Romania Bond
content: 1.	Demonstrate the ability of a Romanian bank to attract long-term funding from local and international investors in difficult financial times. IFC''s investment in RBRO in an environment of economic and political volatility is expected to boost investor confidence in the Romanian banking sector. 2.	Allow the Bank to become less dependent on funding from its parent, and re-create a local funding mechanism that allows the Bank to grow its lending operations in local currency. Without IFC''s investment, the Bank''s lending operations might be constrained, and the access of the financial sector to capital market as a source of local currency funding might be delayed/ reduced.3.	This investment is expected to be a catalyst for other bond issues to follow.

title: Sogebank Sr Loan
content: - Access to finance: through this project, IFC will be providing long-term funding to support lending to SMEs and larger corporations;   - Employment generation: Contribute to direct and indirect job creation via several important sectors including, SMEs and the construction industry;- Support the economic recovery of a post disaster country: Haiti is slowly rebuilding following the January 2010 earthquake, and is at a critical stage in its recovery.

title: Luz del Norte
content: i. Continue IFC''s track record of providing developmental impact in Chile through the implementation of innovative projects with potential for replication, initially in the small hydro and wind sector and now in the solar PV sector. If successful, these investments could greatly open up the market for rapid development of very large-scale solar energy not only in Chile but in all of Latin Americaii. Contribute towards the increase in energy generation to diversify and strengthen the energy sector in the countryiii. Enable the implementation of utility-scale zero-emission power generation, decreasing overall emissions of CO2 and GHG.iv. Create jobs in the local market

title: Austral
content: The proposed Project will:-	Improve Competitiveness: create market alternatives by increasing competition in the reinsurance sector in Brazil, which is still dominated by the IRB, the government-owned reinsurance company;-	Support infrastructure projects: to enable (i) job creation; (ii) economic growth; and (iii) increase in living standards by providing insurance products that are essential for the execution of large infrastructure projects, which could unlock and support Brazil''s potential growth for the next decades;-	Enable fund accumulation: insurers have the capacity to deploy longer-term investments (than commercial banks and other financial institutions)  into the economy, supporting economic development and infrastructure build-up; and-	Promote Innovation: Austral provides reinsurance and insurance products that are underdeveloped and/or new in the Brazilian market.

title: Malawi Mangoes
content: 1)	Expected to reach at least an incremental 2,000 small scale mango farmers over the next five years, thereby improving sustainable income streams along these value chains. 2)	Penetration of modern farming practices and sustainable land use in farming communities in Malawi.3)	Development of improved natural resource management techniques, especially water resource efficiency through promotion of drip irrigation.4)	Contribution to wider regional development in terms of jobs, infrastructure, education, health and other socio-economic parameters.

title: IHS-SA
content: The Fund will have the following development impacts:1.	Economic development: The Fund will help address the short supply of quality affordable housing and will increase the quality of life for the lower-middle income population in Sub Saharan Africa. The spillover effects will include the provision of urban infrastructure through the development of housing communities where families can live, work and play. The Fund is expected to deliver well over 20,000 housing units over the next 10 years2.	Demonstration Effect: Successful implementation of the fund will stimulate other industry stakeholders to replicate this model in other countries. IFC's early involvement in this fund provides support for a successful close. IHS is also demonstrating that low-to-middle income housing in South Africa is a viable asset-class 3.	Private Sector Infrastructure Development: The fund will contribute to urban infrastructure development and surrounding community development, such as roads, electricity, water access and sanitation and will mobilize government investment on supporting infrastructure4.	Job creation: The Fund will foster, through its investee companies, the creation of direct and indirect jobs during construction of the residential properties, and also during property maintenance. The Fund is expected to create over 15,000 construction jobs over its lifetime5.	Linkages: The Fund will increase the demand for construction and building materials in the target markets and will stimulate the use of local goods and services.

title: Yoma Equity
content: (i) Contribute to the Development of the Financial Sector in Myanmar: At present, access to financial services in Myanmar is extremely limited.  IFC''s engagement with Yoma Bank will help to develop a strong financial institution that can provide a demonstration effect for good banking practices.(ii) Increased Access to Financing for SMEs: Limited access to finance is considered a key constraint to private sector growth. By supporting the development of the SME lending capacity of a local bank, the investment will support SMEs and will have a positive impact on economic activity in Myanmar.

title: Africinvest Fund III LLC
content: The Fund is expected to have significant development impact on its investees by:- providing them with risk capital and strategic advice in their growth and expansion plans;- implementing best practice Environmental, Social and Governance standards at both the Fund and investee company level.

title: BBM Agri
content: - Access to finance - IFC will help increase access to finance to medium sized corporations in Brazil as the Bank increases its loan portfolio.
