In addition, clients working in the agribusiness sector will benefit from a targeted line. - Increase competition - (a) IFC will improve BBM''s funding quality by conceding long-term loans, enabling long-term credit operations in the agribusiness sector, and (b) By having a targeted line to these clients, this Project will also support increase the capillarity of financing services and increase competition between banks in this sector.- Dissemination of E&S standards - IFC''s participation in this Project will help the Bank implement and promote good environmental and social standards for agribusiness in Brazil.

title: Bidco Bev. & Det
content: 1)	Farmers Reached: The Project will reach over 20,000 smallholder farmers supplying into Bidco''s supply chain.   2)	Support of basic hygiene needs: The Project will increase the supply of affordable quality detergent, which is a basic hygiene need and helps prevent diseases.   3)	Private sector development: through support of local suppliers of inputs and general suppliers.4)	Serving the BOP: Bidco has a rich history of providing benefits to the lower income, Bottom of the Pyramid ("BOP") segment of the East African market by delivering quality products at affordable prices.

title: APRM II BNPP
content: The key development impacts are: -	Improved Access to Finance:  By indirectly enabling emerging markets farmers and agricultural intermediaries across several countries to obtain price risk management products, the Project will facilitate their access to finance (since their lenders will be less exposed to factor price risk into their funding decisions).-	Relieve EM producers, consumers and intermediaries from the negative impact of margin calls on the liquidity position-	Increased Agricultural Production:  Better access to finance for producers can be expected to lead to increased agriculture production, which in turn will have a positive effect on agriculture prices.-	More Stable Markets for agri-commodity Products:  It is expected to enable producers, intermediaries and consumers of agri-products to enter into more stable and longer term contracts, lowering uncertainty and improving price stability/help address price volatility.The Project will support agribusiness in emerging markets by increasing the volume of trades executed on exchanges for the EM producers, consumers and intermediaries.

title: Bakhresa SA (Pty) Limited
content: (i) Employment Generation: The project will generate permanent jobs for local communities in Durban, South Africa. Also during the construction of the mill, temporary positions will be created in the region. The creation of additional indirect jobs throughout the value chain is expected.(ii) SME supply chain development: Agro allied businesses in the value chain such as local SME''s that provide goods and services to the mill, (transportation, packaging materials, ingredients, distribution, general services) or buyers from the mill (wholesalers, retailers, bakeries, animal feed manufactures) will benefit from the development of a flour mill plant in Durban, South Africa.(iii) Food security: Improved food security in South Africa and neigboring countries, where wheat products are a staple diet.(iv) Fiscal benefits: Increased tax revenues.

title: Kandeo Fund II L.P
content: The Fund is expected to have strong development impact as it will invest in high-growth companies which are looking to replicate their successful business models within the Countries, therefore having a relevant impact in job creation and so contributing to economic development. In addition, the focus of the Fund on companies that offer financial services to the lowest socioeconomic segments of the population will propel financial inclusion in the Countries.

title: Xina Solar One (Pty) Ltd
content: The Project will: (i) promote additional employment and skills development during construction and operation; (ii) diversify South Africa''s energy mix; (iii) reduce carbon emissions by producing green, emission-free electricity; (iv) contribute to increased generation capacity in South Africa (as part of the planned system expansion) and; (v) contribute to the upliftment of local communities, through financial benefits flowing from a 20% shareholding to be held via a community trust.

title: GTST transoil
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to include  (i) increased access to finance for a leading agricultural player operating in a key sector of the Moldovan economy, (ii) support of the Group''s growth and generation of higher export revenues, a major source of export income in Moldova, (iii) increased farmers reach by providing a sizable and stable source of financing for the Group''s purchase of commodities from mainly small and medium-sized farmers, and (iv) job preservation and increased tax revenues.

title: SENAC 2
content: 1. Fostering economic development: providing reliable access from the city of Dakar to the new Dakar international airport will boost trade, tourism and economic growth;2. Easing connectivity between Dakar and other important economic areas of Senegal;3. Helping reduce travel times and ease congestion;4. Allowing savings to the national budget (self-explanatory);5. Demonstrating the replication potential of such tollroad PPP projects in Senegal and in the region (self-explanatory);6. Job creation: the Project will create both direct and indrect jobs during the construction and operations phase.

title: SDM Loan
content: The Project is expected to have significant developmental impact by:a) improving access to finance for mid-size Russian companies;b) strengthening a well-managed Russian bank and supporting its portfolio growth and diversification, and c) strengthening product proposition to SMEs.

title: Eagle Eye Echo-Scan
content: The Project is expected to have a strong development impact for a broad range of stakeholders(i) Increased availability of quality health diagnosis services(ii) Improved provision of healthcare in Nigeria - good diagnosis is key to quality healthcare(iii) Creation of direct and indirect employment for local communities during construction and operation(iv) Skill transfer in diagnosis center management for the benefit of the local workforce(v) South - south investment (from India to Nigeria)(vi) Positive impact on Nigeria''s current account, via foreign exchange saving.

title: SAB SAS
content: (i) Innovation: IT innovations developed by entities like SAB are designed to help financial intermediaries enhance risk control and transaction processing systems, increase productivity notably through automation andcustomization of back to front office tasks, adapt to changes in market and regulatory environments, develop awider range of financial products and expand into new distant markets.(ii) Job creation: SAB''s expansion and future hiring is expected to be essentially in emerging markets. In thisrespect, IFC investment will help retain talent and highly skilled staff in emerging markets (Tunisia and Lebanon as well as other emerging markets where SAB plans to invest) increasing such countries'' economic growthopportunities.(iii) Enhanced credibility for SAB''s clients: By meeting international standards promoted by IFC, SAB''s clients''credibility will be enhanced in both developed and developing countries.

title: Mekong Enterprise Fund III L.P.
content: Expected development impact includes (i) supporting the mid-cap market in Vietnam with access to an alternate source of funding, (ii) improving access to debt and capital markets for the Fund's investee companies, (iii) supporting a promising local fund manager in Vietnam and thereby providing demonstration effect for financial viability of private equity as an asset class for SMEs, and (iv) promoting sustainable private sector and creating employment.

title: Metropolitano II
content: Metropolitano''s expansion will increase the supply of high quality specialized health services in Nicaragua, including the development of the first pediatric hospitalization unit, continuing setting high standards in the health care sector in the country increasing access to health services for the general population.  The project also aims at increasing the Hospital''s Preventive Health Care programs, through the construction of an auditorium for seminars and events on various relevant health topics for the benefit of the local community. Furthermore, the expansion of the only JCI international quality-accredited hospital in Nicaragua, and one of the few JCI accredited in Central America, is expected to have an important demonstration effect.

title: BBVA PY CL II
content: -	The Project will allow BBVA PY to enhance access to funding with longer maturities to SMEs, enabling them to undertake capital investments at longer tenors and attractive costs;-	The facility will be 100% used to provide small sub loans with an average size of US$1 million to Paraguayan SMEs. On a sector level, the introduction of longer-term financing in the market will supply more funding options to SMEs, generating a range of social and economic benefits which include promoting economic growth and raising productivity;-	IFC''s new project with BBVA PY will be a follow-on investment to project #28787, the first long-term loan ever granted to a Paraguayan banking institution by IFC. Leveraging on the success of the first long-term transaction, IFC''s continuous stamp of approval will serve as an additional indicator to private investors on the possibilities presented by the local financial system.

title: BFL RSF
content: The Project is expected to have significant development impact:(i) Access to finance for SMEs: The Project will increase access to finance for the underserved SME market, which represents the largest portion of enterprises in Lao PDR.(ii) Demonstration effect: Successful implementation of this project would encourage other banks and financial institutions to undertake SME financing as a viable option for their future services.

title: Borborema
content: The proposed investment is considered an early-stage investment preceding a project construction decision. Generally, pre-construction stage projects have limited development impacts.  The expected development impacts during the construction and production phases would include: (i)	Supporting local economic development through the generation of direct and indirect employment opportunities to the communities of Currais Novo and Campo Redondo.  (ii) Fiscal receipts in the form of taxes, royalties and foreign exchange. (iii) Development of Community investment programs; and(iv) Demonstration effect to other mining companies on how to develop large-scale commercial mining in accordance with good international industry practices.

title: Queen Alia II
content: The project will enhance the transport infrastructure in Jordan which will (i) enhance the revenues of the Government of Jordan through the generation of additional royalties via the payment of a concession fee; (ii) support the tourism industry of Jordan, facilitating the increased number of tourists in Jordan and indirectly supporting the country''s economy; (iii) preserve local jobs with the additional construction lasting three years and further developing local talent and expertise; and (iv) increase efficiencies and reduce costs across the value chain.

title: Port Lafito, S.A.
content: The construction of the terminal will support the reconstruction of the port sector in Haiti by providing access to reliable facilities, increasing container and bulk handling capacity and increasing competition in the market. The Project will help reduce the cost of transportation by reducing congestion, improving efficiency and productivity, and therefore benefit shippers, shipping lines, and consumers alike. In addition, the Project will create substantive employement and training, while also support revenue generation for the Government / Port Authority.

title: Bridge Bank Group Cote d'Ivoire
content: - Support access to finance and promote financial inclusion for SMEs. - Support the economic recovery of the country, which will strengthen the transition towards stability and prosperity.- Promote job creation: Financing the SME sector will help job creation and promote a more inclusive and balanced economic growth in Cote d''Ivoire.

title: Tikona Broadband
content: i. Technological innovation driving broadband penetration through increased capacity, higher speeds and lower tariffs: Tikona''s innovative wireless broadband solution solves multiple problems including affordability and capacity in India''s underserved market.  This unique, low-cost network is rapidly scalable and can deliver high-quality broadband to India''s price sensitive, data-hungry mass market. Tikona is currently present in 25 cities in India and has potential to expand to Tier III and new urban and semi-urban developments which current do not have access to broadband. Tikona is also well poised to deploy 4G LTE network and provide coverage in rural Tehsil towns in its 5 Circles to homes, SMBs, schools, health care centers, e-gov kiosks etc. The solution is also quite relevant to other global markets where the last mile wire line plant is scantily built.ii. Direct and Indirect Employment: Expansion of the business will provide jobs to c.350 qualified professionals over the next 5-6 years as well as create c.20,000 indirect jobs in support and facilitation functions.iii. Private Sector Enterprise: The proposed investment will promote private sector enterprise in the following manner:o Facilitate the growth of SMEs: Enable access to low cost, customised data solutions for small and medium businesses including a host of applications such as cloud-based serviceso Drive efficiency and competition as an independent, focused, pan-India player in the broadband market o Economic growth: Tikona''s initiatives in the broadband space will help boost broadband penetration in India''s lesser and un-penetrated areas. Much like the penetration of voice services in the previous decade, roll out of broadband services is a powerful economic "equalizer" which will enable better access to knowledge and opportunities, driving productivity improvements for individuals and enterprises as well as overall economic growth.

title: Prasac Sr Loan 2
content: (i) Increased access to credit for micro and SME borrowers.(ii) Banking transformation: If Prasac''s intended transformation be successful, it will have a demonstration effect and provide another role model for MFIs keen to diversify and expand product offerings to better serve their customers.

title: PacificMidstream
content: - Multiplier effect: the IFC investment will support the closing of the hydrocarbon and electricity transport infrastructure gap in Colombia. This will result in substantial efficiencies through reductions in logistic costs and improvement of the economics of hydrocarbon fields, thus promoting further upstream investments. These investments will in turn result in increased regional economic activity, higher production and export revenues, and royalty revenues for the Government.  - Positive environment and social outcome: The investment will also contribute to the reduction of greenhouse emissions by displacing oil trucking, while at the same time reducing the hazards associated to that activity.

title: WCSS Prime Bank BSLF III
content: Financial Market Deepening: Facilitating increased local bank access to the commercial loan market and also facilitating the access to finance for credit constrained SMEs especially to meet working capital requirements. These will deepen the depth of the financial sector.  Demonstration Effect: IFC''s proposed package signals its confidence in the Bangladesh economy and also helps increase the Bank''s credibility in international credit markets helping continued growth of its trade financing operations.Job Creation: Bangladesh, an IDA country, still has nearly a third of its population below the poverty line in spite of improving macroeconomic fundamentals.  IFC investment will further support business growth and spur indirect job creation in the SME and Export oriented segments.Boost Export Competitiveness: The Facility will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements and assist in payments for imports utilized.

title: MF Banka SL
content: The project is expected to have a strong developmental impact by: -   increasing access to funding for underserved MSEs; -   creating a demonstration effect by reengaging in microfinance sector in BiH since 2008 and building confidence for the Bosnian financial sector; -   contributing to economic growth and poverty reduction by helping to create jobs.

title: Recordati Ilac
content: (i) Increased availability of quality drugs in Turkey.(ii) Adoption of industry best practices as the Project will be Turkish Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) compliant; and(iii) Import substitution: the Project is aimed at import substitution of the higher-margin products, in line with the Turkish government''s call for local production.

title: Yi Ming China Fund
content: Expected development impact includes (i) promoting sustainable private sector growth by mobilizing capital to SMEs in the developing Western China region, (ii) helping to improve productivity, operational efficiencies, and quality control across its portfolio companies and (iii) improving environment, safety and health standards through sustainable practices.

title: WCSS Eastern II
content: Improved access to credit:  The Project will increase access to finance for credit constrained SMEs, especially to meet working capital requirements.  It will also expand financial intermediation.Demonstration Effect:  IFC''s proposed package signals its confidence in the Bangladesh economy and also helps increase the Bank''s credibility in international credit markets, aiding continued growth of its trade financing operations.Job Creation:  Bangladesh, an IDA country, still has nearly a third of its population below the poverty line in spite of improving macroeconomic fundamentals.  IFC''s investment will further support business growth and spur indirect job creation in the SME and export-oriented segments.Boost Export Competitiveness:  The facility will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements and assist in payments for imports utilized.

title: MHP Corporate Loan
content: The Project will help facilitate its continued growth in a high potential sector to Ukraine''s economy and strengthen the debt servicing capacity of a leading agribusiness group. Key development impacts of the Project include the following: (i) Support food security: MHP''s overall volumes are expected to increase as a result of the Project and contribute to improved food security in Ukraine and beyond by efficiently converting grain to meat through supporting a leading and efficient poultry producer; (ii) Provide demonstration effect: By supporting MHP, a socially responsible and efficient producer with solid track record, IFC''s investment, which includes a B Loan, will encourage foreign and local investors to invest in Ukraine''s economy in crisis times;  (iii) Support job preservation and creation: The Group currently employs 30,000 staff, including 11,400 women. Direct employment is expected to increase as a result of the Project; and (iv) Support inclusiveness: The Company supports a network of 2,600 SMEs, a franchise network of small shops selling MHP branded poultry. Significant number of these SMEs operate in rural locations often underserved in terms of basic food retail reach.

title: Agrotec Extension
content: The Project is expected to have a significant development impact by- Reaching farmers operating in rural frontier regions- Supporting the dissemination of agricultural and inputs handling best practices to farmers- Generating tax income for the Government- Additional employment following the growth of the Company- Demonstration effect of supporting a sustainable operation in Paraguay

title: WCSS BRAC II
content: Improved access to credit:  The Project will increase access to finance for credit constrained SMEs, especially to meet working capital requirements.  It will also expand financial intermediation.Demonstration Effect:  IFC''s proposed package signals its confidence in the Bangladesh economy and also helps increase the Bank''s credibility in international credit markets, aiding continued growth of its trade financing operations.Job Creation:  Bangladesh, an IDA country, still has nearly a third of its population below the poverty line in spite of improving macroeconomic fundamentals.  IFC''s investment will further support business growth and spur indirect job creation in the SME and export-oriented segments.Boost Export Competitiveness:  The facility will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements and assist in payments for imports utilized.

title: MAS Capital (Private) Limited
content: 1. Increased forex earnings: The project will help increase forex earnings of the apparel industry and improve the currently the country''s Balance of Payments.2. Job creation: The project will lead to increased employment opportunities, and in particular, female employment, in Sri Lanka. 3. Demonstration Effect: The project will support one of Sri Lanka''s premium apparel sector players in terms of E&S compliance, OHS standards, and energy efficiency thereby setting the industry benchmark.

title: IIF A&B Loan
content: -	Provision of long-term capital, which is scarce and not readily available in the market for young institutions such as the Company;-	Continued know-how transfer in the areas of Environmental and Social ("E&S") risk management and project finance underwriting;-	Support to the government of Indonesia''s efforts in increasing investment in infrastructure projects, both for increasing urbanization as well as rural integration;-	Improve access for the Indonesian population to infrastructure such as electricity, water, transportation, telecommunications, etc;-	Economic benefits to the country by dividends generated by the infrastructure projects as well as taxes levied to the project companies, as well as indirect impact of additional infrastructure on the overall economy through higher growth and more efficient operations; and-	Job creation at the project company that receives financing from the Company as well as in businesses that provide services to such project company.

title: Tuxpan
content: The Project will create a new gateway to help accommodate Mexico''s growing container trade and add 576,000 TEUs of modern container handling capacity to Mexico''s Atlantic coast.  The Terminal will provide competition to the port sector and encourage existing operators to increase their efficiency.  Located approximately 150 kilometer close to major production and consumption areas of Greater Mexico City, the Terminal would also reduce in-land transportation time and cost for shippers and consumers. The Project will also generate public revenues, jobs and a boost to economic activity in Tuxpan and in the State of Veracruz.

title: Terra AMC
content: - The project will reduce import dependence of Katanga on maize flour which is a staple food in the province. Imports are costly due to high logistic costs and can be unreliable due to policies in exporting countries. The project is for the development of local maize production at competitive costs and its processing in state of the art maize flour mill.- Local production will promote competition with imports and contribute to improved food security for local populations.- The project will demonstrate the potential to develop primary farming and food manufacturing activities to diversify the local economy from its reliance on mining.- The project will create jobs at various levels of skills thus offering an entry point into formal employment for a significant number of job-seekers. Today, Terra has 38 local full-time employees and approximately 100 contract labors.  Terra will have about 80 local full-time employees at project completion.  In addition, it will have about 500 contract labors for land clearing.  AMCC today has 34 local full-time employees and approximately 100 contract labors for the construction.  At the project completion, it will have about 100 local full-time employees and about 60 contract labors.- The project is expected to improve the company''s ability to increase its CSR projects, where Terra already assists the local community with various infrastructure, including access to clean water (boreholes) and lighting (solar street lights).

title: RA Energy Access Fund
content: 1.	Access to Energy: The Fund should enable the 1.3 billion people that are part of the off-grid / lower income populations to access modern energy products which are cost effective power sources (e.g. for lighting, radio or cell phone charging).2.	Demonstration Impact: This Fund is intended to have a demonstration effect to improve the quality and availability of climate friendly products in a rapidly growing market.3.	Environmental, Health, and Financial Benefits for lower-income users: Solar lanterns as well as other energy efficient products have a demonstrated benefit with respect to using a renewable energy source (solar) to provide environmentally friendly energy solution. Not only is the alternative, incumbent technology expensive and potentially unhealthy, but it could also be dangerous. For example, thousands of (mostly children) users suffer injuries from the use of kerosene lanterns. Moreover, any reduction of the use of kerosene will also result in a reduction of GHG emissions.4.	Job Creation and Productivity: The expansion of the energy access market is expected to create local jobs in the distribution supply chain in various countries in Africa, Asia and across other regions. Further, the use of modern solar lighting is linked to improved access and productivity of small businesses.

title: BanBif Subdebt
content: The development impact of the proposed transaction is expected to be high given that:  - It will support expand access to finance for SMEs in Peru as BanBif''s strategy contemplates an important focus on the SME segment.- It will support SMEs and employment generation, thus, helping address the inequality that exists within the different segments of society. - It will support the Company''s adaptation to the new capital requirements being implemented for Peru''s financial sector, thus, helping also to strengthen the soundness of Peru''s financial system. - It would help to increase the financial choices for companies and individuals, by supporting a Tier II bank in a very concentrated banking sector, with the top 4 banks representing over 80% of the banking sector''s loan portfolio.

title: Auchan Global I
content: i) Affordable goods for lower to middle-income households: consumers will benefit from increased access to better quality and variety of products at lower prices. Auchan''s target is explicitly the lower bracket of the middle income class in urban areas.ii) Employment generation: Auchan''s projects will create significant local direct employment (with a significant portion of female employment) and in addition also indirect employment in the retail value chain. Typically a retail store creates approximately three full time positions for every 100 square meters of building area.iii) Expansion in second-tier cities and frontier regions: Auchan''s expansion will not only target large cities but also second-tier cities in frontier regions of countries such as Russia. iv) Best practice transfer: Auchan''s projects are expected to (a) facilitate the transfer of modern retail and management techniques, which allow lowering food prices without compromising the food quality, to the targeted regions and (b) enhance the efficiency of the supply chain in the countries and promote efficient logistic system. v) Impact on Food Safety: The expansion of modern food retail formats will contribute to food safety by improving supply chain efficiencies, and reducing food waste. The procurement of products locally sourced will generate backward linkages and encourage local producers to process according to best operating standards in terms of safety and quality.

title: Helios Towers Africa Ltd
content: - Further Development of Telecommunications Industry: By expanding the coverage of tower networks, the Company will facilitate further increase in mobile penetration and industry competition which will lead to declined tariffs, improved quality of service and product innovations - Expanded Access in Underserved and Rural Areas: One of the key elements of tower sharing model is the development of low-cost structures that accelerate the extension of telecommunications networks into rural and low income urban areas; the continuous success of Helios Towers Africa will have a demonstration effect to telecom operators in Africa and other developing countries - Increase competition: The presence of Helios Towers Africa will allow smaller and newer wireless operators to benefit from reduced barriers to entry as they will have access to leased tower facilities rather than having to build their own.- Contributing to mitigating environmental impact and climate change: The underlying projects developed by the company will provide a cost effective opportunity to telecommunication operators, to reduce their carbon emission footprint by sharing infrastructure. A significant benefit of sharing tower infrastructure arises from the material, energy and emission savings that ensue from building only one tower instead of multiple towers.

title: Working Capital Systemic Solutions - Southeast Bank 2
content: (i) Financial Market Deepening: Facilitating increased local bank access to the commercial loan market and also facilitating access to finance for credit constrained SMEs, especially to meet working capital requirements.(ii) Demonstration Effect: IFC''s proposed package signals its confidence in Bangladesh economy and also helps increase the Bank''s credibility in international credit markets helping continued growth of its trade financing operations.(iii) Job Creation: Bangladesh, an IDA country, still has nearly a third of its population below the poverty line in spite of improving macroeconomic fundamentals. IFC''s investment will further support business growth and spur indirect job creation in the SME and Export oriented segments.(iv) Boost Export Competitiveness: The Facility will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements and assist in payments for imports utilized.

title: TCell
content: -	Extend and improve the quality of telecommunications services:  TCell plans to invest heavily in its network by upgrading and expanding coverage.  This is expected to improve service for its subscribers and result in access in areas of the country that were not covered in the past.  TCell''s investment program will also compel other operators to invest in their networks, leading to improvements across the industry as a whole and benefiting the general population. -	Direct and indirect employment:  Due to the limited employment opportunities domestically, nearly half of Tajikistan''s labor force works abroad.  This project is expected to generate employment opportunities in the local market at both a Company level and across the supply chain. -	Support delivery of Social Services:  In 2002 TCell launched 3G services under its Indigo Tajikistan brand, making the country one of the first in the former Soviet Union to have a 3G network.  Due to the lack of fixed line, broadband infrastructure, the country''s 3G network is relied on for the transmission of data and mobile internet access.  As applications such as mobile banking and eGovernment services come on line, TCell''s extensive network will allow these services to reach a larger share of the population. -	Demonstration Effect:  IFC has taken a leading role in in the telecom sector as a pioneer investor in post-conflict and IDA countries, such as Afghanistan, Sierra Leone, West Bank and Haiti.  IFC''s participation in this project would send a positive signal to other investors about Tajikistan''s investment potential despite perceptions about a challenging business environment and country risk.  Although it grew significantly in the years that followed the 1992-1997 civil war, foreign direct investment remains limited.

title: FCMB III
content: 1.	Reduce the infrastructure funding gap in Nigeria. 2.	Increase access to finance for SMEs in Nigeria. 3.	Demonstrate the economic and social impact of infrastructure, SMEs and climate change finance in Nigeria.

title: Emerald Sri Lanka Fund I Limited
content: Development of private equity industry: The Fund is expected to be the first private equity fund dedicated to investing in Sri Lanka and will pave the way for development of the private equity asset class in the country and encourage flow of private capital into financing growth of small and mid-sized private companies.Private Sector Development: The Fund is expected to promote sustainable growth in companies that do not have access to other sources of capital. The Fund will add value to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance, and providing operational expertise.  Access to Finance to MSMEs: The Fund will provide capital to capital strained MSMEs. Job Creation: Supporting high growth MSMEs in the growth phase leads to substantial job creation, at a greater rate than the national average.

title: Vix Logistica
content: The Project will have a significant development impact on the Brazilian economy, as a result of: - Improving Brazil''s competitiveness in domestic and international trade by helping increase the range and availability of quality logistics services serving key areas of the economy (such as mining, steel, oil & gas and automotive); - Promoting the organization of Brazil''s logistics sector which is expected to help reduce logistics costs by achieving economies of scale in what is currently a fairly fragmented market;- Supporting the development of domestic capital markets by contributing to the potential future IPO plans of infrastructure stocks with high corporate governance standards.

title: Lucid Colloids
content: The Project will involve supporting a Company with significant operations in Rajasthan, a low income state, thereby increasing employment and economic opportunities in this frontier region. The Project will also result in increased sourcing of guar from farmers in the arid / semi-arid regions of this low income state, it will improve their access to global markets and enable better price realizations. The investment will also enhance the global competitiveness of a mid-sized export-oriented player and will help increase the value addition within India.

title: Education Innovation Fund
content: - Accelerate the introduction and expansion of latest education technologies in selected markets, contributing to improved access, quality, efficiency and relevance of local education systems.- Promote innovation in early stage technology companies through the access to growth capital for expansion in emerging markets. - Provide a demonstration effect of the potential for the private sector to bring innovative solutions to long standing problems in education systems in emerging markets, mainly through the use of technology.

title: Wamda Ventures
content: (i) Support for SMEs: IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. IFC would support job creation in the MENA region as the Fund's strategy is in line with IFC's development impact strategy.(ii) Access to long term early stage venture capital is limited in MENA. The gap is currently filled with a fragmented network of angel investors (mostly friends and family) who have limited capacity for follow on investments, limited management skills and a smaller network with which to support the investee companies' growth.(iii) Support of local entreprenuership / innnovation in high growth technology / media / telecom sectors(iv) Private sector development: The ability of the Fund to indentify best practices and superior management skills in its invested companeis and subsequently disseminate them across the portfolio may lead to increased competitiveness and sustainability.

title: DARP SSF Plural
content: -	Jobs Saved/Preserved: A major consequence of resolving special situations is saving and eventually creating jobs, which carries significant and positive benefits. A significant number of jobs are forecast to be preserved as a result of the financing provided by the Fund.-	Access to Finance: IFC will facilitate the restructuring and refinancing of financially stressed companies, keeping assets in productive use and jobs in place, as well as providing much needed liquidity and risk capital for the local marketplace.-	E&S Standards: IFC''s participation in this project would support a leading Brazilian asset manager with the capacity to implement and promote good environmental and social standards for the corporate sector in Brazil.

title: GTST Ethiopia II
content: The proposed investment will have significant development impacts as follows:(a) Maintain the availability of trade finance in Ethiopia. The Project is expected to finance about US$ 1 billion of imports of oil products to Ethiopia over a year. This will ensure stability in supply of energy products into an IDA economy.(b) Ensuring availability of energy products is critical for retail and industrial consumption, power and transportation sectors. (c) Support to Private Sector - The facility will indirectly support the business activities of private marketing and distribution companies in the downstream oil sector.

title: CITICC
content: The Project will have the following development impacts:(i) Increase affordable housing supply thereby contributing to the alleviation of the current housing deficit in Sub-Saharan Africa;(ii) Create thousands of both direct and indirect jobs during construction and the operating phase of the housing communities;(iii) Transform the affordable housing sector by demonstrating the viability and affordability of this sector whilst maintaining IFC''s environmental and social standards;(iv) Enhance local supply linkages through sourcing from local suppliers and creating critical mass of market demand to justify local manufacturing capacity build-up; and (v) Contribute to more sustainable urbanization through providing much needed urban infrastructure in good quality and at fair cost.

title: WCSS SG GHANA
content: The Facility is expected to have the following specific development impacts:i)	Increased Access to Financing for SMEs: Limited access to finance is considered a key constraint to private sector growth. Increased access to finance is indispensable to grow the competitiveness of SMEs. By directly financing the short-term needs of a local bank to support SME trade and working capital finance needs, the Project will support SMEs and will have a positive impact on economic activity in an IDA country.ii)	Support Financing to Agribusiness Value Chain: By supporting the expansion of SG Ghana''s short-term loan portfolio directed at SMEs operating in agri-commodities, IFC will aim to strengthen the value chain by allowing traders and distributors to increase their imports and make foodstuffs more available in the country.iii)	Support access to energy in Ghana: Continuous energy distribution is critical for sustaining key economic activities, including transportation, cooking and the operation of businesses. A steady supply of critically needed fuel through regular channels will help to improve affordability and help diminish the risk of any disruptions in the country''s supply chains.

title: Frontier II
content: (i)	Job creation: The fund is expected to deploy growth capital in private sector companies spurring job creation, which is typically at a higher rate than the national average.  (ii)	Private sector development: The Fund is expected to promote sustainable growth in companies that do not have access to other sources of capital.  There is significant value addition to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance and transparency, while providing operational and financial expertise in building new business opportunities and partnerships. (iii)	Frontier Market Development: The Fund is expected to create access to capital in an underserved PE market and the Fund's successful exits of investee companies, which potentially include IPOs, would help in deepening of domestic capital markets.(iv)	Incorporating IFC's E&S standards: applying international best ESG practices at the Fund and investee level will contribute to sustainable economic development.

title: PT Ciputra Residence
content: Capital markets development: IFC''s partial credit guarantee product will provide credit enhancement and assist companies such as CR to raise debt funds with institutional investors in the public market and thereby diversify their sources of funding.Reducing housing deficit: The housing deficit in Indonesia is estimated to be high and IFC''s support to CR will contribute to increase in supply.Sustainable urbanization: CR''s focus is on new neigbourhood developments and the use of the proceeds will include new neihbourhoods in frontier regions. Developments outside Jakarta are expected to support the development of new hubs of economic activity and promote living in cities in frontier regions. Job creation: The Project will provide direct and indirect jobs to local businesses.

title: Amret MFI Equity
content: - Contribute to the development of the microfinance sector in Cambodia: Through this investment, IFC will broaden its support to the microfinance sector demonstrating increased confidence and support for the sector as a whole.- Increased access to finance for micro clients, including in rural areas and agriculture sector: As of September 2013 Amret served over 300,000 borrowers of which more than 50% of its clients are engaged in the agriculture sector and 80% are women borrowers; and 110,000 depositors of which 54% are women depositors. Amret is expected to reach about 340,000 borrowers by 2016. Specific indicators to measure and monitor development impact of the Project such as additional clients, additional women clients, additional SME clients and additional clients in agriculture sector will be finalized with the client.- Unique role in providing commercially-oriented expertise: IFC will contribute to the sector''s further diversification of investor base and will bring a more commercially-oriented approach, as well as international expertise and experiences in financial sector, while maintaining the MFIs'' social mission and values.

title: PPC Barnet DRC
content: 1. Support to industrial, social and infrastructure development: the project will expand local production of cement, reduce dependency on imports and save foreign exchange. Ultimately, the project will help reduce cement prices and support the development of the housing and infrastructure sectors.2. Local supply chain development: the project will create new SME business opportunities due to increased demand for the supply of raw materials, transportation and distribution services.3. Job creation: The project will create about 270 jobs for locals and many more indirect jobs in the value chain.4. South-south investment: IFC will be supporting a South African corporate investing up north in Sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Sunergise Equity
content: -	Sunergise provides companies in the Pacific region with access to lower cost power and reduces reliance on expensive fossil fuel imports and exposure to oil price fluctuations, increasing energy security in the Pacific region.-	Supports the renewable energy targets to achieve 50% by 2015 of many Pacific Island Countries. For each 1 MWp of installed solar power it is estimated that around 900 tCO2eq/annum of GHG emissions will be avoided based on peak daytime loads currently being met by diesel generation of grid electricity in Fiji and 1,600 MWhr/annum of electricity generated per installed MWp. Accordingly, the project will reduce the generation of GHG Emissions by an estimated 2,745 tCO2eq/annum with the targeted installation of 3.05 MWp by the end of 2015.

title: Darp SPV Chile
content: - Allow banks in Chile to offload their NPLs, and therefore improve their liquidity and capacity to originate new loans.- Through the appropriate resolution of NPLs, the project could allow a large number of individuals to be able to avoid losing their assets (e.g., their homes) and ultimately to re-enter the banking system.- The proposed investment would contribute to the further development of the distressed assets market in Emerging Markets, resulting in an increase of both the number of NPL transactions and the players in this market.

title: Nyumba Ya Akiba
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impact: (i) access to reliable supply of cement and the creation of a competitive domestic market, (ii) support housing and infrastructure development in the DRC, (iii) job creation & technology transfer, and (iv) contribution to economic growth and SME activity.

title: Tutunska Sub
content: The Project aims at supporting a systemic Bank in FYR Macedonia through strengthening its capital base. With increased capitalization, the Bank will be able to pursue its growth strategy.

title: On Telecom
content: - Expand access to broadband internet: ON is targeting underserved cities and households with poor or no fixed-line internet service, including largely lower income segments of the population.- Replication effect: ON''s innovative technology could play a key role in addressing Brazilian challenges to deploying broadband internet service over a vast territory with no or poor fixed line penetration. ON has a strong team in place, capable of implementing the technology and with the intention to replicate the experience in broader areas of the country and internationally.- Reduce connectivity costs: the rollout of On''s operations will catalyze a reduction in wholesale bandwidth costs and subsequently, a reduction in retail bandwidth costs for corporate and residential subscribers.- Promote economic growth: According to World Bank, a 10% increase in broadband internet access contributes to a 1.5% increase to GDP.  Broadband positively impacts productivity and promotes new business models across several sectors, including e-education, e-health, e-commerce, e-Government, etc.- Job Creation: The Project will also contribute in the creation of direct employment opportunities.

title: Eskhata SL&SD'14
content: 1)	Increase access to finance for underserved MSMEs, contributing to employment and economic growth of Tajikistan.2)	IFC will create a demonstration effect for the entire banking sector in Tajikistan to upgrade their risk management, E&S, insurance and AML practices following principles that IFC will promote in Eskhata.3)	The Project will enhance brand of Eskhata being a local bank and one of privately-owned reputable banks in Tajikistan and help it achieve its further development milestones.

title: Janalakshmi NCD
content: 1. Access to Microfinance: This Project will help in expanding the outreach of access to microfinance to borrowers who have little or no access to formal sources of financing to women borrowers, including in low income states of India which have amongst the highest  population densities and poverty rates in the country.2. Balanced growth of Microfinance: This Project will promote a more balanced growth of microfinance in India. Janalakshmi''s operations are expanding in Western & Northern India where MFI penetration has historically been low. Additionally, the investment seeks to support an institution that has been a front-runner in adopting technology to enable financial inclusion.

title: DJEPL and UUPPL
content: Increasing clean energy production: The project will directly contribute to increase the country''s generation from renewable energy sources and to meet the Renewable Purchase Obligation (RPO) of the state of Madhya Pradesh. The project is expected to generate up to 330GWh from 2018 which corresponds to approximately 0.3 million individual residential people reached.Climate Change Mitigation: IFC''s investment will enable clean energy production that will help avoid GHG emissions, of approximately 268,144 tons of CO2 equivalent emissions per year beginning in 2015.Employment generation:  The Project will provide employment for 40 direct employees during operations.Introduction of High Environmental, Social, Health and Safety Standards: IFC is working closely with the Companies to establish an environmental management system in line with IFC''s Performance Standards.

title: Fransabank CL II
content: The project development impact is expected to be high. The project will generate a number of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of sustainable energy finance and related investments. Specifically, the project would:1. Develop sustainable energy investment across all industries.2. Improve the competitiveness of both Fransabank and the Lebanese economy, by increasing the number of sustainable energy end users and financers.3. Improve local environment by reducing emissions of conventional pollutants,  global greenhouse gases and Lebanon''s dependence on fossil fuels.

title: Lebanese Leasing Company
content: The project development impact is expected to be high. The project will generate a number of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of sustainable energy finance and related investments. Specifically, the project would:1. Develop sustainable energy investment across all industries in Lebanon.2. Improve the competitiveness of LLC and the Lebanese economy, by increasing the number of sustainable energy end users and financers.3. Improve local environment by reducing emissions of conventional pollutants, global greenhouse gases and Lebanon''s dependence on fossil fuels.

title: CCFP Bladex
content: The Project is expected to have a significant development impacts by maintaining funding for trade of critical agricultural inputs and commodities to/from the LAC region. The CCFP is aimed at helping to address the current liquidity constraint faced by both financial institutions and real sector businesses. The CCFP-Bladex facility is expected to have the following development impacts:- Maintaining access to finance: The Project will maintain the availability of trade and commodity finance mainly for the agriculture sector across many countries in LAC, including lower income countries in Central America.  Supporting the stability of credit for the agricultural sector is expected to benefit multiple companies along the agricultural value chain and, thus, support continued growth, sustain employment and encourage the generation of higher incomes going forward.  Its support of agricultural imports will enhance food security and help to mitigate potential negative effects of a decrease in the supply of critical staples.  - Strong demonstration effect: IFC will act as a catalyst among others international finance institutions ("IFIs") by supporting commodity backed finance and market reach through partnerships with banks. This will promote commodities as an asset class and encourage banks to participate in funding the critical agricultural sector, which will ultimately help increase access to finance and develop local markets.

title: Bank Audi
content: Development Impact: a) improved regional integration creating institutional linkages between Lebanon and the region; b) development of financial systems in target markets; c) positive signal to the market given IFC''s engagement when MENA and Lebanon is faced with economic and political challenges and d) increased access to finance and job creation.

title: Al Majmoua
content: (i) Funding: IFC will be providing medium/long term funding to support Al-Majmoua''s growth in the microfinance sector in Lebanon and reach out to more of the under served segments of the market.  The loan would also assist the MFI to better manage their asset and liability position at the time of limited funding opportunities. (ii) Access to finance: The proposed Project would support Al Majmoua, one of the leading microfinance providers, to expand its outreach and serve a larger number of low-income people in Lebanon. The social impact of the proposed project would be significant especially that women account for 50% of total clients. (iii) Job creation: MSMEs are key contributors to job creation in the Country. Developing a vibrant MSME sector, with reliable access to finance, can play a significant role in private sector led economic growth, generating employment and providing opportunities to the poor and under-served groups. (iv) Demonstration effect: Through this project, IFC is expected to act as a catalyst by encouraging other investors, especially local banks, to fund the microfinance sector and bridge the financing gap facing this sector. Furthermore, and when regulatory environment allows, Al Majmoua will consider/assess transforming from its local NGO status into a financial institution company regulated by the Central Bank. This will be a successful example for other NGOs to strengthen their institutional capacity, implement best standard practices, and to be regulated by the Central Bank.

title: Landmark Myanmar
content: (i) Construction of critical business infrastructure: The Project will add much-needed supply of international standard office, retail and hospitality infrastructure to Yangon. International standard business infrastructure such as these are of critical importance in attracting foreign investments in the country.(ii) Improvement of service standards: The Project will significantly improve the standards of office, retail and accommodation facilities and services available to travelers and the business community. (iii) Employment creation and knowledge transfer: The Project will create a significant number of direct and indirect employment opportunities for the local community both during construction and operational phases. It will also promote the transfer of service and management expertise and knowledge to the local staff.(iv) Benefits to the local economy and local linkages: The Project will help create demand for locally-sourced materials, services, and labor both during the construction and operation stages. The Project is expected to generate additional sales for local small and medium enterprises, including a wide range of goods and service providers.(v) Increase in tax revenues and foreign exchange: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange inflow, particularly as it is expected that a significant portion of the users (office, retail and apartment lessees and hotel guests) will be foreign nationals and that a significant amount of Project revenues is expected to be paid in foreign currency.(vi) Private sector development: The presence of this large scale development in Yangon will send a positive signal about investing in Myanmar, particularly to foreign investors.

title: Transatlantic
content: - Development of the hydrocarbon sector in Turkey: The Thrace Basin in Turkey is the country''s largest gas producing province and gas produced in the region is consumed domestically. Being one of the main private E&P companies in Turkey, TAP will help develop indigenous hydrocarbon resources and thus contribute to the country''s goals of reducing energy dependency, and help displace other fuels with natural gas.- Technology and know-how transfer: TAP is pioneering North American technology including hydraulic fracturing and horizontal drilling in Turkey and through the use of advanced development and production technology, is playing an instrumental role in the transfer of technology. TAP''s activities enhance recoveries from and extends the lives of its fields in Turkey, leading to additional revenues to the government in the form of taxes and royalties.  TAP is also sharing knowhow with TPAO, the national oil company in Turkey, with whom TAP partners with in certain gas fields located in Thrace. This transfer of know how is highly likely to enhance recovery from other existing fields operated by TPAO and indirectly generate additional revenues to the government and help improve the energy balance of Turkey.- Helping develop the nascent services sector in the region: TAP has significant drilling, 3D seismic and other development and exploration activities which are currently acquired from Viking Services (an IFC client), an oil field services company operating in the region. TAP is Viking''s key client and will continue playing an instrumental role in the development of the services sector in the country. The availability of North American technology in the region is enhancing recoveries in other existing fields operated by other clients as well. TAP''s expansion in Turkey will create and preserve local services jobs and provide training for local staff. TAP employs local technical staff to monitor and supervise activities such as horizontal drilling in Turkey. Local technical staff, which includes female drilling engineers, in many cases receive training in the United States.

title: CHUEE Rizhao
content: Environmental benefit: Upon full ramp-up of the RSF, 89,112 tons of CO2 emission is estimated to be reduced per year; Access to finance: About 25 EE, RE and WE projects will be financed under this project and most of the borrowers are expected to be SMEs. During the course, the Bank is expected to change its risk perception of EE, RE and WE loans and would be willing to extend more credits to address EE, RE and WE demand; Capacity Building: The Project will help the Bank establish its internal capacity in identifying and assessing EE/RE/WE projects and get ready to expand the EE/RE/WE products offering in the future; and Demonstration effect: The success of the Project will encourage more banks in Shandong to provide the much needed EE/RE/WE funding to local business. The Project, as an innovative PPP (Public Private Partnership) initiative to address China's climate change agenda, will also set a role model for other provinces across China.

title: NephroPlus
content: - Increase in patients reached (IDG 2): Expected to increase the number of patients reached by healthcare services and contribute to IFC''s IDG 2 (patients reached) targets. - Employment generation: Expected to create additional skilled jobs (doctors, nurses, dialysis technicians etc.) including in tier-2 and tier-3 cities. - Enhancing medical infrastructure and creating centers of excellence: Nephroplus plans to expand its number of centers India aggressively, thereby enhance country''s dialysis care infrastructure and improve access to high quality service. Further, Company''s focus on standardized processes, use of patent pending innovation that prevents cross infection and use of certified clinical staff with expertise in dialysis care, would create centers of excellence which could serve as models for the overall sector. - Manpower training: Company''s Enpidia institute (India''s only BONENT empanelled institute) will provide skills training to create employable base of dialysis technicians and nurses. The certified and skilled personnel would be beneficial not only for Nephroplus but for the whole dialysis care sector in India.

title: WCSS Bank Asia
content: (i) Financial Market Deepening: Facilitating increased local bank access to the commercial loan market and also facilitating access to finance for credit constrained SMEs, especially to meet working capital requirements. (ii) Demonstration Effect: IFC''s proposed package signals its confidence in Bangladesh economy and also helps increase the Bank''s credibility in international credit markets helping continued growth of its trade financing operations.(iii) Job Creation: Bangladesh, an IDA country, still has nearly a third of its population below the poverty line in spite of improving macroeconomic fundamentals.  IFC''s investment will further support business growth and spur indirect job creation in the SME and Export oriented segments.(iv) Boost Export Competitiveness: The Facility will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to their working capital requirements and assist in payments for imports utilized.

title: Scanntech
content: Productivity enhancement: Scanntech''s platform allows SMEs such as independent grocery stores to process transactions, run inventory management, and sell financial services. This allows the SMEs to provide new services to end consumers, driving sales and store traffic, thereby strengthening the role of small and medium sized retailers in the economy. Financial Inclusion: The Company''s platform can be used by financial services companies to expand the reach of their products (i.e. micro-credits), thereby improving access to finance for the population. The Scanntech network gives an additional incentive to SMEs to professionalize their operations and join the formal economy.

title: Probiotech
content: (i)Food security: Since feed represents over eighty per cent (80%) of live broiler production costs, improvement in feed quality and feed mill production efficiencies, as envisaged by the project would help in reducing cost of production of broiler making it more affordable to the end-consumer through achieving economies of scale.(ii)Supply chain efficiency and income generation for small growers:On successful completion, the project is likely to help increase the efficiency of the food supply chain leading to improved productivity at the farm-gate level thereby translating into higher income for the growers(iii)Employment creation:The proposed project once completed is expected to help create both direct and indirect employment opportunity for people both at the plant and farm level

title: CRRP
content: The project will support the supply of trade finance in emerging markets, including IDA countries, by sharing credit risk on Trade finance activities in emerging markets with CACIB in order to develop further growth in this activity. The project will also demonstrate to other investors and banks the feasibility of undertaking this type of transaction for the growth of emerging markets trade finance activities.

title: EuroMena III LP
content: (i) Support for SMEs in the MENA region: all target portfolio companies will be in the SME and mid-market segment. IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. (ii) Private Sector Development: the fund manager employs a hands-on value added strategy to help portfolio companies improve operational efficiency and competitiveness leading to improved competitiveness and sustainability. (iii) Economic Development: long-term capital to under-banked sectors with capital needs allows new businesses and markets to develop which lead to increased employment and output.

title: Mapei
content: The Project is expected to enable transfer of technical and managerial know-how in the specialty chemicals sector, create around 500 jobs and improve competitiveness of local construction industries.

title: Education Project - El Comercio
content: The project is expected to (i) expand access and quality of education to students in K-12 and tertiary level; (ii) provide employment opportunities for local teachers and skilled administrative professionals; and (iii) set new local standards, by demonstrating the viability for privately run education institutions to provide good quality education and employability

title: FDN EQ
content: IFC''s expertise in other regions has shown that infrastructure focused financial institutions can play a catalytic role in the markets. The proposed project is therefore expected to have a major impact in Colombia. Some of the most relevant development impacts will be: (i)	Development of  the Infrastructure Finance Market: IFC will support the creation of an institution that is expected to develop further the infrastructure financing market in Colombia, thus, supporting the development of the infrastructure sector in the Country. (ii)	Institutional capacity building: Supported by IFC, FDN will develop its own project structuring capabilities. This is vital for Colombia as  structuring capabilities of domestic financial institutions and state and local governments  for complex infrastructure projects are limited. (iii)	Increased Competitiveness: The project is expected to have a strong impact on the Country''s infrastructure competitiveness, which in turn will enhance Colombia''s private sector competitiveness thereby increasing its capacity to generate new jobs and support inclusive economic growth.

title: Garanti MSME
content: 1. Contribution to economic growth through improved access to finance by SMEs. The level of financial intermediation in Romania has yet to recover from the impact of the crisis. Expanded financial intermediation is needed to support the flow of credit to small businesses and individuals which make up the most important part of these countries'' economies.2. Creates more job opportunities: Employment would widen by aiding SMEs;3. Increasing financial inclusion in Romania: Access to credit and increasing the economic power of women would translate into improved livelihoods for a wide cross-section of society.

title: Westfalia Fruto Mocambique (Pty) ltd
content: (a) Employment creation: The farm will employ 40 permanent workers while during the harvest period (2 months), it will require 400 additional casual workers.(b) Market access and shared prosperity: WM will provide access to market and fair pricing to hundreds of litchi, mango and avocado growers in Central Mozambique and Zimbabwe (neighbouring Chipinge growing region).(c) Knowledge transfer: WM will provide access to training, inputs and appropriate planting material to smallholders and emerging commercial farmers.(d) SME supply chain development: WM will hire local contractors (logistics, earth moving, equipment & chemicals suppliers and the like).(e) Community Development benefits: WM will set up social infrastructures (local clinic, roads<U+00A6>) and will partner with local NGOs to improve the well-being of the community. (f) Replicability/Demonstration effect:  WM sees a lot of potential for expansion in Mozambique and in the medium term in Zimbabwe. WM also hopes to attract other South African avocado and fruit growers by demonstrating Manica''s suitability for agriculture investments.

title: TCQ
content: The construction of the terminal will contribute to increasing Guatemala''s competitiveness and trade by offering needed, modern and efficient container handling capacity to better serve the country''s exports and imports. It will also help facilitate trade with new markets (South America and Asia), as the Project will allow handling of post-panamax vessels and expand the existing port''s capacity for handling containers. The Project will also increase foreign direct investment in the country, generate new jobs, and generate new taxes for the local and state governments.

title: Chola NCD
content: 1.	1.	Additional Reach: The Company is expected to increase its customer base by 400,000 customers over the next few years.2.	Growth in low income states (LIS): Currently, Chola has ~ 40% of its pan-India footprint in low income states. It is expected that more than 50% of Chola''s portfolio will be in low income states going forward.

title: AEP II
content: Expected development impact includes (i) promoting cleaner energy production and access, (ii) improving environment through sustainable practices, (iii) providing demonstration effect for financial viability of clean energy and environmental business and (iv) promoting sustainable private sector and creating employment.

title: CRDB SME Loan, GWFP and GTFP
content: IFC''s financing package for CRDB is expected to deliver the following development impact:1) Supporting SME Sector Development: Through access to longer-tenor loans, SMEs will have greater flexibility in making investments to develop their businesses, improve productivity and income generation, and create new jobs.  Additionally, the project will help the Bank extend banking services to under-served communities, including women-owned businesses, as the Bank increases its branch network and reach through alternative banking channels and platforms.2) Enhancing Access to Finance for Farmers: This Project will contribute to the working capital needs of the agricultural supply chain in Tanzania by partnering with the country''s leading warehouse receipts financing bank, helping grow its activities in agri-lending.  Improved availability of credit to the agri-sector will continue to support growth, promote employment and generation of higher income in this sector.  3) Demonstration Effect: By supporting the warehouse receipts finance activities of the market leader in Tanzania, the Project will have a strong demonstration impact on local banks to promote participation in funding the agricultural sector. 4) Financial Sector Deepening: Deepening the financial sector through improved credit policies and procedures, risk management techniques, product design, and customer service.5) Job Creation: The Project will support income generating exports and population sustaining imports or basic staples which are the essential roles of agricultural commodity trade, and IFC aims to help maintain and expand the commodity financing flows in emerging markets.

title: RC Ronesans Insaat Taahhut A.S.
content: 1. Employment preservation and creation; 2. SME support, by channeling funds to subcontractors through RCI; 3. Payment of taxes (directly from RCI and indirectly from subcontractors);

title: Bandhan Sub Debt
content: 1. Access to Microfinance: This Project will help in expanding the outreach of access to microfinance to borrowers who have little or no access to formal sources of financing to women borrowers, including in low income states of India which have amongst the highest  population densities and poverty rates in the country.2. Balanced growth of Microfinance: This Project will promote a more balanced growth of microfinance in India. Bandhan''s operations are expanding in rural / semi-urban parts of India where access to finance has historically been low.

title: Magma NCD
content: Demonstration effect: In the current market environment, the proposed investment would encourage other institutional investors to consider investment in the Indian corporate debt market. Additional Reach: Magma has an outstanding portfolio volume of US$2.8 billion spread across more than 400,000 customers as of December 13. The investment is expected to reach around 700,000 customers between FY14-19. IFC''s support would also help Magma in scaling-up operations in several LIS.

title: AU NCD
content: 1.	Demonstration effect:  In the current market environment, the proposed investment would encourage other institutional investors to consider investment in the Indian corporate debt market through the FII route. 2.	Additional reach: The investment is expected to reach additional low income customers between FY14-17.3.	Growth in low income states: Au is among the largest NBFCs operating in Rajasthan and catering to the poor segment. IFC''s support would help in scaling-up operations of Au in the semi-urban and rural areas.

title: IFHA II
content: The Project is expected to contribute to the development of health and health care provision in Africa, through the investment of capital and provision of technical expertise, to small and medium healthcare providers. Healthcare is a fundamental backbone to economic development and poverty alleviation. The Fund is expected to invest in companies aiming to increase access to quality health-related goods and services, which in turn should lead to increased employment opportunities for healthcare professionals in Africa and increase access and standards of quality of health services on the African continent. The Fund Manager will adopt international best practices for environmental and social risk assessment and management, and improve transparency and corporate governance, thus transferring knowledge and skills to portfolio companies

title: Nam Long Housing
content: Access to quality and affordable housing: The project will add a significant number of affordable housing units in Vietnam, an IDA country; improve living standards of the lower income population by giving them access to quality and affordable housing. Infrastructure development: affordable/low income housing is currently under-supplied in Vietnam. Governmental support for the sector has been fairly weak and the Project will help improve the infrastructure for the low to middle income earners. Being a pioneer in developing affordable housing in Vietnam Nam Long will encourage other investors to serve the mid-low income population.Employment creation and SME linkages: The Project will help create significant number of direct and indirect employment opportunities for the local communities as well as demand for locally sourced materials, services and labour both during and after construction phase; hence benefit the local community and SMEs.Inclusiveness: Some EHome projects will be built in the suburb areas of Ho Chi Minh city or second tier cities; hence promote inclusive economic growth.

title: CEI Water
content: i) Improve industrial water efficiency through recycling and reusing wastewater, in water shortage regions.ii) Reduce health risks and environmental pollution through improved wastewater collection and treatment.iii) Improve energy efficiency through wastewater heat pump technology to supply heating and cooling services to nearby communities that traditionally use electricity or coal.iv) Job creation by continuous building new water plants.

title: Bancop CL
content: - The Project is expected to have a high development impact as it will add a new client to IFC''s portfolio in Paraguay, further expanding the reach of financial services and products to Paraguayan micro, small and medium sized companies, supporting economic activity and job creation in Paraguay.- The Project will contribute to rural economic development;- The Project will help deepen access to finance by allowing farmers and agri-SMEs access to funding with longer maturities, enabling them to undertake capital investments at longer tenors and attractive costs.- The Project will enhance investor confidence and generate a demonstration effect. IFC''s investment in Bancop will serve as an additional indicator to private investors on the possibilities presented by the local financial system and is expected to create a demonstration effect for other banks and further enhance IFC''s developmental impact in Paraguay.- The Project will support the expansion of a greenfield financial institution in the Paraguayan financial system.

title: Novomet
content: Support to Manufacturing Sector in Russia: support to a manufacturing company involved in value added production in Russia. Demonstration Effect: The Project is expected to encourage other Russian companies to invest abroadLocal Job Creation: The Project will lead to new employment opportunities in Russia and several other emerging economies EMENA (Turkey, Romania, Iraq), LAC (Argentina and Mexico) and Asia (Indonesia) Income for the country: The Company through its operation will be generating increased tax revenueDiversification of the local economy: the Project will enable the Russian economy to diversify further from natural extraction sector by creating more added value products in similar subsectors

title: Diamond Agri JV
content: The developmental impact for the Project includes: (i)Lending to the agribusiness sector: The project will support Diamond Bank to better assess risks associated with agribusiness;(ii)	Access to finance for SMEs: The Project will enable the Bank to ramp up lending to the sector and increase access to finance for SMEs; (iii)Financial Inclusion: The project will generate a range of social and economic benefits, including increased rural incomes and livelihood, and increased food security; and(iv)Demonstration Effect: The Project will demonstrate the economic and social impact of agri-lending to the banking sector.

title: Asahan 1 Hydro Electric Power Plant
content: - Promoting alternative source of renewable energy: The project supports the development of renewable power generation in a frontier region, improving the generation fuel mix using domestic resources and contributing to the reduction of greenhouse gas emission. - Promoting private sector participation in the hydro energy sector: The project supports private sector participation in the infrastructure sector while increasing electricity capacity in the country. - Improving rural income in the frontier region: The project helps promote sustainable economic development in an area with a power shortage.

title: Vorotan Hydros
content: The proposed project''s positive development impact includes: (i) transfer of state-owned hydros to a competent global private power company that will undertake a much-needed rehabilitation investment program, which is expected to improve the operational availability and efficiency of the power plants, helping prevent further degradation and reduction in power generation; (ii) the privatization proceeds will provide budgetary support to the Government of Armenia; (iii) positive climate change impacts through efficiency enhancements, often the least cost option for greenhouse gas abatement.

title: AIICO
content: 1.	Insurance Sector Development: IFC''s support for AIICO will enhance the growth and development of the Nigerian insurance sector, thus improving the sector''s contribution to the Nigerian economy.2.	Entrepreneurship and Employment: IFC''s involvement in the insurance sector through AIICO will promote growth of business activities and employment in Nigeria. AIICO plans to increase its agent count by more than 4000.3.	Social and Financial Stability: Support long-term savings and thereby reduce pressure on public social schemes.  4.	Long-Term Funding Source: IFC''s support for AIICO will also facilitate the generation of long-term funds through the growth of insurance premiums, thereby buttress the country''s nascent capital markets.

title: Global Facility for Women Entrepreneurs
