content: 1) Increasing access to finance to women-owned SMEs, an underserved segment, and supporting job creation through the financing of these women-owned SMEs;2) Mobilization of capital from investors and donors to further demonstrate the commercial viability of investing in women entrepreneurs;3)	Transforming the market through a demonstration effect to encourage FIs in the target markets to scale up lending to the women entrepreneur segment beyond the life of the proposed project;4) Building the capacity of financial institutions to lend more effectively to the women entrepreneur segment;5)	Access to LCY Commercial Longer Tenor Funding for FIs.

title: Synergy Private Equity Fund Limited
content: The Fund is expected to have significant development impact on its investees by- providing them with risk capital coupled with management advice in their expansion plans;- implementing best practice Environmental, Social and Governance at both the Fund and Investees; and- stimulating job creation by supporting fast growing companies.

title: RBI Equity
content: The proposed investment would allow IFC to i) Counter the deleveraging effect by providing the RBI subs with tier 1 capital, ii) enable RBI to continue supporting SME customers, promoting economic activity and job creation in the respective countries, iii) contribute to the banking sector stability by increasing the capital of the emerging markets subsidiaries and iv) have a signaling effect to the market showing support to the banking sector in ECA.

title: CrownPlaza Addis
content: - Provision of modern business infrastructure: As only 3 hotels carry an international brand in Addis Ababa, the Project will increase the availability of hotel rooms of international standards and stimulate competition in the hospitality industry, particularly in the branded segment. -Migration of best practice: The Project will benefit from (i) the transfer by IHG of its extensive global hotel management expertise to the locally recruited staff through training and development; and (b) IFC''s support in implementing international E&S and health & safety standards. -Employment creation: The investment will create significant local direct employment for about 315 people, including approximately 20 percent of female employees, and indirect employment in the supply value chain.- Benefits to local suppliers: The Project will provide business opportunities to the local suppliers during and after project implementation, particularly in the areas of food & beverages supply and the provision of  services (for example, transportation, security services).- Increased tax revenues: The Project will generate tax revenue to the Government of Ethiopia

title: Ayla Networks
content: It is expected that Ayla''s scale up of its software and service offering in China ultimately allow residents to have better control of their home energy use, which studies show leads to reductions of 10%-15%.   Once residents are able to control their plugs, heating & cooling, lighting and appliances via a smartphone app, a consumer will be able to set up rules to control equipment linked to occupancy or temperature (e.g. turn down air conditioning when no one is home unless outside temperature passes 34 degrees Celsius) or other factors.  Early experience in the US with users of the Nest thermostat, which has similar features to the thermostats that Ayla''s connectivity technology will support, has yielded savings.

title: Boulos F&B
content: The Project is expected to have the following impacts: (i) Adoption of new packaging technology with improved food safety benefits. (ii) Direct and indirect employment with the creation of 446 jobs, of which approximately 139 will be to women.(iii) MSME development through development of wholesalers, retailers, distributors. (iv) Tax revenues accruing to Government.

title: Willbes in Haiti
content: The Project also has a solid Development Impact which includes: 1) Higher employment: this project will increase employment opportunities particularly for women; 2) Higher exports: the project will increase the inflows of foreign exchange into the country and fuel economic growth; 33) Improvement of Environmental & Social practices: the project will set a high standard for E&S practices by following IFC''s E&S requirements.

title: Rudine WPP
content: Development impact includes: (i) increasing Croatia''s wind energy capacity by 34.2 MW; (ii) associated displacement of carbon from the country''s substantial thermal generation plants, reduction of pollution and contribution to the effort to combat global warming; (iii) helping Croatia meet EU renewable energy targets; (iv) reducing Croatia''s energy dependance on imports

title: National Cement Company Ltd
content: Employment generation: - the project will create direct and indirect employment;- the project will provide skilled and unskilled jobs during the construction phase;- the project will create temporary jobs during construction;- the project is expected to add permanent jobs at the NCCL facilities; and- the project will create a large number of indirect jobs in the transportation and delivery sectors.Increased local supply chain and consumption of local goods and services:- the project will create new business opportunities in the local economy due to increased demand for the supply of raw materials and delivery services. In particular, it will benefit those small and medium enterprises engaged in transporting the company''s raw materials and products in their own trucks and providing maintenance and general services to the company; and- the communities close to the plant will benefit as they will provide local services and supplies to the plant and its employees.Other benefits to local communities:- the local communities will benefit from the company''s corporate social responsibility initiatives including the development of community infrastructure and the establishment of a scholarship fund.Environmental and social performance: - by complying with IFC''s performance standards and the World Bank Group''s environmental, health and safety (EHS) standards, the company will achieve higher environmental and social standards, which should increase its reputation, reduce the risk of adverse impacts on local communities, and increase the credibility of the private sector with respect to corporate social responsibility.Private sector development:- the success of the project will send a positive signal to other investors considering investments in Kenya; and- the project is expected to set environmental and social standards that can be replicated by other cement producers.

title: Sala Uno
content: Company expanding in a region with rising incidence of eye cataracts:  the current supply fails to deliver a complete and adequate solution at affordable prices.Reducing impact of blindness in the economy:  blindness is the second cause of impairment in Mexico and cataract accounts for 50% of blindness cases.  Eye conditions affect 40% of Mexican adults; SalaUno's potential for social impact is significant. By restoring the sight, people recover, through a relatively simple and inexpensive surgery, their capacity to produce economic value.Reducing geographic and information barriers that prevent patients from restoring their sight.  Currently, 85% of patients treated are from the C and D income groups. Strong demonstration effect in other players of the health sector, by generating competitive pressure to reduce prices, which will ultimately increase social impact.

title: MAS Equity Partners Fund III
content: The Fund is expected to have strong development impact as it will invest in high-growth SMEs and medium size companies which are looking to expand and replicate their successful business models within Colombia and across the Latin American region, therefore having a relevant impact in job creation and so contributing to economic development.

title: CenturySunshine2
content: -	Improve food security: CS supplies fertilizers to farmers in 14 provinces and 2 autonomous regions in China, of which ten are classified as frontier regions by the International Development Association (IDA). The fertilizers help enhance the yield of the farmland and hence address food security issues in China. -	Promote the applications of an environmentally-friendly material: Weight reduction is the most cost effective means to reduce fuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions from the transportation sector. Generally, it has been estimated that for every 10 percent of weight eliminated from a vehicle''s total weight, fuel economy improves by 7 percent. Magnesium alloy is one of the lightest structural materials used in automobiles -- 75 percent lighter than steel and 33 percent lighter than aluminum. The Chinese government encourages the development and application of high-performance magnesium alloys, as stated in its twelfth 5-year plan. -	Employment creation and local linkages: The Project is expected to create approximately 1,000 new job opportunities, of which 600 are in Jilin, a frontier province. The Project is also expected to spur the growth of local supply of goods and services, such as machinery, raw materials, and transportation services.

title: Quantum Terminal
content: -	Help develop critical petroleum products distribution infrastructure in the country that is facing periodic fuel shortages to the lack of affordable petroleum products supply; -	Strengthen private sector participation in the oil products supply chain;-	Reinforce GoG''s deregulation efforts of the petroleum products distribution sector by supporting development of the private sector owned infrastructure and strengthening competitiveness of a leading private sector player.

title: GTLP Extn FIM Bank 2
content: The proposed Project''s development impact is:(i) Channeling liquidity for trade financing in the Sub-Saharan Africa, and the MENA region which is vital to the survival of SMEs, thereby supporting jobs and economic growth in local markets. (ii) Strong demonstration effect by catalyzing other IFIs to support trade finance - a main artery to economic health and recovery in emerging markets and specially in Sub-Saharan Africa where its needed.

title: Multibank Climate Smart and SME
content: The Project is expected to have significant development impacts including: (i)    Enhanced access to finance for SMEs and private companies pursuing SEF investments (including renewable energy project developers): The Project will allow the Bank to provide its clients access to funding with longer maturities enabling them to undertake projects with more appropriate financing structures; (ii)    Positive climate change mitigation: Through the implementation of SEF solutions, Multibank''s activities have a direct impact on lowering greenhouse gas emissions and encouraging efficient management and reuse of scarce resources;(iii)    Financial market development: IFC''s loan will increase the capacity of the local banking sector to finance SEF investments and SMEs; and(iv)    Generate a demonstration effect: The Project is expected to create a demonstration effect for other banks to engage in climate smart / sustainability sector, and further enhance IFC''s development impact in Panama.

title: Bai Tushum Bank
content: 1.	Secure access to finance for underserved segments of the society in an IDA country, more specifically for women entrepreneurs and SMEs in rural areas.2.	Create a demonstration effect for other MFIs in Central Asia to seek efficiency and economy of scale through a transformation into a bank using Bai Tushum''s success as a role model.3.	Develop a positive economic impact by propping up economic growth, improving access to finance in economically and geographically excluded regions, generating new jobs and improving quality of life at the base of the pyramid.4.	Help the Company to reduce its foreign currency exposure, better manage assets and liabilities, and improve its risk profile at a time of limited currency options.

title: NDB Debt Syndication
content: 1. Expanding Access to Finance in a Post-Conflict Frontier Country: Political uncertainty over the last 3 decades had limited the Sri Lankan government''s capacity to support the MSME sector and thereby to allocate crucial resources to boost lagging incomes. The proposed project will help in addressing this constraint by funding the Bank''s operations/expansion and promoting financial inclusion by means of financing of MSMEs.2. Private Sector Development: The proposed Project would facilitate private sector development via access to credit for growing SMEs in Sri Lanka. Given the importance of SMEs in Sri Lanka, the cascading effect of this finance would go a long way in creating employment, reducing poverty and stimulating the economy.

title: China Three Gorges South Asia Investment Limited
content: The project will i) significantly increase Pakistan''s total available power generation capacity by around 17%, to meet more than a third of the current supply deficit, that will in turn contribute to reduction in ongoing prolonged power outages; ii) lay the foundation for private sector participation in development of large scale hydropower projects, leading to 27% increase in power generation from hydropower resources; iii) provide access to electricity to more than 24 million people; iv) utilize indigenous, renewable resources as lower cost alternatives to expensive thermal generation based on imported fuels; v) deliver climate change benefits in terms of increased share of renewable power generation in the overall fuel mix.

title: Izmir tramway
content: By construction and operation of tramways, which represent an efficient and environmentally-friendly alternative to cars, the project aims to create a more functional multi-modal public transportation system, leading to reduction in travel times and contributing in the long run to higher productivity and economic growth in Izmir. By alleviating congestion on the urban road network, the project is also expected to lead to significant environmental and social benefits, including reduction in CO2 emissions, noise and traffic in the City center.

title: Rawbank SME Global Facility
content: (a) Support a systemic bank in an IDA country with extremely low banking sector banking penetration.(b) Increase access to finance for women and SMEs, two strategic priorities for IFC in Africa. (c) Deepen the financial sector through the further deployment of innovative products.

title: Ghana Grid Company Limited
content: The proposed project is expected to help addressing some of the key challenges faced by the power sector in the Country and is expected to have the following development impacts:(a) Reduction in transmission system losses and improvement in quality of power supply to the general populace.(b) Increase of the transmission throughput and ultimately the number of end users served.(c) Generate revenues for the Government of Ghana through taxes.(d) Job creation both directly during the construction period through maintenance requirements and indirectly by improving the growth and competitiveness through an improved reliability of electricity supply.(e) Enable continued implementation of GRIDCo''s large capex plan and associated improved system reliability and capacity.

title: SupplierCard
content: The Project will increase access to finance to MSMEs in Brazil, many of which lack access to loans and financial services. In addition, through this Project, IFC will support an innovative underwriting approach that facilitates lending to this segment, while at the same time reducing funding costs to MSMEs.

title: Anima Equity
content: i. Demonstration effect: Anima is a high quality, well run university system with a professional management team. Through its efforts to turn around struggling institutions, Anima is contributing to the advancement of the sector by demonstrating the value of professional management and financial discipline in the post-secondary education sector in Brazil;ii. Raise quality standards: Strengthening the Company''s position as a leading education company will pressure other institutions to raise the quality of their services in order to remain competitive;iii. Improve access to services: the Company''s plans to expand its network, especially outside Sao Paulo - Rio de Janeiro axis will enhance the country''s education infrastructure and improve access to quality, affordable post-secondary education services for lower income students;iv. Rationalize the market: The expansion of the Company through growing market share and selective acquisitions may help to consolidate the still fragmented education sector, potentially, leading to rationalization and quality improvement in the industry;v. Employ local professionals (teachers and staff);vi. Expand reach of community service activities;vii. Support young entrepreneurs developing an innovative business model for the sector.

title: IMON SL III
content: The Project would have a strong development impact as follows:1)	Increase access to finance for underserved population in Tajikistan, contributing to employment generation, economic growth, and poverty reduction; and2)	Build market confidence for other investors to invest in Tajikistan on a long-term basis.

title: 7 Energy
content: Greater availability of gas is one of the key ingredients for increasing power generation in Nigeria, a country that suffers significantly from lack of electricity and where only about 50% of the population has access to electricity from the grid. The quality of service is generally poor and lack of electricity has put a constraint on the country''s economic growth. There is about 6 GW of existing capacity in Nigeria, of which only about 4.5 GW is operating. The Federal Government of Nigeria''s ambitious sector reforms have recently met some major milestones, amongst which the privatization of 6 Generation Assets (GENCOs) and 10 Distribution Assets (DISCOs), the Transmission Company of Nigeria''s management that has been given to Manitoba Hydro International and the Gas Aggregator that has been created and is operating. Overall, it is estimated that generation capacity will increase to 15 GW in 2020 (mainly thermal). If supplied, gas consumption by the power sector could reach 1.9 Bcf/d in 2015 and 2.6 Bcf/d by 2020. Gas production and transportation is critical to the energy mix, and Nigeria harbors significant gas reserves. Seven Energy''s midstream capacity will be sufficient to supply gas for up to 2,15 GW of power capacity, which represents more than a third of the country''s current capacity. In addition to supplying gas to the Ibom Power Plant (IPP), the Company will directly supply the Calabar National Integrated Power Project (NIPP), a plant with a capacity of about 560 MW. Moreover, IFC funding would also contribute to a planned 2014 project between Seven and an IOC to eliminate approximately 23mmcfd of IOC flared gas. The project will divert the gas to Sevens Uquo gas facility where it will be stripped of liquids and the residual gas blended with Sevens gas, adding to Seven''s gas and liquids steams, in addition to eliminating the flared gas. Finally, the project will generate direct jobs and indirect jobs (through power provided to the grid and to industries including a fertilizer plant in the Akwa Ibom state), as well as government revenues.

title: Abank EE
content: The Project''s development impact is expected to be high, as it generates a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of Sustainable Energy Finance and related investments. Specifically, the Project would: (i)	Further develop sustainable energy investments across all industry sectors; (ii)	 Improve the competitiveness of the Turkish economy by decreasing energy intensity and increasing the number of clean energy projects on the market; (iii) Improve the local as well as the global environment through reduced emissions of GHGs and other conventional pollutants and reduce the country''s dependence on imports of fossil fuels and natural gas;

title: IFC Asia Fund
content: 1. Given that the Fund will co-invest in IFC projects, its development impact will be in line with those of IFC''s investments, which are tracked using IFC''s development outcome tracking systems. Expected development impact to be created includes job creation, financial inclusion and creating access to goods and services. 2. The Fund will further enhance and expand IFC''s development impact by mobilizing additional external capital for high impact investments including investments in frontier countries, and by freeing up economic capital so that IFC can make more investments and thus extend its development reach

title: CDH Fund V
content: IFC's investment in the Fund is expected to have the significant development impact as the Fund will:(i) support strong job creation and preservation in the country;  (ii) help its investees grow sustainably; (iii) support the growth of women-owned and -managed businesses in China.  By investing in women-owned and -managed businesses, the Fund would promote women entrepreneurship and promote gender inclusion in China.

title: Credo Georgia
content: The Project''s development impact is expected to be strong, as the Project would increase access to funding for the underserved micro and small businesses, especially in poor and rural areas. The Project is expected to contribute to economic growth and poverty reduction by helping to create jobs. IFC funding is expected to create demonstration effect by supporting an organization with a dedicated focus of serving the lower end of the market.

title: Ioxus
content: 1. Amid growing calls to reduce carbon emissions worldwide, developing countries like China have become strong advocates of developing a low carbon economy. This project would contribute to development of the clean technology sector in China and assist the government of China to reduce GHG emissions from buses through cost effective and environmentally responsible solutions.2. GHG impact is larger by saving 5-12 percent in 90 percent of cars through mild hybrids than by saving 50 percent in 0.1 percent of cars through EVs.3. This project would enable product transfer to other developing regions, such as Southeast Asia.

title: Tier II Subloan
content: Development impact is expected to be high given that: - By strengthening the capital of a systemic institution, the Project will directly contribute to banking sector stability, while enabling the Bank to increase its activities with hitherto underserved entities both domestic and regional.- IFC would help channel investments from the Country to the surrounding emerging market countries providing impetus to intra-region investments and promoting financial sector integration within the region. - IFC''s significant investment in an innovative instrument would have a positive signaling effect to emerging market investors.

title: BT AMC Subdebt
content: - The Project aims at supporting a well-managed regional bank in Romania through strengthening its capital base. With increased capitalization, the Bank will be able to pursue its growth strategy and maintain its systemic presence.- As micro, small and medium-sized enterprises are a strategic priority for BT, the Project will help improve access to finance for SMEs by providing capital support needed to expand Bank''s operations.

title: Mauricio Equity
content: i. Raise quality standards: Strengthening Mauricio''s position as a leading education company in Northeastern and Northern Brazil will potentially serve as a catalyst for other leading education institutions, especially in those regions, to continue to raise the quality of their services;ii. Improve access to services in frontier regions: Mauricio''s plans to expand its network, particularly in frontier regions, will enhance Brazil''s education infrastructure and improve access to quality, affordable education services for low- and middle-income students. Larger national providers are also expected to follow Mauricio''s regional strategy of expansion in underdeveloped regions, thus further enhancing access to higher education and greater opportunities for employment; iii. Expand reach of community service activities: Mauricio''s expansion in number of enrolled students and into new states of Brazil will allow the Company to provide services to a larger population and a greater range of communities through students'' voluntary professional activities.  Services include legal advice, health care (e.g. dental, medical, and physiotherapy), among others;iv. Create jobs: Mauricio''s expansion plan will benefit the labor market in Brazil''s frontier regions by creating both direct and indirect employment opportunities for local communities in construction and operation of the campuses; andv. Rationalize the market: The expansion of the Company through growing market share and selective acquisitions may help to consolidate the still fragmented education sector, potentially leading to rationalization and quality improvement in the industry.

title: Aurora Gold
content: The expected development impact from this project will include: (i) employment creation of about 700 to 900 jobs; (ii) fiscal payments in the form of royalties and taxes paid to government estimated at US$850 million over the 17 year mine life or US$50 million per year on average (based on US$1,300 per ounce gold); and (iii) setting good benchmarks in environmental and social sustainability for other potential projects in the region.

title: SFCL Senior Loan
content: Access to Finance: Three decades of conflict in the past had limited the Government''s capacity to support MSMEs and thereby to allocate crucial resources to boost lagging incomes. This Project will help address this constraint by funding SFCL''s expansion and promoting financial inclusion by means of financing of MSMEs and women borrowers.Private Sector Development: The Project would facilitate private sector development via access to credit for growing MSMEs in Sri Lanka. Given the importance of MSMEs in Sri Lanka, the cascading effect of this finance would contribute to creating employment, reducing poverty and stimulating the economy.

title: Bayport Zambia
content: - Financial inclusion: increased access to financial services for the low and middle income population in Zambia, including those living in rural areas. Such financial inclusion is expected to be the source of other benefits namely: home improvement, education, small business start-ups/job creation. Other related development impacts expected from the project include: i) contributing to building a domestic capital market, which is a critical ingredient to the financing of the domestic economy; ii) contributing to strengthening the regulated micro-lending space in Zambia as IFC provides needed capital and reinforces the capacity of the sector leader.

title: Abraaj Global Health Fund
content: -Improve access, quality, and affordability of healthcare: Through its investments, the Fund will target improvement in access, quality and affordability of healthcare for low-income and middle-income populations in Africa, South Asia, South East Asia and Latin America - Support innovation: The Fund will allocate part of its commitments to greenfield and scalable new businesses in healthcare. The Fund will professionalize emerging healthcare companies and provide strategic and operational value-addition to improve competitiveness. - Demonstration effect: Through the Fund, the viability of investing in pro-low-income/middle-income healthcare businesses would be demonstrated.

title: Facey Group II
content: The Project is expected to generate the following development impact:- Create direct employment through the growth and regional expansion of the Company''s businesses in the Caribbean and Central American regions, including some of the poorest (IDA) countries;- Support SME Linkages and Inclusive Growth across the Company''s value chain through expansion into new markets, the development of the second open market channel (out of the network retailers), and  the growth of the Global Products Alliance business (distribution of lower value printing equipment through retailers and resellers); - Promote Innovation through the development of new products and technology solutions for its clients;- Enabling medium and large businesses to operate more efficiently by offering business processing, information technology, and document outsourcing;- and finally, support a Jamaican based Group to further expand its footprint in the Caribbean and Central American regions.

title: Societe Industrielle Agroalimentaire S.A.("SIAGRO")
content: Increased availability of affordable quality beverage products for consumers in West Africa.           Increased tax revenue.           Creation of a regional beverage champion.           Demonstration effect for potential new entrants in the beverage sector in the region.           Kirene is distributing its milk to schools thereby promoting nutrition and learning.           Increase stable revenue for farmers in Senegal providing fresh milk to Kirene.

title: ZincOx
content: - Positive Climate Change Impact: The investment will support recovery of resources and creation of valuable raw materials from hazardous waste. - -Furthermore, unlike the traditional method of zinc recovery, the ZincOx process is energy efficient, environmentaly friendly and has a higher recovery rate, with no resudual waste.- Management of waste: EAFD recovery reduces amount of poisonous waste going to landfills, which is a significant benefit, given a major environmental hazard landfills present for health of population. - Job Creation and know-how transfer:  Introduction of waste processing on a commercial scale in multiple countries will result on direct and non-direct employment opportunities.  The expansion of the innovative technology will help promote a concept of viable commercial resource-saving and environmentally friendly business model.

title: Hekangyuan Poultry Breeding
content: Farmers Reached: Currently, about 1,000 rural households are working with the Company as contract farmers for commercial ducks and broilers farming. The Project will increase the number by another 500 rural households.  Food Safety: The Chinese poultry sector is still characterized by poor hygiene standards, inadequate bio-security, and over-use of antibiotics. By investing in Hekangyuan, IFC is supporting a company with a focus on efficiency and food safety and then enhancing its image in the market and setting an example for other similar companies in the industry. Supply Chain Efficiency- the Company is dedicated to the improvement of poultry breeding operation. Its development means the increased supply of high-quality day old ducks and chicks to commercial duck/broiler operations, which enhances the whole supply chain efficiency (better FCR/lower mortality, etc).

title: Investec Africa Private Equity Fund 2
content: The Fund will achieve development impact on its investees by:1) Encouraging economic and financial sector development in viable sectors and companies;2) Supporting a Pan-African emerging fund manager;3) Supporting regional integration through value-building and business models that are scalable regionally and across Africa;4) Ensuring appropriate governance structures are in place and providing hands-on monitoring and guidance to the management of investee companies.

title: MicroCred China RMB Ln
content: Expanding Access to Finance for MSEs: Micro and Small Enterprises ("MSEs") play an important role in creating employment and contributing to local economy particularly in less developed regions. Nevertheless, MSEs are under-served by traditional financial institutions. The expansion of the Companies will help address the issue by increasing credit supply accessible and affordable by MSEs;Supporting Economic Growth in Frontier Regions: Frontier regions in China have experienced much pronounced difficulties in access to finance for MSEs, which hinders the economic growth in these regions. The Companies, operating Sichuan Province which is a frontier region, will expand access to credit in the region, specifically to MSEs, thereby supporting the continued growth of the local economy.

title: AEGEA Equity
content: The Project is expected to increase water and sewerage service coverage in AEGEA''s service area, which is expected to expand throughout Brazil, including frontier regions. This increased coverage leads to positive health impact for the population, especially the poor. Diseases associated with poor sanitation decreased by 34% between 2005 and 2009 in Campo Grande, after AEGEA increased sewage collection and treatment there. This reduction of diseases results in lower absenteeism of students and workers, as well as reduced health expenditures, with substantial positive impact in the economy.The Project will also lead to increase in population that receive water and sanitation services from a private operator and to reduced water losses and energy consumption. Indicators to be tracked will include: (i) total number of individual residential customers receiving new or improved water services; (ii) volume of sewage treated; (iii) volume of freshwater saved (reduced physical water losses); (iv) reduction in water losses (NRW - including commercial losses); and (v) reliability of water services (average hours of service per 24 hour period).

title: Working Capital & Systemic Solutions CIB
content: The project is expected to have the following specific development impacts: (i) increase access to financing for SMEs; (ii) preserve jobs; (iii) support financing of the agribusiness value chain; and (iv) foster competition in Russia''s financial sector dominated by state-owned banks.

title: Helix Lab
content: - Improve quality of medical diagnostic services in the fragmented market. - Increase penetration of medical diagnostic services in underserved markets of the country. - MSME linkages: through the franchise model Helix will create employment opportunities for micro/individual entrepreneurs. - Direct employment including in the regional markets: through the rollout of new laboratories and retail networks Helix will contribute significantly to the job creation.

title: Stora China III
content: - Contribute to the development of Guangxi, an underdeveloped region in China, by creating jobs, improving plantation productivity and processing wood raw material wood into high-value products.- Mitigate climate change through carbon sequestration- Contribute to continuous modernization of pulp & paper industry in China. - Introduction of safe and productive harvesting and silvicultural operations in China- Promote sustainable forest management.- Provide linkage to farmers by supplying high-yield seedlings, plantation establishment knowledge, renting land and sourcing various products and services from farmers. - Contribute to food safety through full product traceability and supply of high quality liquid food packaging materials.

title: Confianza II
content: IFC''s long-term financing is expected to bring high development impact by enhancing Confianza''s capacity to support productive micro enterprises, resulting in higher growth, employment generation and poverty reduction in Peru.

title: VMLA - Mexico
content: 1) Innovation/Demonstration Effect: MVNOs are relatively new in LAC. The business model provides tangible benefits to all participants (i.e., MVNOs, Mobile Network Operators ("MNO"), regulators, and most importantly, the consumer). The MVNO model allows for a deeper penetration of services (i.e., including mobile broadband, etc.) as poorly attended client niches (i.e. youth) obtain a well targeted service offering more aligned to its needs and expectations.2) Broadband / Productivity enhancement: VMM offers a data centric service offering. Broadband directly contributes towards improving productivity. The contributions of broadband connectivity to economic growth, and as a kick-starter of other innovative business models (e-health, e-education, e-commerce, etc.), is widely accepted.3) Infrastructure Sharing: This is a key theme in IFC''s TMT sector strategy. As such, MVNOs operate over existing telecoms infrastructure, thus maximizing efficiency, while increasing competition and reducing prices. The owner of the core infrastructure (i.e., MNOs) also benefits as it revenues increases by selling additional minutes and data wholesale. This is particularly relevant for an operator such as Movistar, whose network in Mexico is not fully utilized.  Also, MVNOs have no substantial infrastructure or facilities, so they are unlikely to create E&S risk.4) Availability, affordability & inclusion of underserved markets: MVNOs contribute to expanding the reach of underserved population segments, lowering the cost and increasing competition in mobile telephony.  This is critical in Mexico, which has one of the least developed telecoms sectors in LAC as a result of a dominant player inhibiting competition and keeping prices very high by regional standards.  MVNOs are fully aligned with the regulator''s objective, particularly after the recently enacted telecoms law (June 2013) which has as main objective to reduce America Movil''s (Telcel) grip on this market.  5) Youth: VMM directly targets the youth segment. Youth in general have a lower purchasing power than other population segments, and thus, a targeted and relevant service offer contributes directly to attending this segment''s needs.

title: Flexituff
content: The Project is expected to enhance employment generation and downward SME linkages in frontier regions in India, including a low income state. It will also increase the availability of the various products manufactured by the Company which contribute towards safe packaging and delivery of food and pharmaceuticals and support to infrastructure.

title: Belarusky Narodny Bank II
content: The project is expected to contribute to private sector development in Belarus through increased small and medium enterprises'' access to finance.

title: Niko
content: The South Asian countries have been experiencing natural gas supply shortages due to growing demand and reduction in domestic gas supply.  Massive blackouts in India have hampered its growth, which is at a decade-low.  From a national security point of view, India plants to double the proportion of gas in its energy mix by 2020 from the current 10% share (coal accounts for 56% of India''s primary energy need and oil 26%), but in the context of declining gas production from domestic fields, meeting this target will prove challenging.  Hoping to boost its natural gas supply and help fix the country''s chronic power shortages, India recently doubled the gas prices from April 2014 onward to around $8.40/mmbtu.  In Bangladesh, gas shortage stands around 500-600 mmcfpd, which results in 600 - 1200 MW of load-shedding, a situation which deteriorates during irrigation seasons, when the demand-supply gap reaches up to 1500 MW. In addition, with 6% of the entire population having access to natural gas and 49% connected to the power grid, most Bangladeshi households in rural areas (99%) as well as urban areas (66%) use biomass for cooking, and the inefficient and poorly ventilated clay stoves have caused 46,000 women and children die each year as a direct result of exposure to indoor air pollution, while many more suffer from respiratory diseases. The proposed investment will support an important junior E&P player in the region in their effort to develop and produce natural gas to meet the growing demand in the region.  The successful implementation of the plan will have a positive and lasting impact on the Company''s culture and way of doing business. The project is expected to (i) support the development of natural gas resources in South Asia as a cleaner primary source of fuel to replace coal, oil and biomass, (ii) support the restructuring of one of the few junior E&P companies with a focus on South and Southeast Asia and improve performance in E&S and operations, (iii) help promote and integrate cleaner and more sustainable environmental practices in the region, and, (iv) contribute to increased fiscal revenues for the host governments.

title: ACLEDA loan 2013
content: (i) Improve access to finance for microfinance and SME clients in Cambodia. (ii) Improve market confidence by demonstrating IFC''s continuing support to the development of the Cambodian financial sector.

title: De Novo Cloud
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impact:Private Sector Development: 1) the project supports the growth of an innovative successful local IT company; 2) the provision of cloud services in Russia will allow De Novo''s customers to reduce capex and operational costs freeing up cash to invest in their core business; and 3) IFC''s financing will help De Novo expand quicker in local and regional markets, as well as in high growth IT sub-sectors such as cloud services.Employment generation: New high-income jobs will be created due to the implementation of this project.

title: IMC Ukraine
content: The proposed investment will: (i) support a viable economic activity and help secure employment in frontier rural areas of Chernigiv, Sumy and Poltava regions; (ii) contribute to food security by increasing production of grains and oil crops; and (iii) contribute to private sector development through promotion of best practice in farming.

title: Tiryaki II
content: - Supply Chain Linkages & Access to Farmers: Tiryaki sources directly from more than 2,850 farmers (all of whom are MSMEs) in Turkey, providing them seeds and pre-financing in the process excluding 30-40 wholesalers who have supply linkages with individual farmers. - Supporting a Regional Player: The Project will improve competitiveness of the Company as well as underline its market position in Turkey which has substantional room for competition.- Job Preservation and Tax Revenues for the Governments: Given that agribusiness is a strategic sector for Turkey, accounting for 25% of employment, the Project will help the sector to preserve the job while increasing tax revenues to the Government on the back of improved supply chain linkages as well as sound operations of the Company.

title: Intermed
content: (i)	Health outcomes: The Hospital will be the first in Mongolia operated to international best practice and is expected to provide health services to over 100,000 patients.(ii)	Import substitution: The Hospital will provide services to patients in Mongolia who typically travel abroad for health care. (iii)	Employment Creation: The Project is expected to create around 300 new job opportunities in Ulaanbaatar.

title: Grooming MF Loan
content: 1) The project will provide long-term access to finance for microenterprises, including low-cost savings services, which will have positive effects on income generation, employment and growth in Nigeria.2) Grooming''s focus on rural/peri-urban areas will reach excluded low-income populations - who are mainly women - which other financial institutions, including most MFIs, struggle to reach sustainably.3) By supporting Grooming Centre, the project will further encourage the formalization and regulation of microfinance in Nigeria.

title: SL Myanmar
content: (i) Construction of critical business infrastructure: The Project will add much-needed supply of international standard hospitality infrastructure to Yangon. International standard business infrastructure such as these are of critical importance in driving foreign investments in the country.(ii) Improvement of hotel service standards: The Project will improve the standards of accommodation facilities and services available to travelers and the business community. While Shangri-La''s extensive training and high operating standards will assure guests of a high-quality product, it will also encourage broad improvements in the standards of existing hotels.(iii) Employment creation and knowledge transfer: The Project will create a significant number of direct and indirect employment opportunities for the local community both during construction and operational phases. It will also promote the transfer of hotel management expertise and knowledge to the local staff.(iv) Benefits to the local economy and local linkages: The Project will help create demand for locally-sourced materials, services, and labor both during the construction and operation stages. The Project is expected to generate additional sales for local small and medium enterprises, including a wide range of goods and service providers.(v) Increase in tax revenues and foreign exchange: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange inflow, particularly as it is expected that a significant portion of the users (hotel guests and apartment lessees) will be foreign nationals and that the majority of Project revenues will be paid in foreign currency.(vi) Private sector development: The presence of these large scale developments in Yangon will send a positive signal about Myanmar, particularly to other foreign investors who are considering investments in the country.

title: Virgin Mobile Central & Eastern Europe
content: 1) Greater availability, affordability & accessibility of mobile services: VMCEE and (Mobile Virtual Network Operator -"MVNOs" in general) contribute toward lowering the cost and increasing competition in mobile telephony. VMCEE''s data centric product offering will support further expansion of mobile broadband, targeting underserved niche markets by traditional Mobile Network Operators ("MNOs") such as lower income population in rural areas and the youth market with limited purchasing power. 2) Improved productivity through broadband connectivity: VMCEE''s data centric offering contributes to improved productivity through greater broadband connectivity. The broadband connectivity is widely recognized to be a catalyst for innovative business models such as e-health, e-education, e-commerce, etc, directly contributing to economic growth. 3) Increase competition and maximize efficiency:  VMCEE will operate over existing telecoms infrastructure, allowing MNOs owner of the core infrastructure to sell excess minutes and data usage, thus maximizing efficiency and increasing price competition through improved cost structure. The MNOs owner of the core infrastructure benefits by selling additional minutes and data wholesale.  VMCEE (and MVNOs generally) are fully aligned with the regulator''s objective of increasing competition in the target markets.    4) Job creation for youth: VMCEE will operates through extensive networks of SME dealers, distributors and franchises, thus creating job opportunities especially for young and skilled labor force who are attracted to the Virgin brand and the associated brand image.

title: Mriya IV
content: IFC''s financing will contribute to the development of a large-scale modern farming operation which will improve land productivity and have a demonstration impact on other neighboring farms. Mriya''s land and operations are located in Western Ukraine in the Ternopil, Ivano-Frankivsk, Lviv, Chernivtsi and Khmelnitsky regions. These four regions are amongst the poorest regions in the country. Development impact of the project will be as follows:Employment: Mriya''s investment program and the additional permanent and seasonal employment positions created by Mriya will make a significant contribution to the emergence of economic opportunities for the population in the regions that Mriya operates in. In addition to creating new jobs, Mriya is setting new employment standards in the region by providing benefits to its farm workers such food and housing.Environmental and Social Standards: As part of the Environmental and Social Action Plan (ESAP), Mriya will implement an ESMS to further enhance its environmental and social management.Private Sector Development: Mriya sells its products to a diversified base of final customers and traders. Among them, there currently are about  50 MSME distributors of mainly potatoes and corn, for final sales on the domestic market and 110 trasporters to deliver the grains and crops to the port for export.

title: BDF Sub-Debt
content: Increase banking penetration and access to financial services: Nicaragua''s private sector credit to GDP ratio is below the regional average and declining. Support for a local bank and leader in housing finance to expand lending will allow for increased access to credit.Growth of SME sector: Increased access to funding to underserved SMEs in Nicaragua will allow them to expand and improve operations.Employment generation: SME is a large employment generator in Nicaragua and increased access to credit will translate into larger production scales requiring more workers.

title: Palestine Growth Capital Fund
content: 1) Job creation: SMEs are the major sources of employment in West Bank and Gaza. Through the Fund's investment in SMEs, much needed growth capital will be injected into the system to foster employment creation.2) Access to finance: The Fund will provide long term risk capital, which is very difficult for the local SMEs to obtain.3) Introducing new sources of finance: Establishment of funds in the region introduces additional and complementary sources of financing to the financial markets which are largely dominated by banks.4) Promoting sustainable growth: The Fund will play an active role in strengthening the SME's governance and transparency. Through hands-on involvement, operating efficiencies of the portfolio companies will be improved, thus promoting growth and sustainability.

title: Davivienda El Salvador
content: The proposed investment is expected to have the following Development Impact:(i) Increase banking penetration and access to credit to underserved SMEs and individuals;(ii) Increase employment generation since SMEs are the main drivers of employment; iii) The Bank''s climate smart activities will have a direct impact in lowering greenhouse emissions and encouraging efficient management and re-use of scarce resources; and (iv) Demonstration effect with other banks replicating this type of funding.

title: El Dovio
content: Generally, exploration projects have limited development impact but even at this early stage, the proposed investment has shown tangible benefits to the surrounding communities by generating local employment for people in poor parts of western Colombia. The project is also expected to help underline the imporatnce of invigorating the mining sector in Colombia. Expected development impacts during the production phase will include:(i) Local economic develoment in a poor part of Colombia through the generation of direct and indirect employment opportunities.(ii) Fiscal receipts in the form of taxes, royalties, foreign exchange and diversification of the domestic economy.(iii) Community investment programs / possible AS interventions.

title: Central America Mezzanine Infrastructure Fund II
content: Reduce Infrastructure Bottlenecks: Fund will provide capital for infrastructure projects which will contribute to the competitiveness of the target region and will help eliminate critical infrastructure bottlenecks that limit growth and job creation.Economic and Private Sector Development: Fund will provide quasi-equity and equity capital to help promote growth and job creation in local communities.Demonstration Effects: Fund will strengthen investees from a financial and governance perspective and help them scale up their operations, thus making them more attractive targets for further investment. This will help to demonstrate the business case for private infrastructure projects and encourage more private investors to enter the sector in the target region.

title: BoG Subdebt
content: The key development objective of this project is to increase financial inclusion in Georgia. The project is designed to improve access to finance for the underserved segment of SMEs in Georgia by providing capital support needed by Bank of Georgia to expand their lending operations.

title: CLN South Africa
content: - Job Creation: The Project will create and sustain a total of 250 positions of direct employment, with nearly half of the jobs located in Eastern Cape, a frontier region and South Africa poorest province. - Support Auto Sector Development & Localization: By helping CLN achieve greater scale in South Africa to serve more OEM clients, the Project is contributing to the localization efforts of the automotive sector development goals in South Africa.- Training: The Company provided training to 450 employees in 2013, and will continue to provide annual internal and external training that contribute to skill and career development.

title: Yes Bank II
content: Access to finance: MSMEs are a critical segment of the economy contributing 17% of GDP and responsible for 47% of total workforce in the Indian economy. At a time when most banks move to larger/safer credits, IFC''s dedicated MSME line will enable YES Bank to continue its program of reaching incremental MSMEs and agri customers. IFC''s credit line will deepen the partnership in this important market segment, enabling YES Bank to utilize its growing, high quality networks and execution capabilities to serve these high priority customers, which IFC cannot reach on its own. In addition, IFC funding will add the much needed resources to YES Bank''s MSME lending program enabling significant additional numbers of MSME and agri customers to be served.Expanding Network:  YES Bank plans to grow its branch network from the present 500 branches to 600 branches in FY14 and 750 branches in FY15. A part of the expansion will be in the low income states, and the expansion will primarily focus on increasing the Bank''s MSME, agri and retail franchise, in order to diversify its client base and increase savings mobilization.

title: Nadezhda LPG
content: -Development of Ukraine''s infrastructure based on modern and safe standards.-Supporting the expansion of the distribution infrastructure for liquified petroleum gas, which is a "cleaner" fuel.-Employment creation / preservation: The investment is expected to create 238 new, permanent jobs.

title: Project Leo
content: (i) Financial inclusion: the project will help broaden access to credit for low income populations that could not have formal access to credit otherwise.  Bringing these under-served populations into the formal banking system has the following benefits: i) better cost of credit compared to informal money lenders; ii) customer protection through the regulatory framework, and iii) a credit history useful for future credit requests.(ii) Housing Improvement and Education: about 50% of the loans granted by ABIL are used for home improvement and education. In a post-apartheid context, improved housing and education are critical for South Africa, as they contribute to the integration and empowerment of previously disadvantaged populations.

title: Thien Minh II
content: Demonstration effect: The Project will have a significant demonstration effect by establishing viability of green buildings in Vietnam. TMG is committed to having a number of its projects meet IFC''s Green Building Standards, thereby demonstrating that it is possible to adopt energy and water conservation measures in the hotel sector.Improve tourism infrastructure: The use of proceeds will primarily be used for the development of three and four star hotels, which will increase much needed supply for hotel rooms in this category, thereby increasing private sector lead improvements in the tourist infrastructure. Employment creation and local linkage: The Project will create a number of direct and indirect jobs, as well as demand for locally sourced materials, services and labour, for the local economy.Foreign exchange and tax generation: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange inflow, as a significant of TMG''s hotel guests are foreign nationals.

title: Muyuan Loan 2
content: Employment: The Company''s operations are located in western Henan Province - a frontier region in China. It provides stable employment opportunities for around 1200 staff, including 400 female employees.Farmers reached: Currently, about 24,000 rural households supply the Company with raw materials such as corn, barley and silage.SMEs reached: The Company sells its breeds to about 1,200 rural pig farms for further fattening for sale to market.Food Safety: The Chinese hog sector is still very fragmented, leading to poor hygiene standards, inadequate bio-security, poor nutrition, and over-use of antibiotics. By creating a larger enterprise with greater focus on efficiency and food safety, the Company supports the improvement of breeding techniques, quality standards as well as the production efficiency of the industry.Renewable energy/waste management practices: The Company''s on-going project to collect and treat the waste from farms to generate electricity for the farms contributes to reducing GHG emissions.Frontier region development: The Project will help the development of Hubei, a frontier province ranking 13th in China in terms of GDP per capita.

title: Banco Caixa Geral - Brasil SEF
content: - Positive climate change mitigation: through climate smart financing, Banco Caixa Geral - Brasil''s activities will have a direct impact in lowering greenhouse emissions and encouraging efficient management and re-use of scarce resources. - Financial market development: through enabling Banco Caixa Geral - Brasil to provide financing on terms that are appropriate to climate smart investments, these investments will be mainstreamed within the bank, and in turn through demonstration to the wider Brazilian financial market on the market potential for climate-focused products.

title: Sisecam Bond
content:
The main development benefits of the proposed investment derive from supporting Sisecam''s US$1.5 billion capital expenditures program in 2013 - 2014. Sisecam is one of the main industrial groups in Turkey and in the region. It has a proven track record as a successful long-term investor, generating employment and fiscal revenues, and transferring industrial know-how to many countries in which it established its presence. This investment program will generate significant development impact for the countries in which Sisecam will invest and is critically important as it comes at a time when FDI in the region has slowed down, many investors remain on the sidelines and there is an increased need to generate stable employment opportunities, particularly in the manufacturing industry.Sisecam has issued a Eurobond which has been internationally rated (BB+ by S&P and Ba1 by Moody''s, the bond has the same rating as Sisecam Corporate rating). The transaction has a strong demonstration impact for other Turkish companies which are considering accessing the international bond markets, an important step in reducing the country''s dependence on short-term flows and mobilizing the large amounts of long-term capital needed to sustain its development. At the company level, the Eurobond issue will help Sisecam achieve larger economies of scale and broader geographical diversification, enhancing Sisecam''s competitive market position in the global glass industry.Update related to additional investment under the COVID-19 response facility:   The Project will (i) contribute to the post-COVID-19
recovery especially through increased economic activity, and also (ii) promote
resilience by contributing to supply chain continuity  across various key
industries (e.g., automotive, construction, food & beverages) in which
Sisecam Group's products are utilized.

title: Bridge International Academies
content: 1. Access to basic education: Bridge aims to provide access to education for 3.5 million students from low-income backgrounds by 2020.2. Promoting affordability: Bridge provides quality education for a significantly lower cost than alternative low cost private schools and government schools.3. Improving quality and accountability: Bridge has a team of specialized content developers that develop high quality content based on the national curriculum. Independent studies on the quality of Bridge education show between 25% to 205% improvement in Bridge students' literacy and numeracy over their peers in government schools and other low cost schools . The use of technology and automation has allowed Bridge to enforce accountability at all level of the organization, particularly ensuring teacher attendance which is a large problem in the Company's target markets. 4. Job creation: The Company aims to create 57,000 teaching jobs by 2020. A majority of these jobs will be filled by youth in the 24-35 year age group recruited and trained as teachers. Additionally the Company will hire individuals for the ancilliary services it intends to provide such as lunch catering services.5. Demonstration effect: The education sector for the low income market is fragmented which results in inconsistent quality and higher costs. The Company will act as a consolidator in the sector and if successful will attract other companies to employ similar strategies, thereby improving quality and reducing costs of primary education in emerging markets.6. Improved nutrition for students: The Company aims to introduce lunch meals at school and will provide students with affordable, nutritious meals.

title: FDC II
content: -Scaling up microfinance: The project will enhance FDC''s ability to support the members of the system in expanding access to financial products and services for low-income households.-Investments in Micro, Small and Medium enterprises: Through the provision of greater funding lines for the Member Institutions, they will expand their lending to El Salvadorean businesses, stimulating investment,  business activity and the creation of new jobs,  particularly  in less developed regions of the country that are significantly under-served by the financial sector.-Support the integration of Micro and Small Enterprises into the formal sector, as access to credit is one of the principal stimuli for these businesses to move out of informality.-Support investments in the agri-business value chain through the funding of member cooperative institutions which target rural lending.

title: BICE RE
content: -	The Project will foster the creation of new RE sources that have a low environmental impact (solar, wind, small-hydro and geo-thermal) with lower GHG emissions than conventional sources.-	BICE's geographical reach and sector knowledge in RE will allow the financing of smaller projects which will foster the development of local economies.-	Financing for additional energy sources will help mitigate the energy shortage and improve energy self-sufficiency in Chile, compensating surging energy prices.

title: Gaja II
content: 1. Supporting SMEs: Fund will invest in SMEs which are highly capital constrained with limited access to bank debt or capital markets to finance their growth strategies2. Economic growth and job creation: Fund will invest in high-growth companies that will create new employment opportunities at a higher rate than national average, thereby contributing to economic development and employment3. Private sector development: Fund will provide value-add to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance and transparency, while providing operational and financial expertise, support in evaluating new business opportunities and building business partnerships4. Incorporating IFC's E&S standards: Applying international best ESG practices at the Fund and investee level will contribute to sustainable economic development

title: Banque Internationale pour le Commerce et l'Industrie de la Guinee
content: This project is expected to have significant development impact by:i)	Promoting lending to viable SMEs in a fragile, post conflict environment where access to finance is difficult;ii)	Supporting  local entrepreneurs, in particular SMEs, which are important contributors to job creation.;iii)    Helping to improve the E&S assessment and mitigation management system of a leading bank in the country.

title: TeamNet Romania
content: IFC''s investment is consistent with the World Bank 2012-15 ICT strategy and will help to: (i)  expand the local IT markets'' (ii)  provide quality employment; and (iii) promote affordable IT solutions to help large public and private organizations as well as  SMEs run more efficiently.

title: Timisoara Muni
content: The Municipality''s priority Investment Program includes several highly developmental projects addressing a range of key sectors and development ojectives: - District Heating: Significant energy savings and reductions in GHG through the rehabilitation of the district heating system. - Transport & Urban rehabilitation: Increased safety for the local population through the rehabilitation of roads. Increased efficiency, standards and comfort of the transport network through the modernization of intermodal stations and improvement of traffic management. Reduced emissions through rehabilitation of roads and expansion of public transport.  - Other: Improvements in a range of social infrastructure projects, including health and social services, and funding for regional SME support programs.

title: Logo
content: -     Improved private-sector efficiency: Software development and IT services play an increasingly important role in supporting domestic growth and efficiency. ERP software solutions, such as the ones developed by Logo, are changing the manner in which businesses operate making them more efficient by enabling them to automate functions, analyze historical trends, make effective forecasts and create added value. -     Improving SME Business Practices: Whereas international players like SAP, Oracle and Microsoft have a strong presence with large enterprises Logo has focused on the SME segment. It provides them with ERP solutions, at reasonable prices, that result in improvements in their business practices in areas such as accounting, internal controls and financial reporting. Because of its high penetration rate amongst SMEs, Logo is the largest ERP vendor in Turkey, in terms of total number of subscribers, and by expanding its product offering, this project will enable the Company to reach a wider spectrum of Turkish companies. The wider adoption of ERP solutions by SMEs will help improve compliance with the requirements of Turkish commercial, labor and tax laws, and support the Government''s effort to grow the formal economy.   -     Employment: The IT sector creates employment for highly skilled staff. Logo offers graduates the opportunity to apply their training in the development and support of ERP software both directly and through its business partners in Logo''s eco-system. Logo grooms these business partners through training and structured programs such as the Logosphere conferences.

title: Capital Indigo
content: Mexico's middle class (about 40% of the population) is expected to double by 2025 (Bain 2013 PE in Mexico Report) and 17% of the population has moved into the middle class in one decade (World Bank).  The Fund is expected to contribute to the growth of SME companies that offer services and products for Mexico's emerging middle class and low income populations. The Fund will invest in 8-10 SMEs positioned in critical sectors that target these groups: education, health and the green sector. Private equity activity that supports mid-cap and large companies in Mexico has grown. The country has low private equity penetration compared to its peers in Latin America, particularly in the high growth SME space. Less than 5% of capital available for private equity focuses on growth SME with a ticket of less than $10 million. The Fund will support the growth and professionalization of SMEs and entrepreneurs by providing equity capital and management advice, improving environmental and social standards and mobilizing co-investments. The Fund's potential demonstration effect is high: successful fundraising and strong fund performance will send a positive signal to equity investors to consider mid-range investments in SME growth funds that will create new sustainable jobs, thereby contributing to economic development and employment. IFC will measure and report on the following developmental impact indicators: i) percentage of funding disbursed; ii) net/gross financial returns; iii) number of jobs created; iv) annual growth sales; v) annual growth in EBITDA; and vi) launching follow-on funds, to mention a few DOTS indicators.

title: Mersin Port
content: The proposed Project will help facilitate trade between the expansive hinterland of South-Eastern Turkey, the Mediterranean and the rest of the world by expanding MIP''s modern, efficient port operation. The Company''s proposed capital expenditure program will allow shipping lines to deploy larger container vessels, and therefore lower per TEU costs, benefiting shippers, shipping lines and consumers.  This would facilitate trade and assist in the continued economic development of the hinterland served by the port. The proposed capital expenditure program will also generate additional tax revenues for the Government of Turkey, as a result of increased revenues of MIP.  -	Demonstration Effect: MIP is proposing to issue the first project bond issued by a Turkish infrastructure company. The proposed transaction will have a significant demonstration effect, encouraging other Turkish infrastructure corporates to consider accessing international bond markets, which would be an important step in the development of a new source of financing for infrastructure projects. The Eurobond issue will allow MIP to maintain its leading position as a port by providing the financing to expand its capacity and deepen the draft of the facility. -	Contribute to the development of the Turkish port sector: MIP''s continued success will enhance competition and increase the available container capacity on Turkey''s Mediterranean coastline. The expected increased container traffic and local cargo will enhance linkages with local businesses involved in transportation, warehousing, logistics, etc., many of which are small and medium size enterprises.

title: Sinofarm
content: - Sustainability and Standards: By investing in Sinofarm, IFC will be supporting a Company with a keen desire to contribute to the sustainable rural development and adopt higher food safety/quality standards. - Support rural livelihood: The Project will source corn for feed from a large number of local farmers, providing a stable source of income for rural farmers. - Employment: The Project will created jobs by promoting standardized and large-scale dairy farming with modern technology. IFC''s investment has strong impact on livelihoods in the rural economies of the frontier region.

title: MD Radiation
content: - The Project would enhance the Sponsor''s ability to further expand in a region with rising incidence of cancer. IFC''s investment addresses the low installed capacity issue contributing to modern oncology infrastructure in markets where some service providers operate old technology, lacking accuracy and effectiveness. - Medical Developers is expected to support the development of technically-qualified staff through training, careful management, regional cooperation and long-term planning. - The Project would also serve to promote higher standards in cancer care with demonstration and spillover effects in the private and public sectors. - The Project will improve local access to specialized treatments previously inaccessible or available only in developed markets.

title: Sesame MSME Financing Package
content: - Increase financial inclusion and access to finance for large underserved markets segments: IFC''s funding support will help the Companies to grow its lending business and increase access to finance for MSMEs.  - Facilitation of global trade and RMB internationalization: IFC will support the Companies to expand business into other markets, and build it into a platform that can provide branchless banking to global MSMEs and can channel capital not only within China but also away from China to finance MSMEs in other emerging markets.- Demonstration Effects of Introducing a New Business Model:  this will be the first large-scale use of "big data" to successfully reach millions of unserved and underserved MSMEs in China and in emerging markets generally.  The success of the Companies will have extensive demonstration effects across emerging markets.

title: MovilRed
content: Facilitation of electronic payments: The expansion of MovilRed''s network financed by IFC will create an important part of the infrastructure required to convert cash into electronic payments and for the acceptance of electronic payments. Making payments electronically rather than in cash has shown to generate greater efficiency that is estimated to reach up to 3% of GDP of developing country economies. Financial Inclusion: MovilRed will make a significant contribution to increase the availability of financial services in Colombia. The company has over five times more points of sale than there are bank branches in Colombia. IFC''s investment will enable the company to leverage this retail network to provide basic financial services ranging from deposits and domestic remittances to simple payment services to the large underbanked population in Colombia.Internet Access for SMEs: MovilRed has entered into an agreement with a major PC manufacturer and an ISP to provide PCs and Internet to small retailers. The Colombian government is supporting this activity with grant funding.

title: Acuagranjas Exp.
content: 1)	Job creation: Chiapas province is one of the poorest provinces in Mexico with limited supply of full-time employment opportunities.  To date, the Company has created approximately 1,000 jobs and will generate at least 1,000 additional direct jobs.2)	Outreach: about 40 local fishermen from the local communities have seen their income and skills significantly improved as the Company assisted them in developing their own fish farms with annual production of up to 40 MT per annum for the larger farmers. Over 300 additional local fishermen will benefit from similar arrangements in Lake Malpaso.3)	Health and education infrastructure: as a result of the Project, more families will have access to health and education support provided by the Company.

title: RCBC Short Term
content: 1.	Increased access to finance is indispensable to grow the competitiveness of SMEs. By directly financing the medium term US$ liquidity needs of local banks to support SME foreign currency requirements, the facility will support SMEs and will have a positive impact on economic activity in the country.2.	Continuing to contribute to the strengthening of environmental and social management practices in the country''s banking system.

title: Enel Wind Brazil
content: The Project fits with the WBG strategy of supporting greater private sector participation in Brazil''s power sector as a means to improve its efficiency and long-term sustainable development. The Project will contribute to the development of wind energy in Brazil, which is needed to meet growing power demand, while at the same time reducing reliance on thermal energy and large hydro generation. The Project will also help the development of the poorer Northeast region of Brazil by installing 342 MW of power generation capacity in this region, contributing to job creation and climate change mitigation.

title: APM TEC II
content: The Project will contribute to the development of the Port of Lazaro Cardenas, the fastest growing port in Mexico and one of the major ports of the country. The Project will increase Mexico''s competitiveness and indirectly drive trade growth by increasing container cargo capacity and improving efficiency levels to better serve exports and imports. The Project will help improve efficiency and productivity as well as increasing competition, benefitting shippers, shipping lines and consumers alike. As the first partially automated container terminal in Latin America, the Terminal would also introduce new technology and provide knowledge transfer to Mexico and Latin America as a whole. Finally, the Project will increase royalties and tax payments for the Port of Lazaro Cardenas and the Government of Mexico.

title: Chipita Turkey
content: - Job creation: The Company will create 172 positions of direct employment. In addition, it would help third-party service and product suppliers increase their employment. - Increased tax revenues: The project is expected to generate EUR 6.7 million corporate taxes over the first 7 years of operations. In addition, it will generate other forms of tax revenues for the Government (e.g. VAT payments and social security contributions for employees).- Foreign direct investment: Although FDI figures are relatively high in Turkey, it takes mostly the form of acquisitions/privatization, and investments in green-field production plants are relatively low.

title: Kibo Fund II
content: The Fund is expected to have significant development impact on its investees by (i) providing them with finance and strategic advice in their growth and expansion plans; (ii) stimulating job creation by supporting fast growing companies; and (iii) implementing best practice E&S and Governance at both the Fund and investees.

title: Adjaristsqali Georgia LLC
content: 1. Increase Georgia''s RE output, serving both the local market and Turkey. The project will provide 61 GWh power to Georgia for the first 10 years of operations while the 372 GWh will  be exported to Turkey.2. Reduced GHG emissions of 222,379 tons p.a for 45 years of operations3. Influence Georgia''s ability to attract foreign investments in the hydro sector and help position Georgia as a emerging market destination for hydro investments4. Contribute to private sector investments in Georgia and attract investors and support South- South investment

title: President Energy
content: Although oil and gas exploration activities started in Paraguay in late 1940s, a number of factors have limited  the intensity of such activities, resulting in Paraguay to still be a non- oil and gas producing country. Generally, the development impact of exploration projects is more limited than for full field developments, but even at this early stage, the proposed investment is expected to generate benefits to surrounding communities. Moreover, by supporting President Energy''s exploration activities in Paraguay, IFC is contributing to develop the hydrocarbon potential in the country and, if the Company  is successful in its exploration activities, IFC expects exploration success to (i) reduce the country''s dependency on hydrocarbons imports, (ii) create a new source for royalties and tax revenues; and, (iii) create local employment and business opportunities along the value chain (production, transportation, distribution, maintenance and general services); and (iv) attract more investments in the hydrocarbon sector.

title: KICB MSME2
