content: (i)    Increase access to finance for SMEs in the country through longer tenor products and trade finance instruments.(ii)	Stimulate growth in underdeveloped markets, support economic recovery through job creation by SMEs in an IDA country.(iii)	Support KICB''s efforts to diversify and increase the volume of their funding base and to better manage their assets and liabilities.(iv)	Support the development of trade finance sector in Kyrgyz Republic.

title: GNG Syndicate
content: -Development of Ukraine''s infrastructure based on modern and safe standards.-Access to high-quality petroleum products and services.-Employment creation / preservation: The investment is expected to create 380 to 480 new, permanent jobs.-Development of local suppliers: Convenience stores, automotive services and fast-food help local economies because such services at stations are primarily locally supplied.-Support of cleaner fuel types: GNG offers liquified petroleum gas (LPG) in many of its filling stations, and the new stations will also offer this cleaner fuel alternative.

title: Jabi Lake Mall
content: The Project is expected to have the following impacts: -  Provision of critical business infrastructure that is currently significantly undersupplied in Africa''s second largest market and most populous nation.-  Provision of a growth platform for local SMEs (manufacturers and wholesalers) in the retail value chain (owners of stores within mall) to gain access to customers and increase their sales.-  Improvement of food security as a result of increased distribution outlets for local farmers leading to increased demand for local products (fresh produce in particular, but also locally processed foods).  -  Improvement in hygiene, health and safety standards in the food retail sector.-  Serve as a catalyst for urban development in the area around the new mall. Development of better aesthetic environments and strong demonstration effect in improving commercial property standards across Nigeria.-  Creation of direct and indirect employment during construction and operations.-  Generation of tax revenues for the government.-  Transfer of operational and environmental & social best practices, both during construction and operations

title: ACWA Equity
content: The project is expected to have the following development benefits: (i) by supporting the significant scaling-up of renewable energy projects in the company''s markets, help mitigate climate change impacts; (ii) increase power generation and desalination services to meet growing power and water demand in the MENA region and in other emerging countries; (iii) support South-South foreign direct investments to promote economic growth and development in non-GCC developing countries; and (iv) generate direct and indirect employment opportunities through the greenfield projects developed by the company.

title: Cimko Cement II
content: Benefits to the employees: The IFC investment will increase the competitiveness of Cimko and preserve employment in Southeast Anatolia, least developed region in Turkey. Increased exports: By improving its competitiveness, the Company is expected to export more of its products regionally.Energy efficiency: Investment program, which is designed to improve energy efficiency, will enable the Company to have sizeable energy savings.

title: NBD SME Loan2013
content: The Project is expected to have a significant development impact as it would enhance NBD''s ability to lend to SMEs. The Project would enable the Company to offer a wider range of financing instruments to underserved SMEs, and encourage the Company to continue developing its SME lending with matched funding that would be available with IFC''s proposed loan. Long-term financing is crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector across the country that would result in improved economic development and improved living conditions. As NBD operates in the regions considered frontier by IFC definition, the Project will be aimed at providing access to finance to the most financially underserved Russian markets.

title: ABN MF Bank Loan
content: (i)The project will enable AB MFB to grow its loan book by an additional 3,000 loans and is expected to result in an IDG count of approximately 10,000, excluding the IDG count resulting from the rights issue in November 2012;(ii)The project will also strengthen the ability of AB MFB to grow its balance sheet, transform into a national microfinance bank and position itself as one of the role models in the microfinance sector in Nigeria. (iii)IFC''s partnership with AB MFB will support its transformation from a local operator to a national operator, which will diversify its operations and strengthen its competitive advantage over other players that operate only in Lagos ;(iv)The project will indirectly create jobs by enhancing the ability of small businesses to survive, expand and provide employment opportunities ;(v)Strong demonstration effect by encouraging other FIs, especially local banks, to extend financing to the microfinance sector and thus assist in bridging the financing gap in the market ; and(vi)Potentially create positive spill-over in the microfinance sector by supporting a strong partner with good risk management and corporate governance practices.

title: Azura Edo IPP
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impact:- Demonstration effect: supporting a pioneering IPP under the umbrella on-going sector reforms in Nigeria. This is expected to set a precedent for future IPPs not only the country but the region; - Access to energy: the project will help avert load-shedding in a country where only 20% of the electricity demand is estimated to be satisfied by the grid;- Reduction in reliance on diesel generators: private enterprises are currently suffering from expensive and environmentally unfriendly diesel generators; - Reduction in electricity costs: gas offers a lower cost option to power the country;- Viability of the gas sector: the Project will contribute to supporting gas producers, ensuring maximum utilization of gas to fuel power generation and reducing of gas flaring in the country. - Economic and Fiscal benefits: the country will also benefit from taxes from the Project and from the increased economic activity brought about by additional power supply.

title: VAALCO III
content: The project has a number of development impacts, including (i) further augmenting Vaalco''s E&S procedures in light of IFC''s revised Performance Standards since the 2005 investment in Vaalco. Vaalco is working with IFC''s E&S team to update its health, safety and environmental procedures and ensure compliance with the Equator Principles, (ii) IFC''s participation in this investment will allow smooth progress with a sizeable capital expenditure program in a difficult investment climate for junior upstream operators in Africa, where commercial lenders have significant reservations about larger exposures even in projects with reputable sponsors and proven track records, and (iii) as Gabon looks to regain its EITI candidacy (the country lost its status in February 2013), IFC''s disclosure requirements meaningfully contribute to Gabon''s transparency as Vaalco will disclose to the public payments to the government and principle contracts.

title: FBPMC
content: Job Creation and Poverty reduction:  the proposed investment is expected to have a high impact in facilitating micro and small enterprises access to finance  - an area of key strategic priority for IFC.  As IFC assists FBP to increase and diversify its sources of funding, the project adresses the need to serve those segments of the population that lack the most access to credit;  hence seeking to (i) reduce income disparities in the country, and (ii) contribute to job creation.Financial Inclusion and Increased Banking Penetration: Being affiliated with a leading commercial bank, FBP has been actively involved in bridging the gap between microfinance and the formal banking sector through low-income banking services.  Through this project IFC will play a key role in promoting financial inclusion.Demonstration Effect and Sector Development:  The proposed IFC loan will send a  strong signal to international investors and local commercial banks, which will help mobilize additional sources of funding to the sector.

title: Borets II
content: 1. South South investment: The project will support international expansion efforts of Borets which includes other emerging markets2. Development of new technologies: The project will help Borets develop new and more efficient technolgies.3. Increased tax revenues for the government: The project will lead to higher revenues and profitability which will translate into a higher tax revenues for the government.

title: QBE Equity 2
content: (i) Ability to support a regional reinsurance company and current IFC client dedicated to increasing access to insurance products to SMEs in 18 LAC countries, including IDA countries.(ii) In face of the second largest shareholder exiting, IFC''s participation will allow the Company to focus on breaking into new markets and expanding in several smaller ones.(iii) Over the short to medium term, IFC is expected to support the Company''s listing on an international public market and increase the likelihood of a successful IPO.

title: Danamon SME
content: (1) Promoting economic development in frontier provinces: The Project will directly improve access to finance in the frontier areas of Indonesia where Danamon is planning to expand its portfolio to SMEs. This will in turn drive innovation, economic growth, job creation, and poverty reduction. The strategic alliance between IFC and Danamon will help the Bank grow its SME portfolio and maintain Danamon''s position as the largest SME private player within the SME competition league.(2) Increasing SME access to long-term finance: The Danamon partnership in this Project will allow IFC to support the SME''s investment in fixed assets and other long-term financing needs. The market potential is challenging with 300,000 bankable SMEs needing access to financial services in Indonesia. Danamon plans to contribute towards reducing this unattended market demand by rolling out its SME expansion plan with its broader product offering.

title: FDL Nicaragua
content: (i) Access to finance: The Project will increase the availability of financing to the underserved rural and agribusiness sectors, primarily small producers. (ii) Employment generation: The Project will contribute to the generation of new direct and indirect jobs through the scaling up of producers. (iii) Demonstration effect: IFC''s re-engagement with the sector together with the successful allocation of funding to rural agri producers is expected to motivate others to reactivate their support to the microfinance sector in Nicaragua, and increase/venture into the agribusiness sector.

title: Puertas Finas II
content: (i) The project will contribute to the development of two frontier regions in Mexico: Oaxaca and Guerrero, where economic stimulators are scarce and very much needed.(ii) Creation of both direct and indirect jobs, especially in Oaxaca where a new production line will be established.(iii) Promotion of sustainable forestry practices as Puertas Finas, provides technical and logistical support to the communities from where it supplies part of its pine wood.(iv) The Company is expected to continue improving its environmental performance, thus reducing its overall environmental footprint.(v) Company''s improvements in energy efficiency of its existing operations.

title: Khan Bank AMC Cap Fund
content: (i) Expanded loan will reach more SME and rural customers through the bank with largest network in Mongolia;(ii) Will enhance the bank''s financing source, improve capital strength and support to grow;(iii) Support to the systemic bank shall boost the confidence in the financial sector overall.

title: FONDESA Gender F
content: IFC''s long-term financing is expected to:1) Increase financial inclusion to women-owned business and their access to credit and overall economic contribution, employment generation and poverty reduction;2) Increase access to finance to micro-entrepreneurs throughout Dominican Republic.

title: Metro Power Company Limited
content: The Project will i) promote the use of renewable energy sources for power generation in Pakistan by providing zero emission power; ii) contribute to diversification of the existing generation mix by reducing the use of expensive imported fuel oil; iii) generate Carbon Emission Reductions (CERs) through the Clean Development Mechanism of the Kyoto Protocol; and iv) help develop local expertise to aid future development of renewable energy in Pakistan.

title: TCB EE Loan
content: The Project is expected to have significant developmental impact by:a) improving access to finance for mid-size Russian companies and contribution to reduction of greenhouse gas;b) strengthening a well-managed Russian bank and supporting its portfolio growth and diversification, and c) providing financing to women-controlled SMEs.

title: Asa Alimentos
content: The project will allow ASA to increase production of poultry and pork meat thus contributing to (i) employment generation in Tocantins, a frontier region; (ii) rural development as the Company will need to expand its current network of integrated small farmers who breed chicken and pork under contracts with ASA, which provides them with a stable source of income and (iii) the sustainable worldwide increase in food supply, being Brazil well-positioned to support this increase due to the country''s competitive advantages as a low-cost producer of protein.

title: Fluidic
content: 1. Decrease operating cost of telecoms to facilitate mobile network coverage expansion in remote areas; 2. Contribute to climate change mitigation by reduced diesel consumption and carbon emissions; 3. Generate local jobs at the hubs and satellites established by Fluidic as well as jobs created during installation in remote areas; 4. Promote investment in IDA countries; and5. Demonstration effect: an investment in Fluidic further enables the Green Power for Mobile initiative, a joint initiative between IFC and GSMA, which aims to replace diesel consumption in the mobile telecom sector in developing countries and especially in Sub Saharan Africa.

title: FINCA Tajikistan
content: The Project would have a strong development impact as follows:1)	Increase access to finance for underserved population in an IDA country, contributing to employment generation, economic growth, and poverty reduction.2)	Create demonstration effect for the entire microfinance industry in Tajikistan to upgrade their risk management practices following the principles that IFC will promote in Finca. 3)	Build market confidence for other investors to engage with Finca and invest in Tajikistan on a long-term basis.

title: Astra Dorms
content: (i) Increase access by providing much needed education infrastructure in second tier cities, increasing access for students from out of city (especially female students) to attend these universities. (ii) Provide value-added services to students including on-site training and career services which will enhance their post-graduation employability. (The company strives to establish links with local academic and local businesses to provide additional training and internship opportunities for students, to be better assessed at appraisal).(iii) Lead to job creation and local supply linkages both during construction and operation of the student dormitories; (iv) Demonstration effect to encourage other financial partners and strong sponsors for similar projects.

title: Botosani Heating
content: The district heating system rehabilitation in Botosani is expected to lead to energy savings of more than 3.4TWh and a reduction of CO2 emissions by over 684.1 ktons of CO2e over the lifetime of the project.

title: OzU II
content: - Increase access to higher education, including for students outside of Istanbul through its dormitories - Provide support for entrepreneurial projects of students, that are likely to create SMEs of the future.- Demonstration effect through establishment of a "green" campus.- Create a center of excellence for computational finance, entrepreneurship and energy efficiency through its research centers.

title: Seker Sub
content: The key development objective of this project is to increase financial inclusion in Turkey. The project is designed to improve access to finance for MSMEs in Turkey, with a special focus on women owned businesses (at least 50% of the project amount will be used to on-lend to women owned SMEs). By working with Sekerbank, which has a growth strategy with a particular focus on MSMEs, this project is intended to demonstrate the business opportunity presented by women enterpreneurs as an under-served market.

title: FINCA Jordan
content: (i) Local currency funding: IFC will provide long term funding in local currency, that is difficult to obtain from the market, to enable the Company to continue supporting and further grow its client base. The nature of the loan being with long tenor and in local currency would assist the Company to diversify its funding sources, better manage its asset and liability position, and assist the Company in avoiding taking FX risks. (ii) Access to finance: The proposed Project would support FINCA Jordan expand its outreach and serve a larger number of low-income people in rural areas of Jordan. The social and economic impact would be significantly high especially that women borrowers represent 97% of FINCA''s clients.(iii) Job creation: MSMEs are key contributors to job creation in the Country. Developing a vibrant MSME sector, with reliable access to finance, can play a significant role in private sector led economic growth, generating employment and providing opportunities to the poor and under-served groups. (v) Demonstration effect: Through this project, IFC is expected to act as a catalyst by encouraging other investors, especially local banks, to fund the microfinance sector and bridge the financing gap facing this sector.

title: Hamkor Bank SL
content: 1) Enable the bank to increase access to finance for MSMEs, largely in remote and rural areas of Uzbekistan, and thus, contribute to employment generation and overall economic development.  2) Build market confidence for other investors to engage with Hamkorbank and the private sector of Uzbekistan on a long-term basis. 3) Promote best banking practices in risk management, E&S, insurance, AML throughout the banking sector and regulations of Uzbekistan by working with Hamkorbank

title: Alto Maipo
content: The IFC investment will: (i) assist Chile in the enhancement of its energy security in the most efficient manner by supporting large-scale run-of-the-river hydropower projects, decreasing system costs by providing alternatives to thermal generation (particularly diesel); (ii) enable the implementation of large-scale zero-emission technology power generation sources, decreasing overall emissions of CO2 and GHG; (iii) increase the direct IFC developmental impact of prior smaller projects in the small hydro and wind sector in Chile, which focused mostly on providing demonstration effects, with a critical mobilization role for a larger project; and (iv) provide support to hydropower projects located close to the load center of the country, in a climate of increased environmental opposition to other projects in the Patagonia region which require extremely long and invasive power transmission lines.

title: TCBuen II
content: The Project will increase Colombia''s competitiveness, and indirectly drive trade growth, by expanding much needed, modern efficient container handling capacity to better serve the country''s exports and imports. The Project will also continue to help reduce the cost of transportation by relieving congestion, improving productivity, and therefore benefitting shippers, shipping lines, and consumers alike. The entrance of TCBuen has led to increased volumes in the port of Buenaventura, as well as improved levels of service for clients from competing terminals. TCBuen project will continue to strengthen Colombia''s port sector by maintaining competition in the market and encourage other terminal operators to continue to improve the efficiency of their own terminal facilities. In addition, the Project will continue creating substantive employment in an area generally devoid of foreign investment and one the poorest in Colombia. This is all expected to result in more fiscal revenues to Colombia.

title: CS Mexico Credit Opportunities Trust
content: (i)     Deepening and Strengthening of Local Capital Markets:  The project will facilitate the  deepening and strengthening of Mexican local capital markets by mobilizing investment from Mexican Pension Funds for the benefit of local corporates. (ii)	Access to Finance:  The project will increase access to longer-term finance for the underserved local corporates segment in Mexico. Vehicles like this offer alternative sources of financing to mid-cap firms especially, which may not be able to get access to longer-term funding readily from local financial institutions.(iii)	Replication Potential: There exists the potential for replication of this project by others in Mexico, and in other regional markets facing similar capital market profiles

title: Altus
content: - Economic Development: The successful implementation of the project will improve the secondary market for distressed assets in the countries of investment. - Business Environment: As banks in the region increase the sale of their distressed assets to independent private investors, the transparency of those institutions'' balance sheets should improve as these assets would be priced according to market conditions. - Financial Infrastructure: IFC''s involvement in this project would allow Altus to positively impact the market place by building NPL servicing capacity in the financial markets. The project is expected to increase the ability of financial intermediaries in the country to offload their assets, particularly non-performing ones, improve liquidity and devote  resources to originating new transactions.

title: KuAz Expansion
content: Investments to be financed under the proposed project will help KuAz implement its 2013-2016 capital expenditures program, which would result in expansion of production capacities, streamlining of operations, energy efficiency improvements and reduction of greenhouse gases emissions. The project is expected to create around 150 additional jobs at the Company.

title: Zalagh
content: Development impact includes:(1) Employment generation, including gender: Zalagh plays a critical role in the generation of employment in Morocco particularly, in rural areas. The current 1,718 positions (of which 390 female employees) comprise a wide range of skill levels, from entry level positions to highly-skilled engineering, veterinary and managerial positions. All employees have access to dedicated training opportunities that allow them to strengthen their skills and develop within the organization. Zalagh''s expansion is expected to increase employment to around 1,900 by 2017, which will provide direct employment opportunities, particularly to the skilled youth who suffer from relatively higher levels and longer durations of unemployment in Morocco.(2) Non-farm MSME linkages: as part of its operations, the Company also maintains relationships with a network of service MSMEs providing personnel, security, safety, transportation, recycling and waste disposal services, thus extending the employment reach of the Company well beyond its direct employees.(3) Economic opportunities in rural areas: as one of the leading providers of animal feed and poultry products in the country, Zalagh supports the economic activity of about 3,845 registered poultry farmers, including some contract outgrowers, and a large number of dairy and cattle farmers. Zalagh provides a range of services to its clients that include regular visits by its sales force, technical assistance, benchmarking of performance against standards, etc.

title: CF Amalia sub-debt Colombia
content: The development impact of IFC''s investment in this Project is expected to be high given that:  - The Project would enable greater cross-border financial integration in LAC, as it would assist the Bank to consolidate its presence in a new market.  By becoming a regional player and a systemic bank in the Country, the Bank and its Sponsor would be (a) promoting commercial trade between two or more countries; b) supporting the increasing trend of companies setting operations and expanding regionally, and (c) improving institutions and investment climate through higher ESG standards.- The proposed transaction would support the creation of a financial services platform with deep roots in LAC. This is expected to diminish the volatility derived from large international investors entering and exiting developing markets. Clients will gain additional confidence in the banking system leading to overall increased economic stability.  - One of the Bank''s strategic objectives is to continue focusing on the SME business, as the majority''s of the Country''s total SMEs lack adequate access to bank financing.

title: Delonex Energy
content: Compared to the West and North Africa regions, the East and Central Africa region remains underexplored for hydrocarbons and, despite recent major discoveries in Mozambique and Uganda, the region''s hydrocarbon potential remains largely untapped.  The work and success of Delonex will help further promote the development of the hydrocarbon sector and encourage further investments in the region.  Smaller companies, such as Delonex, tend to outperform the major oil companies on exploration success and new value creation.  It is expected that independents will continue to lead the way in opening new basins, as governments open up more acreage onshore.  Analysis shows that it is the companies that  are well capitalized, with the right management team, and the correct understanding of the political and social landscape that are best placed to make transformational discoveries.  By opening up new hydrocarbon discoveries in the region, Delonex will pave the way for the entry and broad participation of the large oil companies that bring with them the expertise and resources necessary to develop such new plays, thereby triggering economic activity for the region.  This will eventually bring about substantial revenues to host governments through royalties and profit taxes generated from oil production, direct and indirect local employment and skills development in the host economy.

title: Lamoda Russia
content: The Project''s expected development impacts include: (i) job creation in the areas of logistics, warehousing as well as IT services and marketing and indirectly through supply chains and other supporting services; (ii) transfer of technology by replicating proven internet business concepts in emerging markets with the goal of turning its ventures into local/regional market leading companies in the online retail space; and (iii) benefit to consumers in frontier regions and secondary cities through more choices, lower priced goods and convenient service with home delivery.

title: GTST SIR
content: The proposed investment will have significant development impacts as follows:1.	Increased Access to Trade Finance Lines: The Facility  will finance up to US$2 billion of energy imports to Cote d''Ivoire over two years by providing much needed reasonably priced trade lines for its cross border flows.  It will support a fragile economy''s growth and generate financial savings for a strategic enterprise which could serve to retool and improve its productive and operational capacity. Improved supply of refined products would also have a positive impact on the country''s macroeconomic stability and GDP growth. 2.	Support to SIR ,  and Downstream Operators: By providing adequate and much needed financing, the Facility will help the Company''s stabilization plan. As a result, many jobs will be preserved. In addition, it would benefit other agents who are on its supply chain, such as  local private companies involved in transportation, distribution, and retail of refined oil products. This will support employment in these companies, an important factor given the high level of unemployment rate in the country.   3.     Revenue to the Government:  The Project will help the government of Cote d''Ivoire''s finances, especially through taxation and indirectly through reduction in production costs due to  savings resulting from lower financial expenses.  .

title: Umeme Capex
content: The investment program will enable Umeme to boost loss reduction and increase connections and as such enhance the quality, availability and reliability of electricity supply to consumers, businesses and industries, thereby improving the overall energy efficiency of the Ugandan distribution system and reducing local and emergency diesel based supplies.

title: Ciprel IV
content: IFC's involvement in this Project is expected to:-	Support the provision of competitive, clean and reliable base load power to help reduce Cote d'Ivoire's power shortage and boost its economic recovery;-	Contribute to the reduction of generation costs for the benefit of Ivoirian consumers;-	Stimulate the use of combined cycle technology, making efficient use of the country's natural gas resources as the Project does not use additional gas;-	Provide a significant signaling effect, as the second major foreign investment in the country post crisis, to encourage other private investments in Cote d'Ivoire.

title: UniCredit Rom
content: 1.	Demonstrate the ability of a Romanian bank to attract long-term funding from local and international investors in difficult financial times. IFC''s investment in UCT in an environment of economic and political volatility is expected to boost investor confidence in the Romanian banking sector. This investment is expected to be a catalyst for other bond issues to follow.2.	Allow the Bank to become less dependent on funding from its parent, and enhance local funding mechanism that allows the Bank to grow its lending operations, in particular to SME. IFC''s investment will be instrumental to the Bank''s lending operations and the financial sector as a whole, in providing for an important source of local currency funding, i.e. a domestic bond market.

title: E Factor Network
CAMESA II
content: i)	Promote access to finance:  CAMESA is targeting a very low income segment which does not have alternative sources of funding, and yet it has proven that this segment can generate a healthy loan portfolio.  Therefore, through CAMESA, IFC will be able to provide a sustainable access to finance channel to a financially underserved population, most of whom are women.ii)	Mobilize savings and insurance:  One of the key differentiating features of CAMESA''s activities in Mexico is its integrated approach which has demonstrated that even low income segments are able to generate savings.  In addition, CAMESA already offers micro insurance products that provide debt coverage in case of clients'' death for almost over 10 times the amount of the average loan. iii)	Promote competition:  Mexico presents a higher lending rate compared to other MFIs in LAC; this clearly reflects a low level of competition in the current market environment. Although, it can be expected that competition will keep increasing through the entry of new players, this process can be accelerated only through rapid growth and consolidation of large MFIs and their improvements in operational efficiency.

title: Dafiti Latam
content: The Project''s expected development impacts include: (i) job creation in the areas of logistics, warehousing as well as IT services and marketing and indirectly through supply chains and other supporting services; (ii) transfer of technology by replicating proven internet business concepts in emerging markets with the goal of turning its ventures into local/regional market leading companies in the online retail space; and (iii) benefit to consumers in frontier regions and secondary cities through more choices, lower priced goods and convenient service with home delivery.

title: Tobene
content: The project is expected to:- Provide base capacity addition to the main grid: the project will provide base load generation capacity of 70MW to Senegal''s interconnected system and due to its convenient location; it is also expected to add flexibility in handling electricity demand as well as to improve the system''s overall stability and reliability. The implementation of the project is critical for Senegal in order for the country to meet its fast growing electricity demand and, therefore, to solve the recurring problem of power shortages.  this project will help displace some of the more expensive emergency power rental.-	Promote private sector participation: The Project would be the third IPP in Senegal to be developed by the private sector. This is particularly important in the current context, in which the significant level of investments required is rapidly lagging behind.-	Provide more efficient source of energy: At commissioning, the project is expected to be one of the most efficient thermal plants operating in Senegal, due to its steam turbine. Also, these MAN engine could be easily convertible to gas, which provide some flexibility to the system.

title: Renaissance MCB
content: The project would: (i) support the continued development of a key private sector player as it expands into more challenging emerging markets; (ii) contribute to the development of the transportation and logistics sectors in these markets, facilitating economic growth; and (iii) help the Company displace older vessels, assisting it with complying with new requirements for low sulfur emissions and thereby minimizing harmful greenhouse gas emissions.

title: CF BCP Equity
content: The project is expected to achieve a significant development impact at two levels:(a)	Contribute to increasing access to finance to micro, small and medium enterprises:  BCP''s strategy is to strengthen its positioning in the Casablanca region.  By supporting BCP, IFC will enable the Bank to gain market share and consolidate its leadership in the MSME and retail segment and therefore support economic activity and job creation. (b)	Contribute to increasing banking penetration:  Traditionally, BCP Group has played a key role in providing banking services to low-income market and therefore in increasing banking penetration in Morocco.  The proposed project will contribute to further developing access to banking services for retail clients in Morocco.

title: Seaborn
content: - Increase Capacity: Given the growth of telecommunications, fueled by mobile devices, and in Brazil particularly as a result of its growing middle class, national broadband plan, and increased telecom infrastructure buildout throughout the region, combined with the upcoming World Cup and Olympics, there is significant pent-up demand for affordable large blocks of capacity that can be acquired for long-term lengths. The 4 incumbent Brazil-US cable systems were all built more than 10 years ago using technology from 1995 and have significant limitations on upgradeability. Seabras-1 will have an initial design capacity of 32 Tbps (a multiple of the current addressable market), with an expected upgradeability over its life being a significant multiple of that initial amount.- Reduce pricing: The Brazil-US route is one of the most expensive major transoceanic routes in the world today, and it is also the primary route for international communications between LAC and the rest of world.The project will lower pricing on the route which, in turn, increases telecom competition inside of LatAm and helps to increase affordable broadband penetration locally.- Competition / Independent player:  Further to promoting competition by building the newest submarine cable into Brazil, IFC will be contributing to the launch of the only independent player on the route. 3 of the 4 incumbent cable systems (Globenet, SAm 1, and SAC / LatAm Nauilus) are owned directly by incumbent telecom players (Oi, Telefonica, Level 3 / Telecom Italia), and thus potentially seen by customers as prioritizing the parent company''s own needs above the broader needs of the market.- LAC Regional Integration: The Project will help improve affordable connectivity and competition for the ongoing economic development of northern Brazil and other South American countries (e.g. Uruguay, Paraguay, Argentina, Chile).- Increase broadband internet access: The Project will address the growing demand for broadband internet communications throughout LAC.

title: SIB RSF
content: The project is expected to have the following development  impact:  (i)	Increase Access to finance: The project will increase access to finance underserved SMEs in Cote d''Ivoire, thus supporting the revitalization of the private sector, which will lead to job preservation and creation.(ii)	Capacity Building: The project will help build SIB''s capacity strengthen and grow SME banking  activities including to sub-segments such as women and agri-businesses. The project will also contribute to build the capaciity of the SMEs themselves that will benefit from the financing. (iii)	Replicability within Cote d''Ivoire: The project will have a demonstration effect by encouraging other local financial institutions to increase lending activities to SMEs.(iv)	Replicability within AWB network of African subsidiaries: The project is also expected to have a demonstration effect by encouraging other SSA subsidiaries of the AWB network to increase lending activities to SMEs in their respective markets.

title: Mediterrania Capital II
content: (i) Support for SMEs in the Maghreb: all target portfolio companies will be in the SME and mid market segment. IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. (ii) Private Sector Development: the fund manager employs a hands-on value added strategy to help portfolio companies improve operational efficiency and competitiveness leading to improved competitiveness and sustainability. (iii) Economic Development: long-term capital to under-banked sectors with capital needs allows new businesses and markets to develop which lead to increased employment and output.

title: AllianceBernstein Next 50 Emerging Markets Project
content: Increased cross-border flows prompted by the project will help to make equity markets in smaller and frontier countries more robust by - among other things - improving market liquidity, issuer transparency and disclosure, as well as overall equity market infrastructure.  In turn, such improvements should facilitate future primary market issuance and financing options for companies in these countries, thereby promoting economic growth and enabling poverty reduction.  Development of equity markets in targeted smaller and frontier countries will also benefit from the IFC Advisory Services program.

title: Coursera Equity
content: (i) Promoting affordability: MOOCs will counter-act the trend of continuous increases in costs of higher education experienced in many countries by making available to students of different socioeconomic backgrounds high quality instruction and education materials for free.(ii) Improving quality and accountability: By making available new learning opportunities in emerging markets, Coursera can help build the capacity of local higher education institutions, potentially promoting systemic quality improvements and greater accountability on student outcomes. (iii) Supporting employability: The wide variety of course offerings coupled with Coursera''s student recruitment services can allow students globally to access knowledge and skills that otherwise would not be available to them and open opportunities to access quality jobs by making job-seekers more visible to potential employers. (iv) Supporting lifelong learning in an increasingly knowledge-based economy: MOOCs make available advanced courses that are not widely available in emerging markets and can help the next generation of life long learners acquire 21st century skills and apply them in the workplace. (iv) Supporting innovation: Coursera has the potential to transform the traditional classroom-based education, by allowing universities to license their content to develop personalized and more flexible programs that effectively meet student''s needs. (v) Individualizing learning: Technology has the potential to promote a more individualized learning experience, segmenting the student population according to learning patterns and preferences and providing each segment with customized content and pedagogical tools.(vi) Measuring outcomes: the combination of scale and technology can facilitate data-driven approaches to measure student learning (e.g. through data mining) feeding back relevant information about student learning patterns to instructors and institutions for academic improvement.

title: Nafith Logistics Services PSC
content: (i) create employment opportunities;(ii) decrease congestion at gates and berths thus increasing port throughput;(iii) enhance port efficiencies by streamlining operations and hence reducing freight cost;(iv) contribute to government revenues through collection of revenue share on an annual basis;(v) demonstration effect to engender competition.

title: BHG
content: - Increasing the supply of competitive price-value business rooms/hotels in first, second and third-tier cities with consistent international quality and safety standards; this should encourage increased tourism, business and MICE travel;- Supporting the economic development of frontier regions of Brazil since a portion of the Project will take place in the Midwest, North and Northeast regions of Brazil, thus helping develop key business-enabling infrastructure in these priority areas;- Creating both direct and indirect jobs as well as providing training and promotion opportunities; the Project is expected to create and 2,500 new direct jobs in the operation stage (and over 4,500 direct jobs during the construction phases), with approximately 45% being for women; indirect jobs along the supply chain are also expected to be significant, including in food supply, transportation, security and other needed services;- Providing management and staff with comprehensive training opportunities, primarily through BHG''s own training center in So Paulo and through additional training centers planned in Rio de Janeiro and Belm; BHG will also continue its social program for convicted criminals by continue offering them in-house training and, in some cases, jobs to support their re-integration into society.- Contributing to the development of the local economy by enhancing upstream and downstream supply linkages with SME vendors serving the needs of both the hotel and guests; in addition, the Project will increase tax revenues and tourist''s spending would help support a wide range of local economic activities;- Adopting sustainable green-building design and construction, ensuring higher levels of energy efficiency; the upcoming new properties would meet IFC''s EDGE Green Building standard; Improved environmental and social performance as BHG''s portfolio of hotels would conform to the World Bank Group''s environmental and social standards, including with regards to life and fire safety; and- Providing a demonstration effect to other potential investors.

title: Earthport
content: (i)	Reducing cost of migrant remittance: Earthport''s payment platform significantly reduces the cost of cross boarder money transfers through banks. (ii)	Supporting SMEs: Earthport''s solution supports SMEs in developing countries to engage in international trade. Currently, the high cost and delays for international payments create barriers for the small exporters and traders. Earthport will provide them a payment solution which is much faster and at lower cost. (iii)	Financial Inclusion: Because banks do not have efficient systems to transfer small transfers, currently the vast majority of migrant remittances is sent and paid in cash through specialized money transfer operators. Since these operators potentially compete with banks, they have no incentive to encourage senders and recipients to open bank accounts. Earthport''s system for the first time creates a solution that banks can use to effectively offer migrants a competitive money transfer service and compete with the cash-based money transfer companies. Migrants and their families gain a lower cost service and are incentivized to open bank accounts. The solution will also make it commercially feasible or more attractive for the banks to serve low income consumers. Earthport thereby provides a tool to implement the financial inclusion program of banks and governments.  (iv)	Supporting banks in developing countries: The conversion of cash-based remittances into account transfers will increase the deposit base of financial institutions in the receiving developing countries. This makes money available for lending to SMEs, creates hard currency income of the banks to support trade credit, and directs savings and other deposits into bank accounts. At the same time it significantly increases the multiplier effect of remittance flows.

title: Odea Bank SME
content: IFC''s SME credit line would further help the Bank to extend longer term loans to the SMEs and therefore provide sustainable financing to expand their businesses. As the primary beneficiaries of the proposed senior loan would be SMEs, who is lacking access to especially long term finance from banks, the proposed loan is also expected to have positive impacts in terms of job creation and preservation because SMEs are the major source of employment in Turkey.Lastly, IFC''s partnering with Odeabank, a south-south investment, would have an important demonstration impact in terms of motivating other strong sponsors in the region to enter into the Turkish market

title: IFC Global Financial Institutions Fund
content: 1. Given that the fund will co-invest in IFC investments, it will support private sector development by increasing access to growth capital for SMEs in Emerging Markets.  2. The fund will further enhance and expand IFC''s development impact by leveraging IFC''s economic capital so that IFC can make more investments and thus expand its developmental reach.3. The fund will also allow IFC to participate in larger ticket transactions which IFC would otherwise not be able to finance from its own balance sheet.

title: WCSS Inecobank ASLF
content: Increased Access to Financing for SMEs: Limited access to finance is considered a key constraint to private sector growth. Increased access to finance is indispensable to grow the competitiveness of SMEs. By directly financing the short term US$ liquidity needs of local banks to support SME trade and foreign currency working capital finance needs, the facility will support SMEs and will have a positive impact on economic activity in Armenia.

title: WCSS Unibank ASLF
content: Increased Access to Financing for SMEs: Limited access to finance is considered a key constraint to private sector growth. Increased access to finance is indispensable to grow the competitiveness of SMEs. By directly financing the short term US$ liquidity needs of local banks to support SME trade and foreign currency working capital finance needs, the facility will support SMEs and will have a positive impact on economic activity in Armenia.

title: africaJUICE
content: 1)	Expected to reach at least an incremental 1,000 small scale passion fruit farmers over the next seven years.2)	Significant improvements in local food security.3)	Penetration of fair trade / modern farming practices to the wider producer base in Ethiopia.4)	Development of improved natural resource management techniques, especially water utilization.5)	Contribution to wider regional development in terms of jobs, infrastructure, education, health and other socio-economic parameters.

title: Velocity
content: 1)	Additional and steady income for 5,000+ dairy farmers in the Oromiya region of Ethiopia.2)	Positive incentives for farmers to invest in their livestock and increase their yields.3)	Introduction of healthy, safe dairy products and a resulting increased food safety.4)	Large-scale employment (250+ full-time employees) as well as further  jobs in the adjacent business areas.5)	Increased competition in the Ethiopian dairy industry.6)	Economic development of a sector of pivotal importance to rural and urban economic development.

title: DBL Group
content: 1.	Job creation: The Project will create 850 new direct jobs, as well as temporary jobs during construction. Since dyeing and finishing is physical labor-intensive process, most of the employees will be male. However, being the first state-of-art dyeing facility of the country, the Company will diversify local workers'' skill-set and trigger learning curve on textiles dyeing operation. Moreover, the factory will adhere to international occupational, health and safety standards, thereby, offering better environment to improve workers'' quality of life. 2.	Technology transfer: DBL intends to adopt global best practices in terms of lean manufacturing concepts, factory efficiency, worker productivity and energy efficiency, which will set an important example for  and potentially elevate productivity and efficiency standards of the overall industry. 3.	Boost local competitiveness: The Project is expected to boost Bangladesh''s knit apparel industry competitiveness by enhancing local dyeing and finishing capacity, which will enable DBL and other similar Groups to move towards higher value products. 4.	Benefit to the government: The Project will generate tax revenues for the Government of Bangladesh.

title: Avantel LTE
content: - Productivity enhancement/Economic growth: Broadband directly contributes towards improving private sector productivity and has a transformative effect on economic and social development. The contribution of broadband connectivity to economic growth and as an enabler to other innovative business models (e-health, e-education, e-commerce etc.) is widely accepted. The World Bank Group''s "Information and Communications for Development report" 2009 sites a 1.38% increase in economic growth in low- and middle-income economies for each 10% increase in broadband penetration. Recognizing this, the Colombian government has recently launched several initiatives to increase broadband penetration in the country, one of which is "Live Digital" ("Vive Digital"), which aims to increase Colombia''s internet connections to 8.8 million by 2014.  - Innovation/International competitiveness: Broadband enables access to ideas and idea exchange globally, thus transforming research and development. It facilitates trade in services and globalization and improves countries'' competitiveness. According to the World Economic Forum report, "The Global Information Technology Report 2010-2011", there is a direct correlation between the Network Readiness Index, which measures the use and development of ICTs and countries'' international competitiveness.- Improved performance of social services: Availability of broadband improves public services and enhances national business environment and competitiveness. Access to broadband and consequently to greater data transparency and mobility also strengthens the ability to monitor service delivery and accountability in health, health insurance system for the poor, education, early childhood development etc.- Reducing poverty/unemployment: The Colombian Ministry of ICT in its "Live Digital" initiative values the direct correlation between internet penetration, employment generation and poverty reduction. The Ministry sites a study by Raul Katz from Colombia University which cites that in Chile a 10% increase in Internet penetration led to a reduction of unemployment by 2%. According to a UNCTAD "Information Economy Report" for 2010, in developing countries such as the Philippines and India, for each job created in the ICT industry between 2 and 3.5 additional jobs in the economy were generated.- Competitive Environment: The project wil contribute to competition in a higly concentrated market while promoting broader product offerings and higher quality of service.

title: La Huayca II
content: The IFC investment will: (i) provide a critical global demonstration effect of the viability of financing a solar merchant power project with no feed-in tariffs; (ii) enable the implementation of utility-scale zero-emission technology power generation sources, decreasing overall emissions of CO2 and GHG; and (iii) continue IFC''s track record of providing developmental impact in Chile through the implementation of innovative projects with potential for replication, initially in the small hydro and wind sector and now in the solar sector.  If successful, this investment could greatly open up the market for rapid development of solar energy in the country.

title: Essilao
content: - Technology transfer: The project will bring Best-in-Class technology and manufacturing processes to LAO PDR, an IDA country with GDP/Capita of $1,101/year. Essilor applies the highest standard through standard operating procedures that are applied in each of its plants globally.- Creation of skilled jobs: The project will bring up to 250 jobs in the local area.- Human development: Essilor established a partnership with a local vocational training center and setup a workshop to train 50 to 60 operators and technicians every year to feed the plant''s  needs.- Demonstration effect for foreign Direct Investment (FDI): Essilor is the first large scale multinational corporation to have signed for a large investment on the Savannakhet Special Economic Zone,  and one the few MNCs investing in manufacturing in Lao P.D.R.  - Energy efficiency: the new plant will apply Essilor''s highest standards in terms of energy efficiency.

title: Fiba Sub Loan
content: The project aims at supporting a mid-tier, well managed bank in Turkey through strengthening its capital base. With increased capitalization, the Bank will be able to implement its growth strategy with a focus on the underserved SME segment in Turkey.

title: SunEdison CAP
content: 1. Increasing Chile''s renewable energy output, and helping the country meet its renewable energy targets, including by diversifying its energy mix; 2. Providing a global demonstration effect of the viability of financing a truly large-scale solar power project under a PPA scheme with no feed-in tariffs ;3. Enable the implementation of utility-scale zero-emission power generation, decreasing overall emissions of CO2 and GHG.

title: BVCF III
content: The Fund is expected to deliver strong development impact as it would: (i) help the companies it invests in grow faster and more sustainable, through hands-on managerial and operational involvement, than they would otherwise do; (ii) support the job creation of the fast-growing healthcare companies, including woman employment; (iii) help ensure implementation of best practice governance, including the IFC Environmental and Social (E&S) Standards, in the Fund's investee companies; and (iv) facilitate the transfer of important knowledge and skills to local entrepreneurs that will improve their competitiveness in the global marketplace.

title: Orange
content: i) Financial Inclusion:  There is a significant need in Brazil for health insurance. With a penetration of 25% of the total population, coupled with current demographic trends, the country needs to increase access to health insurance in the short to medium term. This situation is particularly pressing in less developed regions of the country such as the North and Northeast, where penetration levels are 50% of those in the south of the country. The Company is also increasingly providing insurance to individuals through SMEs, the fastest growing segment in its health insurance business.  Sul America''s plan to grow its health and dental business is expected to contribute to solving the shortage of health insurance in Brazil and hence positively contributing to the development of the country. ii) Insurance Sector Improvements:  There is significant potential impact from regulatory intervention on insurance and health sector in Brazil; policy and regulation will need to adapt so that private health care offerings can expand to meet increased demand as demographic changes in Brazil will make health care a major fiscal challenge. In this context, the company''s plan to grow its health insurance premiums by approximately 13% per year will over the next five years contribute to the appropriate evolution of this sector and continue to support government efforts in meeting these challenges.iii) Improve Market Practices:  The Company intends to further improve its health and motor claims handling process from an industry-leading 85% of claims settled in 3 months to 90% of claims settled in 2 months. Over time, other market participants would need to perform at a similarly high level, which could result in increased system efficiency, better service and customer satisfaction.

title: SunEdison Merchant
content: 1. Increasing Chile''s renewable energy output, and helping the country meet its renewable energy targets, including by diversifying its energy mix; 2. Providing a global demonstration effect of the viability of financing a merchant power project with no feed-in tariffs;3. Enable the implementation of utility-scale zero-emission power generation, decreasing overall emissions of CO2 and GHG.

title: Elif Egypt
content: -The project will:- Create 300 direct employment at the production facility and an additional 200-300 indirect jobs in Egypt, plus several hundred temporary jobs tied to the construction period.- Generate fiscal benefits through increased taxes.- Support Egyptian economy in foreign trade balance in terms of both decreased import and increased export.- Procure from local suppliers and support them.- Bring manufacturing management and technical know-how to Egypt and leverage sectors it serves.- Will help to provide timely delivery to the customers and develop the industry in Egypt.- Will have the capability to manufacture from recycled materials

title: Parag Dairy
content: Improvement in food safety standards & technology: In India majority of the milk & milk products have very poor traceability till farm level. Also contamination and adulteration of milk is common owing to significant supply-demand gap and lack of extensive cold chain network. An organized sector player like Parag will help improve food safety standards. Also, Parag is ahead in technology as compared to other players in the Indian dairy sector. Enhanced supply chain linkage with farmers and food suppliers: Parag currently collects milk from ~60,000 farmers directly or through third parties and is focusing on growing the procurement network by setting up more chilling centers and bulk coolers. This increased demand of milk will lead to increase in number of farmers in the supply chain. It will also support other input suppliers to the industry including feed and veterinarian suppliers.Development of medium and small enterprises: Parag distributes its products through 60+ super-stockists, 1,000+ distributors and over 120,000 retail outlets thus having a far reaching impact on supporting medium and small enterprises across the country. Improved incomes in rural and peri-urban areas: The project will create direct and indirect employment and result in other development benefits such as linkages with local suppliers, as also seen in our previous project with Pran Dairy, Bangladesh. Also, Parag sells cows from its own dairy farm to the local population after the cow has its 5th / 6th lactation. These are superior breed cows with yields better than those reared locally and will hence help improve rural incomes.Supporting growth/guiding the critical Indian dairy industry: Expecting a shortfall in supply and to improve yields, NDDB expects a gradual increase in the share of the organized sector to 60% from the current share of 30%. IFC investment will help this medium sized dairy Company to expand rapidly and develop best practices to increase yield that would be disseminated down to farmers who form a critical link in Company''s supply chain.

title: AAR Healthcare
content: i) Access to healthcare - the project will expand access to quality inpatient and outpatient healthcare ii) Demonstration effect - the African health sector is fragmented which results in inconsistent quality and higher costs. The Company will act as a consolidator in the sector and if succesful will attract other investors to employ similar strategies, thereby improving quality and reducing healthcare costs.iii) Job creation - the project will create jobs at the new facilities.iv) South-South investment - Kenya has the most advanced private health sector in East Africa. The Company has transferred skills and capital from Kenya into neighbouring Uganda and Tanzania and the proposed expansion will enable the Company to continue and expand upon this transfer.

title: Tetri Qudi
content: The proposed Project has significant development impact including the following:- Supporting development of agribusiness sector: The Project will expand the Company`s operations in agribusiness, improve its competitiveness, and will support import substitution of mushroom products in Georgia.- Job creation: Direct and indirect job creation and preservation outside Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia, where the job opportunities are scarce.- Food Security: The Project will support food security in an IDA country.- Increased tax payments: Generating additional amount of taxes to be paid to the State.- Supply chain linkages: Growth of the Company will require increased level of economic activity with farmers, distributors and retailers.

title: Circle Oil
content: Contribution to Government Revenues: The Project is expected to result in higher and longer production in Egypt and Morocco, positively impacting the revenues that the host governments will receive including through production sharing, royalties, corporate taxes.	Providing Cleaner Source of Energy to the Moroccan Industry: Circle Oil is the largest gas producer in Morocco and sells the produced gas to industrial consumers in Kenitra. Those consumers'' only other energy alternatives are imported coal or fuel oil /diesel. Natural gas produced by Circle Oil provides cheaper and cleaner energy. Local Industry: The project is expected to contribute to local spending in Morocco and Egypt as part of the field services and operational supplies will be procured domestically. Particularly in Morocco, Circle Oil will contribute to the growth of a small, nascent, oil field services industry which is vital for further exploration and development of the country''s oil and gas resources.Creation/preservation of employment: Even though the project''s impact on employment is expected to be limited, the jobs created by Circle Oil are mainly high skilled and therefore contribute to local skill development and foster technology transfer.

title: DARP APS
content: - Economic Development: The successful implementation of the project will improve the secondary market for distressed assets and could catalyse investment interest on the part of other investors.  - Business Environment: As financial intermediaries increase the sale of their NPLs to independent private investors, bank balance sheet transparency increases.  Assets priced at market serve as a reference for true asset values on balance sheets as well as in the system.- Financial Infrastructure: IFC''s involvement in this Project would positively impact the market place by building capacity of the financial markets in ECA and, in particular, the Balkans. The Project is expected to increase the ability of financial intermediaries to offload their assets.

title: Viking Services BV
content: i. Development of the hydrocarbon sector in Turkey and Iraq: The Thrace Basin in Turkey is the country''s largest producing gas province providing opportunities for gas exploration. Any gas produced in the Thrace Basin is going to be used domestically. Being the main private oil services company in Turkey, the company will help oil and gas operators develop indigenous hydrocarbon resources and thus contribute to the country''s goals of reducing energy dependence and displacing other fuels with natural gas. As Iraq hopes to significantly boost its output capacity which continues to be crucial for the country''s economic recovery, the company''s oilfield services are an important contribution to sector development in the region it operates. ii. Increased competition in the service sector: The company''s competition in Turkey is generally of poor quality and high cost. Through establishing and expanding its operations, the company will aim to provide more competitive pricing for its services, and offering improved quality and response times in Turkey.iii. Employment and training: The company currently employs an international workforce of roughly 1,100,  almost 90% of which are local hires.   Viking has been actively developing local talent and hiring locally has been key in its community engagement strategy.  If it is successful in its expansion plans, it is expected to need additional employees in its markets of operations. Creating and preserving jobs in the sector that currently lacks qualified providers will have positive benefits for these markets in helping create local expertise through employment and training.

title: Marriott Haiti
content: The Project''s development impact is expected to include:- Development of business infrastructure of international standard in Port au Prince.- Creation of a significant number of jobs during the construction and operational phase. - Generation of downstream and upstream local supply linkages with the rest of the economy.- Increase of direct tax revenues by the government.- Improved environmental and social performance, including demonstration of solar water heating.

title: Finca Armenia
content: IFC''s long-term financing is expected to bring high development impact by enhancing Finca Armenia''s capacity to support productive micro enterprises, resulting in higher growth, employment generation and poverty reduction.

title: Fortis Healthcare Ltd
content: 1) Inclusive growth: Fortis'' expansion plans include increasing the number of operational beds in Tier II/III cities, which currently lack good healthcare facilities. The project would improve the standards for clinical and managerial practices in these underserved areas. 2) Reach: The Company will be able to increase the number of patients treated substantially through its proposed expansion. 3) Jobs: Fortis employs over 22,000 people and with the Company increasing capacity, job additions will be significant.  Further, a substantial portion of its employees are women;4) Knowledge transfer/demonstration effect: The Company will bring best managerial and clinical practices to underserved markets;

title: Garden City Kenya
content: - Urban development: The Project will support the expansion of the city of Nairobi by addressing the need for additional residential housing and modern retail infrastructure in the suburbs along the new Thika highway. - Provision of modern retail infrastructure:  The Project will provide a modern and innovative shopping centre expected to be the reference in Kenya and East Africa and also attract reputable international retailers to Kenya.- Access to property: The Project will provide Citizens with the opportunity to have access not only to modern residential units but also to improved quality of life as the Project will also develop a leisure park and recreational areas for families and children.- Job creation: The Project will create direct and indirect jobs both during and after project implementation.- Benefits to local suppliers: The Project will provide business opportunities to local subcontractors, property service companies and other suppliers of goods and services during and after project implementation. - Increased tax revenues: The Project will generate tax revenue to the Government of Kenya.- Development of the private sector: The Project will stimulate two key sectors of the economy, retail and property, with multiplier effects on other important segments of the economy (transport, food processing, banking/mortgage finance).

title: SSL Bosnia III
content: IFC''s investment in SSL continues to have a strong demonstration effect as SSL has become an example of a successful privatization and foreign direct investment in Bosnia and Herzegovina, an IDA country. The new project will help enhance SSL''s turnaround and competitiveness through economies of scale and improvements in energy and resource efficiency. SSL is one of the largest employers in the Tuzla area (approximately 550 people) and generates significant employment at the local brine and limestone mines.

title: Fullerton II
content: Expanding Access to Finance for MSEs: Micro and Small Enterprises ("MSEs") play an important role in creating employment and contributing to local economy particularly in less developed regions. Nevertheless, MSEs are under-served by traditional financial institutions. The expansion of the Companies will help address the issue by increasing credit supply accessible and affordable by MSEs;Supporting Economic Growth in Frontier Regions: Frontier regions in China have experienced much pronounced difficulties in access to finance for MSEs, which hinders the economic growth in these regions. The Companies, operating in two large frontier provinces, i.e., Chongqing and Hubei, will expand access to credit in these regions, specifically to MSEs, thereby supporting the continued growth of the local economy.

title: DARP Fortress
content: -	Market development: The successful implementation of the project could spark the interest of other DA market players and evolve into a common practice;-	Best practices: As part of the project IFC would promote international insolvency standards, creditors'' rights and collection practices for the resolution of the distressed assets; and-	Replication: Through this project, IFC would be helping to assign a market value to a NPL portfolio and distressed assets.  If successful, the proposed project has the potential to be replicated by other entities in the other region.

title: TRM Convertible Loan
content: Increasing access to a suite of financial services including savings, credit and insurance to Timor Leste''s underserved Microenterprises and SMEs with particular focus on women-owned MSMEs.Creating a demonstration effect for private investors by showing that commercial MFIs in a post-conflict environment like Timor-Leste can be financially sustainable.

title: Vision CL PYG
content: - Enhance access to finance for MSMEs.  The Project will allow the Bank to provide its clients access to funding in Guaranies with longer maturities, enabling them to undertake investment projects with more appropriate financing structures;- Generate a demonstration effect.  The Project is expected to create a demonstration effect for other banks by increasing the level of sophistication of the Paraguayan financial system and the BCP, through the greater use of cross-currency swaps, further enhancing IFC's developmental impact in Paraguay; and- Help expand Paraguay's financial sector. By increasing access to finance for low-income groups and other priority sectors such as MSMEs.

title: Safetypay
content: Safetypay creates an alternative online payment system that benefits merchants in countries with underdeveloped online payment systems and allows them to export their goods by selling them online. The company''s system provides banked low income consumers in developing countries the ability to benefit from the lower cost, greater transparency and wider availability of goods and services delivered by ecommerce from which they are otherwise excluded because they do not qualify for credit cards or credit cards are simply too expensive. The company''s system creates incentives to obtain bank accounts rather than just a prepaid card or another transactional payment service and thereby supports financial inclusion. As an investor the IFC can ensure that the benefits offered by Safetypay are increasingly made available to consumers and merchants in developing countries.Banks in developing countries which often do not generate much or any income from issuing credit cards and merchant acquiring (enabling merchants to accept credit cards) gain a new source of fee income and can monetize their online banking service. Safetypay is already working on technology that will enable unbanked customers to purchase goods online by obtaining vouchers from banks which generate fee income and cross selling opportunities for the banks and, again, creates an opportunity for financial inclusion.

title: Neo Gas
content: Climate change mitigation: NEOgas'' primary business is the distribution of natural gas to areas where it is otherwise unavailable, resulting in the displacement of competing fuels such as fuel oil, gasoline and diesel, which are more polluting and with a much higher carbon impact per energy unit. Improved competitiveness of local companies located in frontier areas that are not serviced by the existing gas pipelines: NEOgas provides off-pipeline natural gas solutions to vehicular and industrial customers utilizing a proprietary technology that reduces capital and operational expenses to its customers: the average annual energy cost savings for industrial customers range from 40-60% depending on the location.Job creation: expansion of NEOgas operations will create quality employment opportunities in Peru, Brazil, Mexico and Colombia.Private sector development: the proposed Project will promote private sector participation in the regional natural gas distribution sector that is dominated by state owned companies in Brazil, Mexico and Colombia.

title: Kaiima
content: The Project is expected to have significant development impact by (i) increasing agricultural yields which will result in increased land use efficiency; (ii) developing seed alternatives that are adapted to climate extremes in emerging markets; (iii) creating a non-GMO product that requires fewer regulatory hurdles and thus can benefit smaller markets, including smallholder farmers in IDA countries; (iv) promoting the development of sustainable industrial oils and thereby reduce GHG emissions.

title: Bandelta
content: IFC''s loan would help increase financing to underserved micro and small companies through a sector leader.Employment generation: Contribute to the creation of new jobs in the micro and small business segments, which typically provide the majority of employment in developing countries.Support transformation of MSMEs to the formal sector since lack of credit is the main barrier for an MSME to become formal.

title: Chad Clinic
content: The Project will: (i) contribute to address the demand-gap for adequate heath facilities in Chad, thereby extending the healthcare services available in the country;(ii) raise the country health standards by supporting the leading player;(iii) create employment estimated at 85 positions;(iv) make readily available locally healthcare services for which Chadian are currently travelling abroad (Tunisia mostly).

title: Activa Finances
content: The development impact of IFC''s investment in Activa will be measured by the following metrics: (i) growth in insurance premiums, (ii) growth in sums insured, as well as (iii) the creation of new subsidiaries in other markets in a region characterized by very low levels of insurance penetration currently and (iv) the development of new products that should extend the reach of insurance cover in the markets concerned (micro-insurance, weather risk insurance for farmers, etc).  There will also be a strong demonstration effect by supporting a local entrepreneur who is building a regional group and has had some success already in creating a panafrican insurance alliance (Globus Network) as well a regional reinsurance platform (Globus Re).

title: Project Martina
content: The proposed transaction is expected to generate the following development impacts:- Increase the access to long term finance to farmers, Agri-SMEs and women-owned SMEs, which is highly needed in order for them to undertake capital investments;- Contribute to strengthen the food supply chain, job creation, productivity increase and rural economic development;- The proposed transaction would contribute to the formalization of Agri-SMEs and women-owned SMEs in the country as it will be a clear demonstration of the additional benefits such as having access to long-term financing at adequate terms in line with the business needs;- BI will comply with IFC''s E&S requirements and exclusion list in its underwriting process.

title: ABC Frontier
content: The Project will increase access to finance to SMEs in the frontier regions of Brazil, which are underserved by the domestic financial markets. It will also help ABC Brasil to expand its reach to maintain and increase its lending to SMEs in frontier regions. Finally, the Bank will be required to design and implement an ESMS to screen all SME sub-projects against the IFC Exclusion List and the Brazilian E&S laws and regulations.

title: Unibank SME
content: The development impact of the project is expected to be significant in terms of its support for local businesses in real economy.  By providing financing to the Bank, IFC will enable the Bank to expand its SME lending operations and provide commercial financing to businesses in a variety of sectors, therefore fostering economic growth through job creation. In addition, the project will have an important demonstration effect to other foreign investors. By enabling the Bank to expand its "commercially-priced" funding base, the project should have a meaningful contribution to building a viable banking system in Armenia.

title: Ghana BDC II
content: (i) Alleviation of Fuel Shortages and Meeting Demand Growth:  IFC will support the largest fuel importer who is contributing to alleviation of fuel shortages. Given the empirical evidence of a high correlation between energy consumption and GDP growth and a direct relationship between the absence of adequate energy and many poverty indicators, the project has significant economic importance for the country.     (ii) Deepening Ghanaian Financial Markets: The project supplements the facilities offered by local banks and IFC''s GTFP program through providing additional cost effective trade finance solutions in Ghana.(iii) Private Sector Development: The facility is supporting Ghanaian private sector companies in a recently deregulated and growing sector.

title: Kurum International SH.A.
