content: The Project''s development impact is as follows: (i) In line with the World Bank Group strategy, supporting power sector reform by increasing the share of private sector in Albania''s overall electricity generation; (ii) Sending a strong signal demonstrating the WBG''s continued support to the market and to the GoA''s ongoing efforts to liberalize the power market and promote private sector participation; (iii) Facilitating the move towards the creation of a regional energy market in South Eastern Europe;(iv) Attracting regional players to the Albanian market and supporting south-south investments by financing Kurum Holding''s initiative in Albania. Through the above, the Project is expected to positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Albania through increased foreign direct investment related to the payment of the privatization amount;(v) Climate change mitigation (increased clean energy generation by improving efficiencies); and(vi) Helping Turkish banks invest overseas under IFC B loan umbrella and thus supporting these banks'' entry to new markets in the region.

title: Property Development Company CJSC
content: 1)	Elevation of commercial real estate standards-throughout the country through development of a Class A office building;2)    Development of high quality business infrastructure in Armenia;3)	Direct and indirect employment of service jobs; possibility for further linkages;4)	Tax revenues will accrue to the government;5)     Implementation of green building standards and sound E&S policies as per IFC requirements

title: Vento Brazil
content: (i)	Increased generation of Renewable power: The GOB has set a target to increase the share of power generation attributed to Renewable energy sources in Brazil to 20 percent from current 12 percent of installed capacity. The Project is expected to help Brazil meet this target.(ii)	Contribution to Climate Change Mitigation: The Project helps mitigate adverse climate change impacts by helping Brazil achieve a balanced energy mix through the use of Renewable resources. With current operational projects and projects under development, the Company is expected to avoid approximately 700 thousand tons of CO2 emission annually by FY2018.(iii)	 Employment: The Project will generate additional local employment during construction (largely in Northeast Brazil) and permanent employment during operations. (iv)	 Private Sector Development in Renewable Energy: IFC''s investment is expected to help attract international investors to Renewable energy projects in Brazil which will facilitate the growth of private companies in this sector in Brazil.

title: FINCA GEORGIA
content: - Increasing access to funding for underserved MSEs in poor and rural areas,- Creating a demonstration effect for other MFIs to diversify and to increase their LCY funding volumes and to manage their asset-liability positions better,- Contributing to economic growth and poverty reduction by helping to creat jobs.

title: Internexa Brazil
content: - Access to Broadband: The Project addresses the growing demand for fiber communications and its supporting infrastructure.- Shared infrastructure: As mobile operators are under pressure to improve their networks, niche operators like Internexa are well positioned to provide basic infrastructure services to such Mobile Network Operators ("MNO"). For telecom operators, infrastructure sharing benefits include reduced capex which translate into lower cost of service. Infrastructure sharing is critical in further fueling the evolution of the telecom market, indirectly assisting in the development of broadband services, content and applications, mobile finance and mobile advertising, as several industry segments begin converging.- Reduce Pricing / Increase competition: By supporting a small operator, IFC would be contributing towards fuelling competition and reducing communication prices. Today, a country like Brazil still has one of the highest tariffs for broadband services in the region. - South - South Project: IFC would be supporting a Colombian Sponsor to undertake a regional Project, further contributing to regional integration. When fully operational, Brazilian operations for ITX may represent up to three times the size of their telecoms business in Colombia.

title: TPG Alternative and Renewable Technologies
content: i.	Private Sector Development: Providing high margin products to be manufactured in emerging markets enabling these countries to export higher value products, thus capturing margin and reinvesting these margins within countryii.	Mitigation: Reduced GHG emissions per unit of energy produced by using the alternative technologyiii.	Job Creation: Investments in commercialization and scaling up lead to substantial job creation in the developing countriesiv.	Deployment of innovative climate friendly technologies to emerging marketsv.	Incorporating IFC's E&S standards, thereby contributing to responsible and sustainable economic development

title: Ficensa Loan
content: Banking penetration: by promoting access to credit along the small and medium market companies.Export competitiveness: by providing long term financing that can facilitate the implementation of better production tecnologies, which could eventually sustain competitive exports.Employment generation: SMEs are a large employment generator in Honduras  and more access to credit will translate into larger production scales requiring more workers.

title: Bekto Precisa
content: - On top of existing labor force of the Company, Bekto Precisa is expected to create additional direct skilled jobs until 2014 in a country where official unemployment rate is around 45%,- Moreover, the multiplier effect is estimated at 3x for indirect jobs in small-medium enterprises focused on factory & machine maintenance and small mechanical workshops located mainly in Gorazde, a small remote mountain town, supporting local MSMEs,- On the back of increased sales & production capacity of the Company as well as export-oriented production & sales will boost the hard-currency flow to BiH with a certain positive impact on BiH''s current account deficit and tax revenues; and- Finally, given that Bekto Precisa mainly sources its main processing material and services domestically, which corresponds more than 50% of total annual expenses of the Company, the Project will have a direct positive local supply chain impact.

title: Olam Corp Loan
content: The proposed investment covers a range of corporate projects in various geographies and subsectors. The development impact of each project will be assessed on its particular merits as regards: (i) financial viability; (ii) economic viability; (iii) E&S performance; and (iv) private sector development. Most of these projects, however, are likely to contribute to one or more of the following:-	Food sufficiency, especially in the host countries-	Farm productivity improvement, technology transfer and demonstration impact-	Farmers'' incomes. According to its Annual Report, Olam has relationships with about 200,000 producers, a number that will increase as part of this investment, including in some post-conflict countries in Africa -	Employment generation. The projects contribute to the creation of formal, non-farming jobs in rural areas where most of the world''s poor live-	Support to local MSMEs that provide goods and services or participate in the marketing of Olam''s products.

title: Jelinak
content: Development impact includes: (i) increasing Croatia''s wind energy capacity by 30MW, from the current level of 180 MW, a 16% increase; (ii) increasing the share of energy from low-carbon sources; (iii) helping Croatia meet EU renewable energy targets in the run-up to accession; and (iv) reducing Croatia''s significant energy dependence.

title: Alibunar WPP
content: IFC''s development impact in this Project includes: (i) Demonstration Effect: Through this Project, which will be one of the first wind farms in Serbia, IFC will be supporting the renewable energy sector in the country and hence will set an example to potential investors and financial institutions;(ii) Increasing Renewable Energy Capacity: The Project envisages adding 42 MW of wind energy capacity in Serbia where the share of coal fired generation constitutes approximately two thirds of total electricity generation; and (iii) Displacement of GHG Emissions: The Project is expected to displace carbon from the country''s thermal generation plants, reduce pollution and contribute to the effort to combat global warming. Once completed the Project is expected to avoid an average annual GHG emission of 48,650 tCO2 (with total GHG avoided estimated at 778,400 tCO2).

title: ACLEDA Lao Loan
content: - Improve access to finance as it will enable ACLEDA Lao to continue providing credit to micro and small borrowers, and SMEs. - Specific indicators will be used to monitor the development impact of the Project include growth in portfolio, growth in number of micro, small and SME borrowers, outreach indicators (branches).

title: Midal Cables Moz
content: 1. Job creation:  The Project will create 220 direct permanent jobs for Mozambican nationals and more indirect jobs in the local supply chain.2. Local value addition to a local product: The project will be the first local downstream manufacturing to add value to a part of Mozambique''s aluminum production at Mozal, which will facilitate development of further local downstream manufacturing using output from the project, and also increase export revenues for the country. 3. Knowledge transfer:  The project will allow the transfer to Mozambique of technical and management know-how of aluminum rod and conductor manufacturing and expand the knowledge base of manufacturing in general.

title: BTPN Loan III
content: 1) Increasing Access to Finance for People at the Base of the Pyramid - Strengthening a strategic partnership with BTPN which has a good business model and presence in all 33 provinces across Indonesia, including underserved rural areas, thus reaching customers at the base of the pyramid with a variety of products.  2) New Product Development - Increasing the Bank''s ability to provide integrated services including "capital to grow'' and "capacity to grow", introduce new products such as agricultural finance, develop new delivery channels (i.e. branchless banking) to reach underserved low income pensioners, MSMEs and women entrepreneurs at the base of the pyramid.3) Empowerment of Women - financing women borrowers through the "productive poor" program to empower them to grow their businesses and support their families.

title: Asyaport
content: The Project will help facilitate trade between Black Sea countries, and Mediterranean and further afield countries, by developing a much-needed new, modern and efficient deepwater transshipment container terminal. This is particularly important given the strong growth forecasts for Black Sea countries, especially Turkey. The project will improve the port infrastructure to facilitate Turkey''s growing share of international trade. In addition, the Project will help Turkey realize future gains from developing water transport, which, when compared to road transport, has lower freight rates, more capacity, lower social costs from less road accidents, and less environmental impact. The Project will also create direct and indirect employment opportunities and increase revenues for the Government of Turkey through increased economic activity and higher tax payments, and royalty and lease payments.

title: BRAC IMPACT VENTURES LIMITED
content: -	Supporting access to affordable and potable drinking water to members of the Base of the Pyramid.-	Provision of cleaner drinking water would contribute to reducing waterborne diseases.-	Reduced Greenhouse Gas Emissions: Through this project a significant amount of GHG is expected to be reduced by replacing the traditional method of boiling water using firewood with water filters.-	Job creation: The company would be creating jobs as a new setup.- Scalable and replicable upon the successful implementation of the project: The sponsor and other players would potentially be able to scale this model as well as replicate it in other parts of the world that has potable water scarcity.

title: New Hope Agriculture and Food Fund II, L.P.
content: (i) Rural reach: By helping grow investee companies within the agricultural and food industry, the Fund will support companies in rural areas, where most of the investee companies will be located - contributing to inclusive growth.(ii) Increased food safety: Help improve operational efficiencies across the agribusinesses supply chains through investments in various parts of the chain, which increases food safety standards.  (iii) Corporate Governance: Having a professional fund investing in unlisted companies will contribute to improved corporate governance standards and transparency of investee companies. (iv) Increased food supply: Increased investments in the agricultural sector will allow to increase efficiency and improve the agribusiness supply chain hence increase the food supply.

title: Equitas ECB
content: 1.	Access to Microfinance by expanding the outreach of Equitas in several of the poorer states in India, where the Company would scale up in the next few years. 2.	Promoting a more balanced growth of microfinance by supporting an institution that has been a front-runner in adopting technology, is amongst the pioneers in best practices on responsible financing, takes a very active part in sector development and is working to provide varied financial services to customer segments which have limited access to formal sources of finance.

title: Ujjivan ECB
content: 1.	Increasing access to finance in low income states in India, including states in the northern and eastern parts of the country which have amongst the highest population densities and poverty rates in the country2.	Promoting a more balanced growth of microfinance by supporting an institution that been a front-runner in adopting technology, is a pioneer in focusing on consumer service and responsible financing and offers customized products for various financial and non financial needs of its members

title: Edyficar IV
content: IFC''s long-term financing is expected to bring high development impact by enhancing Edyficar''s capacity to support productive micro enterprises in rural regions, resulting in higher growth, employment generation and poverty reduction in rural regions of Peru.

title: ABC Capital SME
content: Increased Reach/ Access to SME Finance: SME in Mexico is one of the main pillars of the economy but it continues to lacking competitiveness and development.  Through the proposed investment, IFC would contribute to banking penetration and access to credit in the sector and improve production efficiency;- Job Creation: The  SME sector is a driver of employment in this economy. More funding availability would encourage businesses to produce in larger scales that would require the employment of more people; and- Improvements in Environmental and Social Management: with IFC''s investment the Bank will need to establish a ESMS

title: BR Housing
content: The project is expected to contribute to further development of mortgage market in Georgia, through financing the local bank with much needed longer term funds. The financing, combined with Bank Republic''s well-known local brand, its strong distribution channels, local expertise, and high-quality management, will help Bank Republic broaden access of Georgian individuals to high quality banking services and wider range of products.This investment is to be among very few IFI loans with a 10 year tenor provided to a Georgian bank.

title: ACME Energy
content: 1. Directly increase power generation to bridge India's power supply-demand gap 2. Promote climate change mitigation by supporting renewable energy and reducing GHG emissions  3. Generate employment during project implementation and operation

title: Unigold
content: The proposed investment is an early-stage investment preceding a commercial resource discovery. Generally, exploration projects have limited development impact but even at this early stage, the proposed investment has shown tangible benefits for the surrounding communities. The Project provides some direct employment to rural communities in an IFC Frontier Region, where formal employment opportunities are scarce and poverty levels are high. The majority of employees are Dominican nationals, most of which are members of the community of Restauracion or members of other communities located in the area surrounding the project. Should exploration lead to mine development and production, the developmental impacts from this Project would include revenues to the government, rural development through the creation of direct and indirect employment, continuing economic diversification into a new sector, and an important demonstration effect of how large-scale commercial mining may be developed in accordance with good international industry practice.

title: Sberbank KZ
content: The project''s development impact includes: (i)	increasing access to finance for underserved SMEs in Kazakhstan, including those in the agribusiness, which have suffered from restricted access to finance as a result of the financial crisis, and(ii)	diversification of the Kazakh economy away from dependence on the oil sector through a wider support to the private sector development which is to result in more job creation and life improvement.

title: Multimortgage
content: The project will (i) help support the development of the housing sector in Russia and primary mortgage market; (ii) strengthen the balance sheet of a leading mortgage finance institution that serves as a market model for providing housing finance to individuals; (iii) and will help provide proof of concept and demonstration of a fixed/floating hybrid mortgage product which can be replicated by other institutions.

title: IBEF II
content: i. Support of SMEs: Target investees will include SMEs, which traditionally have been capital constrained with limited access to bank debt or capital markets for financing their growth strategies.ii. Job creation: Investments in SMEs in the growth phase leads to substantial job creation, at a greater rate than the national average.iii. Private sector development: Addition of value to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance and transparency, while providing operational, strategic and financial expertise, support in evaluating new business opportunities and building business partnerships.iv. Incorporating IFC's E&S standards, thereby contributing to sustainable economic development.

title: TEB Kosovo Sh A Subordinated Loan
content: IFC''s expected role in the Project is multifaceted.  Its main role lies in supporting a south-south investment to an IDA country through providing a tier II capital loan to a well managed bank sponsored by a partner well known to IFC with a proven track record.  In particular, through this Project, IFC would:a)	Strengthen the Bank with capital to expand its lending capacity and therefore support access to finance for SMEs; b)	Provide its support to a south-south FDI, provided by a long standing IFC client, in an IDA country which would have a demonstration impact to attract similar type of investments into Kosovo;c)	Further increase competition in the highly concentrated banking sector of Kosovo; andd)	Work together with the Bank to implement best industry practices in sustainable finance such as updating their social and environmental management system.This investment''s direct impact would be to support lending operations of a well managed bank and thus would generate a range of social and economic benefits, including economic growth and employment creation, as well as financial deepening with services and products.

title: Arjaan Erbil
content: The Project will foster the development of business infrastructure in Erbil through (i) providing much needed business infrastructure to the employees of development institutions, diplomats, government workers, NGOs, investors, as well as many private companies that are involved in rebuilding Iraq that frequently use Erbil as their home base during their stay and work in other parts of Iraq; (ii) benefiting the municipal city planning by providing infrastructure for business development such as conference rooms and business centers; (iii) creating outsourcing opportunities, (iv) creating employment (around 110 employees); and (v) extensive hotel training that will be provided by Rotana prior to and during operations, which is expected to enhance the overall service quality standards for the hospitality industry in the region.

title: Palma Guinea
content: Business infrastructure development/Opening of Conakry as a travel destination: The Project will support the development of a  high-standard hotel, which will help Guinea''s capital city  address growing demand for quality hotel accommodation driven by increasing business travel and the emerging conference activities sector. Furthermore, the availability of a high-quality hotel is expected to become a driver for more travel (both business and conference) to Conakry in its own right, contributing to the development of the city into a regional center.Best practice transfer: The Project is expected to support transfer of best international business practices to Guinea, especially in such areas as (i) real estate development; (ii) hotel management; (iii) management of environmental, social life and fire safety issues; (iv) business ethics, transparency and integrity in dealing with employees, business partners, authorities and other stakeholders. Employment generation: The investment will create significant local direct employment of about 400 and indirect employment in the supply value chain.Linkages to the local economy: The Project hotel will seek to establish linkages with the local economy, specifically in such areas, as the supply of food products and the procurement of services (e.g. transportation).Encouragement of investment activity in Guinea/Demonstration effect: The Project will have a demonstration effect by encouraging other international and regional players to pursue investment opportunities in Guinea as this IDA post-conflict country works to improve the business climate, facilitate greater foreign direct investment inflows and diversify its economy from the natural resource-based sectors.

title: Santillana
content: - Promote innovation in education through an attractive B2B model with potential for system-wide impact.- Facilitate adoption of digital teaching systems in the "mass market", including both private and, eventually, public schools, by bringing costs down as product penetration expands.- Improve quality  and relevance through the provision of tools with high potential to improve teaching practices and by focusing on promoting bilingualism and providing the school with specific tools to develop 21st century skills.- Contribute to generating evidence about the potential of digital teaching systems to improve learning outcomes.

title: ENN Energy
content: (1)	Increase the accessibility of natural gas beyond the reach of gas pipelines by building an LNG distribution infrastructure independent of traditional piped gas distribution;(2)	Contribute to the development of an LNG vehicle market by making LNG available along major transportation lines while LNG availability has been the major bottleneck hindering the growth of the sector; (3)	Help to reduce local pollution and GHG emissions by promoting the use of natural gas as a cleaner alternative fuel to diesel and gasoline in the transport sector;(4)	Increase competiveness of small enterprises by providing a cost competitive transportation fuel for truck and long-haul bus owners, most of whom are individuals or families from the rural area; and(5)	Increasing employment through the creation of a LNG fueling station network.

title: GTST Ethiopia Trade Facility
content: The proposed investment will have significant development impacts as follows:(a) Maintain the availability of trade finance for trade businesses in Ethiopia. The Project is expected to finance about US$ 1 billion of imports of oil products to Ethiopia per year. This will ensure stability in supply of energy products into an IDA economy.(b) Ensuring availability of energy products is critical for retail and industrial consumption, power and transportation sectors. (c) Support to Private Sector - The facility will indirectly support the business activities of private marketing and distribution companies in the downstream oil sector.

title: TFG Equity 2013
content: i)	To support the development of Mongolian financial sector: through the proposed investment, IFC will help a systemically important financial institution of Mongolia to introduce a strategic international investor and to achieve a more balanced and transparent shareholding structure, which will become a strong basis for the Company''s further development and will also benefit the further development of the Mongolian financial sector; andii)	To promote better corporate governance among Mongolian corporations: after the completion of the transaction, Tenger Financial Group will achieve a more transparent corporate governance, which will have strong demonstration effect to other Mongolian corporations and will promote the improvement of their corporate governance.

title: QDJason Electric
content: - Technology development: Support the development and application of a specialized LED technology that could transform the way the world approaches sterilization and sanitation, Four million people die every year from waterborne diseases. The vast majority of them live in developing countries. DUV LED presents a non-chemical, low energy use (energy efficient), and non toxic (non mercury) alternative to sanitation.- Employment: as the Company continues to expand, it is expected to create additional employment opportunities, both in manufacturing of LED chips and more importantly, help to create a generation of experts in China with deep specialized knowledge in a niche market. - Environmental improvements and climate change mitigation: the Project supports the development of a technology that will have an important impact on CO2 reduction as well as through the replacement of toxic mercury arc lamps.

title: WCSS AB Bank BSLF III
content: -	Financial Sector Deepening: The Project will enable ABBL to access foreign currency funding and compete on a level-playing field with foreign banks that have the benefit of parent funding. The IFC funding will also encourage other international banks / FIs to lend to local banks in Bangladesh.-	Demonstration Effect: The demonstration effect of IFC financing will encourage foreign banks to fund the local banking sector and increase the range and availability of financing options in the market.

title: CFPA MFI Loan
content: The Project is expected to achieve a high development impact by: (i) increasing access to finance by supporting CFPA MFI to further expand its microfinance business; (ii)  supporting CFPA MFI in expanding its micro credit operations to more rural customers, in particular the rural women at BOP.

title: Rubliovskiy III
content: Benefits to consumers: By enhancing its retail chain, the Group will be able to provide access to a more diverse selection of high-quality, affordable products than most Belarusian consumers currently have access to. Stronger bargaining positions vis-a-vis suppliers, economies of scale achieved through geographical expansion, as well as improved inventory management, will allow for cost savings, which eventually can be passed on to the end customer;Supply chain development: The Group''s expansion will (i) increase the number of its local suppliers, (ii) provide additional sales channels for local producers and importers, as well as (iii) contribute to improvements in efficiency and operating standards throughout the supply chain.Employment generation: The Project will provide additional direct employment for approximately 2,500 people 80% of whom are expected to be women. Five of the Project stores will be greenfield construction projects, so temporary jobs will be created during the construction phase. In addition, indirect employment will be created in the retail value chain.Best practice transfer: The Project is expected to facilitate the transfer of modern retail techniques to Belarusian regions and to enhance the efficiency of the supply chain in the country. The Project will also create a standard for employee training and development across the country.Demonstration effect: The Project will have a demonstration effect by encouraging other companies in the region, as well as Western investors, to pursue investment opportunities in Belarus as the country tries to improve its business climate and facilitate greater inflows of foreign direct investment. In addition, the Project will have a demonstration effect for private sector activity in general by showing the capacity of a private sector company to meet effectively and professionally the needs of the population in a predominantly state-dominated economy.

title: NDB Loan Package
content: Three decades of conflict in the past had limited the Sri Lankan government''s capacity to support the SME sector and thereby to allocate crucial resources to boost lagging incomes. The proposed project will help in addressing this constraint by funding the Bank''s operations/expansion and promoting financial inclusion by means of financing of SMEs.The proposed project would facilitate private sector development via access to credit for growing SMEs in Sri Lanka. Given the importance of SMEs in Sri Lanka, the cascading effect of this finance would go a long way in creating employment, reducing poverty and stimulating the economy.

title: Lereko Metier Sustainable Capital Fund Trust
content: The Fund is expected to have significant development impact on its investees by:i) Reduction of CO2 and other GHGs by investing in renewable energy and cleaner technology projects, thus contributing to a reduction in carbon emissions;ii) Supporting business focusing on climate change and clean technology;iii) Supporting regional developmental objectives and environmental commitments toward investment into clean and efficient energy, water and waste sectors;iv) Stimulating job creation by supporting job growth in new sectors;v) Implementing best practice ESG at both the Fund and investee level.

title: Protelindo
content: The project is expected to have a number of development impacts, including the following: 1) improved access to and quality of mobile network in rural areas; 2) convergence of mobile broadband with other sectors which can improve content and applications such as mobile finance; 3) upgrade in business practice and local staff development by bringing global tower industry standards to Indonesia; and 4) increased tower sharing which reduces the visual burden of multiple towers and the carbon footprint of the industry.

title: I&M II
content: i.	Enhance access to finance for SMEs and the agribusiness sector: The Project will allow I&M to grow its SME and agribusiness portfolio and provide these two crucial segments of the economy with access to longer term funding, enabling them to undertake investment projects with more appropriate financing structures.ii.	Generate a demonstration effect: The Project is expected to lead other financial institutions take a more active role in the SME and agribusiness financing arena, thus increasing access to finance for these priority sectors.iii.	Enhancing regional competition and service.  The project will contribute to the success of the East African economic community by supporting a systemic local bank that has a growing regional footprint.

title: SolTuna Expansion
content: (i) Capturing more value in-country.  IFC''s support is expected to substantially increase the amount of tuna that is processed onshore in Solomon Islands, thereby helping the country retain greater value-add from its own tuna resources and thus further benefitting the local economy.(ii) Domestic food security.  IFC''s involvement in the Project is expected to help contribute to domestic food security.  (iii) Job creation.  The Project is expected to help create additional jobs and skills training in the broader fisheries and fish processing supply chain. (iv) Generation of tax revenues.  The Project is expected to generate additional tax revenues for the Solomon Islands government.

title: Suryoday
content: 1.	Access to Microfinance: This project will help in expanding the outreach of access to microfinance to borrowers who have little or no access to formal sources of financing with Suryoday expected to provide financing to more than 1 million women borrowers in the next 3-5 years2.	Balanced growth of Microfinance: This project will promote a more balanced growth of microfinance in India. Suryoday''s operations are expanding in Western India where MFI penetration has historically been low

title: Noyan
content: The proposed Project has significant development impact including the following:(i)  Support of the development of Armenian agriculture, a sector which is the largest employer in Armenia;(ii) It would also help promote export-oriented manufacturing, generating hard currency revenues;(iii) Job creation;(iv) Linkage to the farmers: as a result of expanded production, the Company is expected to increase the number of farmers supplying agricultural products from app. 570 to around 740. The project would have significant positive trickle down effects on farmers who can increase their sales and revenues by supplying agricultural products to Euroterm

title: Minerva Beef
content: (i) E&S Standards: The Project will support the implementation of an environmental and social action plan to address the environmental impacts of the cattle industry in Brazil, Colombia, Paraguay and Uruguay which if successful will result in an important demonstration effect in the sector. Minerva will put together a pilot project (with IFC's support) to enhance its traceability programs. If successful, this involvement will be a paradigm change in the region.(ii) Farmers (Ranchers) Reached: Minerva is one of the largest cattle producers, and one of the largest buyers in the region.  It currently purchases approximately 1.7 million head of cattle per year from 9,000 ranchers, but with this expansion (especially into new foreign markets), Minerva expects to increase its rancher supply base by around 30%.(iii) Employment: Minerva employs approximately 10,000 full time staff.  The expansion will create significant employment opportunities, expected to exceed 4,000 additional jobs in total, especially in rural areas that need non-farm economic opportunities.(iv) South-South Investment: The Project will also support the further South-South expansion of one of the most efficient companies in the sector and support the improvement of the institutional environment in Colombia and Paraguay.

title: DARP SPV CC
content: The development impact of IFC''s investment in this Project is expected to be high given that:  - Allow financial intermediaries in Colombia and Peru to offload their NPLs, and therefore improve their liquidity and capacity to originate new loans.- Through the appropriate resolution of NPLs, the project would allow a large number of individuals to be able to avoid loosing their assets (their homes in most cases) and ultimately to re-enter the banking system.- The proposed investment would contribute to the further development of the Distressed Assets market in Emerging Markets, resulting in an increase of both the number of NPL transactions and the players, in this market.

title: DTBU Tier I & II
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact in the following measurable areas:1. Increasing credit availability to the SMEs. 2. Supporting job creation through providing long term financing to the SMEs.3. Growth in bank''s profitability, which is expected to be achieved through strengthening DTBU''s capital base, resulting in higher taxes to the Government.5. Demonstration effect/market transformation through DTBU''s continued lending to the target segment beyond the life of the Project.

title: DTBT Tier I & II
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact in the following measurable areas:1. Increasing credit availability to the SMEs. 2. Supporting job creation through providing long term financing to the SMEs.3. Growth in bank''s profitability which is expected to be achieved through strengthening DTBT''s capital base, and as a result higher taxes to the Government.5. Demonstration effect/market transformation through DTBT''s continued lending to the target segment beyond the life of the Project.

title: CustomCapitalSPV
content: 1. Increased access to finance: IFC''s investment will enable the company increase access to finance for SMEs, its major clients. Access to equipment finance benefits SME''s by improving their cash management and operational efficiency.2. Catalytic role: IFC will help to demonstrate the strength of Custom Capital business and enable it to build the two to three year track record required to successfully access the capital markets and broaden its investor base. The transaction would further provide a demonstration effect and further establish SME leases as an asset class in the South African capital market.

title: Cventures Primus
content: (i)	Private sector development: The Fund will provide equity capital to help promote growth and improve revenue and profitability of the Fund's SME investees, and help support the venture capital industry in Brazil.(ii)	Economic sustainability: demonstrated through the Fund's ability to help its investees grow sustainably and generate employment growth faster than the national average.  Cventures Ecosystem today has created thousands of jobs, a significant number of which are skilled jobs;(iii)	Financial success: evidenced by the Fund's investment return (net IRR).(iv)	Narrowing the gap of funding for early-stage companies: Despite the existence of innovative technologies, well established research centers/incubators and young companies in Brazil, there exists a gap in funding for early-stage companies in Brazil.  There are limited venture investors for IT/telecom and internet in Brazil, and beyond that sector there is a dearth of venture capital funds. Demonstrating that investments in early-stage companies in cleantech, biotech, education tech/digital media sectors is profitable should lead to increased inflow of much needed private capital for these sectors in Brazil.(v)	Reduction of CO2 and other GHGs:  The Fund is expected to invest a portion of its investments in clean technology companies, thus contributing to a reduction in carbon emissions.

title: Izsu Wastewater
content: Increased wastewater treatment capacity at Cigli is expected to:- avoid overflows, benefiting the environment by reducing the risks associated with the discharge of untreated effluents;- treat the additional wastewater that will be generated by urban growth in Izmir;- allow Izsu to shut down the prior phases of Cigli WWTP, one at a time rerouting wastewater flow, to complete mandatory maintenance, as several facility assets are past their useful life;- help Turkey progress towards compliance with EU environmental standards for wastewater treatment.

title: Lakeshore Capital
content: The Fund would help private sector development by supporting growth and operational improvement of its portfolio companies. Lakeshore I is also expected to improve the portfolio company's long term sustainability through the implementation of IFC's environmental and social standards. Lakeshore I would support private equity investments in the Fund's target country and thus it would help develop the financial markets in Thailand. Through the investments, the Fund is also expected to create jobs.

title: DTBK Tier II
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact in the following measurable areas:1-Increasing credit availability to the SMEs and Very Small Enterprises (VSEs); 2-Supporting job creation through the financing SME and VSEs. The VSEs are a high impact sector, which has low access to finance. Financing this sub-segment helps create opportunities to achieving more balanced growth;3-Increase access to finance to VSEs, including women businesses, which are currently critically underserved in terms of access to finance;4. Capacity building to help the bank to service VSEs on a sustainable basis; and  6. Demonstration effect/market transformation through DTBK''s continued lending to the target segment beyond the life of the Project.

title: Copeval
content: Copeval is having a significant developmental impact by efficiently providing pre-harvest financing to farmers operating in rural areas (including recently developed agricultural regions) making a significant contribution to Chile''s rural economic development as well as to global food security.  Copeval currently reaches more than 30,000 farmers through its network of stores strategically located across all Chile''s agricultural regions. Copeval''s main impacts include: (i) providing farmers with training, advisory, certifications services and technical support; and (ii) contributing to rural economic development through linkages with agricultural MSMEs, farmers, and local rural communities in the surrounding rural frontier regions where the Company operates.Copeval currently sponsors different programs that provide support to small producers, including programs for enhancing the productivity and quality of suppliers, assistance in the implementation of quality certifications, advice in feasibility studies for the implementation of irrigation services, supporting entrepreneurship and encouraging the integration of small producers to the agro-industrial chain.  The training services include sessions for agricultural good practices, pesticides handling, treatment of plagues and diseases, operation and maintenance of irrigation systems and agricultural machinery. During 2012, Copeval provided assistance to about 3,900 farmers from the region of Coquimbo to Los Lagos.

title: Denizbank Covered Bond
content: - Capital Markets Development: Successful issuance by Denizbank would provide additional momentum to Turkey''s capital markets by replicating the first two transactions by Sekerbank and Yapikredi.- Access to Finance for MSMEs: Help strenghten the newly opened covered bond market in Turkey and allow banks (including tier 2 banks) to raise long-term funding from domestic and international investors in order to finance MSME''s especially in the agribusiness sector.

title: Samara region
content: The Project will improve access and quality of essential social infrastructure in Samara Region by increasing the number, capacity and quality of education facilities. With the implementation of the Project the coverage of children with preschool education will increase from 64% to 66% and the total waiting list for preschool education services will decrease by 6%. Around 7.000 students of primary and secondary schools will achieve access to modern learning spaces.The Project is also expected to contribute to female inclusion in the workforce by creating direct jobs for preschool educators and caregivers and increasing labor force participation for young mothers.

title: Chalybs Cylinders Ltd
content: Technology transfer: As a leading producer of seamless cylinders for the storage of high-pressure gases, Faber uses state-of-the-art technologies and efficient processes, which will be installed in Thailand. Local staff will be trained to a new, highly competitive standard in manufacturing processes and management.  While most gas tanks are made with welded cylinders, Faber produces seamless cylinders using precision technology that empties out a steel profile into a shell and seals it into a tank shape. Faber has developed its own safety control processes.Climate change: Compared with traditional vehicles, compressed natural gas (CNG) vehicles provide for reductions in carbon monoxide emissions of 90% to 97%, and in carbon dioxide emissions of about 20%. Other environmental benefits: Combustion of natural gas rather than gasoline in vehicles results in reduced emissions of toxic and carcinogenic compounds and virtually eliminates particulate emissions.Import substitution/improved access to CNG vehicles: Currently automotive plants in Thailand import high-quality, seamless cylinder parts that are not locally available. The Project''s production will lead to import substitution and contribute to the country''s economic growth. Improved access to CNG vehicles will translate into higher incomes for micro, small and medium enterprises and taxi operators, based on lower operating cost of CNG vehicles, which will contribute to inclusive growth.Job creation: The Project is expected to create direct and indirect jobs in Thailand.

title: African Development Partners II LP
content: The Fund will achieve development impact by:i) Investing in high-growth companies, which is expected to lead to above-average rates of job creation;ii) Supporting regional integration by expanding investee companies into neighboring countries to build 'regional champions';iii) Providing much needed growth and expansion capital and value enhancing advice to companies located throughout Africa (mainly IDA countries); and,iv) Improving companies' sustainable development by helping to implement best practice corporate governance and environmental and social standards.

title: DiViNetworks
content: - Increased broadband penetration:  the Company''s expansion and the nature of its products will further support the increase in broadband penetration, particularly, in Sub Saharan Africa region where it is still much lower than in other emerging markets.- Cost reduction:  DiViNetworks'' products substantially reduce the cost of international which is very high in emerging markets compared to developed countries. - Promoted innovation: the Company''s broadband data solutions are truly innovative and exclusive in many aspects.- Increased economic growth:  it is well documented that increased broadband penetration has a direct impact on economic growth; further, broadband supports virtually every sector of the as well as facilitates the transparency and accountability of governments.

title: Zhaoheng Hydropower Holdings Ltd.
content: a)	Support hydro power development: Despite significant hydro power potential, the country is at a nascent stage in terms of harnessing this abundant resource for power generation. The Project is expected to help demonstrate the viability of small-scale hydro power generation in China and thus help attract further investments into this sub-sector.  b)	Support climate change mitigation:  The Project is expected to displace fossil fuel based power stations, helping reduce local air pollutants, improving air quality for the local population, reducing global greenhouse gas emissions and contributing to climate change mitigation. c)	Private sector development. The project will develop critical infrastructure to end-users, while adding more capacity in new private hydro power generation.d)	Benefits to the Government: Development of this project will support GoC''s long term energy security policy. Additionally, the project will generate income taxes which will be paid over the life of IFC''s investment.e)	Benefits to Customers: Demand for electricity in China is expected to grow in the medium to long term, in line with expected GDP growth. The increase in energy supply will serve not only individuals, but also industrial clients.

title: TSKB Pol. Abatem
content: The project is expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of the resource efficiency project investments. Specifically, IFC''s investment would: (i) improve the competitiveness of the Turkish economy by increasing the utilization of the energy, water and raw materials more efficiently; (ii) develop resource efficiency investment projects across all sectors;  and (iii) improve the local as well as the global environment through reduced emissions of conventional pollutants and GHGs.

title: Ingenio Montelimar
content: - Support Nicaragua''s economic growth and employment generation, in particular in poor rural areas, by increasing exports of locally sourced product. - The Company will support vulnerable families in the process of titling their land.- The Project will contribute to financial transparency since the Company will hire an auditing firm satisfactory to IFC.- The Project will increase employment in the rural area of an IDA country by an estimated 1,300 new jobs.

title: Pronaca Agro
content: (i) Farmers reach: Pronaca supports the activities of about 3,000 farmers. As an input to its operations, Pronaca buys about 40 percent of the country''s corn production. It also works together with the Government under an initiative called "Inclusive Business Program", a program that supports small farmers in increasing land productivity by providing technical assistance and financing for the purchase of certified seeds and inputs. It also ensures the purchase of their products (guaranteed volume and prices) via purchase agreements (849 farmers under this program).(ii) MSME development: Currently, Pronaca purchases about US$340 million from domestic suppliers, out of which over 90 percent are considered MSMEs. In addition, the Company supplies over 65,000 small retailers across the country with its products, thus supporting a vast supply chain, which is mostly composed of MSMEs.(iii) Downstream reach: Pronaca serves over 75,000 clients across the country directly and indirectly, through 43 exclusive distributors. By supporting Pronaca''s growth, the Project will generate business downstream.(iv) E&S best practices: Pronaca places high value on conducting its business in a sustainable manner and follows IFC''s best practices in E&S matters, being an example to the sector players in Ecuador.

title: Daycoval Debt
content: The Project will increase access to finance to SMEs, at the same time that it fosters a competitive environment in the Brazilian banking sector. It will also help the Bank maintain and expand its lending to SMEs in the frontier regions of Brazil. Finally, the Bank will be required to enhance its management of environmental and social risks through improvement of capacity and training.

title: BSP Senior Loan
content: IFC''s role is expected to encompass the following: (i)	providing the Bank with a long-term USD loan, enabling it to expand its USD lending program to serve increasing USD demand from PNG clients with USD receivables but a limited access to USD funding;  (ii) demonstrating confidence in and support for the largest and only indigenous bank in PNG implementing its long-term strategic goals of regional and increasing access to finance for local businesses which are drivers of future economic growth and employment creation; (iii) IFC''s long-term loan will also help the Bank reducing maturity mismatch as majority of BSP''s deposit base are short-term; and (iv) mobilize the syndication fund to provide much needed long-term liquidity support to BSP, helping the leading bank to maintain long-term financial sustainability given very limited available capital in the market.The Project is expected to measure the following development impact: (i) at least 412,000 loans disbursed by the Bank during the life of Project from a baseline of 51,864 loans disbursed during 2012; and (ii) the USD volume of outstanding loans reaches USD4,450 million by the end of 2020 (10% average annual growth) from a baseline of USD2,345 million as of December 31, 2012.

title: Prasac Subdebt
content: - Supporting access to credit for Bottom of Pyramid borrowers- Improving market confidence: The proposed debt will not only have a positive impact on Prasac''s capitalization, but also on the market as a whole as it will enhance prospects of mobilizing additional long term funding from other investors- Specific indicators will be used to measure and monitor the development impact of the Project, include additional borrowers, additional women borrowers, additional capital mobilized for lending, ROE & EROE, outreach indicators (branches)

title: CPLF- Hikal
content: 1) Carbon footprint/ climate change:  The Project will replace furnace oil with a cleaner biomass based fuel. This is expected to achieve significant reduction in furnace oil consumption and GHG emissions.2) Support to innovative "green" process: By promoting the enzymatic process, the Project will help in establishing more environmentally sustainable manufacturing processes for pharmaceuticals and chemicals. 3) Demonstration effects: Hikal''s cleaner production process can be expected to have a positive demonstration effect on its competitors, thus encouraging other Indian pharmaceutical and chemical companies to improve competitiveness and environmental standards.4) Quantifiable water savings: The proposed effluent recirculation is expected to result in significant water savings of around 495 m3 of water per day.

title: Itau Gender
content: 1) The Project intends to increase the financial inclusion to women-owned enterprises and therefore their access to credit and overall economic power;2) Increase access to finance to SMEs throughout Brazil;3) The partnership of Itau and IFC is expected to have a demonstration effect of the business opportunity presented by women-owned enterprises as an under-served market in Brazil.

title: PR Bank Equity
content: The most significant impacts of this investment are expected to be: (1) strengthening the micro and small business sector (particularly in rural areas) by increasing access to finance for SMEs, micro-entrepreneurs and agricultural borrowers; and (2) contributing to the strengthening of corporate governance standards and environmental and social management in the Philippine thrift and rural banking sector

title: Compar GT Loan
content: (i) Supporting microfinance: The Project will help support an institution that provides financial services to the underserved regions of Guatemala by providing it with stable and diversified funding to expand its operations, enchanced capacity and increased outreach; (ii) Demonstration effects: The Project will demonstrate the attractiveness of a commercial microfinance institution as many standalone entities are NGO-backed; the Company''s success should encourage best practices and the development of a broader array of microfinance products; (iii) Enhance financial access: in a number of frontier regions in Guatelama with large indigenous populations; (iv) Poverty reduction through entrepeneurship.

title: Afrimax Limited
content: Private Sector Development:  Through participation in the Project, IFC will support one of the emerging private players in Africa broadband telecommunication sector thereby contributing to further development of the business entrepreneurship on the continent. Promotion of Regional Integration in Submarine Cable Broadband Markets: The submarine cable networks along the African coast are currently not fully utilized, and Afrimax'' operations will facilitate the ultimate deployment of international broadband capacity generated by these networks.  Ultimately, it will result in reduction in wholesale and retail bandwidth costs for business and individual consumers.Further Economic Growth: According to the World Bank studies, a 10% increase in broadband penetration supplies a 1.5% increase to GDP.  Further, broadband impacts various sectors including education, health care, financial services as well as government activities.  Therefore, the Project will indirectly contribute to further economic growth in the countries of operation.

title: PT Panca Amara Utama
content: 1) Enhancement of food security: The project will introduce a new supplier of a critical nutrient that is essential for improving farm productivity. This is expected to improve the supply in the regional ammonia market and therefore directly and/or indirectly help address the increasing challenges of affordable and sufficient food supply.2) Local Value Addition and Creation of Export Revenues: The proposed project would contribute towards value addition taking place within Indonesia and create significant export revenues for Indonesia. 3) Job Creation and Community Development: The Project will create quality employment opportunities in the Central Sulawesi province of Indonesia.  The Project is expected to create about 350 direct jobs during operation and 2,000 indirect jobs.  Indirect jobs are expected to arise from opportunities created for local contractors engaged in regular maintenance and repair activities for the Project, transportation, food supply and other activities associated with the Project.  In addition, the Company will provide social infrastructure and professional training to its personnel. 4) SME Development Impact: Chemical and petrochemical projects typically create a large number of downstream jobs and entrepreneurial opportunities in segments such as trading, logistics and transportation. The proposed Project is expected to have a significant multiplier effect through the creation and growth of supporting SME businesses.

title: Kenya Commercial Bank III
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact in the following areas: (i) Increasing access to finance and extending tenors of credit facilities to a number of key sectors for the economy namely, SMEs, agribusiness and housing. As these sectors grow, their need for longer term funding for capital investment has increased over time.(ii) Enhancing competition in the banking sector in Kenya, by supporting a systemic local bank that serves crucial yet largely underserved sectors in the economy; and (iii) Supporting the development of a robust regional banking platform which is essential for the successful economic integration of the newly created East African economic community.

title: ETC Group
content: The proposed project will allow ETC to expand its operations and will have important development impacts. In particular: (i) ETC will (a) offer larger financially viable outlets for some 60,000 small farmers and help reduce post-harvest losses while improving product quality; and (b) contribute to the creation of more efficient regional markets for agro-commodities in Eastern and Southern Africa; (ii) employment creation; (iii) significant revenues are expected to accrue to rural communities as the result of increased commodity purchases and linkages with local businesses and small-sized contractors in rural areas will contribute to spur economic growth; and (iv) there will be incremental income tax for project host governments.

title: Country Bird
content: The project''s expected development impact includes: (i) higher efficiency, quality and best practise bio-security standards transfer by a leading regional poultry player in the region; (ii) SME development through increased outgrowers and distributor network; (iii) supply chain development through investments in agro allied businesses; (iv) creation of additional direct and indirect jobs; (v) improved food security in the investment countries; and (vi) increased tax revenues to Governments

title: KCB Uganda LTF
content: 1.	Access to Finance - Housing: IFC financing will allow KCB Uganda to grow its mortgage business and increase access to affordable housing in Uganda; 2.	Strengthening of Uganda''s banking sector: Introduction of long-term funding will add to the sector''s stability by lowering maturity risk and ultimately contribute towards lowering interest rates, and thereby making mortgages more affordable. 3.	Enhancing competition in Uganda''s banking sector: IFC''s investment will help KCB Uganda grow its market share and thus reduce the dominance of larger banks, and improving the industry''s stability. This will also increase competition and lead to improved service offerings for customers.4.	Increased regional integration: By supporting KCB''s operations in Uganda, IFC will be enhancing competition and services in the regional banking sector thus contributing to the success of the newly created East Africa Community.

title: HEM
content: -This transaction would represent IFC''s first education transaction in Morocco.Demonstration Effect: Supporting a private educational institute that achieves E4E objectives including the provision of quality education geared towards market needs.Scalability: Facilitating regional expansion of a quality private services provider with a scalable model to increase student reach by more than 1.5 times over the next 10 years.Increase Access: to relevant higher education to lower income students and youth in remote cities through comparatively more affordable tuition, thereby increasing number of youth holding relevant skills needed by the market, including soft skills, improving their employment prospects.

title: Is Leasing EE/RE
content: The Project''s development impact is expected to be high, as it generates a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of sustainable energy finance and related investments. Specifically, the Project would: (i)	develop sustainable energy investments across all industry sectors; (ii)	improve the competitiveness of the Turkish economy by increasing the number of sustainable energy end-users and lenders; (iii)	improve the local as well as the global environment through reduced emissions of greenhouse gases and other conventional pollutants and reduce the country''s dependence on imports of fossil fuels and natural gas; and(iv)	improve quality of life through reduced pollution and healthier living conditions.

title: Indusval Agro
content: The Projects is expected to:-	Increase access to finance to farmers;-	Assist Indusval to expand its reach, maintaining and increasing lending to farmers, including farmers in frontier regions; and-	Finally, as part of this project, Indusval will be required to enhance its ESMS to encompass E&S screening against the IFC Exclusion List, the Brazilian E&S laws and regulations and the Performance Standards.

title: Luminus
content: The expected development impact is expected to include the following:- Create a demonstration effect of successful TVET model with strong link to labor market needs.- Expanded access and quality of vocational provision with direct impact on unemployment.- Increased number of students reached in the region.- Successful implementation of expansion in Lebanon will send a positive signal for further south-south investments.

title: Bank Muscat Eq CF
content: The project is expected to have strong development impact by: (1) increasing access to finance for SMEs in a sub-region/country where SMEs have exceptionally limited access to finance; (ii) increasing access to finance for women entrepreneurs; (iii) supporting job creation sectors as SMEs account for around 10-40% of all jobs in MENA; (iv) facilitating broad economic and social impact as the increased level of home ownership (especially among young prospective home owners) will contribute to improve living standards in the country and lead to greater social support; (v) promoting regional integration & knowledge sharing through advisory services.

title: Munich Re Surety Facility
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to be threefold: i) the Project will provide a significant multiplicative effect estimated to help lever project capacity by a substantial factor to support infrastructure projects over the Project life by way of surety bonds; ii) it will launch an innovative pilot facility to support developing country risk transfer in the reinsurance industry that acts as a back-stop for infrastructure risks in the economy; and iii) the Project will have important demonstration effect in further improving the practice of environmental, social and reputation risk management.

title: Petroceltic
content: (i)	Meeting Domestic Demand for Gas: Further exploration, appraisal and development of domestic gas resources will provide cleaner and affordable energy for further development of the industrial and power sectors in Egypt and Bulgaria, help to meet domestic gas demand and slow the pace of natural decline in production in Egypt, and reduce dependency on gas imports and its burden on the balance of payments in Bulgaria.(ii)	Contribution to Government Revenues: The IFC financing will be used largely to fund developments aimed at prolonged production of gas from mature fields in Egypt and Bulgaria, positively impacting the revenues that the respective governments will receive.(iii)	 Employment: The project will create / preserve local employment with mainly high skilled jobs which will contribute to local skill development by providing opportunities to young workers / students.(iv)	Private Sector Development: The project will support one of the very few private junior oil and gas companies operating in Algeria and provide a positive signal to other junior companies seeking to invest in the country.

title: MBK Ventura
content: 1. Increasing access to finance for people at the base of the pyramid: MBK targets to reach at least one million poor women by 2017.  The proposed IFC investment and technical assistance will support MBK in achieving its targets.2. Women Empowerment: Increase access to finance women borrowers and hence empower women to have greater ability to grow their businesses and support their families. It is expected that MBK will employ women staff close to 3,200 by 2017.

title: Axzon A/S
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to (i) support an efficient producer with a solid track record to expand EU standards of livestock production, showcase biogas plants, energy efficiency, clean production, and animal welfare to new farms in Ukraine;(ii) contribute to the modernization of the under-developed pork sector in Ukraine; (iii) support frontier regions in Ukraine by developing creating jobs in rural areas, and contributing to local community; and(iv) contribute to regional and global food security by expanding primary production of crops and animal proteins.

title: Viamericas
content: i. Viamericas enables low cost, expedient, money transfer services to millions of low income families in Latin America. In the ten largest US to LAC remittance corridor countries, the cost of a remittance transfer through Viamericas is up to 40% below the cost of other major providers. A significant number of beneficiaries are in rural areas where remittances serve as the main, if not only, source of income.ii. Viamericas leverages its payout network to extend the reach of financial services to unbanked populations in LAC for opening and funding of bank accounts, buying pre-paid payment cards, etc.iii. Viamericas employs more than 70% of its employees in Colombia and Mexico, in areas such as accounting & finance, legal & compliance and technology services and company plans to more than double its staff in these countries over next three years. IFC''s investment will create additional employment opportunities for highly skilled staff in these markets.

title: Ratnakar Bank
content: Increased access to finance for Micro, Small, Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) sector - The investment will support RBL focus on growing its business in the micro, small and medium businesses, and agriculture sectors. By FY 2016, RBL intends to grow advances to Micro & Small Enterprises segment from INR 400 mn in FY12 to INR 4,500 mn. Also, the Joint Liability Group (JLG) loans is expected to increase from INR 230 mn in FY 12 to INR 10 bn in FY 16. The bank''s growth strategy also involves increasing its women borrowers from around 10,350 in FY12 to 450,000 in FY16.

title: Amakhala Wind
content: The project will: (i) promote additional employment and skills development during construction and operation; (ii) diversify South Africa''s energy mix; (iii) reduce carbon emissions by producing green, emission-free electricity; (iv) contribute to increased generation capacity in South Africa (as part of the planned system expansion); (v) contribute to the upliftment of local communities, through financial benefits flowing from a 5% carried shareholding to be held via two local community trusts; and (vi)provide positive demonstration effects in South Africa and the neighboring countries, as one of the initial large wind projects in the region.

title: Aura Solar
content: The Project will contribute an additional 30 MW towards Mexico''s  stated  target of achieving at least 35% penetration of renewable energy and other "clean" power generation sources in its energy matrix by 2025.  Given its location in Baja California Sur (BCS) and the State''s current energy matrix, the Project will substitute the carbon-intensive HFO and diesel -fired power generation delivered to approx 160,0000 inhabitants with a clean, renewable energy source, and will displace approx. 60,000 tons of CO2 emissions annually.  By reducing the reliance on imports of fossil fuels to BCS, the Project is also expected to significantly reduce environmental risks associated with transporting such fossil fuels through environmentally sensitive areas,  such as the Sea of Cortez . In addition, the Project is estimated to generate approx. 150-200 direct-employment positions during its construction period.

title: FIRST
content: (i) Encouraging economic/private sector development and job growth in the underserved frontier regions of Brazil; (ii) Improved Corporate Governance and Demon-stration Effects; (iii) Specific impact on low income households per sector (e.g. patients served for the health companies or students reached for education companies) in support of IDGs.

title: DHFL Loan
content: Increased Access to Finance for the Low and Middle Income segments: These segments are characterized by low ticket sizes and are not an area of focus for majority of banks and housing finance companies. DHFL is one of the very few HFCs operating on a significant scale in  this market through reliance on robust methods of credit assessment.

title: Khan Bank Debt
content: (i)  Increasing access to finance:  IFC''s investment will help Mongolia''s largest bank to grow its SME and corporate business through both funding and capacity building. Expansion of the bank''s loan portfolio will reach more customers through its largest network in Mongolia and support its existing clients;(ii) Stronger funding position: The project will enhance the funding position of a systemically important bank in Mongolia and support to grow; and(iii) Support the system: Supporting a systemic bank will convey positive signals and boost the confidence in the financial sector.

title: Snowman - IV
content: The Project involves the expansion of one of the few organized operators in the TCL industry in India and is expected to have the following key development impacts: (a) Development of critical infrastructure: The Project involves the building of efficient storage and distribution infrastructure, which is currently lacking in the Indian agriculture supply chain. The expansion will help to lower logistics costs and reduce product wastage in the agriculture sector in India.(b) Frontier (LIS) growth: Part of the investment for the Project will take place in the low-income state of Orissa; (c) Enhancing competitiveness: The Project will strengthen the competitive advantage of an emerging logistics player, helping them become a market leader; (d) Demonstration effect: IFC''s investment will have a demonstration effect, encouraging additional private investments in the logistics sector.

title: Smart Value Homes Limited
content: 1. Increase in housing supply for low income households - the Project will contribute to the alleviation of the current affordable housing deficit in India.2. Employment generation - the Project is expected to create a large number of new construction, sales and marketing jobs and additional jobs in line with the Company''s growth in the future. Moreover, the Project will result in indirect job creation through community services such as schools and retail shops.3. Enhanced supply linkages - the Project will increase demand for construction and building materials in the country.4. Demonstration effect - the Project will lead the way to improve private sector development in this segment of the housing market, which is typically ignored by investors.5. Climate change - SVH will adopt sustainable development practices to construct "green" buildings via the use of alternative materials and renewable energy sources.

title: AB Bank Rwanda
content: The project will have a high development impact considering that microfinance has been shown to play a major role in poverty and unemployment reduction in developing countries. The project will provide MSMEs in Rwanda with greater access to finance, create economic opportunities and develop the local economy. In addition, the project will promote commercial oriented microfinance in Rwanda and provide a strong demonstration to the microfinance sector.

title: DHFL Eduventures
content: 1.	Increased access to finance for education: The project is intended to increase access to finance for education, a space that is substantially underpenetrated with less than 15% of the company''s target segment having any access to finance for this purpose. The company expects to provide loans to more than 60, 000 new students in the next seven years.2.	Demonstration effect: This project shall demonstrate a commercially viable model of NBFC financing for education in India and attract investments in this space. The success rate of banks in this space has been limited and it is hence critical that alternative financing models be encouraged. This project brings together a robust sponsor and management team, institutional shareholders and an existing distribution set-up which improve its chances of creating a strong demonstration effect.

title: Amen Bank Equity
content: The project is expected to achieve a significant development impact at three levels:-	Contribute to increasing access to finance to micro, small and medium enterprises ("MSMEs") and job creation: Amen Bank has historically focused on the local corporate segment (namely SMEs). The proposed project is expected to support the Bank increase its SME lending operations, which in the medium run is expected to contribute positively to the job creation in the country.-	Contribute to increasing banking penetration: The proposed project will contribute to further developing access to banking services for retail clients in Tunisia in addition to local SMEs.-	Demonstration effect: Following the challenges in Tunisia in 2011 and the Eurozone economic downturn, the proposed project will be influential in restoring confidence in Tunisia and the MENA region and creating a demonstration effect for international investors and other IFIs to consider investing in the Tunisian banking sector.

title: SB Real Estate
content: Development Impact include: (i) addressing the housing deficit; (ii) Job creation; (iii) enhanced local supply linkages; (iv) community development;  (v) support an emerging company with excellent sponsorship and management team; (vi)  demonstration effect to mobilize more funding into this much needed sector.

title: UltraTech Cement Limited
content: Employment generation: The Project will create direct and indirect employment in Chhattisgarh. The Project will provide skilled and unskilled jobs during the construction phase. In addition, the Project will create a large number of indirect jobs in the transportation and delivery sectors. Increased local supply chain and consumption of local goods and services: The Project will create new business opportunities in the local economy due to increased demand for the supply of raw materials and provision of transportation and delivery servicesOther benefits to local communities: The Company has established health and medical facilities in India to benefit about 200,000 people and manages schools in India where more than 6,500 students attend. The local communities will benefit from the Company''s corporate social responsibility initiatives. Positive climate change impact: As a member of the Cement Sustainability Initiative (CSI) of the World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD), a global association of about 200 companies dealing exclusively with business and sustainable development, UltraTech is committed to sustainable development. Its investment in energy efficient initiatives has resulted in specific heat consumption in its clinker production being one of the lowest. The Company has taken the lead in the cement sector in India to co-process industrial and agricultural wastes as fossil fuel substitutes in its plants. The Company is among the early proponents of waste heat recovery and alternative fuel usage in cement operations in India. The Project includes a waste heat recovery system, which will reduce energy usage. Higher level of environmental and social performance: By complying with IFC''s performance standards and the World Bank Group''s environmental, health, and safety (EHS) guidelines, UltraTech will achieve higher environmental and social standards, which should increase its reputation, reduce the risk of adverse impacts on local communities, and increase the credibility of the private sector with respect to corporate social responsibility. Private sector development: The success of the Project will send a positive signal to other investors considering investments in Chhattisgarh, a low-income state where foreign direct investment (FDI) is limited. The Project is expected to set environmental and social standards that can be replicated by other cement producers.Increase in domestic revenues: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues.

title: Gavea Credito
content: Dissemination of E&S standards: IFC''s participation in this project would support a leading Brazilian asset manager with the capacity to implement and promote good environmental and social standards for the corporate sector in Brazil. Furthermore, given that the Gvea Group is a standard setter in Brazil in many respects, the potential replication effect may be significant, leveraging IFC''s market impact.      Access to Finance and turnaround: IFC will facilitate the restructuring and refinancing of financially stressed middle market companies, keeping assets in productive use, as well as providing much needed liquidity and risk capital for the local marketplace. In addition, Gvea Credito''s involvement with a client through the Fund can immediately improve the financial profile of the company and in and of itself provide a stamp of approval, opening up access to other lenders and investors.Job preservation: As IFC has learned from similar DARP projects in Europe and Asia, as well as from the turnaround and restructuring of its own portfolio companies (especially during the Asian and Argentine crisis), a major consequence of resolving special situations is saving and eventually creating jobs, which carries significant and positive benefits.
