Based on the current pipeline of companies in the Fund''s pipeline, the Project could preserve thousands of jobs and lead to the creation of many more in Brazil. International Best Practices:  IFC''s participation in the Project, coupled with a strong package of turnaround guidelines, would provide a model for creating a special situations resolution mechanism and can promote best practices in local markets in Brazil and Latin America.

title: Zagreb Airpor
content: - The Project would create a new modern and efficient airport terminal in country''s capital city which is also the business and cultural centre of Croatia. Economic growth and development of tourism industry, a major driver of Croatia''s GDP and employment, would benefit from the Project. - It is viewed as a flagship project in the country with a major strategic importance for both the transport infrastructure and the PPP-type funding - IFC''s involvement in the Project will ensure it meets international safety and E&S standards.

title: Portland Carib 2
content: (i) Private sector development: Fund will improve local companies' competitiveness by providing equity capital and management advice and by adding value through capacity building and ESG improvements(ii) Economic growth and Job creation: Fund will invest in high-growth companies that will create new employment opportunities at a higher rate than national averages, thereby contributing to economic development end employment (iii) Regional integration: Fund will support platform companies seeking to roll out their products and services across neighboring countries. Strategy to build 'regional champions' that will achieve sufficient scale to compete against multinational competitors and access international capital markets

title: Bhilwara Captive
content: 1. Access to Electricity: The Indian power sector continues to be marked by severe demand-supply gaps, including power for industrial/commercial use. IFC''s investment will enable the development of new power generation capacity in the country with a shorter gestation period than other sources of power generation such as thermal and hydro. 2. Climate Change Mitigation: IFC''s investment will enable clean energy generation that will help avoid GHG emissions of approximately 33,000 tons of CO2 per annum.3. Inclusive Growth: IFC''s investment will help establish a clean energy project for industrial usage in the Low Income State of Rajasthan.

title: Callao Muelle Norte
content: The Project will support GOP''s privatization efforts in the port sector, contributing with the development of the North Dock facility in the port of Callao, the major port of the country. As such, the Project will support Peru''s competitiveness and indirectly drive trade growth by increasing container cargo capacity and improving efficiency levels to better serve exports and imports in one of the country''s key ports. The Project will help improving efficiency and productivity as well as increasing competition, benefitting shippers, shipping lines and consumers alike. In addition, the Project will benefit the GOP with royalties and tax payments which will help to free up the fiscal space necessary for Government priorities including education and health.  The Project is also expected to create new employment opportunities.

title: Transglobe
content: (i) Contribution to Government Revenues: The financing provided to Transglobe will be used to fund activities that are expected to result in higher and longer production, positively impacting the revenues that the Egyptian government will receive (mainly through production sharing as well as other methods). (ii) Market Signaling: IFC''s participation in this Project is consistent with IFC''s response strategy (dated June 2011) for the Middle East & North Africa region which calls for IFC to provide comfort to investors through partnerships and mobilization of resources thereby promoting the flow of foreign direct investment to Egypt.(iii) Local and regional spending: The Project is expected to contribute to local and regional spending as part of the field services and operational supplies will be procured domestically.(iv) Employment: The Project will create new jobs and, particularly develop local skills. Transglobe''s direct local employment in Egypt is expected to increase as the company further develops its operations in the country. Even though the Project''s impact on employment is expected to be marginal compared to the unemployment situation in Egypt, this may potentially increase given the early stage nature of some of the assets.

title: Trustco Equity
content: The proposed investment will:i) Enhance access to affordable insurance, reducing the risk of large expenditures that increase povertyii) Enhance the market''s perception of Trustco''s business model, making it easier for them to raise further capital.  This will come via the positive debt issuer profile that would follow the successful bond issuance on the JSE as well as the increased profile through the Company''s presence on the main board of the JSEiii) Support development of the corporate bond market for non-South African companies listing bonds on the JSE

title: Anyou
content: The Project is expected to: (i) support the sustainable economic development and reach  more than 25,000 MSMEs  in the frontier regions in China; (ii) create more than  500 direct jobs and improve local livelihoods in rural/frontier Chinese provinces; and (iii) have a strong demonstration effect  in Chinese animal raising sector

title: Tafila Wind
content: The Project''s development impact includes generation of much needed energy from a domestic, renewable resource, providing for (i) diversification of the fuel mix and (ii) energy security; (iii) displacing expensive thermal power; (iv) avoiding greenhouse gas emissions; and (v) demonstrating the viability of renewable energy financing in Jordan.

title: Jiangxi Tianren Ecology Co., Ltd
content: i)	Crop protection and strengthen supply: IFC''s finance to the Project is expected to help securing supply of bio-pesticides to agricultural users with consideration on environment and health; ii)	Forest protection: IFC''s support is expected to help the Company to supply more products and provide needed spray service for forest protection; iii)	Job creation in frontier region in China: The Project will create more than a hundred of new job position in JiAn, Jiangxi Province, a frontier region in China.

title: Schwarz III
content: Agribusiness/Food Supply Chain Development: Through its expansion plan in the three countries, Lidl will have a beneficial impact on small to large local suppliers by applying its strict standards in food quality and safety and efficient operations and  providing additional sales channels to local fresh and dry food producers through its Lidl network of stores in Europe.Benefits to low income consumers in small cities: Thanks to its modern discount format, the Project will contribute to expanding the access of low and middle income population in secondary and tertiary cities to affordable, diverse selection and high quality food products.Employment generation (direct and indirect): The Project is expected to create significant local direct employment (with a large participation of women, currently at above 60%). The Project has also the potential to generate a significant number of indirect jobs through retail supply chains and related services companies.Improved Green building standards: In line with its current practices in its existing markets, Lidl plans to be the local leader in energy efficiency by expansion of its building green stores equipped with standard setting green components, with potential demonstrational effect on local green building standards.

title: Norson S.A. de C.V.
content: (i) Streamlining and debottlenecking of pork production which will improve biosecurity, animal welfare and result in improved efficiency.(ii) The project will contribute to the reduction GHG emissions through the installation of methane capture and combustion equipment.(iii) Norson currently employs about 2,000 people with a high level of female employment. The expansion will create significant direct and indirect employment opportunities, especially in rural areas that need non-farm economic opportunities.

title: Pacific Infrastructure
content: The project will contribute to Colombia''s competitiveness in the port sector and help overcome infrastructure bottlenecks in the oil export activity: (i) will provide service to oil crude producers that are having difficulty in accessing the international markets without restrictions, (ii) will generate resilience to the overall crude oil export logistics (ii) will provide needed additional capacity for bulk cargo handling with state of the art technology. The main development impact which will be tracked in both projects, is the throughput volume seen in both the port and the pipeline. Pacific Infrastructure will create additional jobs in Cartagena. It will also support the Government with increased concession payments and taxes.

title: Hana Loan II
content: 1. Increasing SME access to finance: SME access to finance in Indonesia is relatively low, with a penetration level of 30% of total SMEs, and with 65% of SMEs still needing additional lending. Hana Indonesia plans to address this gap as it rolls out its expansion plan, by opening more SME branches and networks from 2013 to 2015. This increase in SME lending will also ultimately drive economic growth, job creation, and poverty reduction.2. Promoting South-South investment: Partnering and supporting a reputable regional bank such as Hana Korea in its expansion in Indonesia where IFC has a strong on-the-ground regional advisory team and Indonesia investment team.

title: BIF Equity
content: The development impact of IFC''s equity injection in BanBif is expected to be high given that:  - It will support SMEs and employment generation, thus, helping address the inequality that exists within the different segments of society. - It will support Company''s adaptation to the Basel III capital standards, thus, helping also to strengthen the soundness of Peru''s financial system.- It would help to increase the financial choices for companies and individuals, by supporting a Tier II bank in a very concentrated banking sector, with the top 4 banks representing over 80% of the banking sector''s loan portfolio.

title: Lighthouse II
content: 1. Support of SMEs: Target investees will be SMEs, which are a very capital constrained sector and limited access to bank debt or capital markets for financing their growth strategies2. Job creation: Investments in SMEs in the growth phase leads to substantial job creation, at a greater rate thn the national average3. Private sector development: Addition of value to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance and transparency, while providing operational and financial expertise, support in evaluating new business opportunities and building business partnerships4. Incorporating IFC's E&S standards, thereby contributing to sustainable economic development

title: Flexenclosure
content: The project is expected to achieve significant development impacts: -Improved mobile telecommunication coverage in rural areas through increased reliability of power supply for mobile telecom towers;-Improved competitiveness of mobile operators and tower companies through reduced operating cost;-Climate positive investment through reduced diesel consumption and carbon emissions; -	Generate local jobs during implementation and operations in remote areas.

title: CHUEE SME BOB
content: (i)	Environmental benefit:  Upon full ramp-up for the Project, 233,000 tons of CO2 emission and 600,000 cubic meters of water is estimated to be reduced per year; (ii)	SME access to finance:  Upon full ramp-up for the Project, at least 44 SME borrowers will be financed.  (iii)	Demonstration effect: 1) encourage governments to participate in future public private partnership initiatives of this type, within and beyond China; 2) generate a broader market impact and demonstrate the viability of energy efficiency and water efficiency projects; and 3) catalyze financial institutions to offer sustainable energy/water financing to SMEs;(iv)  Capacity building: (1) promote the improvement of industry-specific loan underwriting process/procedure and strengthen risk management practices; and (2) increase the Bank''s capacity to analyze and finance energy/water efficiency projects;

title: CHUEE SME BON
content: (i)	Environmental benefit:  Upon full ramp-up of CHUEE SME BON, 132,000 tCO2 GHG emission is estimated to be reduced per year; (ii)	SME access to finance:  Upon full ramp-up of CHUEE SME BON, at least 25 SME borrowers will be financed;(iii)	Demonstration effect:  Encouraging governments to participate in future public private partnership initiatives of this type, both within and beyond China; and(iv)	Capacity building:  Promoting the improvement of industry-specific loan underwriting criteria and strengthening risk management practices

title: CHUEE SME BOS
content: (i)	Environmental benefit:  Upon full ramp-up of CHUEE SME BOS, 132,000 tCO2 GHG emission is estimated to be reduced per year; (ii)	SME access to finance:  Upon full ramp-up of CHUEE SME BOS, approximately 25 SME borrowers will be financed;(iii)	Demonstration effect:  Encouraging governments to participate in future public private partnership initiatives of this type, both within and beyond China; (iv)	Capacity building:  Promoting the improvement of industry-specific loan underwriting criteria and strengthening risk management practices; and

title: CF CBC Tier 2
content: Market Signal: JBIC''s involvement in the Project sends an important market signal to international investors endorsing Sri Lanka as an investment target. This will have a key impact on FDI flows particularly at a time when the country is emerging from a 26 year civil war and there is ongoing uncertainty in global financial markets.Strengthen Systemic Impact: A stronger capital base will enable CBC to enhance its systemic contribution to finance the post-conflict reconstruction efforts in the North and East of the country and infrastructure projects identified as a national priority to accelerate economic growth.Increased Access to Finance: CBC is a major SME lender in Sri Lanka, comprising nearly a third of its portfolio. The Project will provide additional funding for the SME sector, which is a key driver of economic growth, and the tangible development outcome of this financing will be monitored through the incremental increase in the Bank''s SME portfolio.Promote Regional Integration: The Project will help promote regional economic integration by supporting the expansion of CBC''s expansion of its regional presence.Optimize Capital Structure of Banks: The Project meets a key priority of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka in raising Tier 2 capital to optimize the capital structure of key domestic banks. Tier 2 capital is relatively new in Sri Lanka and nor widely prevalent since weak market conditions have precluded banks from readily accessing subordinated debt.

title: CF RCBC Equity II
content: (i)	Continuing to strengthen the Philippine banking sector by providing long term capital, following IFC and IFC Cap Fund''s investment in BDO Unibank, Inc. in 2010  and RCBC in 2011, particularly in light of the higher capital requirements of Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas;(ii)	Increasing access to finance to underserved segments in the Philippines such as SMEs, microenterprises, and homebuyers and women entrepreneurs, including in frontier regions outside Metro Manila;(iii)	Promoting and expanding better corporate governance and risk management practices in the Philippine banking sector; and(iv)	Contributing to the strengthening of environmental and social management practices in the country''s banking system.

title: Equatorial Energia S.A.
content: The current operational condition of CELPA is uncertain and the provision of reliable electricity to the population is severely compromised. Once the Project reaches financial close, a knowledgeable and experienced partner will step-in to restructure and undertake significant investment to improve and expand CELPA''s power network, increase operational efficiencies and achieve productivity gains. In turn, the quality and reliability of the service will improve and should, over time, translate into better access to electricity for one of the poorest and most underserved regions of Brazil. In addition, industrial and commercial activities in the region, particularly agricultural activities, will directly benefit from reliable and good quality electricity.Overall, IFC''s financing will support greater private sector participation in Brazil''s power sector as a means to improve its efficiency and long-term development and is expected to benefit directly the State of Para, a frontier region, and support the development of its infrastructure.

title: Mauricio de Nassau II
content: i. Raise quality standards: Strengthening the Company''s position as a leading education company in North and Northeast regions of Brazil will pressure other institutions to raise the quality of their services in order to remain competitive;ii. Improve access to services: the Company''s plan to expand its network in the Brazilian North and Northeast will enhance the country''s education infrastructure and improve access to quality, affordable post-secondary education services for lower income students; iii. Rationalize the market: The expansion of the Company through growing market share and selective acquisitions may help to consolidate the still fragmented education sector, potentially leading to rationalization and quality improvement in the industry.

title: Muyuan Loan
content: mployment: The Company''s operations are located in Province - a frontier region in China. It provides stable employment opportunities for thousands, including  female employees.Farmers reached: Currently, a significant number of rural households supply the Company with raw materials such as corn, barley and silage.   SMEs reached:  Company sells its breeds to rural pig farms for further fattening for sale to market. Food Safety:  The Chinese hog sector is still very fragmented, leading to poor hygiene standards, inadequate bio-security, poor nutrition, and over-use of antibiotics. By creating a larger enterprise with greater focus on efficiency and food safety, the Company supports the improvement of breeding techniques, quality standards as well as the production efficiency of the industry.

title: Wings - Beverage & Detergent Expansion (Indonesia)
content: Expected development impacts are (i) demonstration effect of the Wings Group''s strong attention to food safety and quality standards to other producers, (ii) providing quality products to people at the Bottom of Pyramid (BoP), (iii) increased value addition in the local economy through the coffee project and (iv) higher reach to MSME through Wings'' extensive distribution network (iv) creation of additional 2,100 jobs.

title: Wings SouthSouth
content: Expected development impacts are (i) increasing the supply of quality and affordable detergents in Nigeria, (ii) enhancing food safety and quality standards, (iii) transfer of skills, knowledge and industry best practices from an established group into Nigeria and (iv) creation of 1200 new jobs in Nigeria.

title: Quadria Capital
content: (i) Provision of growth capital to small and medium sized healthcare providers, thus expanding much needed healthcare infrastructure in emerging markets. This would increase access to quality healthcare provision and generate jobs in target markets. (ii) An investment by IFC could be a demonstration of successful private equity investing in healthcare in emerging markets countries. This demonstration would build confidence amongst institutional investors to invest in emerging markets and the sector, and potentially encourage the development of domestic capital markets for investment in healthcare.(iii) The fund managers would provide hands-on guidance for operations and company management of Quadria's portfolio companies. It is expected that with this guidance, the companies will be able to provide better service and grow more quickly and sustainably than they would have otherwise, thereby promoting private sector development.

title: Earlybird Venture Capital
content: (i) Support for SMEs: IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. IFC would support job creation in Turkey and the broader region as the Fund's strategy is in line with IFC's development impact goals(ii) Demonstration effect:  Support for a new fund concept (early-stage TMT VC fund) raising funds in a difficult environment(iii) Support local entrepreneurship and private sector development: Support growth and innovation in the high-growth technology/media/telecom sectors. The Fund's ability to identify best practices and superior management skills in its invested companies and subsequently disseminate them across the portfolio may lead to increased competitiveness and sustainability

title: ALD Automotive II Ukraine
content: The project is expected to have a significant development impact as it would:(i) support Ukrainian financial (non-banking) sector after the recent crisis and in the current fragile economic environment;(ii) enhance further development of the leasing industry in Ukraine, which is still at an early stage;(iii) enable the Company to expand its client network throughout Ukraine, including frontier regions;(iv) facilitate access to finance via leasing services to result in more job creation;(v) strengthen the Company''s capacity in environmental and social management standards, creating a demonstration effect for other companies in the country to upgrade.

title: Armstrong South East Asia Clean Energy Fund, L.P.
content: IFC's investment in the Fund is expected to have the following development impact:(i) The Fund will support the mitigation of climate change through reduced GHG emissions per unit of energy produced by their investee companies relative to conventional energy sources;(ii) The Fund will catalyze the role and growth of the private sector in the South East Asian Power markets by investing in small-scale Independent Power Producers (IPPs).  It will help provide access to power to the broader population in the target countries;(iii) The Fund will help its investees grow sustainably and create jobs directly and indirectly.

title: Concord Medical
content: 1. Increase access to quality healthcare services. The Project will support an established healthcare service provider to move down-market to frontier provinces, to reach middle- and lower-income households, providing affordable basic radiotherapy services that are not readily available to those populations.2. Enable knowledge transfer. Successful operation of the Proton Beam, one of the most advanced technologues in radiotherapy, would enable knowledge transfer amongst radiotherapy practitioners both within and outside the Company3. Demonstration effect. This will be achieved in terms of improving standards and corporate governance in healthcare management, and in sending a positive message to other private sector investors about potential market opportunities in the healthcare sector.4. Promoting health care reform and the public private partnership model. Concord''s success should help to enhance China''s health authorities'' confidence in private health care providers and increase willingness to further relax the regulatory barriers for private investment in the sector. 5. Create skilled employment opportunities. The Project will provide training and create employment opportunities for a number of specialty healthcare positions, including those of radiologists, which are currently in short supply in China.

title: Telecom Development Company Afghanistan
content: (i) Enhance use of telecommunication services in a low income country, through the roll-out of a 3G network, which will enable more people to access to broadband data services especially given Afghanistan's low fixed line penetration of less than 0.2%.(ii) Expand geographic coverage: While approximately 60% of the population is within reach of its network, Roshan is planning to extend service further to rural and untapped areas, with a population coverage target of 80% in five years.(iii) Extend economic opportunity and financial inclusion to all Afghans: Roshan's M-Paisa service has provided, since 2008, the Afghan population with mobile banking services, such as money transfers, bill payments and salary payments to the unbanked population in the country.  There are approximately 130,000 M-Paisa users and with the introduction of better quality 3G technology, the number of users is expected to grow to approximately 1.3 million by the end of 2016.(iv) Improve the well-being of people in Afghanistan through its corporate social program, Roshan Community: Roshan will continue to develop and financially support a wide range of programs aimed at improving the well-being of the people of Afghanistan that are focused on six main areas: healthcare, education, commerce, social welfare, arts & culture and the environment. (v) Provide political risk mitigation: In view of the increasing challenging security situation in Afghanistan coupled with the planned withdrawal of troops in 2014, country risk and security concerns continue to be the primary barriers to foreign investment in Afghanistan. By supporting this project, IFC is expected to send a positive signal to potential investors that it is possible to finance infrastructure projects in Afghanistan.

title: BNB Bhutan
content: (i) Access to finance: increasing access to finance in Bhutan, a frontier market, by enabling BNB to expand and enhance lending to an underbanked largely rural population. (ii) Best practices and implementation of strategy: as a shareholder, IFC will provide BNB with access to international best practices in the areas of IT, risk management, SEMS and governance, and help the Bank implement its new growth strategy and expand into new underserved market segments, not only benefiting Bhutan''s society, but also allowing the Bank to attain higher profitability.(iii) Demonstration effect: as new commercial banks enter the market, BNB can prove to be an example of both success and public impact.  The guidelines and norms that IFC will introduce can serve as an important precedent in the newly developing financial market and can strengthen the country''s investment climate.  Further, IFC''s investment is expected to provide a stamp of approval and increase the interest of other foreign investors to invest in Bhutan.(iv) Strengthening the Bhutanese banking sector. Stronger equity capital footings of a key player such as BNB will help to reduce systemic risk, and enable BNB to play a strong role in increasing and improving financial intermediation in BNB and promoting the competitiveness of the banking sector.

title: GTLP Extn FIM Bank
content: (a) Channeling liquidity for trade financing in the Africa, and MENA regions which is vital to the survival of SMEs in those regions, thereby preserving jobs at such SMEs and the FIs; (b) Strong demonstration effect to support trade finance activities - a main artery to economic health and recovery, especially in emerging markets - through providing longer tenor sources of financing.

title: Value and Budget Housing Corporation
content: This investment will have the following development impact: (a) provide essential residential infrastructure to support the ongoing rapid urbanization in India, resulting in improved sanitation and health conditions; (b) demonstration effect for attracting private capital to the affordable housing sector in India; and (c) demonstration effect with regard to use of construction technology to shorten delivery times as well as eco-friendly practices. Compared to conventional constructions, the Project is expected to use 35% less water and meet IFC''s green building standards that results in at least a 20% lower energy consumption.

title: SEI Solar Power Pvt. Ltd
content: The project will: (i) increase generation of renewable power; (ii) the project will help a Chinese private Company expand its business in India; and (iii) create job.

title: CCFP BTMU
content: The CCFP-BTMU facility is expected to have the following development impacts:  i) increased access to finance for agriculture globally and energy in IDA countries; ii) demonstration impact on local market development, promote commodities as an asset class, and encourage local /regional banks to participate in funding the agricultural and energy sectors; and reduce poverty by providing access to clean energy for urban and rural poor.

title: CCFP SocGen II
content: The CCFP-Bank facility is expected to have the following specific development impacts:- Increase Liquidity: The Facility will ensure continuing and additional funding to the major agricultural and energy sectors in Emerging Countries, especially in Africa and IDA countries. This Facility will contribute to the Bank maintaining its level of business in commodity finance. Among other things, the Facility will enable traders to purchase from and finance agricultural producers, the mainstay of most economies in Africa, and ensure food security and income for the public at large, but especially to farmers. - Strong Demonstration Effect by catalyzing other IFIs to Support Agri and Energy Finance: By supporting commodity backed finance and outreach in partnerships with banks, the facility will have a significant demonstration impact on other banks, especially local /regional banks to participate in funding the agricultural and energy sectors. This would ultimately help increase access to finance for critical economic sectors.- A steady supply of critically needed refined oil products through regular channels will keep prices in check, remove parallel market incentives, improve affordability for the vulnerable poor and contribute to sustaining local economic activities.

title: Almaz Capital Russia Fund II, LP
content: There is limited access to Western-style venture funding and support, a much needed ingredient for a successful telecoms, media, and related technology ("TMT") industry in Russia and Commonwealth of Independent States ("CIS"). The Fund will act as a catalyst to support the development of the technology sector and the growth of local entrepreneurship and innovation. It will facilitate the capacity development as well as sector knowledge and skill transfer while using global industry best practices in portfolio companies thereby enhancing their competitiveness and sustainability. In addition, the Fund will support the creation of new jobs as investee companies expand.

title: Ananta Apparels Limited
content: - Job Creation: Approximately 1,500 new jobs expected over both Phases I and II. - Technology Transfer: AAL intends to adopt global best practices in terms of lean manufacturing concepts, factory efficiency, worker productivity and energy efficiency standards of the overall industry.- Local Supply Chain Linkages: The Project will generate incremental business for MSMEs in the value chain, including accessory and package suppliers, service providers and logistics support.- Benefits to the Government: The Project will generate tax revenues, which is expected to contribute to Bangladesh''s Annual Development Program budget, enabling the Government to execute a greater number of developmental activities.- Demonstration Effect: The Project will support a Company that has committed to adopting best practices in corporate governance, E&S compliance, labor standards, and energy efficiency in Bangladesh''s RMG industry.

title: Root Capital
content: 1) Expected to reach approximately two million farmers over the next five years.2) Significantly enhances Root Capital''s lending volume targets as stipulated in its five-year business plan.  This is expected to positively impact the "missing middle," which is the gap between microfinance and commercial banking, especially in pronounced rural areas in Africa.3) Sends a strong market signal regarding the business case for sustainable and climate friendly agriculture in difficult markets.

title: GC Credit
content: -     Fund focuses on growth midcaps and SMEs, which lack access to financing especially the growth capital type. Only 20% of MENA SMEs have access to credit, lowest in the World; -     Establishment of credit and mezzanine funds in the region introduces additional and complementary sources of financing to the financial markets which are currently dominated by state-owned banks; -     Focus on midcap and SMEs fosters job creation in a region where youth unemployment rate is at 24%; higher than any other region; -     Proactive role played by the Fund is a part of its strategy in helping the companies execute  growth strategies through balance sheet optimization, board seat positions and implementing operational improvements; all of  which would lead to improved governance and private sector development.

title: Tenaga Generasi Limited
content: The Project will i) promote the use of renewable energy sources for power generation in Pakistan by providing zero emission power; ii) contribute to diversification of the existing generation mix by reducing the use of fuel oil; iii) help channelize local investment in the development of renewable energy in Pakistan as the Project is one of the first to be developed by a large local business group; iv) generate Carbon Emission Reductions (CERs) through the Clean Development Mechanism of the Kyoto Protocol; and v) help develop local expertise to aid future development of renewable energy in Pakistan.

title: BI Gender Incl
content: The expected development impacts of this project are:i)	The key development objective of this project is to increase financial inclusion for SMEs in Brazil with a special focus on women-owned business ( at least 50 % of the project amount will be used to on-lend to women-owned SMEs ). ii)	This project is intended to have a demonstration effect of the business opportunity presented by women entrepreneurs as an under-served market in Brazil.iii)	Foster competitive environment in the Brazilian banking sector.  Furthermore, given that the project targets financial inclusion which gives people the opportunity to escape poverty and improve their lives.  Furthermore, World Bank Group research shows that focusing on access to finance for female entrepreneurs has the following benefits:a)	Increasing opportunities for women entrepreneurs is key if the global economy is to have sustained and more equitable growthb)	Women entrepreneurs create jobs that are more likely to employ other women c)	Women are more likely than to men to contribute additional income to household poverty reduction and improved nutrition and schooling for their children; andd)	Giving women entrepreneurs access to credit and increasing their economic power will translate into improve livelihoods for a wide cross-section of society.

title: CF ACLEDA subdebt 2
content: (i) Improve access to credit as it will enable ACLEDA to continue providing credit to microfinance and SME clients.(ii) Improve market confidence, as it will enhance prospects of mobilizing additional long term funding from private investors.

title: Umeme Ltd
content: The IPO is the first step of a new development and investment phase for the Company, which is expected to (i) allow the connection of additional customers to the grid; (ii) reduce technical and commercial distribution losses; (iii) improve the quality of services to end users; (iv) through the improvement of distribution network, contribute to mitigate climate change impacts; As such, this Project represents an important next step in ensuring the long-term reach and reliability of electricity supply in the country.

title: GHIF
content: Given the Fund's focus on the late stage in the development of many of the drugs, vaccines and diagnostics in the pipeline, it is reasonable to expect a large development impact on several fronts: (i) possible replication of the business model and scale-up of the flow of additional funding into late stage development of drugs for neglected diseases; (ii) millions of patients, and especially those in vulnerable population (children and pregnant women) will benefit from the drugs that will be commercialized through this vehicle; (iii) by demonstrating the commercial viability of the proposed funding structure, this could prove to be an important catalyst for the development of drugs that otherwise would not be developed; and(iv) demonstration effect to other charitable foundations that their money could be multiplied and effects of their charitable giving amplified through this funding mechanism, which is expected to bring positive financial return to investors.

title: Plato
content: - Expansion of access to vocational education thereby increasing number of youth that have skills relevant to the job market, including soft skills.- Increase access to quality higher education and internationally accredited programs to lower income students and to remote communities.- Demonstration of financial viability and replicability of a vocational education model that could be applied to various markets across regions, including to post-conflict regions. - Project is an example of south-south investments and will serve to strengthen regional communion.

title: Navegar I
content: The Fund would help its portfolio companies create jobs, which potentially cover the rural areas in the Philippines.  The Fund would help private sector development through supporting growth and operational improvement of its portfolio companies.  The Project would support private equity investments in the Fund's target country and thus it would help develop the financial markets in the Philippines.

title: Tamweelcom II
content: (i)Access to finance: The proposed Project would support Tamweelcom, one of the largest and well managed MFIs focusing on women, expand its outreach and serve a larger number of low-income people in Jordan. Through its well established network of 23 branches in the different areas of the Country, the project would be supporting the company is reaching out to more of the underserved segments of the society and thus expand their business activities and subsequently finance their day to day consumer and family needs.(ii) Job creation: MSMEs are key contributors to job creation in the Country and accordingly developing a vibrant MSME sector, with reliable access to finance, can play a significant role in private sector led economic growth, generating employment and providing opportunities to the poor.

title: MHP WCF
content: The investment program will help MHP expand its domestic and export sales. The proposed Loan will support the Company''s working capital requirements for the successful implementation of MHP''s growth plans, which will have a significant impact on the local economy. Benefits include:- SMEs: MHP supports a network of 2,600 SMEs, a franchise network of small shops selling MHP branded poultry, which will significantly increase with the implementation of the Vinnytsia project. Significant number of these SMEs operate in rural locations often underserved in terms of basic food retail reach. - Employment: The Company currently employs 24,800, including 9,000 females. As a result of the investment program, employment will increase by an additional 8,000 workers. - Food security: MHP''s competitive cost structure will help the company provide competitively priced chicken in Ukraine as well as in importing countries in Africa, Middle East and Asia, thereby contributing to food security in those regions.

title: BML-Brummer
content: The Project is expected to: (i) Job creation: BML''s various projects are expected to create 90 jobs during the construction stage of the plants and 367 permanent jobs in the factories post-construction. The company will be creating 200 new dealerships across the country in the next three years to expand its distribution network, which will create additional indirect jobs; (ii) Technology transfer: BML will be leveraging the technical expertise of LG and Hisense to set up its manufacturing plants, adopting manufacturing best practices, which is expected to improve the overall quality of BML and, in due course, of other companies in the industry; (iii) Diversify Bangladesh''s export basket: BML plans to export Hisense (and possibly other branded) products once operations have stabilized. This would help Bangladesh diversify its export basket and improve the country''s over dependence on the textile sector; (iv) Increase domestic consumption: By selling branded household appliances at lower prices, BML will make these aspirational goods affordable to a much larger section of the country''s population, promoting domestic consumption; and (v) Reduce trade deficit: BML''s backward integration will help reduce Bangladesh''s total import bill and will lead to foreign currency savings, which will help shore up the country''s foreign exchange reserves.

title: Amerra Fund
content: Despite their contribution to food supply and rural livelihoods, smaller and medium-sized agribusiness companies (and the farmers that supply them) have historically had insufficient access to finance from private sector sources, in particular finance that extends for more than one crop season.  Recently, the unfavorable supply-to-demand dynamics for financing to this segment has deteriorated as working capital needs have risen across the agribusiness supply chain with higher commodity prices at a time when the commercial banks who had been operating in some parts of the supply chain have come under increasing pressure to strengthen their capital ratios.  The IFC project supports the expansion of an innovative firm whose business model includes providing financing into this segment by intermediating capital from an institutional investor segment in developed countries that has not historically invested significantly in these agribusiness segments from the emerging markets.

title: Klabin Celulose
content: 1. Employment: The project is expected to employ over 5,000 workers during construction, and following the start of operations, is expected to employ around 1,000 employees in the pulp mill and forestry operations.  Along with Klabin''s existing paper mill in nearby Monte Alegre, the project will be the largest employer in this part of the state.2. Taxes: The project is expected to pay over US$50MM annually in taxes, once it reaches steady state.  Under a scheme that was developed through Klabin''s initiative, in conjunction with local governments, the tax receipts will be shared with the neighboring municipalities, all of which are among the poorest municipalities in Parana.3. Carbon Sequestration: The project will include a forestry base of 106,500 ha, which will be under FSC certification.4. Renewable Energy:  The project includes a biomass-based co-generation plant with a capacity of 260MW.5. Import Substitution: The project will be the first fluff producer in Brazil, and one of the few softwood producers in the country.  By replacing imports that currently meet demand for these products, the Project will enable domestic proeduction in these segments in Brazil.

title: BR Further Inv
content: The Project would: (i) support the continued development of a key private sector player in the relatively new Russian railcar leasing sector; (ii) contribute to the development of the transportation and logistics sectors in the Russian Federation, facilitating economic growth particularly in the economically disadvantaged hinterland and (iii) enable Brunswick Rail to access the debt markets in the future to finance the purchase of additional railcars, foster the introduction of new casting technology improving efficiency on the Russian rail network and participate in the consolidation of the Russian rail sector.  Rail transportation is vital to the Russian economy and Brunswick Rail''s strategy to expand its fleet with new, modern railcars will improve the quality of railcars used in Russia. The majority of the Group''s fleet is unrelated to the oil sector and thus helps facilitate the diversification of the economy. Brunswick Rail''s new, more reliable railcars also help mitigate the risk of trucking replacing railways which would result in an increase of harmful greenhouse gases.

title: Eleni&Associates
content: The proposed Project is expected to have a strong development impact by improving the functioning of commodities markets in Africa (and potentially in a broader emerging markets context) through price formation, market transparency, regional trade, and logistics management.  It is also expected to improve access to credit.

title: OCL II
content: -	The Project will lead to the creation of 150 direct and 120 sub-contracted jobs upon Project implementation. It will also create 10-15 managerial jobs & ~500 construction jobs during its peak construction. -	The Project would produce Portland slag cement, which due to its low clinker-cement ratio would result in savings of 84,000 tons of annual CO2 emissions.-	The project will contribute an estimated US$7 million per annum of tax revenues to the exchequer.

title: Cargills Agriculture and Commercial Bank
content: Access to Finance - The Bank will increase access to finance to MSMEs especially in the unbanked agrifinance sector. The project is expected to contribute to IFC''s IDG on Access to Finance to SME/Micro clients. Expansion in North and East - The Bank is expected to have significant operation in the underserved N-E region of the country which is also part of the farming, fisheries, dairy production area of Sri Lanka. Build investor confidence - IFC''s participation can help build foreign investor confidence and help channel future FDI in the country which is critical for the growth of the economy and specifically for the reconstruction and development of the war affected N E regions. A niche Banking model - The Bank will be built on a unique business model with a bias towards serving the underserved MSMEs and underpenetrated regions of the country. Its strategy of serving the agriculture and linked communities will take its operations outside of the well banked western provinces. The Bank will use mobile banking technologies and take advantage of the extensive Cargills supermarket footprint and its links to the agriculture community to implement its differentiated banking strategy. This project will add a new dimension to the banking sector in Sri Lanka. Employment in the rural regions - The Bank plans to hire graduates as loan officers from the local communities to work in its branches creating job opportunities for young people in the rural regions of the country.

title: Eleme Fertilizer
content: The expected development benefits from the project are:(i) Food Security:  Contribution to the development of the agricultural sector and unlocking its potential, thereby reducing Nigeria''s dependence on imports. The project will increase fertilizer production which promotes intensive agricultural production, and will improve crop yields.(ii) Economic Diversification:  Increased value addition to a natural resource in Nigeria (i.e. natural gas), and advancement of the downstream chemicals sector. The project supports regional fertilizer capacity in Sub-Saharan Africa, which is a growing market heavily reliant on imports.(iii) Employment: Creation of significant direct and indirect employment opportunities.(iv) SME Development:  Removal of obstacles that prevent farmers with small land holds from efficiently optimizing their crop yields and maximizing their incomes.(v) Current Account Impact: Foreign exchange savings by import substitution.(vi) Demonstration Effect: The project is expected to have a positive signal for other foreign investors on the government''s commitment for economic diversification and agricultural transformation project

title: Hans Merensky
content: The development impact of the project is expected to include: Employment creation:  The Company has about 4,300 employees. The expansion of its operations and market position in South Africa and South America is expected to lead to the creation of more jobs.Rural Development: The project will make significant contribution to the development of rural communities in South Africa. Women Inclusion: The project will enhance inclusion as a significant number of the Company''s business units employ largely women.Increased tax and export revenue for government.

title: Shandong Changlin Deutz-Fahr Machinery Co., Ltd.
content: (i)	Food security. The Project will have significant contribution to efficient use of farm land and higher productivity through supply of four wheel tractors that offer higher technology and horsepower by manufacturing close to 200,000 tractors and reaching that many farmers during the life of the IFC loan. (ii)	Development of downstream food industry. Higher crop output resulting from large scale farming with four-wheel tractors will help develop downstream industries such as food processing and packaging. (iii)	Inclusive business. The Project will help the development of SMEs along the value chain, including the dealers/distributors, suppliers, logistics and service providers. A significant portion of these SMEs, especially the distributors, are based in frontier regions and rural areas. (iv)	Job creation. The Project is expected to create more 700 direct jobs in its facilities, as well as significant level of indirect jobs along the value chain and downstream industries.

title: Navix de mexico S.A. de C.V. SOFOM E.N.R.
content: Mexico''s access to finance is very low with only around 12% of the firms in the country having a line of credit compared to a regional median of 46%.This project will support small and medium local suppliers with financing facilities for working capital and growth needs operating in the oil & gas and energy sector. By increasing its source of funding, contractors can secure a larger share of contract bidding as well as remaining as service providers in an industry were contracts are typically awarded to multinationals.

title: MicroEnsure
content: Essential Protection of the Less-privileged: Unpredictable events, such as illness, loss of assets, death or accidental disability of breadwinner, bring devastating consequences to the poor, particularly in developing countries. Natural disasters such as windstorm/cyclones, floods and earthquakes constantly represent a threat to poor households and small enterprises. It is currently estimated that the current penetration of microinsurance is close to 2% of the potential market worldwide and that up to 4 billion people at the ''bottom of the pyramid'' could potentially benefit from microinsurance to mitigate their vulnerabilty against risks and disasters. Insurance can prevent people from lossing the achievements of their whole life and from falling back into abhorent poverty.The Project is expected to increase the availability of micro-insurance products to low-income people in Sub Saharan Africa and Emerging Asia, markets that have very low insurance penetration rates. Based on conservative projections, MicroEnsure (ME) expects an increase of more than 7 million low-income people accessing micro-insurance in the next 5 years, however there is a potential for this outreach to be much higher. ME is actively engaged in the provision and development of weather index insurance, a new and innovative product, currently in several countries and reaching tens of thousands of low-income farmers. As ME continues to develop the technology and management of this product, it has the potential to be rolled out on a mass scale.IFC expects the project to have a strong demonstration effect in the micro-insurance space by establishing the viability and profitability of a micro-insurance platform that can successfully deliver tailored products and utilize innovative distribution channels to reach the low income segment.

title: VMLA - Colombia
content: 1) Innovation/Demonstration Effect: MVNOs are relatively new in LAC. Through this innovative business model the whole mobile ecosystem benefits (i.e., MVNOs, MNOs, technology providers, and most importantly, the consumer). The MVNO model allows for a deeper penetration of services (i.e., including mobile broadband, etc.) as poorly attended client niches (i.e. youth in the case of Virgin) obtain a well targeted service offering more aligned to its needs and expectations.2) Broadband / Productivity enhancement: VMLA offers a data centric service offering. Broadband directly contributes towards improving productivity. The contributions of broadband connectivity to economic growth, and as a kick-starter of other innovative business models (e-health, e-education, e-commerce, etc.), is widely accepted. 3) Infrastructure Sharing: Infrastructure sharing (i.e., including towers) is a key theme in IFC''s TMT sector strategy. The concept behind MVNOs is the sharing of existing telecoms infrastructure, thus maximizing efficency, increasing competition and reducing prices. The owner of the core infrastructure (i.e., MNOs) also benefits as it revenues increases by selling additional minutes and data wholesale. Moreover, the fact of leveraging on existing infrastructure makes this investment a "climate friendly" project. MVNOs have no substantial infrastructure or facilities, so they are unlikely to create E&S risk. 4) Availability, Affordability & inclusion of underserved markets: MVNO contributes to expending the reach of underserved population segments, lowering the cost and increasing competition in mobile telephony.5) Youth: VMLA directly targets the youth segment. Youth in general have a lower purchasing power than other population segments, and thus, a targeted and relevant service offer contributes directly to attending this segment''s needs.

title: SME South Russia
content: The project is expected to have a significant development impact as it would enhance the Bank''s ability to lend to small and medium enterprises.  The project would enable Center Invest Bank to offer a wider range of financing instruments to underserved SMEs and encourage continued development of its SME lending with matched funding that would be available with IFC''s proposed loan.  Long-term financing is crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector across the country that would result in improved economic development and improved living conditions.

title: GFO Loan
content: IFC''s long-term financing is expected to bring high development impact by: (i) enhancing GFO''s capacity to support productive small and medium enterprises, resulting in higher growth, employment generation and poverty reduction; (ii) creating a demonstration effect for other non regulated financial institutions in Colombia by bringing best practices in both insurance and SEMS to GFO; and (iii) disseminating IFC''s global knowledge and expertise in SME products.

title: BG Costa Rica
content: The proposed investment is expected to have the following Development Impact:1) Increase banking penetration and access to credit to underserved SMEs and agribusiness companies;2) Increase employment generation since SMEs and the agribusiness sector are main drivers of employment; and 3) Demonstration effect with other banks replicating this type of funding.

title: ACLEDA Myanmar I
content: (i) Contribute to the development of the financial sector in Myanmar.(ii) Respond to unmet demand for microfinance.(iii) Development of new financial services in Myanmar.

title: MCS Property
content: (i) The Company''s activities are focused on improving UB''s urban infrastructure. As such, they have a direct and immediate development impact with respect to improvements in living standards and inefficiency of doing business in Mongolia''s capital. In particular, the  Company''s pipeline of properties scheduled for completion in the near future includes socially important developments, such as 1,617 affordable housing units in an innovative and replicable "Shine Ger" project with the goal  to make home ownership affordable for young professional families;(ii) MCSP is an important source of indirect employment with 4,782 indirect employees (e.g. contractors);(iii) Through increased purchasing local materials and services, the expansion of MCSP activities will strengthen the Company''s linkages to  the local economy;(iv) MCSP is committed to bringing international property development standards and best practices to a country where the quality of construction  needs to be drastically improved;(v) The MCS Tower included in the Project will contribute to the development of the UB business infrastructure that lacks quality office buildings at this point in time.

title: CHUEE Jiangsu
content: Environmental benefit: Upon fully utilization of the RSF, 257,000 ton CO2/year GHG emission is estimated to be reduced per year; Access to finance: About 30 EE or RE projects will be financed under this project and most of the borrowers are expected to be SMEs. During the course, the Bank is expected to change its risk perception of EE and RE loans and would be willing to extend more credits to address EE  and RE demand; Capacity Building: The Project will help the Bank establish its internal capacity in indentifying and assessing EE/RE projects and  get ready to expand the  EE/RE products offering in the future ; and Demonstration effect: The success of the Project will encourage more banks in JiangSu to provide the much needed EE findings to local manufacturers. The Project, as an innovative PPP ( Public Private Partnership) initiative to address China''s climate change agenda, will also set a role model for other provinces across China.

title: Victoria Group
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to include:(i) Strengthening of agribusiness linkages and support to farmers:  given the strong linkages of Victoria Group with farmers, provision of longer term permanent working capital will help ensure stable access of pre-harvest financing to farmers;(ii) Job preservation:  the Group employs about 1,800 people across its operation and collaborates with about 400 partners which in turn supply the Group from over 25,000 farmers; (iii) Increase tax revenues:  IFC''s investment will contribute to the growth of government revenues from taxation; and(iv) Addressing food security concerns: IFC''s investment will contribute to food security and in meeting the challenges of increasing demand and food crisis.

title: Atlantic Group
content: The development impact of the project is expected to include: (i) support to a Croatian company in its south-south investments in the region, including in Serbia, thus helping a new regional player in its expansion and regional integration; (ii) through appropriate financial support, further improve the business sustainability of an important regional employer and agri-processing company involved in value-added production in a sector important to the region and particularly to the Serbian economy;(iii) generate tax revenues.

title: Ecolibrium Enegy Pvt. Ltd.
content: (a)	Improve energy efficiency: Ecolibrium offers an energy management solution which enables its customers to control and optimize their energy usage, thereby increasing electricity availability to the customers, through reduction in energy wastage. (b)	Creation of Employment: The Company is currently managed by a small team of less than 20 members, which is likely to grow in line with the IFC investment.

title: Access RSF
content: The project is expected to make a contribution to the financial sector and economic development in Nigeria. The expected development impact is summarized below:1) Increase Access to Finance for underserved SMEsThe project will increase Access to Finance for SMEs, including women-owned businesses that are currently underserved in Nigeria.  2) Capacity Building of SMEsThe RSF project will assist the distributors to professionalize their businesses by providing relevant financial and non-financial training that will cover areas such as (a) financial management, (b) business planning, (c) inventory management as well as (d) soft skills / people management skills.3) Demonstration EffectThe Bank''s increased lending to underserved segments has the capacity to contribute to market transformation through continued lending to the target segments beyond the life of the project and demonstrate to the market that these segments can be banked profitably in Nigeria.4) Job CreationThe project will support job creation as they will provide financing to small and medium enterprises, which play a key role in economic development and employment5) Replication PotentialThe RSF project has significant replication potential as the large retailing company will use this as one of its pilot projects for distributor financing, with the potential to expand the distributor partnership with banks to other countries in Sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Access AMSME
content: The project is expected to make a contribution to the financial sector and economic development in Nigeria. The expected development impact is summarized below:1) Increase Access to Finance for underserved SMEsThe project will increase Access to Finance for SMEs, including women-owned businesses that are currently underserved in Nigeria.  2) Demonstration EffectThe Bank's increased lending to underserved segments has the capacity to contribute to market transformation through continued lending to the target segments beyond the life of the project and demonstrate to the market that these segments can be banked profitably in Nigeria.3) Job CreationThe project will support job creation as they will provide financing to small and medium enterprises, which play a key role in economic development and employment

title: Credivalores
content: Colombia continues to have a low banking penetration (Loan penetration to GDP 33%), especially in low-income segments of the population. Consumer loans that are billed and collected through Public Utility companies are an attractive channel to provide financing solutions at effective costs to the underserved individuals.The Project is expected to have a significant development impact as it will allow middle and low income households to have access to formal sources of financing in medium and small cities of Colombia,  instead of going to loan sharks at interest rates as high as 280% per annum and therefore promoting a better income distribution in the Country.

title: KKS-Group
content: The proposed IFC investment will help to:(i)	Improve heat service for customers in the Tula and Kemerovo regions. KKS will significantly upgrade heating assets with modern technology, therefore improving overall quality and reliability of the service; (ii)	Ease constraints on municipal capital budgets. KKS will undertake long due investments and capital expenditures on assets formerly owned or currently leased by municipalities; and(iii)	Significantly reduce greenhouse gas emissions. By raising efficiency and reducing losses, the project contributes to the mitigation of climate change.

title: FINCA Africa
content: It is anticipated this project will have a high developmental impact by:i)	providing funding to underserved segments in IDA countries, particularly women and youth. Over 95% of FINCA's clients in Africa are women and this funding will support portfolio growth and geographic expansion.ii) diversifying funding sources for FINCA's affiliates in Africa, and iii) increasing the tenor of local currency financing available in the local markets.

title: NSL Wind
content: 1. Increasing clean energy production: The project will directly contribute to increase the country''s installed capacity from renewable energy sources by 75MW and to meet the Renewable Purchase Obligation (RPO) of the state of Maharashtra. 2. Improved electricity availability: The project will directly contribute towards reducing the electricity demand supply gap in Maharashtra3. Job creation: The local community will benefit through sourcing of labor from local communities during the construction period, and overall job creation during construction and operation period.4. Support Private Sector development in power generation: A majority of the power generation in India is still state-owned; Through this project IFC will support private sector development and interest in this sector

title: Project Golf SME
content: - The Project will enhance access to finance for SMEs located in regions along the country, leveraging on the bank''s extensive branch network;- The Project will allow the bank to provide its SME clients with the adequate funding to undertake capital investments;- The Project will contribute to fostering SME development;- The Project will include a set of well defined eligibility criteria that will ensure that 100% of the funds will be 100% used to finance SMEs.

title: Laureate Equity
content: 1) Expand access for middle- and lower-income students to high quality post-secondary education across several countries in emerging markets, in many cases addressing demand unmet by public institutions; 2) Enhance employability of Laureate''s students; 3) Demonstrate the viability of education as a global industry; 4) Increase choice and competition in local education markets; 5) Contribute to local communities through outreach efforts.

title: AccessBank MSME
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to be significant in the following areas:(i) Support the growth of the Bank''s MSME portfolio and increase access to finance for MSMEs.(ii) Stimulate growth in the non-oil sector and make a positive impact on employment generation and economic development in Azerbaijan.(iii) Potentially create positive spill-overs in the banking sector by supporting a strong partner with good risk management and corporate governance practices.

title: Auchan Ukraine
content: The Project''s development impact will include: i) Benefit to low and middle-income consumers: The Project will contribute to increase access by low and middle-income households to quality foods, vegetables and goods at affordable prices as Auchan''s historical value proposition is being a food retail price-leader;ii) Food supply chain development: The Project will help improve food quality and safety standards throughout the agribusiness value chainiii) Employment creation: The Project will generate a significant number of direct jobs during construction and operation. Furthermore, the Project will also generate a significant number of indirect jobs through retail supply chains and related services companies;iv) Improvement in green building standards: The Project will contribute to set higher local green-building standards in the country which could have a strong demonstration effect in terms of local climate change mitigation.

title: Gulf African Bank
content: By supporting the expansion of GAB, IFC will seek to achieve strong development impact as demonstrated by:i) increased access to finance for retail, SME and corporate customers;ii) increased targeting of women entrepreneurs to grow the Bank''s portfolio of loans to women run/owned businesses; and  iii) affordable trade finance products for SMEs.

title: SocGenCroa_AGRI
content: - Increased Access to Finance: Increased funding for Agri-business and SME, which will significantly contribute to job creation in Croatia.- Supporting Underdeveloped Regions: Through the Bank''s network the Project will allow access to finance to the most underserved regions, helping job creation and poverty reduction.- Improving Environmental and Social Standards: IFC would help the Bank to develop an environmental and social management system ("ESMS") to assess environmental and social risks of its SMEs and agribusiness lending activities.- Positive Market Signal: IFC''s long term debt in times of high global instability and uncertainty, at a time when capital is flowing out of the South Eastern Europe, is expected to provide market comfort and to send a strong signal to foreign investors on IFC''s confidence and support to Croatian banking system and the region.

title: KBB Mortgage
content: By supporting its portfolio client, IFC will bolster mortgage finance for low-income clients by providing more liquidity at the retail level for low income housing, besides helping bank to increase its market share in the mortgage sector. Access to mortgage finance will inherently boost the historically strong construction sector- one of the key catalysts of sustainable growth in the local economy.

title: MEMCC II
content: - Access to finance: The Project would support MEMCC''s lending activities and expand its outreach to serve more of the low-income active poor and the SME sector in Jordan, including women entrepreneurs who currently represent more than 65% of the Company''s borrowers;- Job creation: MSMEs are contributors to job creation in the Country. Supporting the development of the sector with reliable access to finance would play an important role in economic growth, generating employment, and providing opportunities to the underserved groups.-Demonstration effect:  Through this Project, IFC is expected to act as a catalyst to encourage local banks and FIs to lend for longer periods and support MFIs growth. Further, it will enable MEMCC to better manage its risks and such, by which, setting an example in the market.

title: bKash
content: The project will have the following development impacts:- Increased access to finance through mobile payment: The project is intended to increase access to finance through mobile payment/banking to broader segments of the country including the unbanked and the base of the pyramid.-Enabling integration into the formal banking system: The project will help develop a track record of banking transactions for the bKash customers and aid their eventual integration into the formal banking system and access other financial services such as credit and insurance- Facilitating commerce: The Project will help create a mobile banking/payment platform that will reduce transaction costs and overcome geographic barriers, helping to facilitate commerce in the country amongst broader segments of the population.

title: CPLF-ModernKarto
content: - Resource Efficiency: Thanks to the environmental and climate friendly benefits of the Project, at optimum capacity after implementation Modern Karton will be able to consume less fresh water and discharge less waste water per paper produced compared to the current levels. - Demonstration Effect: The Project is likely to have strong demonstration and replication potential thanks to being a pioneering investment in the sector.

title: Peak Reinsurance Holdings Ltd.
content: Market Development: The Project will help create market alternatives for Asian based primary insurance companies which are today dependent on European or North American based reinsurance groups or inadequate local, nationally based reinsurers.  As an Asian based reinsurer, Clipper aims to differentiate itself from established multinational reinsurance companies in terms of its pricing and capital allocation, and also avoid the often inadequate portfolio diversification found in single-country reinsurance companies.    Local Capacity Enhancement: In partnership with local primary market operators, the Project will improve the availability of technical expertise and reinsurance underwriting capacity in key product areas such a micro-insurance, natural catastrophe and agricultural crop insurance.

title: InterEnergy Holdings Inc.
content: Development impact from the proposed IFC/ALAC equity investment is manifold. The Company is among the few domestic/regionally based IPP companies in the Caribbean region and considers "high developmental impact" synonymous with "long-term commercial success" as its core strategy. IEH through BEL invested in the sector when others were exiting, and has successfully turned around then-problematic companies (e.g. EGE Haina and CESPM) or started out distribution utilities in remote places where there was no electricity supply to support tourism development (e.g. CEPM and CEB) Thus, the Company''s  success is hoped to help catalyze more generation investments and companies following a similar long-term developmental perspective in the DR and the region. The projects within the pipeline, if successful, could alter the energy map of the DR region with a profoundly positive economic impact - a significant reduction in electricity generation costs and an alleviation of balance of payment problems.

title: Organica Water
content: 1.	Improving Water Sanitation and Wastewater Reuse in Emerging Markets:  Organica''s wastewater treatment (WWT) technology offers a highly cost competitive, space saving, and decentralized solution to customers.  This technology application is particularly attractive in the chosen emerging markets that Organica operates in, where a) urbanization and water quality issues are prevalent; b) WWT infrastructures are relatively new and stakeholders are relatively more open to adopting new WWT solutions; and c) increasing urban population density requires WWT solutions that minimizes footprint whilst aesthetically pleasing/ecosystem-like solutions allow for preservation of land value in the vicinity. 2.	Promoting a Decentralized and Distributed Wastewater Solution:  In addition to driving resource efficiency on every level- lower energy usage, lower geographic footprint and lower infrastructure costs; Organica''s WWT solution is comprised of botanical garden like structures which blend into the urban landscape with no resemblance to traditional facilities. The sustainable look and feel as well as the smaller infrastructure footprint promote a decentralized and distributed approach towards WWT and contribute to a drive towards urban sustainability in emerging markets.3.	Improving Effectiveness of Wastewater Treatment Solutions: Organica''s utilization of plant roots andits patented artificial media as a special biofilm carrier creates a more diverse and complex biological treatment system that improves treatment efficiency by maximizing oxygen transfer. This ultimately enhances the resilience of the WWT infrastructure against variations in treatment volume and wastewater quality variability. 4.	Stimulating Water Technologies Innovation and Resource Efficiency:  Organica''s innovative biological treatment solution generates substantial savings in capital cost, operating cost, energy use and physical land use compared to conventional WWT technologies.  IFC''s investment will stimulate technological innovation in WWT solutions that addresses energy and resource efficiencies, thereby strengthening its target market''s ability to delivery key infrastructure services and offer decentralized solutions.

title: IAS
content: The proposed Project is expected to:- Create up to four new highly skilled jobs (pilots, skilled mechanic for maintenance, etc<e2><U+00A6> ), developing a local know-how. - Support the development of exploration and production of natural gas activities, much needed for the recovery of Ivoirian power sector, by providing reasonably priced transportation services. - Help an Ivorian Comapny with regional activities grow, contributing to the development of exploration and production of natural resources in West Africa in general. - Create a demonstration effect by providing financing to a Company in a post-conflict country, demonstrating that viable investments can be made in Cote d''Ivoire, and pave the way for more investments in the future.

title: Oyu Tolgoi LLC
content: Macro-economic impacts:  The Oyu Tolgoi project is expected to make a significant contribution to Mongolia''s economic growth, increasing GDP by more than 30% at full production and providing a catalyst for additional private sector investment in Mongolia''s fast growing mining sector. Fiscal impact: The Project is expected to generate significant revenue streams to the Mongolian Government. In addition to a 34% equity stake, the Government will receive: (i) a royalty of 5% of sales for the life of the mine; (ii) taxes on profits; (iii) other taxes and duties, including customs duties, value added, excise and immovable property/real estate taxes and payments for mining licenses; (iv) dividends on its equity ownership stake.  Employment: At peak construction the Project employs 14,800 workers, of whom 10,000 are Mongolians.  During operations the Company is expected to have 3,500 direct employees, of whom 90% will be Mongolian. The Project is also expected to generate significant indirect employment in the supply chain including service companies, construction, mining equipment contractors, transport and maintenance operations.Regional impacts: The Project is expected to be a catalyst for investment in infrastructure including housing for company employees, utilities and services in the the Khanbogd soum and regional cities. The Project will also develop the road, air transport and and electric grid in the South Gobi region and will provide investment and support for university education and vocational training for mining and technical graduates across Mongolia.

title: Alliar
content: The Project is expected to have strong development impact by way of the following:(i) Promotion of social inclusion and better health outcomes by bringing diagnostic services of good quality to underserved regions where today patients must travel over 200km for a Magnetic Resonance exam;  (ii) Creation of jobs and training opportunities to local staff, particularly women (70% of Alliar''s workforce is female). This employment generation will be focused on regions outside large metropolitan areas of the country, specifically in the North, Northeast and Midwest regions of Brazil - frontier regions.(iii) Improvement of healthcare standards for quality, efficiency and ethical practices in the acquired regional units. (iv) Economic development: In addition to job creation, tax generation through the opening of new patient service centers will also contribute to direct economic development in less developed regions of Brazil.

title: Nature Forestry
content: The Project is expected to: (i) support the sustainable economic development and natural resources management in the frontier region; (ii) create more than 200 direct jobs (based on the projected plantation size achieved) and improve local livelihoods in rural/frontier Chinese provinces; and (iii) have a strong demonstration effect for China forestry sector to support legal and certified forestry operations.

title: Stone Apple
content: Employment: The Company''s expansion will increase the availability of direct and indirect jobs in the target countries where it plans to expand. IT services companies are usually the "first job" for many school graduates.
