The industry is also a source of employment for women as they allow them a job that recognizes their professional capabilities.Development of IT sector: The implementation of this project will promote the development of the IT services sector in South East Asia and in other emerging markets in the long-term fostering competition in the markets where it plans to expand. An investment in Stone Apple will also enhance the competitiveness of these markets as attractive destinations for outsourcing and offshoring.Export/ Economic Growth: Outsourcing/ offshoring generates significant export revenues helping organisations become more efficient and creating local employment thereby contributing to economic growth.Human Capital Development: Stone Apple implements useful training programs for its employees in various technologies. This project will enable the replication of these training programs to new markets where the Company is expanding.

title: Dugbe Gold Project
content: Generally, exploration projects have limited development impact but even at this early stage, the proposed investment has shown tangible benefits to the surrounding communities by generating local employment for people in poor parts of eastern Liberia. Key expected benefits during development and operation will include notable social contributions by Hummingbird. Once developed, the Project will also bring revenues to the national government through royalties and taxes, notable local economic development in a poor part of a post-conflict IDA country through the generation of direct and indirect employment opportunities.

title: Parques Eolicos del Caribe S.A.
content: (i) Diversifying the power generation mix in the DR: Currently the DR relies primarily on imported, expensive fuel to generate power.  The Project would enable local wind resources, rather than imported fuel, to generate power; furthermore, the cost of the Project''s power is significantly less than current wholesale power prices in the DR, so the country will add lower cost power to the energy mix; (ii) The Project is expected to generate approx. 156 GWh per annum of clean, non-fossil fuel dependent electricity generation that will displace an estimated 110,000 tCO2e per annum, leading to improved air quality and climate change mitigation.

title: Calidra International
content: The following summary development impacts are expected to be achieved: maintaining profitability, achieving cost-energy efficiency, using alternative fuels and raising environmental, health and safety standards.

title: Bank of Ayudhya flood relief
content: Support the economic recovery: The worst flooding in Thailand in half a century is expected to reduce the country''s economic growth by 1-1.5%. The Project will support the country''s disaster responses by providing source of emergency liquidity.Financial sectors deepening: The Project will enable a local bank to access foreign currency funding and provide a level playing field with foreign banks that have the benefit of parent funding.Increase financing to sub-borrowers: The project will contribute to an increase of BAY''s loan portfolio.

title: Agrofusion
content: The proposed investment intended to support the Company''s current capital structure will: (i) help a leading Ukrainian tomato paste producer to scale up its export revenues and increase inflow of the foreign currency; (ii) support a viable economic activity and help secure employment in frontier rural area of Kherson region; and (iii) have a demonstration effect on other vegetable producers in Ukraine through promotion of sustainable agricultural practices.

title: CapMan Russia II Fund, L.P.
content: (i)	Support for SMEs: IFC's experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. IFC would support job creation in Russia since the Fund's growth strategy is in full alignment with IFC's development impact goals.(ii)	Access to long-term equity/risk capital is limited in Russia: SMEs are typically only able access short term bank loans in the absence of equity investors. IFC's investment would support the growth of Russian enterprises by providing scarce equity financing.(iii)	Private Sector Development: The Fund Manager employs a hands on, value added strategy with its portfolio companies. Through this knowledge sharing, the team helps with implementation of best practices in corporate governance, environmental and social monitoring system, all of which leads to improved competitiveness and sustainability.(iv)	The Fund will make investments primarily outside Moscow in cities and regions where SMEs often have limited access to financing. In the two predecessor funds to this Fund, 10 out the total 14 investee companies were located outside Moscow and St. Petersburg.

title: Loan to LAPO Microfinance Bank, Nigeria
content: The project will have a high development impact considering that microfinance has been shown to play a major positive role in sustainable reduction of poverty and unemployment in developing countries. It will deepen financial inclusion in Nigeria, where access to finance remains extremely limited for low-income populations. IFC''s support to LAPO MFB is expected to have a strong demonstration effect and encourage the professionalization of locally-sponsored institutions, especially NGOs seeking to transform into microfinance banks.

title: KTDA
content: 1)	Farmers Reached:  The project will reach tea farmers and further strengthen KTDA which serves as a good model for smallholder supported enterprises.2)	Support a key export sector which benefits the Kenyan economy.

title: Farcan Enerji Uretim Anonim Sirketi
content: Turkey Country Partnership Strategy FY2012-2015 outlines strategic objectives for fast, sustainable, equitable and inclusive growth that respects the environment. In line with this strategy, the World Bank Group aims to contribute to improved supply of reliable and efficient energy, increased use of renewable energy and climate actions under implementation. The Project will have a significant development impact as it will: (i) increase Turkey's electricity output and help meet the country's growing energy demand and provide power supply security; (ii) in doing so, reduce Turkey's reliance on coal and lignite, thereby reduce carbon emissions in electricity generation; (iii) support power sector reform by increasing the share of private generation in Turkey's overall electricity generation in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation of a regional energy market; and (vi) by size and nature of the transaction, influence Turkey's ability to continue to attract foreign investment in the energy sector. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Turkey.

title: Amalia EQ
content: The Project would enable greater cross-border financial integration in LAC, as it would assist the bank to enter in a new market. By becoming a regional player, the bank would be (a) promoting commercial trade between two countries; (b) supporting the increasing trend of companies setting up operations also expanding regionally, and (c) improving institutions and investment climate through higher ESG standards.One of the bank''s main focus is to further grow its SME portfolio, a market segment that is still underserved in Latin America. The proposed transaction would support the creation of a financial services platform with deep roots in LAC. This is expected to diminish the volatility derived from large international investors entering and exiting the developing markets. The end-user is expected to gain additional confidence in the banking system which ultimately is expected to derive in higher saving rates and overall increased economic stability.

title: JV East
content: - Development of Ukraine''s infrastructure according to modern and safe standards and introduction of higher service standards in the region through GNG''s OKKO filling stations and convenience stores- Provision of reliably cleaner high-quality fuels to Ukrainian automotive consumers- Employment generation/preservation- Linkages to local suppliers: the JV''s station''s convenience stores, automotive services and fast-food restaurants will provide opportunities for local suppliers who supply the goods sold

title: HDB Barging
content: The proposed IFC investment will help to:(i)	increase the supply of efficient, low emission transport services on the Parana-Paraguay River System;(ii)	increase competition in the barging sector, encouraging operators to improve efficiency and reliability of service;(iii)	 create additional employment for the region;(iv)	foster South-South investments; and(v)	improve supply chain management and support the development of the iron ore and steel industries in the region with follow-on benefits for construction and industrial sectors.

title: Housing Finance Co. of Kenya - Green Financing
content: The Project is expected to generate a range of social and economic benefits related to mortgage lending. With CCCP funds complimenting IFC''s own funds, it is expected that the Project will also generate environmental benefits through the development of energy efficient green housing projects. The Project may also have a strong demonstration effect in Kenya and beyond - to financial institutions seeking to build their green housing business and to property developers seeking to green their portfolio. Specifically, the Project will: (i) increase access to affordable housing in Kenya through growth in mortgage lending; (ii) help to grow housing supply in Kenya through on-lending to property developers; (iii) facilitate energy efficient housing developments and therefore introduce and promote a new sustainable housing product into the Kenyan market; (iv) enhance environmental and social (E&S) management capacity of HFCK and therefore help the Company to improve E&S and sustainability standards for property developers; and (v) help abate green house gas emissions as a result of construction of green buildings.

title: Edilar
content: Provision of quality education material: Edilar plans to expand its product offering and geographic reach further. This will have a strong development impact by providing public sector teachers with books, teaching material and ongoing training financing and thus enhancing the quality of the Mexican public education system. The Project is expected to reach over 80,000 teachers in 2017, which represents more than two million students reached annually.Private-public collaboration: Edilar works hand in hand with the Mexican Ministry of Education and teachers union by (i) providing certified educational content for K-12 public sector teachers, (ii) supporting the ongoing training and provision of teaching materials, and (iii) providing financing alternatives to public sector teachers for certified training purposes. Frontier regions: Edilar is present in 27 Mexican states, of which 6 are frontier states, providing education material to school teachers in rural areas, some of which are only accessible by 4x4 automobiles. These school teachers would have no other possibility of acquiring books, teaching material or training.

title: PetroNova
content: IFC''s investment will be used for early exploration activities.  Development impacts for exploration activities are typically limited and at this stage mainly limited to some local employment and procurement. If the exploration efforts are successful, significant development impacts are expected to be realized, including:i) Creation of local employment opportunities through direct hiring and indirectly through PetroNova''s contactors.  ii) Fiscal benefits to the Government of Colombia through royalties and income taxes. iii) Procurement of oilfield services and supplies from local and regional sources, thus fostering local economic development.

title: Astarta
content: The project is to support the growth and diversification of one of the leading farm enterprises in Ukraine, engaged in the production of crops, sugar and milk. The corporate investment program will include in particular: (i) a cost reduction program for sugar production; (ii) a biogas capture component that will both reduce GHG emissions and improve energy efficiency in processing; and, (iii) a soybean processing project that will add value to the local production of soybeans while serving the needs of the fast developing livestock and poultry sector. This program will contribute to the growth of the Ukrainian economy, to global food security by increasing production of key crops exported from Ukraine, while supporting direct and indirect employment in rural areas where alternative job opportunities remain scarce.

title: Educomp
content: - Expanding equitable access to quality basic and secondary education.  Educomp is one of the largest K-12 education services providers in India.- Improving quality education in India, both in public and private schools and in tertiary education, through its learning management systems and technology products, tutoring, assessments / test preparation, and teacher training services. - Promoting innovation, knowledge transfer and scalability in the Indian education sector, given the Company''s role as a market leader and the fact that many competitors may become followers of successful business and academic practices.- Bringing about a significant demonstration effect that the use of technology in education can effectively help improve learning outcomes.- The Project will support the growth of the Educomp''s employee base in key business segments over the next four years.  - Potential for South-South investments, as the Company has expansion plans in other developing countries including some in Africa.

title: Finansbank DPR
content: 1. Provide & mobilize term financing: the Project will provide a significant amount (US$150-200 million) of long-term funding to the bank, which would otherwise be difficult to obtain under current market conditions. 2. Access to finance for the underserved markets: the Project will increase access to finance for MSMEs, thereby supporting economic growth and job creation.

title: Reventazon HPP
content: The Project is expected to have high economic and developmental impact in the following ways: 1) provision of critical infrastructure to support economic growth: the Project is expected to generate around 1,400 GWh of base-load power generation annually, or about 10% of the country's total generation, helping to meet increasing power demand driven by economic growth; 2) decreasing carbon emissions through the displacement of fossil-fuel powered generation.

title: Elbrus Capital Fund II
content: (i)	Job Creation: IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. IFC would support job creation in Russia since Elbrus' midcap growth strategy is in full alignment with IFC's development impact goals.(ii)	Access to Finance: Long-term equity/risk capital is limited in Russia. SMEs usually access short term bank loans in the absence of equity investors. The shortage of capital from independent global investors, unrelated to local political groups is very pronounced. Russia has the lowest private equity penetration when compared to other BRIC countries. IFC's investment would support Russian companies by providing additional equity to the small /midcap market.(iii)	Private Sector Development: Elbrus will employ hands on management as well as buy and build value added strategy in portfolio companies. The Fund's structuring know-how and network would be tapped, and new management techniques and growth strategies would be incorporated by investee companies; leading to improved competitiveness and sustainability.(iv)	The Fund will consider making investments in companies outside Moscow and St. Petersburg where SMEs are often underserved for equity capital.

title: IFC/SG MRT Trade
content: The proposed investment will have significant development impacts as follows:(a)	Maintain the availability of trade finance for trade businesses in Mauritania. The Project is expected to finance in excess of US$1.5 billion of energy commodity trade flows to Mauritania over two years by providing much needed liquidity.  This will protect an IDA economy against the risk of energy shortages, the risk of being cut off from suppliers as commercial banks have reduced their emerging market exposure.(b)  Ensuring availability of energy products in the local economy, critical for consumption, power and other energy needs.  A steady supply of critically needed fuel through regular channels will keep prices in check, remove parallel market incentives, and improve affordability particularly for the vulnerable poor and is necessary to sustain economic activities.  (c)	SME Development -  By supporting the private sector companies in the country''s downstream oil sector, the project will provide business opportunities to local private companies involved in transportation, distribution, and retail of refined oil products

title: SES Power
content: 1. The project is expected to alleviate the demand-supply deficit in MENA and Africa and mitigate the negative impact on economic growth. 2. Through investing IFC will help capitalize a player with the technical expertise and risk appetite to invest in frontier countries.3. SES'' additional capacity is expected to be deployed to also alleviate disaster induced power shortages.4. The project will help to facilitate economic growth by making available short term capacity to large scale industrial projects, overcoming supply bottle-necks.5. The deployment of units to remote areas that are not yet connected to the national grid increases rural access to electricity.

title: Azure Rooftop
content: 1. Demonstration effect: The Project will serve as a role model for rooftop generation of solar power. It is expected that after implementation of the Project, the Govt. of Gujarat will roll out larger rooftop programs in Gandhinagar as well as other cities in the state. Other states such as Rajasthan are also expected to follow suit.2.Private Sector Development in Solar Rooftop Energy Generation: The Project is first public private partnership (PPP) for rooftop solar generation. IFC support to a roof top solar project will help to attract other potential sponsors to such nascent clean energy program.3. Contribution to Climate Change Mitigation: The Project helps mitigate adverse climate change impacts by tapping in to clean and renewable energy source.

title: Softlogic Plc
content: (i) Job creation: The project is expected to generate 930 direct jobs, with a significant part of the workforce drawn from the local community. In addition, the project will also generate indirect employment related to the supply chain of the tourism sector.(ii) Best practices in hotel management: The hotel is expected to be managed by a global hotel chain and will bring best practices in the sector to Sri Lanka.(iii) Increase access to high quality consumer products: The project will increase the number and geographical reach of retail products for Sri Lankan consumers and also make the products available to lower income segment of the population in smaller cities.

title: F-Road
content: The Project will achieve strong development impact and demonstrate IFC''s commitment to support financial inclusion and the development of frontier regions in China:(i) Improve Access to Financial Services: lack of access to financial services in rural areas and frontier regions has been a challenge for China.  By using mobile networks effectively, access to financial services will no longer be limited to areas in which a bank is physically present or there is access to the Internet.  Through easier access to the financial services visa mobile devices, underserved population will experience higher financial efficiency and capture more business opportunities, leading to increased income and improved livelihood. (ii) Promote Financial Sector Innovation: access to banking and payments services through the mobile phone is new in China.  By assisting the pioneering mobile banking service provider at this important stage and by helping develop it into a model company, IFC is expected to have demonstrative impacts and accelerate adoption.(iii) Enhance Institution Building: through F-Road, IFC could potentially improve the operating efficiency, scale and financial transparency of small financial institutions and enable these financial institutions to reach out to their clients.

title: ATB A+B SME Loan
content: The Project is expected to have a significant development impact as it will enhance the Bank''s ability to lend more to SMEs and households in frontier regions of the Eastern Russia.  Such financing will be crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector and diversification of the regional economies where the Bank operates (including 9 frontier regions, defined as having per capita income 80% or less of the national average). Additional developmental impact lies in the introduction of the Bank and its unique business model to the international wholesale funding market, by possibly marketing its debut syndication.

title: BIF III
content: - Without the Project, it would be much harder for BanBif to raise the amount of medium-term funding it is seeking from diversified sources and at competitive market conditions.  If fully deployed, the loan could help make financing available for over 3,000 SME loans during the life of the project.  - The income derived from the financing activity made possible by the investment would be widely distributed helping reduce the income gap prevailing in Peru.

title: OzU
content: (i) Incerased access to higher education. (ii) Through its focus on enterprenurial research and application and industry-oriented education, support its students in establishing the SMEs of the future or taking their place in the work force with the right skill sets.(iii) Create a demosntration effect by being the first environmentally friendly university campus in Turkey, with international accreditation. (iv) Create a center of excellence for computational finance, enterpreneurship and energy efficiency through its research centers.

title: Ramkrishna Forgings Limited
content: This investment will have a strong development impact in the form of (a) direct employment generation for about 390 people in the state of Jharkhand and (b) enhance global competitiveness and capabilities of the Company as it embarks on its journey to become a player of scale in the auto-components sector.

title: SRF Industries (Thailand) Limited
content: (i)	Improving Local Supply Chain:  Local procurement of about US$10 million is expected during construction.  During operational phase, business for local supply chain will increase.(ii)	Job creation: The Project is expected to create about 300 direct jobs and 1500 indirect jobs in ancillary units and supply chain. In addition, there will be temporary jobs created during construction phase and during life of the project.(iii)	 Food Security:  The Project supports the expansion of the food packaging industry, thereby reducing food spoilage and enhancing availability of processed foods. (iv)	 Enhanced Financial Sustainability through Product Diversification:  The BOPET plant expands the company''s product base in Thailand (currently producing Nylon 6 tire cord), thus providing an additional revenue source, and access to new markets and customers.(v)	Demonstration Effect of a South-South Investment: The project will facilitate a South-South investment and its success could encourage other Indian companies to expand in emerging markets.

title: BOG IV
content: The project is expected to support the SME business in Georgia through provided much needed long-term financing to boost the recovery of the economy after the negative consequences of the global financial crisis. The project will have an opportunity to encourange lending to women-owned SMEs. The Project is expected to have a strong demonstration effect and support mobilization of international funding for Georgian market.

title: Coop Bank Kenya
content: By providing long term US$ financing and a trade line, IFC expects to deliver strong development impact through its partnership with Coop Bank.  Long term funding to address the existing maturity mismatches will offer a lower risk funding approach to the Bank''s business and consequently allow for increased reach in terms of broader access to finance for various market segments.  In summary, the provision of long term finance is expected to have strong development impact in the following areas:i) Access to Finance - SME: IFC''s long-term funding will allow Coop Bank to grow its SME lending business and enable it offer affordable long term finance to its clients;ii) Access to Finance - Agriculture: access to long term funding will enhance the Bank''s ability to grow its agribusiness lending portfolio and increase the tenor of its loans;  andiii) Access to Finance - Trade: the trade line under GTFP will allow the Bank to ramp up its trade activities and more importantly offer affordable trade finance to SMEs.

title: IHH Healthcare Berhad
content: 1. Potential transfer of expertise from IHH''s portfolio brands including Acibadem, Parkway and Pantai to lower income markets, thereby improving access and quality of healthcare for the middle class in these markets, expanding the scope of health care services that are available, and improving the quantity and quality of medical professionals trained in these countries.2. Development of high level skills and creation of higher income jobs through education, training and employment of doctors, nurses, and lab technicians. The development of such skills is expected to positively impact the wider market over time. 3. Promotion of South-South investments across Asia and CEEMENA.

title: Patria Credit
content: - The development impact of IFC''s financing is expected to be high, as it will enhance the MFI''s ability to support productive MSEs which will in turn stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction.- Create a demonstration effect for MFIs in the country by bringing best practices in insurance and social and environment management systems to Romania''s largest MFI.- Improve asset quality of the portfolio through IFC''s global knowledge of microfinance and rural products.

title: CF - Banco BHD Subordinated Debt
content: Increase access to financeThe Project will enhance BHD''s capital structure maintaining its ability to continue growing and supporting the SME segment which will increase access to finance in a market with low banking penetration. Greater access to finance is expected to stimulate the growth of businesses and, in turn, employment generation. Resource MobilizationThe capacity to mobilize other investors through the AMC to provide a significant amount of funding at a time of global instability.

title: Izmir Muni
content: The installation of an Intelligent Traffic System infrastructure will contribute to the City''s efforts to create a more efficient road transportation system in Izmir, reducing travel times and fostering higher productivity and economic growth. Moreover, there will be a number of environmental and social benefits due to reduced air pollution, traffic accidents, noise and congestion in the City center. In addition, strengthening its fleet of fire trucks and other emergency vehicles will enable the City to provide a more effective response to its citizens in case of emergencies.

title: Aqualia Capital
content: The Sponsor has been actively participating in and expanding its business presence in developing countries. In the context of rapidly growing demand for reliable water and wastewater treatment services in developing countries, public sector financing constraints and generally lack of quality service delivery by the public sector, private sector participation can play an important role in serving the growing demand, financing the required infrastructure expansion and rehabilitation works, and improving sector efficiency and quality of service delivery. Aqualia has significant operational experience, technological know-how and managerial competencies that it can leverage and share to contribute to the development of the water sector in its developing country target markets.  Water scarcity has become a matter of serious global concern and it has become especially pronounced in the Middle East and North Africa region, where the Sponsor is currently active. In Mexico, the Sponsor is building aqueducts to deliver water to communities which are facing growing water scarcity as nearby aquifers have been over-exploited. The Sponsor''s desalination projects in Algeria and aqueducts in Mexico are expected to serve around 2.8 million people.  The Company is expected to develop new projects in the future that will help significantly expand the number of customers to whom it will deliver clean drinking water. Rapid urbanization and industrialization in developing countries has also meant that governments need to aggressively address the issue of wastewater treatment in a sustainable manner. Projects like the Sponsor''s New Cairo wastewater treatment plant will be important in proper management of wastewater and the re-use of treated wastewater for purposes such as irrigation. By contributing to enabling increased access to clean drinking water, improving efficiency in water management and supporting best practices in wastewater management, the proposed Project will support sustainable economic development.

title: DARP_Planters
content: (i) Market development: The successful implementation of the project could spark the interest of other market players and evolve into a common practice.  Furthermore, this could become an important stabilization mechanism for the Philippine financial sector and help IFC to address the current NPLs issues of its existing clients; (ii) Best practices: As part of the project IFC would promote international insolvency standards, creditors'' rights and collection practices for the resolution of the distressed assets; and(iii) Replication: Through this project, IFC would be helping to assign a market value to a NPL portfolio.  If successful, the proposed project has the potential to be replicated by other entities in the EAP region.

title: CPLF - KuAz
content: Investment to be financed under the proposed project will help KuAz implement its energy efficiency and clean production program, and ultimately achieve reduction of greenhouse gases emissions and reduction in energy consumption.

title: Dakshin
content: The project will increase access to finance for small and medium enterprises (SME) in India who have limited access to formal sector lending. The Company''s diversified product offerings would also lead to increased access to affordable housing finance across India which has a much lower penetration of mortgage finance as compared to other emerging markets.

title: GTLP RMB Trade Asset Facility
content: The Project is expected to have strong development impacts. First, it will contribute to the development of more market driven solutions for RMB-based trade settlement, with a stronger focus on small private sector Chinese banks (importer-side) and emerging markets (exporter-side). Second, it will contribute to increasing currency availability and reducing volatility risks in international trade, especially at times of crisis like the ongoing Euro-zone crisis, by diversifying the options available to both importers and exporters. Finally, the Project will help attract other global players to the RMB-based trade settlement markets with emerging markets.

title: KKagit
content: The project will create additional employment through 300 additional jobs in Kipas and indirectly in related fields, notably waste paper collection in a frontier region of Turkey. The project will increase the use of recycled paper and in turn improve the domestic waste paper recovery rate, especially in a frontier area. Moreover, the project will result in the production of high quality cardboard through the use of the most recent technology in the industry that will help substitute for imports. Kipas Kagit will also supply corrugators in the food packaging container business that contribute to improved efficiency in food distribution and ultimately lower costs, thereby helping with food security.The project will also be integrated with an on-site co-generation plant. It is expected that the waste ash from the co-generation plant will be used in the cement operations of Kipas.

title: Trans-Oil
content: The expected development impact includes the following: (i) improve efficiencies of under-performing acquisition assets; (ii) support the competitiveness of a leading Group operating in a key sector to Moldova''s economy; (iii) realize benefits to local farmers in the form of integrating farmers with higher value added domestic and international markets and increased access to finance for farmers; (iv)  encourage local and regional companies to consider investments in Moldova by demonstrating a successful test case; and (v) job preservation and increased tax revenues.

title: SRF South Africa
content: (i) Import substitution: Currently, South Africa imports around 20,000 TPA BOPP plain films.  The BOPP films produced by this Project will lead to import substitution and eventually facilitate the growth of the local economy.  (ii) Job creation: The Project is expected to create more than 200 new jobs during construction and operation.  Furthermore, additional jobs will be created through auxiliary services, through the life of the Project.(iii) Environmental and social best practice: A successful implementation of IFC''s Environmental & Social (E&S) standards will serve as an example which other chemical companies might emulate.(iv) Knowledge transfer: SRF''s experience in India and IFC''s technical advice will allow the Sponsor to transfer knowledge of efficient plant management and operations to Africa.

title: Ujjivan
content: 1.	Increasing access to finance in low income states in India, including states in the northern and eastern parts of the country which have amongst the highest population densities and poverty rates in the country2.	Promoting a more balanced growth of microfinance by supporting an institution that been a front-runner in adopting technology, is a pioneer in focusing on consumer service and responsible financing and offers customized products for various financial and non financial needs of its members

title: VMLA - Chile
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: i. Greater availability, affordability & accessibility of mobile services: Mobile Virtual Network Operators ("MVNOs") contribute towards expanding reach, lowering the cost and increasing competition in mobile telephony. Besides voice services, VMLA''s product offering will support further expansion of mobile broadband, particularly in niche markets that have not been successfully served by traditional Mobile Network Operators ("MNOs"). Particularly, VMLA will target the youth market which has more limited purchasing power than other population segments.  In this regards, VMLA is positioning itself as the first pan-LAC MVNO, targeting the youth sector with highly segmented and tailored voice and data offerings.ii. Efficiency gains in the telecom industry through the sharing of infrastructure: The concept behind MVNOs is the sharing of telecoms infrastructure with existing mobile network operations (i.e, VMC will use Movistar''s network to provide its services). The specialization enables the use of existing spare capacity for niche markets through the sharing of infrastructure, ultimately contributing to generate greater efficiencies of the telecom industry overall.iii. Greater availability of broadband services (mobile in this case) and innovation: Greater access to mobile broadband is expected to contribute towards improving productivity and generate economic efficiencies. The contributions of broadband connectivity to economic growth, and as a kick-starter of other innovative business models (e-health, e-education, e-commerce, etc.), are widely accepted.

title: Equitas
content: 1.	Access to Microfinance by expanding the outreach of Equitas in several of the poorer states in India, where the Company would scale up in the next few years. 2.	Access to Finance for Affordable Housing and Used Commercial Vehicle Financing to people engaged in the informal sector for affordable housing and used commercial vehicle financing, several of whom are currently underserved by the formal banking system.   Clients who avail finance for purchase of second hand commercial vehicles would be able to open up a livelihood opportunity for themselves and their families and turn from being a driver to an owner.  The housing finance company helps people who run businesses in the informal sector to plan for and buy a house at current prices.  Typically such people are almost fully excluded from the formal financial sector.3.	Promoting a more balanced growth of microfinance by supporting an institution that has been a front-runner in adopting technology, is amongst the pioneers in best practices on responsible financing, takes a very active part in sector development and is working to provide varied financial services to customer segments which have limited access to formal sources of finance.

title: GTLP Extn SCB
content: The project is expected to have a significant development impact by increasing funding for trade of consumer goods, intermediate goods, smaller machinery and commodities demanded by emerging market enterprises.

title: Inabensa Bharat
content: Inabensa Bharat''s operations will support the construction of solar energy plants globally by providing a necessary component in the form of the solar panel structure, thereby encouraging the use of clean energy and reducing CO2 emissions through the implementation of clean energy plants.  In addition, Inabensa Bharat will support improvements in the infrastructure supply chain through the increased manufacture and sale of transmission towers across Asia, the Middle East and Sub-Saharan Africa to meet growing demand.  As a result of increased focus on transmission capability in India, energy access is expected to improve.   Finally, the project will support job creation in India, both during the expansion and operation of the facility, a key objective for the Indian government.

title: Recaudo Bogota
content: a. Reduce the number of buses in the system by about 7500 buses, all of which old, below safety and environmental standards; b. Reduce accidents and death-by accident rates related to buses; c. Reduce congestion and traffic gridlocks; d. Improve labor conditions for most of today''s driver-owners. Reduce working hours from 13-14 / day to 8 per day, receive stable income, social security, health insurance and other benefits; e. Improve quality of service in the public transportation system of Bogota. Provide predictable, scheduled service, run buses that are of superior quality than the ones currently in use. f. Increase transparency in the system which will result in better cost and remuneration allocation;  g. Recaudo will make a system of transfers possible, reducing total cost of ridership to all those users of the system that today transfer from bus to bus and pay multiple fares for each destination; h. Recaudo will make it possible for Transmilenio to manage the systems more efficiently by providing live information on traffic conditions, bus unavailability, break-downs, maintenance schedules, etc; i. Recaudo will help improve the security in the transit system by allowing Transmilenio to better monitor key stations and by availing bus drivers with an SOS system for all emergencies.j. Recaudo''s fare and recharge infrastructure will take cash out of the transport system, eliminating all the other inefficiencies that come with it - waiting lines, slow bus mounting procedures, pilfering, etc.

title: OCB SLF
content: (i)	Increased Access to FCY Financing for SMEs: Limited access to finance is considered a key constraint to private sector growth. Increased access to finance is indispensable to grow the competitiveness of SMEs. By directly financing the short term US$ liquidity needs of OCB which in turn will support export oriented SMEs, particularly in the Southern region, where the Bank is establishing itself as a MSME bank, the Facility will make an important contribution to sustainable export-led economic growth in Vietnam.(ii)	The Project is expected to have a positive impact on job preservation by partially bridging the foreign currency liquidity gap in export oriented businesses.  This is especially important in an environment where a large number of SMEs have been severely affected by the continuing financial crisis. Financial support to SMEs is thus critical to employment preservation in adverse market conditions.  Hence, the Project will have a direct impact on job preservation and employment generation through OCB''s financing of private-sector companies.

title: Credins EE/RE
content: The Project is expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of sustainable energy finance and related investments. The development impact of the Project is expected to be significant in the following areas:* improving the competitiveness of the Albanian economy by increasing the efficiency of energy use across sectors,* facilitating the development of energy efficiency investments among residential and potentially SME clients and targeting to generate a minimum decrease in per unit energy consumption >15% (kWh/unit (m2, production).* increasing lending for RE projects in Albania, with specific focus on small hydro power plants, provided that at least EUR 15 million would be financed, and app. app.15 MW newly installed* improving the local and global environment through decreased emissions of greenhouse gas and other conventional pollutants while reducing the country''s dependence on energy exports.

title: RenewGen Debt
content: - The largest private sector investment in a waste to energy in Sri Lanka to date awarded via an international bidding process - The project will handle a significant portion of the waste (up to 580MT per day) of the Western Province of Sri Lanka and help minimize negative impact of dumping and burning of waste- The plant will provide up to 10MW of renewable energy to the grid- The plant will generate employment for about 50 workers with a significant part of the workforce drawn from the local community.- The project will result in reduced greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions- The project will deliver economic benefits to the WMA which will channel these resources into enhancing its capacity

title: Techcombank SLF
content: The Facility is expected to have the following specific development impacts:(i) Increased Access to FCY Financing for SMEs: Limited access to finance is considered a key constraint to private sector growth. Increased access to finance is indispensable to grow the competitiveness of SMEs. By directly financing the short term USD liquidity needs of Techcombank, the Facility will support trade-oriented SMEs for their exports, imports and working capital needs, eventually support the sustainable economic growth of Vietnam.(ii) Job Preservation in an IDA Country:  The Facility is expected to have a positive impact on job preservation by partially bridging the foreign currency liquidity gap in trade-oriented businesses. This is especially important in an environment where a large number of SMEs have been severely affected by the continuing financial crisis. Financial support to SMEs is thus critical to employment preservation in adverse market conditions.  Hence, the Facility will have a direct impact on job preservation and employment generation through Techcombank''s financing provided to private companies.

title: RenewGen
content: - The largest private sector investment in a waste to energy in Sri Lanka to date awarded via an international bidding process - The project will handle a significant portion of the waste (up to 580MT per day) of the Western Province of Sri Lanka and help minimize negative impact of dumping and burning of waste- The plant will provide up to 10MW of renewable energy to the grid- The plant will generate employment for about 50 workers with a significant part of the workforce drawn from the local community.- The project will result in reduced greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions- The project will deliver economic benefits to the WMA which will channel these resources into enhancing its capacity

title: BT Conv. Bond
content: Specific positive developmental impacts are expected to be:(i) Strengthen the capital base and adequacy of a systemically important bank in Romania, and do so in a more efficient manor than raising Tier I capital. In light of the difficult economic context, a strong capital base is very important, not only because it will reduce the solvency risk for the Bank, but it allow the Bank to consolidate its position on the market.(ii) Allow the Bank to continue to grow its loan portfolio. In the absence of this investment, the Bank could be required to reduce its loan portfolio growth, reduce its exposure to riskier asset classes or increase Tier I capital, which would be costly at this stage. (iii) Demonstrate the ability of a domestic Romanian bank to attract investments from international investors in difficult financial times; and bolster depositors'' confidence in the banking sector of Romania by signaling IFIs'' continuing support and commitment to the Romanian banking sector.

title: JFLC Loan
content: Expanding access of finance to SMEs: SMEs contribute significantly to China''s GDP growth but have been under-served by commercial banks.  The growth of JFLC, an SME focused leasing company, can help address the SMEs'' financing difficulty by providing flexible alternative channels;Supporting economic growth in frontier regions: Frontier regions have much lower financial service penetration in China. In light of the credit tightening in China, leasing addresses the local demand for funding, supports the continued growth of local economy, and thus mitigates widening gap between frontier regions and coastal regions;Promoting the development of the leasing sector: Leasing penetration is only 3.8% in China. IFC''s further investment in JFLC will have a strong development impact in promoting the development of leasing sector in China.  JFLC has maintained a sound business record and is expected to further improve its risk management capability. JFLC could become a model institution for other leasing companies to emulate, with a demonstration effect to stimulate the healthy development for the entire leasing sector.

title: Prasac Snr Loan
content: -	Increasing access to credit: The proposed investment in Prasac is expected to improve access to credit in Cambodia as it will enable Prasac MFI to provide credit to underserved micro finance and retail borrowers. -	Specific indicators that will be used to monitor the development impact of the Project include: growth in portfolio; growth in number of borrowers; growth in number of women borrowers; ROE & EROE, outreach indicators (branches).

title: ACLEDA SME loan
content: Increase access to credit: The proposed investment in ACLEDA is expected to improve access to credit for SMEs in Cambodia, and in particular to women-owned SMEs.

title: FHP Indonesia I
content: The Fund would help private sector development through supporting growth and operational improvement of its portfolio companies.  The Project would support private equity investments in Indonesia, helping develop the financial markets in the country.

title: Chuvashia 2012
content: The project is expected to improve access to essential pre-school education services in the Republic by increasing the number and capacity of the centers for preschool education. The project is also expected to improve the quality standards of pre-school education in the Republic available to local population.

title: Fawry I
content: The project will have the following development impacts:- Create an efficient, reliable collection infrastructure for billers;- Provide consumers with a convenient, reliable and secure payment option;- Facilitate trade by reducing transaction costs and overcoming geographic barriers; - Extend financial inclusion by reaching unbanked populations with limited access to traditional banking services; and- Signal to the market, that Egypt has viable and innovative early stage companies that can attract venture funding.

title: Farmsecure RSF
content: Farmsecure is having a significant developmental impact by promoting a more productive and sustainable agri-business model in South Africa. The Project is expected in turn to make a significant contribution to South Africa''s rural economic development, as well as to global food security by increasing access to sustainable and profitable farming structures for farmers.This means that Farmsecure''s focus includes the empowerment of farmers with scientific farming skills, agricultural knowledge and technologies, and hands-on support to assist farmers in fulfilling their maximum potential both in terms of yield and revenues, positioning the Company ahead of the field in the region''s agricultural development.Farmsecure works on a commercial farming basis with a long term goal to further develop small scale farming supported by the infrastructure of sustainable commercial farming.

title: Alliance Tire
content: 1. Technology transfer and enhancing India''s competitiveness: Innovation and technological ability are critical to the development of off-highway tires, a high-value niche segment of the global tire industry. The Project will increase the competitiveness of the Indian OHT manufacturing sector as a result of shared R & D and technology between ATC India and its associate companies, Alliance Tire Company Ltd., Israel and Alliance Tire Americas Inc., USA.2. Employment generation: The Project will create direct employment for about 850 people. ATG is committed to developing and strengthening its employees'' technical expertise and engineers from each of its Israel and India facilities are often sent to the other location to conduct training. In addition, the Project will create temporary employment during its construction phase.3. Agricultural productivity: Almost 60% of ATG''s sales are to the agriculture equipment sector, where increasing productivity is critical to meet increasing food demand. ATG invests significant resources in its research and development and conducts extensive testing to ensure its tires are designed to increase the productivity of the equipment on which they are used.

title: Africa 2012
content: The Project is expected to make a significant contribution to the financial sector and economic development in SSA. The Project''s expected development impact in countries and regions where the Group is present is summarized below:(i)	Increase Access to Credit:  The proposed investments in the Group are expected to improve access to credit in SSA as they will enable the bank to maintain and/or grow credit provision to the domestic economies where it operates, including to underserved market segments (e.g., agribusiness, climate change, SMEs and microenterprises); (ii)	Develop the Financial Sector in IDA and Conflict-Affected Countries:  the Group has demonstrated its commitment to IDA and post-conflict countries by strengthening and/or establishing operations in some of the most difficult environments, making it a pillar of financial sector stability in those countries and a link between them and their more stable neighbors;(iii)	Create/maintain employment :  By helping the Group to better serve its clients in the countries within which it operates, the Project will also help generate job opportunities for the bank''s clients thereby creating or maintaining employment opportunities for more  people in the region.

title: NBV Equity
content: i) Increasing Access to Finance: NBV expects to open new rural branches and expand its microfinance program in 2012, which should further drive access to finance for Vanuatu''s rural population. It is estimated that approx. 80% of Vanuatu''s total population lives in rural areas.  Given high travel costs to access bank branches, only approx. 13% of Vanuatu''s rural population has bank accounts.  Increased access to finance would increase inclusive growth for the larger population.  ii) Promoting Competition: The banking market is dominated by four commercial banks. The strengthening of NBV''s lending capacity will improve its competitiveness in the market. Strengthening of NBV would serve to promote competition within the sector, which would benefit the people of Vanuatu.

title: Shombhabona
content: IFC''s support to the Company will enable it to provide increased access to finance for the micro, small and medium entrepreneurs, who are mainly in the unorganized sector and do not have good access to insurance products. The Company is also expected to diversify its product base to have a healthy mix of corporate and retail business.Focus semi-urban areas and targeted products for retail clients: The Company''s growth strategy is focused on the retail sector and semi-urban areas. The Company is expected to increase its semi-urban presence by deepening its existing operations and having a wider network. It intends to reach a larger retail client base through products specifically designed to cater to their needs.

title: Kongo Coffee
content: 1. Income generation for small holder coffee growers: Expanded processing capacity will generate increased demand and therefore income for growers. Growers will have access to a local, price competitive coffee buyer who has capacity to demonstrate a consistent buying pattern, thereby promoting security of income.2. Job creation and upskilling: Additional employees will be required as processing volumes increase, many of which are roles undertaken by women. New machinery and technology will provide the opportunity for the local labour force to develop of new skills.3. Small holder sustainability: The investment is expected to impact up to 500 coffee growers. This may assist in encouraging younger people to continue participating in local businesses, thereby contributing to industry sustainability.4. Rural development: approximately 100, 000 people in  the Chimbu region are heavily reliant on the coffee industry. Growth of KCL''s business will create additional downstream business opportunities for MSMEs including buyers and other related businesses.5.  Improved financial management and corporate governance: IFC''s involvement will provide an opportunity to improve internal systems and broaden management capacity6. Skills training for growers: opportunity for IFC technical assistance such as enabling business training and accreditation courses.

title: PIBT
content: The Project will: (i) facilitate overall economic growth by further augmenting Pakistan''s transport and logistics infrastructure through development of the country''s first multi-purpose non-food dry bulk cargo terminal; (ii) significantly improve overall efficiency in handling, storage and transportation of non-food dry bulk cargo by way of  faster turnaround of vessels at the port as well as increased efficiency in inland transportation of cargo through road and rail networks; (iii) enable handling and storage of imported coal in Pakistan in an environmentally responsible manner while ensuring high level of safety as per international standards; (iv) provide requisite infrastructure to local cement producers for export of cement in bulk form thus facilitating access to new markets; (v) generate additional revenue for the Government through taxation and royalty and lease payments to Port Qasim Authority (a government owned entity); and (vi) send an important signal of support to local sponsors for development of sustainable businesses in Pakistan during a challenging economic environment.

title: Diamond Bank JV
content: IFC will be providing and mobilizing long term funding and support at times of adverse market conditions. In addition, it will be providing an integrated advisory program that will assist the institution to strengthen its corporate governance.

title: Conaprole WMP
content: - Raw milk production is the primary source of income for over 2,000 farmers, especially in the frontier region of Rivera. The additional capacity will increase raw milk purchase from farmers, improve their livelihood, and contribute to the devevelopment of rural communities. - IFC''s Advisory Services project provides technical assistance to small and medium farmers to help them improve productivity and profitability. - IFC''s investments help increase Conaprole''s commitment to sustainable production and social responsibility.- The new plant will create additional jobs (both direct and indirect).- The Project will enable Conaprole, Uruguay''s largest exporter, to increase the export of milk powder and contribute to the country''s export revenue.

title: Gulftainer II
content: Once regarded as having one of the Middle East''s most comprehensive transportation systems, Iraq''s transport and logistics infrastructure has suffered from more than two decades of neglect and underinvestment. Rehabilitation of such infrastructure is a major national and regional trade issue. Gulftainer investments in Umm Qasr Port should help solve this issue and thus contribute to Iraq integration in the regional and global economy.Iraq relies heavily on imports for its consumer goods and for its reconstruction program. Cost effective transport of imported goods is therefore critical to Iraq''s economy. The 2012 Doing Business indicators however show that Iraq''s is lagging behind other countries in the region in terms of logistics performance. Gulftainer''s investments to modernize one of Umm Qasr berth combined with its experience to efficiently manage container terminals is expected to improve the situation.At present, a substantial portion of goods coming into Iraq are off-loaded at ports in the neighboring countries such as Kuwait, Turkey and Jordan and are then transported into the country by road, which tends to increase the time and cost of delivering the goods to the end consumer. The Project should have a significant impact on reducing these impediments to trade in Iraq and foster the country''s reconstruction efforts along with its economic growth and development. Efficient and well-developed transport and logistics infrastructure is an essential component for the expected growth in Iraq''s oil and gas production and export-related activities and the Project would play a strong role in facilitating these improvements.In addition to its direct impact on trade, the Project should also contribute towards socio-economic development through the creation of several hundred jobs, reduction in the cost of goods paid by the end consumer (through reduction of costs incurred in the transportation process) as well as substantial royalty payments to the Government of Iraq.Through its involvement at Umm Qasr port, Gulftainer will also play a strong role in training and improving the skills of the employees of the Iraq Port Authority, help introduce industry best-practice and contribute its valuable know-how in managing ports and logistics operations, which should improve the overall efficiency of the sector.

title: Sibenik WPP
content: Development impact includes: (i) increasing Croatia''s wind energy capacity by 43.7MW, from the current level of 124 MW, a significant 35% increase; (ii) associated displacement of carbon from the country''s substantial thermal generation plants, reduction of pollution and contribution to the effort to combat global warming; Average annual GHG avoided is estimated on 33,000 tCO2 while total GHG avoided is estimated on 660,000 tCO2; (iv) demonstration effect, given it is one of the largest wind power projects in the country to date; and (v) reducing Croatia''s significant energy imports.

title: KQ Airways
content: IFC''s support of Kenya Airways expansion plan will have significant development impact.  From a social and labor point of view, the Company estimates that the number of employees will nearly double after five years (currently 4,400 employees) most of which are of a technical/qualified labor nature.  At the regional level of Sub Saharan Africa ("SSA"), the launch of the freighter division coupled with the opening of new intra-Africa destinations will contribute to markets integration and will reduce the transactional costs of trade, an aspect that is extremely important to promote the economic development of the SSA economies. Finally, KQ''s entry into new international markets will promote competition as well as provide a key transportation link between growing economies in the Middle East and Northern Africa ("MENA") region and Asia promoting international trade, South South Investments and tourism to and from Africa.

title: XB Syndication
content: (i)	Increasing access to finance to Mongolian SMEs; (ii)	Diversifying funding source for an important IFC partner as well as a systemic bank;(iii)	Helping direct international capital to Mongolia;(iv)	Introducing Mongolian entities/banks to global capital market.

title: Metito III
content: 1) Support for a Regional Player in the Water Sector by putting in place a more suitable capital structure to support its growth plans.2) Increase in Access to Services by helping Metito to pursue new projects and expand capacity at existing plants, and thus to widen service access significantly. 3) Promotion of Water Reuse in Africa and Asia. 4) Enhancement of Competition and demonstration of the benefits of private sector participation by investing in private sector water projects in MENA and China, which are areas that have relatively few private sector players.5) Development of Emerging Markets by supporting the Company to further grow its presence in MENA, Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa and, to contribute to balanced rural and urban development in developing countries with increased investment.

title: CF XacBank SD
content: (i)  Increasing access to finance to Mongolian SMEs; (ii) Diversifying funding source for an important IFC partner as well as a systemic bank;

title: Forus Loan II
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to be high. The Bank already has a locally recognised franchise and a loyal customer base in servicing micro- and small businesses, including those in the remote regions, small towns and rural areas.  This segment is underserved and especially lacks access to quality financial services, on both lending and savings sides.

title: SinoGreen Fund
content: IFC''s investment in the Fund is expected to have the following quantifiable development impact:(i)	Reduction of GHGs through adoption of clean technologies and more environmentally sustainable practices: indicated by potential reduction of CO2 emissions directly and indirectly by the Fund''s investees;(ii)	Private sector development: indicated by improved revenue and profitability of the Fund''s investees;(iii)	Economic sustainability: demonstrated through the Fund''s ability to help its investees grow sustainably and generate employment growth faster than the national average;(iv)	Financial success: evidenced by the Fund''s investment return (net IRR) and the Manager''s ability to raise successor fund.

title: Eaton Uganda
content: (i) Expand mobile telecommunication access: With the improvements to current networks and construction of additional tower sites, existing mobile phone operators will be able to expand the reach of their services both in terms of geographic coverage and network traffic capacity.  In addition, collocation reduces the incremental cost of expanding service for all carriers thereby allowing them to service remote and economically less developed areas where average revenues per user and minutes of use tend to be lower. (ii) Increased competition: The entry of Eaton Uganda will add a second player in the tower sharing market which will lower barriers to entry for smaller and newer mobile phone operators through access to leased towed facilities compared to building their own.  (iii) Expand access to other ICT technologies: Eaton Uganda will be building a tower network capable of not only supporting mobile network traffic but also wireless broadband, backhaul and broadcast networks, which would increase the penetration levels of these technologies. (iv) Contribute to mitigating environmental impact and Climate Change: The Company''s constructed network and services offered will provide a cost effective opportunity for operators to lower their carbon emission as well as physical footprint by sharing infrastructure.  Significant benefits of tower sharing arise from the material, energy and emissions savings incurred from building only one tower compared to each operator building their own site to cover the same terrain.

title: Ameen MF Lebanon
content: (i) Funding: IFC will provide medium/long term funding, that is not available in the market, to enable the Company to continue supporting and further grow its client base. The loan would also assist the Company to diversify their funding and better manage their asset and liability position at the time of limited funding opportunities. (ii) Access to finance: The proposed Project would support AMEEN Lebanon, one of the main microfinance providers, expand its outreach and serve a larger number of low-income people in Lebanon.(iii) Job creation: MSMEs are key contributors to job creation in the Country. Developing a vibrant MSME sector, with reliable access to finance, can play a significant role in private sector led economic growth, generating employment and providing opportunities to the poor and under-served groups. (iv) Demonstration effect: Through this project, IFC is expected to act as a catalyst by encouraging other investors, especially local banks, to fund the microfinance sector and bridge the financing gap facing this sector. Furthermore, the fact that IFC''s first microfinance investment project within Lebanon is with one of the only two microfinance players in the market that adopt best practices and are regulated by the Central Bank, would amplify the value and credibility derived from adopting best practices and falling under the supervision of the Central Bank, hence encourage other players to apply best practices and convert to NBFIs, thereby developing the microfinance market.

title: Infuse Capital
content: 1) Environmental impact: India is currently the third largest CO2 emitter and by 2030, India's share of global emissions is expected to increase 60%, which represents the largest expected percentage increase of any nation. Because of India's existing energy infrastructure is insufficient and inefficient, there exists an opportunity to shift development away from the model of fossil-fuel centric generation & old technologies to clean technologies. Demonstrating that cleantech investment is profitable in India may spur the type of widespread private sector adoption that could help alter India's emerging carbon emissions footprint. 2) Narrowing the Gap of funding of Early Stage Cleantech Companies: Despite presence of affordable, globally proven technologies, there exists a gap in funding for early-stage cleantech companies in India, with no major VC actively investing them in an ongoing basis. Demonstrating that investment in early-stage companies in cleantech sector is profitable and may lead to increased inflow of much needed private capital for the sector.

title: Delta Partners
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: i. Economic and Private Sector Development: Investment in high-growth TMT companies and establishing telecom and IT infrastructure in high-need areas, including in Sub-Saharan Africa and Asia will contribute to economic growth and deepening of private markets.ii. Knowledge transfer and demonstration effect: The Fund employs, hands-on/value-added strategy with its portfolio companies, thereby transferring management and sector knowledge to emerging market firms, leading to greater competitiveness and sustainability.iii. Creation of New Jobs: Support the creation of new jobs as investee companies expand.iv. Private Equity Development: Support and further develop emerging private equity industry in the target regions.

title: BOA Ghana
content: The Project is expected to have high development impact in the following areas: (i)	Improved Access to Finance:  Injecting fresh capital into the Bank would allow for growth as the Bank would be able to further leverage itself to fund growth in the strategic focus area of SME and the currently unbanked rural populous. (ii)	Demonstration Effect:  IFC is helping to demonstrate the soundness and viability of the Ghana Banking Sector. It is expected that there will be new private sector entrants be it via new institutions or additional investment in existing enterprises, this will help to increase the reach of financial services and products in Ghana.

title: Superfilm
content: 1)Preservation of employment in frontier region of the country: Combined Superfilm and Sanko Tekstil have around 6,000 employees most of which work in the frontier regions of Turkey. The increased capacity at Superfilm and Sanko Tekstil will enable the Borrowers to be more competitive and retain the existing work-force.2)Exports: Superfilm and Sanko Tekstil are exporters. The investments will enable them to improve their standings in the export markets and help increase export activity and hard currency inflows into Turkey.3)Environmental Benefits: New machines will be more energy-efficient which will increase overall energy efficiency of Superfilm and Sanko Tekstil.

title: Delta Partners
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: i. Economic and Private Sector Development: Investment in high-growth TMT companies and establishing telecom and IT infrastructure in high-need areas, including in Sub-Saharan Africa and Asia will contribute to economic growth and deepening of private markets.ii. Knowledge transfer and demonstration effect: The Fund employs, hands-on/value-added strategy with its portfolio companies, thereby transferring management and sector knowledge to emerging market firms, leading to greater competitiveness and sustainability.iii. Creation of New Jobs: Support the creation of new jobs as investee companies expand.iv. Private Equity Development: Support and further develop emerging private equity industry in the target regions.

title: Real LRIF
content: (i) Reduction of CO2 and other GHGs: Fund will invest in renewable energy and cleaner technology projects, thus contributing to a reduction in carbon emissions;(ii) Economic and private sector development: Fund will provide  equity capital and project financing to help promote growth and job creation in local communities;(iii) Demonstration Effects: Fund will strengthen investees both from a financial and governance perspective and help them scale up their operations ,thus making them more attractive targets for investment and acquisition. This will help to demonstrate the business case for renewable energy and clean technology projects and encourage private investors to invest in this sector.

title: Abengoa CSP SA
content: 1.	Increasing South Africa''s renewable energy output and helping the country meet its renewable energy targets, including by diversifying its renewable energy mix.  South Africa is facing electricity supply and demand imbalances that risk power cuts and the increased generation capacity from the Project will help to address this.2.	Associated displacement of thermal power, resulting in avoidance of carbon emissions and local air pollutants (Sox and NOx) associated with South Africa''s predominant coal-fired power.3.	Demonstration effect, as one of the first private sector renewable energy projects in South Africa and the first CSP projects in sub-Saharan Africa, proving the viability of financing a large CSP project on a limited recourse basis, demonstrating the suitability of solar power to South Africa given its excellent solar resources, and supporting the successful role out of the first projects under South Africa''s new renewable energy independent power producer program.4.	Job creation/community development: the local communities will benefit through (i) significant sourcing of labor from local communities during the construction period, and overall job creation during the construction and operation periods; (ii) community development programs undertaken as a result of direct ownership in the power plant companies by Community Trusts.

title: MNT
content: MNT''s expansion in Turkey and in the region will increase availability and quality of molecular imaging and oncology treatment services in Turkey and in the target countries; where oncology is an area still hugely underserved and facing a strong increase in patient demand. MNT''s unique model of providing outsourced services within public and private hospitals enables the company to reach to a wide spectrum of patient base including the lower income segments. The project will enable creation of a regional healthcare player with high quality, ethical and corporate governance standards, attracting further foreign investor interest to the region''s healthcare sector.

title: Jain Irrigation Systems Ltd.
content: Raising farmer incomes:  The adoption of MIS is expected to result in reduced risk from weather, lower cost of farm inputs and an increase in farm yields due to better utilization of inputs.  This is expected to improve farmer income and have a direct impact on poverty reduction.Improved water management: India has 16% of the world''s population and only 4% of the water resources.  MIS improves water use efficiency from the average 30-40% in India to 80-85%, leading to improved water management resulting in more sustainable growth for the country.   Supporting the development of a modern food processing industry:  A very low proportion of fruit and vegetable produce is currently processed in India and growth in processed foods is likely to be constrained by lack of a reliable supply chain.  JISL is expected to play a key role in not only supplying some of the inputs but in setting the benchmark for other players that enter the market.Employment: Additional employment is expected in India.

title: Project Sava
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to include: (i) Operational turnaround and efficiency improvements at Carnex, a large employer and former regional leader; (ii) Support to an agricultural company involved in value-added production in a sector important to Serbia''s economy; (iii) Extend the MK Goup''s reach to farmers and imporve agricultural infrastructure; (iv) demonstration effect by encouraging other companies to invest in the region; and (vi) increased tax revenues.

title: AEGEA Saneamento
content: The Project is expected to increase water and sewerage service coverage in AEGEA''s service area, which is expected to expand throughout Brazil, including frontier regions. This increased coverage leads to positive health impact for the population, especially the poor. Diseases associated with poor sanitation decreased by 34% between 2005 and 2009 in Campo Grande, after AEGEA increased sewage collection and treatment there. This reduction of diseases results in lower absenteeism of students and workers, as well as reduced health expenditures, with substantial positive impact in the economy.The Project will also lead to increase in population that receive water and sanitation services from a private operator and to reduced water losses and energy consumption. Indicators to be tracked will include: (i) total number of individual residential customers receiving new or improved water services; (ii) volume of sewage treated; (iii) volume of freshwater saved (reduced physical water losses); (iv) reduction in water losses (NRW - including commercial losses); and (v) reliability of water services (average hours of service per 24 hour period).

title: Equatoria Tower
content: The proposed project will help (a) create business infrastructure that will improve the investment climate of South Sudan; (b) address a severe demand-supply imbalance in commercial real estate sector of South Sudan; (c) create of a minimum of 100 jobs directly and indirectly; (d) provide a demonstration effect where IFC''s involvement in the Project could act as a catalyst to encourage other financial institutions partner with good regional companies to invest in South Sudan; and (e) promote South-South investments through providing finance to a regional group (UAP Holdings) to enable it expand its business regionally.

title: BOK STF Loan
content: Financial Sector Deepening: The Project will enable BoK to access foreign currency funding and compete on a level-playing field with foreign banks that have the benefit of parent funding. The IFC funding will also encourage other international banks / FIs to lend to local banks in Nepal eventually increasing the access to market funding.Supporting Trade: Support to SMEs (via trade financing) is critical as trade in Nepal contributes 41% to the GDP. The project will have a positive impact on economic activity in Nepal

title: Banyan Tree II
content: 1)	Jobs: Like with all the SME growth fund investments, the provision of expansion capital to companies at a crucial inflexion point in their development is the most effective way to impact job creation. This funds ability to reach companies that would not ordinarily access PE capital on account of dilution fears makes their capital even more impactful   2)	Private sector development: An investment in this fund will serve to enhance IFC''s mandate of developing the ecosystem for private enterprise to thrive by promoting SMEs, their suppliers, customers, providers of capital and potential acquirers. This is particularly relevant given the fund''s focus on the manufacturing and industrial segments of the Indian economy

title: Vino Zupa AD
content: The development impact of the project is expected to include:(i)	strengthening of agribusiness linkages and indirect support to farmers;(ii)	support of a Company based in a frontier region in southern Serbia, one of the least developed areas in the country;(iii)	support of an agriculture company involved in value added production and exports in a sector important to the Serbian economy; and(iv)	job preservation in a severely underdeveloped region where a substantial portion of the local population depend on the Company for the livelihoods.

title: Azito Phase 3
