content: IFC''s involvement in this Project is expected to: * Support the provision of least cost, reliable and clean base load power to help reduce the country''s power shortage, and support its economic recovery; * Displace expensive emergency thermal power being rented today, thus reducing costs to Ivoirian consumers;* Stimulate the entrance of new IPPs and the use of combined cycle technology, making efficient use of the country''s natural gas resources (as the Project does not use additional gas); * Provide a strong signalling effect to the broader investment community to support Cte d''Ivoire''s economic growth.

title: Zambeef Expn
content: The project''s expected development impact includes: (i) Development of a sustainable and reliable food supply chain; (ii) Facilitate the growth of a successful regional integrated agribusiness player; (iii) Better capacity utilization of industrial facilities by relieving constraints on the supply of soya and wheat at the Company''s plants; (iv) Intensification of crop production due to additional irrigation; (v) Increased employment opportunities across the group

title: Continental III
content: (i) Expand access to housing finance, while stimulating demand for labor, materials and other supplies for the housing industry; and (ii) indirectly support the construction and development of small hydropower plants, which will increase the availability of clean energy in the country;

title: Podgorica Roads
content: Given the central location of Podgorica along the main road axes connecting different cities within Montenegro and providing access to neighboring countries, a targeted investment in the roads sector is expected to improve national and international connectivity, reduce travel times and vehicle operating costs and contribute significantly to local economic growth. By keeping transit traffic out of the city, the Project is also expected to help reduce air and noise pollution and road crashes along the existing network. The first tranche of IFC investment will allow the City to refinance expensive existing debt, thus reducing the cost of financing its capex and improving its debt servicing capacity.

title: OC Egypt
content: The proposed investment is expected to have the following development impacts: i) employment preservation and creation as the Company''s construction activities increase; ii) SME support through local procurement by the Company and through channeling of funds to subcontractors; iii) revenue generation to the Egyptian economy through payment of taxes by the Company and its subcontractors; and iv) promotion of better E&S standards in Egypt''s construction sector as the Company enforces its E&S standards on local subcontractors.

title: COMPAGNIE HOTELIERE DE LA LAGUNE S.A.
content: - South-South investment;- Job creation and skills development; - Benefits to the local economy through both downstream and upstream local supply linkages; - Government revenues through tax collection; and - Environmental and Social standards improvement including life & fire safety and green building components.

title: CCL Products
content: Economic value addition and employment generation in VietnamExpansion of a mid-scale Indian company in Vietnam will have a demonstration effect for other Indian companies considering similar avenues for growth. Positive environmental impact: Ngon Coffee recycles solid waste generated during the production of instant coffee to be used as biomass fuel, thus conserving scarce fossil fuel and reducing environmental pollution

title: Wataniya II
content: The Project will have the following development impacts:-	Improve access to telecommunications services:  The Project will improve the availability of reliable and affordable communications for consumers and businesses in the West Bank and Gaza.  Access to reliable, high quality voice and data services is key for economic activity and for personal and family lives, especially given the many restrictions on mobility currently in place throughout the territories.-	Spur competition:  Mobile sector in West Bank and Gaza is highly dominated by the incumbent operator. As the Company will expand in the market, it is expected to improve the quality, coverage and cost for the mobile users. -	Increased employment:  The Project will create quality employment opportunities at both the Company and the distributor level in the West Bank and Gaza, which suffer from 15% and 26% unemployment rates respectively.  The Company has approximately 410 employees as of December 31, 2011 in the West Bank and plans to hire an additional 160 in Gaza, by the end of 2013.

title: CoreCo CA Fund
content: The Fund is expected to have significant development impact in the following areas:-- encouraging economic and private sector development by providing much needed equity capital and management advice for SMEs which in return will promote job creation;-- implementing best-practice corporate governance and E&S standards at the Fund and investee level; and-- supporting regional integration.

title: Kalkitech 1
content: The Project is expected to have strong development impact by way of the following:(a)	Improve energy efficiency: Kalkitech''s integrated software and hardware technology solutions for the T&D segment will contribute significantly to optimize energy efficiency by providing technologically advanced solutions to utilities and other industrial customers in a market characterized by acute energy transmission and distribution inefficiency. (b)	Improvement in quality of electricity to consumers: The key benefit expected to be delivered to end-consumers is the significant improvement in grid performance and delivery of electricity through fewer power outages, improved power quality and better management of load and electricity. (c)	Support changes in regulatory environment: There is significant traction developing in the power sector in terms of regulations such as Availability Based Tariff, Merit Order Dispatch, Open Access and power trading; sales of Kalkitech''s ELTRIX products will help ensure better compliance with this new regulatory environment.(d)	Creating employment opportunities: New applications of advanced communication and information technologies will provide employment opportunities to the large and growing pool of software and technology professionals in India.

title: Alutech Expan
content: The Project will further increase the supply of high quality extruded aluminum products and panels, which are important components for the construction industry, and are used in infrastructure, housing amd industrial real estate developments across the region.  The Project will help Alutech grow its share in the regional market, substituting imports and providing adequate quality products at competitive price.  It will also help the Company to increase its exports to the European markets.  Key development impacts to the local economy include employment generation and benefits to the consumers.  The Project has a significant demonstrational effect.

title: URBI Verde I
content: The Project''s strong development impact includes: (i) job creation; (ii) addressing the housing deficit; (iii) integrated and sustainable urban developments; (iv) transfer of knowledge and best practices on green building in Mexico, and E&S sustainability; and (v) contribution to equitable economic growth and community development.

title: BICICI RSF
content: This project is expected to have significant development impact by: (i) Supporting the resumption of lending in CDI and helping spur economic growth through the increase in lending to SMEs;(ii) Promoting lending to viable SMEs in a post-conflict environment where it has been increasingly difficult to access financing.

title: Doshion
content: a)	Create projects for water distribution and transmission thus increasing access to clean waterb)	Create projects for treatment of waste water thus reducing water pollutionc)	Generation of employment both during construction and operation stage.

title: CCFP ING Bank
content: The project is expected to have a significant development impact by increasing funding for trade of critical agri and energy commodities to/from the emerging markets. CCFP is aimed at helping to address this current liquidity constraint faced by both financial institutions and real sector businesses.

title: HSBCbank Armenia
content: The development impact is expected to be high, as the Project provides the needed long term funding for investments in renewable energy and energy efficiency sub-projects in an IDA country through an experienced and capable bank and contributes to the deepening of financial intermediation in Armenia. It will also help Armenian companies to improve their competitiveness and overcome the consequences of the economic crisis as well as support job generation. Estimated volume of greenhouse gas emissions that can be avoided as a result of the project implementation stands at 15,000 tons.

title: Persianas Group
content: The Project is expected to have the following impacts: i) Improvement of food security - rollout of modern food retailing as planned anchor for every development.ii) Direct and indirect employment - retail and service jobs; possibility for linkages. iii) Tax revenues will accrue to the government.iv) Development of critical business infrastructure in Africa''s second largest market, and most populous nation.v) Elevation of commercial real estate standards - throughout the country.vi) Better aesthetic environment, particularly states outside Lagos undergoing redevelopment.

title: SIPRA CI
content: (i)	Contribution to the Development of the Ivoirian Poultry Industry:  IFC investment will support the Company''s efforts to promote higher efficiency, quality, and best practice biosecurity standards.  These best practices would spread throughout the country, and contribute to development of Ivorian poultry industry.(ii)	Benefit to the supply chain:  SIPRA operates in a post conflict country with significant linkages to farmers and MSMEs.  SIPRA works with 25 poultry outgrower farms.  Also, SIPRA sources maize locally reaching small farmers, and sells its feed and day-old chicks to poultry meat and egg farmers.  The Company indirectly contribute the growth of small service-oriented businesses (transporters, restaurants, etc.).  (iii)	Employment creation:  The Company has 523 full-time employees and 217 temporary workers. The Project is estimated to create approximately 200 additional jobs.(iv)	Increased Tax Revenue For Government. (v)	Demonstration effect:  IFC investment in Cote d''Ivoire will raise confidence of other investors.

title: Apollo Hosp
content: -	AHEL''s plans to set up new hospitals and expand facilities will enhance the country''s medical infrastructure and improve access to high quality healthcare services. The Company''s facilities in larger cities will act as centers of excellence for tertiary healthcare, while its new facilities in second and third tier cities and in Low Income States (LIS) will bring affordable quality healthcare closer to populations in these locations and reduce the need for people to travel long distances to seek medical care.   -	The Project will help raise the overall quality of private medical service delivery in India, thereby also having a strong demonstration effect.-	The Project, upon completion, will provide additional direct employment to more than 9,000 people in the healthcare sector, apart from generating indirect employment. -	AHEL is incorporating aspects of green buildings into the design and construction of its facilities while also taking steps to increase energy efficiency of existing operations.

title: SAME DTZ Croatia
content: 1.	Contribution to food security. Based on competitive cost structure, quality, efficient distribution network and service, the projects are expected to increase the availability of tractors and harvest combines in their regions. This, in turn, should help improve the agricultural productivity and thus output, and contribute to food security. 2.	Contribution to rural development: Increased mechanization of the agriculture in the region is expected to lead to higher farmer income as well as development of small businesses that provide spare parts and maintenance/ repair services for the agricultural machinery. 3.	Job preservation in a frontier region.  By supporting the continuation of the Croatian Company''s post-privatization restructuring, IFC''s investment is expected to ensure the preservation of at least 300 jobs at the plant, and help increase indirect employment in the supply chain and distribution network of the SDF group in the region through the Company''s growth.

title: SAME DEUTZ India
content: 1.	Contribution to food security. Based on competitive cost structure, quality, efficient distribution network and service, the projects are expected to increase the availability of tractors and harvest combines in their regions. This, in turn, should help improve the agricultural productivity and thus output, and contribute to food security. 2.	Contribution to rural development. Increased mechanization of the agriculture in the region is expected to lead to higher farmer income as well as development of small businesses that provide spare parts and maintenance repair services for the agricultural machinery. 3.	Job preservation in an IDA-blend country.

title: Ambow
content: (i)	Improve students'' employability: The Project will provide the infrastructure for college students, high school graduates, and working adults to improve their technical skills and employability prospects through hands-on IT training and other soft skills training;(ii)	Reduce youth unemployment: By bridging the skill gap between college and high school students and their first job, the Project will reduce unemployment among youth; (iii)	Enhance education outcome: The Project will enhance education outcomes by offering vocational training services that mobilize quality teachers, online learning tools, and innovative systems that track students'' progress as well as provide guidance on their career prospects; and(iv)	Support innovative model of education: The Project will provide support to an innovative model of education delivery: large career enhancement campuses located in close proximity of potential employers, with courses designed closely with these potential employers and content providers.

title: ECT
content: The project would: (i) support the continued development of a key player in the still nascent private Kazakh rail sector; (ii) promote competition and the role of the private sector in a state-dominated industry; (iii) contribute to the development of the transportation and logistics sectors in Kazakhstan; and (iv) help renew Kazakhstan''s aged railcar fleet, helping avoid a supply crisis over the next 5-10 years as about half of the existing fleet needs to be retired.  The availability of new, more reliable railcars would also help sustain the competitiveness of Kazakhstan''s railway sector, mitigating the risk of trucks displacing the railway with attendant increases in harmful greenhouse gases.

title: MBJ ROS
content: a) The Project involves much needed investments for the continuous maintenance of SIA''s infrastructure in order to improve safety and ensure operations at the highest levels of service to all stakeholders (carriers, tenants and users).  b) The safety improvements at SIA are essential for the airport to continue supporting tourism in Jamaica, a critical source of revenues for the country''s economy. c) The continued success of a high profile project like SIA will encourage other foreign investments and further private sector participation in infrastructure concessions in Jamaica.

title: TTS III
content: Substantial development impact will result from improving the country''s transport infrastructure, including: - increased trade for several basic industries such as agriculture, chemicals, metals and mining;  - expanded capabilities in transporting agricultural commodities from the region which becomes increasingly important in supplying grains to the world market; - improved cargo handling capacity and efficiency at the port of Contanta, a major trade hub in Central and Eastern Europe; - further development of river transport, a more cost effective and environmentally benign transportation mode than the alternative road transport; and - new river trade volume to Constanta, which will generate economic growth, boost local employment, and contribute to incremental tax revenues for the government. A more efficient transportation system in Romania should contribute to further regional integration and should have positive spillover effects in neighboring countries, increasing trade among EU countries as well as among neighboring transitioning economies such as Ukraine and Moldova.

title: Itau SME NE CL
content: 1)	Increase access to finance in frontier regions with focus on smaller and middle sized companies.2)	Assist in  the development of companies located in frontier regions of the country which are still underserved by the domestic financial markets.

title: Convergence Fund
content: - Further Development of ICT Sector in Sub-Saharan Africa:  Based on substantial expertise in ICT sectors and hands-on, value added approach to investees, the Fund Manager will continue to proactively source investment opportunities with significant socio-economic and developmental impact.- Provision of Critical Funding and Expertise to Emerging Market Companies:  The Fund will address critical funding needs by emerging market companies that due to their business stage or scale might face capital access constraints.  The Fund''s investments will support entrepreneurship, innovative business models and technologies, and generate employment.  The Fund Manager will provide operational, technical and managerial advice to its investees.- Development of Africa Private Equity Sector: The importance of private equity for development of emerging market private sector, nurturing entrepreneurship and supporting business innovation is well recognized, and IFC''s commitment to the Fund will serve as a vote of confidence for Africa''s growing private equity industry.

title: Russian Towers
content: The project is expected to have a number of development impacts including the following: (i) improve access to mobile network in rural areas due to a decreased time to market and improved economics of accessing more sparsely populated areas; (ii) enhance the coverage and quality of service in rural areas; (iii) facilitate more economically efficient use of resources, including land and capital investments, due to the reduced need in the number of towers; (iv) reduce the visual burden of multiple towers as well as the carbon footprint (through reduced and/or more efficient use of diesel generators to supply power in rural locations); (v) encourage more competition that, together with lower capital costs and operating expenses of operators, would translate into the lower cost of services to users, and (vi) assist in the creation of direct and indirect (through subcontracting) employment opportunities.

title: LH El Salvador 2
content: This project will have the following high developmental impacts:1.	Help promote primary mortgage lending in El Salvador in the low to mid income segments; 2.	Help build a securitizable pool of mortgage assets which will eventually benefit El Salvadorian capital markets.

title: CBM Equity 2
content: The proposed investment seeks to (i) help Credit Bank of Moscow grow and serve its small-and-medium enterprise client base; (ii) expand its operations to new regions outside of Moscow; (iii) strengthen and diversify its capital base; (iv) mobilize additional investors to enter the Bank''s capital in light of a future initial public offering (IPO); and (v) promote best practices in terms of corporate governance and business and risk management, enabling the Bank to become one of the key platforms for sector consolidation.

title: Rusfinance EECar
content: 1.	Development of sustainable "green products" in Russia, and particularly financing of CO2 efficient vehicles compliant with current noxious emissions standards or better, that directly contributes to the protection of the environment and human health. 2.	Given that Rusfinance will be financing eco-friendly vehicles, including those manufactured in Russia, which meet the CO2 and other emissions criteria (such as GAZ and YO-mobile), it would further strengthen the development of the Russian economy and local employment outside of raw materials sector.3.	Using global best practices and in close cooperation with the WB experts, including Societe Gererale Group, IFC would develop and pioneer a new "green" car lending product that is in demand in numerous developing and developed markets, thus building this solid platform for product replication worldwide.

title: MIFA Debt Fund
content: i)	Poverty reduction: The project is in line with the IFC microfinance strategy for increased outreach in South, East and Central Asia, especially in large countries like India and China, home to 40% of the world''s population.  Microfinance penetration rates in this region remain among the lowest globally. By supporting the expansion and sustainability of well performing MFIs, the project will improve access to finance for thousands of micro and small borrowers. This in turn will stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty alleviation in the region.ii)	Access to local currency commercial longer-tenor funding for MFIs: By lending in local currency, the Fund will facilitate the access of Asian emerging market MFIs to commercial funding that is better tailored to their needs. It will reduce the volatility of MFI loan portfolios, as currently most MFIs are unable to properly address the currency mismatch risk.  Further, the Fund aims to provide longer tenor funding and subordinated debt products, a clear need for MFIs currently.iii) Mobilization: the Fund will mobilize resources from local and private partners to promote microfinance as a viable asset class.iv) Capacity-building: the TA Facility will aim to build the capacity of microfinance institutions, with a focus on business and finance skills, MIS development, and corporate governance.

title: Fibabanka Women
content: The key development objective of this project is to increase financial inclusion in Turkey. The project is designed to improve access to finance for SMEs in Turkey, with a special focus on women owned businesses (at least 50% of the project amount will be used to on-lend to women owned SMEs). By working with Fibabanka, a well-run, mid-tier bank with a particular focus on SMEs, this project is intended to demonstrate the business opportunity presented by women enterpreneurs as an under-served market

title: Alta Growth II
content: Alta Growth Capital Mexico Fund II, L.P. is targeting equity investments in 10-15 SMEs that will be supplemented with environmental, managerial and technical value addition.  Private equity-sponsored companies often adopt management practices (in environment and social, financial control, cost accounting, quality control, corporate governance, legal structure and tax reporting) that are better than those used by their local peers. If Alta Growth is successful and delivers developmental and financial results for its investors, it may be able to launch successor funds. Examples of successful, well-run private enterprises will contribute to encourage foreign investment in Mexico. The Fund is expected to contribute to a vibrant and sustainable private sector that will improve employment, trade balance, and public finances in Mexico. Finally, by attracting new investors to the private equity asset class <e2>local pension funds, insurers and investment companies, the Fund will help these companies to achieve higher risk adjusted returns as well as the implied benefits that private equity brings into their overall portfolio. The IFC team will measure and report on the following developmental impact indicators: 1) percentage of funding disbursed, 2) net/gross financial return, 3) number of jobs created, 4) annual growth sales, 5) annual growth EBITDA, 6) launching of follow-on funds, 7) tax paid to local governments, among other indicators.

title: BRL Club Deal
content: The Project would: (i) support the continued development of a key private sector player in the relatively new Russian railcar leasing sector; (ii) contribute to the development of the transportation and logistics sectors in the Russian Federation, facilitating economic growth particularly in the economically disadvantaged hinterland; and (iii) facilitate a Eurobond issue which will be used to finance the construction of additional railcars and help avoid a supply crisis over the next 5-10 years as the majority of RZhD''s fleet reaches the end of its useful life. The majority of the Group''s fleet is unrelated to the oil sector and thus helps facilitate the diversification of the economy. Brunswick''s new, more reliable railcars also help mitigate the risk of trucking replacing railways which would result in an increase of harmful greenhouse gases.

title: Power Grid
content: The key development impacts of the Project are (a) supports increasing investments in the Indian power sector - a critical bottleneck for economic growth and poverty alleviation.   In particular, the power transmission sector requires urgent investments to ensure efficient transfer to power from generation to load centers; (b) supports increased private sector investment in the power generation sector by allowing new generation projects to access users across the country due to the development of the National Transmission Grid by POWERGRID ; (c) helps mitigate climate change impacts by supporting development of renewable energy projects which need the National Grid to optimize utilization of the power they produce.

title: Merec Grp Expn
content: (i) Strengthening the wheat procurement logistics and improving the group''s production infrastructure; (ii) Employment creation; (iii) SME development as the company''s new projects would entail increased demand for locally produced maize and increased business for retailers; (iv) Increase domestic food production in Mozambique; (v) import substitution which will save the country foreign currency outflows; and (iv) Increased tax revenues to government

title: CITY BSLF II
content: The Project is expected to have the following specific development impacts:-     Financial Market Deepening: By providing local banks with much-needed FX liquidity and facilitating their access to the commercial loan market, the Facility will help deepen the financial sector by establishing a level playing field between local banks and foreign banks operating in the local market that have an advantage due to support of parent funding.  -	     Demonstration Effect: The demonstration effect of the IFC funding will encourage international banks to finance the local banking sector and increase the range and availability of funding options in the market. -  	Economic Growth Acceleration: The Facility will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with trade finance solutions to finance their working capital needs and pay for critical value chain imports. -	      Job Creation and Job Loss Prevention: By providing much needed working capital support to SMEs, the Facility will help create new jobs and also prevent job losses resulting from business interruption, particularly in an economy where the poor are mainly employed as daily wage workers.

title: Triada LIH
content: (i) Address housing deficit: Colombia''s current deficit stands at 1.3 mm units that grows at 140,000 units per year.  The Project will contribute to address the increasing deficit by supporting the development of 5 to 10 projects in a five period; (ii) Address shortage in housing supply: Colombian homebuilders face constraints in obtaining medium- to long-term financing, especially equity to finance land acquisition. This issue constraints the ability for homebuilders to develop larger projects and is one of the main reasons why the number of housing units built every year is not enough to address the increasing deficit.  The Project will help Triada to develop larger scale projects; (iii) Alignment with Government''s priority:  Housing is one of the strategic pillars of the government.  President Santos is setting up the framework and designing the incentives to increase the stock of new units by 250,000 per year.  The Project will be aligned with the government''s strategic priorities for the period 2012-2014 and will benefit of the incentives that the government will make available to foster housing supply.

title: CIMB Niaga Sr.
content: (i)	Development of the housing finance sector: By providing long term funding, this project will enable CIMB Niaga to grow its mortgage loan portfolio and thereby further develop the housing finance sector in Indonesia. (ii)	Increase availability and the affordability of mortgage loans: Further growth of CIMB Niaga''s mortgage loan portfolio will increase the availability and access to affordable mortgage loans.(iii)   Support a Government of Indonesia initiative: The project will support the government''s efforts to increase access to housing financing.

title: Fullerton Credit
content: Expanding Access to Finance for MSEs : Micro and Small Enterprises ("MSEs") play an important role in creating employment and contributing to local economy particularly in less developed regions. Nevertheless, MSEs are under-served by traditional financial institutions.   The expansion of the Companies will help address this issue by increasing credit supply accessible and affordable by MSEs; Supporting Economic Growth in Frontier Regions: Frontier regions in China have experienced much  pronounced difficulties in access to finance for MSEs, which hinders the economic growth in these regions. The Companies, operating in three large frontier provinces, i.e., Sichuan, Chongqinq and Hubei, will expand access to credit in these regions, specifically to MSEs, thereby supporting the continued growth of the local economy;Demonstration Effect of Setting Best Practice in the Burgeoning Chinese Microfinance Sector:    The Companies have potential to become model institutions in China in serving the MSEs with a novel business model.  The success of the Companies is likely to attract other MCCs to emulate, with a demonstration effect to stimulate the healthy development for the entire sector.

title: Titan Danube
content: (i)	Contributing to further improving infrastructure development and strengthening the capacity of the construction sector and related activities, a key growth and local sustainability area for the Balkans in the long-term(ii)	Supporting employment and enabling entrepreneurial opportunities through increased operational efficiencies at energy consumption, resource utilization, etc.(iii)	Contributing and safeguarding income to the Governments through taxes as a result of the plants'' operations and continuous performance improvement(iv)	Supporting and strengthening local SMEs by promoting  sub-contracting at local level and investing in their continuous performance improvement

title: Lacteos Toni
content: IFC will be supporting the continued growth of one of Ecuador''s leading agribusiness companies in terms of employment and linkages through the value chain and one of the most important staple food producers in the country.  The Project will contribute to improve Toni''s competititveness in the production and commercialization of dairy products, and help the Company extend its reach toward the interior of Ecuador.  Toni has a strong base of the pyramid focus as it services more than 90,000 small shops, and sources milk from approximately 2,300 small and medium-size farmers, most of them located in rural frontier regions where employment opportunities are scarce.  Its activities therefore have a considerable reach in the local economy and impact on livelihood of local population.There are specific developmental impacts associated with the Project, which are summarized below:Product Safety: consumption of raw milk is still very popular in Ecuador, in particular in the interior of the country. This is considered a health hazard as the product does not meet minimum health and safety standards. On the contrary, Toni''s products conform with high quality and safety standards, and therefore reduce public health risks for consumers.  Toni''s growth strategy in the interior of Ecuador will displace consumption of raw milk with high quality and safe products.Employment: Toni''s improved performance and increased production capacity will result in higher employment opportunities at the plant, and in rural areas througout the country.Farmers linkages: Toni sources milk from direct and indirect farmers througout the country.  As a consequence of the Project, Toni will further develop milk production and tehrefore enhance and stabilize farmers'' income and increase hired employment on dairy farms.

title: Nile Kordsa
content: -Employment preservation: through capacity increase and efficiency gains, the Project helps to maintain and further create employment at the Company-Continued know-how and technology transfers: given the Group''s focus on product innovation and its ability to meet stringent quality standards, the Project is expected to result in continued technology and know-how transfer through the expansion of the Company''s operations into PET.

title: BPI SEF II
content: The project is expected to contribute to the development and diversification of the financial sector by assisting in the development of new markets and product lines in sustainable finance with significant growth potential.  This in turn will continue to have positive demonstration effect in the commercial mainstreaming of RE/EE finance among other commercial banks.  Lastly, the project will contribute to pollution reduction by increasing usage of more energy efficient and renewable energy technologies.

title: RBRU DPR
content: The proposed Project is expected to have a number of the development impacts:1. Capital market development: As the first DPR securitization out of Russia since the crisis, this would provide an important signaling effect to the market and could set the stage for subsequent Russian DPRs.2. The deal would create a long-term funding source for the Bank.3. The Project is expected to positively impact private sector development by increasing access to finance for SMEs.  Long-term financing is crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector across the country that would result in improved economic development and improved living conditions. 4. The Project would contribute to the objective of commercial long-term lending without sovereign guarantees to well-performing subnational entities to support their investment in the essential economic and social infrastructure.5.    Demonstration effect: A succesful closing with the participation of other IFI''s could be used as a model for replication with other Western European banks with emerging market subsidiaries.

title: Bayer Ukraine CA
content: IFC involvement through this transaction is expected to have a strong development impact, through:(i)	increased and improved access to financial services for agricultural SME's and farmers;(ii)	improved productivity through the provision of certified, top quality crop protection products and know-how to SME farmers;(iii)	improvement of Bayer's and farmers' integrated pest and disease management (IPM/IDM) approach, coordinated use of pest and environmental information along with available pest control methods, including cultural practices, biological, genetic and, as a last resort, chemical means to prevent unacceptable levels of pest damage.

title: DARP Philippine Asset Growth One
content: (i) Market development: The successful implementation of the project could spark the interest of other market players and evolve into a common practice.  Furthermore, this could become an important stabilization mechanism for the Philippine financial sector and help IFC to address the current NPLs issues of the bank;(ii) Best practices: As part of the project IFC would promote international insolvency standards, creditors'' rights and collection practices for the resolution of the distressed assets; and(iii) Market transparency: Through this project, IFC would be helping to assign a market value to a NPL portfolio.  If successful, the proposed project has the potential to be replicated by other entities in Asia.

title: CNAV Fund II
content: Supporting SMEs: The Fund's strategy is to target SMEs with high upside potential but that lack access to finance due to limited resources in the market. Private Sector development: The Fund will provide not only capital but also managerial support and expertise to SMEs in North Africa region to improve their competitiveness and sustainability.Implementation of best practice for corporate governance in portfolio companies: The Fund will adopt international best practices for corporate governance and management, as well as transparency, thus fostering knowledge and skill transfer, and encouraging best practices across the industry.Job creation: Unemployment constitutes one of the greatest barriers for poverty alleviation and economic development in the region. The Fund's target countries including Morocco, Algeria, Tunisia and Egypt exhibit high unemployment rates. The Fund's strategy is to target high growth companies, which will make a positive contribution to job creation and economic growth.

title: Virgin Connect
content: 1. Increase Access to Broadband: The Company mainly operates in fifteen regions of Russia. The Company's strategy is to acquire operators in these regions lacking the necessary cash resources to invest in their own infrastructure and then invest in the required infrastructure to increase broadband penetration.2. Increase Competition: Currently 82% of the broadband market is captured by six operators with the remaining 18% spread between several dozens of smaller operators. As the Company expands, offering high quality broadband services with exceptional customer service, incumbent operators will start investing in infrastructure to increase their service levels, resulting in a more competitive market in which broadband prices are expected to decline, benefiting customers.3. Employment Creation and Skills Transfer:  As the Company expands local jobs will be created and with the Company's commitment towards providing high quality training to all their staff, local talent and skills deployment will be enhanced in frontier regions of Russia.

title: Hospitaria
content: Provision of quality health care services to an underserved area: Both Ambar Capital and Ginequito are committed to providing quality health care services to an area which continues to grow substantially, without access to quality healthcare. The hospital will represent the first secondary care hospital in the area, thus improving the quality of health care to the local population.   Demonstration effect: The envisioned Project is innovative in comprising a fully integrated medical complex and designed with energy efficient systems. This is expected to have a demonstration effect for further health care projects in Mexico. IFC will assist in implementing and encouraging further "green" construction. Strong social commitment: Ginequito has historically shown a strong commitment towards the community. The expansion will allow for Ginequito to continue its contribution to the community.Urban frontier: The hospital will be constructed in an area of Monterrey, which does not have quality medical services readily available. The local population living in the northern part of Monterrey will benefit significantly from the planned hospital building and adjacent medical facilities.

title: Primorsky
content: - Improved access to quality healthcare: the Project is expected to increase availability of modern inpatient and outpatient health care services for local population and reduce pressure on public health infrastructure - Demonstration effect: the local private provider''s expansion into advanced segments of care, together with potential new PPPs with local health authorities building on success of the existing PPP in Kazan will raise awareness and increase attractiveness of healthcare for private investors and financiers- Job creation and retention: the Project is expected to create 450 new jobs, including 350 for medical personnel, contributing to retention of qualified staff in the sector

title: Proteak
content: Climate change mitigation: IFC financing will support the Company in establishing teak plantations and supporting the growth of the existing planted area, which will directly result in a significant carbon sequestration. Moreover, since land reserves and land to be acquired comprise mainly ranch lands that have been degraded due to over-grazing of livestock, the Project will have a considerable impact on soil regeneration.  Employment generation: The Project is expected to create direct and indirect employment (number of jobs to be created and wage levels) and contribute to poverty reduction in remote rural areas.Strong demonstration effect:  Successful implementation of the Project will demonstrate the long term viability of sustainable forestry projects in regions with favorable weather and soil conditions for forestry, and degraded land available.Frontier regions: The Project involves direct investment and job creation in remote rural areas of Costa Rica and Colombia, and frontier regions in Mexico such as the states of Nayarit, Tabasco and Chiapas.

title: Aqualyng
content: 1. Address the severe water scarcity in China; out of the 663 cities in China, 400 are short of water and 110 are facing serious shortages.2. Assist the government in establishing a technology that reduces energy consumption, especially with the growing environmental pressure that is increasingly being stressed by the national government and the international community.3. Demonstration effect to grow this infant industry through the success of the project, in particular the Caofeidian plant as the model desalination project for China.4. Adoption of environmentally sustainable practices in a water sector that requires careful planning of the waste (brine).5. Enable knowledge transfer and technology transfer by supporting a company that is shifting its research and manufacturing to China, and planning to expand into other emerging markets.

title: Equity Bank Ltd
content: The project is expected to:i) Support Lending and Growth in the East African Market:Equity Bank has a wide distribution network in East Africa with subsidiaries in Uganda and South Sudan, offering financial services to the large unbanked population. The Project will support the Banks continued growth ultimately contributing to renewed economic activity in East Africa.(ii) Increased Access to Finance for SMEs:SME''s are a key growth sector for EBL. IFC will assist with SME development beyond financing to include advisory services for key aspects of its SME operations including lending to the agricultural sector and women entrepreneurs. The expected improvement in access to finance for SMEs will help to generate employment at the grass roots level and further facilitate regional trade which is expected to grow rapidly following the economic integration of the East African Community.(iii) Support regional Expansion and integrationIFC''s engagement with EBL will its regional expansion strategy and contribute to increased competition and service in the regional banking sector. This will strengthen the regional economy and contribute to the success of the newly created economic community.(iv) Increased Financial Inclusion at the bottom of the pyramidEquity Banks has a clear focus and commitment to increasing financial inclusion at the bottom of the pyramid through new and innovative products and services. IFCs investment will support the Banks growth strategy and allow it to reach even more customers at the bottom of the pyramid.

title: PMC Serbia
content: Sustainable employment creation - The Project is expected to create at least 367 skilled jobs in Sumadija District, a frontier region of Serbia.Support FDI in Serbia - Channeling foreign direct investment is a priority for Serbia. The project will contribute to balancing Serbia''s large current account deficit. Support export oriented industry - the project will sell its product to FIAT assembly plant in Kragujevac, which will export 90% of the production.Technology transfer - MA and Proma are FIAT trusted suppliers and have state-of-the-art technologies and efficient processes. Local staff will be trained to new, highly competitive standards.

title: Yes Bank
content: The market segments focused on by Yes Bank overlap with some of IFC''s top priorities. Through this investment IFC will initiate and develop a relationship with a potentially important development partner. IFC will help refine the focus and strengthen the capabilities of the Bank in effectively addressing SMEs and agriculture customers as it expands its network and increases its exposure in these market segments.Access to finance: The proceeds of IFC''s funding will be utilized by Yes Bank to finance its customers in the SME and agricultural sectors. IFC''s investment will thus ensure continued and increasing access to finance to the SME sector in increasingly challenging credit environment.Supporting a private sector bank in the growth years:  Yes Bank is a recently established private sector bank with 7 years of operations, and has demonstrated consistently good performance. Yes Bank was also the regional (Asia Pacific) winner of the 2011 FT/IFC Sustainable Finance awards. The Bank has ambitious plans to expand its branch network, broaden its footprint in smaller cities and grow its SME franchise. This project will support the long-term growth strategy of Yes Bank and improve its financial fundamentals.

title: Mediterra CP
content: (i)  Support for SMEs: IFC experience has shown that small to midcap companies can achieve higher job creation rates than large cap companies. IFC would support job creation in Turkey since Mediterra's midcap growth strategy is in full alignment with IFC's development impact goals.(ii) Access to long-term equity/risk capital is limited in Turkey. SMEs usually access short term bank loans in the absence of equity investors. IFC's investment would support Turkish companies by providing liquidity and depth.(iii) Private Sector Development: Mediterra will employ a hands on, value added strategy with portfolio companies. Through this knowledge sharing, new management techniques and growth strategies are incorporated by investee companies, leading to improved competitiveness and sustainability.(iv) The Fund will seek to make investments in Anatolian cities where SMEs are often underserved for equity capital.

title: Lombard Asia IV
content: The Fund would help its portfolio companies create jobs, potentially covering the rural areas and increasing female employment.  The Fund would help private sector development through supporting growth and operational improvement of its portfolio companies.  The Project would support private equity investments in the Fund''s target markets, helping develop the financial markets in its target countries.

title: Kompanion
content: The developmental impact is expected to be high:-	 The Project would provide funding for the underserved segments of the society, more specifically women entrepreneurs and individuals in poor rural areas.-	 In Kyrgyz Republic, the provision of term funding in the local financial market would have a strong demonstration effect and build market confidence. -	 Strengthening the microfinance sector in Kyrgyzstan will allow to prop up economic growth in the country through generation of new jobs and improvement of life at the base of the pyramid.

title: SnowmanIII
content: This repeat investment will have a strong development impact by helping build efficient agriculture supply chain solutions in India. Additionally, the investment will help in (a) building competitiveness as the development of an efficient supply chain will help reduce waste and losses as well as reduce logistics costs, (b) providing an opportunity to local businesses to outsource their distribution functions and lower their distribution and inventory costs. Further, IFC''s repeat investment will provide a strong demonstration effect, signaling IFC''s faith in the TCL sector. This should aid the sector and Company in attracting new private capital in future. Finally, this expansion is expected to create additional jobs.

title: Arnur Credit
content: The developmental impact is expected to be high:- Open up more financial channels to the underserved segments of the society in remote and rural areas of Kazakhstan through supporting lending operations of Arnur Credit. Through access to finance, local micro and small entrepreneurs, more specifically women owned borrowers, would be able to expand their business activities and subsequently finance their day to day consumer and family needs.- Contribute to the employment creation and improvement of life at the base of the pyramid through the strengthening of the microfinance industry in the frontier regions of Kazakhstan.- Create a demonstration effect for MFIs in the country to upgrade their practices in different areas including risk management and social and environmental risk management.

title: ENDA II
content: - Access to Finance for Micro-Entrepreneurs:  This project will also allow ENDA to increase the outreach of its lending operations.  With an existing average loan size of US$600 and an average maturity of eleven months, this project would enable ENDA to provide over 45,000 such loans during the tenor of the credit line expected to be up to five years.- Improved Economic and Social Livelihoods:  The planned expanded outreach of ENDA's credit activities is expected to have a significant and positive impact on its clients' livelihoods.  The provision of credit services empowers micro-entrepreneurs to take a proactive approach to improving their economic well-being.

title: Conti Auto Thai
content: 1.	Climate change: The Project involves the manufacturing of high pressure pumps, a key component of the Piezo common rail system. Continental is a pioneer of diesel technology and is the market leader for Piezo Common Rail Technology, which will promote adherence to EURO 6 emission standards, which will be mandatory from 2014. This new technology will lower carbon dioxide emissions by over 15% relative to regional standards, and by 5% relative to world-class standards. Assuming that half of the CO2 savings are attributable to the injection system , the Industry Specialist calculates CO2 emissions reduction of 17 g/km per vehicle attributable to the use of the Piezo common rail technology. With an annual mileage of 30,000 km, a lifetime of 10 years per vehicle and a production of 145,030 vehicles in 2011, total estimated CO2 savings is 739,650 tons in 2011.2.	Technology transfer and enhancing Thailand's competitiveness: The Project will increase the competitiveness of the Thai automotive sector through the transfer of best practices and managerial and technological know-how. Innovation and high-tech manufacturing processes will support Thailand's transition to a developed country status. Historically, the development of the auto sector, including the export of high-value components, has played a significant role in the economic transformation, as exemplified by Japan, Korea and Taiwan.3.	Generation of highly skilled labor: The Project will generate approximately 780 jobs. Continental is committed to developing and strengthening its employees' technical expertise. All newly recruited engineers from Thailand attend a one year training program at its headquarters in Germany. 4.	Support of local suppliers: This Project will require local suppliers to improve their quality and will generate around EUR40 million of local purchases annually by 2014. We estimate that over 1,000 employment opportunities could also be created within the local supply chain. Continental is situated close to its supply base and provides regular inputs to improve quality through internal audits and supplier evaluation.

title: Grameen Phone V
content: Bangladesh is an IDA country with nominal GDP per capita of around $550 for 2009. The country has one of the lowest teledensities (only 42%) and highest subscriber growth in the world.  Since 2006, total number of subscribers has increased from 20 million to more than 65 million, with a significant impact on the economy in terms of aggregate investment, employment and productivity levels, particularly in rural areas. By further investing in network development, offering improved connectivity and additional services, GP will continue to assist Bangladesh to build its competitive strength. The Project will also enhance competition in the sector, leading other mobile operators to invest further in their networks, thereby increasing availability and improving the quality of cellular services and lower tariffs.

title: A & C Mixed Use
content: i) Development of necessary business infrastructure:  The Project will alleviate the country''s critical lack of class A office space and it will improve retail services to meet the country''s growing population; ii)  Job creation: The new office building will create new direct and indirect employment both during the permanent stage and during construction; iii) Benefit to local suppliers:  Local procurement of construction supplies, food and services throughout construction; andiv) Skills transfer: there will be the transfer of skill and expertise in the construction and renovation of the mall and office building to the local workers

title: Finsch
content: A strategic priority of South Africa's Medium Term Strategic Framework (2009-2014) is the creation of employment opportunities. The framework also specifically recognizes the economic contributions from mineral extraction and processing, and the need for support for continued expansion in the sector. The Finsch expansion, which contemplates the long-term and economic sustainability of a 44-year old mine, will support this government objective, by increasing production from 1.5 Mcts per annum to 2 Mcts per annum and extending the mine life from three to 18 years, thereby promoting sustainable development in a frontier region of South Africa. More specifically, the development impact from the Finsch expansion is expected to include:(i) Employment: Successful implementation of the Finsch expansion will help maintain the aggregate number of direct and indirect jobs and potentially create opportunities for further employment.(ii) Fiscal Contributions: Petra anticipates Finsch to start generating royalty payments immediately and become a tax paying entity by 2014. As per IFC requirements, Petra has agreed to publicly disclose all material revenue payments made to the South African government.(iii) Community Development: Finsch already contributes directly towards community development through the provisioning of social, commercial and industrial infrastructures.(iv) Support to Local SMEs: A large proportion of Finsch's procurement is expected to be from South African suppliers, of which a significant percentage is expected to be from local and regional suppliers. Finsch is committed to supplier development and training, and expects to allocate a portion of its community development expenditure to such initiatives.

title: Byblos Arm REE
content: The project envisages partnering with a capable financial intermediary to provide residential energy efficiency loans to Armenian residents. Energy-efficiency improvements can play a critically important role in Armenia - a country without indigenous fossil energy resources and thus very dependent on imported fuel. IFC will also provide advisory support to Byblos Bank Armenia for development of energy efficiency product and related training.

title: Pragati Fund
content: The team expects high development in the following areas:1. Flow of private capital to LIS - Focus of the Fund's investments will be for the benefit of companies and projects in LIS2. Support of SMEs - The target investee companies will be small to medium enterprises3. Private sector development - The target companies will benefit from value-added practices that include increased corporate governance, environmental and social standards and transparency.4. Accelerated growth - Providing advice and risk capital to enable faster growth in portfolio companies. 5. Job creation - Supporting high growth companies which will reach the bottom of the pyramid and create employment at a faster rate than the national average.

title: SRLL
content: - SRL''s expansion plans include opening new laboratories across India including laboratories in several Low Income States and Tier II and Tier III cities, which will help improve the standard of medical facilities by providing advanced, high quality diagnostics services. - The Project will provide additional direct employment to more than 800 technically qualified professionals apart from generating indirect employment for close to 2,000 people through its collection centers and other allied downstream facilities. - The Project will provide standardized high quality diagnostics services in a fragmented industry, where the quality of diagnosis has a critical impact on the health of the population. - The Project will create new business opportunities for local companies, including small and medium enterprises that will be franchise partners and through training and development of franchise partners, help improve the overall quality of healthcare services.- SRL also plans to expand its laboratory network across several lower-middle income countries in Asia and Africa.

title: Armajaro
content: The project''s development impact includes direct benefits to rural populations in many developing countries in Africa and Asia and a demonstration impact on sustainability and traceability initiatives. Some key impacts will be: 1)  increased number of farmers reached/trained, 2) improved E&S practices in the traceable portion of the supply chain 3)  improved farmers'' income through certification, training and improved access to market.

title: Karadzhalovo SPP
content: 1. Increasing Bulgaria''s renewable energy output, and helping the country meet its renewable energy targets, including by diversifying its renewable energy mix; 2. Associated displacement of thermal power, resulting in avoidance of carbon emissions; 3. Demonstration effect, showing the viability of financing a large SPP on a limited recourse basis, and proving the ongoing viability of the Bulgarian RE sector, given recent changes to the RE Law.

title: BP Southern Afri
content: The Fund will achieve developmental impact via:1) Providing investment options for SMEs to diversify and boost economic and social development;2) Encourage economic and private sector development in local communities, providing much needed equity capital for SMEs, and promoting job creation;3) Building institutional capacity of local companies through technical assistance programs; 4) Implementing best-practice corporate governance and social and environmental standards at the Fund and Investee level.

title: Rialto Energy
content: The project offers strong development impacts.Develop Cote d''Ivoire''s energy sector: By financing CI-202 appraisal, the project will help increase gas availability, which is crucial for the country''s power sector. The country currently suffers from power outages.Increase government''s revenues: Oil and gas production will increase the country''s exports and the government''s fiscal revenues.Provide local employment: the project will generate local employment directly through direct hiring and its local contractors, and indirectly by improving the power sector''s economics.

title: Vegpro Ghana
content: The proposed Project will help a) create employment for up to 1500 people; b) develop the horticulture industry in Ghana; c) develop a network of suppliers of goods and services (inputs, transportation, maintenance; equipment, etc) which has industry-wide benefits; d) provide access to export market for 200 smallholder farmers which should improve their incomes and e) contribute to food security through the production of maize for the local market and increased incomes of employees and smallholders.

title: Regional CL PYG
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact as it will help an IFC client to bolster its financial services and products to Paraguayan companies and individuals, supporting economic activity and job creation in Paraguay.On an institutional level, by providing access to longer-term local currency financig, IFC will help Banco Regional to introduce new products in the financial system limiting foreign currency risk.  On a sector level, the introduction of longer-term financing in the market will supply more options to SME's and individual borrowers, therefore generating a range of social and economic benefits which include promoting economic growth and raising productivity, as well as increasing banking penetration in rural areas. The anticipated development impacts of the Project are to:-	Enhance access to finance for SMEs.  The Project will allow the Bank to provide its clients access to funding in Guaranies with longer maturities, enabling them to undertake investment projects with more appropriate financing structures;-	Generate a demonstration effect.  The Project is expected to create a demonstration effect for other banks and further enhance IFC's developmental impact in Paraguay; and-	Assist in the deepening of Paraguay's financial sector by increasing access to finance for low-income groups and other priority sectors such as affordable housing.

title: TMB flood relief
content: Support the economic recovery: The worst flooding in Thailand in half a century is expected to reduce the country''s economic growth rate by 1-1.5%. The Project will support the country''s disaster responses by providing a source of emergency liquidity.Financial sector deepening: The Project will enable a local bank to access foreign currency funding and provide a level playing field with foreign banks that have the benefit of parent funding.Increase financing to sub-borrowers: The project will contribute to an increase of TMB''s loan portfolio.

title: OCB SME Loan
content: As a large segment of the private sector, particularly SMEs, remains un- or underserved this project is expected to directly expand credit access to SMEs, provide liquidity for exports and indirectly improve market perception to commercially-priced long-term funding for SME lending, which could catalyze similar funding from commercial sources for further SME-lending activities. It is also expected to promote market development with the introduction of syndication for this type of funding.

title: Fosun Pharma 2
content: 1. Support frontier region development. The Project will provide support to some of Fosun Pharma's subsidiaries in the frontier provinces. The Project will send a positive signal to the market in terms of the region's capabilities in carrying out relatively high value-add pharmaceutical manufacturing.2. Support development of anti-malaria drugs. One of Fosun Pharma's subsidiaries has the exclusive right to manufacture artesunate, a treatment for malaria, in China and export artesunate-related products to 37 countries. The Project will support the expansion and upgrade of the manufacturing capacity of these anti-malaria drugs.3. Increase access to quality and affordable medicines. Through the expansion of the Company's distribution network, the Project will increase the availability of quality and affordable medicines addressing rising demand. The Company is also expected to bring more facilities acquired through acquisitions into compliance with the Chinese GMP standards.4. Employment creation and local linkages. The Project is expected to create a number of employment opportunities for the local communities as well as spur the growth of local suppliers of goods and services.

title: Laxmi Organic
content: -	IFC''s proposed investment will help LOIL become a leader in adopting latest practices to ensure clean production. This is significant, especially in an industry where most medium-scale chemical manufacturers tend to follow polluting processes with minimal investment in waste effluent handling. LOIL has designed a zero discharge ETP for additional effluents generated from expansion projects where processed effluent will be used as feed water.-	The proposed investment in a thermal co-generation power plant will provide the most efficient <e2>Energy and Product Integration'' solution between steam intensive ETAC plant and power intensive DD plant. -	LOIL is in the process of carrying out R&D for cost effective thermal solar panels which has potential to integrate with co-generation unit in DD plant. This pioneer design will mitigate LOIL''s reliance on fossil fuels and reduce its greenhouse gas footprint.-	The proposed expansion is expected to create nearly 70 jobs over the next two years and result in other indirect development benefits such as linkages with local suppliers, upgrade of existing infrastructure, and indirect employment creation through auxiliary businesses in the region and during construction phase.-	Considering that 70% of India''s current requirement for DD products is being imported, the proposed investment will facilitate self sufficiency and conserve foreign exchange.

title: Pran Natore Agro
content: Agriculture accounts for 21% of Bangladesh's GDP, whereby 55% of the country's population derives its income from the sector.  Private sector involvement will ensure continued growth in income-generating agriculture activities, particularly by integrating small farmers into formal supply chain linkages such as those that Pran's operations have established. In addition to creating over 1,200 new jobs, the proposed Project will positively impact the livelihood of several thousand farmers and their communities by ensuring consistent demand and fair pricing for their produce. Further, Pran's unparalleled distribution network will enable the Company to reach under-served, impoverished communities and provide them with affordable, essential food products of high quality.

title: Canopus
content: The stability of the Brazilian macro economy during the last seven years coupled with the Government's agenda to prioritize the housing sector in a countercyclical effort, have boosted the demand for lower- and middle-income housing.  The proposed Project will support a reputable domestic housing company to undertake its growth plan in response to increasing demand for quality and affordable entry level lower-income houses in Brazil, thereby helping to reduce the current housing deficit in the country  particularly among lower-income families. Consumers will benefit from the expanded supply of residential units, while such housing developments will contribute to urban infrastructure development and community development around them, such as roads, electricity, hospitals, recreation areas, and so forth, thus also improving living standard of the population in the surrounding area.  Finally, in addition to promote significant job creation, the Project will also enhance local supply linkages through increased demand for construction and building materials in the country. Once construction is completed, the housing units will stimulate the use of local supplies of goods and services, supporting maintenance, retailing and wholesale operations.  In addition, local employment will be generated during and after construction.

title: EVN Macedonia
content: The Project''s expected development impacts are as follow: (a) Supporting the Company during the power sector deregulation by providing long term financing,  (b) Continue supporting EVN with their turnaround strategy that essentially focuses on increasing bill collection rates and reducing energy losses that will lead to significant electricity savings for FYR Macedonia, and (c) Promoting proper sector reform and the development of a competitive power market in the country.

title: FINCA Kyrgyz 2
content: The developmental impact is expected to be high:- 	The Project would provide funding for the underserved segments of the society in an IDA country, more specifically women entrepreneurs, and would help create jobs and reduce poverty in Kyrgyz Republic.- 	The Project would support the efforts of FMCC to diversify and increase the volume of their funding and to better manage their assets and liabilities at a time of limited funding opportunities.- 	In Kyrgyz Republic, the provision of term funding in the local financial market would have a very strong demonstration effect and build market confidence. This is extremely relevant in a post-conflict environment.

title: IMON SL 2
content: The developmental impact is expected to be high:-	The Project would provide funding for the underserved segments of the society in Tajikistan, more specifically women entrepreneurs; would strenghten the microfinance sector in Tajikistan and would help create jobs and reduce poverty in Tajikistan by supporting economic growth.-	In Tajikistan, the provision of term funding in the local financial market would have a very strong demonstration effect and build market confidence.

title: BBVA P Sr Loan
content: The Project will provide SME funding to a systemic bank in Panama, generating a range of social and economic benefits which include promoting economic growth and raising productivity, as well as increasing banking penetration in rural areas. The anticipated development impacts of the Project are to:(i)	Enhance access to finance for SMEs.  The Project will allow the Bank to provide its clients access to funding with longer maturities, enabling them to undertake investment projects with more appropriate financing structures;(ii)	Generate a demonstration effect.  The Project is expected to create a demonstration effect for other banks and further enhance IFC's developmental impact in Panama; and(iii)	Assist in the deepening of Panama's financial sector by increasing access to finance for low-income groups and other priority sectors;

title: Laureate LAC
content: (i) Expand access for middle income students to high quality post-secondary education; (ii) Improve quality of education and access to the job market, through better academic standards; (iii) Demonstration effect in the country regarding the viability of privately-run education institutions.

title: TSKB Sustainable
content: The project is expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of the sustainable energy finance and stream of SE project investments. Specifically, the Program would: (i) develop SE investment projects across all sectors; (ii) improve the competitiveness of the Turkish economy by increasing the SE of end-user's operations; and (iv) improve the local as well as the global environment through reduced emissions of greenhouse gases and other conventional pollutants and reduce the country's dependence on imports of fossil fuels and natural gas.

title: BTPN Loan II
content: 1) Increased Access to Finance to the Underserved Population: The proposed project will significantly increase access to finance for large populations at the bottom of the pyramid.2) Women's Empowerment:  The proposed project will help to increase access to finance for women borrowers and will enable them grow their businesses and support their families financially.3) Job Creation:  The Project will directly create employment opportunities within the Bank as well as create broader employment opportunities arising from the creation and expansion of microfinance enterprises that the Bank supports.  BTPN currently employs about 13,000 staff and expects to employ more people to support the growth of its business.

title: SASFIN EE
content: The Project is expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of sustainable energy finance and a stream of energy efficiency project investments. Specifically, the Project will i. facilitate energy efficiency investments by Sasfin''s small industrial and SME sub-borrowers; ii. build Sasfin capacity to finance energy efficiency projects and iii. improve the local and global environment through reduced emissions of greenhouse gases and other conventional pollutants while reducing South Africa''s dependence on fossil fuels.

title: CPLF- Mriya
content: IFC''s financing will support resource and energy efficiency improvements at the sugar plants. The implementation of the project will achieve significant reductions in energy consumption, water use and CO2 emissions. As a result, Mriya will realize direct economic benefits and enhance its competitiveness.

title: Vonpar Alimentos
content: IFC's investment in Vonpar will have a direct and significant impact in the region's development:  (i) The company works together with about 1,133 farmers that produce milk for Vonpar, and Vonpar provides technical assistance to the farmers it sources raw milk from, with dedicated staff, and will support the farmers in  improving the quality of milk in light of the new milk safety regulations that are expected to come to effect in 2012; and (ii) although the production staffing needs will decline in the new chocolate factory due to increased automation and efficiencies gained from co-locating the candy and chocolate plants, increased employment is expected in the transportation, sales and promotion staff as sales of the company continue to increase.

title: GTLP Extn Citi
content: The project is expected to have a significant development impact by increasing funding for trade of consumer goods, intermediate goods, smaller machinery and commodities demanded by emerging market enterprises.

title: Atlantida Loan
content: - The Project expects to address climate change by reducing GHG emissions through the use of alternative energy sources and cleaner technologies.- It will help transform the energy matrix and reduce dependency on volatile imported fuel prices and subsidies for costly thermal energy power sources; ultimately will help alleviate public budget constraints.  - IFC will contribute to the creation of new direct and indirect jobs during the design, construction and operation of the sub-projects.- Consumers will have improved access to more reliable and less costly sources of energy; - Implementation of clean technology projects will facilitate the transfer of modern production techniques to Honduras which may be followed by new entrants into the sector.

title: SEF Tajero II
content: Through this Project, IFC will be supporting a local sponsor that has built a distribution business in a challenging environment.  The project will have strong development impact:  i) in the business community where Tajero will serve as an example of the benefits to be gained through improved transparency and corporate governance; ii) for consumers, as  the affordable financing that Tajero will obtain from IFC will help mitigate the price increases it is passing on to its customers, which are also as a result of global food price increases; and iii) for investors and exporters to the region, as IFC's involvement with Tajero adds comfort in identifying potential partners in Tajikistan,  a country with few foreign investors outside the resource sectors and microfinance.

title: IXcellerate
content: The Project is expected to have the following impacts:i) Expanding availability of IT infrastructure, services and solutions: IXcellerate fills a gap in the market for high quality/high availability systems hosting which is, in turn, needed for business continuity and disaster recovery service offerings.  ii) The Company's association with Guy Willner, who co-founded one of largest global providers of vendor neutral data centers, brings best practice in operational procedures, design, and business model to the country. iii) Improved private sector connectivity and public sector competitiveness: This Project will help provide cost-efficient and energy-efficient IT infrastructure and services.

title: Etileno XXI
content: The Project is expected to have a significant development impact by (i) adding value to a natural resource which would otherwise be used as natural gas, (ii) creating forward linkages that would develop the downstream industry, (iii) improving the position of Mexican downstream converters, such as savings on inventory, reduced foreign exchange exposure, local access to a PE supplier that could provide services and new solutions, (v) providing inclusive growth for an economically underdeveloped southern region of Mexico, (iv) creating employment and training opportunities.

title: Fundacion Cardio
content: (i) High quality health coverage in an underdeveloped region: Colombia overall has 10 beds per 10,000 inhabitants, low as compared to Argentina and Brasil.  This low coverage is even less in remote regions, such as the ones FCV is targeting; Santander, coffee region and the Atlantic coast.(ii) Availability of hospital infrastructure for population for some frontier regions of Colombia (Norte Santander, Guajira, Magdalena, Cordoba, Choco), (iii) Best practices redeployment in a network of smaller hospitals: FCV has JCI accreditation for its main hospital in Bucaramanga and plans to expand this standard to the new project as well to the hospitals under management.(iv) Improving coverage: FCV has a track record of operating 4 hospitals in different cities of Colombia and plans to continue expanding its network.

title: JN SBLL
content: FORMTEXT The development impact of IFCs financing to JNSBLL is expected to be high, as it will support productive microenterprises and foster employment generation. Sponsors such as Jamaica National Building Society are good partners for IFC, as they are committed long-term players in Jamaica and to expand to areas such as providing the so much needed financial services to low income households and helping address the inequality that exists within the different segments of society. The beneficiaries of these loans will be low-income micro-entrepreneurs in Jamaica.

title: APMG
content: This project is expected to increase access to high quality medical services, promote dissemination of best operational and clinical practices, provide community health services per the China health care reform blueprint, and generate high quality employment opportunity for medical professionals in China.

title: Agricover Credit
