content: This project generates multiple developmental impacts:(i)	Increases Access to Finance for Farmers: Romanian farmers would be able to access to long-term debt to finance their investments in agriculture sector, resulting in higher productivity and economic growth.(ii)	Job Creation and Increased Tax Income for the Government: With IFC financing, the Company will be able to grow its business, creating new jobs and resulting in higher revenues and taxable income.(iii)	Support to a Domestic Agriculture Group: The Project will strengthen the Company''s and the Sponsor''s market position and improve its competitiveness in agriculture sector.

title: CCLP Rabo
content: The project is expected to have a significant development impact by increasing funding for trade of critical agri and energy inputs, including fertilizers and crop protection as well as energy products that cover daily needs (e.g., refined fuels, kerosene), to/from the emerging markets. CCLP is aimed at helping to address this current liquidity constraint faced by both financial institutions and real sector businesses.

title: Tiryaki
content: -Supply Chain Linkages and Access to Farmers: Tiryaki sources directly from 40 farmers in Turkey through contract farming arrangements, providing them seeds and pre-financing in the process. In addition, the Company works with third-party logistics and service companies. The Project will increase the impact of the Company on SMEs along its supply chain.-Job Creation and Increased Tax Revenues for the Government: Profitable growth of Tiryaki''s business would create new jobs and increase the tax revenues to the Government.-Supporting a Regional Player: The Project will strengthen the Company`s market position, which has substantial room for consolidation, and improve its competitiveness in agribusiness sector regionally.

title: Candax
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts:1.	Value extraction out of mature, marginal fields: The Project involves investments aimed at prolonging the life of mature fields which, given their marginal nature, would otherwise see production decline quickly and be abandoned within the next few years. 2.	Contribution to government revenues: The Project will generate fiscal receipts in the form of royalties, corporate taxes and participation in the production through the Tunisian national oil company ("ETAP").  3.	Demonstration effect: The Project supports a junior oil and gas company with assets in Tunisia. Increase in     production and positive returns to shareholders should incentivize more investors to supply capital for similar ventures in the country that focus on marginal and mature field development. 4.           Preservation and creation of employment: By sustaining production for a longer period in the Company''s mature fields, the Project will maintain current employment levels. Approximately 140 families rely on their income from jobs sourced on these fields. Furthermore, the Company is committed to create managerial positions in its Tunisian offices as well as operating positions for the development of the fields.5.	Generating additional business for local and national suppliers: Candax''s local procurement will have a positive impact on regional economic activity through the purchase of equipment, products and services.6.            Improve Tunisia''s energy account trading balance: Tunisia currently has a negative energy account trading balance. Production from the Project will help alleviate the energy trade deficit and raise foreign exchange earnings. The following indicators will be tracked throughout the life of the Project: (a) Annual output levels; (b) Tax and other payments made to government; (c) Employment; and (d) Domestic purchases (US$).

title: Medco Power 2011
content: The Project is expected to have the following developmental impacts:a) Climate Change Mitigation: The Project is expected to displace coal and oil fired power generation that would otherwise be developed and to have demonstration effect in facilitating the development of small-to medium -sized domestic IPPs using domestic gas or hydro resources, a market segment that has been under-served thus far. b) Private Sector Development: The Project would also have a demonstration effect in facilitating the development of local IPP players, in a market that remains dominated by foreign IPP investors. The development of local players is important in supporting the growth of a competitive IPP market and would further broaden the local private-sector base.c) Infrastructure Development: The Project is expected to add power generating capacity for over one million people, a substantial number in a country where approximately 1/3 of the population lives without regular access to the electricity network.d) Rural Development & Employment: Investments in small scale hydropower projects are expected to stimulate job creation and economic growth in rural communities.e) Taxes: The project is expected to increase the tax base of the Government of Indonesia.

title: KBB_SubDebt
content: By providing the Bank with the sub-debt, IFC/AMC will help Komercijalna to strengthen its capital base at a time where Basel II capital requirements are to be adopted in Serbia. This will consequently allow the Bank to further strengthen its position in the market and bolster its financial services and products to Serbian enterprises and individual consumers, supporting economic activity and job protection in the country.

title: CCLP SocGen
content: The CCLP-Bank facility is expected to have the following specific development impacts:- Increase Liquidity: The Facility will ensure continuing and additional funding to the major agricultural and energy sectors in Emerging Countries, especially in Africa and IDA countries. This Facility will contribute to the Bank maintaining its level of business in commodity finance. Among other things, the Facility will enable traders to purchase from and finance agricultural producers, the mainstay of most economies in Africa, and ensure food security and income for the public at large, but especially to farmers. - Strong Demonstration Effect by catalyzing other IFIs to Support Agri and Energy Finance: By supporting commodity backed finance and outreach in partnerships with banks, the facility will have a significant demonstration impact on other banks, especially local /regional banks to participate in funding the agricultural and energy sectors.  This would ultimately help increase access to finance for critical economic sectors.-  A steady supply of critically needed refined oil products through regular channels will keep prices in check, remove parallel market incentives, improve affordability for the vulnerable poor and contribute to sustaining local economic activities.

title: CF Muscat SME/HF
content: The project is expected to achieve a significant development impact as it will allow IFC to enhance access to finance for job creation sectors such as SME and low-middle income households in Oman partnering with a strong bank with an established distribution capacity and reach.  Specific positive developmental impacts are expected to be:-	Job Creation: Through this project IFC will increase access to finance for SMEs and housing finance  in Oman that play an important role in generating employment and economic growth.-	Enhance access to finance for SMEs: The project will support the underserved SME segment which in turn helps the industry diversification efforts.-	Enhanced Access to Affordable Housing and Social Impact: The project will promote the primary mortgage market enhancing the level of access to viable housing finance and the ability of the population to purchase their homes. The increased level of home ownership will also contribute to improve living standards in the country;-	Positive Signaling to the Market:  IFC''s continued engagement at a time of global turmoil is expected to send a positive signal to markets.

title: DAP LT Financing
content: DAP is having a significant developmental impact by supporting a more productive farming business model in Paraguay, which is expected in turn to make significant contribution to Paraguay''s rural economic development as well as to global food security. DAP''s main impacts include:(i) DAP''s innovative approach to establish trust-based relationships with the local peasant communities. DAP''s initiatives help rural families to improve their farming practices, triggering a virtuous circle of development. (ii) DAP is partnering with leading NGOs and local community organizations to develop outreach programs for rural farmers to improve their access to new markets by (a) capacity building on good agricultural practices, (b) advise on product diversification (e.g. organic products), and (c) improve access to roads and logistic services. (iii) DAP has contributed to the development of a new class of agricultural service companies and SMEs agri-contractors in frontier rural areas that provide various services and inputs to the Company.  DAP supports indirect employment for 850 persons working for more than 44 SMEs agri-contractors, which DAP promotes through trainings, workshops, and social activities. (iv) DAP contributes to food security by promoting soil conservation agriculture expertise (no-till farming), sustainable pest management (IPM) and world-class farm technology and management, increasing the yields and sustainability of owned and leased farms.

title: IMGC India
content: This product is expected to enhance accessibility to affordable housing finance across income segments and regions through the provision of guarantees and support to the lenders. The proposed project will have development impact in the following areas:- Increased home ownership for middle income households  and first time buyers, and deepening the financial market for housing finance - Increased activity in the housing sector- Knowledge transfer to the company and the sector from the various sponsors of the company in helping develop the mortgage finance and guaranty market in India- Risk Transfer: The mortgage guarantee product is expected to allow the banking system an new and effective avenue for risk diversification and would allow the institutional investors to participate in the very large mortgage market which would otherwise be closed to them.-It will also lead to a standardization of lending practices.

title: MATCO Rice
content: The expected development impact includes the following:(i)	Employment: The Project will generate 300 new rural jobs and about 200 seasonal employees in Punjab in 2 years;(ii)	Farmers reach: The Project will create additional backward linkages which are expected to generate benefits to approximately 1,500 farmers in the region;(iii)	Improved agri-infrastructure: The Project will increase  automatic drying capacity by 45,000 MT and automated silo capacity by 30,000 MT thus improving food storage in the Punjab region and reducing losses and bottlenecks; and(iv)	Better quality product: The company will expand the production of its high quality branded rice products in Pakistan.

title: Samapleu Nickel
content: This is an early-stage, exploration project in a post-conflict, IDA country which is set to attract investment to develop its mineral resource sector.   During exploration and prior to commercial resource discovery, the Project will have limited, immediate development impact.  Nonetheless, even at its early stage, the Project provides local permanent employment to 35 people in an area with no formal employment opportunities and poverty levels of 80%.   Should exploration lead to mine development and production, the developmental impacts will be notable.   Key expected benefits will include taxes and other payments to government, the generation of direct employment and indirect jobs through linkages into the community as well as the improvement of local transportation and other infrastructure that will support local economic development.   Successful resource discovery and development are also likely to attract more foreign investment into the sector.

title: Zephyr India III
content: (i)	Support of SMEs: Target investee companies will be SMEs, which are capital constrained and have very limited access to bank debt or the public markets to finance their growth strategies(ii)    Jobs: Investments in SME companies entering a growth phase leads to a substantial impact on job creation at a rate faster than the national average(iii)	Private sector development: Addition of value to portfolio companies by means of improved corporate governance and transparency while providing financial and operating expertise, evaluating new lines of business and sourcing strategic partners(iv)	ESG: Incorporating IFC environmental and social standards, thereby contributing to sustainable economic development

title: Dutwa Nickel
content: The proposed investment will contribute to the completion of a full project feasibility study to confirm the commercial viability of Dutwa. Thus IFC''s current investment will be used for further exploration and studies, and not for the development of a mine. Development impacts from exploration activities are typically limited and at this stage mainly limited to local employment.If Dutwa is developed, significant development impacts will be realized, including: (i) diversification of Tanzania''s mining industry beyond gold and gemstones into base-metals; (ii) Government revenue generation and increased foreign exchange earnings; (iii) Significant linkages of Dutwa with other domestic economic activities; especially transportation and logistics; (iv) employment opportunities; and (v) Dutwa could become a long-term base-load customer of the Tanzanian central rail system.

title: Aureos SEAsia II
content: (1)	Support the Development of SMEs. The Fund is expected to invest in small and medium-sized enterprises in the Target Countries. The Fund will address a major constraint faced by SMEs by providing access to finance through equity and quasi-equity instruments. In addition to its capital investment, the Manager expects to provide hands-on support to strengthen the management capacity, develop new information systems, improve accounting and financial systems, and play an active role in identifying new market opportunities and potential acquisition targets. (2)	IDA countries. The Fund intends to invest in SMEs located in IDA countries such as Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam.  (3)	Promote Private Sector Development and Create Jobs. The Manager is expected to source quality SMEs that can generate employment and accelerate growth enabling them to become local and regional market leaders. Furthermore, the successful execution of the Manager''s strategy will attract additional funding sources from the private sector to help narrow the funding gap experienced by most SMEs.

title: Lidl Romania
content: Improvement in green building standards: As one of the few global retailers in the food discount stores segment in Romania, the Sponsor will, through the Project, contribute to the improvement of local green building standards by applying the highest level of energy efficiency measures, in line with the ones prevalent in its home market of Germany; which would help the new Lidl stores exceed IFC''s Green Building standardFood Supply chain development: Schwarz''s expansion will (i) increase the number of its local suppliers, (ii) provide additional sales channels for local fresh and dry food producers in Romania, and (iii) contribute to improvements in food security and availability, as well as in efficiency and operating standards throughout the supply chain.Benefits to low income consumers: By expanding the modern discount format in frontier regions and secondary and tertiary cities of Romania, Schwarz will be able to improve access of local low income customers to a more affordable diverse selection of high-quality food products.Employment generation: The Project will create significant local direct employment (mostly women who represent more than 60% of Lidl employees), and indirect employment in the retail value chain.

title: Belcorp
content: Strong development impact through the generation of 8,920 direct jobs across the region and 1 million of indirect jobs for women through the direct sales market model.

title: Custodian
content: 1. Insurance Sector Development: IFC''s support for Custodian will enhance the growth and development of the Nigerian insurance sector, thus improving the sector''s contribution to the Nigerian economy;2. Entrepreneurship and Employment: IFC''s involvement in the Insurance Sector through Custodian will promote growth of business activities and employment in Nigeria. Entrepreneurial activities will be encouraged by the availability of appropriate and effective insurance products for risk management; 3. Government Revenues: By enhancing the capacity of the insurance sector to support business activities and employment, IFC''s investment will also enhance the growth of government revenues from taxation of insurance and other business activities;4. Long-Term Funding Source: IFC''s support for Custodian will also facilitate the generation of long term funds through the growth of insurance premiums, thereby addressing the shortage of local currency financing for infrastructure development in Nigeria.

title: ProteaTakoradi
content: (i) Absorb the unmet demand for quality hotel of international standards in a major business district of Takoradi.(ii) Standards: Improve hotel standards in the 3 star segment.(iii) Skill transfer: Encourage the transfer of skills and expertise in hotel management to the local workforce. (iv) South-South Investment: support a South/South investment in CAF region.(v) Employment: Direct and indirect employment for locals during construction and operations. (vi) Revenues: Government revenue source through tax collection.(vii) Local supplies: local procurement of construction supplies, food and services throughout construction and operations.

title: NBD SME Frontier
content: The Project is expected to have a high developmental impact on account of(a) providing access to finance to the Russian SME sector;(b) contribute to new employment generation in small towns of the Central part of Russia.

title: Progresemos III
content: The development impact of IFC''s financing to Progresemos is expected to be high:(i)	Increase Access to Finance:  Progresemos provides financial services to low income segments of the Mexican population living in rural areas with limited or null credit opportunities.  Moreover it will contribute to build up a credit culture amongst this low-income population; and(ii)	Greater Commitment to Creating Opportunities to Disadvantage Groups:  This project will support productive low-income micro entrepreneurs which consequently will positively impact employment and income generation in the frontier regions where Progresemos operates.

title: La Nacional
content: - Provide long-term financing on terms not generally available: Long term funding is important to reduce term mismatch risk in mortgages. The IFC transaction is thus expected to provide long-term funding with a tenor and amount that is not generally available in the local capital markets.- Broadening Funding Source: The project will assist La Nacional to diversify its funding structure which is based on savings and term deposits.

title: DelawareGroup
content: Quality Employment: The Company''s expansion will increase the availability of direct and indirect jobs in those countries where it plans to expand.  Vocational and engineering students typically intern and land their "first job" at IT services companies, supplementing their income and tuition expenses. The industry increasingly employs more women and handicapped persons as IT fully jobs recognize their professional capabilities.Development of IT Sector in Latam: This project will promote the development of the IT services sector in Latam while fostering competition in those markets where the Company plans to expand.  An investment in Delaware would also support and enhance the competitiveness of the region''s as an attractive destination for outsourcing and offshoring.Technology Transfer: Delaware implements useful training programs for its employees in various technologies.  This project will enable the replication of these training programs to other countries. This technology transfer will increase the professional standards and technical knowledge throughout the region.Export/Economic Growth: Offshoring/Nearshoring generates significant export revenues. IT outsourcing helps organizations become more efficient and creates employment, which in turn contributes to economic growth.

title: ACBA Bank II
content: High development impact on account of (i) continued MSE support in an IDA country and (ii) Sustained ability to lend to the agricultural sector which comprises 29% of its loan portfolio.The Project will generate a range of social and economic benefits, including economic growth and employment creation, as well as financial deepening with services and products tailored to low income populations, the Bank having a strong foothold in rural financing to micro and small enterprises and farmers.

title: Kosmos Energy Finance International
content: Development impacts include: (i)    generating substantial revenues for the Government;(ii)    stimulating economic activity through creation of demand for local goods and services; (iii)   providing opportunities to develop domestic energy sources such as gas to address the country''s energy needs; (iv)   promoting further foreign direct investments in the country and in the region, particularly in the hydrocarbon sector;(v)    helping expand the universe of lenders active for operators in the West Africa region and therefore play an important market-building role.

title: Regulus
content: The proposed investment will be made before the completion of a full project feasibility study that would confirm the commercial viability of the Rio Grande project. The IFC investment will thus fund exploration and further studies and will not fund the development of a mine or result in any immediate incremental production. Development impacts from exploration activities are typically limited but nonetheless create local employment.Should Rio Grande be developed into a commercial mining operation, significant development impacts are likely to be realized during the construction and production phases, including employment opportunities, tax revenues and foreign exchange contribution to the national economy, purchase of local goods and services and associated economic development.

title: Galaxy chemicals
content: (i) Setting up environment friendly world class facilities compliant with International Regulatory Standards.(ii) Employment Generation: The original project is expected to create nearly 110 jobs (including direct and indirect employment) with an additional 10 from the expansion.  Additional training opportunities for about 30 local engineers.(iii) IFC''s investment in the Company will have a significant number of direct and indirect development benefits such as linkages with local suppliers, upgrade of existing infrastructure, indirect employment creation through auxiliary businesses in the region.

title: Sura Holding EQ
content: IFC''s involvement in this project would allow it to positively impact the market place by contributing to the development of a strong local pension system in Mexico, Chile, Colombia, Peru and Uruguay. This is of the outmost importance as pension funds plays a critical role in terms of generating long term financial resources for investments in priority sectors of the economy such as infrastructure among others. At the same time, the development of pension systems and capital markets are closely interrelated. As pension funds grow, new financial instruments are developed to meet their needs and to fill perceived gaps in the market, facilitating the growth and modernization of the local capital markets.

title: Microqual
content: a)	The Project will have a strong development impact by the way of reducing the capital expenditure and set up time associated with installing new telecom infrastructure and thus facilitate expansion of telecom services in rural and remote corners of India. b)	Project will contribute to climate change mitigation by reducing the diesel fuel through the initial use of renewable based hybrid energy solutions and later on, direct tapping of electricity from transmission networks. c)	Deployment will result in employment opportunities in hilly states and rural areas. It will also contribute to government revenues by way of taxes and reduced use of subsidized diesel fuel.

title: Tribanco Mobiliz
content: The project will (i) increase access to finance to MSMEs; and (ii) introduce Tribanco to international funding markets for the first time. Additionally, the project will support a unique business model that promotes the sustainability of these MSMEs by delivering advisory and partnership support (through the Smart affiliate network).

title: Saham Finances
content: Saham Finances currently operates in the two regions of the world which have the lowest insurance penetration globally. In sub-Saharan Africa, Colina is present in countries in West and Central Africa which significantly lag the rest of the region. This investment will allow Saham Finances to (a) consolidate its 2010 acquisition of Colina and leverage synergies with CNIA SAADA; (b) provide growth capital to Colina to further expand its insurance activities in Southern and Eastern Africa through targeted acquisitions, in countries that are markedly under-penetrated; and (c) meet the expected growing demand for insurance products in Morocco as a result of the "Contrat-Programme 2011-2015", a public-private partnership intended to boost penetration rates of non-life and life insurance.

title: LPV Equity
content: IFC''s participation in La Positiva Vida is expected to increase the availability of life insurance products in Peru, a country which presents one of the lowest insurance penetrations in the continent.  Given the Group''s target market, IFC''s investment would help increase access to insurance protection for the lower segments of the population.

title: Wintermar Group
content: With an increase in exploration and production activity, particularly in Natural Gas, expected in eastern parts of Indonesia, there is a greater need for marine services in these regions where incomes are significantly below the average national GDP. As one of the few businesses operating in the area, Wintermar will create employment opportunities and the associated multiplier benefits of increased incomes and tax revenues in the area.

title: Thika IPP
content: The Project will be a significant step in assisting Kenya to achieve a more diversified energy mix and some stability to its power generation. It will contribute to the country''s installed capacity in thermal generation as hydropower is frequently negatively impacted by drought. In addition, the Project presents a less expensive alternative to investments in emergency diesel fired plant and a strategic solution to Kenya''s medium term power needs. The World Bank''s recently completed Africa Infrastructure Country Diagnostic found that the lack of adequate and reliable electricity supply is Kenya''s largest infrastructure challenge and a key constraint to economic growth (contributing to economic losses of up to 2% of GDP).

title: UT Bank
content: The Project is expected to have high development impact in the following areas: (i)	Improved Access to Finance:  Injecting fresh capital into the Bank would allow for growth as the Bank would be able to further leverage itself to fund growth in the strategic focus area of SME and the currently unbanked rural populous. (ii)	Demonstration Effect:  IFC is helping to demonstrate the soundness and viability of the Ghana Banking Sector. It is expected that there will be new private sector entrants be it via new institutions or additional investment in existing enterprises, this will help to increase the reach of financial services and products in Ghana.

title: IFC Climate Catalyst Fund
content: The project is expected to deliver strong development impact by: (i) stimulating the development of Climate Funds and climate friendly projects and companies which are expected to play a key role in accelerating the growth of investment in renewable energy and other low-carbon solutions; (ii) mobilizing the additional capital needed to help fill the investment gap caused by the reluctance of institutional investors to invest in Climate Funds and climate friendly projects; (iii) reducing GHG emission and creating other positive environmental impacts; (iv) promoting the robust, inclusive economic growth needed to improve the lives of people impacted by adverse climate change; (v) transferring technology, best practices (including IFC Performance Standards) and innovative business models; and (vi) raising awareness of the commercial attractiveness of investing in low-carbon and climate-friendly projects and companies, and helping institutional investors to learn about these sectors in emerging markets.

title: UAG Univ
content: (i) Provision of quality education as the University refurbishes its existing facilities, improves its academic offerings and strengthens its balance sheet(ii) Increase in reach to other population segments beyond those traditionally served by UAG through the expansion of its community college (UNICO)(iii) Demonstration effect by enhancing the credibility of financing educational institutions in Mexico

title: CIRA
content: - Increase access to high quality education services in the Egypt:  The Project will increase capacity of good quality primary and secondary education and improve its access, as CIRA is proposing to expand to upper Egypt and other frontier regions in the country. - Improve quality and operational performance:  IFC''s investment in CIRA will improve its quality of education through sharing of IFC global knowledge of education business.- Increase employment opportunities, especially for women: The Project will increase employment opportunities for skilled teachers to find good employment opportunities within their country. Traditionally, a greater proportion of the K-12 teachers are women, hence this may provide attractive employment opportunities for women.

title: KPLC
content: The proposed Project is expected to address some of the key challenges faced by the power sector in Kenya and have the following development impact: (i) increased coverage of electricity in the fast growing peri-urban as well as rural areas; (ii) reduction in commercial and technical losses; and (iii) improved quality of service.Despite the successful sector reforms, electricity supply remains unreliable and penetration rates low. The World Bank''s Africa Infrastructure Country Diagnostic found that the lack of adequate, reliable electricity supply is Kenya''s largest infrastructure challenge and a key constraint to growth. Unreliable electricity supply in recent years has led to an estimated economic losses of up to 2% of GDP or approximately 7% of the annual revenues of Kenyan firms, higher than that in other countries of similar economic development. Interruptions in electricity supply stem mainly from inadequate generation capacity and weak transmission and distribution networks, particularly in areas of high growth in electricity demand.

title: Leopard Haiti
content: The Fund is expected to deliver strong development impact through: (i) supporting undercapitalized SMEs in Haiti with funding, managerial guidance and technical assistance; (ii) demonstrating successful private equity investing in Haiti, a priority IDA country, (iii) building confidence amongst institutional investors to invest in Haiti; and (iv) mobilizing co-investment from strategic international investors.  Private equity-sponsored companies often adopt management practices in financial control, cost accounting, quality control, corporate governance, formalized legal structure and tax reporting that are better than those used by their peers. If the Fund is successful and delivers developmental and financially positive returns for its investors, the investment manager may be able to launch successor funds.  Examples of successful and well run private enterprises will contribute to a vibrant and sustainable private sector, improving employment, trade balance and public finances in Haiti.

title: Ambit Pragma II
content: (i)	Support of SMEs: target investee companies will be SME''s(ii)	Private sector development, addition of value to portfolio companies by means of improved corporate governance and transparency(iii)	Providing advice and risk capital to enable faster growth in portfolio companies (iv)	Supporting high growth companies which will reach the bottom of the pyramid, and create jobs at a faster rate than the national average(v)	Contributing to sustainable economic development by incorporating environmental and social standards

title: MENA- STF
content: The development impact is expected to be:(1)	Give emerging market issuing banks continued access to trade credit in MENA region and other IDA countries, which were hit hard during the financial crisis and the recent political instability; and(2)	Maintain the access to credit for the underlying exporters and importers.

title: Forum Synergies
content: The Fund is expected to have a strong impact for private sector development as follows:-- Private sector development:  The Fund will add value to its investee companies, by providing managerial, operational and strategic support to improve their competitiveness and sustainability-- Economic development:  The Fund is expected to invest in high-growth companies aiming to increase output, which in turn should lead to increased employment rates.-- Environmental practices:  The Fund Manager will adopt international best practices for environmental and social risk assessment and management, and improve transparency and corporate governance, thus transferring knowledge and skills to portfolio companies.-- Support of SMEs:  The Fund is expected to invest in SMEs and companies slightly above the SME scope.

title: GC Prim Moldova
content: By providing financial support to GC Prim, IFC directly supports: -	the retention of jobs for local staff in an IDA country with limited alternative employment prospects;-	a sustainable local glass packaging industry player to continue its operations in a financially sustainable manner, that would also have positive effect on the beverage production sector in Moldova;-	the competitiveness of a successful exporter in an IDA country.Furthermore, by facilitating the partial reduction of the outstanding MAIB loan by proposed USD 5 million, IFC would enable MAIB to: -	comply with the recently tightened single-client exposure limitations of the Central Bank of Moldova;-	free-up additional capital to be redeployed domestically to a broader base of borrowers, including many SMEs.

title: Fin Crear Loan
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to be high, as it will enhance the ability of Financiera Crear to support productive micro, small and medium enterprises which will in turn stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction.  In addition, Financiera Crear will be able to increase its outreach and sustainability incorporating thousands of new entrepreneurs to the formal financial sector.

title: JY Organic
content: 1.Rural growth and Employment: The Project supports a organic food company in the frontier region in China. The Company will have impact and rural reach by procuring from additional households, employing additional rural workers, and create business opportunities for MSMEs.2.Sustainability and Standards: By investing in JinYuan, IFC will be supporting a Company with a keen desire to contribute to the sustainable rural development and adopt higher food safety/quality standards.3.Demonstration Effect: The success of the Project is expected to have strong demonstration effect in the organic food industry in China and sets a good example for peers to improve their operational standards.

title: MENA Fund
content: The project is expected to deliver strong development impact by: (i) mobilizing the additional capital needed to help fill the emerging investment gap caused by the retrenchment of the private sector; (ii) enabling IFC to invest in more projects by leveraging IFC''s economic capital; (iii) promoting the robust, inclusive economic growth needed to improve the lives of people in the MENA region; and (iv) raising awareness and restoring investors'' confidence.

title: FONDESA
content: The Project is expected to: -Enhance FONDESA''s ability to support productive micro entrepreneurs and low income borrowers who will, in turn, stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction. - Strengthen micro finance services in the Dominican Republic, covering a number of provinces across the country and outside urban areas with low banking penetration.

title: I&P Capital III
content: Fund is expected to have significant development impact by (i) encouraging economic and private sector development in local communities by providing much needed equity capital and management  advice for SMEs which will promote job creation; (ii) implementing best-practice corporate governance and social and environmental standards at the fund and investee level; and (iii) supporting regional integration by expanding investee companies into neighboring countries to build 'regional champions.'

title: UABL III
content: The proposed IFC financing would help: - increase capacity and reduce the cost of transportation on the River System benefiting multiple commodity producers, shippers and consumers; - support the agricultural development in inland Paraguay, Bolivia, Brazil and Argentina by connecting farmers to global transportation links and helping to expand feasible production areas; - support the development of iron ore and steel industries in Brazil and Argentina, respectively;- reduce harmful effects on the climate by decreasing UABL''s fuel consumption per unit transported and avoiding the use of trucks; and - encourage competing barge operators to increase their efficiency and, therefore, serve as a catalyst for increased trading activity in the region.

title: enso Albania
content: The Project''s development impact is as follows: (i) creating approximately 50MW additional renewable energy for the country, which in turn would improve sector sustainability and decrease reliance on imports; (ii) supporting power sector reform by increasing the share of private generation in Albania''s overall electricity generation; (iii) facilitating the move towards the creation of a regional energy market; and (iv) attracting international players to the Albanian market. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Albania.

title: City Express International
content: i) Increased business and tourism infrastructure: The Projects are expected to add to their region's business and tourism infrastructure by expanding and improving the existing base of accommodation facilities and business services; In addition, they should encourage increased tourism, business and meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions ("MICE") travel;(ii) Mid-market hotel development: The Projects will help the development of the domestic midmarket business hotel segment, thereby extending the product range in the targeted cities, where there is currently a shortage of supply; (iii)  Benefits to the local economy: The Projects will create opportunities for economic links (local and regional) between tourism and other sectors, both in the development phase (construction services and building supplies) and during on-going operations (employment and operating supplies);  in addition, the Projects will create both direct and indirect jobs, as well as provide training opportunities for employees. They will also contribute to maintain and increase foreign exchange and tax revenues;  spending by visitors would keep help support a wide range of local economic activities, restaurants, transportation, tours, entertainment, sports and leisure activity; and (iv) Climate change: In order to adopt sustainable green building design and construction, Hospiteum and City Express will continue to ensure high levels of energy efficiency and have various hotels achieve possibly compliance with LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) standards.

title: OSL Kochi
content: Support greater usage of an environmentally-friendly fuel, in the face of growing energy demand and limited domestic supply: The share of natural gas in the primary energy segment in India is only 8% currently. Natural gas supplies from domestic sources are expected to be constrained over the next few years; as a result, Indias reliance on imported LNG is expected to increase. SPSL is a key link in the logistics chain for Petronet as it seeks to ramp up LNG imports through the new terminal at Kochi. 	By supporting Petronets growth, SPSL will indirectly be contributing to the greater usage of an environmentally friendly fuel, and increasing the share of fuel that is bought and sold under free market conditions (Petronet and other newer market players are operating under new legislation that requires open access and unbundling of the supply chain). Higher Environmental, Social, Health and Safety Standards: IFC will work closely with SPSL to ensure that IFC performance standards are met, particularly those related to labor management and working conditions, as well as the management of effluents and waste-water. Employment Generation: As a result of the Project, direct employment is expected to be created for ~56 employees.

title: Cosmo IV
content: Employment opportunities - The Project is expected to create up to 300 new employment opportunities.Efficient technology usage  The Project will employ technology that improves the conversion ratio (input raw material to film output) thereby reducing wastage in the environment and contributing to a cleaner environment.

title: Hilton Bujumbura
content: The Project will: (i) address the supply-demand gap for business hotels of international standards, providing key business infrastructure as the Country emerges from a post-conflict status; and (ii) raise  the country hotel standards by supporting the establishment of a 4-star internationally managed hotel in the country.

title: Estacio II
Granules II
content:
- The Project will significantly demonstrate how domestic companies use their strong comparative advantages of low cost of production and scale to exploit the opportunities that enable them to move up the pharmaceutical value chain in selling to more regulated markets.
- The Project will support the Company's expansion enabling wider availability of high quality, low cost drugs in developed and developing markets.

title: Advans Nigeria
content: The Company is expected to help reduce unemployment and poverty in the western state of Oyo by: (i) increasing access to microfinance services; (ii) supporting the development and growth of the local MSME finance sector; and (iii) serving as a role model for good practices in the sector.

title: Simandou III
content: Economic transformation for Guinea: At full production the Simandou iron ore project will be the largest mining and commercial project in the country and will make a large direct positive contribution to Guinea''s economy for decades. Annual taxes and royalties to the Government of Guinea have the potential, at full production and after tax holiday, to exceed US$1 billion p.a. (subject to iron ore prices) and will directly employ over 4,000 Guineans.Infrastructure development:  The Simandou infrastructure, particularly the rail, will open up the east of the country to new private sector development opportunities. Simfer has committed to the provision of a multi-use/multi-user facility, which will include passenger rail services.  The construction of the rail will also require the construction of a feeder road network along its alignment, further facilitating local movement and trade.  Emerging sustainable mining sector:  Guinea is an emerging iron ore producer and, based on its resource endowment, is expected to become one of the main global producers in the coming years. The Simandou iron ore project will be the first of several large projects and will set key benchmarks going forward in terms of standards of operation and E&S management.  In addition, Simandou''s infrastructure could in the future potentially be shared on a commercial basis with other emerging iron ore operations in the region.Community development:  Simfer will spend a minimum of 0.25% of project revenues on socioeconomic activities in affected prefectures (particularly Beyla and Forecariah), including investments in electricity, roads, water and sanitation, communication, and health and education.

title: Intl. House
content: - Contribute to filling the gap between supply and demand for quality office space in Bujumbura and provide much needed property infrastructure which is necessary to attract and retain investment in this post conflict country;-	Private sector development, an important engine for growth, in a post-conflict country;- Introduce new building standards to the market; - Have a demonstration effect on other local companies to pursue similar commercial property development projects;- Create opportunity for linkages and benefit to other sectors of the economy, from suppliers to tenants who will benefit from additional quality office space;-	Create employment (direct and indirect) for about 200 people during construction and about 100 post-construction;-	Increase in government revenues through taxes paid.

title: Tbilvino
content: The project will have following development impact: i) Promotion of formal private sector abiding by rules, regulations and obligations; ii) Creation and preservation of  direct and indirect employment in rural areas of Georgia, where the job opportunities are scarce; iii) Linkage to farmers - IFC''s support will ensure the sustainability and growth of income for more than 300 Georgian farmers; iv) Improvement of product quality and food safety management systems, compared to uncontrolled producers; v) Contribution to the recovery of Georgia''s wine sector, helping to increase the Country''s export potential; vi) Generating additional amount of taxes paid by the Company to the Government.

title: ABank-Banking on Women
content: The key development objective of this project is to increase financial inclusion in Turkey. The project is designed to improve access to finance for SMEs in Turkey, with a special focus on women owned businesses (at least 50% of the project amount will be used to on-lend to women owned SMEs). By working with ABank, a well-run, mid-tier bank with a particular focus on SMEs, this project is intended to demonstrate the business opportunity presented by women entrepreneurs as an under-served market.

title: Axis Bank Ltd.
content: 1. Wider Impact: With a wide presence in India, Axis Bank has a natural advantage in terms of client reach which will allow it to expand rapidly in this area with IFC''s support. Through the proposed facility, Axis Bank can support a wider range of clients in the renewable energy and climate change space.2. Demonstration Effect: Axis Bank''s expansion in this space is likely to help attract other financial institutions to increase their risk appetite and invest more actively in Climate Change sectors.3. Greenhouse Gases (GHGs) savings: The proposed investment will result in substantial savings of GHG emissions as it will encourage investment in clean energy projects.4. Institution Building: IFC''s support to Axis Bank will help it to scale up its capacity to assess clean energy projects through sharing of its experience and knowledge of the sector worldwide.

title: Cleantech Innovation Facility
content: Impacts will vary investment by investment but tax receipts, job creation, and GHG emission avoidance will be indicators for all investments.  Other impacts may include increased access to water and energy for the underserved, recycling leading to reduced pressure on landfills, and technology transfer from the North to the South and from South to South.  Both directly and via demonstration effects, the CTIF aims to bring more capital and talent to Cleantech in development countries, and aims to support innovation in technology and business models.

title: FinCo
content:
- Demonstration Effect: This will be the first specialized green finance company in emerging markets; its success would encourage its replication in other markets with significant positive impact globally.

- Environmental Impact: Through the activities of the companies that FinCo finances and advises, FinCo is expected to have a significant positive impact on the environment.

- Wider Reach: Given the strong sponsorship of the Company by Tata Group, the support from IFC and other high quality partners, the Company will have the credibility and the network to create a wider reach across sectors and market segments in the environmental finance market in India.

title: FONDEP II
content:
Job Creation and Poverty Reduction:   The proposed investment is expected to have a high impact in facilitating micro and small enterprises access financial services - an area of key strategic priority to IFC.  As IFC assists FONDEP with sourcing additional funding,  this project addresses the need to serve those segments of the population that lack the most access to credit; hence seeking to (i) reduce income disparities in the country, and (ii) contribute to job creation in underserved regions.

Demonstration Effect and Sector Development:  IFC's partial credit guarantee will help mobilize local currency financing for a microfinance institution in a post crisis context thus sending a strong signal to donors and commercial banks, which will help mobilize additional funding to the sector moving forward.

title: Cauris II
content: The Fund will achieve development impact by increasing access to financing for small and mid-sized companies in Francophone West Africa which are largely ignored by the larger funds; investing in frontier markets such as Benin, Burkina Faso, Guinea, Mali, Niger and Togo, supporting a local emerging Fund Manager in the region; investing in growth companies of a local emerging Fund Manager in the region; providing hands-on monitoring and guidance to the management of SME companies through board/management participation; sharing environmental and social international best practices with a local SME Fund Manager.  The investment is expected to create above average employment and accelerate economic growth across the region.  The investment will be across a diversity of sectors.  The Fund's investment in target companies will range from Euro 2-4.5 million and will consist mainly of strategic minority stakes, with board representation and shareholder right to influence the strategic direction of the company and conduct of management.

title: Nature Elements
Vortex
content: 1.	Increased access to finance in rural areas: The project is intended to increase access to finance; particularly basic banking services such as cash withdrawal and bill payment by installation of a large number of rural ATMs across India. These ATMs can potentially be used as a platform for transactions for other financial inclusion projects.2.	Greenhouse Gases savings impact: Vortex''s rural ATMs consume substantially less power than conventional ATMs and can be operated using solar power.3.	Demonstration effect: This project shall demonstrate a commercially viable model of domestically developed, technology enabled, low cost ATMs that can increase access to banking in previously unbanked areas through design of products tailor-made to suit the requirements of these areas and customer segment.

title: YKB DPR
content:
- The Project would generate a range of social and economic benefits, including economic growth, higher productivity of farming and food & beverages processing, as well as enhance banking penetration in rural areas, which represent around 35 percent of Turkey's total population.
- The Project would directly support the renewable energy sector in Turkey by increasing access to long-term funding at attractive pricing levels for RE borrowers, and also contribute to a reduction of green-house gas emissions.

title: Bhilwara Green Energy Limited
content: 1) Providing long term local currency financing: IFC is able to provide long term fixed rate rupee loans in India which is difficult in this market. Indian banks typically provide variable rate loans which adversely affect power project's viability due to interest rate fluctuations; 2) Financing of wind Independent Power Producers (IPPs): Foreign banks have largely been absent from wind IPP financing except in some cases. IFC's participation in the Project is likely to significantly help Bhilwara Energy complete the financing of this Project as well as help it in future fund raising; and 3) IFC involvement with the Project will help Bhilwara Energy in adopting a structured framework to manage its social and environmental systems which will act as a benchmark for its subsequent wind projects.

title: ECOM Global
Magallanes EQ
AWI SME Finance Facility for the Middle East and North Africa
content: The project is expected to have the following development impact: (i) Improved access to finance for SMEs: SMEs in the MENA region account for 40% of GDP and 70% of employment. With this project, IFC would provide necessary funding and capacity building services to SMEs, including women entrepreneurs, enabling them to grow and expand their business and continue to play a major role in supporting the region's economic growth and job creation; and (ii) Improved financial infrastructure:  (a) The risk sharing structure of the SME facility aims to attract private sector investment flows and promote SME finance as a viable asset class. (b) The capacity building initiative would help build the capacity and increase the risk appetite of banks and lenders for the SME sector and enhance SME financing.

title: ItaFos Mineracao
content:
The project will support the further intensification and expansion of agricultural production in North Eastern Brazil, the Cerrado, by making available SSP fertilizer closer to market. Given Brazil's already important role in supplying global agricultural markets and its significant potential for converting soil into arable land, the further development of the Cerrado plays an important role in promoting global food security, to which this project is making a contribution.

Specifically, the expected development benefits from the project will be in the form of:
Development of regional fertilizer capacity in a growing market that relies on imports and domestic supply from producers which are located at a distance.  Greater production and supply of SSP in the region supports the expansion and intensification of agricultural production and creates some degree of independence from imports with the positive effects overall of reduced transportation lag times and lower price volatility.
Expansion and intensification of agricultural production in the Cerrado, which has become the breadbasket of Brazil. Further intensification and expansion of agricultural activity depends on the availability of Single Super Phosphate ('SSP'), a source of sulfur and key ingredient to turning the sulfur deficient soils of the Cerrado into arable land.
Job creation in an isolated area in the poorer northeast of Brazil with few economic opportunities.
Revenues to government through corporate income taxes.

The following development indicators will be tracked throughout the project: i) payments to government, ii) jobs during construction and operational phase, iii) domestic purchase of goods and services, iv) community development outlays.

title: TSSA New Berth
content: The Project will help strengthen the port sector in Brazil by increasing container handling capacity at the Port of Salvador, which is critical to enabling further trade growth for Northeast Brazil and to strengthening Bahia's position as an investment destination. The Project will also create direct and indirect employment opportunities and increase revenues for the Government of Brazil through increased economic activity and higher tax payments, custom duties, and lease payments.

title: EAIF Two
content:
To close the infrastructure gap with other parts of the world, meet the Millennium Development Goals, and achieve national development targets in Africa within 10 years, an annual spending in infrastructure of US$93 billion (about 15 percent of the region's GDP) would be required. A funding gap equal to one third of this amount exists and the magnitude of the required investments places a premium on maximizing private sector investment flows that the proposed IFC investment will support.

The development impact of the project will be captured in terms of the Fund's performance, the Fund's additional investments in SSA infrastructure projects, the expansion of infrastructure capacity made available by project investments, the role of the Fund in extending appropriate environmental and social standards and the quality of those investments as follows: (i) Net Internal Rate of Return; (ii) Private sector involvement in infrastructure; (iii) Percentage of underlying investments with steady cash flows; (iv) Total infrastructure capacity (e.g. electricity generated, volume of export/import handled by a port etc.).

title: TICO
content: The Project is expected to have a number of major benefits, including: (a) Increased supply of electricity to support Ghanas growing economy at a more efficient cost  the Project involves the increase of the existing plant capacity from 220MW to 330MW, with no additional fuel requirements (since a combined cycle operation utilizes waste heat from the simple cycle generation)- with the ultimate benefit of a lower cost of energy for the consumers.(b )Further diversification of Ghana electricity supply away from over-reliance on hydro power generation (with the attendant rainfall driven variations in supply), as well as utilization of gas resources from Ghana and the region, with the planned conversion of the plant to dual fuel mode  gas and LCO. (c) Supports the growth of private sector investment in Ghanas power sector, with positive signals for future investments.(d) Positive climate impact through avoided C02 emissions, by increasing the plants energy output capacity with no incremental fuel requirements.

title: Patisen
content:
-	Increase supply of food production domestically, thereby benefiting local consumers.
-	Support transformation of a local company into a regional champion.
-	Employment creation:  The Company has 250 full-time employees and 1,000 temporary employees. The Project will create additional jobs. 
-	SME development:  The Company assists small wholesalers with a professional Patisen sales force to distribute its products to consumers, thereby transferring marketing know-how and sustainability of local SME wholesalers.

title: Gulf Power Ltd
content:
The Project will be a significant step in assisting Kenya to achieve a more diversified energy mix and stability to its power generation. It will contribute to increasing the country's installed capacity in thermal generation as hydropower is frequently negatively impacted by drought and the creeping effects of climate change.

In addition, the Project presents a less expensive alternative to investments in emergency diesel fired plant and a strategic solution to Kenya's medium term power needs. 

The World Bank's Africa Infrastructure Country Diagnostic found that the lack of adequate, reliable electricity supply is Kenya's largest infrastructure challenge and a key constraint to economic growth (contributing to economic losses of 2% of GDP).

title: CBC Debt DPR
content: The Project will provide support for expansion of CBC''s SME portfolio.  Such SME financing will provide a boost for the agriculture, infrastructure and tourism sectors in the post conflict provinces of the country. Capital market development - The Project will provide a capital markets demonstration effect showcasing a novel avenue for Banks to raise long term FCY financing through a future flow of DPR which is currently unleveraged.

title: ASSUPOL
content: The project is expected to (i) expand the availability of insurance products (e.g. life, disability and accident cover, funeral cover, retirement policies and savings and investment products, etc.) to underserved populations in South Africa; (ii) highlight the potential of this market segment to other companies and the business model required to serve it; and (iii) increase the safety net protection for those who mostly need it.

title: DB FX Facility
content: The proposed Facility is expected to have a number of development benefits and should help IFC meet its Institutional Development Goals ("IDG"). First, it will increase the depth of local and cross-currency hedging products that are available to clients in emerging markets. Second, it will promote hedging transactions in markets where there are significant barriers to entry for many companies and financial institutions, by seeking to widen the circle of counterparts to include second-tier credits. Third, by improving access for emerging market clients to currency risk hedging products, it will facilitate financial risk management and planning, specifically in sectors that are key for the development of local economies such as microfinance, medium-sized enterprises operating in the manufacturing and agribusiness sectors, pension funds, and low-income housing. Broadening access to cross-currency hedging tools will enable clients in these key industries to better manage foreign exchange risk and strengthen their balance sheets and, through increased access to finance and more efficient use of capital, expand their businesses. Fourth, since only swap transactions with at least one local currency leg will be eligible for inclusion, the Facility will contribute especially to the development of local derivatives markets.

title: RVR Equity
content: By improving the railway's infrastructure and rolling stock, the Project would have a substantial development impact.  In particular, it would: (i) increase competition in the transport sector, reducing costs and leading to service improvements; (ii) shift traffic from road to rail (especially heavy bulk cargoes), slowing the deterioration of the road network and improving safety; (iii) increase regional integration in transportation, trade and economic development; (iv) by reducing transportation costs, facilitate economic growth particularly in Uganda and other landlocked countries in the region; and (v) by substituting trucks, reduce the emission of harmful greenhouse gases.

title: OCI Group
content: The proposed investment is expected to have the following development impacts: (1) revenue generation to the Egyptian government as both OCI and EFC through tax payments by OCI and EFC; (ii) contributing foreign currency income to the country through export revenues and dividends received from investments outside of Egypt; (iii) job creation, directly through a number of planned capacity expansions in the fertilizers sector, and indirectly through sub contracting parts of the construction works in many on the Group''s projects; and (iv) contribution to food security through increased availability of fertilizers to support supply growth in primary agriculture.

title: SunEdison
content: (i) Demonstration effect of early non-recourse financing of solar PV in India, Thailand and other regional markets; and (ii) support early stages of regulatory reform by helping the regulators, private sector and Government improve and ensure sustainability of regulatory structures supporting solar; (iii) directly increase power generation by 0.1 Million GWh per year; and (iv) promote renewable energy in line with climate change strategy by displacing approximately 115,000 tons CO2 per year.

title: Altyn Ajydar IV
content: The proposed project will help AA expand into Kazakhstan and improve its competitiveness with the production of multi-layer packaging products through the use a new and more efficient corrugated packaging line in a location that is closer to its client base in Kazakhstan. Moreover, the project will have a demonstration effect for other SMEs, as AA has been a successful company in the region. Besides improving the company's competitiveness, the investment is expected to result in an estimated additional employment of 100 workers in Kazakhstan.

title: Garanti Romania
content:
- Increased access to finance: New loans and portfolio growth is expected for SMEs in the Country in an environment where funding resources are constrained.
- Supporting a new entrant to the market: Supporting competition in the market and signaling support to the SME financing.
- Enhancement in operational procedures: Bringing best practices in insurance and social and environment management systems to a newly formed bank.

title: Emergia LAC
content:
Positive social effects of Emergia are largely tied to increased employment opportunities, particularly in smaller university towns and for women, who represent 67% of Emergia's workforce.  Employees at Emergia benefit from childcare facilities, 24-hour on site medic and other  services largely unavailable locally.

Emergia is typically an "anchor employer" in the smaller towns where it operates, employing hundreds of people and providing to many their first job.  Some of these towns suffer from chronically high unemployment rates. A rise in employment and an ascending middle class has positive spillover effect in the local economic community. It is estimated that 4 indirect jobs are created from each direct job in the contact center industry.

title: Alpha Geo
content: The development impacts of the project include: (i) increase of housing supply for low income households - this project is expected to contribute to the alleviation of the current housing deficit in Mexico, increasing the supply of affordable entry level housing by 40,000 houses a year; (ii) GEO plans to leverage part of the efficiency gains by providing a larger house (more square meters) to its clients at the same low entry price (approximately US$15,000); (iii) enhanced supply linkages - the project will increase demand for construction and building materials in the country; (iv) job creation - the new facilities are expected to create 1,500 new jobs in 2011 and additional jobs in line with the Company's growth in the future; (v) demonstration effect - the project will lead the way to improve private sector development in this segment of the housing market; (vi) Green Building- the technology adopted by ALPHA will reduce the environmental impact building materials by saving of more than 70% of the traditional waste generation and reduction of the energy use in the construction process by 18%. The prefabrication will also allow for higher levels of insulation and integration of  water and energy efficient technology in the homes. The client is interested to work with IFC's Green Building Specialist to explore these opportunities.

title: UniCredit AGRI
content: The project is expected to have a high developmental impact by: (i) supporting bank operations within agribusiness industry, an underserved segment of Serbian economy, by providing term finance for agri producers. Agribusiness is one of the few sectors in Serbia where country has current account surplus and where Serbia can develop a sustainable long term competitive position (ii) access to finance to lower income population by providing long term housing finance that is currently not available in the market, and (iii) IFC investment will help banking sector sustain its recently built trust, significantly affected by the global economic crisis.

title: Magma Fincorp Limited
content: IFC''s support to the NBFC will enable the Company to provide increased access to finance for the micro, small and medium entrepreneurs, who are mainly in the unorganized sector and do not have good access to the banking sector.Focus on rural and semi-urban areas and low income states: The Company''s growth strategy is focused on the rural and semi-urban areas. The Company is expected to increase its rural presence by deepening its existing branch network through the hub and spoke model.

title: ACWA Power Jordan
content: The Project is expected to improve CEGCOs power plants performance, both technically and environmentally, and enhance Jordans overall power generation efficiency and possibly increase total installed capacity. This will provide the government of Jordan with a quick, easy to implement and relative cheap solution to meet the expected increase in demand over the next few years enabling it to realize considerable savings.

title: Newcom corp
content: The project is expected to: (i) help create additional jobs and promote entrepreneurship; (ii) contribute to increase the power generation capacity and tap into a renewable energy resource; (iii) reduce carbon emissions that would have been generated by alternative sources of electricity; (iv) provide access to health facilities; (v) support the development of mining and natural resources activities in Mongolia; and (vi) further contribute to Government tax income with expanded operations of NCG.

title: United Water
content:
The transaction would have high development impact through IFC support of a growing private player in the following aspects: 

i)	The expansion of water supply and waste water treatment plants owned or operated by United Water in both municipal and industrial water sector will help to address the problem of water scarcity and lack of waste water treatment capacity in certain cities that are facing the challenges of urbanization.

ii)	The upgrading of Tuo Ke Tuo United Water Co. Ltd. in Inner Mongolia will enable the plant to treat industrial waste water to meet existing regulatory requirements.

title: SPC 4-5
content: The Projects will have high development impact on the Thai solar market by supporting a small but professional Thai developer with the development of their further solar farm licenses creating a replicable model for the Sponsor and a demonstration effect for local and regional solar IPP developers.  The Project will: a) promote private sector investment in the PV sector which is at an early stage of development in Thailand; b) support less carbon-intense economic development by substituting expansion of thermal power with zero-emission renewable energy and 4,785 CO2 tons avoided per year per project; and c) create direct and indirect employment opportunities in rural area of Thailand.

title: MedLife III
Epure BOT2
content:
The project would have high development impact through IFC support of a growing private sector company in the following aspects:
i)   Support a key private sector investor who is playing a meaningful role to address water shortage and environment pollution issues;   
ii)  Support a private sector investor to expand business in the Frontier regions of China as 2 out of the 4 projects are located in one of the western provinces; and 
iii)  Help Sound Global free up cash for international business development and potential South-South cooperation opportunities.

title: Credit Europe RU
content: The Project is expected to have a demonstration impact as well as a developmental impact. The demonstration impact will be achieved by assisting a viable financial institution in accessing the syndication market and international investors in a challenging environment. IFCs support will contribute to bring additional stability and diversification to CEBs funding. On the developmental front, the Project will indirectly support the Russian SME sector, which suffers from a chronic shortage of funding options. This Project will also enable CEB to keep on growing its regional distribution channels and branch network, which in turn will generate new employment opportunities in regions where such opportunities are often limited.

title: Vina Eco Board Co., Ltd.
content:
(i) Climate Change Mitigation: Through the Project, IFC will support positive climate change impact linked to sourcing of waste wood and use of bio-mass based power plant.
(ii) Employment: The Project will generate about 200 jobs at the Project site and also indirect employment through linkages to farmers who will supply part of the wood raw materials to the Project.  In the future, the Company is considering supporting farmers in sustainable plantation by working with local government agencies and research institutes and providing advice and seedlings.  
(iii) Development of Local Industry: The Project will support the development of local wood processing industry by establishing the first particleboard facility in Vietnam. From construction phase to operational stage, SFC will bring in its first class expertise and quality management system, which is expected to have demonstration effect to the local industry.

title: Sunpreme Silicon
content: The Project will contribute to the transfer of technologies in the solar sectors to key emerging markets such as Latin America, Sub-Saharan Africa, China and India by combining the high technology innovation in the Company's US facilities, with the lower manufacturing base and target user markets in developing countries.  By supporting a technology innovator that focuses on reducing cost/watt at the module level and supplying modules to the large manufacturers, the Project will support the solar sector in its aim to reduce its cost to close to grid parity levels in key markets. In addition, the Company's green technology process sequence avoids toxic and/or exotic materials, aiming to eliminate the paradox of exporting clean technology globally while polluting the environment locally.

title: NSL Power
content: a) Expanding the availability of energy in power deficit country like Indiab) Reducing reliance on coal and use of renewable sources of energy thus having positive climate change impactc) Providing employment to local people during construction and operations

title: SPV Cont Towers
content: -Improved mobile and broadband access: Access is one of the 3 pillars of IFC''s telecoms strategy, is achieved through overall business efficiency thanks to the co-location model, as the telecoms ecosystem benefits from tower costs spread amongst multiple carriers, leading to improved access (coverage, prices, provision of additional services, etc.). The other pillars i.e. mainstreaming of private and public services and the fostering of innovation, are also achieved by a more efficient telecoms industry.    - Reduced capex and lowers operating costs: For telecoms operators, the reduced costs can translate into lower cost of services for users. Potentially, operators can unlock cash from their balance sheets (in the case existing towers are sold to independent third party operators), critical in a region like Central America, where financing options are scarce. - Telecom sector growth Infrastructure sharing is critical in further fuelling the evolution of the telecoms market, indirectly assisting in the development of mobile broadband, and more indirectly, content and applications, mobile finance and mobile advertising, as several industry segments begin converging. -Increased competition: co-location allows smaller operators to have access to a well managed network and they can quickly roll out their network and compete more effectively. - Environmental benefits become evident, especially in reducing the visual burden of the explosion in tower masts (i.e., as a result of mobile telephony markets with as many as 5 operators). - The Project also assists in the creation of both direct and indirect employment opportunities.

title: Paradeep Phosphates Limited
content: The Project is expected to: (i) increase the domestic capacity of  DAP and other complex phosphatic fertilizers, and contribute to the growth of the agricultural sector in India; (ii) assist the Company in upgrading its environmental and operating performance to achieve international standards; (iii) help lower PPL's production costs which would benefit the farmers;  (iv) help mitigate the impact of climate change since the energy released during the sulphuric acid oxidation process will be used to power a significant part of the plant's operations; (v) create a number of direct and indirect job opportunities for local communities, including temporary employment to local labor during the construction phase of the Project assets.

title: Vishwa Infra
content:
a) Improve sanitation and better water services to about 450,000 people in two mid-tier towns in India
b) Generate employment both during construction and operation
c) Demonstration Effect- Successful execution of the Project will help provide push for further replication of PPP based water infrastructure creation in the country

title: Artha Capital
Alios Finance
content: By supporting the expansion of this strong vehicle and equipment leasing, long-term rental, and consumer finance company into new markets such as the Tanzania and Kenya, IFC will improve access to financing for SMEs and job-producing companies in both countries.  Participating in this expansion will enable IFC to add value to the project, based on its presence in the new markets, and its leasing experience in advisory services, legislative advisory services, and financial services in the region.  The project is expected to have a strong development impact in the following areas:  i.) Enhance Alios Finance's ability to deepen access to financial services for SMEs in Kenya and Tanzania; ii.) Increase Alios Finance's access to local currency financing; and; iii.) Subject to diagnostic work, strengthen the business environment for leasing in the region.

title: RafflesEducation
content: The proposed investment is expected to increase the provision and access to quality education services. The Company''s expansion into new markets is not only expected to increase the supply of highly in-demand education services, but also improve the quality of service in those market given the strength of Raffles'' core programs. The establishment of Raffles'' schools in markets like India and Bangladesh for example will also offer another option for students seeking international curriculum, but who do not wish to leave their home country. In addition, the project will support the development of private education services in India through partnership with an established market leader.

title: Maybank MEACP Clean Energy Fund
