content: The impact of providing equity financing to businesses in the clean energy sectors through the Fund includes, but is not limited to: (i) improvement in clean energy technology in Asia and associated lower fossil-fuel consumption along with reduced emissions of greenhouse gases (GHG); (ii) adoption of more sustainable clean energy practices; and (iii) dissemination of low cost technologies to developing markets.

title: Scholz Balkans
content: An important aspect of this investment lies in the climate change element related to recovery of resources and creation of scrap as a raw material for steel making out of metal waste.  Production of steel out of scrap significantly reduces CO2 emission and lowers energy and water consumption as compared to the traditional method.  In addition to the environmental impact, metal waste management is vital for growth and sustainability of the Balkan economies, many of which are struggling with high unemployment and with management metal waste.  The Group''s operations and the Project address both issues by providing direct and indirect employment for collecting the waste metal and cleaning up the areas from the wasteAn important aspect of this investment lies in the climate change element related to recovery of resources and creation of scrap as a raw material for steel making out of metal waste.  Production of steel out of scrap significantly reduces CO2 emission and lowers energy and water consumption as compared to the traditional method.  In addition to the environmental impact, metal waste management is vital for growth and sustainability of the Balkan economies, many of which are struggling with high unemployment and with management metal waste.  The Groups operations and the Project address both issues by providing direct and indirect employment for collecting the waste metal and cleaning up the areas from the waste

title: Jain NBFC
content:
1.	Increased Access to Finance in Rural Areas: The project shall increase access to finance among smaller farmers who currently have limited access to credit in purchase of agricultural productivity tools.
2.	Improved Utilization of Water Resources: MIS and drip irrigation is capital intensive from the point of view of most small farmers. With improved credit access, it is expected that increased number of farmers would install MIS systems which would improve Water Use Efficiency which is a critical consideration as water resources start becoming scarce.
3.	Demonstration Effect: The proposed project shall demonstrate a commercially viable financing model for agricultural credit needs in rural India. This project brings together a strong sponsor and management team, institutional shareholders and an existing distribution set-up which improve its chances of creating a strong demonstration effect.

title: Medanito SA
content:
The project will lead to further exploration, appraisal and development of primary energy sources in Argentina. The expected benefits will come in the form of:

1.	  Increased supply of hydrocarbons, particularly natural gas: IFC expects that Medanito's upstream production will increase from the current level of 3,600 boe/d. About 60% of this upstream production consists of natural gas.  Continued support for gas production and displacement of more carbon-intensive fuels is a key part of the World Bank Group's strategy, as natural gas is endorsed as a bridging fuel in the transition to a low carbon economy. The increased levels of gas production will also mitigate Argentina's dependence on gas imports. 

2. 	Contribution to Government revenues: the project will result in increased sales of natural gas, LPG, and crude oil. The associated provincial taxes, royalties, and federal income taxes will provide an important source of income to the Federal and Provincial Governments (incremental fiscal revenues are estimated at more than US$150 million over the next decade). 

3.  Creation/preservation of local employment and sourcing in Argentina: by extending the life of the Company's reserves, the project will help to secure direct and indirect jobs in the Provinces of Neuquen and Rio Negro. The project will also have an impact on regional economic activity through local purchasing. 

IFC plans to monitor the following indicators during supervision: (i) annual production of natural gas in Argentina (mcf); (ii) payments to governments (US$); and (iii) purchases of domestic goods and services (US$).

Governance risks assessment

It is expected that benefits from the project will accrue to different levels of government in Argentina in the form of taxes and royalties. Benefits to the local population are also anticipated in the form of direct and indirect employment. In coming to a view on whether to support this project, IFC has reviewed a range of governance and transparency metrics including, but not limited to, The World Bank Institute's Governance Indicators and Transparency International's Corruption Perceptions Index. The Government has committed to strengthening public sector performance within Argentina's federal system, with a view towards improving the effectiveness of basic service delivery and building transparency and trust, objectives that are supported by the World Bank Group. In addition, the Governments of Neuquen, La Pampa, and Rio Negro adhere to the 2004 "Ley de Reponsabilidad Fiscal", meant to promote fiscal discipline at the provincial level. Separately, IFC requires all its extractive industry clients to publicly disclose taxes, royalties and other payments made to governments.  On balance, given the governance situation in the country and the project's expected development benefits, IFC believes that this is a project which it should support.

title: San Miguel Mobilization
content: The project would help to: (i) improve the debt structure of the Company by replacing financial debt maturing in the next two years with long term debt; (ii) assist the Company to continue its investment program in a frontier region in Argentina (province of Tucuman); (iii) support the final completion of an innovative waste water treatment designed to adress the specific and difficult effluent issue faced by San Miguel; (iv) provide economic benefits for Tucuman, a frontier region, and benefit local farmers, workers and affiliated enterprises; (v) maintain the financial flexibility of San Miguel in order to continue its South-South investments in Uruguay and South Africa.

title: CEF IV
content: The project is designed to have significant impact in (1) promotion of greenhouse gas reduction, (2) promotion of the more environmentally sustainable practices, (3) support of the development of a relatively new sector and (4) job creation, including in China's frontier regions, through investment in China-focused cleantech portfolio companies.

title: Bangladesh SME Liquidity Facility (BSLF) I Eastern Bank
content:
The key indicators for this Project will be the increase in number and value of short term transactions to finance trade customers, including SME working capital needs and number of SMEs financed.

By providing local banks with much-needed FX liquidity and facilitating their access to the commercial loan market, the Facility will increase the range of funding options available to them. 

The Facility will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing trade customers, including SMEs & exporters, with the necessary FX liquidity to finance their working capital needs.  

IFC's loan will support job preservation in the small business sector that may otherwise have been forced to reduce staff in the face of financing constraints

title: Fawaz Abdul Aziz Al Hokair
Bangladesh SME Liquidity Facility (BSLF) I BRAC Bank
content:
The key indicators for this Project will be the increase in number and value of short term transactions to finance SME working capital needs and number of SMEs financed.

The demonstration effect of the IFC funding will encourage international banks to finance the local banking sector and increase their range of funding options. 

The Project will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with the necessary liquidity to finance their trade and working capital needs.  

IFC's loan will support job preservation in the small business sector that may otherwise have been forced to reduce staff in the face of financing constraints.

title: BRASILFactors
content: (i) To promote SME financing, particularly for the lower-end SME segment that is less sophisticated and has more limited access to funding; and (ii) to improve the business enabling environment - factoring in Brazil is an unregulated industry with mostly unsophisticated players who, oftentimes, promote informal practices. The project will support the creation of a world-class factoring company that can become a highly visible industry player and an industry benchmark for best practices.

title: Odebrecht Surety
content: The Project aims to sustain the development of additional infrastructure projects when the insurance and surety industry is constrained and contribute to economic growth in Latin America and Africa. As a result, through the Project, CNO will be able to carry out additional projects in Latin America and Africa, creating employment opportunities for the base of the pyramid, generating taxes for different countries and improving critical logistics. The Company also promotes environmentally and socially sound construction projects. Finally, by supporting a company that has implemented sound corporate governance practices and a strong risk management policy, IFC will set a demonstration effect for other companies in the EPC sector. The Project's success will also encourage the Facility's replication within IFC and by other multilateral institutions.

title: BANCOSEF
content: IFC's involvement in this project would allow the Bank to make financing available to businesses committed to higher environmental standards that need longer term funding for their sustainability-related activities. It is also expected that the project will lead to the adoption of higher environmental standards across the banking sector.

title: BG Credit Line
content: The proposed financing by IFC will support the growth of Banco General's low income mortgage portfolio.  It will also enable the Bank to reduce term mismatch.

title: FV Argentina III
content:
- Expansion of Argentine Export Base: FV's ability to continue developing its export base is dependent on the required permanent working capital needs to sustain an adequate and diversified level of stock to supply different markets abroad. The wide portfolio of products require FV to allocate larger amount of resources in order to better attend each market it supplies and enhance its competitive position abroad.

- Creation of Consumer Surplus: FV's cost optimization and energy efficiency improvements is expected to eventually translate into more competitive prices to end users, primarily within the construction sector. More competitive prices for building materials will benefit the housing sector.

title: Bangladesh SME Liquidity Facility (BSLF) I Southeast Bank
content:
The key indicators for this Project will be the increase in number and value of short term transactions to finance SME working capital needs, number of SMEs financed, female employment, number of jobs created and supported.

The Project will help accelerate economic growth in Bangladesh by providing SMEs and exporters with the necessary liquidity to finance their trade and working capital needs.

The demonstration effect of the IFC funding will encourage the entry of international banks to finance the local banking sector and increase their range of funding options. 

IFC's loan will support job preservation in the small business sector that may otherwise have been forced to reduce staff  in the face of financing constraints.

title: VI Fund II
content: Investment in the Fund is expected to deliver strong development impact as it would: (i) support an IDA country, (ii) create employment, (iv) improve access to debt finance for the Fund's investees, (iii) support promising local fund manager and (v) help develop the private equity industry in Vietnam.

title: Idavang A/S Russian Projects
content:
- Support Russia's under-developed pork sector to modernize, achieve self-sufficiency & international competiveness. 
- Support an efficient producer with solid track record to expand efficient production in Russia, introduce high European standards of livestock production, showcase clean production (CP) and energy efficiency (EE) to other pork producers. 
- Support the frontier Pskov region (per capita GDP about 60% below national average) to revitalize waste land, develop competitive pig and crop production, create jobs in remote rural area, contribute to local community.
    The Project will help alleviate insufficient domestic pig production, substitute imports, increase fresh meat supply (vs. frozen imported meat), and pass cost savings to consumers. The Project will rehabilitate the crop land that has not been cultivated for 15-20 year and create jobs in the rural area with high level of unemployment. As pork production remains highly supported by the Government (interest subsidized loans, tax benefits, import tariffs), additional domestic production will also result in losses for the Government and local tax payers, which is expected to be compensated by increased corporate tax payment, benefits to employees, local economy and communities. Overall, the medium to long term developmental impact can be expected as: (i) Russia has excellent long term fundamentals for pig production (feed availability, climate, large tracts of land for waste disposal); (ii) current production costs in the country are not globally competitive but can be improved with better technology and livestock management standards introduced by efficient producers; and (iii) the country is a net importer and may be able to compete on an import parity basis.

title: Digicel PNG III
content:
The Project will improve access to reliable and affordable telecommunication services for consumers and businesses as well as introduce new value added services.  Since Digicel's initial launch in PNG in 2007, mobile penetration rate has grown from 3% to 31%.  The Company expects that mobile penetration will continue to grow over 40% by 2017.

The Project will expand mobile services to remote and rural areas where telecom infrastructure is currently poor or non-existent, thus increasing geographic and population coverage.  In addition, the Project will improve the speed and reliability of telecommunications services to the business segment, hence enhancing the efficiency and competitiveness of these companies.

The Project will create direct and indirect quality employment opportunities in PNG.

title: GTLP Itau PY CL
Salamander 2011
content:
- Enhanced Availability of a Cleaner Fuel:  The Project will support the development of natural gas reserves. The increased availability of natural gas will promote the use of a cleaner fuel, given that natural gas has much lower carbon emissions than coal which is frequently the alternative fuel for power generation in Southeast Asia. 

- Preservation and Creation of Employment: The Project will have a sustaining impact on existing employment levels in producing assets and will contribute to the creation of new jobs in assets about to enter into production. Salamander staff positions are generally remunerated at a 25%-30% premium to other comparable employment. The percentage of nationals in managerial positions tends to be high, mostly above 75%. 

- Contribution to Central and Local Government Revenues: The project will increase production and generate significant fiscal receipts from a combination of royalties (8-12.5%), corporate taxes (41.5%-50.0%), production sharing (42%-73%) and obligations to supply domestic consumers at below-market prices. A material portion of these - approximately 15% of royalties in Thailand and 15-30% of total government payments in Indonesia - is expected to ultimately accrue to the regions where the oil and gas activities are undertaken. 

- Generating Additional Business for Local and National Suppliers: The project is expected to have a positive impact on national and regional economic activity through the purchasing of equipment, products and services.  For example, in 2009 contracts worth more than US$121 million were sourced from regional and national suppliers. 

- Promoting Competition and Development of Marginal Fields: The project promotes competition in the oil and gas sector through the growth of one of very few independent exploration and production companies exclusively focused on Southeast Asia. The participation of smaller privately-owned companies is important to the industry, as they often focus on reserves deemed too small to be of interest to the majors and the national oil companies which dominate the sector in Southeast Asia, and deliver production and recovery rates which tend to be above industry averages.

- Development in Frontier Regions: One of the Company's major assets, the Sinphuhorm Gas Field, is in the Northeast part of Thailand, a region that is by far the poorest and has been excluded from much of Thailand's growth.  Salamander's spending on local purchases is expected to have a positive impact on the regional economic activity, help to increase the income of the local people and promote an inclusive growth. 

Going forward, the following indicators will be tracked (i) gas production; (ii) employment; (iii) tax payments and other revenues to host governments; (iv) domestic purchase; (v) community development outlays.

title: Food Concepts
content: The Project's expected development impact includes (i) employment generation; (ii) gender promotion (QSR sector employs a high proportion of women); (iii) demonstration effect to the QSR/poultry market in West Africa; (iv) MSME reach; (v) develop efficient poultry industry in Nigeria; and (vi) introduction of best practice poultry using a technical partner with a proven track record.

title: Vivimed
content:
Setting up of environment friendly world class facilities compliant with International Regulatory Standards
The new facilities are expected to create nearly 1,700 new jobs (including direct and indirect employment)
Potential linkages with local suppliers, upgrade of existing infrastructure, indirect employment creation through auxiliary business in the region

title: AccessBank Tajikistan - Senior Loan
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impacts: (i) increase access to finance for MSEs; (ii) contribute to employment creation and poverty reduction in Tajikistan; (iii) support the Bank's efforts to diversify and increase the volume of its funding; (iv) build market confidence in financial institutions and encourage more intermediaries to extend financial services to target segment; and (v) deepen the financial markets, stimulate competition in the microfinance sector and increase lending products and services available in the market.

title: HPC Odessa
content: The Project will increase Ukraine's competitiveness, and indirectly drive trade growth, by providing modern efficient container handling capacity with deep draft to better serve the country's exports and imports.  The Project will help reduce the cost of transportation by serving larger vessels which have lower unit costs, therefore benefitting shippers, shipping lines, and consumers alike.  It will also strengthen the country's port sector by increasing competition in the market and encouraging other terminal operators to improve the efficiency and service standards of their own terminal facilities.  The Project's success will also have a demonstration effect for encouraging private infrastructure investments in Ukraine. In addition, the increased capacity is expected to result in more fiscal revenues to Ukraine when trade recovers.

title: Emerging Markets Communications, Inc.
content: Improve productivity through connectivity:  The impact of increased and affordable access to communications and data services is widely acknowledged, with far reaching benefits in terms of private and public sector productivity, including market information, education, tele-medicine and extending financial services to the frontier.  Increased coverage: EMC has the capacity to deliver fully managed, end-to-end solutions in difficult countries and regions where satellite technology is the best or only alternative. Broader range of services:  Further to basic data and voice, EMC can support more sophisticated applications, processes and corporate software solutions such as SAP and Oracle.Enhance competition:  Often, EMC is the only viable alternative to the incumbent telecomsoperator.  Supporting EMC helps increase competition and provides comfort to many f its customers that sensitive communications will be handled with privacy. Reduction in travel/carbon footprint:   EMCs Video-on-Demand solution to be deployed in 2011 will allow customers to collaborate with their colleagues, clients and suppliers without the need to physically travel in and out of remote locations.Vulnerable ultimate beneficiaries:  Clients in main vertical (development agencies / NGOs, accounting for 54% of revenues), directly target the base of pyramid, especially in Africa.  These institutions reach would be limited without the services of specialized niche providers such as EMC. Quick deployments:  EMC has a custom-designed solution allowing fast, tactical implementation of communications links following natural catastrophes (i.e., most recently in the Haiti and Chile earthquakes). EMC''s personnel, a team of highly trained and experienced professionals, is available and ready to deploy and implement satellite services within 48 hours thanks to a stock of pre-staged equipment at regional offices across all continents. Business continuity:  Strategically located infrastructure ensures business continuity / disaster recovery through redundant links and ample data center capacity. Remaining operational during a disaster makes the difference between financial sustainability and extensive losses for any public or private corporation.

title: Reinsurance Br
MPEF III
content: The proposed Project is expected to have a high development impact as: (i) the Fund will target SMEs with clear growth prospects that can increase job creation, (ii) the Manager will adopt best practices for transparency and corporate governance of its investee companies, thus fostering knowledge and skills transfer, and (iii) the Manager will employ a hands-on value added strategy to help portfolio companies improve operational efficiency and competitiveness.

title: CHUEE SME SPDB
content:
(i)	Environmental benefit: Annual reduction of 267,000 tCO2/year during 2015 to 2018
(ii)	SME access to finance: At least a total of 35 eligible loans will be disbursed by the end of 2014 from a baseline of zero loans as of December 2010
(iii)	 Demonstration effect: Encouraging the Chinese government at both central and local levels to participate in future public private partnership initiatives of this type; and 
(iv)	Capacity building: Promoting the development of industry specific loan underwriting criteria and improved risk management practices.

title: Zorlu Pakistan
content: The Project's development impact is expected to include: (i) contribute to alleviating the significant power shortage situation in Pakistan; (ii) support the development of the country's large wind resource base for power generation; (iii) help reduce the country's increased reliance on imported fuel for power generation; (iv) support continued private sector participation in the country's power sector; and (v) contribute to avoiding greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Mriya II
content: IFC''s financing will contribute to the development of a large-scale modern farming operation which will improve land productivity and have a demonstration impact on other neighboring farms.  Mriya''s land and operations are located in Western Ukraine in the Ternopil, Ivano-Frankivsk, Chernivtsi and Khmelnitsky regions.  These four regions are amongst the poorest regions in the country. Development impact of the project will be as follows:Employment: Mriya has approximately 1,002 permanent employees and 623 seasonal employees. The project is expected to increase permanent employment to about 1700 and seasonal employment to about 900. In the western Ukraine where Mriya operates, employment opportunities are scarce. In addition to creating new jobs, Mriya is setting new employment standards in the region by providing benefits to its farm workers such food and housing.Environmental and Social Standards: As part of the Environmental and Social Action Plan (ESAP), Mriya will implement an ESMS to provide a structured framework to identify and act on environmental and social risks and opportunities in the management of its agricultural operations as well as down-stream in the agricultural value chain, in the operations of the Sponsor-owned affiliated sugar beet processing plants.Private Sector Development: Mriya sells its products to a well diversified base of final customers and traders. Among them, there currently are about  55 MSME distributors of mainly potatoes, buckwheat, and corn, for final sales on the domestic market. On the purchasing side, Mriya relies on about 27 MSME suppliers, in addition to several large key ones, for deliveries of fertilizers, plant protection chemicals, and spare parts.

title: Farmakom MB
content:
The Group will
- have access to liquidity in order to support its expansion in export markets generating hard currency for the country,
- strengthen existing linkages with local suppliers,
- provide value-added products & services to customer improving their living standards; and
- additional tax revenues to the local Government by increased operations.

title: MobiNetS
Acleda Sub debt
content:
Increase access to credit:  The proposed investment in ACLEDA is expected to improve access to credit in Cambodia as it will enable ACLEDA Cambodia to provide credit to underserved micro finance and SME and retail borrowers. 
Improving market confidence:  An IFC loan to a bank such as ACLEDA will enhance market confidence in the Cambodian financial sector and its perception in the international markets.  The proposed subordinate debt will not only strengthen the Bank's capitalization, but is also expected to enhance prospects of mobilizing additional equity and long term funding from private investors.

title: Mercantile Bank Holdings Limited
content:
IFC's investment in Mercantile is expected to yield the following key developmental impact:
(i)	Development of SMEs / Mid Market clients in South Africa, through increased access/reach of financial services;
(ii)	Promote the development of sustainability business through providing long term financing to projects that result in environmental benefits; and
(iii) Assist Mercantile to manage asset/liability mismatch by providing long term local currency funding

title: Business Partners International Rwanda SME Fund
content:
The Fund is expected to have significant development impact by:
-	Encouraging economic development of private sector by increasing the flow of risk capital to small and medium-sized companies in Rwanda.
-	Providing much needed growth and expansion capital and value-enhancing advice to companies located in Rwanda, which currently lack access to both. The resulting stronger companies are expected to generate above-average rates of job creation.
-	Improving companies' sustainable development by helping the Fund to introduce best pratice corporate governance and E&S standards.

title: SLV
content: IFC involvement with the Company is expected to have a strong development impact in the economy by: i) supporting the development of an export oriented sector with deep roots in the economy and with extensive linkages throughout the value chain; ii) creating additional direct and indirect employment while helping to preserve 140 existing jobs; iii) improving living standards and climate change by promoting sustainable management of natural tropical forest through certification.

title: Guangxi Hwagain Group Co., Ltd
content:
(1)	Rural growth and employment: The Project supports the expansion of a successful pulp and paper company in the frontier regions of China. The Company procures bamboo from around 6,000 rural households in frontier Guangxi and Jiangxi regions. As a result of its expansion, the Company will have a significant impact and extensive rural reach by procuring from additional 6,000 rural households,  and creating business opportunities for MSMEs, such as traders of bamboo, truck owners, distributors, etc.
(2)	Sustainability: Pulp and paper sector is reported to account for a significant portion of water pollution in China and the sector places a huge demand for global wood resources. IFC will be supporting a Company with a keen desire to contribute to sustainable development by: (a) contributing to proper management of forest (bamboo) resources; (b) efficient manufacturing, and (c) adopting and ensuring workplace safety and pollution control.

title: Paravani
content: Developmental impact would include: (i) increase of Georgia's renewable energy output by approximately 409 GWh / year, serving both local markets and Turkey, with associated avoided carbon emissions; (ii) reducing Georgia's dependence on carbon-based generation during the winter months and increasing energy security; (iii) by size and nature of the transaction, influencing Georgia's ability to attract foreign investment in the hydro sector and position Georgia as an emerging market destination for hydro investments; (iv) contributing to the development of a merchant power operations and private sector investment in Georgia's energy sector.

title: Kenya Commercial Bank II
content:
i) Support Lending and Growth in the East African Market: 
The East African banking sector was affected by the global financial crisis, which led to a slowdown in the economy and reduced lending by the banking sector. Now that the situation has stabilized, KCB is well positioned to increase lending in the local market, which is important for investment and economic recovery in the region. The Project will, therefore, support the resumption of lending by KCB ultimately supporting renewed economic activity.

(ii) Increased Access to Finance for SMEs: 
SME's are a key growth sector for KCB. IFC will assist with SME development beyond financing to include advisory services for key aspects of its SME operations. The expected improvement in access to finance for SMEs will help to generate employment at the grass roots level and further facilitate regional trade which is expected to grow rapidly following the economic integration of the East African Community.

(iii) The investment in KCB Rwanda will have high development impact.  On an institutional level, access to longer term local currency financing will help KCBR manage its liquidity more effectively by limiting foreign currency risk.  On a sector level, the introduction of longer term financing in the market will afford more options to SME's and individual borrowers by providing longer term financing for mortgages and other new products.  In addition, the proposed technical assistance program will build the Bank's capacity in mortgage origination and monitoring in line with global best practice.

(iv) Support regional Expansion and integration
IFC's engagement with KCB and the support for its regional expansion strategy will encourage other banks to follow suit, which improves the level of competition and service in the regional banking sector. This with strengthen the regional economy and contribute to the success of the newly created economic community.

title: Apollo SA
content: The project will allow the company to increase domestic tire supply, maintaining the competitive market dynamics, with benefits to consumers, and to increase exports, earning the country an additional foreign exchange. The project will provide increased tax revenues to government.

title: Dunar Foods Limited
content:
(i) This Project is expected to generate new rural employment of 34 permanent and about 100 seasonal employees in Haryana and Punjab in three years. 
(ii) This Project is likely to create additional backward linkages with farmers as it is expected to increase procurement of basmati rice paddies from about 230,000 mt to 440,000 mt in three years, via "mandis" (markets) from farmers in various states.
(iii) This Project is likely to create forward linkages with SME distributors as well. 
(iv) This Project will provide climate change benefits by adding 5 MW husk power generation capacity.

title: PRAN Dairy
content:
The agriculture sector in Bangladesh accounts for 21% of its GDP, and 55% of its population is dependent on agriculture, including 20% in dairy activities. The local dairy sector is undergoing a slow transformation from unorganized to organized channels. Within the organized sector, there are a very limited number of private sector players. The Project will support the continued expansion into the dairy sector by one of the largest agribusiness companies in Bangladesh. Pran's extensive distribution reach in Bangladesh will enable it to reach to under-served populations while bringing in improved efficiencies in the sector.

The proposed Project will also have a transformative impact on the supply chain for dairy products. Pran currently works with 17,000 farmers on the dairy business. As part of this Project, PRAN will set up 60 new dairy hubs over a course of ten years, which will enable it to increase its reach to 90,000 additional farmers. The hubs will support smallholder dairies by providing entire package of logistic support including, veterinary care, animal husbandry, dairy housing, feed, breed improvement and training.

title: MUL EE Thailand
content:
The following development benefits are expected:IFC is contributing to the development and diversification of the financial sector by assisting in the development of new markets and product lines with significant growth potential. By sharing credit risk in the EE/RE/ESCO lease portfolio, IFC provides comfort to and reduces risks taken by financial institutions, especially those entering into such new markets in Thailand for the first time. 
IFC's project complements BMUL's strategy to support the EE, RE and ESCO sectors and will enable BMUL to manage risk and grow its assets at a faster pace than it would on its own.Environmental and social benefits: Thailand is heavily dependent on energy as an input and has one of the highest electricity rates in the region. The project will contribute to increasing efficiency in industry and reduce operating costs. In addition, the project will also contribute to pollution reduction by increasing usage of more efficient technologies with fewer harmful side-effects.

title: Mifel
content:
Address Mexico's SMEs and agribusiness companies financing deficit and foster competition in both sectors where Mifel has traditionally focused on.

Support the consolidation of the Mexican financial sector by enabling the Bank as an acquirer or a more attractive target.

title: Aavishkaar MSME
content:
The team expects high development impact in the following areas:
1). Enhance early stage / VC investing in India and address asymmetrical distribution of PE/VC funds to some extent.
2). Attractive long-term capital appreciation by supporting high growth businesses.
3). Expand access to quality healthcare and education opportunities in India, reduce carbon emission and create employment opportunities. Provision of capital to scalable enterprises in low income states and rural and semi-urban areas in India. Target sectors include education, health, water and sanitation, agriculture and renewable energy sectors.  
4). Demonstration of successful venture capital investing in an IDA country such as India and underserved sectors, thereby building confidence amongst institutional investors to invest in the country and sectors.

title: GNG Central
content:
- Development of Ukraine's infrastructure based on modern and safe standards.
- Access to high-quality petroleum products and services
- Employment creation/preservation.  GNG employs 4,700 people (only 2,000 in 2004).  The proposed investment is expected to create about 900 permanent jobs and 250 thousand man hours of construction jobs
- Development of local suppliers.  Convenience stores, automotive services and fast-food help local economies because such services at stations are primarily locally supplied.

title: CHUEE SME BRCB
content:
(i)	Environmental benefit: Annual reduction of 160,000 tCO2/year during 2015 to 2018
(ii)	SME access to finance: At least 20 eligible loans will be disbursed by the end of 2014 from a baseline of zero loans as of December 2010
(iii)	 Demonstration effect: Encouraging the Chinese government at both central and local levels to participate in future public private partnership initiatives of this type; and 
(iv)	Capacity building: Promoting the development of industry specific loan underwriting criteria and improved risk management practices.

title: Dallol Potash
content: The Project is in an early exploration phase so its developmental impacts are limited in scope at this stage. However, the Project is located in an under-developed part of the country and will likely contribute significantly to the area''s development should it transition into a full operating mine through: (i) generation of employment; (ii) improved infrastructure access; (iii) stimulation of local economic development through purchase of local goods and services; (iv) payments to government in the form of royalties and taxes; and (v) improving the receipt of foreign currency to the government.The Company has committed to make public all material payments to the government as per IFC requirement.

title: Mibanco - PEN Syndication
content: The development impact of the Project is expected to be high, as it will enhance the Bank''s ability to support productive micro, small and medium enterprises which will in turn stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction. In addition, Mibanco will be able to increase its outreach and sustainability incorporating thousands of new entrepreneurs to the formal financial sector. The Project will help develop the B loan market in local currency in Peru and reopen the syndication market for MFIs in Latin America, following the financial crisis.

title: MedGulf
content:
1. Spread awareness about insurance value as a risk insulation to the formation of more businesses and jobs and to the increase of social stability in the MENA countries.
 
2. Formalize best insurance risk management practices for participants in the MENA insurance market to stimulate more investment opportunities, economic efficiency, stability, and poverty reduction. 

3. Develop an economic multiplier effect through channeling insurance premiums into regional economies' investments and capital markets products to support the private sector development in the MENA region.

title: Seker SME Covered Bond
content: Open and create a covered bond market in Turkey and allow banks to raise long-term funding from domestic and international investors in order to finance SME's and other projects.

title: Sanasa
content: The proposed project is expected to have a significant development impact in enhancing the Bank's ability to expand its outreach in the microfinance sector and result in improved economic development and poverty reduction.  The Project will also help in improving access to credit in underserved areas which are more difficult for the formal banking sector to reach. Moreover, the Project will also increase access to finance for women as a significant proportion of SDB's MFI clients are expected to be women.  Finally, the Project is expected to create a demonstration effect for other investors to invest into the microfinance segment.

title: Market Shoping Center Kigali
PT SPV V
content:
Sustainable development of the textiles industry: The Project supports the development of additional fiber capacities based on renewable raw material - dissolving grade wood pulp.  Arguably, viscose has a lower impact on the environment compared with cotton (due to lower usage of land and water per unit of fiber) and petrochemical-based synthetic fibers (considering the bio-degradable properties of viscose and lower usage of fossil-based sources). 

Job creation:  The Project is expected to create 270 new job opportunities for the local economy.  In addition, the Project will support the long-term growth of the Indonesian textiles sector through increased domestic production of VSF at internationally competitive quality and costs.  This, in turn, will ensure the retention and growth of employment across the textiles value chain in Indonesia, textiles being one of the country's key sectors in terms of employment and foreign exchange earnings.

title: Comemsa
content: Key development impacts of the project include:Supporting the construction of solar energy plants globally by providing a necessary component to the solar panel structure and encouraging the use of clean energy, thus reducing CO2 emissions through the implementation of clean energy plants.Improving the infrastructure supply chain through the increased manufacture and sale of transmission towers across Latin America and in the USA to meet growing demand.  As a result of increased focus on transmission capability in Mexico and Central American, energy access is expected to improve. Supporting job creation in Mexico, a key objective for the Mexican government, both during the expansion and operation of the manufacturing facility.

title: Shangri-La Ulaanbaatar Hotel LLC
content:
The Project's expected development impact includes the following:
(i)	Increased supply of hotel services: The Project will help meet the growing demand for hotel accommodation in the presently under-served 5-star hotel sector in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. 
(ii)	Employment creation: The Project will create a significant number of direct and indirect job opportunities for the local communities. 
(iii)	Benefits to the local economy and local linkages: The Project will help create demand for locally sourced materials, service, and labor, both during the construction and operation stages . The Project is expected to support small- and medium-sized enterprises, including a wide range of goods and service providers.  
(iv)	Increase in domestic revenue and foreign exchange: The Project is expected to contribute to the domestic economy through increased tax revenues and foreign exchange inflow.  
(v)	Private sector development: The presence of the Shangri-La Hotel in Ulaanbaatar will send a positive signal to other foreign investors who are considering investments in Mongolia where there is limited private sector activity. The Project is also expected to have an impact on the upgrade and development of retail and travel-related infrastructure in the city of Ulaanbaatar.

title: Microvast
Fibra Cap Incr
content: Fibra has expertise in credit operations, particularly involving SME borrowers and low income individuals.  The major development impacts expected from this project are: (i) with a strengthened capital base, the Bank will be able to further expand its credit activities, increasing access to credit for both SMEs and low income individuals; (ii) the presence of well capitalized mid-sized banks in Brazil is an important factor to maintain competitiveness in the even more concentrated Brazilian banking sector after the crisis.

title: Coopenae
content: 1.	Contribution to Private Sector Development: By supporting Coopenae, IFC will facilitate access to specialized financial services for consumers and MSMES.  These segments are generally underserved by large foreign-owned banks in Costa Rica.  SMEs represent a critical private sector segment, however, accounting for about 30% of the total number of registered Costa Rican companies.2.	Scaling up MSME Lending: This Project involves scaling up a local MSME lender by supporting it with long-term local currency debt funding.  Accordingly, IFC is playing a catalytic role in the sustainable development of the MSME sector. 3.	Contribution to Poverty Reduction: The Project will support productive MSMEs and employment generation in Costa Rica.  MSMEs account for 38% of the total formal employment in Costa Rica and the SME sector plays a crucial role in achieving poverty reduction and accelerating economic growth and is therefore key to the health of the economy.4.	Funding Mobilization: IFC will provide the loan in local currency and with FMO, which will provide parallel funding of equal amount.

title: FINCA Kyrgyzstan
content:
The developmental impact is expected to be high:

-	The Project would provide funding for underserved segments of society in an IDA country, more specifically women entrepreneurs, and will contribute to employment creation and poverty reduction in Kyrgyz Republic.

-	The Project would support the efforts of FMCC to diversify and increase the volume of their funding and to better manage their asset and liability position at a time of limited funding opportunities.

-	In Kyrgyz Republic, the provision of term funding in the local financial market will have a very strong demonstration effect and build market confidence. This is extremely relevant in a post conflict environment.

title: FINCA Azerbaijan
content:
-	The Project would provide funding for underserved segments of society in an IDA country, more specifically women entrepreneurs, and will contribute to employment creation and poverty reduction in Azerbaijan.

-	The Project would support the efforts of FINCA Azerbaijan to diversify and increase the volume of their funding and to better manage their asset and liability and their local currency position at a time of limited funding opportunities.

-	In Azerbaijan, the provision of term funding in the local financial market will have a strong demonstration effect and build market confidence.

title: Techno Wind
content: 1. Increase power generation from renewable sources: The Indian power market is characterized by significant supply deficit which is expected to continue in the medium term. Through this investment, IFC supports a company which will add approximately 200MW of renewable energy generation capacity over the next 2 years to meet the growing electricity demand in India.2. Climate Change Impact: The Project helps mitigate negative climate change impacts by helping avoid GHG emissions.3. Private Sector Development: 80% of power generation in India is still state-owned, with all major players focused on large thermal and hydro power projects. In line with its mandate, IFC''s participation in this Project will help stimulate private sector development within the renewable energy generation sector.4. Employment Generation: The Project creates employment opportunities during project identification, construction and operation for local communities

title: Bayer Farmers
content: IFC development impact in this investment will be measured according to the following indicators:i) increased and improved access to financial services for agricultural SME''s and farmers;ii) support agri-customers and one of the leading sectors of the Ukrainian economy through an innovative financial product;iii) demonstration effect to the local market that should encourage local banks to serve this crucial yet largely underserved sector;iv) improvement of Bayer''s and farmers'' integrated pest and disease management (IPM/IDM) approach, coordinated use of pest and environmental information along with available pest control methods, including cultural practices, biological, genetic and, as a last resort, chemical means to prevent unacceptable levels of pest damage.

title: IFC Global Infrastructure Fund
content: This Project is expected to deliver strong development impact by: (i) mobilizing additional capital for infrastructure investments and thereby ensuring a larger number of projects are completed; (ii) enabling IFC to invest in more projects because project risk exposure will be shared by Fund Investors which will  increase the number of projects that will adhere to IFC Performance Standards; (iii) demonstrating that emerging markets infrastructure investments present an attractive investment opportunity; (iv) investing in frontier regions; and, (v) introducing large international investors to investing in infrastructure in the emerging markets in a sustainable manner.

title: Khan Bank Sub D
Shalivahana
content:
Increase power generation: The Indian power market is characterized by significant supply deficit which is expected to continue in the medium term. India's regulatory environment is increasingly supportive of renewable energy. Through this investment, IFC supports a company which will add approximately 200MW of renewable energy generation capacity over the next 3-4 years to meet the growing electricity demand in India. 

Climate Change Impact: The Project helps mitigate negative climate change impacts by helping avoid GHG emissions - IFC estimates a reduction of approximately 227,000 tCO2eq/year attributable to IFC's investment alone. 

Private Sector Development: 80% of power generation in India is still state-owned, with all major players focused on large thermal and hydro power projects. In line with its mandate, IFC's participation in this Project will help stimulate private sector development within the renewable energy generation sector. 

Development of Low Income States (LIS): The entire pipeline of SGEL's projects is in the LIS (Madhya Pradesh, Orissa, Jharkhand and Chattisgarh). SGEL's projects create employment opportunities and stimulate the development of the rural economy. 
 
Employment Generation: The Project creates employment opportunities during project identification, construction and operation. Significant employment is created during operations by biomass traders supplying fuel to the various plants of the Company and its subsidiaries.

title: SEAF Caucasus Growth Fund
content:
This project is in line with IFC's overall strategy for investments in the Caucasus region. The expected development impact of the project includes:
- Support of SMEs: All target portfolio companies in the fund will be SMEs.
- IDA Country Focus: The three target countries of Georgia, Azerbaijan and Armenia, are IDA-blend countries.
- Economic Development: Provision of long-term capital to sectors traditionally overlooked by the formal banking sector will allow companies to grow which can lead to increased output and increased employment.
- Private Sector Development: Manager employs a hands-on, value-added strategy with portfolio companies, providing professional management and operations support and expertise leading to better competitiveness and sustainability in SMEs.
- Support a nascent private equity industry in the Caucasus.

title: DARP SPV Covinoc
content:
The proposed project is expected to have a high development impact in the following areas:

(i)	Economic Development:  The successful implementation of the project will aid the development of a secondary market for distressed assets which in turn will serve as a stabilization factor for the financial system. This should enable institutions to focus on productive use of capital which can result in higher liquidity and increased capitalization levels at the lending institution level. 

(ii)	Business Environment:  As financial intermediaries increase the sale of their distressed assets to independent private investors, the transparency of those institutions' balance sheets would improve as these assets would be priced according to market conditions. In addition, the demonstration effect of the project will help promote international insolvency standards and creditors' rights while providing investors with risk mitigation, divestment routes, and out-of-court resolution mechanism. All of these factors will greatly increase the region's attractiveness to local and foreign investors.  

(iii)	Financial Infrastructure:  IFC's involvement in this project would allow Covinoc to positively impact the market place by building capacity in the financial markets. The project is expected to increase the ability of financial intermediaries in the country to offload their assets, particularly non-performing ones, improve liquidity and devote these resources to originating new transactions.

title: Moorhouse Properties Limited
content: The proposed Project will (i) bridge the supply gap for high quality under-served hotel markets in major business cities in Nigeria which is presently met with sub-standard accommodation and guest houses, (ii) contribute to the improvement of the business infrastructure of the country, (iii) create significant job opportunities to the local people and linkages with other sectors of the local economy many of which are SMEs, both during Project implementation and ongoing operations, such as small contractors, building material suppliers, agricultural and food processing, textiles manufacturers, etc, (iv) encourage improvements in the standards of existing hotels and transfer of hotel management expertise and training of the local staff, and (v) the Project has the potential to provide a demonstration effect and kick off the development of a mid and budget market hotel segment in Nigeria.    It is also important to note that international chains assure guests of an established product and service quality; often encourage broad improvements in the standards of existing hotels; and provide staff with compensation usually above local norms.

title: TCX Fund
content:
TCX contributes to the development of the LCY markets by offering floating and fixed rate funding to counterparties for extended maturities and in situations where long benchmark rates are either illiquid or not available. This will facilitate future lending in LCY by fostering competition, price signals, extending the tenors and reducing the cost of LCY debt. 

The use of hedging reduces the currency/maturity mismatch of emerging market borrowers, strengthens their balance sheet and encourages a more efficient use of their capital.

TCX's focus on Sub Saharan Africa & microfinance aims to get a maximum effect where it is most needed. TCX is committed to achieve its focus in these two segments by establishing a lower minimum deal size and by charging less capital to transactions in these areas (Dutch government incentive).

title: QICT II
content: The proposed IFC financing will help strengthen the transportation sector in Pakistan by improving transport logistics between Port Qasim and Lahore, efficiency levels at QICT's existing container terminal, and value-added CFS services at Port Qasim.  The accompanied improvements in service levels, efficiency, and costs will benefit all port users including shipping lines, exporters, and importers. In addition, the long-term introduction of viable rail service between Port Qasim and Lahore will significantly reduce transport costs and emissions. The Project is expected to create new jobs and generate increased revenues for the Government of Pakistan through higher royalty and lease payments by the Company as well as higher taxes. IFC's financing will also send an important signal of support for sustainable Pakistani enterprises during the current challenging political and economic environment.

title: Denizbank A.S. Agribusiness DPR
content: The proposed project would send signals of confidence in the DPR financing market which had been dormant. The project would generate a range of social and economic benefits, including economic growth and employment creation, as well as financial deepening with services and products tailored to low income populations especially in agribusiness sector including farmers.

title: Q and M
content: - Increasing access to high quality dental care: Demand for dental care in China is increasing, yet standards are reported to be generally low. This project will include skills transfer from Singapore.  - Regional integration of best practices: Best management and clinical practices will be transferred from Q & M''s operations in Singapore to its facilities in China.- Employment generation: This project will provide employment opportunities to additional dental workers in China and allow them to work in a high-quality, safe clinical environment.

title: Tamek
content:
The Project will have following development impact:
   - Increased Competition: The Project will strengthen Company's position in the market as well as improve its competitiveness, which in turn will promote the competition in the fast growing fruit juice and branded processed food sectors.
   - Local Supply Chain Linkages & Farmers Reached: The Company works with various distributors throughout Turkey and applies contracted farming for various raw materials. So, with the Project the Company would be able to (i) collaborate more with its distributors to increase efficiencies, (ii) support more individual farmers; and (iii) further extend its local supply chain coverage thanks to improved operational and financial performance at corporate level. 
   - Job Preservation & Increased Tax Revenues: With the Project, the Company will be able to retain its existing labor force while improved financial performance would lead to higher revenues/profitability resulting in returns to the society in form of taxes.

title: Turan MSME Loan
content: The proposed project will have high development impact. The project is expected to have the following development impacts: (i) increase access to finance for MSMEs; (ii) improve corporate governance; and (iii) deposit mobilization.

title: UniBank MSME
content: The proposed project will have a high development impact. The project is expected to have the following development impacts: (i) increase access to finance for MSMEs; (ii) improve corporate governance and (iii) deposit mobilization.

title: Bansicredi
content: The project is expected to (i) increase access to finance to small farmers and other low income individuals in small cities and regions outside of the main urban centers, (ii) increase the loan term for the system members and (iii) support the development of new financial solutions for the system members.

title: UHG - ADM
content: The project will i) improve access to quality healthcare, particularly for publicly-insured patients; and ii) contribute to government movement to better integrate private businesses into health sector. UHG's national presence is anticipated to extend the reach of services and create stable employment to specialized medical personnel, even beyond the traditional Istanbul market.  The project may also be expected to strengthen over time the position of Turkey as a healthcare tourism destination.

title: CEZ Shperndarje
content: The Project's expected development impact is as follows: (i) supporting the expected technical and financial turnaround of the power distribution sector in Albania, which in turn would improve sector sustainability and growth; (ii) enhancing energy efficiency through reduction of energy losses; (iii) upgrading and expanding the power system to improve the reliability and quality of electricity supply; (iv) increasing electricity access, especially for the poor and rural communities in one of the poorest countries in south-eastern Europe; and (v) supporting the country's power sector reform. Through the above, the Project is expected to deliver positive fiscal impact and contribute to Albania's long-term growth prospects.

title: Grupo Salud
content: (i) Creation of high quality health services provider as a center of excellence in Peru ; (ii) Demonstration effect on viability of private health care institutions; (iii) Provision of services to middle and lower income patients through PPP facility (Trecca) which will benefit from the flagship hospital within the group, despite not being financed by IFC

title: Euroleasing SME
Equity TCB
content: The project is expected to have high developmental impact by a) improving access to finance for mid-size Russian companies and SMEs, b) strengthening the capital base of a well-managed Russian bank and supporting its planned IPO, and c) helping the development of funding for energy efficiency projects in Russia.

title: Agrofertil
content: The Project is expected to have a significant development impact by (i) reaching farmers operating in frontier regions (likely to include a significant share in BOP), (ii) supporting the dissemination of agricultural best practices and inputs to farmers, (iii) generating tax income for the Government, and (iv) employment.

title: PTC Fin Loan
content:
Wider impact: With IFC's support, PFS can support a wider range of clients in the RE space potentially across multiple technologies and increase the renewable energy generation base in India. 

Demonstration effect: PFS is a developing financial intermediary and its expansion in this space is likely to help attract other financial institutions to increase their risk appetite and invest more in these sectors. 

GHG Savings: The proposed investment will result in substantial savings of GHG emissions as it will encourage power generation from renewable and climate friendly fuels. This is critical in view of Government's overall intention to reduce carbon emissions. 

Institution building: IFC's support to PFS will help it to scale up its capacity to assess clean energy projects through sharing of its experience and knowledge of the sector worldwide.

title: Sagicor Financial Corporation
content: With the financial and institutional backing of the IFC, the Company is expected to strengthen its position in the market as a leading indigenous insurance company and to bolster its prospects for further expansion, while at the same time consolidating and strengthening its life insurance operations. In addition, by investing in SFC and, consequently, the local insurance markets, IFC can also play a critical role in driving more widespread access to financial and insurance services, as well as in developing the local capital markets.

title: First Cravings
Energomera II
content:
i.The project is expected to contribute to the energy savings in Russia through wider use of metering, especially new generation meters, and lead to reduced GHG emissions in the longer term. Monocrystal's increased production will support further reduction in GHG emissions through the use of LED lighting and employment of solar cells in electricity generation.
ii.Employment preservation: IFC's investment will support one of the largest employers in Stavropol.  Moreover, Energomera is a high-technology employer in a region where employment opportunities are generally limited to agriculture jobs. Currently the Company employs approximately 4 500 people of which 2 300 are female.
iii.	Monocrystal is an export oriented company which brings foreign currency denominated revenues to Russia.

title: Exim India: South Asian IDA countries Export Facility
content:
The development impact of the project is expected to be: 

-	supporting international trade between India and other South Asian countries; 
-	providing access to finance to the underserved medium enterprise sector as they would be able to secure financing to execute export orders in the current weak market conditions; and
-	helping boost confidence in the Indian economy amongst other market participants and facilitate improvement in international credit flows to India.

title: CF - AUB
content: The main developmental impact of the project is expected to be in the developing member countries in the MENA region where AUB plans to expand as follows:Improving the quality and operational standards of the local banks acquired/to be acquired by the Bank.Strengthening the financial systems in the local markets where AUB is/will operate through introducing new talent, modern management, best practices and comprehensive risk management frameworks. It would also increase competition, resulting in the provision of better financial services and banking products.Strengthening the capital base of the banks acquired/to be acquired that will lead to enhancing the access to finance in the underdeveloped markets in the Region and as such contribute to economic growth, capital formation, employment and private sector development.Developing the retail lending and housing finance capabilities of the banks acquired/to be acquired, which would benefit the underserved consumer segments.Supporting the flow of funds from the resource surplus GCC countries to the less developed markets and facilitate trade, investment, remittances, etc and thus increase regional economic integration.

title: Commercial Bank of Iraq
content: The proposed Project is expected to have a high development impact as it will (i) Provide fundamental banking services to an underserved market; (ii) Expand and help develop financial services and products, (iii) Advance capacity and institution building of CBIQ.

title: Interswitch
content: Providing a low-cost channel for the poor and people living in rural areas to participate more actively in the economy by providing access to the country's financial infrastructure has been shown to have a positive economic impact for both those populations and the country's economy overall.  Through the Project, Interswitch will enable the Nigerian population, especially the unbanked, (i) have access to easier forms of electronic payments that will reduce cash in circulation, which has been a source of crime, fraud and corruption; and (ii) make themselves eligible for more sophisticated financial services and products.

title: Nuestra Gente II
content: - Increased access to finance: If fully deployed, the loan and PCGs would help increase access to finance for micro entrepreneurs in Peru. CNG's portfolio is expected to increase by 20% on average annually during the life of the project from a base line of US$250 million in November 2010.

title: Kaizen
content:
The project is expected to have a high development impact in the following areas:
Provision of long-term equity capital to institutions in the education sector value chain and thus increasing access to education in India.  This type of funding is not readily available in the market.
Operational improvements to portfolio companies in the education sector in India through the value add role of the Managers. This will improve the quality and sustainability of education sector institutions in India and make them more attractive to strategic investors.
Demonstration of successful private equity investments in an underserved sector, thereby building confidence amongst institutional investors to invest in India and the sector.

title: Regional CL
DARP Clearwater
content:
Support Private Sector Investment in NPL Portfolios:  Distressed asset transactions help improve the stability of banking systems by providing a way for banks to manage their NPLs/asset quality and allow banks refocus their recourses and activities back to lending.  In Asia, while there is private sector interest/activity in this segment, it is largely directed towards more developed markets (e.g., Japan, Australia).  

Without a means to support stressed companies or resolving NPLs, economic assets can lie stagnant and unproductive.  In addition, such investments can help many borrowers to de-leverage their balance sheets to sustainable levels, avoiding the unwinding of otherwise viable companies.

title: Bandhan
content: The proposed project is expected to have a high developmental impact by: (i) increasing access to finance in some of the poorest states in the northern and eastern parts of India; (ii) promoting a more balanced growth of microfinance in India. Most of the MFIs operating in India are concentrated in southern India. Bandhan's operations are largely in the northern and eastern part where microfinance penetration is very low and very few MFIs of significant size are located; (iii) contributing to employment creation and poverty reduction in each of the states where Bandhan operates; and (iv) providing capacity building support in areas such as governance, product development and environmental and social standards so as to establish best practice.

title: Star Hydropower
CPLF - Mytischi
content: Rehabilitation of the heating infrastructure in the City to be supported under the proposed project will improve energy efficiency, improve the quality of heating and hot water services to residents, and reduce heat losses and maintenance costs. Ultimately the project will contribute to improving the living conditions and environment in the City.

title: Seguros GyT S.A.
content: In strengthening the capital and operational base of the leading insurer in Guatemala, an institutional endorsement standard for other insurers in the country will be set.  This is expected to be a key contributor in setting the country's insurance industry on a more stable footing, which will enhance reputation and security, as well as facilitate an improved usage of insurance by Guatemalans, including the lower income segments.

title: Russia Residential Energy Efficiency Program
content: Successful implementation of the Project is expected to lead to avoidance of approximately 2.5 million tonnes of CO2 over the lifetime of the investments enabled by this Project (see next section).

title: GTLP FIM Bank
content: (i) Channeling liquidity for trade financing in the Africa, and MENA regions which is vital to the survival of SMEs in those regions, thereby preserving jobs at such SMEs and the FIs; (ii) strong demonstration effect by catalyzing other IFIs to support trade finance  a main artery to economic health and recovery, especially in emerging markets.

title: Magerwa 1
content:
1. This investment aims to bring an international sponsor with signifcant global experience in mid-size port operations and management into Rwanda.
2. The Privatization of Magerwa and its acquisition by Portek is expected to lead to growth in the former's business prospects and also lead to serious improvements in operating efficiencies in the facilities owned and operated by Magerwa. Given the critical position played by Magerwa in the import & export trade flows for Rwanda, this will have a signifcant beneficial impact on the regional economic environment.

title: Vitafoam SL
content:
Increased private sector development especially since there is no foam manufacturing plant in Sierra Leone.
Transfer of technology to a new market.
Reduction in Imports and increased local production.
Increased government revenue.
Job creation.

title: Altobridge
content:
The project aims to achieve the following development impacts:
I. Provide Voice & Mobile Internet Connectivity to Remote Communities
-Mobile Operators have been commercially constrained from extending their networks into remote regions in emerging markets due to the costs involved of rolling out traditional network infrastructure, e.g. towers, microwave links, power etc. The low operating and capital costs of the Altobridge lite-site reduces the barriers to rural and remote network expansion, namely, expensive satellite backhaul, power source and truck-roll costs.
-The Company's Data at the Edge solution and other products will provide reliable and affordable mobile broadband connectivity to schools, homes and enterprises in areas that currently lack such access to the internet.
II. Assist in the creation of direct and indirect employment in emerging markets
III. Promote energy efficiency through the reliance of Altobridge products on renewable power sources

title: EPM AB Loan
content: The Project expected to benefit about 3,000,000 residents with better supply of water and sewerage services, 209.300 residents through new rural electricity connections, about 460.000 residents with new electricity connections and street lights, as well as about 600,000 residents with better electricity supply through rehabilitation and connections.  Of that large group, about 1,2 million people fall in the low income category classified as social strata 1 and 2 in the Colombian system. In addition to the social impact, network rehabilitation investments offer a positive environmental impact.  Reducing non revenue water (NRW), which is about 36%, is critical given that a one percentage point reduction in water losses saves about 3 million m3 per year of treated water, sufficient to supply about 70,000 people. The Project will help reduce the level of non revenue water from about 102 million cubic meters in 2010 to about 85-90 million cubic meters in 2012, and help maintain the level of commercial losses in electricity distribution network at 13.4% or less through rehabilitation and replacement of network infrastructure.

title: SEWA
content:
1.	Demonstration effect: Successful execution of this project will send a strong signal to the market that clean energy projects at the Base of the Pyramid are sustainable and can be commercially supported through collaboration with reputed institutions like SEWA who have a strong rural outreach.
2.	Increased household incomes: Usage of energy efficient cookstoves and solar lanterns will increase household incomes by reducing expenses on firewood, kerosene and electricity and increasing availability of time for wage-earning activities.
3.	Greenhouse Gases (GHGs) savings: The potential reduction in GHGs is estimated to be approximately 1 million tons of carbon dioxide equivalents over the life of the project.
4.	Improved healthcare: Efficient cookstoves can reduce the risk of respiratory and other diseases amongst women and children.
5.	 Job Creation: The project envisages facilitating creation of micro-entrepreneurs and micro-franchisees involved in distribution and servicing of equipment.

title: Soufflet ECA
content: Project is to secure the working capital needs of a large regional player in the grain/oilseed/malt sector in five countries in a challenging economic context. The Project supports the long term strategic commitment of Soufflet to the region, where it expects to expand its activities in in-kind prefinancing of farmers (in the form of inputs), procurement of grains and oilseeds, storage and logistic services, malt processing and international trading.- SMEs, farmers, and employment. The Project will also carry significant benefits for Soufflets partners. In particular, employment and number of farmers reached are expected to grow. Most farms in the region are fairly large and provide substantial employment in rural areas. In addition, Soufflets activities also support many MSMEs (e.g. independent elevators, importers of inputs, transportation companies, security, catering, cleaning, maintenance, etc), which further reinforces the Companys direct impact on the local economy.- Upgrading of storage/logistics infrastructure. Soufflet has acquired and developed 210,000mt of grain storage capacity in the five countries. These facilities were usually poorly maintained, inefficient because of bottlenecks at various stages of loading and unloading, and were not operated at standards of safety applied to the Companys facilities in other countries. The Company has engaged into a multiyear improvement program that frees usable capacity, eliminates bottlenecks and upgrades the standards of operation to internationally accepted levels. This will in turn improve the quality of services to local farmers and local residents. This also provides a benchmark for the operation of competing elevators in the region. - Building more competitive markets. Storage and drying capacity in inland elevators remains limited relative to the current production levels, which provides better negotiating power to elevator operators. Soufflets expansion of its presence and higher standards of operation will provide valuable competition in this underserved market. - Agricultural productivity improvements. Soufflet has a staff of agronomists whose primary mission was to ensure adequate agronomic practices for the production of high quality malting barley. As the Company expands its procurement towards other grains and oilseeds, this expertise is being redeployed to ensure that a package of inputs, prefinancing, agronomic advice, storage and marketing services is available to local farmers to improve productivity and strengthen their partnership with Soufflet.- Strengthening rural economic development. Soufflets operations generate significant economic opportunities for rural communities in terms of employment as well as linkages to MSMEs.

title: Actis Africa Real Estate Fund 2
content: The Fund will have the following development impacts: i) contribution to filling the gap between supply and demand for quality commercial  real estate and providing increased access to quality business infrastructure critical for economic growth in key markets of Sub-Saharan Africa; ii) improvement of business infrastructure standards through the introduction and the implementation of best practices in terms of environmental and life and safety standards in key markets of Sub-Saharan Africa; iii) development of quality retail infrastructure in Sub-Saharan Africa thus improving access to quality products and services for the consumers; iv) creation of direct and indirect jobs both during construction and operation of the commercial properties in the target markets, and v) benefits to other sectors of the economy such as in the supply chain.

title: Vinati Organics Limited
content: The Project is expected to have the following development impact: (i) Supporting a global-scale and competitive manufacturing operation which is environment friendly as it is committed to minimizing effluent discharge; (ii)	Demonstration effect of good Environmental and Social practices among the mid-sized Indian pharmaceutical and specialty chemicals producers, where such practices are limited and (iii)	Local employment generation - addition of up to 100 new jobs on permanent / contract basis and an additional 50-100 jobs during construction phase in a relatively underdeveloped area in Maharashtra state.

title: ACBA-Credit Agricole Bank, Armenia
content:
High, on account of:
-Continued SME support in an IDA country
-Sustain bank's capacity to lend to agricultural sector where it has 20% of its loan portfolio.

title: Global Climate
content: The Fund is expected to have a significant development impact in promoting energy efficiency and renewable energy products to households and SMEs. This in turn will support climate change mitigation and its associated benefits such as increased energy efficiency, and reduction in pollution levels. The Fund is also expected to demonstrate that energy efficient projects can be bankable, thereby leading to increased investment in this area by the private sector.
