Coupled with this demonstration effect will be the transfer of knowledge that will be achieved in some markets by the Technical Assistance Facility with respect to appraising climate change products and ensuring they are bankable.

title: KHI Ghana
content:
(i)	Develop infrastructure:  The project will add to the country's critical lack of business infrastructure. 
(ii)	Job creation:  The hotel and associated development will create new direct and indirect employment.  
(iii)	Benefits to local suppliers:  The hotel is expected to source almost all of their food and non-food purchases locally, thereby providing increased business opportunities to a wide range of local suppliers and sub-contractors, most of whom are SMEs.  Going forward, KHI Ghana's operations are expected to offer a significant revenue source to these SMEs, thereby enhancing their competitiveness and growth.

title: Comasel Louga
content:
The project will have significant development impact as it will support the improvement of the living conditions of population in rural areas and the reduction of poverty. The project aims to support the progressive transformation and improvement of living conditions of the population in rural areas of Senegal which at present lacks electricity. This will be achieved by (i) providing lighting and access to modern communication to 11,826 new rural households, (ii) improving delivery of social services, health centers and schools and (iii) enhancing economic productivity through the provision of electricity for productive purposes. 

The population in rural areas depends on fuel-wood for cooking, on wicks, kerosene lamps and some small batteries for lighting, and on human force  frequently from women  for domestic and productive tasks. The project should promote growth and the personal development of women and children by making their domestic work load less heavy

The social benefits from electrification  the ability to power lights, radios, small appliances and televisions  will make a significant contribution to enhancing the quality of life and the reduction of poverty.

The Project will improve access to electricity as it will provide electricity to 11,826 rural users (9,945 via connections to the national grid and 1,852 with individual solar kits), in the next three years who at present do not have access to electricity.

The project will have a positive environmental impact since it will help to reduce CO2 emissions through the use of renewable energy. It will promote conservation by: using renewable sources of energy (solar energy) and reducing deforestation. Comasel Louga has opted for solar powered systems to complement the electricity provided by Senelec. Clean renewable energy sources will help reduces the use of individual fuel based generators and wood fuels thus reducing pollution in these communities.

title: FATEN
content:
i) Access to finance: Through this project, IFC would support the growth of a well managed and financially sound MFI in West Bank and Gaza, Faten, which would result in expanding much needed access to finance for low-income Palestinians. 
ii) Job creation: The small and micro enterprises (SMEs) sector accounts for about 79% of total employment and as such is a key source of job creation and income generation and a powerful tool for combating poverty. IFC's engagement with Faten would have a significant impact since Faten is a major player in the market and solely dedicated to serving the micro entrepreneurs.
(iii) Medium-term funding: IFC will provide Faten with the much needed medium-term funding that is otherwise not available in the market, to enable the company to continue supporting, and further grow its clients' base. The social and developmental impacts would be very high especially that women borrowers represents significant percentage of Faten's clients.

title: Xinjiang MCC
content: (i) expand access to finance to MSEs in one of China's most remote and poorest provinces; (ii) assist in the creation of jobs and promotion of entrepreneurship through MSEs; and (iii) support a South-South investment and the expansion of a key IFC strategic partner that seeks to be a leading microfinance institution across the region.

title: PNG SME Risk Sharing Facility
content:
The Project is expected to have significant development impacts on account of:
(1) Access to Finance: The Project will increase access to finance for the underserved SME market in PNG. 
(2) Support for SMEs: IFC support for the SME sector will greatly enhance the ability for SMEs to engage meaningfully and profitably in the supplier arrangements for the LNG project and subsequent extractive industry projects.
(3) Capacity Building: The TA associated with the RSF will increase the capacity of the banking sector to provide services to the SME sector that should continue to have positive impacts beyond the life of the RSF, build the skills and abilities of the SMEs, and provide technical assistance to GoPNG.

title: Tianjin Haitai
content:
There is growing need for better management of natural resources and pollution in the continued economic and population growth of China and the rest of the world. Natural resource management and reduced utilization of fossil-fuel based resources are important for both climate change and sustainable growth.  

While much emphasis has been put into supporting China's domestic industries, with construction the 4th largest in energy consumption, the efforts to reduce the energy intensity of China's growth (especially with growing environmental pressures and the global financial crisis) are a continuing and significant effort that is increasingly being stressed by the national government and international community.

Companies like Haitai are emerging as critical drivers of innovation in natural resource management and energy efficiency, particularly in China.  Haitai is contributing to the development of the clean technology sector in China and assisting the government of China to adopt higher quality and more environmentally friendly roads. 

An investment in this industry will greatly support the Company's ability to develop and grow in the domestic clean technology sector, by expanding to the frontier regions where China's planned expressway network will reach.  The investment may also help Haitai transfer knowledge and products to other developing regions outside of China.

The Project will have significant developmental impact by:

i.	Contributing to the development of the clean technology sector in China;
ii.	Assisting the government of China in achieving its transport construction goals while at the same time reducing cost and impact to the environment; 
iii.	Using 300,000 tons of RMA asphalt can save 60,000 tons of petroleum (105,000 tons CO2 equivalent compared to paving with conventional SBS modified asphalt), use up nearly 10 million pieces of waste tires, and reduce RMB200 mm in construction cost.

title: FINCA Microfinance Holdings
content: The proposed project is expected to have a high developmental impact by: (i) establishing a commercial microfinance holding company that will support the transformation process of credit only NGOs into regulated deposit taking institutions in poor and post conflict countries, (ii) promoting financial sector development through the transformation of the affiliates into professionally managed and sustainable financial institutions that serve low income entrepreneurs, especially women entrepreneurs, (iii) building public confidence in financial institutions and encourage more intermediaries to extend financial services to the target segment, (iv) providing capacity building support to transform the NGOs into viable financial intermediaries that provide financial services on commercial terms, and (v) contributing to employment creation and poverty reduction in each of the affiliates' countries. FINCA's objectives in establishing the holding company also include broadening access and increased outreach to the lowest income entrepreneurs in the countries in which it operates and to which it expects to expand.

title: MTB - EE loan
content: IFC development impact in the MTB investment will be measured according to the following indicators:i) support a growing private sector bank through provision of long-term funding and expertise;ii) provide access to finance for SME''s as a part of its long-term objective to develop private sector in Belarus;iii) enhance competitiveness of the economy by addressing environmental and energy efficiency challenges faced by local enterprises.

title: Metcombank I
content: The project is expected to have positive impact on private sector development through supporting the growth of a financial institution whose strategy is built on servicing clients in the less developed regions of Russia with a special focus on lending to retail and SME customers.

title: Podgorica Bypass
content: The proposed IFC investment will support private sector development in Montenegro through reduced travel time, enhanced mobility and facilitating country's reintegration into international trade and tourism networks. It will also have long-term environmental and social benefits by reducing air pollution and traffic accidents in the City.

title: La Vegona
content:
Help lower an IDA country's dependence on thermal power:  Currently, non-renewable sources account for over 60% of Honduras' annual power generation.  The successful completion of the Project will provide clean, low-cost power generated from a renewable resource to meet close to 2.6% of the country's current power demand and allow for the possible retirement of old, inefficient and more expensive thermal capacity.

Development of Honduras' hydroelectric resources: To address the country's current energy challenges, the Government of Honduras ("GON") has put forth a strategy to develop its domestic renewable energy resources, including hydropower.  Successful completion of the largest private sector-led hydroelectric project in Honduras to date would contribute directly, as well as indirectly through demonstration effect, to this objective.

Climate change: The Project is expected to displace thermal power generation, hence reducing the region's carbon emissions by approximately 108 thousand tons of CO2 per year.

Supporting the financial sustainability of the power sector: The Project will reduce Honduras'wholesale energy prices and dependence on oil, supporting the power sector's path towards financial sustainability.

Cost Efficiency:  The Project will help lower the cost of electricity and therefore help support a lower cost structure for industries and consumers in Honduras.

title: Orient Express Bank
content:
1) Through this project, IFC will facilitate the consolidation of the Russian banking sector: Orient Express has already merged with four smaller banks in 2009 and 2010, and has both appetite and capacity to continue acquisitions of small and medium banks in the next two - three years.  
2) In cooperation with Orient Express Bank, IFC can further contribute to climate change mitigation and development of the energy efficiency market through enhancement of energy efficiency component in retail lending.
3) Through this project, IFC can facilitate further increase of access to finance for SMEs across sectors: Orient Express is currently operating as a primarily retail bank with a small share of micro and SME lending, but has good platform and systems in place to develop micro and small enterprise lending on a much broader scale.
4) Through this project, IFC will strengthen its business partnership with a systemically important bank operating in less-developed regions where significant developmental challenges remain: Orient Express operates in a number of frontier regions of Russia, where access to finance is especially important. Going forward, as Orient Express acquires additional banks, its distribution network will further expand and its ability to reach more clients in frontier regions will increase.

title: Stomana III
content:
- Countercyclical Support: The proposed transaction would provide durable financial support to a significant employer, exporter and tax payer in Bulgaria by supporting Stomana's efforts in the aftermath of the worst financial year in recent history for most steel-makers.
- Environmental and Financial Benefits: Part of the proposed IFC financing is aimed for the capital investments of Stomana.  The investment into the new Electric Arc Furnace (EAF) would bring forth better utilization of electric and natural gas consumption of Stomana.  This would create both environmental and financial benefits as soon as the new technology is installed and implemented.

title: Favorita WC
content: The Project supports the continued growth of one of Ecuador's leading agribusiness companies and a long standing IFC client.  It will improve Favorita's competitiveness in the production of bananas, and ensure greater traceability and sustainability certification demanded by customers in developed markets.  The Company employs over 10,000 workers (nearly 9000 agricultural) and provides commercial opportunities for over 300 business partners and 400 farmer suppliers.

title: Eximbank Moldova
content: By supporting Eximbank, IFC would increase access to finance for Moldavian enterprises and support economic activity and job creation. IFC investment would help banking sector sustain trust, during a difficult period.

title: Latapack Growth
content: (i) Development and employment generation (136 direct employees) in a frontier region of Brazil (100% of the investment in the Bahia State); (ii) Increase the production and utilization of easily recyclable packaging materials; (iii) Increase of energy efficient manufacturing process, including new CDL technology; (iv) Increase of supply in an underserved market/replacement of imports; and(v) Indirect Positive Base-of-Pyramid effect.

title: Gamesa
content: Job creation: The new facility is expected to create about 150 new jobs as well as additional jobs in line with the facilitys growth and expansion in the coming years;Support for the Indian wind power market: by producing low-cost turbines locally that are best suited to the countrys grid and wind conditions, the Gamesa Project will help develop and bolster the wind market in India;Technology transfer: while the Project currently envisions assembly in India, the Company aims to have a full turbine production facility set up in the long-term. This process will result in the transfer of important climate change related technology.

title: Togo LCT
content: The Project will combine deep water location advantages, with state-of-the-art container handling equipment, and world class management know-how to create the first modern container transshipment hub in West and Central Africa (WCA) capable of handling todays larger container ships. This will allow shipping lines to deploy larger container vessels in WCA, avail the region to scale benefits enjoyed elsewhere in the world, and significantly lower transport costs to the Terminals users. The Project will result in the expansion of Togos maritime sector, stimulate competition in the regional shipping and logistics market and potentially catalyze further regional integration.  In addition, the Sponsor will bring port operation and management know-how to Togo, resulting in an upgrading of the skills of the local workforce.

title: Engro Pakistan Emergency Investment Facility
content: The emergency loan is expected to help the Company deal with declining fertilizer sales and delays in completion of its new fertilizer plant that are due to the large scale floods in Pakistan.  The facility's objective is to smooth the operation and output and support the Company to respond quickly to the recovery in fertilizer demand once agricultural production picks up again.

title: EFGSerbia
content: The Development Impact is expected to be strong in terms of (i) providing support to EFG Beograd in the form of term lending and (ii) supporting MSMEs in Serbia which EFG Beograd is financing.

title: Bancpost SME
content: The Development Impact is expected to be strong in terms of (i) providing support to Bancpost in the form of term lending and (ii) supporting MSMEs in Romania which Bancpost is financing

title: BIB B loan
content: Industrial has expertise in credit operations, particularly involving SME borrowers. The three major development impacts embedded in this project are: (i) expand access to credit to underserved SME segment; (ii) help maintain a competitive environment in the concentrated Brazilian banking sector; (iii) IFC Environmental and Social Standards: the Project facilitates the Bank setting up an appropriate social and environmental management system, commensurate with its business lines.

title: RCBC Equity
content: The proposed Project is expected to have a high development impact as it will increase access to finance to MSMEs and support the consolidation of the Philippine banking sector.  The Philippine banking system is extremely fragmented with over 818 operating banks. The system is inefficient with too many small players. Of the 818 banks, there are 38 commercial and universal banks that together own almost 95% of the banking industry's assets.  IFC's strategy is to support consolidation in the industry to enable larger banks to go down market which should bring down credit cost through improved efficiencies.

title: Microcred Microfinance Bank Nigeria Limited
content: The project will have a high development impact considering that microfinance has been shown to play a major positive role in reducing poverty and unemployment in developing countries. The initiative will strengthen the provision of microfinance services in Nigeria, where access to finance remains extremely limited for low-income populations. By supporting a new institution able to sustain microfinance on commercial terms and following best practices, the project has the potential to generate a substantial increase in the long-term availability of financial services for the poor. The project will also have a demonstration effect by showing local financial institutions that microfinance can be sustainable and generate commercial returns.

title: Brasil Terminal Portuario
content: The Project will help strengthen the port sector in Brazil by increasing container handling capacity at the Port of Santos. The increased capacity at BTP will help ease the existing congestion at the Port of Santos's container terminals, which are currently operating at capacity. The accompanied remediation of the site formerly used for waste disposal will benefit the Santos community and avoid further contamination of the soil and water. The Project will also create direct and indirect employment opportunities and increase revenues for the Government of Brazil through increased economic activity and higher tax payments, custom duties, and royalty and lease payments.

title: Frikom extension
content: The proposed Project supports the continued regional growth of an emerging market player, and also develops a local supply chain for small fruit and vegetable farmers:- Private Sector Development: Support privatization, rehabilitation and improve the productivity of formerly state-owned assets;- Employment: Safeguard employment at Nova Sloga, including a large number in rural areas;- Farmer benefits: Strengthen the competitiveness of vegetable supply chain by providing reliable access to market and technical assistance to farmers;- SME development: companies like Frikom (and eventually Nova Sloga after its turnaround) are the local engines of supply chains, upstream supporting farmers by providing a reliable off-take of fruits and vegetables, and downstream by supplying retail and distribution networks;- Community development: the construction of a local supermarket (there is none within a 60 km radius), the local presence of an off-taker for produce with credible infrastructure on the ground, the availability of technical assistance for horticulture will support rural and community development;- Tax-payer benefit: Increase taxes paid and decrease in state support to a loss making state-owned enterprise;- Quality Management Certification: Improve E&S management and quality certification at Frikom, and support introduction of E&S management and certification process at Nova Sloga.

title: Caucedo Phase 2
content: Caucedo''s Phase 2 expansion will: (a) increase efficiency and relieve capacity constraints to meet incremental demand  for container handling services in the Dominican Republic; (b) through increased efficiency and faster turn around time, the port will reduce transportation costs and thereby benefit shippers, shipping lines and consumers alike; (c) result in more revenues (port fees) to the Dominican Republic and (d) generate additional employment and upgrade worker''s skills.

title: ABBank Equity/CB
InfraV-AK KhanWH
content: There will be direct beneficial impact on quality of life and health.Employment generation by engaging people from villages for operating community water systems and revenue collectionsEnvironmental benefits - the adoption of WHI''s systems will help minimize the use of chemicals with toxic by-products used in alternative water purification methods like chlorination. The distributed water model also assists in minimizing water losses by supplying water at the retail level thereby avoiding supply leakage losses.

title: Estacio
content: The project will i) increase access to quality post-secondary education, especially for lower income students; ii) improve the quality of post-secondary education throughout Brazil through academic and operational improvements and standardization; (iii) expand the Company's operations in frontier regions, in particular the Brazilian Northeast; (iv) enhance efficiency and rationalization of the sector in Brazil.

title: Cheves Hydro
content: The Project's success is critical in supporting the Government of Peru's efforts to refocus on developing Peru's hydro potential to sustain continuous economic growth through a properly diversified energy mix and address the climate change agenda.  Furthermore, the Project is expected to have other key economic and developmental impacts by: (i) decreasing carbon emissions through the displacement of thermal power generation; (ii) increasing employment, mainly during the construction phase; (iii) contributing royalties and tax payments that will directly benefit the regional and local governments around the project; and (iv) serving as a benchmark in terms of implementation of E&S standards for other hydroelectric developments in the region.

title: Bioparques 2
Al Hikma V
content:
-	 The investment will support south to south expansion.
- Hikma will have a demonstration effect increasing the number of FDA approved manufacturing facilities in the MENA region.
- Hikma will increase the availability of a wide range of quality medicines in the MENA region.
-	 The regional expansion will increase generic competition and increase access to affordable medicines.

title: SEDAS
content: The Project's development impact is as follows: (i) development of sustainable private power distributors by providing the first long term project financing to a distribution company in Turkey; (ii) demonstrating the viability of distribution privatization to help attract local and international investors to future distribution privatization tenders; (iii) supporting power sector reform in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation of a regional energy market; and (iv) benefiting the end-users by bringing innovation and improved service levels. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Turkey.

title: Vietnam Bank for Industry and Trade
content:
The Project will achieve a strong development impact by demonstrating IFC's commitment in supporting Vietnam financial market reform, including the following:
improving the capital adequacy of the third largest local bank which is of systemic importance for Vietnam.  The project will demonstrate IFC's continued commitment to Vietnam's financial market through assisting the state- owned bank to increase its capital to meet business expansion needs and pursue its privatization and modernization plan amid global financial turmoil.
focusing on SME lending; IFC's investment will assist the Bank to expand its SME loan portfolio to reach clients through its wide network in all cities and provinces of Vietnam, thus supporting employment generation, livelihood improvement and private sector growth.

title: Abank Sub Loan
content: The Project is expected to support a growing Turkish bank through a subordinated loan facility, which will qualify as Tier II capital. The proposed investment is intended to strengthen the Banks balance sheet by expanding its capital base, as well as support its growth strategy, focusing on the SME segment.

title: CPLF - Karsten
content: The proposed project will help Karsten reduce its high energy costs and its carbon emissions footprint. Karsten will pilot the use of solar panels in farm worker housing, which it can replicate on its other farms. This is in line with IFC's stated objective of creating demonstration projects that can showcase successful cleaner production efficiencies for others in the sector.

title: NBC Uruguay CL
content:
The anticipated development impacts of the project include:
(i) improve access to long-term finance for small farmers and agri-SMEs; and,
(ii) enhance the agribusiness sector efficiency and job creation in rural frontier regions by leveraging NBC's nationwide branch presence.

title: AEB Syndication
content: The Development Impact is expected to be strong in the following areas: (i) supporting the Armenian SME sector in overcoming the consequences of the economic crisis and improving SME competitiveness through providing access to long-term funding and (ii) enabling AEB to expand its client network throughout Armenia.

title: CF Banco GyT
content: The proposed transaction is expected to have a high impact as it will (i) recapitalize one of Guatemala's leading banks and improve the banking systems' solvency; (ii) enable south-to-south investments as part of GyT Continental's strategic plan to expand in the region; (iii) help overcome the low banking penetration still prevalent in Guatemala; and (iv) potentially reduce fragmentation as weaker players may become targets for stronger market participants.

title: O3B Networks Limited
Banque de l'habitat du Burkina Faso
content: By supporting the first dedicated housing bank in Burkina Faso, the Project is expected to make a significant contribution to the housing sector in the country by helping to provide a significant portion of the Burkinabe population with an opportunity to access homeownership. IFC's investment will also help mobilize much needed long-term finance to BHBF, which, in turn, will contribute to financial sector strengthening. Finally, the project will help demonstrate the commercial viability of mortgage lending in Burkina Faso.

title: Suu dairy
content: (i) Expansion of raw milk procurement is expected to provide 2,500 existing and 1,500 new herders and farmers involved in milk supply chain with increased and more sustainable income; (ii) at the same time the project will provide them with more  information about quality milk standards through newly established MCPs and MCU as well as new milking parlors that will   offer a controlled environment for cow milking; and (iii) Self-sustainability of Mongolia for domestic milk product supply will be improved and import dependency will be reduced. Currently around 25 % of all processed dairy products are imported.

title: Catalyst Fund I L.L.C
content: The Fund will achieve development impact by improving access to equity financing to emerging and mid-sized companies that are expected to create above average employment and accelerate economic growth across the region. The investments will be across a diversity of sectors. The Fund's investments in target companies will range from $5 million to $15 million and will consist predominantly of strategic minority equity stakes, with board representation and shareholder right to influence the strategic direction of the company and conduct of management.

title: GTLP II Commerz
content: The project is expected to have a significant development impact by increasing the availability of unfunded solutions (i.e. guarantees) for trade of consumer goods, intermediate goods, smaller machinery, and commodities demanded by enterprises in Africa.IFCs global franchise (in particular on the African continent) in financial markets will be critical to the projects success in leveraging trade volumes, expanding to new markets, and mobilizing any requisite funding support (i.e. guarantees) to enable the continued support for trade.

title: SEF Tajero Choc
content:
Through this Project, IFC will be investing with a local sponsor that has built a strong distribution business in a challenging environment and now is looking to start its own production in a predominantly import dependent market. With IFC's involvement, Amiri is well positioned to become a model production site through support from IFC on food safety, HACCP and environmental standards, and would be able to disseminate best practices through its distribution network.
The Project's main beneficiaries will be financiers, employees, owners of small stores and consumers.

title: CF Ficohsa
content: IFC will: a) increase access to small and medium enterprises and housing financing; b) potentially facilitating consolidation of the Honduran banking system; and c) provide capital support and long-term funds to be channeled to small and medium enterprises and housing finance.

title: Compartamos Loan
content: The proceeds from the credit line will be used by Compartamos to increase and diversify its funding base by obtaining medium-term funding for on lending to small and micro enterprises in Mexico.

title: Lattice Power
content:
IFC's expected development impact resulting from a potential investment in Lattice includes: 

Contributing to the development of Jiangxi Province which has a much lower GDP per capita (US$2,200) compared to the average GDP per capita in China (US$3,200).  

Helping China address climate change challenges by financing a company that manufactures energy efficient LED technology. The success of this Project will provide the development of an important technology notably for more energy efficiency lighting, computer monitors, notebook and TV displays. 

 Creating employment opportunities for both operational and management positions (around 1000 new employees) in a frontier region.

title: Enerjisa-II
content: The Project will have a significant development impact as it will: (i) increase Turkey's electricity and renewable energy output and help meeting the country's growing energy demand; (ii) in doing so, reduce Turkey's reliance on coal, thereby reduce carbon intensity and contribute to the effort to reducing global warming (iii) support power sector reform by increasing the share of private generation in Turkey's overall electricity generation in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation of a regional energy market; and (vi) by size and nature of the transaction, influence Turkey's ability to continue to attract foreign investment in the energy sector. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Turkey.

title: India Collections Management Private Ltd
content:
The developmental impact of the Project stems from its ability to support financial entities and others to more effectively manage and collect non performing loans.
An improved collection system allows for greater bank profitability, improvement in the credit culture, support to the distressed asset sales processes and more systemic efficiency.

title: Tribanco Eq
content:
- Poverty Reduction and Increase in Access to Finance: the project is expected to have a high development impact. It is expected to be significant in terms of its support for micro and small businesses and employment generation in areas and among populations that are underserved by the formal banking system. Tribanco follows Martins Group to the most remote and neglected urban and rural areas of Brazil, where many people (small shops and end consumers) have virtually no access to financial services. The proposed investment will support Tribanco's role as a pioneer bank that is widening access to credit in remote and under-privileged sectors of the economy. 

- Corporate Governance: the project is expected to contribute to the improvement of market governance standards, particularly as this is a family-held bank, in which IFC would become the first minority investor. This is a very important step for the Family and will represent an important contribution to the development of corporate governance standards in Tribanco.

title: Bic Mobilization
content: The project is expected to (i) increase access to finance for small and medium enterprises (ii) fully support and help the Bank to introduce new funding and commercial opportunities from emerging markets financial institutions, especially in Asia and (iii) broaden mid-sized banks funding alternatives.

title: Goldwind
content:
The project will have the following positive developmental impacts:

Contribution to the Sustainable Development of Wind Technology: Goldwin, as a leader in China's wind market, has developed unique direct drive and permanent magnet generator ('DDPMG') technology that is seen to represent the future trend of turbine development worldwide. The success of the new turbine technology can significantly help improve the economic return of wind power investment and thus sustain the healthy development of the industry, both in China and other emerging economies.

Development of Frontier Regions:  Goldwind, headquartered in Xinjiang, one of the most impoverished regions in China. Goldwind also has production bases in other less developing remote frontier regions like Inner Mongolia, Gansu, Shaanxi and Ningxia. Given the labor intensive nature of the business, Goldwind can create abundant job opportunities in these regions and further develop its supply chain which in turn benefits local SMEs. Goldwind has a significant impact on the local economy of West China. 


Role Model for Domestic Player in China's Wind Market: Goldwind was the pioneer and leader in China's wind market. The Company's impressive achievement in becoming the fifth largest turbine manufacturers globally has made clearly demonstrated that newly start-up companies, originated from frontier region, can also succeed in sectors that are mostly dominated by big state owned enterprises.

title: Attero Recycling
content: This project has the potential to generate a powerful demonstration effect that could result in additional capital flowing into the domestic formal e-waste sector. This will support growth of a small and evolving, but critical market. The community at large will also benefit as the growth of Attero will result in a greater portion of e-waste being recycled in an environmentally sound manner, avoiding the dumping of hazardous substances that have negative health impacts. The project also supports climate change because re-cycling metals from state-of-the-art e-waste technology consumes less energy and generates less hazardous emissions than mining them. The project will allow the Company to grow, generating employment in an environmentally and socially conscious sector that would not have otherwise been created.

title: FINEM SME
content: The project will: (i) provide funding to education SMEs (schools, universities, language centers, etc.) primarily for infrastructure expansion and modernization; (ii) contribute to the improvement of financial discipline of education SMEs as result of Finem's due diligence, monitoring, and in some cases advisory functions; and (iii) create a strong demonstration effect about the viability of lending to the sector.

title: TEB Kosovo Sub
content:
IFC's main role lies in facilitating the development of Kosovo's financial sector through introducing a subordinated loan in the form of Tier II capital. This would help diversify the funding base of the Bank and set as a benchmark for others to raise funding in the form of Tier II capital which is highly effective to increase lending as it leverages the balance sheet. Furthermore, by sharing IFC's global knowledge and expertise in the financial markets, IFC would help TEB Sh. A to strengthen its business strategy and implement best industry practices in a nascent market.
The Project will generate a range of social and economic benefits, including economic growth and employment creation, as well as financial deepening with services and products tailored to the SMEs.

title: Cai Lan International Container Terminal, LLC
content: The Project is expected to deliver considerable development impact by (i) reducing the costs of transportation, thereby benefitting shippers, shipping lines and consumers; (ii) encouraging other terminal operators to improve the efficiency of their own terminal facilities, thereby spurring increased trade in the region; (iii) creating additional port revenues for Vietnam; and (iv) introducing international port operation and management know-how to North Vietnam, resulting in an upgrading of the skills of the local workforce.

title: DARP IFC/ADM Cornerstone Facility
content: By providing sound, but financially stressed, companies with access to financing which they would not otherwise be able to access using conventional banking avenues, the Facility would:  i) support viable private sector companies; ii) save jobs; iii) increase efficiency; and iv) maintain productive asset utilization.  Investing in stressed companies with the aim of corporate turnaround and recovery, has a high development impact in improving corporate governance and transparency of investee companies as well as inducing managerial and operational improvements required to restore viability to the investee company.

title: IHS Nigeria
content: (i) Expand mobile telephony access: With the construction of additional tower sites, existing Telcos will be able to expand the reach of their services both in terms of geography and capacity. In addition, collocation reduces the incremental cost of expanding service for all carriers thereby allowing them to service remote and economically less developed areas where ARPU and usage will be lower. (ii) Increased competition: The presence of IHS Nigeria will allow smaller and newer wireless operators to benefit from reduced barriers to entry as they will have access to leased tower facilities rather than having to build their own. (iii) Expand access to other ICT technologies:  IHS Nigeria, directly and through its subsidiaries, will be building a tower network that is capable of supporting not only mobile cellular networks, but also wireless broadband and backhaul networks, thereby improving the penetration of these technologies. (iv) Contribute to mitigating environmental impact and Climate Change: The underlying projects developed by the Company will provide a cost effective opportunity to Telcos to reduce their carbon emission footprint by sharing infrastructure. A significant benefit of sharing tower infrastructure arises from the material, energy and emissions savings that ensue from building only one tower instead of three or four.

title: AMSME Bank of Africa - Tanzania
content:
SME Lending Expansion: The project is expected to enhance BOA Kenya's focus on SME lending and strengthen its capacity to adequately serve this segment of the banking market. The project will also enable the Bank to offer wider financing options to Kenyan SMEs, and hence encourage expansion of SME lending to this underserved yet key segment of the Kenyan economy. Such financing will be crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector across the country that results in improved economic development and poverty reduction.

Demonstration Effect: The project will have a demonstration effect for other banks to diversify into the SME segment. In addition, BOA Kenya will have to comply with IFC's environmental and social management standards. Compliance with these standards will improve the Bank's environmental and social profile and create a demonstration effect for other banks.

title: BDO SEF
content:
The following development benefits are expected:

IFC is contributing to the development and diversification of the financial sector by assisting in the development of new markets and product lines with significant growth potential.

IFC's project complements BDO's strategy to support the EE and RE sectors and will enable the Bank to manage risk and grow its EE and RE assets at a faster pace than it would on its own.

Environmental and social benefits: The Philippines is heavily dependent on energy as an input and has one of the highest electricity rates in the region.  The project will contribute to increasing efficiency in industry and reduce operating costs.  In addition, the project will also contribute to pollution reduction by increasing usage of more efficient technologies with fewer harmful side-effects.

title: Cacanska Banka
content: The Project is expected to have a high development impact. It will:- enable CBC to expand its lending to SMEs in the region that had limited access to finance from the banking sector historically and who will need more support given the effect of global crisis in Serbia. Central and Western Serbia region has a high concentration of SMEs, which play a critical role in the country''s economic growth and employment. - strengthen the capital base and adequacy of the Bank and demonstrate the ability of a Serbian locally-owned bank to attract investments from international institutional investors in difficult financing times and thereby help the Bank to meet difficult asset quality and liquidity challenges going forward.- will enable economic growth and job protection in less developed regions in Serbia.- advance capacity and institution building of the Bank through the IFC''s nominee possible involvement in the Bank''s Board of Directors; and - facilitate the eventual sale of the Bank to a strategic investor.

title: Urwego Opportunity Bank Rwanda SA
content:
This project will have a high development impact considering that microfinance has been shown to play a major positive role in reducing poverty and unemployment in developing countries. The initiative will strengthen the leading microfinance institution in Rwanda by financing the company's planned portfolio growth and expansion. The initiative will also develop the Rwandan local currency swap market as one of, if not the, first swapped IFC loan into Rwandan Francs.  

Development impact will be measured on the basis of financial and operational performance of the institution, its expanded product offer and outreach, and adherence to sound corporate and social governance (including environmental compliance).

title: CACIC
Akbank DPR
content: The project will provide long term funding that is not currently available in the market. The proceeds of the IFC financing will be used to on-lend to SMEs and/or sustainable energy financing projects in Turkey. The presence of IFC would mobilize other IFIs and commercial long term lending to the project.

title: JEP 3: WKPP 66MW
content:
The Project is part of a key medium-term process of replacing outdated Jamaican power generation capacity with the most efficient and viable source of generation available in the short term. It should result in a reduction of the cost of energy for the Jamaican ratepayer and improve system reliability, while reducing the country's fuel bill. 

The Project is also expected to have significant demonstration effects by showing that a well-structured project in a sector with a sound regulatory regime can attract private sector investment in Jamaica and be successfully syndicated at difficult economic times.

title: Trustco Finance (Pty) Limited
content:
The Project is expected to deliver strong development impact by:

<e2>?<U+00A2>	Enhancing access to additional teachers training courses
<e2>?<U+00A2>	Improving the prospects of high school dropouts
<e2>?<U+00A2>	Improving the productive capacity and job earning potential of the current workforce
<e2>?<U+00A2>	Improving the employability and job earning potential of high school graduates
<e2>?<U+00A2>	Facilitating the adoption of new skills and/or career changes by those in full time employment who cannot afford to leave work and enter university full time.

title: Ust Kamenogorsk Poultry Farm, JSC
content: Through working with UKPF, IFC will support the development of a local market leader in the poultry sector, a high priority for the Government of Kazakhstan.   Since the IFC project will address improvements in bio-security, cleaner production and energy efficiency, the Company will be able to serve as a model for other poultry and meat producers to improve their operations.   The Project main beneficiaries will be financiers, grain farmers, soybean and sunflower farmers, employees, retail stores, consumers, and the nearby residents of the UKPF operation.

title: Beijing Shenwu Thermal Energy Technology Co., Ltd.
content:
(i) Support innovation and contribute to development of clean technology sector in China. 
(ii) Assist the government of China to achieve its energy efficiency and CO2 emmisions reduction goals.
(iii) Enable cleaner production best practices in key polluting industries in China and other developing regions.
(iv) Increase Employment: with the successful implementation of the Project, the Company will create additional 600 new jobs in total in the next three years.
(iv) Increase Employment: with the successful implementation of the Project, the Company will create additional 50 new jobs in its Bejing headquarters and Hubei manufacturing site.

title: AMSME Bank of Africa Uganda
content:
SME Lending Expansion: The project is expected to enhance BOA Uganda's focus on SME lending and strengthen its capacity to adequately serve this segment of the banking market. The project will also enable the Bank to offer wider financing options to Ugandan SMEs, and hence encourage expansion of SME lending to this underserved yet key segment of the Ugandan economy. Such financing will be crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector across the country that results in improved economic development and poverty reduction.

Demonstration Effect: The project will have a demonstration effect for other banks to diversify into the SME segment. In addition, BOA Uganda will have to comply with IFC's environmental and social management standards. Compliance with these standards will improve the Bank's environmental and social profile and create a demonstration effect for other banks.

title: Harmon Hall
content: By supporting Harmon Hall, IFC will have the following development impact: (i) expansion of access to high quality English education and primary and secondary education: Consolidation of Harmon Hall presence, as well as further expansion into new markets, will expand the availability of high quality English education in the country, which provides skills necessary to compete and advance in the national job market; (ii) creation of employment opportunities: as a result of its expansion, Harmon Hall hires additional teachers and sales personnel to serve its growing student base, thereby helping to improve living standards and contributing to human capital development; (iii) expansion of high quality training: Harmon Hall provides training support to all its personnel in order to ensure a healthy pipeline of high quality trained staff to serve its current and future schools; (iv) standard setting among English language schools: the high quality standards by which Harmon Hall operates will set a precedent in the English education market, which will generate pressure on other competitor schools to pursue accreditation and quality standards; (v) community engagement: Both K-12 and English schools provide scholarships to students who cannot afford the tuition.  Additionally Harmon Hall has begun to engage with public schools to provide the English program within their regular program. By doing so, more low income students will have access to quality English education which today is inexistent in the public system.

title: Chisinau City
content: IFC role is to provide funding to Chisinau City on competitive terms for long term tenors in line with the long-lived nature of its assets. IFC also expects to provide strategic advice in formulation of the City investment priorities and technical expertise during project preparation and implementation and facilitate and trigger further high-priority investments in local municipal infrastructure.

title: AMSME Bank of Africa - Kenya
content:
SME Lending Expansion: The project is expected to enhance BOA Kenya's focus on SME lending and strengthen its capacity to adequately serve this segment of the banking market. The project will also enable the Bank to offer wider financing options to Kenyan SMEs, and hence encourage expansion of SME lending to this underserved yet key segment of the Kenyan economy. Such financing will be crucial for the sustainable development of the private sector across the country that results in improved economic development and poverty reduction.

Demonstration Effect: The project will have a demonstration effect for other banks to diversify into the SME segment. In addition, BOA Kenya will have to comply with IFC's environmental and social management standards. Compliance with these standards will improve the Bank's environmental and social profile and create a demonstration effect for other banks.

title: Egyptian Indian Polyester Company - Sokhna
content:
(1) Demonstration Effect of a South-South Investment: The Project will be the first PET project in Egypt and North Africa as a whole, a region which has the potential to become an important region in this industry. The Project is a South-South investment and its success could help GOE attract further FDI in the country.
(2) Promotion of Downstream Industry: The water and carbonated soft drinks bottling industries in Egypt, which comprise several small players, currently lack domestic sources of PET resin. This Project is expected to help these players improve the efficiency of their operations through savings in logistics costs.
(3) Diversification of export earnings: The majority of Egypt's foreign currency revenues currently come from natural gas sales and tourism. The Project is expected to contribute to the diversification of Egypt's export base.
(4) Employment Creation: The Project is expected to create about 450 permanent jobs and about 800 jobs during construction. In addition, it will provide indirect employment through use of local port facilities and supplies.

title: Archimedes Global Ltd.
content: The project is expected to: (i) expand the availability of health insurance to under-served populations (project expects to reach 670 thousand insured by 2018 as it expands to other markets (not including Greece); (ii) open 24 clinics in its principal markets; (iii) highlight the potential of this segment of the market to other insurance companies, and the innovative business model required to successfully serve it; (iv) increase financial protection for people requiring health care; (v) promote much-needed transparency of payment in the local health sectors; and  support evidence-based medical practices.

title: Fibra Mobiliz
content: Fibra has expertise in credit operations, particularly involving SME borrowers. The two major development impacts embedded in this project are: (i) expanding access to credit to underserved SME segment; and (ii) helping maintain a competitive environment in the concentrated Brazilian banking sector.

title: Societe Eiffage de la Nouvelle Autoroute Concedee
content: The  proposed Project is the first toll-road designed on a PPP basis from its inception in Sub-Saharan African, and has significant development impact: Improving access to Dakar, Senegals economic engine: today, with the acute congestion affecting the RN1, the only road in/out of Dakar, it can take over two hours to travel about 20 km. This congestion is a significant cost to the movement of goods and people out of Dakar. The Project will eliminate this cost, resulting in improved competitiveness of the Senegalese economy through better access to markets; Reducing the cost of infrastructure development to the GoS: the Project will allow the GoS to build a modern toll-road, up to international standards and operated by a world-class operator, while saving about EUR90 million in upfront capital expenditure costs. This immediate cost saving would allow the GoS to direct the resources of its general budget to other priority expenditures  in particular, in the social sectors; Improving the living standards of about 3,000 households: the Project is an essential component of a larger urban upgrading project, undertaken by the GoS with support from the World Bank (IDA), the African Development Bank and the French Development Agency, to upgrade one of the neighborhoods crossed by the Project toll-road (Pikine). As part of the Project, the GoS will implement a comprehensive upgrade and restructuring of Pikine, leading to a major improvement in the livelihood standard of about 3,000 households (for additional details, cf. available documents relative to IDA project number 4341-SN, approved by the Board of the World Bank on May 2009);Raising private sector participation in infrastructure in Africa to new levels: the Project a first of its kind in Sub-Saharan Africa: this will be the first greenfield toll-road PPP in Sub Saharan African (excluding South Africa), conceived as such from the onset (there are a number of toll roads in Africa, but they are all expansions of existing roads or having the addition of a toll post construction). The demonstration impact of the Project will therefore be very high, demonstrating that well structured PPPs in the transport sector are feasible in Africa, and paving the way for the replication of such structures.

title: Mindoro Resources Ltd
content: The project is in exploration phase so its development impacts are limited in scope at this stage. However, the project is located in an underdeveloped part and frontier region of the country. It is outside of key centers of commercial activity and will likely contribute significantly to the areas development should it transition into a full operating mine and refining operation. Expected impacts would include generation of employment, local economic development through purchases of goods and services, improved access to infrastructure, and payments to central and local governments in the form of taxes and royalties.  Mindoro has also entered into a novel partnership arrangement with local artisanal miners to help them secure small scale mining permits and meet environmental and social compliance requirements. Mindoro has also entered into a Benefits Sharing Arrangement with local indigenous people committing the Company to providing employment opportunities, skills training, scholarship funds and a share of any mining revenues.During the exploration phase the key impacts to monitor will include: (i) finalization of drilling program and resource confirmation; (ii) number of local employees; (iii) completion of feasibility studies confirming mine planning and applicable onsite processing techniques; and (iv) completion of required Social and Environmental assessments for each stage of development.

title: Business Oxygen Pvt. Ltd.
content: IFC Ventures focuses on high risk IDA countries where few other sources of financing for small business operate.  The program will directly build the local capacity of financial intermediaries to manage sustainable investment funds for small businesses, providing both risk capital and critical advisory assistance.

title: CASAN - Loan
content: The program would strengthen the commercial viability CASAN, save energy and water resources, and better target their subsidies for the poor.  This proposed investment will replace 300,000 water meters, about 40% of the underperforming meters still in use. Updating the customer data base, a process that includes on-site inspection, will not only help with better billing and collection, but also in identifying low income residents eligible for subsidized tariffs but not receiving that subsidy.  These investments will result in improved billing and collection, reduced unaccounted for water, better reliability of water supply, and energy savings in pumping and treatment of water in the long run.

title: Williamson Diamonds Limited
content:
Given that IFC's investment is focused towards Williamson, the development impact of the Project is concentrated in Tanzania.

The Tanzanian mining sector contributed about 3.5% of the country's GDP for the 2008/09 fiscal year. Tanzania's Development Vision 2025 aims to increase this contribution to 10% of GDP by 2025. The Williamson expansion, which contemplates the long-term and economic sustainability of a 70-year old mine, will support this government objective by setting an example and potentially attracting further investments into the Tanzanian mining sector. More specifically, the development impact from the Williamson expansion is expected to include:

(i) Employment: Successful implementation of the Williamson expansion will help maintain the aggregate number of direct and indirect jobs and potentially create opportunities for further indirect employment. Williamson is also expected to introduce skills training to facilitate labor mobility and growth.

(ii) Fiscal Contributions: The Williamson mine has been operating at a loss over the past few years. Petra plans to return the Williamson mine to profitability, and anticipates the mine to start generating royalty payments by FY2013 once the expansion is completed and becoming a tax paying entity by FY2016. As per IFC requirements, Williamson has agreed to publicly disclose all material revenue payments made to the Tanzanian government.

(iii) Community Development: Williamson plans to spend about 2% of revenues on community development, starting in 2013. The mine already contributes directly towards community development through the provisioning of social, commercial, industrial, medical and administrative infrastructures. The Mwadui hospital, which is totally funded by Williamson, provides access to health care facilities for the community as well as various HIV and malaria treatment programs. In partnership with the Elizabeth Glazer Pediatric AIDS Foundation, Williamson conducts a community outreach program which provides education, care and treatment to HIV/AIDS patients in Mwadui and other neighboring communities.

(iv) Support to Local SMEs: A large proportion of Williamson's procurement is expected to be from Tanzanian suppliers, of which a significant percentage is expected to be from local and regional suppliers. Williamson is committed to supplier development and training, and expects to allocate a portion of its community development expenditure to such initiatives.

Key indicators that are proposed to be used to monitor the development impact of the Williamson project during its life are: (i) aggregate direct and indirect employment, by gender, both at Petra and at Williamson; (ii) total taxes and royalties paid by Williamson to the government; (iii) total expenditures incurred by Williamson on community development activities; and (iv) amount of money spent by Williamson on purchases of local and national goods and services.

title: JPS Co. II
content: The project's expected Development Impact are as follows: (i) reduce overall levels of system losses, thereby improving overall system efficiency, reducing carbon footprint, and dampening the need for new generation; (ii) expand generation capacity through small hydro and wind hence providing fuel diversification sources to the country and resulting in savings in imported fuel and reduction of CO2 emissions; (iii) create employment through the new generation facilities plants (wind and hydro) and train local personnel into energy efficiency and renewable energy aspects; and (iv) significantly enhance safety standards by providing households with proper wiring of their homes, and reliable and efficient metering and distribution networks.

title: Argentex
content: The proposed investment will be made before the completion of a full project feasibility study that would confirm the commercial viability of the Pinguino project. The IFC investment will thus fund exploration and further studies and will not fund development of a mine or result in any immediate incremental production. Development impacts from exploration activities are typically limited but nonetheless create local employment. The proposed project is located in a remote region of Santa Cruz province that suffers from depopulation and economic stagnation. A volcanic eruption in 1991 covered the area with a thick layer of ash that put an end to the then vibrant cattle industry in the region. There are few other sources of potential economic growth and job creation in the area. Should Pinguino be developed into a commercial mining operation, significant economic development impacts are likely to be realized during the construction and production phases, including employment opportunities, tax revenues/foreign exchange contribution to the national economy, purchase of local goods and services and associated economic development.

title: SSL Bosnia II
content: The investment will help enhance SSL's turnaround and increase its competitiveness through economies of scale. Once SSL returns to profitability, this will enhance tax and export revenues for the country. SSL is still one of the largest employers in the area and also generates significant employment at the local brinestone and lime mines.

title: Piaggio
content:
The projects will have a number of important development impacts as follows:
(i) Improved access to economic life and mobility for individuals as well as micro/small enterprises in two IDA countries: In India, Piaggio's LCVs are sold to self-employed or micro/small business owners active in transportation of cargo and passengers and provide highly cost-effective solutions for distribution systems/logistics. In Vietnam, the project will increase competition and improve the quality of two-wheelers available to the consumers.
(ii) Enhancing competitiveness of the manufacturing sector in both countries and technology transfer: Through the projects, Piaggio will transfer technological know-how and help develop technical and management skills in the automotive sector.
(iii) Employment generation: The projects will benefit the local population by generating new employment, approximately 500 in Vietnam and 300 in India. In addition, significant number of indirect jobs are expected to be created along the value chain from suppliers to distribution and after sales services.
(iv) Demonstration effect: Successful completion of Piaggio's projects will boost confidence in both economies and provide a demonstration effect to other foreign investors.
 (v) Improved energy consumption in product manufacturing and product usage: Piaggio's technology is expected to be highly efficient in terms of energy consumption in the manufacturing. In addition, the vehicles manufactured will offer better fuel-efficiency and lower green house gas emissions as compared with the competition.

title: BWL
content: The Project would: (i) support the continued development of a key private sector player in the nascent Russian railcar leasing sector; (ii) contribute to the development of the transportation and logistics sectors in the Russian Federation, facilitating economic growth particularly in the economically disadvantaged hinterland; and (iii) by financing the construction of additional railcars, it would help avoid a supply crisis over the next 5-10 years as the bulk of RZhD's fleet reaches the end of its useful life.  Most of Brunswick's fleet are unrelated to the oil sector and thus help facilitate the diversification of the economy.  The availability of new, more reliable railcars would also help sustain the competitiveness of Russia's railway sector, mitigating the risk of trucking replacing railways with the attendant increase in harmful GHGs.

title: The Alutech Group
content: The project will support one of the largest private companies in Belarus.  Furthermore, the project will contribute to Alutechs export prospects.  It is expected to have a positive demonstrational effect for improvements in business practices, transparency and financial reporting.

title: National Collateral Management Services Limited
content:
The project will have a strong development impact by helping build efficient agriculture supply chain solutions and promoting inclusive growth as several of the proposed warehouses are in low income states. Around 50% of NCMSLs current (leased) warehousing capacity by volume is located in the low income states of UP, MP and Rajasthan while 33% of the new (owned) warehousing capacity is proposed to be established in these states.

Additionally, most of the procurement activities of the Company are in LIS; for example in the case of Suguna, procurement is being carried out largely in Rajasthan while in the case of FCI, procurement was carried out in Orissa, Bihar, MP, Rajasthan and UP.

title: MedLife II
Energy Dev II
content:
EDC is the largest company currently utilizing geothermal sources of energy in the Philippines, thus our support will provide critical additional resources of an appropriate tenor to help develop projects in the geothermal energy sector and thereby, help the country move toward greater reliance on private sources of growth in the renewable infrastructure sector. 
The investment also underpins IFC's key strategy of supporting climate change mitigation projects in emerging markets.

title: BIF II
content: -Increased access to finance:  Without the Project, it would be much harder for BIF to raise the amount of medium-term funding it is seeking from diversified sources and at competitive market conditions. If fully deployed, the loan could help increase BIF SME loan portfolio by 30% on average annually during the life of the project from a base line of US$185 million in 2009. Wealth derived from the financing activity made possible by the investment would help reduce the income gap prevailing in Peru.

title: Pervobank
content:
i) Access to finance.  The IFC senior loan for on-lending to SMEs will improve access to long-term funding for small and mid-size companies in the regions.
ii) Fighting climate change.  The Energy Efficiency component of the IFC senior loan will contribute to mitigating climate change in one of Russia's most industrially developed regions.  Reduction in energy cost will increase the competitiveness of the Bank's clients.  It is expected that the Project will have significant impact through lowering annual energy costs, primary energy savings and reductions in GHG's emissions.

title: Nova Liniya III
content: The new stores would provide the consumer with more efficient distribution channels and greater access to goods at more affordable prices, including access to products which are important for local consumption.  The new stores would also help boost local production of import substituting products in Ukraine.  In addition, the new stores will support local supply chains and create additional jobs.  As four out of the five planned news stores are outside Kyiv, the proposed IFC investment would also support development of retail operations in more underserved markets in Ukraine.

title: San Jacinto
content:
Help lower Nicaragua's dependence on thermal power:  Currently, renewable sources account for less than 30% of Nicaragua's effective installed generation capacity.  The successful completion of the Project will provide clean, low-cost power generated from a renewable resource to meet close to 20% of current power demand and allow for the possible retirement of old, inefficient and expensive thermal capacity. 

Development of Nicaragua's geothermal resources: To address the country's current energy challenges, the Government of Nicaragua ('GON') has put forth a strategy to develop its domestic renewable energy resources, including geothermal power.  Successful completion of the first large-scale greenfield private sector-led geothermal projects in Nicaragua would contribute directly, as well as indirectly through demonstration effect, to this objective.

Climate change: The Project is expected to displace thermal power generation, hence reducing the region's carbon emissions by approximately 361,901 tCO2 per annum (after project emissions of 39,167 tCO2 per annum).

Supporting the financial sustainability of the power sector: The Project will reduce Nicaragua's' wholesale energy prices and dependence on oil, supporting the power sector's path towards financial sustainability.

Cost Efficiency:  The Project will help lower the cost of electricity and therefore help support a lower cost structure for industries and consumers in Nicaragua.

title: UBF Seguros
content: The project is expected to (i) increase access to private and public insurance schemes to Brazilian farmers (government and private insurance schemes reach over 2 million farmers); (ii) Support the development of new insurance products for agro-insurance; and (iii) facilitate access to finance through expanding the surety market.

title: GTLP II ECA -Intesa
content: The projects development impact is expected to be in three main areas:1.  Provide emerging market banks continued access to trade credit in regions significantly impacted by the crisis such as Southern, Central, and Eastern Europe and Central Asia, as well as issuing banks in sub-Saharan Africa and other regions;2.  Maintain access to credit for the underlying importers/exporters, critical drivers of GDP growth; and3.  Increase Intesa Sanpaolos exposure to IDA countries.

title: Roofings Rolling Mills Limited
content: The Project is expected to have a strong development impact by: (i) providing consumers with increased access to high quality steel products in a 110-million people market; (ii) contributing to the upgrade of local business practices through the introduction of modern production technology; (iii) positively impacting other sectors such as construction and low-income housing; (iv) focusing on job creation and retention; and (v) encouraging other economic operators to move into the new industrial park.

title: Vinte PCG
content: The increased supply of funding will help Vinte build quality and affordable entry level dwellings, and in turn benefit a large number of families in the low to middle income segments.  The housing developments built by Vinte will contribute to urban infrastructure and surrounding community development, previously built by local/federal authorities and neglected for a while due to persistent government deficits.

title: MAIB SME
content: By supporting MAIB, IFC will indirectly help Moldavian enterprises and support economic activity, job protection and creation. IFC investment would help banking sector sustain its recently built trust, during a difficult period.

title: XacBank Sub Debt
content: (i) Increased access to finance to Mongolian SMEs; (ii) Creation of jobs and other economic benefits as a result of supporting SME growth; and (iii) Strengthened capital position of a leading bank and an indication of confidence in the Mongolian financial sector.

title: Saudi Orix SF
content: The project will help SOLC, a leading leasing company in Saudi Arabia, develop an "energy efficiency" portfolio.  The size of the portfolio and the number of SMEs using this financing will be an indication of the success of the program and will have knock-on effects (though difficult to quantify) on raising the visibility of that form of financing in the Kingdom.  By helping the Company introduce this innovative product, the project is also boosting the Company's competitive edge which should reflect on its growth and margins.  Finally, as this would be the first SF funding provided by IFC in the region, it will likely have demonstration effects for replication in the region both by Orix and others.

title: Alta Ventures Mexico Fund I, L.P.
content:
The Fund is expected to have a strong impact for private sector development as follows:

-- Support of SMEs:  The Fund is expected to allocate all of its commitment to SMEs.

-- Private sector development:  The Fund will add value to its investee companies, by providing managerial, operational and strategic support to improve their competitiveness and sustainability

-- Economic development:  The Fund is expected to invest in high-growth companies aiming to increase output, which in turn should lead to increased employment rates.

-- Environmental practices:  The Fund Manager will adopt international best practices for environmental and social risk assessment and management, and improve transparency and corporate governance, thus transferring knowledge and skills to portfolio companies

title: Craftsman I
Teraco
content:
In Sub Saharan Africa the Data Center market is nascent, forcing government and corporations, especially financial institutions, to build their own facilities in-house.  When compared to in-house facilities, data centers offer improved energy efficiency, a high level of reliability and redundancy, the capability to host more sophisticated IT services and solutions and are often much more cost effective.

IFC's investment will expand the availability of high quality/high availability IT infrastructure which is, in turn, needed for IT systems, business continuity and disaster recovery services.   This, in turn, would improve private sector connectivity and public sector competitiveness.  The Project will help provide cost-efficient and energy-efficient IT infrastructure and services, the lack of which is a major constraint to doing business in the region, including in South Africa.

title: Global Trade Supplier Finance
content:
The Program is expected to have significant impact in development in the following areas:

(a) Directly increasing direct access to finance exports from emerging markets and supplementing the availability of credit through the local banks that has been the primary focus for economic development.

(b) Reducing the cost of financing the supply chain that enables a better competitive position for the exporter as well as improving the transparency and risk profile of the transaction as the payment risk is transferred to the buyer

(c) Increasing the suppliers' sales to both large buyers in the program as well as to other companies, in turn increasing employment levels for the suppliers.

title: Ethiopian Coffee
Wadi III
content: The proposed Project encompasses several autonomous components. The primary economic benefits will be in the economic value added by the overall investment program, as well as possible synergies with the Company existing operations. The various components of the program (soybean crushing, table eggs) do not appear to benefit from excessive levels of effective protection, so that financial and economic returns are likely to be aligned. Other economic impacts will include: (i) additional taxes; (ii) additional employment; (iii) additional reach to MSMEs, and, (iv) additional reach to farmers, although most of the new projects will rely on imported agricultural raw materials of which Egypt  has been a major importer. Development outcome indicators will include (i) the project  FRR and ERR, (ii) employment including female employment, (iii) taxes paid, and (iv) number of farmers and MSMEs reached.

title: CHUEE 3 SME
content: (i)potential reduction of approximately 4 million tons of CO2equivalent greenhouse gas emissions per year; (ii) supporting the local banks to strengthen their in-house capacity of assessing energy efficiency projects by providing advisory services on a commercial basis; (iii) provision of EE finance support to over 50 SMEs.

title: SBM  [Mauritius]
content: The IFC advisory services program and accompanying investment in SBM is expected to deliver a measurable economic (financial) and sustainable (non-financial) development impact by:1.	Funding through SBM, those investments in IFC target areas that are often short of medium-term hard currency funding such as Infrastructure (including sustainable, renewable clean energy), Education, Healthcare, and Agri-business; and2.	Increasing access to finance for SMEs through a proven approach to capacity building and introducing SME credit rating review by linking in the IFC MSME business methodology.

title: Jordan India Fertilizer Company
content:
The expected development impact of the Project includes: (i) creating permanent employment opportunities in the Project area (estimated 440 permanent jobs) as well as temporary construction jobs (estimated 750 on average); (ii) helping increase Jordan's industrial exports by generating approximately US$2 billion in export revenues over the life of the proposed IFC investment; and (iii) linkages with national suppliers as the Project is expected to award at least US$140 million worth of contracts to local firms.  In addition, the Project is assisting the largest fertilizer producer in India to meet increasing demand for fertilizer by Indian farmers, particularly in the supply of phosphate, a critical element in nutrient growth and part of the Government of India's strategy to increase its usage.

As part of project supervision process, IFC will track the following indicators:
(a) number of new jobs created,
(b) export revenues from the Project, and
(c) amount of contracts awarded to Jordanian firms.

title: CB Otkrytie
content: i) Demonstration effect: The project would lend credibility and funding to consolidation of the Russian banking sector and encourage private investors to enter this area.(ii) Access to finance: By providing Otkrytie with an equity investment, IFC would strengthen the capital base of a private FI serving clients across the country, thus improving access to finance for SMEs and individuals.

title: NBS Bank
Tamweelcom
content:
(i) The Project would support the launching of a new Energy Efficiency product through a leading microfinance institution for the benefit of low income people in Jordan to allow them to use cleaner and renewable sources of energy (solar energy).  
(ii) Tamweelcom would be the first MFI in Jordan to offer such an innovative product that would contribute positively to its market position. 
(iii) IFC will provide long term funding to enable the Company to continue supporting, and further grow its clients' base. The social and economic impacts would be high especially that women borrowers represent 90% of Tamweelcom's clients.
