(iv) The planned AS will strengthen Tamweelcom internal capacity and enhance the loan officer's skills in promoting such products.
(v) Social and economic implications by lowering monthly energy bills for end-users of the solar panels.

title: Dalkia DH
content:
The need for increased capital and operating expertise in the district heating networks of the former Soviet Union has been clear for many years.  A decade long reform effort has recently attracted international industry capital and expertise to the power sector but low tariffs, constrained by limited affordability, has resulted in little progress in the heating sector. A number of domestic groups have entered the sector in recent years, often in conjunction with power distribution.  They are new to the heating sector; achieving the improved technical performance they projected has proven a challenge and most are now also suffering from capital constraints.  Effective intervention in this sector has the potential to deliver very considerable development impact. 

Dalkia has demonstrated its ability to achieve significant improvements in the heating sectors of post-Communist markets in Lithuania and Estonia and to generate returns for the long term upgrading of the networks.  It is the international industry investor best placed to make a region-wide impact on these systems.  

Reduced water losses, energy savings and heat generation in CHPs create savings which allow improved maintenance and upgrading, the provision of an improved service and the preservation of important capital assets. 

More efficient use of water and energy, conversion from HOBs to CHPs, and the increased use of renewable fuels in these CHPs, brings local environment benefits, which also contribute to climate change goals. 

Improved technical, operational, managerial, environmental, and corporate governance standards in the heating companies will promote the wider development of PPPs and contracting out of services by municipalities.

title: Gulftainer Corp
content: Once regarded as having one of the Middle Easts most comprehensive transportation systems, Iraqs transport and logistics infrastructure has suffered from more than two decades of neglect and underinvestment. Rehabilitation of such infrastructure is a major national and regional trade issue. Gulftainer investments in Umm Qasr Port and Sulaimaniyah airport should help solve this issue and thus contribute to Iraq integration in the regional and global economy.Iraq heavily relies on imports for its consumer goods and for its reconstruction program. Cost effective transport of imported goods is therefore critical to Iraqs economy. World Banks Doing Business indicators however shows that Iraq is facing difficulties in terms of logistics performances. Gulftainers investments to modernize one of Umm Qasr berth combined with its experience to efficiently manage container terminals should contribute to improve the situation.At present, a substantial portion of goods coming into Iraq are off-loaded at ports in the neighboring countries such as Kuwait, Turkey and Jordan and are then transported into the country by road, which tends to increase the time and cost of delivering the goods to the end consumer. The Project will have a significant impact on reducing these impediments to trade in Iraq and foster the countrys reconstruction efforts along with the economic growth and development. Efficient and well-developed transport and logistics infrastructure is an essential component for the expected growth in the countrys Oil & Gas production & export-related activities and the project would play a strong role in facilitating these improvements.In addition to its direct impact on trade, the Project will also contribute towards socio-economic development through the creation of several hundred jobs, reduction in the cost of goods paid by the end consumer (through reduction of costs incurred in the transportation process) as well as substantial royalty payments to the Government of Iraq.Through its involvement in Iraq (Umm Qasr port in particular), Gulftainer will also play a strong role in training and improving the skills of the employees that would be seconded from IMTC, help introduce industry best-practice and contribute its valuable know-how in managing ports and logistics operations, which would help in improving the overall efficiency of the sector.

title: Thien Minh Group
content:
The Project is expected to have significant development impact as described below:

i) Income and Foreign Exchange Revenue:  The Project will generate benefits to the Vietnamese government including tax revenue and foreign exchange inflow, particularly as a significant portion of the hotel guests are foreign nationals and the majority of hotel revenues are paid in foreign currency.

ii) Employment:  The Project provides permanent employment opportunities in hotel management, of which a significant portion are to local staff including a number of female employees.   

iii) Staff Training/Knowledge Transfer:  The Foreign Group will continue to provide hotel management training to its own local staff and will also provide cross-fertilization of knowledge transfer via staff training to other lower-tier hotel properties owned by the Thien Minh Group.

iv) Purchases from Local Suppliers:  The successful implementation of the Project will also ensure continued and increased local supply purchases (food and beverage, supplies and other local services rendered during hotel operations).

v)  Environmental and Social Management System:  The Project, through IFC's support to put in place an appropriate environmental and social management system, will help to ensure implementation of proper World Bank Group life, fire and safety procedures at all of Thien Minh Group's hotel properties.

title: Life Healthcare
content: The project is expected to: (i) Encourage significant investment between emerging markets; (ii) Result in the transference of world class hospital management expertise into new markets; and (iii) Increase access to high quality healthcare in underserved markets in the target countries.

title: Magic Box LLP
content: The investment will help increase Magic Box's product range and variety, thereby improving its competitiveness and export capacity into neighboring markets in the region, notably the larger Kazakstan market. The project will also promote import substitution in Kyrgyz Republic.

title: Exim India II
content:
The development impact of the project is expected to be: 

supporting international trade between India and Africa; 
providing access to finance to the underserved small and medium enterprise sector as they would be able to secure financing to execute export orders in the current weak market conditions; and
providing access to long-term import finance to African importers.

title: Softwell
Tsodilo
content: The development impact at the exploration stage will be limited to the provision of local employment opportunities and support for community development activities. We expect the Project, if it advances to a mine, to have the following notable impacts: i) Direct employment and the implementation of  programs to improve livelihoods of the local population in a region with very limited employment opportunities other than cattle farming;  ii) generation of revenues for government in the form of royalties and corporate taxes. Assuming the base metal discovery is confirmed, the Project will also support the effort by the Government to diversify the mining sector from dependence on diamond mining.

title: Galicia GTLP/EE Agri CL
Guardian Holdings Limited
content:
With IFC as an important shareholder, the Company is expected to strengthen its position as a leading insurance company in the region and to improve its prospects for expansion into new markets in order to obtain a more diversified exposure to weather risks, a wider customer base and stronger financial and operational capabilities. 

The project is expected to improve the growth potential of the Company, and therefore have strong development impact, including: (i) increased access to insurance products (e.g., life, property, casualty, etc.) in underserved regions such as the Caribbean and Central America; (ii) increased competition as the potential of this market segment is further revealed; and (iii) produce demonstration effects through resulting regional business process innovation.

title: SEF Ceska Sporitelna
content: The following development benefits are expected: (i) Mobilize up to EUR47.5 million via the risk sharing facility; (ii) Increase access to finance for renewable energy projects, which will lead to a sizeable and measurable reduction in GHG emissions; (iii) Reduce the country's dependence on imports of fossil fuels and natural gas. (iv) Support development of local SMEs, increase the number of renewable energy clients and contribute to employment generation. (v) Directly support the government's strategy of promoting renewable energy. (vi) Create a replicable facility to be used in lower income European countries.

title: TIGO - Colombia Movil
content:
Affordability & Accessibility:  TIGO targets the mass market, and has driven the market in terms of tariff reductions, critical for improving penetration in a country where 49.2% of population is below the poverty line. 

Coverage: TIGO has contributed to a wider availability of mobile services in the country.  A portion of TIGO's capital expenditures is allocated to increasing geographical coverage, one of its disadvantages compared to Comcel and Movistar.  The Company's capital expenditure program aims to expand coverage to 95% of municipalities.  

Wireless broadband offering: TIGO is seeking associations with other important companies that might help to offer a more comprehensive product offering.  It recently joined UNE S.A. ESP to add postpaid mobile telephony to UNE S.A. ESP 's residential fixed line clients.  TIGO has also launched together with UNE S.A. ESP a very competitive wireless broadband product using its 3G network.

title: City Express II
content: The proposed project will have the following development impact: (i) increase in supply of competitive price-quality business hotels with consistent international quality and safety standards; (ii) creation of new employment both directly at the hotels and indirectly along the supply chain, temporary employment will also be provided to local labor during the construction phase; and (iii) the Project will generate supply linkages for local vendors serving the needs of both the hotel and its guests and will contribute to the development of the local economy.

title: Helios Towers Africa, Ltd.
content:
By contributing to the cost effective expansion of Africa's wireless telecommunications tower network, this project will:

(i)	Expand mobile telephony access: With the construction of additional tower sites, existing mobile operators will be able to expand the reach of their services both in terms of geography and capacity. In addition, collocation reduces the incremental cost of expanding service for all carriers thereby allowing them to service remote and economically less developed areas where ARPU and usage will be lower. 
(ii)	Increase competition: The presence of Helios Towers Africa will allow smaller and newer wireless operators to benefit from reduced barriers to entry as they will have access to leased tower facilities rather than having to build their own.
(iii)	Expand access to other ICT technologies:  Helios Towers Africa, through its subsidiaries, will be building a tower network that is capable of supporting not only mobile cellular networks, but also wireless broadband and backhaul networks, thereby improving the penetration of these technologies.
(iv)	Contribute to mitigating environmental impact and Climate Change: The underlying projects developed by the Company will provide a cost effective opportunity to telecommunication operators to reduce their carbon emission footprint by sharing infrastructure. A significant benefit of sharing tower infrastructure arises from the material, energy and emissions savings that ensue from building only one tower instead of three or four.

title: Elite
content:
(i) Support for Investments in IDA countries: IFC will play a role to support a local company pursue its strategic objective to develop a portfolio of real estate investment projects in Armenia and Georgia, both IDA countries, by providing long-term financing that is not currently readily available in the market.

(ii) Supporting Business-Enabling Infrastructure:  The Project will provide the first true Class-A office commerical building in Yerevan and contribute towards meeting the demand for Class-A commercial/office space in the country.

(iii)Increased Employment: The Project will create new employment, both directly and indirectly.  In addition, temporary employment will be provided to local labor during the construction phase.

(iv) Demonstration Effect: IFC's participation during the crisis will encourage other investors and financial institutions to also pursue other investment opportunities with viable companies in Armenia.

title: Tegucigalpa Risk Share
content: The proposed Project will help the Municipality improve traffic flows and strengthen maintenance management practices, contributing to lower vehicle operating costs. In addition it will help the Municipality conserve valuable road network assets along the 280 km main road network.  The Project is also expected to improve the term structure of the Municipality's debt to better match the expected benefit stream from its investments.

title: Atul II
content: This investment is expected to have the following development impacts. It will help strengthen and expand the operations of a mid-tier company to enable it to become internationally competitive and help the Company's efforts to reduce water conservation. The Company is also expected to step up its social contributions in local communities and also actively maintain and increase more than one million trees planted in its campus.

title: Muyuan Pig
content:
Corporate Development:  The proposed investment will support the continued expansion of a small, private pig farming company in a frontier region to become a competitive, quality conscious national player - which will ultimately be publicly owned.  

The Project will benefit, as highlighted below, one of the poorest areas in Henan province (Neixiang County) which has a GDP per capita of $1150, only half the average GDP of the province.  

Employment:  The Company will provide stable employment opportunities for around 1000 staff, including 300 female employees.  The Project will create 300 new jobs, of which 100 would be for female employees.

Farmers Reached:  Currently, about 24,000 rural households supply raw materials directly and indirectly, through aggregators/traders, to the Company.  The additional capacity will allow the Company to expand this reach further by either increased sourcing from its existing supply base and/or expanding the supply base.  
 
SMEs reached:  Muyuan sells its breeder pigs to about 1,200 rural pig farms, which in turn grow the piglets to produce commercial hogs for sale.  In addition, the Company uses over 100 small, rural contractors for its raw material sourcing and logistic services.

title: IFC/SCB Facility
content:
The project is designed to have a development impact in terms of:

Reducing Supply Interruptions:  Improving access to trade finance is designed to help the BDCs import product on a regular basis, alleviating the occurrence of petroleum product shortages in Ghana; 

Private Sector Development: The facility is designed have a role in supporting independent private sector players.; and

Supplementing Existing Facilities:  The project supplements the facilities offered by local banks and IFC's GTFP program by providing additional cost effective trade financing solutions in the Ghanaian market and helping increase the overall trade finance flows to the country.

IFC proposes to monitor the following key development impacts during the life of IFC<e2>?s investment:

-	The volume of petroleum products imported in Ghana through the use of this facility
-	The number of BDCs using this facility
-	The total storage infrastructure established by the BDCs in Ghana in terms of capacity

title: Locko A+B (EE)
content: Through this project IFC would contribute to fighting the climate change in Russia by jumpstarting the EE lending program of one of visible SME lenders. IFC's A loan along will enable the Bank to provide energy efficiency loans to its clients. Reduction in energy cost will increase the competitiveness of the Bank's clients which would support sustainable economic growth. It is expected that the Project will result in significant developmental impact through saving of primary energy, reduction in annual energy costs and reduction in GHG emissions during the subprojects' lifetime.

title: YKL Health. EE/RE
content:
There are two main areas of expected developmental impact:
(i) IFC would help one of the leading leasing companies to increase its exposure to healthcare sector of the economy in Turkey. This would further have a demonstration impact for other financial intermediaries to start looking into health sector. Indicator would be number and volume of health sector loans made by YKL during the life of the loan.
(ii) The project is also expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of the sustainable energy finance and stream of Energy efficiency project investments in Turkey.

title: MLA - Bond
content:
The proposed project is expected to have a high development impact in the following areas:  

Access to finance for SMEs: The project will provide SMEs with increased access to finance, many for the first time in the formal financial sector. 

Increased private sector competition in the financial sector: The project is expected to promote growth and increase competition in the financial sector as the leasing industry grows and brings new players and instruments into the market.

Transfer of leasing know-how and best practice: The project will reinforce the transfer of new technologies and know-how in leasing activities. Tunisie Leasing, which has established a strong franchise in Tunisia has brought to bear its management, operational and technological expertise to this project

title: TRP Expansion
content:
The Project is expected to deliver development impact by:
(i) allowing the influx of passengers that will generate tourism revenues for the city of Buenos Aires, supporting local small businesses serving the tourist market, therefore helping Buenos Aires's tourism industry and city's long-term economic growth.
(ii) reducing congestion in the Port of Buenos Aires by increasing berth availability; thereby benefitting shippers, shipping lines and consumers;
(iii) yielding higher concession revenues to Argentina; and 
(iv) creating jobs in a country still challenged by unemployment.

title: DeNovo Corporation
content:
Some of the development impacts are highlighted below:

Improving IT infrastructure in Ukraine: Currently, there are no certified Tier III datacenters in Ukraine or data centers that fully meet the requirements of the National Bank of Ukraine.  DeNovo would provide a service level that fully meets the requirements of financial institutions and auditors.
Increase in capacity: Though there are more than a dozen data center services providers in Ukraine, the IT services market in Ukraine is underdeveloped and demonstrates a strong capacity on the demand side.
Reduced climate change impact: DeNovo data center will be established using a "green" computing concept, i.e. implementation of energy-efficient computers, network servers and peripherals, as well as "free air cooling" technologies.  The data center will install state-of-the-art special software based power management systems to optimize power usage.  The power saving potential is up to 30%.
Banking sector development: DeNovo will provide the local banking sector with access to high quality computing capacity with guaranteed up-time, power outage protection, operational data security, and communications redundancy. Outsourcing of data center services would allow Ukrainian customers to reduce Capex and operational costs, to free up cash to invest in the core business.
Employment generation: Up to 30 new high-income jobs will be created due to the project implementation.
Skills Training: DeNovo specialists will be able to get first-hand experience in operating Tier III datacenter which is now unavailable in the local IT market.

title: Lok II
content: The proposed investment is expected to have the following development impact: i) increase access to finance by reaching low-income families through MFIs, ii) provide goods and services to low-income families by investing in companies that serve the BoP, iii) build institutional capacity through technical assistance, and iv) support the growth of the microfinance sector.

title: MPICO Malls Limited
Mongolia Opportunities Fund I, L.P.
content: The Fund is expected to deliver strong development impact through (i) supporting undercapitalized SMEs in Mongolia; (ii) demonstrating successful private equity investing in Mongolia, a priority IDA country, (iii) building confidence amongst institutional investors to invest in Mongolia; and (iv) mobilizing co-investment from strategic international investors.

title: Global Warehouse Finance Program
content: The Program is expected to have a very high development impact in four critical areas: (i)	The Program will increase access to finance for banks to assist the agriculture sector which is an important driving force of the economy, i.e. in IDA countries.  The Program will promote the commodity backed lending skills among local banks and avail more working capital to farmers to finance their harvest inventory management;(ii)	The Program will contribute significantly to private sector development of the local banks lending to the agriculture sector and job creation by supporting farmers side of the agricultural value chain;(iii)	The Program will also enable IFC to identify other investment opportunities such as supply chain financing and financing of warehouses; and(iv)	In the countries where IFC will facilitate the Advisory Services to establish the WHR system, IFC can play a catalytic role to infrastructure the investment climate for an efficient and transparent agriculture market system.

title: WEG Industries (India) Pvt. Ltd.
content:
Improved Product Availability and Quality.  
The Indian market is undersupplied with locally-manufactured, high voltage motors and generators that are state-of-the-art technologically.  The importance of manufacturing this equipment locally derives not only from transportation cost savings but also because this equipment is built-to-order to very detailed specifications, bringing to the client benefits from the ease and accuracy of information exchange with a local manufacturing facility and improved delivery times. 

Infrastructure Development.  
Infrastructure, including power generation is a bottleneck to economic development in India.  WEG will increase its capacity to sell turbines for small-scale, run-of-the-river generation projects that tend to serve areas that are off-grid.  Further, another important segment which requires high voltage motors are the producers of basic infrastructure building blocks: cement and steel  plants.  WEG also is building on its track record in India of supplying motors for the pumping stations that make up important, government-sponsored irrigation projects.

Employment.  
The Project will generate at least 250 direct jobs and is estimated to generate a multiple of this in the supply chain of WII and contractors for corporate and industrial services including maintenance, security, transportation providers, etc.

title: Lafarge Iraq
content: The development impact of the project is expected to include: (i) increased supply of cement to meet Iraq's needs for reconstruction; (ii) substitution of imports from neighboring countries, which will help stabilize prices in the sector; (iii) modernization and standard-setting in the sector, in which Lafarge is currently the only private sector player, and all other plants are state-owned, many of which are small and in poor condition; (iv) demonstration effect on other potential foreign investors who could help bring much-needed FDI into Iraq; (v) job creation; and (vi) tax revenues for the Government of Iraq.

title: TIBA
content:
Outsourcing: TIBA is performing in Argentina services that are otherwise carried out in-house (mainly in the US) by Tier 1 content providers (i.e., Disney, Fox, ESPN, etc.). By outsourcing, the industry achieves efficiency, as broadcasters concentrate in their core business of producing content, while players like TIBA specialize and bring higher service quality to critical parts of the value added chain.  

Position Buenos Aires as a LAC media and entertainment center: Over the last few years, Tier 1 broadcasters have relocated Spanish-speaking support and creative resources to Argentina, lured by low/medium salary levels for an otherwise highly creative HR pool. 

Targeted advertisement: By providing efficiences (i.e., in spectrum usage, in compression, in content management, etc.), TIBA allows its customers to open new feeds of the same channels.  This permits the streaming of more relevant and dedicated content and advertising to local audiences throughout LAC.

Non-traditional, high-value added export: Over 90% of TIBA's revenues consist of export of services, thus increasing fiscal revenues and hard currency generation for the country.

Increased delivery of content: Virtuous cycle, whereby more content drives new distribution channels and services, which create more demand and larger audiences. This improves cost structures and economies of scale, which provides better access to affordable relevant information.

Employment: TIBA contributes to increasing the employment of technical skilled labor.  The Company is seen as cutting edge in LAC's broadcasting industry.  For many technicians, TIBA is their first job, thanks to agreements with Engineering universities.

title: Braeburn
content: The Project will increase availability of high quality education in Kenya and Tanzania.  Through the introduction of Braeside Sixth Form College, it will make a contribution to broadening the course availability of technical and vocational training, which is limited in Kenya.  The Company's continued emphasis placed on teacher training and professional staff development, including the partnership with Kenyatta University on specially designed B.Phil.Ed and M.Phil.Ed courses, will help to increase the availability of high qualified teaching staff in Kenya and Tanzania.  The project will create both direct and indirect job opportunities, particularly as management expects to use local staff and local materials in Braeburn's in-house workshops in fitting out new schools.  Finally, as Braeburn continues to improve quality standards and works to obtain international accreditation, it can serve as an example to other private education institutions in East Africa.

title: Guaranty Trust Bank, Plc. - V
content:
Stamp of approval: IFC's involvement in the Project demonstrates its commitment to the Nigerian banking sector during adverse market conditions and validates the long-term viability of a systemically important bank. This stamp of approval should facilitate future fund-raising efforts that might be undertaken by well-run banks in Nigeria.

Access to scarce dollar long-term financing:  Given the difficult global market conditions, IFC is probably one of the very few sources of long-term funding of such magnitude available to the banking sector in Nigeria.  

Knowledge sharing: IFC's ability to engage strategically with the Bank and provide support to further enhance the Bank's implementation of a social and environmental management system.

title: AmKonzen Asia Water Fund, LLC
content: The project is expected to have significant positive impact by (i) providing access to water to the areas where clean water is scarce, (ii) providing better waste water management, (iii) enabling more sustainable industrial process and (iv) creating employment through water works

title: Apollo - III
content: The  greenfield project will result in the creation of about 1,500 skilled and semi-skilled direct, permanent jobs and an additional 2,000 jobs during the construction phase. The Project will also result in establishment and development of new Small & Medium Enterprise (SMEs) in the supply chain.

title: Crane
content: In addition to the demonstration effects there are a host of quantifiable benefits to resort staff, suppliers, customers, and the destination that are associated with leveraging high quality management and facilities.

title: Applied Solar
content: The Project will have strong development impact by way of development of off-grid renewable energy through solar power. It will contribute to climate change mitigation by reduced use of diesel fuel which has detrimental environmental effects. Further, the Project will result in employment opportunities during both implementation and operations in remote areas. It will also contribute to government revenues by way of taxes and reduced use of subsidized diesel fuel.

title: SocGen CEE IFI
content: The Development Impact is expected to be strong in terms of (i) strengthening and, in certain cases, recapitalizing financial institutions in Cental and Eastern Europe and (ii) supporting agribusiness, climate-related projects and SMEs, sectors in which SocGen subisidiaries have a good presence in the targeted markets.

title: Clean Resources Asia Growth Fund, L.P.
content:
The impact of providing equity financing to companies in the business of technology transfer in the clean technology space is significant.  It includes but is not limited to the following:
(i)	Improvement in clean energy technology in Asia, leading to reduced GHG emissions
(ii)	Adoption of more sustainable practices
(iii)	Dissemination of low cost technologies to developing markets
(iv)	Creation of employment in urban and rural areas

title: YellowPepper
content:
The anticipated development impacts of the Project are:

1)	Access to financial services to unbanked:  The project will help improve access to basic financial (payment) services for un-banked segments of the population, as YP's model allows for simple and secure access to financial services to such segments using the mobile platform. 

2)	Increased business volume for MSMEs: MSMEs, who typically do not have the ability to accept electronic payments, will benefit from a simple and secure electronic payment method, increasing merchants current competitiveness vis a vis larger stores. This could also help MSME's market their products to a broader geographic range of consumers since payments can be received electronically. 

3)	Promote connectivity: Mobile payment platforms such as YP's end up fueling the demand for better mobile connectivity among individuals and MSMEs.  In turn, telecoms and broadband connectivity fuels the flow and exchange of ideas and innovation, directly leading to increased productivity.  Connectivity and e-business in general are critical for helping LAC bridge the digital divide with more advanced regions.

title: Solida RE
content:
Key development impacts of the Project include:

 - Increased Housing Supply for Low-Income Households:  This Project is expected to alleviate the current housing deficit in Mexico, including in a few frontier states and benefit over 100,000 families in the low to middle income segments with increased supply of quality and affordable entry level housing.  

- Community Development: The housing developments built by the homebuilders financed by Solida and IFC will contribute to urban infrastructure development and surrounding community development.  In addition, the Project helps support the urbanization efforts of local governments, as the housing projects include partial infrastructure works.  

- Job Creation and Financial Security:  The Project will create job opportunities both during construction and operation of the housing communities. Increased supply of low-cost housing developed by the Company will make an impact on the lives of the low income purchasers who will improve their personal security and through payment of their mortgage build up equity (often for the first time) in a significant asset.  
 
- Enhanced Local Supply Linkages: The Project will increase demand for construction and building materials in the country. Once the construction is completed, the housing units will stimulate the use of local supplies of goods and services, supporting maintenance, retailing and wholesale operations.  Moreover, the low income properties financed by the Project are often the buyers' first property title and such property rights are considered a key determinant of economic development as they promote the formal economy.

title: ALD Automotive Ukraine
content: The Development Impact is expected to be strong in terms of (i) instill confidence in Ukrainian leasing sector via providing long-term funding to the leasing company in Ukraine and (ii) enable the Company to expand its client network.

title: Rede D'Or
content: The project will have significant development impact by: i) demonstrating best practices throughout the medical community; ii) increasing access to high quality medical care; and (iii) and acting as a catalyst for the rationalization of the private health sector in Brazil.

title: Kordsa Global-multi country
content:
The Project will have significant development impacts:
IFC's investments in Kordsa Brasil and Kordsa Argentina will benefit the manufacturing cluster in both countries, and particularly in the case of Brazil, in a frontier region of the country, where employment opportunities are limited.
Employment preservation: By strengthening the capital structure of the companies, IFC's investment will help retain jobs and assist the companies emerge from the crisis as more viable entities.
Continued know-how and technology transfer: Given the Sponsor's focus on product innovation and its ability to meet stringent quality standards, the Project is expected to result in continued technology and know-how transfer to the subsidiaries in terms of manufacturing and quality processes.

title: Aubaine Graphic SA Printing Chad
content: IFC investment would help support the growth of a local sponsor, increase the competition in the local printing industry and substitute imported products with locally manufactured products. The investment will highlight IFC support to private sector development, especially in Chad. The Project will also generate employment estimated at 77 positions and provide quality education material to local schools at competitive cost.

title: TCB Syndication
content: High, on account of:-	Strong signal to the market as this project marks the return of a 2nd tier private bank to the syndicated loan market-	Strengthen TCBs capital structure and its ability to support its existing and future SME and trade finance clients-	The project would have a strong demonstration effect as it would help international lenders restore back confidence in the Russian banking sector.

title: Metito II
content: Metito's activities in the MENA region and China help to extend water and wastewater treatment services to key income and employment generating sectors in the region's economy, such as the tourism sector in Egypt, the ports sector in Indonesia and the rapidly growing Chinese market. Metito's focus in the MENA region and China is targeting some of the most water-deprived areas in the world with low-cost water and wastewater treatment solutions to help support economic growth. Metito is also demonstrating the ability of the private sector to operate successfully in the water and sanitation sector in the MENA region and China, which is crucial to sustainable development, and increasing competition in the sector so that other investors might be induced to follow suit.

title: FCMB II
content: Stamp of approval and support of Nigerian banking sector: IFC involvement in the Project demonstrates (i) commitment to the banking sector of Nigeria at times of adverse market conditions and validates the long-term viability of a strong tier II bank; and, (ii) Providing and mobilizing scarce long-term funding under the current market conditions; and (iii) Provision of an integrated advisory program that will assist the Bank in the areas of corporate governance with particular focus on risk management.

title: Gorenje
content: The IFC investment will help Gorenje continue its longstanding leadership, by helping it expand, modernize, and restructure its operations following the economic crisis. The investment will result in better product competitiveness through improved energy efficiency and innovation, enhanced high end product range,  improved labor productivity  and  job creation in South-East region. The Group's investment program will allow the transfer of first-class production methods and manufacturing practices including the development of local industry through linkages with network of local suppliers. The capital increase associated with the Project will reduce the government's influence and strengthen market-oriented behaviors. Moreover, the IFC investment will support the Group's growing focus on ecology and offer comprehensive waste management solution to regional clients.

title: IDFC Climate Change Loan
content:
The expected Development Impact of the Project is as follows:

Institution building: This project will help IDFC scale up its capacity to assess renewable energy/ energy efficiency projects through sharing of IFC's experience and knowledge of these sectors worldwide. 

Wider impact: Through the proposed facility, IDFC and IFC will be able to leverage each other's strengths, IDFC's client reach in the local market and IFC's expertise in climate change projects, to achieve a wider scale and impact on climate change investments in India.

Demonstration effect: Expansion into climate change areas by a leading financial intermediary like IDFC is expected to help attract other financial institutions to increase their risk appetite and invest more in these sectors.

title: Project Name Pending
content: (i) Reduction of CO2 and other GHGs: The Fund will invest in renewable energy and clean technology projects contributing to a reduction in carbon emissions; and (ii) Demonstration Effects: The Project will strengthen investees both from a financial and governance perspective and help them scale up their operations thus making them attractive targets for investment and acquisition. It would demonstrate the business case for clean technology projects and encourage private investors to invest in this sector.

title: WCAP A Loan
Cernavoda and Pestera Wind Farms
content:
Demonstration Effect.  The successful commercial financing of the Cernavoda and Pestera wind farms, which together would install 228 MW of wind capacity, will send a strong signal to commercial lenders that the Romanian wind market, which is supported by the Renewable Energy Law 220/2008  and associated secondary legislation, presents attractive opportunities for renewable energy investors.  

Decreased Carbon Emissions:  The Project will displace fossil-fuel generation.  This will help reduce local air pollutants (SOx and NOx) and improve air quality for the local population.  It will also contribute to Romania's climate change abatement efforts and help the country meet its renewable energy generation targets for 2020.

title: Advans CI
content:
The main development impacts are twofold: 
(i) Demonstration effect: consistent with IFC's strategy to set-up greenfield institutions in frontier markets, supporting the first commercial microfinance institution in Ivory Coast presents an excellent opportunity to develop the sector and attract new entrants. 
(ii) Access to finance for underserved segments: over the next five years, the project will provide over EUR 120 million of financing by 2014 year-end through approximately 90,000 loans. As newer financial products are introduced (savings, micro-insurance, domestic and international transfers, mobile banking, etc), more than solely credit needs of the clients will be serviced. Additionally, the geographical spread is expected to widen as Advans Ivory Coast expands to other urban areas, smaller towns and provincial capitals.

title: Linea Clave
content: The proposed investment is expected to have the following developmental impacts: (i) help diversify the Dominican Republic's energy matrix and reduce its dependence on oil-based energy; (ii) reduce industrials' manufacturing costs by utilizing less expensive sources of energy, increasing their ability to compete globally; (iii) reduce the overall polluting emissions of the industrial/power sector by using clean energy; (iv) support the development of a potential regional player in the natural gas sector; (v) set environmental and performance guidelines thus establishing a benchmark for a sector that is currently under development; and (vi)<U+00A0>support the introduction of new technology for LNG distribution and the development of the regulatory environment.

title: AB Bank Zambia Limited
content: The project will have a high development impact considering that microfinance has been shown to play a major positive role in reducing poverty and unemployment in developing countries.  The initiative will strengthen the provision of microfinance services in Zambia, where access to finance is limited for low income populations.  By creating a new institution able to sustain microfinance on commercial terms and following best practices, the project has the potential to generate a substantial increase in the long term availability of financial services for the poor.  The project will also show local banks that sound microfinance can be sustainable and generate attractive returns.  As a consequence, it is expected that the interest of local banks in the micro enterprise and SME sector will be strengthened.

title: MHP Ukraine
content:
The primary beneficiaries of the project will be its financiers (through higher incomes).  There are specific developmental impacts associated with the investment which are summarized below:

SME Development: MHP supports a network of 2,256 entrepreneur franchise SMEs that sell the Company's products.  Most of these SME are owned and operated by women, often in underserved rural locations, so these enterprises have a significant economic presence. Under the terms of the franchising agreement, the Company provides basic training for the franchisees, a consistent supply of poultry products as well as advertising and promotional support. 

Employment:  The Company currently employs 20,579 workers in total, 8,535 of which are female.  As a result of the investment program employment is expected to increase by an additional 7,000 workers.  

Environmental and Social Standards: As part of the MHP's previous investments with IFC, it undertook extensive efforts to meet terms of the previous Environmental and Social Action Plan (ESAP).  The Company has continued to grow rapidly and needs to formalize its Environment and Social Monitoring System (ESMS) to meet the needs of a larger, more extensive enterprise.

title: BSP Debt and Equity Financing
Green for Growth Fund
content: The project is expected to have a significant developmental impact in promoting energy efficiency and renewable energy and expanding lending to households, small and medium enterprises including ESCOs, municipalities and public sector entities in Southeast Europe and Turkey. Among key developmental impacts can be listed: Broadening access to sustainable energy finance: The project will increase the availability, and therefore access to sustainable energy finance in the region, it will help to create new banking products that allow actors to make energy efficiency investments that will contribute to reduced local pollution, reduced energy bills, increased energy security and it will support climate change mitigation. Demonstration effects of improved energy efficiency among sub-borrowers: The Project will demonstrate the benefits of energy conservation and promote the expansion of energy efficiency and renewable energy lending in the energy inefficient Western Balkan economies and Turkey. The project is also expected to transfer and build additional expertise related to sustainable energy investment among banks, particularly in the area of assessing the risk and creditworthiness of clients for energy efficiency loans.

title: Tulu Kapi Gold Project
content: Although Ethiopia has considerable mineral resources, the mining sectors contribution to the countrys GDP is still small. The Government of Ethiopia has made the development of its mineral resources an important strategic priority in order to diversify its economy, grow its sources of foreign currency (reducing its dependence on coffee exports) and attract foreign direct investment.  A successful exploration program by Nyota would have notable demonstration effect and help establish mining as an attractive sector for private investors, promoting sustainable resource development and economic growth through infrastructure development and employment generation. The Project is in an early exploration phase so its developmental impacts are limited in scope at this stage. The key impacts of the project that IFC will monitor include: (i) finalization of drilling program, completion of the scoping study and acquisition of a mining license; (ii) number of local employees; and (iii) completion of Social and Environmental Impact Assessment (SEIA).Should the project move to a fully operating mine, it promises to generate notable, additional developmental benefits both for the country as a whole and particularly for the area around the mine, which is located in an underdeveloped part of the country.

title: Globino
content: The project is expected to have the following development impacts: i) increased employment of approximately 600 new employees; ii) increased purchases of raw materials from local small and medium enterprises; and iii) benefit to consumers from lower prices and a higher standard of food safety.

title: TCE Ege Konteyner Terminal Isletmeleri A.S.
content: The Project is expected to deliver considerable development impact by (i) contributing to the growth of trade and economy in a region that is important for the Turkish economy by expanding container handling capacity immediately in the Aegean region; (ii) reducing the costs of transportation, thereby benefitting shippers, shipping lines and consumers and (iii) increasing competition in the market and encouraging other terminal operators in Turkey to improve the efficiency of their own terminal facilities, thereby spurring increased trade in the region.

title: Aavishkaar Goodwell India Microfinance Development Company II
content: Aavishkhaar Goodwell II will have the following development contributions: i) increase access to finance for low-income families in rural areas and low-income states, ii) provide support to a local emerging fund manager expand its reach into new geographies, iii) develop commercial proof of concept for MFI funds model, and iv) through the Fund, invest in growth companies that are expected to create economic benefits and employment opportunities for the community.

title: West Africa Venture Fund PCC
content: By investing in WAVF the following developmental impact could be expected: Poverty alleviation, employment generation and regional stability: WAVF by providing funding and business support to more than 100 SMEs presents a unique opportunity to catalyze the growth of small businesses, employment and wealth creation;Private sector and local economic development: WAFV provides a model for sustainable private sector development in post war economies, by growing SMEs which otherwise would not receive financing and advisory services;Food production, health and educational development: WAVFs allocation of 30% of its investments to the agribusiness sector and 5% each to ICT, health and educational sectors will help to develop these key private sectors;WAVFs focus on the Sub Saharan Africa post conflict countries of Liberia and Sierra Leone and SME Funds will ensure a maximum positive impact in countries/asset class where it is most needed.

title: Husk Power
content: The Project has a strong development impact in terms of impacting real 'bottom of pyramid' households and commercial establishments through affordable electricity supply apart from employment generation and environmental benefits. Rural electrification is in an 'acute crisis' as more than 125,000 Indian villages are presently un-electrified. The Indian government has designated several thousand villages as 'economically impossible' to reach via conventional means. Further, current power options (kerosene lanterns, diesel generators) are uneconomical, inefficient and wreak enormous environmental havoc. Without electricity, these villagers are forced to live at the whim of natural forces and lack basic communication, education and healthcare infrastructure. HPS has identified 25,000 villages as feasible sites within India's rice producing area (Bihar and neighboring states) for its projects.

title: Agri-Vie
content: The Fund will contribute to the economic development of the Region by helping to provide scarce development capital that is not likely to be satisfied by the Region's debt and equity capital markets. The management team expects to take an active role with its portfolio companies to ensure that they have sufficient resources to pursue their growth strategies, strengthen its corporate governance, and achieve operational, financial and costs improvements. The growth and success of these companies, in turn, will have a positive impact on food production, exports, job creation and formalization, increased employee benefit coverage, development of employee skills, transfer of knowledge and consumers in the Region.

title: Trada Maritime
content:
Develop Local Skills and Job Creation: IFC's contribution to Trada will help develop local skills and provide increased opportunities for Indonesians in the nascent domestic market. Trada is the leading developer of FSO and has strong focus on the domestic market. Trada is to provide a local crew of up to 40 personnel (the charter will be able to accommodate up to 280).

Smooth Transition for Reform to Reduce Leakages from the Economy: IFC's assistance will support the series of government reforms to inhibit transfer pricing which has become widespread, by allowing a smooth transition for Indonesia's shipping and related sector to undergo these reforms. The government has already set low taxes for Indonesian flag-vessels to encourage ship-owners to register their vessels in Indonesia; the new law makes local registration for intra-Indonesia cargo mandatory.

title: Kuwait Energy II
content:
The project will lead to further exploration, appraisal and development of domestic natural resources in Egypt, Yemen and Ukraine, helping to meet domestic demand for oil and gas and curbing production declines particularly in Yemen and Egypt.   Revenues to governments, particularly in the case of Yemen and Egypt, provide the countries resources to promote macro-economic stability and support development priorities.

The Project's expected benefits will come in the form of:

1. Increased domestic gas supply in Ukraine: The Project will help to increase domestic gas supply and contribute to relieve reliance on imported gas. In addition, success of KEC in Ukraine may encourage other private companies to invest in Ukraine's gas sector. 

2. Contribution to Government Revenues: the Project benefits to the governments of Egypt, Yemen and Ukraine include revenues in the form of production share, royalties and corporate taxes.  In 2009, the Government of Egypt's fiscal take from KEC's operations in Egypt was US$68 million, the Government of Yemen's take was US$11 million and the Government of Ukraine's take was about US$2 million. 

3. Employment, development of local skills, technology transfer: The Project will help to sustain employment and, in particular, develop local skills. KEC's direct local employment in Egypt, Yemen and Ukraine is expected to continue to increase as KEC further expands its operation.  Training of local people and technology transfer are especially important in Ukraine due to the lack of private investment in the gas sector in the country and the restriction on expatriates working in the country.  
  
4. Supporting the development of local independent E&P sector in Middle East and North Africa: The E&P sector in MENA has traditionally been dominated by large state-owned oil companies or western oil and gas companies. KEC is one of the first significant attempts by the local private sector to participate in this industry. KEC's ability to grow into a company on par with other mid-size international E&P companies will have a demonstration effect to encourage other such private sector initiatives.

IFC plans to monitor the following indicators during supervision: (i) annual production of gas in Ukraine (mcf); (ii) payments to governments (US$); (iii) number of direct employees in portfolio countries; (iv) community development outlays (US$); (v) purchase of domestic goods and services (US$).

title: Cholamandalam DBS Finance Limited
content:
Sustained access to road transport infrastructure finance: Chola is focused on smaller CV financing to small road transport operators to first time users which provide the last mile connectivity, a critical logistic link in the transport infrastructure chain.  Supporting Chola will ensure continued access by a substantial franchise of more than 150,000 small operators for CV finance. 

Increased access to finance to the MSME segment: Chola's growth focus will continue to remain in rural areas serving the financially underserved population.  The Company plans to penetrate deeper into the rural areas, by financing CVs and through loan against property and expects to increase its outreach to more than 500,000 customers in 3 years.   

Demonstration effect through consolidation of large NBFC: The proposed project will help the company to restructure its capital and consolidate its position. IFCs investment will further strengthen the Company's consolidation efforts and have a demonstration effect in the NBFC sector.

title: AkEnerji
content: The Project's development impact is as follows: (i) creating 160MW additional renewable energy for the country; (ii) supporting power sector reform by increasing the share of private generation in Turkey's overall electricity generation in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation of a regional energy market; and (iii) leveraging IFC's experience in financing generation projects in deregulated markets. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Turkey.

title: Kribi
Vodafone Ghana
content:
i) Expand access. This Project will increase the availability of reliable and affordable telecommunications services for consumers and businesses in Ghana.  Ghana's teledensity, at 54%, indicates that there is potential for further growth in the market. The lack of teledensity is pronounced in semi-urban and rural areas, where it is less than 10%. This project will enable Vodafone Ghana to upgrade technology, increase capacity, and improve coverage, giving more consumers and businesses access to reliable and affordable telecommunications services.  Furthermore, Vodafone Ghana will be expanding what constitutes the largest fiber optic network in Ghana in order to expand its broadband service capabilities in a country with a low broadband penetration rate (~ 4%).  

ii) Spur Competition. The Project will enhance competition in the sector, leading existing telecommunication operators to: (i) invest further in their networks, thereby increasing availability and improving the quality of telecommunication services; and (ii) lower tariffs.

iii) Product and service innovation.  Vodafone Ghana's relationship with Vodafone Group is resulting in several benefits, including knowledge transfer for product and service innovation.  The Project will enable Vodafone Ghana to further improve the quality and variety of services offered as its upgraded network will utilize state-of-the-art mobile technologies to provide value added services and to enable multimedia and data applications.

title: OTO Loan II
content:
The proposed Project is expected to have Development Impacts in the following areas:

1. Deepening the NBFI sector
Indonesia financial sector is still heavily dominated by banks, which accounts for 80% of the financial sector assets. Indonesia needs to develop Non-Banking Financial Institution (NBFI) sector, which can efficiently provide financing to consumers and SMEs through its ability to lower operational costs and deal with much smaller customers than banks would like to do. Additionally, NBFI can provide healthy competition to banks which eventually foster the development of financial sector even further. The proposed Project will provide OTO with adequate long-term fix rate financial resources for its growth. IFC support will help OTO develop its own funding sources, build the ability to compete with the banking system on an ongoing basis, and provide efficient, competitive financing to consumers.

2. Increasing access to motorcycle financing for low income households
OTO customers are mostly low income households who do not have bank accounts. IFC financial support to OTO will help OTO expand its portfolio and networks to more frontier provinces, and hence increase access to finance to low income households for acquiring personal transportation which is important to their business needs and mobility. 

3. Strengthening the micro and small business sectors
Motorcycle is an efficient mode of transportation to deliver goods and services. Hence, a large number of motorcycles owners use their motorcycles as part of their SME/ micro businesses. The proposed Project will facilitate the increase of motorcycles financing available to SME/ micro businesses which is necessary to expand their operations.

title: El Shorouk (Motaheda)
content:
The Project is expected to have the following key developmental impacts:

Employment Generation:  The Project will help create 200 direct jobs in manufacturing, and at least as many indirect jobs throughout the wastepaper collection supply chain;
Waste Paper Recycling & Positive Impact on Environment:  The Project will improve the paper recovery rates in Egypt, where they remain at historically low levels. An organized wastepaper collection system that will be established to provide the main raw material to the Project could have a transformational impact in this field.  
Import Substitution:  At present, around 75% of Egypt's duplex board is imported.  The Project will lead to increased supply of the locally-produced good quality packaging products, as the Project output is destined predominantly for domestic consumption.
Positive Impact on Consumer Goods Industries:  Increased availability of high-quality packaging materials at competitive prices will have a positive impact on the domestic and regional consumer goods companies, helping them increase their sales, working capital management and profitability.

title: Zambeef Products PLC
content: (i) Creation of jobs;(ii) Increase food supply;(iii) Improvement in local farmers'' incomes through the purchase of young calves as well as technical assistance;(iv) Development of an efficient integrated meat supply chain; and(v) Improvement in quality standard of meat available to retail.

title: IFC RBC Venture
content: The RBC Venture is expected to deliver strong development impact via two key areas:  a) providing critically needed equity/equity-related funding to improve and stabilize the capital base of the second-tier of Russian banks, thereby speeding up recovery and job creation in the overall economy, specifically in the less financially accessible Russian regions as they emerge from the on-going crisis; and, b) expected "demonstration effect" as the investment potential of second-tier and regional Russian banks is highlighted and thereby catalyzing further private-sector investments into an undervalued future growth area for the Russian economy.

title: Emerging Capital Partners III, L.P.
content: Supplemented by IFC's and other investors' commitments, ECP will have the resources in place to immediately deploy capital across Africa in a manner which will allow companies with proven track records to strengthen their competitive positions, provide jobs through growth and improve corporate governance.   Taking ECP Africa Fund II as an example, 93% of the portfolio companies achieved sales growth in 2008. For the same period, these companies paid a total of about $166 million in taxes and retained close to 28,000 employees, of which about 25% were females. On average, about 90% of the employees were Africans and also served in positions ranging from management teams to board of directors.

title: Zain-Iraq
Daycoval Mobiliz
content: Daycoval has expertise in credit operations secured by collateral, particularly involving SME borrowers.  The two major development impacts embedded in this project are: (i) making additional credit resources available to the underserved SME segment, and (ii) helping maintain a competitive environment in the concentrated Brazilian banking sector.

title: Bakhresa II
content: The proposed projects will have the following impacts:(i) local production of flour, substituting for flour imports with consequent impact on value added, service to local bakeries, employment, SME reach and contributions to government revenues through increased income taxes; (ii) Improved logistics, via rail and road.

title: Agrotec S.A.
content:
IFC's involvement in this project is expected to have a strong developmental impact as it will:

-  Increase farmers' access to pre-harvest financing,
- Contribute to rural economic development while reaching the BOP in rural areas,
- Contribute to the development of agri services and supply chain sector in Paraguay, and
- Support the dissemination of agricultural best practices and inputs to farmers (Agrotec provides technical assistance to farmers to improve productivity through improving yields and profitability).

title: Universal II
content:
Facilitating the development of the tourism industry in the Seychelles: Because of the similarities in geography and infrastructural limitations between the Maldives and the Seychelles, Universal was one of two Maldivian hospitality companies approached by the Seychelles Ministry of Tourism to help develop the Seychelles' tourism industry, which was virtually non-existent before 2006. Despite having been present in the Seychelles for less than three years, Universal has contributed significantly to the local economy by providing employment opportunities, establishing a clinic and a school, by building required infrastructure (e.g. a jetty) and by providing free transport for the island's locals to Mah<e9>, the capital.

Environmental support: IFC's biodiversity and environmental specialists, together with external consultants, are working with Labriz to ensure that the resorts' operations have minimal impact on the biodiversity of the island and the resort's surrounding environment.

title: China WindPower
BioCarbon
content:
Climate change mitigation and adaptation is one of the World Bank Group's strategic priorities. IFC has identified the forest sector as one of the key pillars of its climate change mitigation strategy. The following outlines the key development impacts of the proposed transaction.

The Project will directly help in climate change mitigation through avoided deforestation of mainly tropical rainforests in several countries where these forests are seriously threatened.
The Project will result in intervention in sites where there is a significant threat of biodiversity loss.
The Project will provide for direct benefit sharing with local communities and local governments as well as development of alternative livelihood strategies for the local communities.
The Project would support one of the early private sector initiatives for conservation of forests and is likely to have a demonstration impact that could catalyze large amounts of private capital in this sector.
Finally, the Project is expected to demonstrate the viability of AD projects and serve as a test case for advancing the discussions on the adoption of an international Reduced Emissions from Deforestation  and Degradation (REDD) framework.

title: PCH Stand-By
content:
Significant Direct Contribution to Poverty Reduction: IFC's proposed project will support PCH's liquidity management across its 21 bank network. In turn, this will help stabilize the network banks' operations in providing financial services to MSMEs in a time of financial stress. Supporting productive small businesses will in turn stimulate growth, employment generation and poverty reduction (ProCredit banks currently provide access to financial services to nearly 1 million MSMEs).
 Scaling Up Microfinance: By supporting an institution sponsored by ProCredit, this project will help scale up microfinance institutions operating in LAC, ECA and Africa.  The proposed product for the parent company will allow the institutions to tap into PCH in times of liquidity shortfall.  If utilized, the proposed project will enable the group to further their deposit mobilization (which is the source of the volatility), and enable them to manage their liquidity to maximize on-lending.  
Demonstration Effect: This project will provide a signaling effect to stakeholders in the markets where ProCredit operates and provide comfort to its MSME clients if PCH activates the line. PCH will be able to tap into the IFC line and quickly inject liquidity in situations where a subsidiary faces a liquidity shortfall.

title: Senior Loan for ACBA Leasing, Armenia
TWG1
content: CGCs investment capacity and operating know-how is expected to greatly benefit the investee companies. In the specific case of Jordan, CMTCs fleet renewal and expansion project, funded largely by CGC, is expected to improve Ammans underdeveloped public transportation system. It is also expected to help reduce traffic congestion and user travel time as CMTCs increased presence will not only offer a comfortable alternative to individual or shared car use but also displace, replace and restrict the operations of minibuses.Investments in the public transportation system such as the contemplated investments in Jordan and Lebanon in combination with a transfer of know-how is also expected to lead to higher bus frequencies, a better reliability and the use of more modern buses. The project is also expected to positively affect the direct users of the public transportation system as well as the non-users due to the resulting easing of road congestion. Municipalities are also expected to benefit from lower roadway investment costs. The enhanced service levels are also expected to have a strong impact on the urban poor who traditionally live far away from their place of employment and rely on public transportation.

title: Achmmach  Tin
content:
Although Morocco has considerable mineral resources, the mining sector in Morocco has been dominated by the Government of Morocco with primary focus on phosphate rock. Current Government policies and incentives aims to diversify and grow its mineral industry and attract foreign direct investment. A few international junior mining companies have started exploration programs in the country.  A successful exploration program by Kasbah would have notable demonstration effect and help establish mining as an attractive sector for private investors, supporting/promoting sustainable resource development and economic growth through infrastructure development and employment generation.

The Project is in an early exploration phase so its developmental impacts are limited in scope at this stage. However, the project is located in an under-developed part (IFC Frontier region) of the country and outside of key centers of commercial activity and will likely contribute significantly to the area's development should it transition into a full operating mine through generation of employment, improved infrastructure access, local economic development through purchased of local goods and services and payments to government in the form of royalties and taxes.

During the early exploration phase the key impacts to monitor will include: (i) finalization of drilling program, completion of the feasibility study and acquisition of mining license; (ii) number of local employees; and (iii) completion of Social and Environmental Impact Assessment (SEIA).

title: FinansL EE
content: The project is expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of the sustainable energy finance and stream of Energy efficiency project investments in Turkey.

title: 8 Miles Fund I 'A' LP
ProCredit MSME
content:
The development impact for the project is high. It fosters: 

Term funding for MSMEs:
- By supporting PCB, IFC will indirectly help Serbian enterprises and support economic activity, including with the much needed development of the country's MSME sector, and job protection and creation.

Countercyclical role:
- IFC investment would help banking sector sustain its recently built trust, during this crisis inflicted period.

title: Thien Viet Securities Joint Stock Company Ltd.
content:
Like other capital markets in their early stages of development, the practices in Vietnam's securities industry fall short of international best practice industry standards. Unlike most other players, TVS' sponsors are determined to build up a best practice organization from the upstart and seek IFC's assistance in this area. If TVS is successful with its strategy, this project will have a significant demonstration effect for the whole industry to follow and will allow IFC to expand its support to other major players in the industry.


The Project will be carried out as a part of a larger Vietnam Capital Markets Program. Consequently, the development impact is expected to be achieved at both industry and institutional levels.

title: Solar Power (Korat 1) Company Limited
content: The project will have high development impact on the Thai solar market by supporting a small but professional Thai developer with their first four 6MW projects, creating a replicable model for the Sponsor and a demonstration effect for local and regional solar IPP developers. The Project will: a) promote private sector investment in the PV sector which is at an early stage of development in Thailand; b) support less carbon-intense economic development by substituting expansion of thermal power with zero-emission renewable energy and 4785 CO2 tons avoided per year for each 6MW project; and c) create direct and indirect employment opportunities in rural area of Thailand during construction and operation of each 6MW project.

title: Suvidhaa
content:
- Addressing BOP Needs: Suvidhaa will empower the Bottom of the Pyramid consumer segments by providing innovative access to services and payments solutions required to fulfill the services in a more efficient and convenient method which was not previously available. 35% of Suvidhaa's existing footprint in India is in the lower income states. The Company will further expand its reach through mobile applications.

- SME development: By having Suvidhaa outlets in the stores, the small retail store franchisees will be able to significantly increase the traffic of customers to their stores by leveraging the services and the brand name of Suvidhaa. These micro-SMEs will be able to increase approximately US$300 per month in revenue.

title: Nuqul (MENA)
content:
Improved economic resilience:
The expansion of conversion capacity in the host countries of the project (namely Egypt and Jordan), will help support the local economic environment by decreasing reliance on typically more expensive and volatile imported goods. Additionally, the manufacturing focus of the project will support diversification of the economy in the countries where the new capacity will be established. The project will also enable Nuqul to increase its internal consumption of jumbo tissue rolls and focus its sales on higher-margin finished products, thereby improving its operational performance and resilience.

Spread of world-class business practices:
Over the past years, Nuqul has made significant progress on the path to institutionalization notably in separating ownership and management as well as implementing world-class corporate governance and business practices. The Nuqul Group is a highly respected institution across the MENA Region and the project will enable Nuqul to spread its commendable business practices by expanding the Group's regional reach. 

Benefits of regional integration:
The project will facilitate increased trade linkages within the region and serve as an example to other players of the rewards available from global integration.

Improved living standards for the populations: 
The project will create sustainable employment opportunities in countries where youth unemployment is a major issue.  Domestic and efficient operations will enable the Nuqul Group to bring more affordable quality products in the market, thereby improving the local populations' access to products catering to basic human needs.

Demonstration effect: 
By providing long term financing in markets where these types of financing are typically not available, IFC sets a long term interest rate benchmark for commercial loans of longer tenors. This may lead to the eventual development of a long term interest rate curve in the local market and enable local lenders to provide these types of financing.

Cleaner production support:
The project will support the Nuqul Group's efforts to move towards cleaner production, thereby contributing to decreasing the Group's environmental footprint.

title: GRIMAS
content:
- Industrialization and private sector development in Mali, Senegal and CI:  The Project will support a local sponsor who is contributing to industrialization of the region.  The success of the Project would create backward linkages with suppliers and forward linkages with local wholesalers/retailers (who sell GRIMAS' soft drinks) many of which are MSMEs.
- Employment:  The Project will create local employment, direct and indirect through the supply chain. 
- Import Substitution:  Currently some of beverages/preforms/caps/gas consumed in the region are imported (especially in CI and in Senegal). The increase of local production with local brands would enable import replacement. 
- Government Revenues: The overall Project will contribute to public revenues through increased taxes paid by GRIMAS as well as those paid by suppliers and other downstream service providers (i.e. distributors, etc.).

title: Zain Malawi Dist
content:
The Project is expected to deliver strong development impact by:

Improving Access to Telecommunication Services: The financing of Zain's distributors through this Project would help strengthen the capital base of the distributors, enabling them to expand to previously underserved regions of Malawi.

Catalytic Effect: The demand for financing by the SME sector in Malawi is mostly unmet due to the perceived lending risks involved. The Project would encourage Standard Bank to provide funding to Zain's distributors, who are part of the SME sector, based on IFC's assumption of partial credit risk and the demonstrated viability of such a structure.

Job Creation: The Project would lead to creation of new jobs as the distributors will need additional staff to support their expanding businesses.

Capacity Building: The Project will provide needed training to Zain's distributors that should help build their capacity and improve corporate governance.

title: Globaltrans II
content: EExpected developmental impact includes the following: (i) facilitation of trade and increase of transportation volumes; (ii) renewal of the sector's railcar fleet; (iii) demonstration effect; and (iv) spillover effect of supporting employment and production capacity at railcar manufactures.Expected developmental impact includes the following: (i) facilitation of trade and increase of transportation volumes; (ii) renewal of the sector's railcar fleet; (iii) demonstration effect; and (iv) spillover effect of supporting employment and production capacity at railcar manufactures.xpected developmental impact includes the following: (i) facilitation of trade and increase of transportation volumes; (ii) renewal of the sector's railcar fleet; (iii) demonstration effect; and (iv) spillover effect of supporting employment and production capacity at railcar manufactures.

title: New Africa Mining Fund II
content:
With the involvement of IFC and potentially other Development Finance Institutions ("DFIs"), NAMF II is expected to establish a sizeable fund with significant financial and operational capability. NAMF II will focus on junior mining companies in Africa, which are typically unable to attract institutional investment for their early exploration and pre-development work. Providing capital at this end of the extractives resources value chain fills an important gap in an important sector, whose development holds significant potential economic impact and developmental benefits for the host countries in the long term.  More immediately, the Project is expected to help junior mining companies advance their projects up the value chain, through the provision of equity capital and close support from the Fund Manager, while applying environmental and social best practices and establishing long-term partnerships across the region.

The following indicators will be tracked throughout the life of the fund:
Achievement of first close/funds raised
Net IRR
Number of employees of NAMF II investees
Percentage/number of NAMF II investees acquiring mining permits/completing feasibility studies
Percentage/number of NAMF II investees going into mine development
Number of NAMF II investees in which the Fund Manager maintains a board seat

title: Moderna
